Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC TRIP AT ALLEGRO OCCIDENTAL PLAYACAR”
Reviews.Author: Pat856
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar Feb. 22-29. With hesitation I booked this hotel as it was quoted as 3 ½ stars and with recent events in Mexico. A week prior to our arrival, I emailed Erika Padilla (agerenciaoap@mx.occidentalhotels.com) with a request for a king size room, as close to the pool as possible on the ground floor. She responded immediately and said that she would do her best to accommodate us. Arrived at Cancun airport, very organized, quickly got our luggage and then proceeded to go to our bus transferred. We were immediately spoken to by a man whom we thought was with Air Transat bus, only to realize he was trying to sell his sightseeing tours. So be aware of anyone approaching you inside the airport because they are trying to sell you tours or timeshares. The actual bus ride from the airport took over 1 hour as we had to drop off other people at other hotels but we didn’t mind because we were busy trying to see the sights around us. The bus driver was fantastic, he was quite funny so it really got us in the “Mexican” mood with his quickie Spanish lesson. Location: Building 54. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm, quick check-in, but we had to wait for our room as it was not ready until 3pm which was fine because it gave us time to check out the hotel, have lunch. I was immediately surprised at how beautiful everything was from the lobby, to the grounds which were immaculate to the pools and the gorgeous ocean view. Absolutely breathtaking! I like to be at the pool in my lounge chair, sipping my drink rather than on the beach but I we walked every day along the miles and miles of beach, beautiful. The resort is a 5 min. cab ride (70 pesos) into Playa Del Carmen, a beautiful picturesque quaint town. 5th Avenue is where it’s at, from night clubs to pubs, to restaurants, it has it all the nightlife you want. Very safe to be in. The hotel had cabs lined up outside, but they got to know our names and as soon as we walked outside the front entrance of the hotel, they were ready with the cabs. Room: We went into our room and it was beautiful, king size bed, bottom floor, across the relaxing pool! Who could ask for more, with an added bonus of a bottle of champagne from Erika. She went out of her way to make sure everything was perfect, one night, we found a plate of fruit, one night we found chocolate covered strawberries! I cannot thank her enough. She is the sweetest, cutest women, so warm and friendly! Thank you Erika for making our trip filled with wonderful memories. Thank you to Yvonne as well. All the 5800 rooms are all close to the pool/ocean area. Food: Fabulous. The Italian restaurant was great! I’m Italian and the marinara sauce was fantastic! The Mexican was very good as well. The buffets at lunch were great, pizza was good although sometimes I think they could have cooked it a bit more, I like my pizza crispy but it was still very good. The dinner buffets were always different, the breakfasts were fantastic! A lot of variety with their menus. STAFF: One word: wonderful friendly staff! I want to thank Neri for his terrific cappuccinos. I still miss my 11am cappuccino. He was always very friendly and courteous, very nice man! Erika, goes without saying how wonderful she was. I can’t remember everyone at the front desk but they always had a smile and a thank you or how are you today! Allegro should be honoured to have these hard working, talented people working there. ENTERTAINMENT: All the staff were good. Not much entertainment at night. We went to the disco one night, but it was small. We didn’t mind it, we usually went to Playa Del Carmen on 5th Avenue every night, Erika had given us names of places to go, they were wonderful little “Mexican” places with live music and that is what we like. Overall, our experience in Mexico was wonderful, weather was hot, hot, hot. If you want a great, clean, friendly hotel with good food and amazing staff, Allegro Occidental Playacar is the place to go. This hotel deserves at the very least a 4 star rating. We will definitely be coming back. I hope to see you Erika again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: JulesTorontoCanada
Reviews.Content: This is our third time at the Allegro over the last few years and it has always been a nice stay. They are doing a few upgrades which are overdue, as I understand this is one of the original hotels in this area, and it's starting to show. But that aside, the grounds are fabulous, the beach since it's been "resanded" is lovely, the food is reliable, the staff very friendly and accomodating, and one of the biggest things for us is the fact you can walk into town. Playa del Carmen has grown but still has charm and great restaurants. I would go back to the Allegro again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Week at the Allegro Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: WahooToronto
Reviews.Content: We love this resort. Our trip in Feb. was our 7th time returning to the Allegro Playacar. The hotel is small, quaint with lovely manicured lawns & foliage. Just a short walk to town along the street or take the beach if you choose. The rooms are very comfortable and with each having their own balcony it gives you a sense of privacy. Great variety of food, there is something for everyone...from the buffet to the a la carte restaurants, you can't go hungry here. The staff at the front desk were wonderful especially Erika and Yvonne. We spoke with other guests there who have been going there over and over. We will be going back again, this time hopefully for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: ROMA G
Reviews.Content: I was in Allegro Playcar in Feb 2012. It was very nice, clean with lots of exotic trees and flowers. Great veriaty if food and tasty. Staff was very friendly. Lots of acitvities throughout the Resort. Every night in the theatre there were dancers, comidians and entateiners. They played games involving the audionce. The main guy ADAN was superb. He hosted the shaw on english and spanish. He danced, sang and entertainn people to the fullest. ADAN made the show. ROMA - Edmonton

Reviews.Title: “Good price value...”
Reviews.Author: Katharina R
Reviews.Content: Do not expect 4 or 5 star hotel. Rooms are more like 2 star´ed European hotel. BUT we really enjoyed it anyway because we did not have to high expecations. We stayed in a top floor room - wich is much more spacious and "authentic mexican" than the ground floor rooms because of the palm leaf roof. And we did not have any problems with insects or birds getting in or any other problems with the rooms - as many others have described in their reviews. If you want to go early to bed some nights, try to get a room as far away from the show stage as possible - they make a lof noise during the show wich starts at 21 h. By the way, do NOT expect professional actors at the show - but if you combine it with a good bottle of wine or some drinks it can actually be funny to observe! The outdoor area at the hotel is really nice! The buffet food is okay but again do not expect to much. The Italian Restaurant is really good - try the carpacio as starter! Trips we can recommend: Day trip to Maroma beach. Coba, Mayan Village and Cave trip (one trip) - you can book it at the hotel, with the guy in the corner with the blue shirt. We met several people who went on the Chichen Itza trip and nobody liked it - it was overcrowded and touristy and the trip is very long.

Reviews.Title: “"Very friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: EliAn2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small simple but quaint resort to sit back and relax visit Allegro. Just came back from our 2 weeks holiday getaway and had a great time. As time share owners we had an ocean-view room upstairs on building 45, it was close to the pool and the beach. Our friends that traveled from Argentina stayed in building 54, both had a balcony with hammocks. Allegro is a small resort (we like small resorts only) very well located in the exclusive neighborhood of Playacar amongst incredible hotels and houses definitely worth visiting. It is only a few minutes from town and only a 70 pesos cab ride. The resort is very simple, the lobby is very welcoming with great couches and tables but no bar, the grounds are beautifully maintained, there is 2 pools, we used the one by the bar with a perfect view of the amazing beach. The bathrooms by the pools need TLC and the stalls are really small. The Mexican restaurant and the lunch buffet are very conveniently located by the pools. No need to worry about dressing up for lunch here! The food in general was good, the menu changed everyday so there was a good variety to satisfy everyone's taste. We loved the "Chef's choice" night and the breakfast station were you can get eggs made to your taste, I recommend the omelets, they were excellent.The ambiance at the Italian restaurant is pleasant but definitely needs improvement, the menu is very, very small and the foods are better at the buffet, however, the waiters are very curtious. The staff, particularly, the morning and lunch staff at the buffet were fabulous!!!! they treated us fantastic, always had a smile or a joke, we looked forward to seeing them every day, definitely they made this holiday a memorable one. Our hats go off to Luis, Jacobo, Alfredo and Humberto for their cheerfulness, unbelievable talent and friendship during our stay, we miss you! Ditto for Fernanda for keeping the boys in line Ha,Ha! (she is very blessed to have such great guys in her team), also Neri for his expertise at the espresso bar and our lovely maid Lucy for her kindness and attention to detail. Thank you for a job well done, Allegro should be proud of these outstanding staff members!!!!! We will remember you always!!!!!!!!!! As far as the nightly shows don't expect much, in the past we never missed one, there was a variety of talent, but now they are really not worth going to unless you want to be on stage for some kind of a silly game. The exception is the Mexican show. We know you are capable of better Allegro, we've seen it in the past! Visit the "Tulum" ruins if you can, it is beautiful (aprox. $40) and "X-caret" an eco- friendly park were you can swim with dolphins, see the turtles hatchery, the zoo, the aquarium, swim in the underground cenotes have lunch at one of the restaurants by the beach and much more. This park will take your breath away (aprox. $140). Overall all four of us enjoyed our vacation and we will be back, hopefully by then some of the little kinks will be fixed and the extraordinary waiters are still there then!!

Reviews.Title: “simply lovely”
Reviews.Author: Annie2786
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a 4 day stay at allegro playacar and we did not want to leave! we had such a wonderful time and this hotel definitely made leaving tough. we had read some mixed reviews before coming but i can't imagine what people have to complain about! we arrived 5 hours before check-in, but this was no problem - we were able to store our bags in a locked storage room until our rooms were available. we were welcomed with a delicious cocktail and went right to the pool. the pool and the view are amazing. there are 2 pools, one is the relaxation pool and the other is the activity pool where we always sat (this pool has the direct ocean view). once we checked in to our rooms, we were very impressed! the rooms are very simple and slightly outdated, but not in a bad way - they were very nice! we had a second floor room so we very much enjoyed our balcony with a hammock. the resort grounds are very charming with the different huts. the staff were all very nice and helpful! the food was VERY good, the lunch buffet was near the pool which we very much enjoyed. breakfast and dinner were also very good - we loved the buffet. no one in our party (4 people) got sick from the food, drinks or water - major plus! the drinks were pretty good, the mojitos are very good. some of the drinks were pre-made so they were a little too sugary but there were plenty of other options. we were treated very well at this resort and would definitely come back again. the activities team was great and kept everyone involved! Adan (the leader of the activities team) was absolutely hilarious - he does a great job and so does the rest of the team. only negatives (and these are minor): sometimes the music near the activity pool was a little too loud, a lot of people walking around trying to sell you things and the birds are very loud in the morning and it is often hard to sleep past 7AM without earplugs! but who wants to sleep in when you are somewhere so beautiful? people would feed the birds near the pool which resulted in a large number of birds, but this is no fault of the resort. overall: if you want a great vacation at a great resort in a great location - you should stay at this resort. the beach location and proximity to town make it a perfect option. the charming grounds, fabulous pools and great food make this a perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: MyPhilosophy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very simple, so I do warren you if you aren't looking for the minimal basics, then I suggest you look else where before making the lives of staff members miserable with an over abundance of complaints. The food was good, buffet had a different selection every night! The drinks were AMAZING, mojitos were a little sweet. Corona on tap which was a bonus. No one got sick from the food or drinks here. I am so bad with names, but the guy that works the beach bar until close, is absolutely wonderful. He will for sure take care of you. The grounds were kept absolutely pristine, and the beach, WOW. Simply beautiful. The nice thing about this resort is, since it is a smaller resort the beach doesn't fill really early. One thing that I did not read in reviews was that there is no lobby bar. I have been away several times, and this is the first I have ever experienced that. For me, it was a bit of a problem, as I do like to meet people at the lobby. Otherwise, great vacation. Feel free to ask questions. Also, I would suggest going to Señor Frogs in the 5th ave area, great fun!! Also forgot to say that each room has a hammock on their balcony, soooooo amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Improvements, Great People”
Reviews.Author: Star726
Reviews.Content: Occidental Playacar has improved wonderfully since our visit in 2010. The rooms, linens, and food have taken the biggest steps. We always thought the staff and grounds were terrific and they remain so. The beach has been restored and is a joy to use. For food, we'd recommend the Mexican Restaurant as the best both in food and service quality. The Buffet has many more and fresher selections for breakfast and dinner. The lunch, near the pools, has a more limited selection but there is always a good salad and soup and a good selection of meat and fish. (The fish served throughout the resort was outstanding this year.) The weather was good this year (Jan 28 - Feb 11, 2012) -- last year is was chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Size”
Reviews.Author: ErwinSchuster
Reviews.Content: This property is in a great location, you will get what you have paid for. The staff are wonderful and go out of their way to assist you. Yes, the rooms are dated, but as you stay there mostly to sleep only they are passable. The food is sufficient, we did not try the specialty dinners. The wine though, not sure if their buyers have ever tried the product themselves. I have made and tasted homemade wines that were far superior. This resort is exactly as I would expect a three star to be like. We have stayed at five star rated resorts, so we can compare. Great resort for the budget minded, somewhat older crowd. The nightly entertainment was to put in mildly, lame.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY...”
Reviews.Author: margarita5040
Reviews.Content: This is a much smaller resort than I am use to but very friendly, most accommodating and the staff are very good especially Jacaboo (works breakfast, dinner & server on the beach), Abel, Freddy (bar staff @ the pool area outside of the Mexican restaurant) Ivonne, Cindy and Denis(F) @ the front desk. These employees go over and above, friendly, helpful, cheery and warm wonderful servers. Anibal room attendant, another great employee. The breakfasts are great...lots of good mexican fare to choose from, eggs many, many different ways and sometimes fresh donuts as well. My fiance really likes the bacon, my favourite was salsa, eggs, gaucamole & refried beans. Lunch by the pool was always good too...lots of choices, plus fresh fajitas, pasta and always grilling up chicken, salmon, chicken & regular burgers. The pizza was good, thin crust, lots of different toppings and fresh. Dinner was okay, nothing really over the top except for the "Chef's Regional Night"; whole chickens, oven roasted turkey, lamb, pork, salmon, seafood mix, ribs, roast beef. Very good. The Mexican was very good as well but for meat choices would have to be the "Chef's Regional" We booked into the Italian al la carte-fantastic; nice setup in the middle of the room with different types of appetizers, plus what you could pick off of the menu. A few suggestions, resort should offer specialty coffees, such as cappucinos, espressos, Spanish in the al la carte without EXTRA COST. (their is the 'gourmet coffee' hut just beside the pizza booth, but for the speciality coffees you need to pay extra. House wine, red-tasted more like vinegar, as though the grapes never really matured on the vine and processed anyway. When the resort didn't have the regular house wine but were offering the Frontera from Chile way, way better. This same wine can be purchased in Ontario (i have tried it), way better choice and HAS BODY!!!! The resort only offers Corona as the beer of choice, we picked up some of the brand we prefer, better tasting. The mini bars are stocked only with water, where again being use to a larger resort where these places put in beer, pop and sometimes small snacks. if you arrive late, after 10:00pm there is no food available and only the disco is open for drinks. But since 2008 which was the last maya trip for my fiance & I, the resorts have all done an AMAZING job reclaiming the beach area. There is plenty of beautiful sandy beach, loads of chairs and you are not feeling too close to the next group of sun worshipers. The resort keeps you busy if you want to be with many activities, night parties and fun things! Allegro is so close to Playa del Carmen, that we walked in either during the day or our most favourite time was right after an early dinner strolling around and exploring! This area is extremely safe and never once felt uncomfortable or concerned. I would walk (by myself) first thing in the morning...if doing so be sure to bring water, a hat and not like me remember to hydrate when returing. We had the best ever room, 5804...waking up having a coffee with only 5 steps to the pool and only a few more down the stairs @ being on the beach! Walking the beach into Playa, you can admire other resorts as well as the many homes for rent/sale, ending up by Senor Frogs. one small note is we took a taxi (my fiance worked out a great deal with one of the reputable services just outside where the bus would p/u to take to resort) because we got to the resort, signed in & bracelets on about 3-4 hours ahead of the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canucklife
Reviews.Content: Location!! Location!!Location Stayed from Feb 16-23 2012 This hotel is located perfectly in the Mayan Riviera.It's about 45 minutes from the airport in Cancun but after that the area it is located in is very centralized.A very nice scenic and safe 15 minute walk to get to the village of Playa Del Carmen and it's famous 5th avenue shopping area, Playa Del Carmen is a must! On your way there you even get to see some Mayan ruins if you walk by the street , if you want romantic Playa Del Carmen is accessible by the beach.Also instead of turning right for playa Del Carmen you go left you have about 3 minutes from the hotel you have the Playacar market a small shopping area that sell souvenirs, beer and you have a drugstore.You can also find a Starbucks with FREE INTERNET. Now for the hotel this is a 3,5 star hotel and it is a little outdated it must of been great to look at 15 years ago but who cares you are not there for the room we spent all of our time outside anyway all you need is a place to sleep.The beds were comfortable, room clean,fresh linen everyday.As for the leaky roof we can't say it did not rain.The resort itself is a nice size ,all short walks to get to the pools the quiet and action pool.The beach is awesome great white sand, beautiful ocean.The food was excellent we went to the buffet and had a good selection.The a la Carte is a bust it was always booked full the buffet was sufficient. The staff are very polite and helpful ,they were just awesome!! Now for the Bad... The concierge are a pain in the .... they harass you continuously to attend one of occidental information session and promise you an upgrade to their 5 star hotel further down.We did it the Canadian way we were polite and said no on the first day and on the second but on the third we had to be a bit more firm then they left us alone.The beach lounge chairs definitely need to be replaced. If you do any excursion Xel-ha is an unforgettable experience. I would say you get your bang for your buck at this resort and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “If you like 2 star hotels this is the one for you!”
Reviews.Author: K R
Reviews.Content: OK... I have never placed any reviews for hotels; however, I would like to share my vacation experiences at the Allegro Playacar so you can make a better informed decision before you book your trip. Upon arrival Feb 17, 2012 we were checked into room 3115. The room is on the second floor of one of the the "villas". The roof is made from dried grass and ours had three holes in it and smelled very moldy. Our shower did not have ANY pressure and the A/C did not work. After complaining several times, we were finally moved to room 4204 - a first floor room on the other side of the resort. This room did have a working shower; however, the A/C, phone, TV and ceiling fan all did not work. After making complaints, the maintenance person came to fix the ceiling fan, but that was all that was fixed (we were told the A/C was being fixed the following day, but this never happened). This room was musty and humid, and all of our clothes ended up damp and smelling musty the whole week. our hammock was infested with bugs and we both received numerous bites. There are no alarm clocks in this hotel, so bring your own. When I went to the front desk to ask for one, they said that because it is a three star hotel they do not have alarm clocks. The a-la-carts were nothing special, the menu was limited and the food seemed to be pre-cooked as the pasta was dry and the vegetables were soggy. The buffet was not bad; there was a decent sized selection of apps, mains, salads, fruit/veggies and desserts. Unfortunately, most of the fruit being served was canned or flavorless. The only thing that saved eating at the hotel was the service provided by the staff - they all do what they can to make your eating experience enjoyable and entertaining. If you are looking for nightlife or any sort of evening entertainment this hotel is not for you. There is a huge stage in the courtyard, unfortunately it was only used to find Mr. Allegro one night, Mrs. Allegro the next night, and singing karaoke on the third night, then the events repeat themselves. It was funny that during the karaoke night at around 11pm the staff shut down the "party" as one room complained about the noise and sent around 50 people out of the area and suggested they visit the "disco" - a room that was 20 feet wide by 20 feet long and barely qualified as a lounge. The beach is great and you will have great service from the staff if you tip well - that goes the same for the pool areas. Lunches by the pool are good and have plenty of selection. Aside from the pool, the only redeeming feature of this hotel is its location. It is only a five minute cab ride to 5th ave in Playa Del Carmen, which is the shopping/restaurant/entertainment district. We ended up going there almost every evening as there was NOTHING to do at the hotel. Beware of Pablo the "Lomas Travel" representative. He is a salesman and will make you great "deals". Two of our three excursions were great (Xel-ha and Tulum/Coba) but the third (para-sailing) was a disaster. The day did not happen as it was "promised". Our private car, direct trip, turned into a tour bus carrying over 30 people and making 5 stops. The two hour activity took almost 5 hours, and did not include everything we were promised. Be careful, as Pablo tells you what you want to hear so he can get your business. We had requested late check out as our return flight was at 11pm. When we first made this request, we were told it would cost $40usd; however, when our check-out day arrived, they attempted to charge us $60usd instead. They did eventually give us a 6pm check out for $40usd, but for some reason when I went to pay upon check out the girl requested my passport so she could make a photocopy of it as I was paying cash and "it is the law". I payed with MC as they did not require to verify or copy your ID for that method of payment.??? We were a group of twelve on vacation that booked 6 rooms. For the most part our experiences were the same. This was not a comfortable "resort", the food was average, no nightlife, bugs, no AC, and an overall moldy smell. If you get a good price and can get through some of these things in the 35 degree heat then I suggest go for it. If you are looking for a fun, comfortable, relaxing resort then this place is probably not for you. I will state again that the servers were great. If you want more information email me at krod@live.ca.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: pam b
Reviews.Content: Stayed frn 10 - 17 Feb 12. This resort is very dated, however, very relaxing. The grounds are beautiful, and the staff very friendly. The rooms are not the best. The rooms really need to be updated, and there should be more comfortable chairs to sit on. The bed was hard (only a spunge placed on a cement slab). By the time we went to bed, we didn't care. We did sleep well. The rooms are not very sound proof. You can hear just about everything. The shows were not the best, however it was something to do during the evening. That is really the only negative about this resort. The food was great. Even if you were a picky eater, there were lots of choices for all meals. We enjoyed a 5 course meal of steak and lobster on the beach for Valentines day which was superb. The pools and the beach were beautiful. Lounge chars on the left side need to be replaced, but the lounge charis on the right were much better. The staff were all very friendly. Our maid Rebecca was wonderful, and made us little displays of animals or dolls with the towles every day. We really enjoyed ourselves, and would definately reccomend this to older couples or young families. If you want to party, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “the worst!”
Reviews.Author: missy856
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that escpes.ca is rating this resort as a 4 star aand when my friend and i got there, we where like crushed with disbelief. first room we were given we had broken windows, torn screen, dirty bathroom and floor. Ask for a better room it took forever it was not much better, the only difference was that the windows were not broken. their was no where to unpack your suitcase, no minibar in the room we had a hard time to get a bottle of water. no satelite t.v, not even a remote, our bed was on cement base and old mattress covered with an egg shell sponge.. Every day we had to get our own towels facecloth and etc......... Escapes.ca had done nothing but false publicity in order to sell their rooms. They sated this resort had undergone major renovations , it had no activities no non motorized sports, chairs on the beach were simply busted. Im a traveller of 12 years and this has to be the worst one i've ever had to stay at. People should beware who theybook with cause it can be very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Very Simple, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGriz
Reviews.Content: Location: Playacar is a great area just a 20 min. walk south of downtown Playa Del Carmen. You can walk on the beach to 5th avenue or through town. The area offers easy access to most excursions since they are south of the area. Rooms: There are close to 40 bungalows each housing 8 rooms. This hotel is older than surrounding hotels. The rooms provide a neat atmosphere with a straw ceiling and a king size bed. Some people complained during rainfalls since it may get through the ceiling if you're on the 2nd floor. We could hear everything the neighbors were saying since the cement walls are not very sound proof but we had read this in the reviews and brought ear plugs to help us sleep (this was not the case for everyone we talked to, maybe only on 2nd floors?). We ran out of water a few times and the toilet didn't flush half the time. Pools: 2 very nice pools, not too busy since this is a small resort. Beach: Very nice beach and very large, maybe 75 yards wide give or take. There are lots of seashells in the sand so you should watch where you walk. Nice water, green flag everyday. Food: Food was o.k., always something to eat even for picky eaters. Lots of drinks available and they provide nice drink catalogs to make it easier to choose. Never any lineups at the bars of which there are 2 during the day plus the disco in the evening. Staff: Very nice and polite staff, lots of smiles. Shows: There is a show every night for the guests, these are the same everywhere and we hate them all and avoid them as much as possible. Beach activities: The staff do a good job with daily activities. There is a free 4 hour intro to scuba course in the pool for those interested. There are organized ping pong tournaments and you can play basketball on a very nice court and tennis and beach volleyball. For the price, this is a great resort. We would never go back to the same location twice but we both recommend this resort. It is small, not a party resort for people who just want to relax. Day Trip #1: Tulum ruins, Tulum beach, Coba ruins, Cenote swim and mayan village. It was great but could be a brutal walk for older folks. Day Trip #2: Catamaran in Cancun on Isla Mujeres. It was great, lots of booze, not for old people or kids. We also took the ferry to Cozumel island and spend a few hours there. It's very nice and lots of restaurants/shops. Side note: The most annoying part of the vacation were babies on the flights. I can't understand why anyone would bring a baby on one of these trips, everyone on the flight was annoyed. It's also a form of child abuse to bring these babies in the hot sun for a week, we saw so many sunburned babies.

Reviews.Title: “average resort”
Reviews.Author: maxspirit1965
Reviews.Content: this was our second time at the Allegro. We were there for two weeks. The beach is fabulous and the location is ideal! The food is good, great variety. We were very disappointed in the service of the wait staff this time. And the employees of the Vacation Club are annoying and rude. The rooms definitely need repairs and updating. The nightly entertainment is very poor. The service at the front desk was very good, especially Ivonne and Amin. Overall, it was okay but I don't think we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Craig C
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 weeks at the Allegro Playacar and had a wonderful holiday. The beach was great and probably the best beach for long walks that we've been to. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. They are large, lush, are even home to coatimundi and some agouti. The food was very good; many choices. The staff was great. Especially kudos to Yairi (guest service manager). Rooms were clean but could use some updating. Overall the visit was a very positive experience and we wouldn't hesitate to return. Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay, great food”
Reviews.Author: Meggie T
Reviews.Content: We spent in this place 3 beautiful weeks and I have to say that everything was very nice. In despite rooms are very simple, the Food was amazing and I liked the concept of changing cusine style day by day. The only issue we had was with reception staff. They were not helpful so much - our original request was for two double beds and after about 15 hours of traveling we got king bed. When we kindly ask to change the room we were told, that it is not available and they will move us next day. Can happen so we came back next morning to ask, at what time can we move to our new room. Noone known about moving and again told us that there is not any room available. We both have been working in hospitality and agreed to wait one more day, as it can happen, that the room type is not available. The story was almost the same, and we decided to solve this with management. What a surprise, room was available and we were finally moved on third day. Except Front desk I have to say that all others were very friendly and helpful and made our stay amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple just returned from our vacation (Feb. 2012) where we stayed at Occidental Allegro Playacar resort. It was wonderful! The staff was great. The facility was very clean. The food was good. The grounds were well groomed. Nice beach and pool area. There were shops that you can walk to just a couple of blocks away. We travel alot and we would definetly consider returning to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DiscoNan
Reviews.Content: It was my second time at this hotel. Its relatively small, 278 rooms, and in small thatched buildings, not the huge apartment complex style like the big resorts. Beautiful grounds, and of course takes just 2 mins to get from the pool back to your room. The rooms are adequate, nothing fancy, but clean, and comfortable. The beach was just gorgeous, white sand and of course the turquoise waters. Hotel facilities. Its definitely not a 5*, but we enjoyed the evening shows, and liked joining in with the beach games every day. The staff were awesome, and made sure we had a great time there. 20 minute walk into Playa, or 30 mins along the beach. You can't go wrong !

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TrippinOut2012
Reviews.Content: Travelled the week of January 21st - 28th and arrived early in the day to find our room wasn't ready yet. No worries, as we were directed to the pools, buffet and beach until the room was ready in the afternoon. After checking in, we met with Yairi in Guest Services to book our a la carte reservations, and we were advised that they were overbooked and that they would be happy to move us to the Xcaret at their expense. I knew where this resort was located (farther south from PDC) and that it wasn't ideal for us, and Yairi was excellent - she made some calls and set us up at the nearby Sandos Playacar Riviera until Jan 24th. This resort was amazing and we took full advantage of its amenities. When our stay was over, we returned to the Allegro and met again with Yairi and then Miguel (or Edgar?) who graciously attended to us and provided us with a ground floor room next to the beach, in 5702 (not beachview, but very nice location and everything worked well in the room -- basic but comfortable). A big thank you goes out to Yairi, Miguel/Edgar, Ivonne and the rest of the friendly front desk staff. Overall, while the resort is admittedly one of the more dated ones in Playacar, we were very impressed with the quaintness of the resort, the quality of the staff and the grounds - immaculate! A pleasant, short walk from front lobby to beach and back. Its location within Playacar (a gated, secure subdivision of resorts and condos), its proximity to PDC and the quality of the beach are ideal. Food wise, the Italian restaurant was very good and the buffet (lunch and dinner) was varied and satisfactory for our needs and tastes. We did not take part in the Mexican a la carte near the pool so I cannot rate this. The poolside snack shack and pizzeria were very good for quick food fixes during the day. All of the staff were very attentive and always smiling and quick to give a friendly "Hola!". The upstairs bar was cool and often a happening spot in the early evening. The pools were clean and cool but refreshing in 26+ C humid temps and the beach was spectacular -- not crowded at all. The beach loungers on the south side of the resort seemed newer and in better condition, but plenty to choose from. You can walk for miles with nothing but white sand and turquoise water. I spent plenty of time reading mixed reviews of this resort before travelling and was worried to say the least, but after experiencing it first hand I would have to say the Allegro Playacar exceeded my expectations and will give it a two thumbs up for value and overall experience. It is certainly not a 5 star resort but we knew this going in and, for the price, we felt it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks in paradise”
Reviews.Author: sunlovers2003
Reviews.Content: After spending our two-week holiday at this incredible resort in 2003 we could not wait to return. On our 1st visit due to storms, there was very little beach, if any. We were very excited to find “our” beach beautiful sand, turquoise water. We were in heaven. Our room was just like we remember, very neat, clean and functional. The grounds are immaculately kept, with workers constantly striving to make it even more beautiful. The main restaurant is constantly filled with almost anything you would desire, with a different theme every night. The servers, Jacobo, is particular is the best we have encountered from all our holidays. He was always polite, cheerful, funny and always ready to tell a story about his country and way of life. We recommend the Italian Al la Carte, just to get away from the buffet and be further pampered. The menu was a little challenging, however, the outcome was divine. Yairi, from guest services was very courteous and gracious hostess. Our hats are off to ALL the personnel at the Allegro. We walked to Playa del Carmen a couple of times, we always felt safe and at home with these beautiful smiling people. We can’t wait for a return visit next year. We know that this is a 3-½ star resort, but the service is 5 stars. Thank you, until next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff and food will blow you away”
Reviews.Author: Hungrywatcher
Reviews.Content: The mantra you get what you pay for is a little off here. The structures need a bit of maintenance and they seem to be working on that New air unit when we were there giant device as well as external fixes. But what obliterates any misgivings about the rooms is they are cleaned professionally by honest friendly staff I left a bunch coins and small bills out one day and found them stacked neatly on the night stand The restaurant staff is marvelous and the food is unbelievable just avoid the Italian a la carte no so Italian. The Mexican was to die for go figure! Buffets had huge selections and the staff was on you like a tent in a typhoon, great service. Nice small resort 15 minute very safe walk to Playa del Carmen, the region is a semi gated community cabs were many and excellent honest service just make sure you have close to the fare$7 to or from town. Worth the trip to the 5th street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “The opposite of frantic – just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Tripsterchick
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a great time and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing vacation at a low-key beachfront resort offering simple but comfortable accommodation, good food and drinks, some sports and poolside activities, nightly entertainment and lots of peace and quiet. At 23 years of age, the Allegro is one of the original hotels in Playacar. It’s smaller than most of the newer resorts – nowhere on the property is more than a two-minute walk from anywhere else, compared to as much as ten minutes at other resorts – and it’s a lot more tranquil. You’ll hear music around the main pool when activities like aquasize are underway, but even then the volume is pretty low. No booming club music like at the nearby Iberostar where a young couple who shared our airport shuttle told us there was nowhere out of earshot of non-stop thumping music. Allegro Playacar’s grounds are attractively landscaped and well maintained, and home to a number of animals we enjoyed watching – a coati family (mom and three young), several agoutis (like a monster squirrel crossed with a monster guinea pig) and an iguana who liked to sun himself on a path. While not tame, these creatures are clearly accustomed to people, so you can get quite close to take photographs. The hotel is situated on a very nice stretch of beach, though it has a bit of an incline and, in some places, a ledge, making it a little tricky to walk along the water’s edge without getting wet if there are waves. If you turn to the right, i.e., south, and walk for 15 minutes or so, you’re into an undeveloped area. Walk left/north from the hotel beach for about 15 minutes and you’ll reach Playa del Carmen and the pier for the Cozumel ferry. You can also walk to PdC by turning right on the road in front of the hotel lobby. We found PdC a little tacky so didn’t go back, but there’s no shortage of shops, restaurants and clubs, if you’re so inclined. The ADO bus station is also located there, along with two collectivo terminals, one for travel north and the other for travel south. Here are some specifics that may help you decide if Allegro Playacar is for you. ACCOMMODATION The two pools occupy the central part of the property, with rooms located either side in eightplex palapas. Each palapa has four rooms on the ground floor – two on one side of the building and two on the other – and four rooms on an upper level accessed by exterior stairs. We were originally given an upper-floor room, but it had been pouring the day we arrived and the thatched roof had leaked, wetting the bed, so we were moved to the ground floor. The upper rooms are a little more private, but I found the air downstairs fresher; upstairs seemed musty, maybe because the thatch was wet. Rooms are fairly basic but clean and comfortable, and we had everything we needed – always plenty of hot water; fresh towels, some sculpted into an ever-changing parade of amusing and fanciful creatures; toiletries topped up as needed; and a 1½-litre bottle of water left in the room each day. Every room has a patio or balcony with a table, two chairs and a hammock. Our room was close to the beach and opposite the hedge separating Allegro Playacar from a Viva Wyndham property. Not the most scenic spot, perhaps, but it was quiet. Rooms close to the theatre (lobby end of the property) are probably rather noisy when the evening shows take place. FOOD AND DRINKS Breakfast and dinner are served in the main restaurant, above the lobby, lunch at the small restaurant between the two pools (it doubles in the evening as the Mexican à la carte). We were impressed by the variety at all the buffets. We’re not picky eaters, but we do eat gluten-free, which can sometimes be a challenge in restaurants. However, we had no difficulty finding things we could eat – lots of fish, chicken, pork and beef dishes, vegetables, salads, cheeses, egg dishes, fresh fruit and delicious yogurts. You can have things like omelets made to order, but we always found so much selection at the buffet that we never bothered. There’s a different theme every evening – Caribbean, Mexican, Asian, etc. – so you shouldn’t get bored. And the two à la cartes (Mexican and Italian) were both enjoyable. Best to make reservations when you arrive, as they seem to book up quickly. Our only criticism of the restaurants was the house red wine, which was truly dreadful. The white was okay, but the red had an unpleasant smell of nail polish remover and tasted like vinegar. Why Occidental would choose such a poor quality of wine is beyond me. I believe it’s a Spanish chain, and we were told the wine is Spanish, so perhaps there’s some corporate loyalty to the homeland, but personally, I find it misplaced. All other drinks were good, if a bit syrupy. We finally settled on mojitos, which were less sweet than most others. SPORTS The hotel has two tennis courts, both in excellent condition and night-lit. Most days we played early morning and late afternoon, though with the breeze coming off the ocean, it was actually comfortable enough to play at other times. We took our own racquets and balls. Not sure if you can borrow or rent equipment at the hotel, but you can certainly arrange lessons with the pro (US $30/hr, I think). Had there been more green-flag days on the beach (we had only one), we would have looked into water sports. Our vacation package included boogie boards, windsurfing, kayaking and catamaran, though we never saw any equipment at the activities desk or on the beach. Perhaps it’s available at some other location. POOLS As mentioned, there are two. The activities pool also has a swim-up bar so is probably a little more social. The relaxation pool, shaped like a figure eight with a little bridge over the centre, is perfect is you’d just like to lie back and read. Both have plenty of chaises longues, and waiters will bring you drinks. STAFF Everyone we dealt with, from bar and restaurant waiters to front desk staff, housekeeping and guest services, was friendly and attentive and spoke excellent English. There seems to be a pretty high ratio between staff and guests. We never had to wait for any service, and there always seemed to be someone on hand, at restaurants or poolside, to sweep up any crumb as soon as it got dropped. ENTERTAINMENT There’s some type of show every evening. We enjoyed three lively and colourful performances by a professional dance company. Each show had a different theme – Latin, Mexican folkloric and variety – with multiple costume changes. These performances alternated with entertainment provided by the hotel activities staff, including a beach party, comedy night and karaoke contest. Can’t comment on any of these shows as we didn’t attend. EXCURSIONS We had visited the Mayan ruins at Tulum and Coba on a previous vacation and wanted to try something different. Ruling out Chichen Itza because it seemed too far, we opted for Ek Balam, about 2½ hours from Playacar. Unlike Tulum and Coba, this site is a bit off the beaten track and doesn’t seem to be reachable by collectivo and/or ADO bus, so we booked an Alltournative tour through our Nolitours rep at the hotel. Ek Balam isn’t as well known as other Mayan sites, consequently has far fewer visitors, and our group had the place almost to ourselves. Visitors are allowed to enter any building and climb the pyramid, not as high as the one at Coba but in better condition and containing the tomb of an ancient ruler. The tomb is surrounded by an astonishingly well-preserved stucco wall replete with statues and carvings. Next stop was a cenote that we rappelled into – initially a little scary, but then fun, and the water wasn’t nearly as cold as anticipated. We also ziplined inside the cenote (into the water – you have no choice), then had a bland but adequate lunch at the cenote park. While I support Alltournative’s mission to involve the Mayan community so they get some benefit from tourism, I suspect we might have got better value with another tour operator. After returning home, I learned that Ek Balam is only about 20 minutes from the colonial town of Valladolid, worth a visit in itself, and from there it’s not far to Chichen Itza. Had we booked with Mayans’ Explorers, for instance, we could have visited Valladolid and Chichen Itza as well as Ek Balam and a cenote, all for the same price (US $129 pp) or less, and with fewer people in the group. Check Tripadvisor reviews for both Alltournatives and Mayans’ Explorers and see what you think. A TIMESHARE BY ANY OTHER NAME.... Other than the red wine, the only thing we didn’t care for at Allegro Playacar was the sales pitch that kind of snuck up from behind. We were told that Allegro was overbooked so we’d be offered the opportunity to move to another hotel in the chain, the Grand Xcaret, which has four stars as opposed to the Allegro’s three. Not wishing to consider such a move sight unseen, we arranged to visit the Grand Xcaret, about ten minutes south of Playacar, to check it out. This, in fact, turns out to be a pitch to have you buy into Occidental’s “vacation club,” a timeshare in everything but name. It’s one thing to be hit on by timeshare salespeople in town, but I find it poor business practice for a hotel to victimize its own guests. And by the way, we preferred Allegro Playacar even if it had one less star than the Grand Xcaret, so we decided to stay put.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: Cailiejan
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time here! There was food all the time, the activities during the day were great, and the shows at night were awesome too! The beach was fantastic and right there! Say Hi to Juan the lifeguard...he's pretty cool! The rooms weren't 5star rooms...they were quaint and a nice clean place to lay your head at night! But the staff were great, friendly and we most definantly will be staying there again! Enjoy a nice 15min walk along the beach into Playa del Carmen...where the shopping is practically free! lol

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice grounds, adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: Thumps
Reviews.Content: The Allegro playacar is a great value for your money all-inclusive on a lovely beach just 15 minutes walk from Playa Del Carmen. The rooms could use a facelift, but they're fine (though you can hear everything in the room beside you). The buffet restaurant has a wide selection, but it is very difficult to get a reservation, other than at 6 or 9, in either of the a la carte restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Friday, checked in Sat!”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Resort is quaint! Excellent, is quiet for people that want to relax, that's for sure! Staff is friendly, tip 'em a couple bucks and they are VERY friendly. The one day I tipped Martin at the bar 5 bucks and a couple hours later we were sitting on the beach, nowhere close to the pool bar. We were only there for a short period of time. Then, low and behold, Martin showed up with a 5 gallon pail of drinks! I also can't forget Nestor at the pool bar. You rock buddy! (Mike, Sheeeerrriiiiii! LOL) There was also the little dude that worked at the pool bar and the Disco, awesome kid! Things are a little dated at spots in the resort but all I was asking for was a clean place and that by far was met. Only complaint is that the majority of the buffet food was cold, although still delicious! Great bang for your buck! Also, one of the nicest beaches I've been to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation at Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar resort from Dec. 27th to Jan. 10th and had the best family vacation! We have been travelling for many years around these dates so it's very expensive to travel with two kids and since one is 13, paid for an adult price as well. We really love Riviera Maya and noitced it was expensive so when I found this Hotel which was in our budget, I did alot of reading here and noticed mixed reviews, but mostly excellent reviews about the beach. Mostly what I admire is Erika, who was so professionnal in replying to some reviews and when I decided to write to her, just to inform her of our arrival and what would like upon arrival for our room location for us and my sister who came the second week. Honestly she really exceeded our expectations. Overall this hotel is the best we've had for everything we look for. Best service in this Hotel: Thanks to Miguel, Hotel manager, for upgrading our rooms, and was always on the premises in greeting all guests; Thank you to Yairi, Concierge, for always making sure we are well serviced; Thank you to Erika who handled my request so well and also came to introduce herself; Thank you to Sergio, Sarai, Victor, Adan & Ricardo, they were the best animation team we have had from our previous trips. They made our kids and us so happy! They had many activities and we enjoyed all of them. Thank you to Jose, room maid who always had our room so clean and mostly the beautiful and unique towel art work. This Hotel is so well located, the best beach you could find in Riviera Maya, Excellent service, best food, rooms are nice a bit small. Once again thank you to all for making our stay such a memorable one, and we will definately come back, mostly because of such an amazing atmosphere. Jasmine

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Safe Resort Location!”
Reviews.Author: Opinionated2012
Reviews.Content: "Booked with ease approx 9 days in advance through Escapes.ca. All information needed to travel safely was emailed to me by Escapes.ca. Many important tips in this info package including plane tickets, hotel voucher (all inclusive) and how to "advance" book seats on the charter flight (plus much more info). For the $15 charge per seat per flight (some seat locations on the plane cost more), I recommend this be done so you are confident you'll be sitting beside your travel partner. You also can show up for the flight slightly later than those travels who do not already have their seats booked. The Allegro all inclusive resort in Playacar was great! It is only rated a 3.5 to 4 star, but the service is 5 star for sure. The grounds of the resort are great. The rooms are a little rustic, but gives you the feeling you are in Mexico. I enjoyed the rustic atmosphere of the room. I recommend the upper floor of the 8 suite buildings (4 suites on ground floor...4 suites on upper floor) in order to get the vaulted ceiling and the view of the grass roof from the inside. I believe most of the upper floor rooms have king size beds while most of the lower floor rooms have 2 double beds. I also recommend a building location close to the pool and ocean. All rooms have a patio (lower floor) or deck (upper floor) with a hammock that works great. NOTE: Due to the grass roofs, some upper floor rooms could drip a few drops of water during a heavy rain. This happened in our room, but we enjoyed that too. All you have to do is wipe up the small pool of water on the tile floor with a towel and it is dry again. I ask you...where else can you stay where your room will have a grass roof? This is a memory I will NEVER forget! The staff in all areas of the resort are well trained so I tipped a lot to acknowledge that fact. The entertainment/activities staff work very hard offering activities during the day around the pool and at night hosting shows in the theatre (and beach parties if that is on the agenda). The restaurant, bar and domestic staff work with a smile ALL THE TIME so I tipped, tipped, tipped (just $1 USD) everytime they did something for me. The professional dancers that perform in the theatre (about every second night) are very well trained and put on unique shows. During one show I lost count after 10 costume changes. NOTE: There is only a few seconds of delay before the next number would start. HOW DO THEY CHANGE SO QUICKLY? This was very impressive as was their talent, energy, fitness level, muscle tone, make-up and looks. I enjoyed the food in the Italian a la carte and at the buffets. The food was excellent at this resort...always something good to eat because of the wide selection. Sorry I did not try the Mexican a la carte, but I saw lots of people using it. Check out the "snack shack" near the lunch buffet. They seem to BBQ something different everyday along with the expected beef burgers. The feeling of safety in the Playacar area and on this resort are second to none. Playacar is a gated area of Play del Carmen and no unauthorized vehilces enter this area. The fact that the shopping district of Play del Carmen's 5th Avenue is a $7 taxi ride or a 20 - 30 minute walk away (walk on the beach or on the street) makes this resort's location the best I ever experienced in Mexico. The beach was very nice and safe. The water colour is amazing! You can walk a long way down the beach in both directions and view the other resorts in the area. I believe you can book parasailing, subba diving and snorkling excursions, etc. right on the beach (just a short walk 5 min walk from the Allegro resort). The beach walks and activities are a definite plus. I did not experience one "time share" sales pitch while staying in this area. I would go back to Allegro in Playacar in a minute for all the reasons mentioned above."

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time !!”
Reviews.Author: ddetlor
Reviews.Content: The beach, the staff and area are all just great !! The food was good and very little bugs at night. Our room was bottom floor as requested because if it rains hard the top rooms roof leaks. The rooms were modest but clean. The resort is a good 3.5....if they would update the rooms a bit it would be a good 4..... we had a great time with NO complaints at all........if we wanted a 5 star we would have gone to one. We would go back and we were with our girls 15 and 10 who also had a great time !!! The only problem I had was NO STRAWS if you like a straw bring some. The walk to town is about 15min. and very safe.We got some really great deals. You just must know how to handle the pushy people and bargan with them. Drop them alot and walk away if you must. My husband got a little tired of the draft but drinks were good and so was the selection. The mexician food was very good. Entertainment was ok better on some nights. I was selected one night and had a blast ! Only wish I had a video of it. So as long as your not a snob and are looking for a 5 star. This hotel is well worth it. We stayed Jan. 10 - 18th. Stay on bottom level... Heather Dawn and family from Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Just got back last night.”
Reviews.Author: Irene3981
Reviews.Content: We booked thru AirTransat. The shuttle from the airport took about an hour and half. It takes a while for them to load up with enough people then they make stops along the way. We got a great deal so for the price it was AWESOME! LOCATION: The resort is right on a beautiful beach in a row of other resorts. It's about a 25 min. walk down the beach or by street to get to Playa Del Carmen. About 5 mins away in the other direction is a small plaza of shops. This is where the tours picked us up. HOTEL ROOM: The resort is nice for a 3 star. It's one of the only Mexican style resorts left in the area. There are over twenty bungalow style places each with about 8 rooms. The ones on the top have a thatched roof. Not good in the rain, luckily we were at the bottom. Also people on the top floor said you could hear everything in the rooms beside them since they shared one roof. The bathroom had been updated but not totally redone. The beds are on hard cement but I talked to many people in other resorts and theres was the same. WEATHER: It does rain this time of year. So one evening it rained several inches in about 40 mins, two night it rained continuously but was gone shortly after midmorning. There was one day it rained about 10 hours equaling about a foot of rain. The resort has no activities should this occur. All activities are outdoor ones and there are not many spots to go that do not have the thatched roof, which leaks. FOOD/Drink: The drinks were great. There are only 3 bars, one by the buffet with limited seating, one at the pool and one in the disco which is only open in the evenings. The buffet is open for breakfast and dinner. The food trays are put on metal plates that are supposed to keep it hot, but most food was cold. The buffets were 70% the same each night. Each night had a theme with a little decor. Breakfast got boring quick. There was at least one station that would make hot food on demand but only one item (ex. breakfast, eggs or omelettes and at dinner one meat would be served there) so it would be hot. Lunch is served by the pool & mexican ala cart. Lunch is the steam food trays over hot water so it was hot and always good. The ala carts are okay at least the food is hot. SERVICE: The staff are great! Some have very limited or no English but all are happy, personable and very helpful. The entertainment staff (Hector & Victor especially) were fantastic. The waiters are always singing and in a good mood. We especially liked Jacobo. Our rooms were cleaned daily, fresh towels and each day a new character made of towels was on my bed when I got back to the room. EXCURSIONS: We took the ferry to Cozamel. Tip there are two companies working in tandum and if you buy a return ticket you can only return on their ferry which does not always have great return times, so buy a one way ticket then on the way back you can get a one way for the next returning ferry no matter what company it is. It's about $13 USD one way. We did a tour to Tulum for $43 US, it's a fairly small ruin but has a great beach. It's only a half hour away. We also went to Snorkle with the turtles in Akumal it was $79ish. They picked you up, brought you to the jungle to swim in a natural cenote for about 1/2 hour then bring you to the ocean in Akumal to snorkle with the turtles for about 40 mins. Note: you could take the public bus for $3 US and either use your own snorkle equipment or rent theirs. The only good thing about the tour is someone with an underwater camera swims with you and takes photos. This CD is $25 US. It would have been nice to be there longer as the beaches are beautiful. I would definately go again. I returned home to snow.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Fun Week”
Reviews.Author: ILoveSummerSun
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Allegro Playacar resort from Jan. 9th-16th. The resort is definitely dated, but kept very clean and tidy. The grounds and gardens are really beautiful with mature plants and trees. The transfer to the hotel was good, bus was new and clean. The attendant, Joel, was funny and helpful with information about Mexico, and the area. Check in was average, not too slow, as AI resorts often are. Staff seemed like they were always a bit overwhelmed, tense and not overly friendly. It seemed like they had a lots to deal with, the hotel was completely full. Our room was fine, basic, which we were expecting. Very clean, had a fridge, coffee maker, in room safe etc. We asked the house keeper(with a small tip) to leave 2 or 3 bottles of water in our room, as they only leave one. We did have some trouble with our safe, but that was figured out. Although, I wouldn't necessarily use the safe next time, as it seemed like anyone working on the grounds could reset the password... The beach is lovely! Such soft, creamy coloured, "flour-like" sand. What was nice, and what really convinced us to book this hotel, is that it is right on the beach. Some of the other resorts are on a huge piece of property, and you have to walk 20 minutes just to get to the beach from your room. The beach is also cleaned every day or so of seaweed and garbage, so it is very pristine. The pools were clean and nice. Lots of activities went on in and around the pool right in front of the beach; stretching, yoga, aqua aerobics, jenga, ping pong tournaments etc. I personally don't like to do that stuff in front of the whole resort, so I didn't really get involved. Safe was really on it, cleaning up glasses and garbage and kept the place tidy. The food was really decent actually, quite a bit of variety. I found breakfast to be the best, chilquillies, beans, omelet station, tons of fruit, fresh juice, french toast, waffles, cereal, pastries... Lunch got pretty boring fast because the buffet moves down to the restaurant by the pool, and the variety is pretty lacking. I did however love that there was always fresh salad stuff; beets, carrots, lettuce, radish and bean sprouts. I don't eat wheat or dairy, and there was quite a lot of stuff I could eat. You can always just asked for corn tortillas and make tacos with whatever ingredients you find, I did this a lot. There is also a BBQ which had burgers, hot dogs, fries etc. This seemed to be pretty popular with some of the big eaters. If you don't do dairy, then I might suggest bringing those little tetra packs of soy milk for your coffee etc. I just drank my coffee black. We made a few trips into Playa del Carmen and the little shopping area in Playacar. Both are major tourist traps, annoying men harassing you to buy their stuff and when you don't being totally rude to you. I actually wanted to buy some silver from this shop in Playacar, and the shop keeper was such a jerk, I had to leave, and it totally threw me off of shopping for the rest of the trip. Everything is way over priced at the markets, and on the streets, do not expect to get a good deal in this area. So a few things on the bad list.... - We had to switch rooms as we were in the unit right by the genorator, which was so loud, even with ear plugs, the vibration kept me up for 2 nights. This unit is building 25, so any rooms with 25 first. The hotel was full so it took 2 days to switch rooms, until someone checked out. - The second room we moved to completely flooded when it rained, there was about an inch of water on the floor, and water was literally POURING onto our bed. I can't describe how frustrating this was after we had just switched rooms and unpacked our stuff. The staff at the front desk were overwhelmed with all the people in the same situation as we were.. I think there must have been about 8-10 rooms that were leaking from the rain. We were in Unit 14 on the top floor. So we were moved to the other Occidental resort, Excaret. We got a basic room, which was quite a bit more updated than our room at the Allegro, so it was a nice change I guess. We tried to look on the bright side, change of scenery. There was a bottle of sparkling wine in our new room(Unit 22, and it didn't leak the next time it rained) with a letter of apology for the inconvenience. - We refused to pay for the room safe at the end of our stay, but it would have been $2US per night. - Beach chairs are really uncomfortable, they are probably 20+ years old. But there was always enough of them for everyone. - Internet access is only in the front lobby, and it costs a lot, I can't exactly remember, but I think it was $30US for a hour...? - Drinks are overly sweet, I asked for "NO Sweet" and they were much better. And if you drink beer, you might be disappointed, as there is ONLY Corona on tap, and it's bad. Bar staff was always helpful, and wanted to make you happy! - Be warned of the Occidental staff that is right outside the lobby, as they are trying to get you to view a time share in their other resort, the Excaret. Unless of course you want to spend $50,000US on 25 years of time shares! They are very persistent and pushy, and do not let on what their real intentions are. "Just come and view the property, take a few photos, and show your friends back home how nice it is, so then maybe they will want to come there in the future" is what the man told us. We were told we would get a free bottle of tequila 100% agave, t shirts and a beach bag. We were not told it was a time share, vacation club, or that it was high pressure sales, would take over 3 hours out of our day, and make us so frustrated. Be aware, those friendly guys are working on commission to get you over to that over resort so they can try to pressure you into a 25 year commitment!! Anyways, enough bad. We really did have a fun trip, the food was better than expected, the bar staff and restaurant staff are great and friendly, the beach is amazing, the hotel grounds are beautifully kept, there is lots to do as far as sports and activities. We went to one show at the theatre, and it was a dance show. It was good, talented dancers, pretty girls and lively music. It seemed like every night there was lots of applause and cheering coming from the theatre and mini disco. This resort is definitely 2-3 stars, so if you are expecting that, then it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Its a 3.5 star, so expect a 3.5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Frenzy_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Occidental Allegro Playacar from Jan 9-16, 2012. We choose to return to the Playa de Carmen area as we love the beach in playacar and this hotels accessibility to 5th avenue. This resort is located within the Playacar gated community of hotels which is right outside of Playa de Carmen, and a 15-20 min walk to 5th avenue. Keep in mind, this is the oldest hotel within playacar. If you are looking for marble and granite, I would highly suggest you pay more and go elsewhere as this hotel is rustic in design but elegant in all other areas. Beach: Wonderful – Long white sand and turquoise water. Shade is minimal, and boach loungers are dated and some in need of repair. Hotel: there are approx. 40 small units containing 8 studios in each building. The rooms although dated with old and chipped tiles, each room is cleaned daily, beds are changed and more importantly, no bed bugs! We opted for a room on the second floor, we were lucky enough that our rooms roof did not leak,. But some other guests were not so fortunate. Food: This is our third time at an Occidental hotel., and I must say it exceeds a 3 star expectation. The food was great. There was fresh fruit daily, and a great variety in selection. Both ala carts were also easy to book and delicious. Pos: Beach. Staff. Drinks. Food. Accommodations. Neg: No gym. Wi-fi or internet access $50 a week. Safe $2 per day. The truth: This is an excellent 3.5 star! Keep in mind its a 3.5 star. Don’t expect a 5 star hotel for a 3 star rate!

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: robptravels
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from the Allegro Playacar and had a fantastic vacation.The food was excellent and plenty of variety. The allegro sits on the most beautiful stretch of beaches just paradise! if you are looking for value at a reasonable price don't hesitate to book this hotel. The rooms are a bit tired so if your looking for marble and granite this is not your hotel. The Allegro is rustic but so very comfortable. Service all around was wonderful. Location is grea,t just a 20 min walk to 5th avenue and a 70 peso cab ride. At the price we payed i would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great week then up graded”
Reviews.Author: go-away
Reviews.Content: we booked two weeks here but we were offered an up grade to the Excart Resort more on that pace in next resort. the Allegro we had a fantastic time again the food was great the staff in most part were very helpful but in the end that was all resolved . the games at the pool was a lot of fun to watch. our stretching was bending our elbow with a drink in hand. will be back. we meet a nice couple here who told us about the upgrade and meet them there again I am going to write a review about that next

Reviews.Title: “First time, we WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: kmcanada
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Occidental Allegro Playacar at the end of August, beginning of September 2011. This is our third time to Mexico (we normally spend 10 days), we always stay at the Occidental Grand Xcaret in the Royal Club but we really wanted to check out the Allegro Playacar as we have heard great things about this smaller resort in the Occidental family. Since we are ‘regulars’ now at the Xcaret, they drove us over to the Allegro and we spent the entire day there, and we were thrilled. The Allegro Playacar is in an area the we would term as a ‘gated community’, it is a nice little area with many residential homes, a Starbucks ! (made my day, a short walk from the resort) and some other little stores. The whole Playacar area is just very nice, comfortable and safe since you cannot get into the community unless you live there or work there (or obviously are staying at one of the resorts in the area). The grounds of the Allegro are absolutely gorgeous, they are clean, beautifully manicured and well, what else can I say…. you will see grounds keepers constantly maintaining them. Lots of pride goes into their work. Accommodations: The rooms are located in villa type buildings, two-story with an average of four rooms per building. The rooms are an adequate size for one or two people, large bed, armoire with a flat screen TV, safe, ceiling fan, A/C, closet, clean and bright washroom, and separate sink area (euro design, the bathrooms have certainly been updated). If you are travelling with more than two people they open up the adjoining door (which normally locks on both sides) and essentially give you two rooms (therefore 2 bathrooms for a family of four- this works well!) They also have Vacation Club rooms – which are suite type rooms (more like what we are used to in the Royal Club at the Xcaret). Everything is clean, bright and the curtains, bedding, towels, etc. are clean, not worn and are well maintained. Sure you might find a little gecko living in your room, but if that is something that will ruin your trip then just stay home, you’re in a tropical country and lizards and other giant bugs are the norm here. I had seen some comments on this site in the past about it being unclean, and things needing to be fixed. But apart from our room, we were shown many rooms in other buildings and their views and clearly everything has been updated since the new manager took over around December 2010. We did not see anything that was in need of repair or anything that was unclean. Food: Food is fabulous, even lots of food for my picky children! The Beach/pool restaurant serves anything from Hamburgers to pasta to seafood and salads, lots to choose from. They have a separate area where you can get pizza, and even a little BBQ area where you will find the burgers and hot dogs. You can eat inside the restaurant or outside at the many tables available. They also have the buffet at the main building and another restaurant which is escaping me right now, only because we didn’t eat in there (but saw it and the décor was beautiful) – I think it was an Italian Restaurant. Much to the Occidental experience we have at the Xcaret- the food at the Allegro Playacar is also great! If you need something just ask. At breakfast you will have make your own omelets, and all of the other traditional North American breakfast items in addition to some traditional Mexican favourites, so there is always LOTS to choose from. I will throw this in here only because I have been asked so many times, and in hindsight when travelling with the kids it was a question I had too. MILK: Coming from a family where we drink tons of milk (normally skim milk here in Canada) the milk available at the resort tastes just like good old Canadian milk- however I would compare it more to a 1 % or 2 %. The kids drank it daily without EVER making a comment that it was ‘different’ or ‘tasted funny’, and they even offer chocolate milk, which makes life easy too. I was relieved that they would still drink the milk, as I did not want the kids having pop every day just because we are on vacation. The fruit juices were also very nice and pure. Service and Tipping: The service at the Allegro is top-notch just like what we are used to at the Xcaret (which keeps us coming back), and because of this we will be back to the Allegro Playacar as well. Do not be surprised when they walk by with a smile and ‘hola’ and ask if you need anything. You will encounter this all the time, from many different staff members, I think because they are a smaller resort they have the ability to be even more personable and this is a very large asset for them. I cannot tell you how frustrating it is to see people not tipping just because they are eating at a buffet or thinking somehow that ‘all inclusive’ means that your tips are somehow included. These people work very hard. For the most part they work 12 hour days, more hours at peak time and still only make about $ 12.00 USD a DAY ! Yes, I said A DAY ( this is just the country’s norm) For those of us who make much more than that an hour, it shouldn’t kill you to tip for service that you appreciate. Please don’t be a spoiled tourist, we are all humans and should treat others with respect. Ok, I just had to vent, I have just seen so much ignorance over the years. Much of their income depends on tips; it is part of their culture and it is appreciated more than you know. Normally we tip the maids, restaurant servers, our excursion tour guides and the bar staff. But don’t forget about the groundskeepers, and so many others that work just as hard but are not necessarily front line with the customers. When I see the same groundskeeper for a few days, I tip him. Beach and pools: The 2 pools are beautiful and clean, lots of pool side chairs available and towels whenever you need them. The beach is clean, and the water is a beautiful shade of blue. Even the day we were there, it was very windy, the red flags went up advising people not to go into the water (the waves just get so big) but still a beautiful sight (see my pictures). The sand is clean and clearly regularly groomed for litter and seaweed. The Allegro is smaller that what we are used to at the Xcaret, but we really liked the ambiance. I would say it is ‘quaint’ and very friendly. We just spent the day there and still made many new friends. It is child friendly, but that doesn’t mean that you cannot have a good party time there. If you want more of a party time, as for a villa near the pool/bar/restaurant area. If you are travelling with children and want some early nights in bed this is easy too as there are villas away from the music and night life. There IS something here for everyone! Like I said though- if there is something you need, just ask as they are VERY accommodating and eager to please, but they don’t read minds. So before you complain ask for what you need! This train of thought goes for anywhere you may visit. Clearly great pride is taken by the management and staff at the Allegro ~ thank you for a wonderful day and this coming August we will be spending five days at the Allegro and five days at the Xcaret ! PS- you can also walk along the beach into Playa del Carmen in about 20 minutes Any questions please msg me as I am feeling like I forgot to include something

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Playacar Resort”
Reviews.Author: sharkhunter2009
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Mexico where we stayed at the Allegro Playacar in Playa Del Carmen from January 3 to January 10th. I think for myself the biggest problem was I had the luxury of staying two weeks at the Grand Palladium White Sands Resort & Spa last year and set the bar way to high. The Allegro is an older resort and during our stay there it seemed it was always being repaired by workers at the resort (wood twig railings going to the second level suites).
