They would also clean the pool while we were in it (scubbing tiles with cleaners) Transportation: After arriving in Cancun and boarded the bus, it took a very long time to get to the resort as a result of dropping people off at two other hotels. What compounded the delays was the amount of time we got stuck behind vehicles and golf carts left in front of the resorts and for some reason the drivers couldn't be found. It took us an additional hour to finally get to the Allegro. Check-in: Checking into the Allegro seem to go without a hitch and the staff was quick to get us to our suites. The one thing I did realize was that there were not a lot of people around and the resort almost seemed empty. Room: Arriving in the room it was easy to see that this is an older resort when looking at the rough plaster patchwork done on the ceiling of the bathroom and chipped tiles on the floor throughout the room. The curtains had also seen better days. The overall appearance of the room is not an overly big deal as we spend very little time in it. More importantly, the king size bed provided me with the comfort and sleep I needed. Pools/Beach The pools were somewhat small with the one pool (with bridge across it) being the main area for all the children at the resort and given the time of year was a tad bit on the cold side. The pool with the volleyball net and swim up bar was almost never used and I don't recall a single moment ever seeing anyone sitting at the swim-up bar which may have been a result of how cold the water was. On two of the days, the water level of the main pool was so low that it made it difficult to even swim in it. The beach was great and was where we spent the majority of our time because there were so few people staying at the resort. The beach here was was far better than the Grand Palladium with almost no coral on the beach or in the water. Food/Restaurants: The food and restaurants were probably the most disappointing aspect of the Allegro and especially the buffet upstairs. In saying this, I am not sure if it is because of what I had experienced at the Grand Palladium or I was just expecting too much. The selection of food served at the Allegro buffet was somewhat limited and worse of all it was more often cold than even warm. Breakfast (bacon, eggs, sausages) were almost always luke warm to cold and on several days was in short supply with many people waiting for the staff to bring out more. On one occasion, a fresh new tray of bacon came out and it was cold as if it had been sitting in the back for a time. The Italian restaurant was not too bad and was almost empty on any given night and the Mexican restaurant never did open during our stay and not sure why. Overall, I would say that the food aspect was the most disappointing part of our stay other than the buffet between the pools seemed to be busy throughout the day once it opened and especially the hamburger hut of to the left of it. Beverages/Alcohol: The one thing I can say is that this resort did not hold back on serving alcohol and in abundance. If you ordered a rum & coke, you could almost guarantee you would get a triple or quadruple as a drink serving. No point waiting to be served because few if any staff came by the beach or your chair to serve you. This was definitely a self-serve resort for alcohol. Internet/other services: The real negative about the Allegro was that there was no free internet as offered by other resorts. The cost was US$50/week for access and most if not all people just walked the block down to the Starbucks coffee shop to access the Internet. The other issue was that you had to pay $2 a day to use the in room safe which i found to be a bit cheap for even this resort. Although it is such a small amount to pay it was still a problem when we couldn't even get the safe to open. A call to the front desk to fix it went went unanswered. The one other complaint was with security when we had problems with the couple above us. They would fight throughout the night after a day of drinking and when we called security they refused to do anything about it because no one else had complained about it.

Reviews.Title: “fun family time over new years”
Reviews.Author: JustColleen
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent, walking distance to play del carmen and a little shopping area (though more expensive than playa). Small resort that although was very close to amenties it had a private, relaxed and secure feeling. Rooms, spacious and clean. Although the first night we did not get adjoining rooms to accomodate us and our three small children, the second day the manager Miguel was very helpful and set us up for fantastic rooms close to everything accesible for kids and also moved my partents right beside us as well. The first set of rooms up by the lobby were in desperate need of a paint job and bathroom reno's but the second set of rooms were updated and nice. Staff: Fantastic... very helpful and friendly. Limburg stands out as a favourite as well as the Manager Miguel who was very helpful and personable. Food... Excellent.. lots of variety and different theme nights during our week stay so even though there are not a lot of restuarant options, you had a good variety and didnt have to eat the same thing everyday. we only did a la carte once at the Italian and it was amazing!!! Kids club, not the best I have seen but not the worst. This is actually the only time we have brought our small children and they were leary about going to kids club but once they gave it a try they were eager to go back, lots of activities and the staff there was great. Grounds. Well maintained and clean, the beach is beautiful and clean. Overall: we have a great vacation. New years eve dinner and entertainment were excellent. Great place for a young family to go without the fear of children being lost in a large resort. Staff is approachable and accomodating... Enjoy your time there.. Good quality for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “It's in my top 5 of best holidays I've had”
Reviews.Author: Gillian P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 21st December 2011 - 4th January 2012. Loved this place, it was so clean and tidy. Room: was spotless and it was near the beach, I loved it's location. Fresh towels everyday which I love. Food: was good, something to suit everyone, even for the fusiest eater. Though sometimes the food was only lukewarm. I prefer my food to be hot, so that it can cool down as I'm eating, but that's just me. What can I say about the cocktails, I loved them, they make part of my holiday. Staff: were awesome. All the staff were charming, polite and curteous. Alexis in Reception was so professional and such a gentleman. The waiting and bar staff were just the best - Carlos (who kissed my hand every evening I went for dinner), Fausto, Candido, Enrique, Victor, Jacabo (who sung to me every morning I went for breakfast), not to mention Ivan and Miguel who made the best cocktails and were so entertaining. Thank you all for looking after me so much, you made this one the best times for me. And last but not least, thanks to Neri for all the cuppuccino's you made me, you are fantastic! Beach: very clean and no problem in getting a sunlounger. I found my own wee quiet spot and it was great. Entertainment staff: these guys and girls work very hard and thanks to Adan (so professional, helpful and such a gentleman), Sergio, Victor and Lester (who I know has now left). You guys got me involved in some of the activities and I even won a t-shirt. As for the entertainment in the evenings, I feel this could be improved on. There was a lot of shows put on by dancers, don't get me wrong, they were very enjoyable but some live music, ie band or singer, would've been good for a change. If you didn't want to leave the resort after the entertainment there was nowhere really to sit and have a drink. There is a disco which is very good but I feel that putting some wicker tables/chairs/sofas around the courtyard area near the stage area and just outside the disco would be good as if you want a drink but don't want to stay in the disco you can still sit outside and enjoy the great atmosphere of this place. This is just a personal opinion, as a solo traveller I find it easier to meet people this way rather than in a noisy bar/disco. The New Year's Eve party, well what can I say, this place just excelled, one of THE best nights I've had. You had to be there to appreciate it. All in all, this holiday has to be in one of my top 5 and I am planning returning Christmas/New Year 2012. Oh and can I please have a table and chair outside the disco bar if I do ... thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Playacar over New Year's”
Reviews.Author: Matildah
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at this resort, and loved it. The staff are very friendly. The food was great - even though the main restaurant is a buffet, the type of food was always changing, fresh and plentiful. The hours for all meals span a 4 hour period (bkfast= 7-11, lunch=12-4 poolside, and din= 6-10). There was never a line up for food like some other larger resorts. The resort was at capacity while we were there, but you would not have known it. The beach area is huge -- and best bonus ever: no lounger hogging! (ie you don't have to wake up at dawn to get a lounger). The beach is lovely and since the resort is smaller than neighbouring ones, there is lots of room on the beach. There is beach volleyball, pool volleyball, tennis and basketball. Other activities are going all day long if you choose to participate. The rooms are located in little bungalow thatched roof buildings that house 8 rooms. The upper level rooms have a great high ceiling and a balcony. The lower level rooms have a terrace - both are quite nice. Be aware however, the birds love to sit at the peak of the roof and sing their hearts out at sunrise! The area of the resort is the gated community of Playacar. It is quite nice filled with modern homes and cobblestone roads. We ran around the area and felt as safe as we do at home. The walk to town was a leisurely 20 minutes and quite enjoyable. There is also a plaza close by (3 mins) that has souvenir shops and a Starbucks. That made for a nice excursion. They did a great job over the holidays providing a lovely New Year's Eve gala and also a special poolside dinner with a fire show and dancing on the beach. We would highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay from Dec. 21st to 28th 2011”
Reviews.Author: dfgLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay at Allegro. The staff was really nice and always helpful. The beach is pretty and much less crowded than the resorts beside. There was always a few empty chairs! The food was good (buffet, Italian and Mexican restaurants). The resort is clean and it is intimate because it is not too big. The only problem is the room. We changed from 2701 (bottom floor) because we had a nice view on the resort next door. Our second room was on the second floor (5411), it was a little bit cleaner, but still very old and the air conditioner was not working well... The overall stay was worth it, even if the room was not too good (we stayed outside all the time anyways to get a nice tan!).

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable honeymoney”
Reviews.Author: N0r_79
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 days in Allegro Occidental Playacar and, our experience is that this is a "value for money" hotel. The staff was very helpful. The resorts are found ideal location on the beach, resorts are relatively small, quiet and peaceful. We have only one negative experience, we believe that the rooms should be renovated now...they are "dated"... The food and drink were excellent and always changing, actually you can eat all day if you want...:-) The location is perfect, walking to Playa Del Carmen is maybe 20 min. The beach was very nice but we did not find as white sand and green water as we saw in Tulum... At last but not least, the garden of the hotel is full of "flora and fauna" :-) and was very peaceful. So enjoy your vacation here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value with ongoing improvments.”
Reviews.Author: blacktop_gypsy
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this resort, having stayed there in December 2010. The excellent beach and close proximity (15 minutes walk) to Playa del Carmen are the biggest draw. The food was much better this year than last year. The resort is one of the older resorts in Playacar. I noticed some big facility improvements such as the renovated disco, refurbished basketball courts. The rooms are still rather dated, but who spends a lot of time in their room. In our suite, the old soapstone tub had been fitted with a new fiberglass tub insert. No matter how much you clean soapstone, it always looks dirty, so this was a nice change. The bottom line is that for the money, it is a great resort. Nearby resorts may have nicer rooms, but they are much more expensive, and don't offer a lot more. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: sheron a
Reviews.Content: everything excellent,friendly fun staff.good food and drinks.great beach with lots of cots.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbabybeachbaby
Reviews.Content: This resort met my expectations and surpassed them on many levels. The staff is fantastic, especially the entertainment crew and the bartenders/waiters. They really go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and take care of your every need. The only complaint I have is that I didn't see many tourists tipping?! Mind you, it seemed like there were many Europeans in the Mayan and they are not use to tipping so...?! Remember, the local wages are pathetically low and the staff relies on tips to support their families, so be kind and generous:)) The location is perfect, walking to Playa Del Carmen is maybe 20 min and then you can walk about 30 min in the other direction to a beautiful raw beach landscape of sand, rock and palm trees, great exercise in the sand:) And the beach is to die for, seriously...heaven on earth!! I travelled with a girl friend (we are late 40's) and 3 kids (ages 17-21) and we had a blast. We are pretty active people and the kids played beach volleyball everyday and engaged in many of the activities around the resort. There are so many things to do off the resort. It really depends on the type of person you are. We snorkeled in some cenotes, spent a half day in Akumel snorkeling with turtles etc and went to Tulum to see the ruins. Next time, I will get over to Cozumel and Isla de Mujeres:) I guess the fact that we didn't do all the things we wanted to is a testament to the resort, we were just having so much fun that we didn't want to leave most days!! I was worried about the food, but we were all really impressed, tons of variety yum! Actually I am really missing it right about now lol. My girl friend is allergic to gluten and she could eat most things, and the chefs made her special dinners if needed which was awesome! So in summary, I think this resort is an amazing choice for the price. It is not 5 star people so don't go there if that is what you are wanting. This resort is small and quaint, literally 2 min walk from any room to the beach or buffet. Some of the larger resorts are 15 min walks from rooms to beach, so just keep that in mind when booking:) If I were to go back to the Mayan then I would stay here. Enjoy your trip! The Mayan Riviera is a beautiful choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It all depends what you want...........”
Reviews.Author: jeff_reinhardt
Reviews.Content: After having read numerous reviews - it was with some concern that we left for our trip to Occidental Allegro Playacar (December 3-10). We think it all depends upon what you want and your expectations. It's a beautiful property, in an ideal location on the beach. It's relatively small, quiet and peaceful. We were fortunate to be placed in the "First Club" section and in a beautiful suite.... so our viewpoint is a bit jaded. The rooms (thatched room units) are clean and simple. Because the property is small, you are always a short walk to the beach, pool or one of the restaurants. The buffets are fine - good choice of styles of food and quality is good. The Italian restaurant (need reservations) was excellent ! The Mexican restaurant (need reservations) was fine.... but there was so much Mexican food anyway.... wasn't really necessary. Buffet dinner changes themes each night. This is NOT a big fancy mega resort. There are many of these in Playacar and Riviera Maya. If you are looking for marble, fancy dining, big pools, beach chairs that require you getting up at 6am to place your stuff on.... then this isn't for you. If you like hammocks, feet in the sand and wading/swimming in the water --- this is your place. The entertainment at Allegro is pathetic...... yet in a funny way. Worth stopping in --- but if you are looking for a resort with nighttime activities you will be disappointed. This is a laid back place. Take a day trip and go to Akumal to snorkel with the turtles and to the cenotes (caves). We had considered doing this without a tour.... but would have missed lots of stuff that we saw by going with a tour.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Holiday at Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Danielle O
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Allegro Playacar for two weeks from Dec 4 - 18 and it was lovely. We paid $1400 each for two weeks, an all inclusive package. When we had booked, we were told the rooms are simple but the beach is fantastic! And so it was. This resort could not have a nicer beach with white sand and clear blue water. It was truly beautiful. The buffet food was good and always changing. One night would be a Mexican dinner, the next Italian to All American and so on. The staff members were exceptionally friendly and continuously made efforts to play games, join activities, spend time getting to know you, answered any questions that we could think of and since we were there close to christmas, many offered to tell us about their Mexican traditions. The rooms were very simple, nothing extravagent. If you are looking to spend most of your vacation time inside your hotel room, do not book with Allegro. However, if you are looking to spend most of your time out on the fantastic beach, playing with your children or sipping cocktails in the sand, playing many fun beach activities, are determined to play games, interact with the staff members, enjoy nightly entertainment, and are looking forward to experiencing different food and such . . . book with Allegro! :) If you are an open minded person, easy going and loves a nice beach, Allegro is the place for you! In every experience, there are always positive and negative results. Allegro had more positive than negative experiences. I hope this review helps :) All the best, Danielle British Columbia, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eeva K
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Occidental Allergo Playacar in two periods: from 2nd to 4th of November and again from 22nd to 30th of November and I enjoyed my stay and had a really good time. Yes, the rooms need upgrading. But on the other hand the price that I paid for my stay was reasonable and I think that I've got my money's worth. The beach was great, the food was quite good and the staff was very frendly. Special thanks to Carmen, the cleaning lady, a very nice young woman who did an excelent job. We were able to chat a little with my "un poco de Espanol". On 22th of November I came to the hotel directy from Cuba and was quite tired when entering the hotel. So. I was expecting and hoping for a relaxing and a bit boring week by the pool. Relaxing it was but not boring, thanks to the entertaiment team. I had fun. I took part in the daily activities that they arranged and their evening program was entertaining, too. As a dancing lover I expecially enjoyed the dancing performances, they where really good. Also, the entertainment team's own Comedy show was very funny. I had a really good time and if I'm ever coming back to Playa Del Carmen, I'll definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a 7 day relax”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends on a trip Nov 18th – Nov 25th 2011… and after reading so many bad reviews we knew we wanted to write a review before we even left so while we were there we took note of things… -Yes there was a little lizard in our bathroom one of the days (scared my Friend half to death) but I caught it and put it outside… you are in Mexico! These things happen! -The Front desk staff was not the nicest but I don’t blame them, all the other staff gets to be out and about in the resort visiting with guests and entertaining. -The rest of the staff was awesome! and we miss them so much!!! Thank you to Victor, Lester, our Bag boy and bartenders, (ps. the Mojitos are heavenly!!!!) -Internet was $2 per 10 mins -Big plus! You can actually walk to the market on 5th ave. to shop and its $7 to cab there if you don’t want to walk the 20mins there. -The photographers are really nice and they take good pictures, $12-$15 a picture is a really good deal compared to other places I have been. -The resort is small; its a 5 min walk or less from one end to the other, -The beach is beautiful and they clean it every night (we were told by another guest we met there) -We paid $900/person for the all-inclusive 7 nights and it was worth every dollar. -The shows at night are awesome for kids, the staff gets them to participate a lot and join them on stage. (we were not really into the shows though… as we are in our 20’s) -Food was amazing at the Mexican and Italian Restaurants!! -The buffets were also good, we would try every dessert they had at dinner but they were definitely not the sweetest desserts. -Also there are tones of activities they do during the day, Dancing lessons, water aerobics and things like that (we just tanned and drank the whole time though) Hope this helps someone out,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: BobTay
Reviews.Content: Just back from two weeks vacation with my spouse and had a Great time. First things first, where there any problems? Yes. Did they spoil our vacation? No, far from it. I can only speak as a First Club member but, Aida,(so sweet) Ignacio and Jose took GREAT care of us. They really were concerned about any issues we may have had. They did everything possible to make our stay as excellent as it was. Yes the resort is in the process of upgrading all the rooms and this takes time and money as we all know. It is not the fault of the staff by far. As for the beverage service, well we thought it was above standard. Naming a few, Esteban, Carlos and Santiago made sure our refreshments were as good as could be. As for the food and service. I did not hear one complaint about the variety or quality of the food. The Italian restaurant was our favorite, being taken care of by the Captain, Issac and Roberto. They went out of there way to make us feel so very welcome. Not to forget they buffet staff, Victor, Jacabon and Jorge always found us a place to sit at breakfast and lunch. It is not hard to like these people, I mean even they maintenance staff would greet you when you saw them. I have noting bad to say about this resort. Once all of the rooms are upgraded it will be hard to get reservations because of the beach, location and last but not least, the GREAT STAFF. They are all so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kara C
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews we were pretty concerned about going to this resort, however when we got there it was not at all like people have been saying. The hotel staff was very friendly, and we got checked in right away, and upgraded to a room by the pool and beach. The rooms are dated however they are VERY clean and the cleaning staff do an excellent job of keeping them that way. We didn't spend too much time in our room just to sleep and maybe watch a bit of tv to relax, so the fact that they were dated was not a big deal for us. The air condtioning worked perfectly too. We stayed on the second floor with a thached roof and had no problems. The food and drinks were excellent and the staff always remembered what you were drinking and were very attentive. There is very little night life, the shows at night are ok, nothing too fancy, if you are looking for night life go into town and go to Coco Maya it was alot of fun! The staff at this facility work very hard and treat their the guests well, we met many people who keep returning to this resort, we met a couple who have been 5 times, and another who come every year!The beach is amazing, one of the best, so enjoy and relax and remember to be kind to the staff and you will have an amazing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected ;)”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: Yes, I got there with very low expectations, my son was so upset after reading the reviews, I told them, lets just do it, I already booked it, so to late, lets try to enjoy it the best we can. Oh my God! when we got there, I got the best surprise ever, they upgrade our rooms, to a 2 bedroom suite with ocean view, the best view and best room I had ever had. So after that what else could I ask for? I was not expecting much, I had stayed at the Allegro in Cozumel, pretty much the same set up, but we go for the beach, the best at both, the food is not the best but still manage to gain some weight, so I'm glad it was only OK. The service was exellent. Thanks Freddy, the best waiter during the dinner time, thanks Faviola for keeping us in shape with the morning stretching, thanks to Jose at the first club desk and thanks to Victor and his back up, for keeping our rooms clean. We had the best time ever.

Reviews.Title: “Alegro Playa Car pretty sad place”
Reviews.Author: Tamshaw_11
Reviews.Content: I have been to the alegro playa car in 2008 and it was an amazing holiday!! so i talked 6 other friends into going there!! well whatl happened? the rooms were terrible but they were clean the customer service at the front desk was terrible and watch out for the Bernice she is terrible and should not work in customer service my cameras were stolen right from the patio at 4 am only people around was us and the security at that time of the night!! the guy that took them was the guy that shuts off the lights in the early am,and not the young guy either our neighbor could not sleep and was outside having a smoke and watched the guy take them!! she didnt think anything of it and thought they would just put them at the front desk!! well guess what the cameras are gone and we are still waiting for the security to come do a report!! well we are now home for almost 2 weeks and still have not herd a thing!! we talked to about 6 different managers about this problem and we were all sluffed off!! the girls at the front desk need to be fired out on there!!!! and bring someone in that really wants to work and accomadate your guests!! the greating in 2008 was a drink and an Hola this time it was cranky women and no Hola and no drink,,,,,sad occidental beacuse u did have a great little place with great staff!! and what happened to the garden bar and the midnight lunch??? time to open your eyes guys!!! before its to late and no body comes anymore the cameras back would be great or even the sd cards i have the chargers and those cameras are useless with out them would also be great to get a reply back from the many managers that wrote the color and make of the cameras down to do a report so i can get my insurance to cover them!! will not be back !! oh yeah one more thing your entertainment staff Lester was great and only doing his job sorry other people thought he was creepy... think about it people he is only doing his job and if you dont want to listen to the music and the guy talking over the speaker then go to the beach or to the other pool to read your Damn book dont blame it on Lester cause he was one of the nicest staff at this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seemed”
Reviews.Author: chatham-momma
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Nov 1311 to wake up to a flood in the room the next day.....went to the front desk was told I would be moved not sure where....... we had already repacked our belongings .asked to return at one to the desk.returned at ten to one and was told it wasn't one yet have a seat..sat watched Ithe clerk do nothing.....she waited on us at one told us our room would be ready at 4 and gave us the number.......ok checked room maid was not there yet location not bad......returned at 4 had bellboy take luggage to new room as the luggage was at the security desk all day.....guess what the new room was full of curtains it was a storage room never to be cleaned......now I am mad back to the desk ask to see manager that was a chore the questions asked just to see him final I said no more questions just get him,,,,,,, Martin came out of the back room heard my complaint asked me to give him a minute.......He got us a new room ocean pool view I am happy just to have a room.....rooms are the same just different view this room we had to get the tv fixed and had no airconditioning but at the point we said screw it we won't be back........The food was ok same old same old every night nothing special.........pool games not much and most of them boring and kiddish........nightly entertainment we won't even go there but i would like to know one thing when did darts ping pong and bingo become casino nightly games I missed that one in my home town......the bar well the front area has none....the disco opens at 6pm the pool bar opens at 11am they are not even close together the walk during the day from rooms or lobby is far if you want a drink but don't want to hang around the pool......we had a rain day and had to stay in the room for we ended up close to the bar but there is no general gathering area to socialize with your new friend and have a drink and fun.......the pool bar that is a joke you go to it but have to yell for the bar tender who is on the top level making drinks for we had only one person most of the time.......this is the first resort I have stayed in (7 yrs going) that we were not greet upon arrive with a drink and a welcome...... there were a lot of room changing going on at the resort for one reason or another one building was even closed down due to problems........the best part was when our friends were having down time in there room someone was trying to get in.... upon opening there door they found a family trying to get in the room they were just assigned....upon checking they were trying the right room but it was already ocuppied.......that is good management skills ......My girls had their cameras stolen one evening that is a different story they know who what time off our balcony reported it .......was told security would come for a statement it is now Nov 29 and we are still waiting...four different managers were told and they all played dumb. .......would I go back not on your life....... I will say Martin the manger was awesome the only one thou but the camera issue he was not working.....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: JMHPelham_Ont_
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in the Playacar area and we quite enjoyed it. This hotel has a great location on a beautiful beach within walking distance to town-approx. 20:00 via the sidewalk or 35:00 via the beach. Hotel is clean and tidy with attractive grounds and a very friendly staff. We found excellent food at both the buffet restaurants and the a la cartes. Yes, the rooms need updating, yes the nightly entertainment is very weak, but for the price we paid, the beach, the staff and the food make it great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Your Money”
Reviews.Author: BarbFry
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to the Allegro Playacar and without a doubt we would go again. We have stayed at 5 star resorts just a few minutes up the beach and at the end of the day it was the same beach here as a few resorts up. We spend enough time in our room to sleep so the fact that they are a little tired doesn't concern us. We don't go on vacation to sit in our room. The rooms are very clean and well taken care of by the housekeeping staff. Every day we came back from the beach to a clean, organized room with a cute animal creation on our beds. Yes the beds are firm, but other than the obnoxious neighbors in the room behind us that had no concern for anyone else but themselves we slept great! The neighbours activities only interrupted our slumber for a few minutes anyway and this was largely due to the fact that our particular room could be an adjoining room if necessary so the seal around the doors was not that efficient. The resort has lovely, well manicured grounds. There is a lack of outdoor seating in the upper area of the resort near the lobby and evening buffet. It would have been nice to be able to sit outside following our meal for a little while. Since we arrived the week following Tropical Storm Rina, its possible it had just been stored for the period of bad weather, if not the resort should invest in some. There are lots of new beach chairs and ample beach to enjoy. We prefer the beach to the pool but the pool was clean and maintained daily. There is a new gourmet coffee bar, and Neri will make you an excellent cappucino with a smile. In my opinion the food had improved over last year. There were several dishes to choose from so everyone can find something they like. There were several excellent fresh fish dishes this year and overall all food was fresh and well prepared. We only had one night that the heating trays did not work as efficiently and some of the dishes were a little cold. The staff are friendly and courteous. The resort is working on some updating and some of the rooms have been closed for complete overhauls. Several balconies were being repaired while we were there. So again, if you are looking for excellent value for your money you cannot go wrong here. The resort is a little tired, but clean, the staff are friendly and efficient and the beach is the same from one resort to the next! Why pay more???

Reviews.Title: “Worst rooms ever Dont settle for sub par vacation”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: We attempted to stay at this resort this past week... afrer walking into a very small dirty lobby.. We were taken to the rear of the resort where they checked us in.. when we arrived at our room we were in shock.. this place is so small and dirty.. cracked floor tiles no dressers to put any of your clothing... and the bed is so friggin hard... its just a cheap cheap mattress on top of a concrete slab... worse then any motel 6 ive ever been in.. needless to say we we not happy... only good thing i can say about this resort is that once i expressed my disgust in this resort.. they gave me a full refund less the one night we stayed and we moved up the beach to Royal Haciendas... truely a first class resort unlike the dump called Occidental Allegro Playacar..

Reviews.Title: “Best overall value!”
Reviews.Author: tromponya
Reviews.Content: Just got back and have a lot to tell you about this place. You should know some things about Mexico before you go. Mexican time is slow- don't go expecting anything to be on time. In fact don't go with any expectations and you will enjoy your holiday so much more. Also, it's a 3rd world country and there is rubble, cockroaches, and poverty. Read up about your location before you go. Do not drink the water or even brush your teeth with it. Take note not to open your mouth in the shower like I do in the morning! Leave the tap off when brushing your teeth to avoid the habit of running the water over your toothbrush.  Otherwise, this resort is good water-wise as they do wash the produce in chlorinated water. Take immodium in case your tummy rejects the foods and be moderate with your intake!!  The food  was very good. The meals had something for everyone every night, and you'll see some of the same stuff each day - but it is good and fresh.  Go see Neri for gourmet coffee by the pool. This guy is so nice and makes excellent cappuccino with a genuine smile. The staff here are truly incredible. I've been to a lot of resorts from 2-5 star and this place makes the cut of excellence. They will do everything possible to make you happy. If you're a rude and arrogant person you may find otherwise- but that's life. Everyone there works really hard so be appreciative to get the best service. The pool guys are the fitness staff and the evening show staff. Shows were nothing great but fun participationary shows. But they are very fun people. My room was cleaned every day- the sheets so white and clean pulled fresh over the extra firm bed - ( all beds here are quite hard- even the club beds are hard) so be prepared for that. This place is a bit tired and out-dated. If your looking for luxury look somewhere else. If you're looking or best value service on an economy budget this place is your best. They do try to sell you a time share but once you firmly state you will absolutely not be interested, they do not hassle you as I've read in previous reviews.  The rooms are far from soundproof so expect to hear others in adjoining rooms. Most people realize this immediately and share the courtesy of remaining peaceable while in their rooms. We went with three other couples and one couple experienced a very rude encounter every night. Some people are just rude and think they need to put on a show. If it were us beside these inconsiderate folks, we would have not been too shy to tell them off after the first night. Ear plugs are are great addition to your suitcase- even for the plane ride -they are a plus. There are beautiful animals around the resort. A little 'runny' is like a large hare with porcupine-like hair , no tail and are very tame and harmless. Iguana are here too and little wee croaking lizards- as well as pretty Mexican raccoons that are super friendly. The hotel photographer brings down exotic animals each day to the beach to get pictures with. The surf is strong here. The water and beach are excellent but you need to go elsewhere for calm serene beaches. Or there is a nice pool! We took a day trip to Maroma beach. The travel guy at the hotel lined us up for $25/ person to go there. We got transportation to and from, entrance fee, Jetskiis for 30 mins each, and pop and chips all included. When we arrived we paid 2$ each for a conservation fee and went into the most beautiful & isolated beach ever. It was calm enough to snorkel right there and I saw barracuda, angel fish and little white fish and a small group of unknown fish! The waiter walks a 1/4 mile to serve u what u want. If u decide eat there DO! Yum! Have the garlic octopus or the fish tacos!!!! 20$ for two people. That is a super deal and you can go early and spend the whole day there- horsebackridimg and atvs are also available. They have showers there too so bring dry clothes and a towel. This is my fifth time in Mexico so please email me if you like. Oh there is a 30$ snorkel tour -1 hour snorkel about 15 min boatride away. A very profficient guy named Oliver will be your guide. Worth it!! Last tip: but sunblock at home or pay $22.00 a bottle! have questions .

Reviews.Title: “Bi-polar resort, saved by the beach”
Reviews.Author: danimaltron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here along with another couple in April 2011. At the time, it was one of the cheapest all-inclusives in the Riviera Maya. When we arrived, we weren't sure if we were in the right place. The lobby and entrance was small, looked run-down and nobody greeted us. We went to the main desk, and dealt with a pretty miserable man that seemed to only grudgingly help us. When we arrived in our room, we were even more shocked. It was totally dilapidated. Tiles were cracked, old furniture, a bath tub that resembled a trough, chipped paint everywhere. While it seemed clean enough, it was run down. We went down to the beach as soon as we changed, and immediately got a smile on our face. The beach is beautiful. Nice white sand, and it's fairly shallow and goes out a while before getting deeper. The beach saved this place. Service by everyone after our initial bad impressions was very good. Barmen were friendly and attentive, same with waiters. Give these hard working people a tip every once in a while! The food was good, not amazing. A few nights at the buffet had especially good food. The A La Cartes were mostly good, aside from a dish here and there that was mediocre. Another nice aspect is that it's very close to play del carmen. It's within walking distance (about 15 - 20 minute walk, one-way) and you just follow a single street to get there. Entertainment at night was absolutely horrible though. Management needs to take a hard look at that, and rework everything. The shows are absolutely pathetic and need to be thrown out. It was actually offensive at how terrible it was. If they couldn't take some time to plan some shows, why have any at all? Seriously, it made everyone cringe in embarrassment for the staff that had to participate. The onsite "club" was gross. It smelled very strongly of mildew and ammonia (I saw them behind the bar washing things using ammonia). And there are resort staff crawling through there trying to take everyone away to CoCo Bongo. It's setup as a trap to sell people on that. It seems they intentionally allow the onsite "club" to be so gross that you wouldn't want to stay and dance. Unfortunately for them, the recruitment staff was so annoying and pushy we had no desire to go with them anywhere. Another annoyance was the entertainment during the day. By the pool/beach there is constant, unrelenting rave type music playing only interrupted by a staff member's annoying voice shouting for the relaxing crowd to do various activities with him. It made us and everyone we saw cringe. You literally had to walk down the beach a ways so this annoyance would fade into the background. We were also creeped out by the guy who did the water aerobics. His routine involved getting all the woman to hold hands, and then snakes themselves around until they converged on him. He seemed to really love all the woman pressed up against him. He then instructed the group to bounce up and down in the water. We saw him do this almost every day with these half-intoxicated women. Super creepy. This same guy also liked to invite himself into beach volleyball games that vacationers were playing. He would then begin to hassle everyone around him, telling them they don't know how to play properly and basically just being a jerk. His arrival usually signalled the breakdown of any enjoyable volleyball game. What doesn't make sense is that during the day, they try and turn the place into a rave. At night, it turns into a bizarre episode of telletubbies on the entertainment stage, with nothing for the adults to do. Management really needs to look at this as it's very backwards and can lead to boring nights and frustrating days. Some tweaks to the entertainment staff and how they "entertain" would go a long way. Overall, we had fun and really enjoyed the beach. But I would only try this place if it was really cheap and you're OK with having nothing to do at night and like to go to sleep early or trek out to the offsite clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Headed downhill”
Reviews.Author: lynWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playacar from Oct. 22-26 when we were moved to their sister resort Xcaret for safety reasons due to hurricane warning. This was all handled well and proffesionally. There are no complaints in this area. Safety was their no. 1 concern. Now onto the Allegro Playacar review. We stayed here 9 years ago and my has it gone downhill. The rooms are really shabby. Our air condioning did work fine though and it was clean with no bugs. We were on a second floor. The rooms are noisey due to the thatched roofs. Sheets are super thin and they use the plastic mattress protectors which are super hot. We removed and wrote a note until they left them off. Felt they got all the old stuff from their sister resort Xcaret. The food was not good at all. Always lukewarm and you had to hunt for plates and were lucky to get someone at the table to help you. We are not picky but it was not easy finding something you could actually figure out what it was. Breakfast was good with fresh omelets made to order. The pool and beach area is still beautiful but the activity people are basically nonexistant. The nightly entertainment consisted of audience particiapation not any real shows. One of the shows was definately not family orientated as it was rather naughty. They do have a wonderful pair of photographers who do awesome work taking pictures for no fee and they do not pressure you to take them. I was really impressed with the young couple and our daughter decided to have her senior pictures taken there. We got 82 pictures on a CD for a very reasonable price. Had we wanted for a small fee they would have printed actual pics for us. The drinks were very weak and I do not drink much. They also acted at least, as if they didnt know how to make very many different ones. there were no beach waiters and usually a line for drinks with only one bartender on duty. A few times there were two. The location is great as you can walk into town and on the beach forever if you want. I did feel safe and the maids were wonderful. The size of the resort is small which we like but will not return do to the shabbiness of the resort and the food. Two times was enough for us. We are not 4 or 5 star resort visitors but this just didnt meet our expectations. Somewhere else for us next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews because this was going to be our 25th wedding anniversary vacation. We had an excellent time. The food, service, entertainment, and the room was very nice. We highly recommend paying the extra fee for the romantic dinner on the beach. A memory that we will never forget. First Club is the way to go. K & C

Reviews.Title: “Beware of their street timeshare saleseman”
Reviews.Author: Hugo H
Reviews.Content: There are about 20 resorts in the Playacar community and my wife and I like to take a strol to town after morning breakfest. This is the only property that has a salesman, but this person is a total non profesional. after countless times (in a week) of telling this person thay we where not inrtested in visiting his property, this person cursed at me not thinking I knew no spanish. I asked to speak to his boss and did so but no avail. This person had the odasity To challenge me to a fight, I told this person to take a good look at my face and just leave me alone. My wife avoide conflict and just walked accross the street. Stay Away from this property and always remember that if you say no to something, they are most likely saying something back that is not very perty. The same happens in town. Now I dont Know if its an advatage to be bilingual, because all it has brought me is conflict from the vendors on 5th ave. in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Other resorts offer more...”
Reviews.Author: Earthling911
Reviews.Content: Room: Room 5803 - Upgraded first floor "ocean front" room We paid for an upgraded room, which was to include an ocean view, a DVD player and a stereo. ($25 per day, normally $35 per day but since we went from a king to a 2 double the price was reduced.) Good points: - Got a bottle of water every day - Working ceiling fan - The couple getting married were treated like royalty (I was the maid of honor) - The wedding was beautiful - The food in the Mexican restaurant was tasty Bad points: - Pool view, not ocean view - Broken TV - took 3 calls and a trip to the front desk to get fixed - No DVD or Stereo - took 3 calls and 2 visits to the front desk (this wouldn't have been a big deal, but it was promised and paid for, and it was a really rainy week.) - Air conditioner didn't work - 2 complaints later they came in the room and turned it off. - Bugs (ants and spiders) - Only 1 bar - Expensive Wi-Fi ($30 for 4 hours) - Food in the Italian restaurant was served cold. - Rock hard beds - Other people attending the wedding staying in a 2nd floor room had a "present" from the wildlife left on their bed. In the same trip we stayed at a neighboring resort, which was actually less expensive per night, so the idea of "you get what you pay for" just doesn't hold water. Frustrated, we booked into another resort for the last 2 nights of the trip, using the over-priced resort Wi-Fi. On check out they presented us with a form to sign, basically saying that we were leaving for "personal reasons, not the fault of the resort." We refused to sign, since it was the resort that we found at fault.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: natalie14589
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week after visiting Las Vegas to get married, The grounds and beach were beautiful, bar area very nice, well maintained, the rooms were a big disappointment, very smelly, 3 rooms with no A/C, no mirrors, dirty stained baths, The 4th room offered was reasonable, The food basic, at times only luke warm and we both returned home ill, My husband has lost half a stone in 3 days through what we suspect to be food poisoning, However, we did thoroughly enjoy the holiday, met some great people, staff were very helpful and friendly, would consider going back if the rooms were modernized.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Terry2006
Reviews.Content: We read so many negative reviews that when we arrived we asked if we could upgrade to another hotel -- we could not, so we made the best of it. After getting a bit better room, we discovered that most of the reviews were way off and Occidental Allegro is really nice resort. Keep in mind, we aren't comparing it with places that cost 2 or 3 times as much...and to be honest, we went to an Iberostar that cost 3x what we paid for the Allegro, and actually wished we were back at the Allegro. Food: We were completely surprised by the reviews that complained -- the food was very good, esp the Italian and Mexican restaurants. Reviews that said, "hot dogs at every meal" must be eating every meal at the snack bar or something. The bar drinks were great, some of the best we have had in our 8 stays in Cancun (they still use real fruit in their drinks, unlike a lot of big name resorts). Location: Excellent beach location - since they are a small resort, they have a lot more beach per person than other, larger resorts do. We could always find a chair and the beach wasn't packed like the other places. Beautiful beach and ocean. Rooms: This is THE only real problem with this resort - the rooms are very old and in dire need of renovation. We looked at several rooms and finally sprung for the ocean front for an extra $20 a night. The AC barely works, tile missing / cracked in the bathroom, needs paint, etc. If the rooms were renovated, this place would be an incredible deal. Staff / service: I can't see how anyone could complain about the staff -- if you needed anything, they would help you out. Very friendly and patient. Janet and Fabiola from Kids club were outstanding, Mayra in Guest Services helped us with anything we needed and the front desk was wonderful too. The staff in the Italian restaurant were so nice to us and our kids that it felt like we were leaving friends when we departed. Other: This resort gets lots of non-US/non-Canadian travelers, so realize that there are folks who don't know how to wait in a line, folks who smoke around babies and kids, folks who only talk by shouting - it's odd at first, but just be patient and it is all fun. Overall: We got a great price ($800 /week for 4 persons) and felt it was well worth it. Even with the room issues, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beach & pool great, charged twice for safe, safe was robbed $200 USD”
Reviews.Author: Tracie V
Reviews.Content: We all got sick from the food or the drinks (and yes, we were careful not to drink tap water). The room was clean and older, rustic, but acceptable as it was close to the ocean, pool and was a rustic but nice atmosphere. The beds were thin and awfully hard, but the decorations each day with fresh flowers and folded towels was great. The buffet food was unappealing a lot of the time, while it may have looked ok, it was not as tasty as it looked. Over cooked or soggy. There are two restaurants that you have to make reservations for, the Mexican and the Italian. They each had wonderful main courses, but the appetizers and desserts were unappealing or soggy. The biggest issues I had was being robbed (from the locked safe) $200 USD and being charged twice for the safe as the records didn't show we had paid the first time. We all got sick, even after being careful to only drink bottled water, not eat salad or anything washed in sink water. The bar by the pool didn't seem to hold high standards for washing the glasses. It appeared that they were rinsed out and left with tap water in them, so even if you poured bottled water or pop into a glass, it was a dirty/contaminated glass. This resort is close to Playa del Carmen and it cost 70 pesos to get a taxi each way. The prices for souvinears is ridiculously high and poor quality, not like it use to be. Even the vanilla prices have tripled. Anyhow... with the robbery, and illness, poor quality of buffet and crazy hard beds, we wouldn't book here again but would put out the extra money to go into a five star.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Curt1_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took another couple with us to allegro occidental in march of 2011. We had a great experience and can't believe how negative the comments are. While we were there we didn't have a single problem. Great rooms, no problem with a/c, food was great, staff was excellent, and we met great people. The pool bar was great. The Italian restaurant and the mexican restaurant were very appetizing. We had great weather and met some great friends. We would definately recommend this resort to all our friends and have already. Great job. The resort was clean and it was very private unlike some of the busy bigger resort. We are from Canada and maybe our expectations are lower than they should be however we enjoyed ourselves. Thank you for the great vacation. We will be back. For a 3 star, we believe it should have been ranked a little higher.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better...a lot better”
Reviews.Author: stlcardsfan08
Reviews.Content: This place had a pretty setting, but lacked a lot. I don't normally ask for a lot while on vacation, especially in a foreign country. But food is a major component of my overall happiness. This place seriously lacked in edible food. The Mexican restaurant didn't even have guacamole. How can you not have guacamole in a Mexican restaurant IN Mexico??? Plus, even getting food was difficult. The Disco had an awful dj. Not everyone listens to techno, and when there's no one dancig after 2 hours of listening to the awful stuff and then it gets asked to be changed to ANYTHING else and they STILL won't change the music. Not Good. Not good at all. Unless you have First Club access I would seriously reconsider staying at this place. It might have pretty pictures, but it's any but. I only gave this place excellent ratings for service & beverage selection because I had access to the First Club. Otherwise, it's thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Myrna K
Reviews.Content: My nephew and i stayed here in August and were promised an air conditioned room and when we arrived our room had no working AC and it smelled terrible and there was a terrible noise throughout it. Maintenance couldnt fix it and after 4 room changes all with the same terrible smell, and they even tried to put us in a room where people already were we had to stay in a room that wasnt even close to satisfactory because they claimed there were no more rooms. There were bugs and there was no hot water one day and one no water at all another! And the man in the room next to us would pee all over the bushes for two days!!!The staff didnt seem concerned and our tour company didnt show up until two days before we left! We were told to contact them if we had troubles but there was no contact number. I am not a fussy person but this was honestly the worst smelling, most unorganized, shoddy, run down place I have EVER stayed. DO NOT STAY HERE, no matter what the price. AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: laura b
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel at the end of August...and loved it. The general ambiance of the hotel was very relaxed and welcoming. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were impressed with the food...for a buffet we were expecting less, but the quality and variety of the dinner buffet was very good. The hotel was clean and tidy, our room was lovely. Ok so the air con wasn't brilliant but the room was a nice temperature and we were in Mexico at the end of the day so didn't want to spend long in the room anyway. The pool and beach are lovely. I would say that people who moan about this hotel on this site obviously have champagne tastes but beer money! This hotel represents excellent value for money and those who complain expect 5 star but will only pay for 3 star. Personally i would rate this as a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shahrine k
Reviews.Content: This is sooooo disgusting place. I hate it so much. Air condition doesn't work, rooms is disgusting. Spiders and webs all over the room. The room stinks so bad. Bathroom is awful. Cannot think of taking shower there. The place is awful. My worst nightmare. All the bad reviews about this place is true. Don't come here!!!! Im never coming back here again in my life. This place is dead to me.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for at a 3.5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: Jan499247
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids aged 16 and 13 stayed for one week in August 2011. The beach and pool area are fantastic. Lots of activities to keep guests busy like aqua volleyball, contests in the water etc....We had the best weather - very little rain, and lots of heat and humidity. We had an upper floor room with barely any air conditioning, despite asking for repair on a number of occasions. We kept being told it would get fixed, but to no avail. We had originally booked adjoining rooms for our kids, but ended up with two separate rooms beside each other; they were overbooked and could not switch us. The rooms were in need of repair overall. They smelled musty - including the bedding. They were however cleaned everyday, and staff were friendly. The food was quite good, even the kids found lots of things they liked for the week. There is a snack bar by the pool, a bar b q and a pizza place as well, open all afternoon. Breakfast and dinner at the buffet and the two a la carte restaurants were also quite good. For a 3.5 star resort, you get what you pay for and you need to enjoy it for what it is. If you're a pool/beach family and care little about your room, then this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Le royal dumpe”
Reviews.Author: Dino201
Reviews.Content: This place is a sad excuse for a resort. The buildings are old and in desperate need of repair. The air conditioning is largely ineffective. The pillows smell. Dont bother asking for something to get repaired... It will take days. MOST IMPORTANTLY many of our party got sick from the unsanitary conditions in the royal club. Stay somewhere else! ANY OTHER PLACE is likely to be better. I'm a member of the vacation club and I am embarrassed for them.

Reviews.Title: “CELEBRATED OUR 25th ANNIVERSARY THERE!”
Reviews.Author: GuapoDallas
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 and 13 of our friends and family spent 2 weeks at the Allegro in July. The Hotel was at 100%, and I guess doing something right because they were sending over booked people to their sister resort (Xcaret). After reading all the negative comments I was wondering if the resort that we have been to so many times and loved, had deteriorated so much? What I found was the contrary. The place is as beautiful as always and had the time of our lives. Sure there are some problems mainly with some rooms A.C., but can easily be solved by requesting a room with proper air conditioning. This Resort is rated as a 3.5 stars and for the money (which is about 1/2 of what you'll spend at a 5 star) is well worth it. We have been to other resorts that are larger, better rooms, better food than this one, but not as "Quaint" and friendly. The BEACH is probably one of the best in Playa del Carmen. With it's white sandy beach and turcoise waters you can't go wrong. The ROOMS are "Bungaloo" 2 story buildings with thatched roofs of 8 units per building, surrounded by beautiful vegetation and palm trees. Each room has a hammock out on your balcony when you want peace and quiet. The main walkway from your room to eigther the restaurant, pools, or beach is a short distance and enjoyable. The GROUNDS are well kept and full of tropical plants. The POOLS (2) one quiet and one with music and activities are great. The ACTIVITY STAFF is always full of fun and surprises and keep people entertained. 3 RESTAURANTS - the main one for breakfast and dinner buffet style(with different theme foods every night). The Italian & the Mexican that you need reservations for (included in your all inclusive, one visit each per stay) are excellent when you feel like getting served off the menu. The restaurant by the pool is for lunch only and is buffett style, good variety. The SHOWS at night (9:30pm kids show, 10pm Adult) are pretty good with different kind of dancers every night (Mexican, Carribean, Las Vegas, etc..). The DISCO/BAR that opens at 9pm every night till 2am is great for a night cap. What we love about this resort is that it's relatively smaller than most at Playacar and get to know people from all over the world. My teenage kids met so many other teens from Spain, Italy, Holland, France, U.S, and Mexico. This is the first time in 12 years of visiting Mexico that we saw so little Americans. I guess the bad press about safety and security are keeping some away. But believe me, they take care of the tourists. They understand where their livelyhood comes from. There are no crime problems in Playa del Carmen. Visit 5th ave. for shopping, restaurants, bars, and clubs. One more thing, tip a little, it goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back in November!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMX
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I and my youngest son and his wife, and my oldest son and his fiance stayed at the Allegro in May this year for one week. I am a vacation club owner so not sure if our rooms and service were that much better, or if its a timing thing, but we loved it. My oldest son and his fiance had a small wedding ceremony on the beach and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. We had a hotel type room and a 2 bedroom suite for the week, and we had zero complaints. Jose and Aida in the vacation club office were soooo much fun and helpful. Even at the swim up pool area and the buffet, we asked for Tacos and they made us up a batch and our own quacamole. The drinks are as stong as you want them to be.... the first is normally weak but just ask for more tequilla or rum or whatever your poison is and they are more than happy to help you. We went to 5th avenue and did some shopping, drinking and eating. The shops down the road from the resort are very nice and things are priced pretty much the same. We also went up to Puerto Morelos for the day during a fishing tournament that my boyfriend was in .... that was great too! This is our second visit to this resort, the last was right after hurricane wilma wiped out the beach....so it was awesome to see sand...and a lot of it! Two of my girlfriends and I are returning for week in November and have no hesitation about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great staff, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: gypsi_chic
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I wasn't sure how I was going to feel about staying in the Playacar area, being so close to town, as our last vacation was quite a bit further south, at the Occidental Xcaret. I have to admit it was pretty awesome being able to take a casual 10-15 minute walk into Playa Del Carmen instead of having to take a cab. Took a bit longer than that walking on the beach, but the view was nicer than taking the street side. Since it's a gated community, I felt super safe the entire time. My husband and I both did miss the sweet lagoon at the Xcaret hotel, we were only able to get into the water one day out of the 7 due to high winds, so there was no beachfront snorkeling this time, but we made up for that by taking a day trip to Xel Ha. Gorgeous place & we highly recommend it, food & drinks being included in your day pass is fantastic! We also booked another day trip at the hotel, (thank you Juan Pablo Cisneros with Lomas travel!) to Ria Lagartos & Ek Balam. Ria Lagartos is amazing! Our boat guides were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, describing the plants, birds & crocodiles, taking the time to slow down for photo ops. Ek Balam is a treasure! I can now cross off another pyramid that I've climbed! Indescribable architecture. Our tour stopped for dinner in Valladolid...I would love to spend more time in this city! We also took advantage of the bus to Lapis Factory and managed to spend more than we needed to on silver jewelry, again! Playa Del Carmen is definitely fast moving into the tourist zone, I noticed prices were quite a bit higher than even 2 years ago at the restaurants & bars on Fifth Street, so we veered off the beaten path a little to find better prices. As for the hotel itself, it could use some changes. There was ample food at the buffet, though there seemed to be a lack of bacon. Go figure it was the men who noticed this! Otherwise while there was always plenty to choose from, they definitely are attempting to cater to a European clientele instead of maybe sticking to a local diet. I find that unfortunate as when I'm travelling I prefer to eat what the locals do. But that's just me! None of us starved and we also went into town and ate a few times as well. The rooms were cleaned daily, and we always left a tip for the housekeeping. Getting water seemed to be a bit difficult sometimes, but one night my husband was suffering from a bit of sunstroke and when I called the desk they had no trouble getting us extra within moments, so I assumed they were just being frugal with people wasting the bottled water, which makes sense. Fair warning on ground floor rooms though, don't leave food or drinks out, there's little ants that LOVE it! Beds were...hard...'nuff said! But how much sleep are you really gonna get when you're in paradise for only a week?? We're not a very high maintenance group of people so I would recommend the Allegro Playacar if you fit that bill.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for what you get...Really”
Reviews.Author: joycehome
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in mar/apr, we got a cheap price out of Comox which usually is pricey. We stayed for two weeks, and it's all about the beach for us , so as far as that goes it's a great beach. the hotel or chateaus(blocks of four rooms were simple but lack basic maintenance, clean, but each unit had something broken or missing. the grounds are nice and well looked after but anyplace down there be careful of trip hazards, we saw many people that were injured from falls. food was high average for the price , the restraunts were good, the buffet was good the second week did not repeat to much, but you had to keep an eye out for the daily special that usually was great. the staff were polite and the drinks were all good, we brought small thermal mugs. In all being walking distance to Play Del Carmen was great the beach fabulous, the hotel adequate. Never do we stay at the same place twice so that's not an option, so not going to say were going back, but good bang for the buck, if you pay little to stay some place do not expect much in return.

Reviews.Title: “Had to sign a waiver promising not to sue!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2travel34
Reviews.Content: I lasted exactly three days, at which point I demanded that my tour company send me elsewhere. They obliged, however, Allegro made me sign a waiver promising not to sue or slander the Occidental hotel chain, specifically the Allegro Playacar, for misrepresentation of its services, lack of amenities, star rating, etc...enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Nice priced vacation”
Reviews.Author: kelinwv
Reviews.Content: Pros; Great location great beach, nice pools, plenty of alcohol, cute and clean rooms,Very clean and well groomed grounds, nice kids crew, very attentive and hard working staff, plenty of food and a good selection. Cons; Signs of an aging property, VERY POOR A/C IN THE ROOMS, Bothersome time share agents

Reviews.Title: “Mid-range all-inclusive. Got what we paid for.”
Reviews.Author: jamesgangx5
Reviews.Content: For first timers: Playa del Carmen is a coastal city about 40 min South of Cancun. Playacar is a gated community of hotels and golf courses ar the South end of the city. It is directly behind the island of Cozumel and the taller hotels on the island can be seen from the shore in Playa del Carmen. There are numerous all-inclusive hotels lined up inside Playcar along with private homes and at least one golf course. Occidental Allegro Playacar is a mid-price all-inclusive about in the middle of the pack in all aspects including location. Very cool thatched roofs(real) make it very tropical and exotic. The meals are very good if repetitive. There is a Mexican and an Italian restaurant that are reservations only that are also good. The reception staff are friendly and helpful. Our first room had a heavy smell of mold so we switched only to find it too had that strong smell. We chalked it up the being in the tropics with very high humidity and lived with it. Very cool and rustic rooms that we loved. One warning- the A/C cannot compete with the heat and moisture at least in July. I had trouble sleeping while sweating so much(No, I'm not overweight, Ok maybe 5 lbs!). The fan helped some but not much. Each room has a colorful hammock and we used it alot.(brought them home as gifts too). Two very nice pools. One has a swim up bar. Ask for Nestor - What a nice guy! Remembered our names the whole week. Ask for his secret drink special- Poncho Villa. I'm pretty sure the alcohol is a bit watered down as it takes quite a few to get that 5 o'clock somewhere feeling but if you can handle the calories you will arrive at that destination! I would recommend this hotel for anyone trying to do an affordable vaction here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: extreme67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average, the rooms aren't nice maybe cute but what you read about ants, is definately true....the resort sprayed twice but didn't help after the 3rd time I stopped asking. The food was a big disappointment as well as the drinks!! My husband and I love to do all inclusive so we can relax, eat and drink!!! This was not the case the buffet served the same food for breakfast and dinner. What they served for dinner was sure to be on the breakfast buffet!!! They did not even have cheese for the omellets on the cook to order section..Usually don't like to east beans for breakfast but it was always on the buffet. Tried the italian restuarant one nite, thought i would order italian food, tried the lasagne it was a BIG disappointment! We met another couple that arrived a couple of days before us and they didn't eat dinner ever at the resort because of the quality, so we would chip in for a taxi and go into to town.(7 bucks one way) The location of the resort was good the beach and the pool was nice. But the drinks sucked!!! You could never 2 drinks in a row that tasted good. The first one would be good then the 2nd would be disguisting, the only decent drink we found was the mojito's. If this had been our 1st all inclusive we would probably never do it again. But other all inclusives we have stayed at have been great. Pay a little more so you can have a enjoyable time because you will not here!

Reviews.Title: “BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS - THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: blivingston4244
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to many destinations from 3 to 5 plus stars. This was our worst trip ever. We are used to different food (husband is from the Caribbean) but the buffet was the slop diner. The Italian restaurant was good though but you can't go there every night. I would not recommend this place to anyoe - the pool was dirty with vomit from the swim up bar, the disco is the only place where the a/c worked but is more of a sports bar with a pool bar with a tiny dance area in the corner with terrible music and ully light. . We stayed in 3 different rooms over the week and out of 5 rooms we checked out, none had a/c. Don't stay on the 2nd floor, the roofs leak, ther's a cat urine smell in some of the rooms and they are very hot. Had to beg for more toilet paper. We had better food, accomodations and service in Holguin (Sirenis Playa Turquesa) and this place makes a 3* in Cuba shine! The trip was cheap -$750 each all in but would have been better to spend a little more or to have gone to DR or Cuba. Will not be back to this or any other Occidental propery and likely not to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER..”
Reviews.Author: simplyTaina
Reviews.Content: When we had made our reservation we asked if there was going to be any problems getting there after midnight since our plane was getting in around 11:00pm. We called around 3 times just to make sure everything was ok, and each time we were reassured that it was. Upon arrival we were taken to our room and after walking all the way to the room and going up a flight of steps we found out the room was not ready (it was 12:30AM), we were so tired from the trip, we just wanted to shower and go to sleep. The employee left us there while he went to the reception's desk, and we waited 20 minutes before he came back with keys for a room on the other side of the Resort. Once we were settling we noticed there was a puddle of water next to the bed, and the bed was wet on that side. The air conditioner was not working, the room smelled musty, it was horrible, We didn't sleep at all. The next morning we went to the VIP office and asked to be upgraded for the nightmare we had been through. At 11:00am we were upgraded to one of their VIP rooms at that time we were told our suitcases were going to be taken to our new room. We waited until 2:00 and went to our room just to find out there was nothing there. We told reception again about our suitcases and she apologized and said they would get them right away. Then at 4:30 we went to our room and STILL NO SUITCASES, we were beyond upset. My boyfriend went to the reception's desk so upset and told them about us waiting all day for the suitcases, they could care less, they apologized once more . We are members of their VIP Club and their idea of VIP is so distorted. This new room we were upgraded to had a pad on the bed, making it a little easier to sleep, because the rest of the Resort has boards for mattresses. The air conditioner was not working either. We were so tired from all of this that at this point we didn't care about anything anymore . The food is the worst food I have ever seen in my entire life, it was just disgusting, it didn't even looked good. I did not eat while there and this was an all inclusive. I only ate bread and some pizza from their pizza shop. Everything in this Resort is old, rusty and just outdated. We were told the entire Resort is going to go through a remodeling face soon. They can remodel all they want, we will never stay there again. If you don't want to have a nightmare vacation, stay away from this place. There are a million other places you can stay at. We had a meeting with the "Customer Service manager", and he was such an idiot. When we told him everything we had been through, he actually justified it all, and actually told us about the bad Service we received that if he was to fire that person, the next person would just do it as well. Also told us that because it had been raining that the employees were easily frustrated. Who says that? I actually told him he should not be the Customer Service Manager. All in all everything about this hotel is horriblee..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Onmyway4
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with a positive...you cannot beat the beach and the location of the hotel. I would not recommend the Occidental Allegro Playacar to anyone. The facility is in desperate need of renovations. The food is mediocre at best...the buffets are chaotic and monotonous. I believe the staff is hard-working and does the best with what what they've been given. We stayed in three different rooms during our first 24 hours. Torrential rains caused our first room to flood. None of our rooms had working air-conditioning. Linens were in need of replacement, as were bathroom fixtures. We stayed as guests of club members. We will not return to this resort...consider another option!

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back, very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: sam_sam1975
Reviews.Content: First night at this hotel was very. Breakfast next day pretty good the day after not so good!!! Queues out of the door but when we eventually got in there were no plates, no glasses and even asking 4members of staff still nothing. Went to Mexican one night very good. Medeterrain excellent food and staff great and made to feel very special. On to the Malaysian, this was a disaster from start to finish. Staff couldn't understand anything even when I pointed to what I wanted I was brought something else which was inedible. My husband ate his meal and within the hour he had terrible bad stomach and sickness which lasted for 3 days which took us to the end of or holiday. 2 days before we came home I feel ill with a bad stomach and am still ill now awaiting results from doctors. On the positive side this is a beautiful location and setting and cannot fault the maid who cleaned our room, she was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: LizzieG19
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday June 12th. Our room was ready as soon as we got there so we threw our suitcases in the door of the room and went for dinner. We were pleased with the selection of food on this first night and had no complaints. The beach was amazing the entire time. Now begins my list of issues... 1. Our second night at around 10pm my boyfriend yelled from our washroom to look for some toilet paper, because there was none left in there. Luckily I had some tissues. I called the front desk right away to ask for a maid to bring some to the room. She said their would be there within 15 minutes. We headed to the beach for about an hour, and when we returned there was no toilet paper still. We really wanted to go to bed so I headed to the front desk in person and requested some again.
