The girl said the maid would be there as soon as possible. Well we had already waited that long, and I asked her if she could just give me a roll, its not gold or anything! She said I either had to grab some from the public washrooms in the lobby for the night or wait. I went into the public washrooms expecting small rolls in there, but no they were huge industrial sized tp rolls. I had it at this point and just walked back to the room, and finally we got a roll at 12:30am. 2. Breakfast was the same soggy pancakes and waffles as well as left overs from lunch/dinner the day before that had been transformed into some weird stuff that did not look good at all. My boyfriend said the omlettes were okay. 3. Lunch lacked creativity. Hamburgers, Hotdogs, Fish and Fries every day. 4. The third day there was a tropical storm so we jumped in the pool to swim in the rain. The lack of the cleaning by the overworked bartender caused all of the cigarette butts on the swim up bar to be washed into the pool! YUCK! 5. I couldn't finish one drink the whole time because each sip was like taking a shot. I requested light alcohol but my requests were ignored. 6. We never tried the restaurants because our friends told us they were a huge dissapointment and they ended up leaving after the second course. 7. We never had a sandwich or fresh guacamole all week. (Website is misleading) 8. We stayed in 2115 by the tennis court and we stayed on the top floor. Our roof had a hole in it so two nights before we left a screaming lizard came in at 4 am, along with an ant infestation. I asked the front desk to do something about it, and they said they would spray the ants.... Never happened though. 9. The pools and beach close at 10pm. So if your going to be up past 10pm, don't bother coming here! We did not expect a great place because of the price we paid, but I expected more than this. I was sick the whole time due to the food, and lack of eating. I actually lost 5 pounds because I was not willing to eat much more than the fruit. Spend the extra 100-200$ and go somewhere nicer, we will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Part great, part so-so”
Reviews.Author: beerbob1950
Reviews.Content: The food was excellent. We had wonderful service. We loved walking on the beach and it was an easy walk to the shopping in Playa del Carmen. Everything was close by. The air conditioning was poor, it felt like it only blew warm air. My wife hated the thatch roof because we could see through it in one spot. It rained three days while we were there but there was no leaking through the hole so I don't know if there was plastic covering it or if there was no leaking because the hole was located right by a beam so there was no runoff to the hole. The hole didn't bother me because there was no leaking.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Allison24
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at Allegro Playacar in May 2010 and returned for vacation the exact same week in May 2011. The time spent during the same week in the exact same room was not equivalent. There was a SIGNIFICANT decline in this resort in 1 year. Enough decline in quality that I can say without a doubt that I will not return to this resort of any Occidental property. We arrived early due to our flight and the room was not ready but we did not expect it to be having read Trip Advisor before our review. However, since the hotel arranged our transportation to and from the airport...one would have thought they would be aware we were arriving early!! As guest of a member we were entitled to limited use of the First Club. Due to a mistake of the resort, we were listed as a referral member and therefore forced to go on the 90-minute tour. When I say forced, I mean we received a letter that if we did not go we would be downgraded to a diffferent room and charged more. This wea after a different staff member dismissed us from the tour for the mix up!!! They also called and told us to be sure to bring our ID's and credit cards to the tour.! So we went to the tour and the staff members followed us around for the rest of the week. I.e. - siting by you at lunch, walking outside your room, etc. I did not appreciate that. Had I been close to home, at this point I would have packed up my bags and come home. The food was horrible, very little protein available, and the protein (meat) entrees that were available were cheap cuts (i.e. chicken thighs and wings). During our 2010 visit, the conculsion of the week on Friday night the resort put on an awesome outdoor Mexican fiesta for dinner when asked why that wasn't done this year we were told because they didn't have enough employees. When we questioned the quality of the food, we were told that it was "off" season. Folks, the food I feed my dogs is better than the American cheese they had out! During our 2010 visit, every day for lunch the resort grilled hot dogs, hamburgers, fish, pork chops, etc. When asked about the grilling this year we were always told "maybe tommorow". Tommorow, never came and after one bite of the hamburgers that were out...I never touched another burger all week. Guacamole is made from a powered avocado it appears...it is not fresh. The room was large with 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms and adequate in space but damp due to the climate. The rooms are in desparate need of renvoation which I understand that the resort is slated to begin soon. The sfaff at this resort is among the hardest working people I have ever encountered in the dining and housekeeping departments. A $5 tip will get you outstanding service all week long! The resort has a fantastic location its ashame they are letting hotel operations ruin the resort. The sand is beautiful (full of red ants though!) and the water is sparkling, crystal blue. The neighborhood (Playacar) is quiet and has security controlled entrances. I never felt unsafe. If you need internet access, go to the Starbucks across the street from the resort and buy a drink for unlimited free internet with A/C!! We took a trip to Cozmuel one day ($13 pp per way) and had a great time renting a Jeep and visiting Coconuts on the back side of the island. Cocounits has the best margaritas (really!!!) and Sangria. The view at Cocounts is amazzing as it sits on top of a cliff overlooking the Carribean sea! Overall a good value but the Wyndham next door is the same price and the facilites are much nicer. We were really disappointed in this hotel this year. It was actually good to come home from vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and would go back...”
Reviews.Author: ginag108
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, the staff were friendly and I loved the idea of rooms not being one after the other. Rooms are two on the bottom and two above with hammocks on the front porch area. Food was amazing and loved it when they moved the restaurant outdoors with entertainment. The pools were clean and great to stay in with it's own beach only a few feet from the back of the hotel. The area is peaceful and worth staying in. You will have to visit the Xcaret eco resort, it is a must do. The hostel is amazing and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate for Low Season”
Reviews.Author: PJdogcat
Reviews.Content: Visited Allegro Playacar between June 5th to 12th. I visit every year because I feel at home in Playa Del Carmen and I'm a member of the Allegro Vacation Club. You can't beat the location & the beautifully restored beach at the resort. You can walk north along the beach right into town at the steps of Senior Frogs. The food is a hit and miss at times, unfortunately, due to low season, this was the worst I've experienced at this resort. The breakfast assortment that I've come to expect was severely lacking upon this visit. The Mexican restaurant has always been the best a' la carte at the resort, as far as consistency. You definitely don't come to this resort because of the food ! The resort is medium size, so it's easy to meet people and the activities during the day, make this a fun resort. The grounds are luscious and the housekeeping staff work hard. I've had one of the best massages at their spa and it's great value compared to Canada. Vacations are what you make of it. Take the good with the bad and don't sweat the small stuff. Keep a lookout for the cute Mexican agoutis on the resprt ! Hope this helps ! ~ Hola

Reviews.Title: “COMPLAINERS: GROW UP-YOU WANT $1000 VALUE FOR $100 PRICE”
Reviews.Author: AntanasL
Reviews.Content: We were here from May 21 to 28. We have been to their Royal Hideaway a year ago. Yes, they are different, but the price is also quite different. Occidental Playacar is on a beautiful beach. Wide beach with plenty of room and turquoise water. There was even a lifeguard on duty on a high platform daily. The people working there are just super nice. They are all polite and no one ignores you. The drinks are fine. If you feel they are too weak, just ask the bartender and they will spike it up for you. Also, try tipping once in a while. They are really amazing people. After the first day, so many were calling me by my first name that I had a hard time believing how they remembered or even found out. Some even knew what you wanted. We are members of the First Club, so we also access to a top of the line selection of drinks. But we did not drink there exclusively. Now, the one complaint that we had was their house wine. It was very so-so. In the Italian restaurant you are able to purchase a bottle of wine from a reasonable selection. No, not hundreds to choose from but I would guess somewhere about 25 or 30. Priced about $20 to $40, it was a reasonable option. You know that you cannot get that cheaper at home. Can you really expect to get a good bottle of wine for $5? If that is your main criterion then you should buy a bottle every night from the Italian restaurant or be at a place that will give you a great bottle daily for free. The food WAS average but, again, consider how much you are paying for everything. It was in no way bad food, just average. Like the price that you paid for the beautiful surroundings, the pleasant and happy atmosphere, the two nice pools, two hammocks (one by each door) that you can swing on, some evening entertainment, and quite a lot of amenities in the resort. I just cannot understand the crab-a__es who complain about things like a lock on the safe that was not working. They probably punched in the wrong combination and the safe would not open. BIG DEAL!! I am just sure that it completely ruined their whole stay. My thought is this. You came to a very nice resort that is located on a gorgeous beach, has a couple of large and very nice pools (one with a swim-up bar), has a couple of specialty restaurants, has wonderful people who service you with a smile, has a massage hut located close to the beach and pool, nice warm water in the sea and pools, etc., etc.,etc. What on earth more do you want? If you want to pay for ONE DAY what you paid for a whole week, and without food or drink yet, and you simply MUST have American food, then stay at home or go to Florida. You will pay maybe ten times more and I wonder what you will find wrong with the set up there. This is not Four Seasons. The price is very affordable. We saw that practically all of the people were enjoying themselves and had a great time. So, loosen up folks, stop looking for the perfection of heaven. We have been at the Occidental Group resorts 4 times already and we will keep going. We really like it. We are from a suburb of Chicago and our vacations are not limited to our home area or only the USA but also a number of countries in Europe, Canada, Islands. So we did not just crawl out from under the rock and were impressed here. All you need to do is to be realistic in your expectations, come with an open mind set to be relaxed and have fun, and leave that "critics' list" at home. The bartenders and maids were all so nice. Also the concierges, especially "Natcho", "Israel", "Jose." the manager of the Italian restaurant --who worked along with the waiters- and Francisco Camejo--regional manager of the Occidental First Club--who is a very nice and efficient and knowledgeable perso.

Reviews.Title: “best time ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cbarle
Reviews.Content: i read some of the reviews from those who rated this hotel poorly. this was our 25th anniversary and i wanted to make sure we had a great time. the trip started off like a horror stary with the airlines,(spirit). but after arriving at allegro, half a day late, everything changed. everything was beautiful. the hotel, grounds, gardens, beach, pools, bars and restaurants just great. the food is not american as we know it. we have traveled from north scottland to brisbane, nowhere was the food like in america. concierge, jose, and lucy our housekeeper were outstanding. what ever we wanted or needed was always right there. the staff was extremely friendly, happy and interactive; a sign of good management. we enjoyed every minute we were there. we will tell all our friends and will be back soon. Oh, one other thing, try tipping, smiling and saying please and thank you. treating others the way you want to be treated goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Beer , horrible food!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patyzita
Reviews.Content: My room number was 5404 , great view ! I could see the pool and the beach . But the food was horrible and beer was hot!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: peeps99
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at an all-inclusive resort that is private, friendly and charming then, the Allegro Playacar property is the one for you. It is a smaller resort and nothing like the big ones where all the rooms are in a high rise building. The rooms are grouped together like bungalows of 4 rooms on bottom/4 rooms on top each throughout the property. There was a buffet for breakfast/lunch/dinner where there was a huge variety of delicious food and drinks. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Goyo from Olympus Tours was invaluable in helping us arrange the tours we wanted to go on. The resort is only about a 20 min walk from Playa del Carmen. The weather was perfect this time of year. It was in the 80's and sunny everyday. We will definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, unforgettable beach”
Reviews.Author: Vacation4ever33
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Allegro Playacar between May 1st and 8th. Because our friends owner of their vacation club they have arranged 2 bedroom ocean front room and that was amazing. I have never seen a beach this gorgeous before. People who worked there made our stay much more enjoyable. Food was average but for the money we paid I thought it was amazing. I have read lot of reviews about vacation club so I was curious. So when they invite us to presentation we said ok. First Claudia(the hostess) welcomed us us if we bring our credit cards and IDs then introduce us to our rep Josa(young Mexican, very nice:)) After couple of hours we were convince and bought the membership. We are very happy with what we got and we already know our friends who introduce us also very happy with it. We are planing to come back on September they were very helpful at first club desk and they made our reservation already. It is 3 star hotel with 5 star service. Recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, but still not great...”
Reviews.Author: michymichxo
Reviews.Content: After reading quite a few reviews, I must admit I was scared to go to this resort! Most of what was said, good and bad, was true. After arriving at the Cancun airport, we found our shuttle and were off to the hotel in no time. When we arrived at our destination around 1130am, we were told our room would not be ready until 3:00, which we already knew from reading the reviews :) Thankfully, we packed our bathing suits and things in our carry-ons and were ready to go to the beach. The beach was amazing! Gorgeous, clear water and plenty of sunchairs. Water was quite wavy, which was fun and refreshing. Not so safe for those who aren't strong swimmers though. Overall, the beach was wonderful and we spent the majority of our time here. Only complaint: the sand had lots of tiny shells which hurt if you have sensitive feet and walk barefoot. No biggie, just wear your flip flops if that's the case. After spending a bit at the beach, we headed to the snack bar for lunch. The food....also not so great. However, if you are used to all-inclusive resorts that are on the cheaper side, it's nothing you haven't seen before. Nachos, hot dogs, burgers, salads, etc. Not so bad. And the beer and drinks were great! We finally arrived at our room around 330. The room was nothing special. At all. Actually, quite dissapointing. The bed was hard as a rock and the linens were damp from the air conditioning (that didn't seem to work at all.) Small, smelly bathroom, and a broken safe. Not a great first impression. We stuck with it for the first day though, because how much time do you really spend in your room? We did ask to be moved to a new room the following day, which the hotel accomadated no problem. The second room wasn't much of an improvement, but it was better than the first being on the second floor and having a nicer view. Best part of the rooms: the hammocks :) awesome for an afternoon nap, or for reading on the deck, whatever you like. It was fantastic. The food at all of the restaurants was mediocre...not great but not the worst I've had! I could always find something to eat. I would definitely reccommend going into Playa del Carmen and walking along the streets, there are tons of restaurants to choose from with amazing food! Definitely worth the 5 dollar cab ride. Nightlife at the hotel was pretty lame, but there were plenty of bars in town. Overall, we had a great trip, very relaxing and much-needed. I would go to the hotel again but only if i got a last minute deal...i wouldn't pay over $1000 for it.

Reviews.Title: “Better resorts out there”
Reviews.Author: Cosmopolitan82
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort for the price as it was meant to be a budget vacation. Located about an hour drive from the Cancun airport. The drivers there are terrible but we DID get there quick! We arrived around 11:30am and as expected the room wasnt ready until 3. Check in was fast and easy,our bags were left with an attendant (we carried around a smaller bag with valuables) while we explored the beach/pool and had some lunch. Asked for the status of our room at 1:30pm and we got room 3415, perfect location. The higher the room number the closer you are to the beach. We had a top floor room with a king size bed and a thatched roof. We could hear EVERYTHING from our neighbours. The birds also give you an early wake up call, but overall it was a nice change from the standard hotel chain room. Turned the A/C on the first day and it didnt feel cold until our 5th day, i assume because of the roof. The room needed a major cosmetic repair because although it may be cleaned it still looks dirty. Beds are very hard (concrete boxsprings with one of those egg carton-foam topper things). This was concerning because since the room wasnt cold - I can only imagine the sweat saturated into it! Food wasnt the best. We enjoyed the Mexican restaurant, the beef chimichanga was the only thing I ate all week that had flavour. The coffee was good, wine was terrible. You need to ask the omelette lady for bacon during breakfast as its not left out. We had to flag down servers for water/coffee most of the time...sometimes i served myself at their station. Everything had hotdogs on it (hot dog pizza, hot dog soup, etc) The beach is beautiful, we loved the rough water but be careful of sharp shells. The water was not suitable for small kids/poor swimmers. Take advantage of the 10 min free massage. I think they have less staff on sundays. They closed the swim up bar and shut down the burger/hot dog hut. Not a huge deal - we never waited more than 2 mins for a drink at the pool bar. Drinks were good. We tipped at the end of the week to those who gave us good service. Jacobo was the only server who offered to bring us drinks by the pool. The nightly entertainment was cheesy but the kids show was fun to watch. After the show ends there is nothing to do, nobody uses their disco. Go into town to party, coco bongo is a show you need to see at least once. Take a $7 cab into town and you can catch the game on TV, go to bars, shop..you can also walk the beach but its at least 30 mins and it was too hot for us. There is also a small plaza 5 mins away if you walk left from the resort. I heard the excursions are cheaper there. We booked with Juan at the resort and would recommend him (Jungle Maya Tour was AWESOME if you like a physical adventure). Bring an alarm clock for the room and cheap watches for the beach. We didnt bring any and had a hard time keeping track of the time for restaurant reservations/excursions. The wake up call didnt make any sound just a blinking light on the phone. We were disappointed there wasnt a gym on site, get creative for exercise. The pool activities were never as scheduled Overall - its a small, clean, quiet resort. Dont expect bells & whistles its not a 5 star. We didnt expect one but wanted to provide a review of the facts.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Basiaka
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we checked-in to a dirty room. The last thing you want after 11 hours flight and an hour in the taxi is dirty room with no towels to have a shower. Rooms don't smell nice but of dump. We had loads of red ants in the bathroom every night, even after complaining nothing was done about it. My boyfriend got bitten quite badly. We changed the room after one night and got another double with a see view. It was lovely but reception member of staff tried to trick us to paying him $100 calling it Junior Suite. Because we have moved only the next day on his day off and room was standard double we haven't paid as no other staff members knew about it and matter was forgotten. We found out later that another couple had the same problem, was also asked to pay by the same person. They got keys to our room by mistake so looks like security is very poor if anyone can get into your room. We also booked a lobster meal on the beach which was lost so it's good to double check reservations. Main course was over cooked badly. Shame as the rest of the meal was lovely. Daily buffet was pretty much the same everyday. Not much choice, poor salad section. I would recommend changing house wine as it's undrinkable. Head of massage section was nice and friendly but it's tiring being asked everyday to book a massage with them. Shop in the hotel is so over priced that I would recommend buying sun lotion (high as sun is very strong) and after sun before travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Food was not good quality.”
Reviews.Author: Jojovolleyball
Reviews.Content: The property was beautiful. Overall very clean and felt safe. Food selection was not good at all. The only other thing was they need to get a bigger play mix at the pool. Tired of hearing the same songs over. I would go back to this area but pick a 4 or 5 star hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful, lush grounds.”
Reviews.Author: Susanxxxxxxx
Reviews.Content: I returned on April 4th from a super vacation in Mexico, staying at the Allegro with my 21 year-old-daughter. Although Allegro is a 3 star resort, it was very satisfactory. Allegro is a smaller resort with beautiful grounds, which makes you feel like you are living in a beautiful, lush garden. The thatched guesthouses have 4 units down and 4 units up, and each unit has a small patio with a hammock. I often saw other guests relaxing on their patio having evening drinks or enjoying a stretch on the hammock escaping the midday heat. It was relaxing to lie in the hammock reading, watching the birds and other small animals or the hotel staff grooming the grounds. The pools were always clean and gave a beautiful view over the beach. Although a number of people reserved their chairs with towels, it was not a problem to get a beach chair, or to find a place to sit to have lunch from the bar, which is in the pool area. Staff was really terrific at the Allegro. Front desk staff was cheerful and very helpful with questions and with advising about tours and any other needs. The cafeteria was a treat in the morning, as singing waiters moved efficiently and so cheerfully from table to table offering coffee and other needs. Humberto and Luis!!! Their cheerful singing and buoyant moods were infectious! The other restaurants, Italian and Mexican required pre-booking, which is best done on the day you arrive, as they are very popular. The Italian is very elegant, exquisite food and wonderful service. The Mexican is also a treat, with fine service and a good atmosphere. Tours arranged by the guest services staff were good. We booked for a ½ day snorkeling trip and had the luck to have a tour guide called Issey, short for Isreal. A wonderful, helpful, knowledgeable man who brought us on a Mayan adventure snorkeling tour in 3 spots: Yal-Ku Lagoon – a very enjoyable swim up to a fish filled reef; a cenote – an underground lagoon with crystal clear water, stalagmites and stalactites; and a lagoon where we enjoyed racing along a zip line and dropping into the water, and jumping off a high edge into the clear pool of water. We also enjoyed a scuba diving trip arranged at a poolside kiosk at the hotel. This was convenient, as our competence was thoroughly checked out by a PADA certified diver in the Allegro swimming pool, and we later left for the diving trip from their headquarters, the PADA diving centre, about 5 minutes walk down the beach. It was a wonderful outing with 4 or less divers per dive instructor. We had one dive instructor for my daughter and me, and we were treated to swimming amongst hundreds of beautiful fish on a very interesting reef. A great dive, and well worth it. Along with my many very wonderful memories of a great trip, is my appreciation for what I think of is helpfulness beyond what I expected. On arriving home from my trip I found that I had left behind in my hotel room a beautiful, new leather jacket. I contacted the front desk at Allegro. Yvonne persisted in locating it from security, and Myra, who works for guest services, then took on the responsibility of arranging to identify it for me and arrange to have it sent home to me. Myra sent me photographs to ensure she had found the right jacket, she arranged Fedex to send the jacket, and she e-mailed me many times to see that I knew how things were progressing. I was so grateful that Allegro staff had gone to the trouble to help me even though I was no longer their guest! I insisted on sending a reward for their trouble and for my gratefulness, but Myra would not hear of it! All I can say is: “Thank you for a wonderful week in Mexico, with only wonderful, positive memories! I will be back, and I will certainly be staying at the Allegro!”

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the cost...”
Reviews.Author: Frank0336
Reviews.Content: For the cost of our trip for our family of 4 and the other family members who also vacationed at the Allegro Playacar, it was a good value. We didn't pay for a 5 star and we didn't expect a 5 star. Check in was quick which was great because all we wanted to do was get to the pool to cool off. The rooms were very clean, there was a lot to choose from for the meals that were offered. The main buffet area was kept clean, it was sometimes full and they would open up a separate area so there would be more tables. They would run out of glasses and plates periodically, but they were quick in getting more out on the floor. The location on the beach was ideal, there was a lot of sea shells in the sand that people complained about, but we were on a beach. Our room was very clean, but it did need some updating, and the bed was a mattress on a slab of concrete, something that you get used to after a couple of nights. Entertainment needs more work, they tried their best, but it did lack a few things. The pool area was great and the lunch buffet always had something to satisfy us. The bbq buffet was next to the pool and it provided burgers, hotdogs, fries and fish from the grill. The employees of the resort were very friendly and daytime entertainment provided a little fun for everyone. Being so close to town was great, a 30 minute walk up the beach and you were there if you wanted to do any shopping. In the nightime, we would walk to the square which took less than 5 minutes. Starbucks gave us free access to the internet with a purchase and shoppng was ok in the square. Our location on the resort was right next to the pool area, which was also just a few steps to the beach, which we were pleased with. Quite beautiful site looking onto the beach but it was always windy, but it was pleasant where it was so hot. For people who like the ease of getting around, this is a small resort, I believe about 260 rooms, so it didn't take long to get around. If we were to get the same deal again, we would go to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: kimberly71
Reviews.Content: After booking the hotel and reading more reviews I was scared about what I had gotten myself into. I was pleasantly suprised. The ride from Cancun can be about an hour. Relax and look at the country as you head to your destination. Alto obviously does not mean sto to the drivers...it was great!! Riveria Maya is being built up so it looks a bit rougher at first but just hold on!! It does not appear to be as big of a party town as Cancun and I really liked that plus it was the start of off season. The reviews about the room are correct. The hotel is in need of repair and the air conditioner in our room wasnt the greratest. The sewer smell was easily fixed by wetting a smaller towel and placing over both drain holes in the bathroom and by the sink. If you keep the door closed it reduses the smell and keeps he room cooler. I also brought bathroom spray. You are supposed to put toilet paper in the trash, the entire country is like this....dont complain, be careful if you do flush it and call maintance if you screw it up...your not in a rich country so they have som old technology that they are working with. The towels are large and always enough. The wateris not hot like you might be use to. Look on the roof, the black barrel catches the water and the sun heats it up, they have no hotwater heaters, the showers were great and you dont need the hot water anyways. The bed is on a slab of concrete and the mattress is firm but comfortable and did not cause me a problem. I mean really, my objectie was only to sleep here for maybe 7 hours and clean off then head out so the room was not amazing but i HAVE HAD WORSE AT A COMFORT IN Or Econolodge. The maid did a great job everyday. The bufets were average but always enough food and it was dishes I have not seen but the names are above the station. The bar was nice and the drinks were fine. The beach is amazing and great location. The sand is not powder and you have to be careful of the shells, but I loved that part. I picked up so many shells and had a wonderful time, wear swim shoes if you have sensitive feet but this is a real beach!!! The flags were yellow and red but it is the SEA and undertows can be expected but I was in the water everyday!!! The staff is amazing and wonderful. They get to know you personally and give good advice when you venture out of the resort!! Time share tour took 5 hours....dont go unless you really want to buy!! The animal that looks like a rodent is cute to watch and the geckos and iguanas are everywhere!! I worshiped the sun so by nightlife I was asleep. I did make 2 shows, they are like little theatre productions so dont expect the Lion King play, but the staff works hard and it shows. Shopping on 5th ave. is great it was 70 pesos to get there but we were able to barter to 50 pesos to get back. BE minful of when the cruise lines come into the shopping area as the prices go up. The prices are also cheaper after 1pm. Remember, these people are trying to make a living, you are trying to make a great deal, they will come down on prices and may push you for a price, there are many streets with the same product so move on. Beware, there is a very cute little girl with a gecko on a string..she likes to throw it on you and smile. She also wants to play with you. She is darling!!! WE drank the filtered water at the resort the entire time with no problems. I had an amazing trip that was within my small budget. I could not have had this vacation had I not been at the Allegro, its not fancy and dosnt have all the thrills but it was affordable and comfy. The free watrs sports are only for one hour a day and you have to have a $20 deposit, they give back to you if you return it in an hour. There are people that sell stuff on the beach, just like the market name your price. They are few that come, nothing like in Cancun. There is a lady that brids hair, I did it and had no worries about my hair until the last day and then had my friend take them out. Beware, having the braided hair makes you a target for people to try and sell you stulff! Lamos did our excersion and it was painless. Have a great time and really...I would return to this place in the future as I said before, I am there to be comfortable, I do not need to be waited on hand and foot and have all the ammenities, I went for the beach and surf!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the price we paid, the Allegro was great!”
Reviews.Author: DBcooks
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from our wonderful trip and found the Allegro a lovely resort. The food was great! It was prepared more in a Mexican style than trying just to cater to North American "tastes." The beach area was beautiful and an added bonus was that the swimming pools were kept open late at night. We have found that most resorts close their pools down when it gets dark outside. The room was pretty funky looking with a thatched roof and we even had a couple of doves nesting above our patio. Lovely bird sounds to wake up to. The only downside is some of the room locations. Ours happened to be right near the nightly entertainment so whether you wanted to watch it or not you heard it. We dealt with it fine as we stayed up later but it would be a tough location especially for those with young children. All in all it was great and we would both recommend the Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a King and Queen. Very Relaxing. Beach Beach Around.”
Reviews.Author: 5bgjon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 16, 2011 to April 23, 2011 and loved it. The only thing between our bedroom and the Beutiful Ocean, was the sand on beach. We stayed in Room #4801 of the First Club and would Highly Recommend this. King Bed was just right, 2 TV's, as if you really use, and 2 bathrooms. Aida and her staff in First Club bent over backwards to take care of our every wish. There is plenty of selections at Buffet to insure you don't lose wieght and the Lobster Dinner on beach was to die for. 15 - 20 minute walk into Playa Del Carmen for shopping spree or sightseeing, was easy. Went scuba diving twice and the water clarity is magnificent compared to Illinois ponds ! Highly suggest going to Akumal and do the snorkel trip or scuba diving. No currents and lots of sea turtles. First Club can arrange this. Will go back here several years to come !!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked this without first reading the reviews , if I had read the reviews prior to booking I would probably not have stayed here, but once the $$ was paid , not much we could do but hope for the best. I find these trip reviews from fellow travellers very helpful , especially ones that contain tips on things to bring , and sites to see. Even the nay-sayers have helped, This was our 4th trip to Mexico , but 1st with our teenage daughters , along with 6 other extended family members.. Bus ride from the airport took much longer than what we were told ..i.e. approx 1 hr . We were on the bus for 45 min before it even left the airport! The ride in was uneventful and dead SLOW ! Speed limit 100 kph ...the driver never went above 70 the whole way. I'm no speed demon, but we had just spent 6 hrs on a flight and wanted to get to the resort ASAP. We had to make two stops along the way to drop off passengers at other resorts. In total it was +3 hrs from luggage pick up to our drop off at the resort --- the airport transfer is included , but I RECOMMEND you skip the bus , and take a taxi ...you'll get to the resort in 45 mins tops! Check in was painless. Staff were efficient and friendly . Rooms were ready. Only questionable transaction was the room safe rental rate of $2 USD/day .When we got to the room, the safe just req'd to be coded with your access code and you had a safe place to store your passports and valuables. I'm thinking we would have had use of this safe even if we didn't pay . $14 not a big to do , but its the principle of the thing - why charge us if we really never had to pay. Our daughters had a safe in their room - which we didn't rent, b/c we didn't need 2 - but just to see if it would work ..we set up theirs as well and could have used it ...@ no charge . Go figure ! Special requests ...A few days prior to leaving home, I tracked down the Allegro reservations line and called the resort to request adjoining rooms for ourselves and our daughters, pleasantly surprised that we got them upon arrival. We were on the ground floor of Bldg 55 , excellent location close to the main pool and beach . The rest of our group were next door . from previous posters I came prepared for the rooms' shortcomings ... I brought along extra hangers, a box of tissues, some rolls of TP, air fresheners, our own beach towels, facecloths, alarm clock, and an extension cord. .Bathroom has an outlet for the hairdryer, and there's another one in the shelf in the closet. Beds were hard ...took some getting used to , even with the foam toppers . Our bathroom was fine, great water pressure, lots of hot water, but they recommend you put the TP in the garbage bin. Not what most of us are used to doing at home.. if you don't ..it gets easily clogged ...just letting you know:-) A/C worked fine, and the ceiling fan kept the room nice and cool at night. No issues with noise ..place pretty much died in that area of the resort once the bar closed. Rooms were cleaned by cleaning-OC maids ... they really took their time and did an excellent job,. We left a tip every day . Our girls looked fwd to the seeing what towel art was left on our beds each day. Mini bar was always restocked with bottled water, the resort info you're given at check-in said there's supposed to be choc bars and chips in there as well ...purely a myth .. only treats in our fridge were the ones we brought from home. As mentioned in just about every other review ..this place could use some TLC ... it's showing its 27 yr old age ... missing railing on the ramp up to the buffet restaurant. Chipped concrete on some 2nd storey balconies ..floor tiles in the rooms were laid by the mayans . But overall, we knew we weren't going to a five star ... short staffed bar , lack of resort amenities , the much needed repairs , chipped/peeling paint on the bldgs .. it is a 2.5- 3 * .... at best. Food was okay - booked both a la cartes as soon as we checked in . Recommend that you get that done as soon as you can. The Mexican was great - best main course was the shrimp . We booked the Italian , but unfortunately never made it back from an excursion on time ..and lost of reservation :-( The breakfast was the best meal of the day at the buffet. Great omelette station , bacon was a rare find ..and not that great. Replenishment of condiments (pancake syrup, honey etc) was slow. Lots of mornings we had to wait on juice glasses . Waiters/ Servers worked hard, but just weren't enough of them . Plenty of fresh fruits , yogourt, and asst'd breads/rolls/pastries. Cold or hot cereal / choc milk /cold cuts / cheeses . Pretty much anything to please even the pickiest of eaters. Dinner at the buffet was somewhat of a hit or a miss. One night I walked around the various stations and nothing appealed to me, I just gave up and had ice cream . The pasta station could use better heating elements .. it was always cold and the sauces were room temp at best . Unidentifiable dishes were everywhere , surmised that these were most likely leftovers from prior meals ..I've never seen so many dishes made with leftover / half cooked potatoes ! Dessert selection reminded me of the dining hall when I was at university . Bland , mass produced gelatin like impersonators of what should have been cheesecake and fudge brownies . The best part ..like other reviewers ...we loved the grounds and the beach.. Throw your towel on a chair early to reserve an umbrella ..they go fast. Mixed drinks were weak ..wine was vinegar-like , the only true tasting beverage was the Coroner on tap. BUT if you tipped ..you got Bacardi and not some Mexican watered down version. Bar staff ,,busy / hard working / friendly folks, but they needed extra help behind the bar during the peak afternoon hours. Always a line for drinks, or waiting on glasses by the pepsi dispenser. Swim up bar .. never got close to it as it was constantly under seige by a group of loud ,obnoxious, rude , drunk and disorderly , ashamed to same, fellow countrymen. I'm all for someone having a good time ..but when you get so drunk that you run the risk of hitting your head as you somersault into the shallow end ...security really should have been keeping a better eye on these guys. At one point one of them verbally attacked an older lady. The vulgarity and obscenties he hurled were grounds for removing him from the resort . Families with small children witnessed this . It was not very pleasant. Security really needs to do a better job to deal with unacceptable behavior and unsafe situations ...people too drunk to walk should not be allowed in the pool. Nolitours rep ...not very helpful ...prime objective was to sell tours (which more more expensive than the competition) and make higher commission . We expected info on the resorts facilties .We booked a Coba Tour with a rep at the Playa Plaza (long story ...I do not recommend using them ..they were called Adventour ..a guy named Leonardo sold it to us . ) We did all the things they promised, and then some .... trust me book elsewhere. We booked our 2nd with Barrakuda (on the resort site - next to where you get the towels) . All day Catamaran trip , with snorkelling and parasailing. A nice day with no surprises . Short walk to the Playa Plaza (5 mins to the left of the resort front lobby) will get Starbucks and free WiFi . the girls took the iPods and got online no problem to get in touch with their friends back home. Buy a phone card at the Plaza USD $10 for 30 mins . Phone calls from your room, even using a calling card will be outrageously expensive ! Overall the trip was fine ... we've been on better resorts, for the same price as we paid for this one . Love the Mayan Riviera area ... will go back again , but next time will do my research . Adios !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Newfiemissus70
Reviews.Content: The room had a/c unit that was very noisey. Had to turn it off at night to try and sleep. Beds are a thin single mattress over a slab of concrete. Beds are made of concrete. When we checked in, only had one room in the light that worked. The rest were taped together with black electrical tape. The safe I rented in the room broke twice and each time had to wait an hour each time for the security guard to come and reset it. Our villa room door had to be finally repaired. Before that, we had to have our key cards replaced three times. Had flying cockroaches in our room that were bigger than the gekkos that were crawling over the walls. We also had tiny bugs that crawled over the bedding. I was assured by Guest Services that they would not bite. Like that would comfort me! We finally got moved to another room near the beach. This was one only had the small bugs. But the bathroom smelled like sewer and vomit mixed together. I was told to go to Guest Services and tell them all of our complaints and maybe I would be compensated but I didnt get anything. The food was so-so. My child ended up in hospital with a stomach infection due to the food and was severly dehydrated. Oh, and if you happen to have to go to the hospital, if they say, they may need to move you from ER to upstairs and that the cost will not change, they are lying. Insist you stay there and if not, check yourself out. They will keep you and run tests that are probably not necessary also prescribe alot of medications that are also not really necessary. The hospital care was excellent, don't get me wrong. Getting back to the Resort, the service at the Buffett, could be better. There were days, that you order a drink, and you would never get it or you'd have to run around and find a mug, cutlery to set a placement yourself. They dont have enough people working there to accomodate the number of guests. I think there were 4 people altogether. The plaza with Starbucks that has free internet service is only a 4 min walk away. We always felt safe, no question about that. You can walk to Playa del Carmen in 30 minutes or take a cab. Good shopping there as well. The night life on the resort is non existent. They had a very small disco bar, that was empty most nights. Some nights it was closed. Their shows they put on for the guests were okay. Nothing spectacular. I would go back to Playa del Carmen yes, but not to this resort. Finally, I heard the beach was beautiful here, but I have to disagree on this too. The beach was full of sharp bits of coral everywhere.. you needed your shoes on to walk on the beach. We only went out on the beach once. Ive seen better beaches in Cuba and Florida. And the water was always rough. If the red flag wasnt up then it was the yellow. Always very windy. Take a sun block that is 60 or more and get a prescription to avoid "traveller's trots" from your doctor before you go. Ive been home two days now and myself and my child are still suffering. Guaranteed you will get them unless you have a great tolerance to the food there. And dont drink too many drinks with salt or lemon and lime. It can react with the sun and give your mouth and other parts of your face and neck, some pretty mean blisters- which I got. The only good thing I could say about this resort, was the grounds are beautiful, plenty of pool chairs around, and the pool bar was good as well as the snack bars burgers.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Worshipers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bavaldez6
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! We just returned from a FABOLOUS vacation! If you are considering a trip to Playa Del Carmen anytime soon, I hope you take the time to read my review...Please note, we did our homework before booking our trip with this hotel and knew exactly what we were expecting to get... Upon arrival, we were informed that our hotel was over-booked and that they would be up-grading us for the night to their 5-Star sister hotel "Xcaret Occidental". This hotel was very beautiful but extemely large. It accomodates a very large number of people -The place is so big, you have to take a tram down to their so-called beach, which was actually a man-made cove. There was also no view of the beautiful ocean that Playa Del Carmen is known for. The following morning we returned back to the Allegro Playacar and met with the Property Manager "Miguel", who quickly got us checked in to our hotel and took EXCELLENT care of us throughout our entire stay. Although our rooms were not quite ready, our luggage was kept safely in the lobby while we were able to go play at the beach and pool and officially start our vacation. The beach is absolutely beautiful, one of the finest beaches we've seen yet!! We also enjoyed relaxing at the pool while enjoying the view of the ocean. Later on that afternoon, we went to check out our rooms which were a little smaller then what we are used to -but very CLEAN, close to the ocean and pools which made it more enjoyable and most importantly -we knew we had chosen the right place!!! By nights end, the resort staff had made a point to get to know each of us by name, which made it a very personable experience. The Entertainment Staff is AWESOME and is continously providing all sorts of entertainment to all guests and plays great music by the pool. I just can't say enough about the Servers (Alex, Jacob and Manuel) whom we met down by the pool area and disovered worked the morning buffett as well. These guys are very hard workers, always referred to us by name, very eager to please and they ALWAYS, ALWAYS have a smile on their face.They provided us with plenty of laughs and our drinks never went dry! The food in the Buffet was good -a little something for everyone! The (2) restaurants were great I especially liked The Italian and the staff was AWESOME!!! We went to the nightly entertainment shows and appreciated all the hard work it takes to put such a production on. Great dancers, great music, great entertainment. The grounds are very CLEAN and kept up nicely. We will defintely be returning to this resort and look forward to bringing our adult kids with us....Thank you Allegro Playacar for your EXCELLENT SERVICE and we will see you soon...Hasta Proximo AMIGOS ~Betty/California

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: KimandGlen
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was pretty scared after I read the reviews on here. The negative reviews were very inflated and completely inaccurate. We arrived very late at night and were greeted by very enthusiastic clerks at the front desk. Check in was quick and we headed to our room. We were on the top floor of a small hut like cabin. It was very private with a hammock and table. The rooms were really small and older but we didn't expect it to be a 5*, because we paid for a 3.5*. There were no bugs in the room and the rooms were clean. The maids did a fabulous job at ensuring the rooms were clean daily. You are not there to spend your time in the rooms so the 20 or so channels are fine and many are in English. The beds were hard but definitely comfortable! I haven't slept better in my life. Quiet and comfy. The staff greeted us daily with smiles and were always pleasant to deal with. We met Eduardo, the conceirge for the Spa, and he remembered my name even after a quick discussion on the first day. The entertainment at the pool was great. Antonio was very funny and always had a smile on his face. We enjoyed watching him doing daily aerobics in the pool with the ladies. The pool bar needed upgrading as it appeared dirty with missing tiles. It wasn't always equipted with a bartender which meant you needed to leave the pool to get a drink. In the afternoons, there was only one bartender at the bar, which did meant longer line ups. Because it was a small resort, lines were relatively small. Don't expect to be delivered drinks on the beach as this doesn't seem to be a speciality for them. The night time entertainment was fine. If you are looking for a night club atmosphere, you may be disappointed. Very few people stayed around after the show to use the night club. The shows were fine, but to be honest, I went to bed early most evenings. The service was great. We especially liked Jacobo. He was so accommodating and very personable. He worked at the breakfast buffet and later at the pool as a waiter. He was so good. You will enjoy him! The food was awesome. Something for everyone. We decided to got the Italian restaurant for both of our a la carte dinners and were not disappointed. The service, and food, were unbelievable! The pasta was wonderful, and the wine was delicious. We went to 5th Ave 3 evenings. We liked going at night because it was cooler. They served tequilla in alot of the shops and you could buy/ drink beer while you shopped. You could buy local beer anywhere from $1 to $5. Be careful not to get sucked into prices as they start really high. You can buy hammocks for $20 (they start at $60 at most places) and some cheap jewellery. It is about a 15 minute walk from the beach or 70 pesos by taxi. I went parasailing with my husband and enjoyed it. The Nolitours rep suggested we book through them as it would be higher standards but the one on the beach looked just as safe. We also went to Rio Secreto. It was fun but certainly not for anyone with back or leg problems. My brother in law and I had massages on the beach. It was amazing to be in the heat with a cool breeze. It was an experience I will not forget! The beach was awesome. The waves were big, the water was warm and the water was clear as could be. I am so glad we were at a resort on the beach. Internet was horrible. It was broken 2 or 3 days that we were there. They only had 1 computer, which was slow most of the days. It cost 20 pesos for 10 minutes. Overall, this is a great resort at a 3.5*. We were not disappointed. Don't listen to the negative reviews....if you are not happy, let Guest Services know. They should be able to accomodate you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for low budget and low Season”
Reviews.Author: xoxotravelmissy
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed the place especially the time we went there. I only didnt enjoy the first room we received that was dirty, bed bugs in it, the loud noise from a house water pump or something, the non-functionning air condittionning, broken shampoo dispenser, bad reno jo in the bathroom.....Anyway we saw that we immediatly asked for another one. The other one was on the ground level and on the left side of the resort. It was perfect...and couldnt complain about anything, ok maybe the filling the fridge is non do able for them. We would suggest that if you go to this hotel it should be on the low season otherwise as we heard from people or reviews of the hotel , you would do lineups ofr anything, food and drinks. You will be disapointed with the place if you paid more then 1000$ per person...that is a guarantee but you'll never pay that much on low season...especially from Canada. Also, do not go see the guy from Lomas travel at the hotel...He will pretend that he doesnt understand you ...(language barrier supposed issue) and charge you a ridiculus amount of money(the conversion of the money is a rip off) and he will not give you a decent deal if you buy several trips from him...(deal is a free picture with the photograph of the hotel..which was actually very crappy)...i would say go for travel agency desk that is smack in front of the reception exit hall...they'll give you several free goodies when buying at least two trips...didnt buy any trips from them but regret it.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Mexico was AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: JBrayley
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the resort we were greeted by the bellman at the door with a very friendly "hola" and a smile. From there the front desk staff was super and accomodating. We arrived at 11:30 am, and I knew that check in was at 3:00 pm. They said that the room wasn't ready yet, as I fully expexcted, but brought us each a welcome drink, and told us that we were free to use any and all facilities until our room was ready. We changed into some cooler clothes and went to have some pizza and relax. Around 1:30pm as we were wandering through the lobby, the desk clerk called us over and said our room was ready...early...and that we could go to it if we pleased. The busboy carried our luggage up for us right away and the fun began. The in room safe is FREE, which was a nice surprise, and the room was very clean. It had a beautiful thathed roof, balcony with table, chairs and hammok that my daughter made good use of. These rooms are designed in true mexican fashion. Not really big, but get the job done. We loved the villa type atmosphere. There are only eight rooms per villa and each has it's own private entrance...no halls for drunks to run down. The grounds are absolutely BEAUTIFUL. I have never seen gardens, grass, pools, etc maintained so well. These are tended to 24/7. You will not find a single piece of garbage, or trash laying anywhere around this place. The staff get to know you quickly and are the friendliest bunce that I have met yet. They go above and beyond their duties to help you out and show you around.. The food was awsome, plentiful, and plenty of variety. The buffett is changed up each day, and night. There is really no reason to have to eat the same thing twice. The drinks were plentiful as well, both alcholic and regular. The nightly entertainment was just that...entertaining. It was a little corny, but great fun as well. You have to have that attitude that you are there for fun, and you will not be dissappointed. A few times during the week, we walked into Playa Del Carmen to visit "Fifth Avenue" this is the main shopping district, and has a wide variety of shops and booths. Be aware that this is how these folks make their living and sales pressure is everywhere in town. A friendly wave of the hand and a "No Thanks" is all it takes to carry on. Time share sales are evident at the airport and in town, but I didn't see One salesman at the resort. All in all this was an amazing experience for our family. We will Definitely be back soon. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: go-away
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my brother, we had a great time when we checked in we asked if a room on the 2nd floor was available. We got one near the pool bar. the pool bar served great drinks and the lunch they served there was past what I inspected from wat I have seen at other places. enjoyed the pizza and The grill for hot dogs & hambugers. We ate in the main resturant for dinner again tne food had a good many items. and each night something different. the waiters were quick to pick up the dirty plates and bring more wine. all areas were kept very clean I even seen managers pick up plates and glasses around the pool area. the rooms were kept unbelievably clean I never seen maids work that long in one room. Especailly on the balconies and windows. We will return. also enjoyed Paya del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Helene044
Reviews.Content: If you have any standards whatsoever, don't go here!!! Didn't expect much upon arrival, but was even worse than I thought! Run down rooms, restaurants and public areas. Service and friendliness of staff awful. Wine was absolutely undrinkable, smelt of petrol and tasted like acid, even the waiter agreed and said he would never drink it! Food was OK. Wouldn't even go back if I was payed to go there!

Reviews.Title: “could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: eduward84
Reviews.Content: We stay at the resort for three day, then had to move next door to the RIU for the rest of the week,We had so many thing that were not working the phone,the bathroom,the shower, the T.V ex... The only thing that was really great was the rooms were well cleaned everyday,but they are out dated and the railing on the resort are need of repair because they are make of wood and they where falling apart.The people that work there are really friendly and always speak to you. The people that run the front desk need more help ,one person on the desk is crazy when you have 20 or more people come in all at once ,they put on really good show at nigth time to.This place could be a really nice place if they would put some work into it the grounds are keep up ,the pools are really nice the food could have had more variety,We could not find bacon in the morning for the first 2 day we were there because you have to ask at the back were they make the eggs. The location is great if you like to walk ,We were only hafe an hour or less from Playacar.the beach is beautiful and you could wake or run for miles. There is so much to do there shopping if you like that or rent a car before you go over to the inland Cozumel. Take the ferry to Cozumel and drive around the inland ,there is the must amazing beach on the other side ,the sand is like white baby powder and the water is crytal clear.We also went to xel-ha and xplor they both were great thing to do,if you take the kids or go with other adult friends. This is one vacation that I will never forget about

Reviews.Title: “not really that nice overall”
Reviews.Author: res12345
Reviews.Content: the staff really seem to try and are friendly. the management need to catcha boat and leave. The food is average. we have stayed at many different locations. This is not anything to brag about. location is pretty good. short distance to business area. (within walking distance) Beware of the (holiday planners) They are very smooth and will get you if you give them any time. DO NOT talk to them there really is no deal. They want you tied up fro 25 years. They say you can trade or sell and make money. That is all crap. People can't give away timeshares. They will try to give you free things to try the Royal Hideaway, then get you to sign and then they say you are bound in a contract that makes no sense. REMEMBER, if you happen to get sucked in to a contract with the Occidental....bla bla ... you legally have 5 business days to get out of it, no matter what you signed. Their laws states that even if you sign a waiver it is not legal. AND, if you have been lied to, tricked, coerced, or the contract has contradictory statements, which they do, you can also get out of the contract. BUT, you have to pursue them diligently. There that is my advice. I have been there, done that. got out of it. have a good day. i hope this will help others.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE STAY AWAY!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 204chick
Reviews.Content: Room-the smell was horrid it smells like sewage.Air conditioner leaked water.The roofs has holes that you can see right through them.No hot water or pressure the toilette didn't flush good. BAR=DISCO BAR SMELLED LIKE SEWER POOL STICKS BROKEN AND IT WAS VERY DIRTY WITH DISGUSTING SNACKS.THE POOL BAR HAD BIG LINE UPS.AND THERE WERE BARELY ANY CUPS AND THE ONES THAT WERE THERE WERE DIRTY. DRINKS&FOOD=they water down the alcohol and i think that someone should check the food and alcohol before someone gets sick because me and my friends were throwing up there food everyday.I Hope you consider this warning Before taking a trip to a dump.It is cheap but not worth it go somewhere else if you can i wish we did...

Reviews.Title: “Love the sand and sun”
Reviews.Author: shaprl1
Reviews.Content: We usually shop aound for a smaller resort.Smaller resorts in Cuba has been our choice and go there once a year. We like it that way as you get to know other guests and the staff. We where ready for the older resort ,we found so was not disappointed. We arrived at 11:45 a.m to the hotel. Told right away ,rooms not ready until 3.pm. We had packed a bathing-suit in our carry ons and a few other articles as we realised we would not get room right away. We changed in washroom. They put our suitcases in a locked room. If we had not inquired where to put luggage it would have sat outside front door as I noticed another guests did. No attempt to help with luggage. We did go back a few times and asked if room was ready yet but told no. Yes desk clerks where not the friendlest. Our first room smelt damp and stinky. It was near the stage. I complained and they said could not change until next day and yet I saw other guests arriving who did not have a room yet and got one. We where comfortable that night,slept well and decided oh well we`ll stay as we are not in room much. We went for breakfast,came back there was a large puddle in middle of bed plus on the head of bed. It rained that a.m very hard after we got up. I went over to desk and complained. They had another room.,strange as it was all made up in the a.m .Where was that room the evening before. . While we gathered our belongings up. A young housekeeper came in ,stripped the bed. He put clean linen right over the wet mattress. Guess that`s why the room smelt damp. Now for some possitive. We got a nice room closer to beach...loved it! even if we had to be quiet as we where on top floor. Pool was lovely and you could sit there and see the beach. Close to the great beach buffet.It was there fr. 11 to approx 4p.m Bar drinks where good. We had our own cooler bottles so kept drinks cold and got a larger drink. We walked into town on the street ,lovely homes and then back on the beach. We enjoyed the beach but,water was much too ruff to snorkel out from shore. We went on two excursions. One to Tulum..very interesting but Guide talked way too much on bus going and there. Guess we could have looked around by ourselves. They took us to this huge Jewllery place. They must have had 75 or more employees trying to sell you something. I was not impressed even if they where wanting to make a living. We went snorkling with the sea turtles , that was good. My favourite was snorkling in the fresh water underground river the Cenote. Ruff jeep ride in and out of there but worth it. Back at resort their entertainment staff was great. Always had something going on. Entertainment was very good at night. We ate mostly at buffet. Not the greatest desserts but guess who needs them . We went to the Italian,food wonderful and great service as usual. Staff wonderful,happy and obliging at this resort. We didn`t go to the Mexican. If you want to go to the alecart restaurants you have to reserve at the desk a day or so ahead. Night life is quiet but by that time we are ready for day to end. Quiet drink at pool bar until 10 p.m or upstairs at main bulding until late. The younger people go into town in evening to the different bars. Seemed to have a great time ,we where told. Our check-out went smoothly. Would we go again? I don`t think so,well maybe someday .We want to try somewhere else,not in that area in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation with quality people”
Reviews.Author: Holidayspls
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel and staff! Small homey resort feel. Superior location in the Mayan with the friendliest and attentive people in all of our travels. Staff immaculately dressed and always willing to please. Always great variety in food choices and tasty. This resort has everything to offer if your looking for sun, fun, relaxation and quality. Not an overwhelming high towering resort. Sweet bungalows with thatch roofs. The nightly entertainment was outstanding. The grounds were immaculately kept. The bartenders (who I am sure you must realize) work very hard. Look for "Noi" around the pool, he will take care of you. The beach was perfect and within walking distance into Playa del Carmen if you care for night life or shopping. Wish we were still there and are making plans for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are right-this one is all over the board-engages in unfair trade practices and should be civilly liable”
Reviews.Author: ben_there_done_it
Reviews.Content: I am a firm believer in Tripadvisor after this stay. Read through all the comments-you will get the good and the bad. I like this resort. We were there for 3 days. It is not too large nor too small a resort. Nice pool, nice grounds. Nice hammocks for each room. Great staff everywhere except for front desk and management. Now the bad. The walls are paper thin. If you have nice quiet family types and couples next door (most of the people in the resort), this is no problem. If you have, as we did, drunken morons who fight at 2 am before having noisy sex....you will get no sleep. If you read that they have 3 restaruants and think you are going to have some variety...think again. The reservations for the sit down restaurants appear to be non-existant though the restaurants are empty. Be prepared for buffet. The big problem with this resort, though, is management. As noted in other reviews, this group overbooks this hotel to the extreme. We had 2 rooms...one for our family which was arriving after 2 of us spent the first 2 days there. We showe up at 2:30 to get the room and were told we couldn't check in until 3 pm. O.k. rules are rules. At 3, we waited in line to get our room. At 3:30 we were told the hotel was overbooked and they would move us to the RIU Yucatan but it would be awhile before they could take care of it. The other hotel, while a higher * hotel is nothing like what we were wanting...big, noisy, package tourist hotel to the extreme. We wasted the afternoon moving. This practice of overbooking the hotel is apprently an epidemic with this outfit if you read the other reviews. This type of practice is clearly illegal and should be stopped. After telling you that they don't have a room for you, they give you a release to sign releasing them from legal responsibility for providing you an alternative. Don't sign the release even if they put you up at the Taj Majal.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot on an awesome beach”
Reviews.Author: Booboo345
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The gardens are wonderful. The rooms are in smaller buildings, with only 8 rooms in each building - much nicer than a regular hotel. The rooms are getting dated, but are kept very clean. Our air-conditioning was extremely loud with weird pop-corn popping sounds, but we just turned it off at night and put on the ceiling fan. The temperature was fine. The beds are a bit firm like most in Mexico, but these were pretty good. The food was good - not awesome - but good and there was always something for everyone (even our picky youngest 6 year old). There seemed to be a bit of a shortage of tables. We had to get our drinks, go find a table, then "claim it" with our drinks, or we'd have no place to sit. Not many spoons to be found either.... Someone else said they weren't warned about expensive phone calls by the Nolitours reps - be we were. Perhaps they misunderstood, but we've been to Mexico before and have been surprised by the huge bills before. The kids club was really nice - made our 6 year olds visit. She loved it there and didn't even WANT to be with us. They did lots of crafts, nice play ground, went to the beach, played games, watched some TV (in Spanish mostly, but some English), etc. etc. - Janette there was wonderful. The activities people were really enthusiastic and did some exercising and games. There is no gym at this hotel, which we missed. There is no dive shop at this hotel, but 1 hotel away is the Barrakuda (that's how they spell it) dive shop. They were top notch. We had Hugo as our dive master for 4 dives. He taught our boys the resort course and took them for their first 30 foot dive. They pick you up right in front of the hotel, so you don't need to take a taxi anywhere. They had lots of gear to use and reasonable prices. We highly recommend them. The photos offered at the end are not the best qualtiy for 50$ for a dvd, but we got them as it was our boys' first dives. It was mostly around 30 C while we stayed, but there was always a steady breeze, so we always felt comfortable. There seemed to be enough chairs for us - not lots, but enough. The hotel never ran out of towels either which is nice. Feel free to trust the Lomas travel rep located at the hotel. We took the Rio Secreto trip through him and saved $15 per person vs the Nolitours reps. Very nice place to stay for a lovely family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: BigEB
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Allegro Playacar! Right on the beach! Good food,great service! Buffets have something for everyone,fresh and tasty. Only complaint was the beds are a little hard but sleepng was okay. Music and the evening show ends about 11:00. Beautiful grounds, flowers and plants. Staff were great, hard workers, ready to help please you or bring you a new drink. Most speak English. A short walk into town Playa Del Carmen on the beach or the road 30 mins. Recommend the Rio Secreto tour Awesome! One of the wonders of the world!

Reviews.Title: “It is all about location.”
Reviews.Author: Canadienseloca
Reviews.Content: We returned from this resort overall satisfied. The best motto is, "you get what you put in". We initially decided to stay at this resort because it was a bit cheaper (appx 1000.00 CAD) so that we would be able to have some extra money for excursions, shopping, etc. Overall, we stayed here for the price and the location. The location was perfect for walking into Playa del Carmen, and for its close proximity to tourist sites such as Tulum etc. The beach front was amazing as well (you can walk on the beach into Playa del Carmen). Now, the negatives. The food at this hotel was terrible. Breakfast was the best! If you are a wine connoisseur, bring your own. The "house" was also horrible. There are only two a la carte restaurants. The Italian was okay. We did not attempt the Mexican one. Other drinks - general slushy drinks and corona. Tip well and you will get Bacardi instead of local rum. The resort was generally clean and the house keeping employees were very approachable and nice. We left a few dollars every day for a tip which was well received. Rooms - try to get a room on the first floor. If you have a room on the second floor you will be able to hear everything your neighours are doing - especially when they get down and dirty. Try to get rooms close to the beach (they are better and you get nicer towls!). Beds are relatively comfortable and you are able to sleep. Don't expect anything spectacular. The rooms are plain. Service - service at the front desk was slow (as expected) but don't think you will get and answer from various front desk employees if you want them. If you want a room change it will take you three days and no one ever knows. We actually had an experience where some at the front desk gave our room keys to a couple that had just arrived at the resort. They accidently entered our room at 1:00am while we were sleeping. When I called the front desk to discuss the mishap, the man spoke to me in a very rood manner and then hung up. We made a formal complain to the director of the hotel. Don't run into that guy - he's rude and need a crash course from McDonalds in customer service. Entrainment crew was excellent. You have to watch the classic musician show. Hilarious. Juan was also great. He will show you around downtown if you want to party and is very approachable. He will also teach you salsa. The afternoon games were also quite fun. As previously stated, it was a nominal resort with terrible food and just below average service (only at the front desk) but the beach is awesome, the location is perfect and there is an endless supply of corona. Have no expectations and you will have an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - We will be returning next year.”
Reviews.Author: islandgroveart
Reviews.Content: From landing in Cancun to our departure we had a fabulous time at Allegro Playacar !!! We were picked up promptly by the Nolitour Bus and arrived at the resort by 11:30 a.m. We were checked in quickly and given our wristbands. My e-mail request for a ground floor room, due to hip issues, was granted and the front desk was fully aware of my request upon arrival. Our luggage was taken care of while we enjoyed lunch and a leisurely 3 hours by the pool and beach until our hacienda room was ready at 2:30. Our luggage was promptly delivered . We reported a problem with the room safe showing an error and security arrived quickly and fixed the problem. The staff at Playacar are friendly and ready to assist you in anyway. Everyone greets you with a smile and a "Hola" Their English is very good. The Entertainment Crew are terrific. We enjoyed the daily activities, games and salsa dance lessons. Special thanks to Antonia and Juan. You guys are terrific The nightly entertainment is top notch and always something to look forward to at the end of the day. On one occasion we left the resort for the day. It was hot and sunny and we left our window open. It poured rain while we were gone and the floor of our room became a lake. The cleaning staff went in and mopped everything dry. moved a towel dried a suit case that was under the window and had everything back to normal by the time we arrived back at our room. Breakfast was excellent ! The Grill by the Pool made excellent burgers, ribs and fries as an alternative to the lunch buffet. My only critique would be the dinner buffet (3 1/2 ***). We enjoyed the Mexican a la carte and did not try the Italian Room. Other than the dinner buffet, our entire experience at Playacar was a positive one with extra stars for the entertainment team and the beach. We will be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation in 18yrs!”
Reviews.Author: MBintcliffe
Reviews.Content: My husband & I, my sister & her husband & friends from another provence met us there for a week. We all really enjoyed everything about the resort, the location, the staff, the food & oh that beach. We really liked that there were only 8 rooms per villa & you didn't have to walk dozens of stair cases or wait for any elevator. Only thing I didn't like about our room was that if you went to bed a little early, like 1 or 2am the resort next door had very loud music booming from their disco so if you get a room in the 12 or 13 block in that area & want a little more quiet to sleep ask to be moved. The 2 ala carte restaurants were amazing, the after dinner shows were terrific for a little local resort, great dancers! The entertainment staff work their butts off to make sure you are having fun 24/7. Just beware of the timeshare police that will try reel you in for a 5 hr "visit" to another property, they'll tell you it's 90mins but it's not, when you get a note on your room door saying you are to come to the welcome desk for a "welcome gift" that's the 1st clue that you are about to embark on a time share spiel, if you are not interested don't go & waste 5 hrs of sunshine like 1 poor couple in our group did while we soaked up the sun & sipped on pina coladas. Take a strong sunblock because that sun is hot! It's a 15min walk into Playa & only a 35 min ferry ride over to Cozumel where we found better deals than on 5th Ave in Playa & the vendors & shop keepers in Cozumel do not hound you to come in to check out "their junk, better than wal-mart" as they would say in 5th Ave in Playa. Great deals on Coach purse knock offs in Cozumel too. I highly reccommend the Catamaran from Cancun over to Isla Mujeres, well worth it. We all would definitely go back. I miss it already! Thanks to Antonio, Angel, Emily, Erica & all the rest of the fantastic staff! You guys all work so hard to make all of the guests happy & are doing a fantastic job!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: meximel
Reviews.Content: Wow,where to start. We had a great time at the Allegro Playacar. Got home at 5 am this morning and wish we were still there. This is a solid 3.5 star resort, the food was great, rooms older (but clean),staff (fantastic,very friendly), location (can't beat it),we rarely took a cab to Playa del Carmen, walked on the side walks and the beach,a nice little walk, and very safe. The beach, awesome, it is so beautiful on the beach in front of the hotel, people walkng by would often ask "what resort is this", very impressive. I was so worried after reading reviews before we went on this trip, should have know better than to believe some of the negative crap.
