The hotel was over booked for our two week stay, and they did offer for us to stay at thier other resorts in Exceret, or Cozumel, (both are supposed to be 5 star) ,but we just said (no thanks, we love it here), no problems, no pressure. Our group of 12 had a wonderful time, and as great as we found it , we still heard some people complaining ( we would just shake our heads and wonder why they just didn't buck up and go stay at a five star resort if thats what they wanted). Would I recommend this hotel to family and friends YES YES YES. Would we stay here again YES YES YES. We have traveled to the Mayan and Cancun 5 times, you could not beat the location on any of our holidays, and the friendliness of ALL the staff unbeatable. Go stay at this resort with no worries, and above all remember that it is a 3.5 star resort, not a 5 star and you will be as happy as we all were. If you have any questions just ask, hopefully I can help you out.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel, grounds were beautiful, great staff, good food, even the great big king size bed was very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cecile_K_S
Reviews.Content: We had incredible weather but very windy so we only used a sail boat towards the end of the week. For that you have to reserve at the beach kiosk of the next door hotel but it's free. The beach was amazing, but not allways easy to find shade. I wish there had been more parasols. The dancers and performers at the shows are very talented and I really enjoyed their performances, but our teenagers/young adults were not so keen and didn't really go. So much to see in the area so it's worth booking a tour through Juan Pedro at the hotel. You should definitly see either Tulum or Coba ruins, snorkel in the cenotes. If you don't mind a long drive, go to see the Sian Kaan reserve. You will see sea turtles, dolphins, other wildlife, snorkel in a coral reef, go to a secluded aquamarine sea pool, fishing village. It's a protected and non-comercial area, well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “wanted to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: traveller984029
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the people were so friendly! We loved the buffet and tried different foods every night. Rooms were rustic- mayan style, with thatched roof. Loved location, as we could walk on beach , and 25 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen. Resort is older, but we loved the grounds and animals. Pools excellent, and great food available most hours of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: tigrou22
Reviews.Content: First of all, gotta apologize for my English... I'm not perfectly bilingual but will try the best I can! My boyfriend and I traveled to Mexico (Riviera Maya) for the first time last week (february 23rd). We already have gone to Cuba twice, Dominican Republic twice, but it was our first time in Mexico and WE LOVED IT! Second time in an Occidental Hotel and resort and once again, we weren't disappointed!! Don't expect a 4 and a half or 5 stars; it's a good 3 and a half, 4 at my point of vue! PERFECT for a good vacation at an accessible price! The hotel and resort is VERY clean, nice gardens, well maintained, it's a beautiful site! The buffet restaurant is at the second floor of the lobby, as so is the Italian "à la carte" restaurant; everything is central. 2 pools: one to relax and one with activities; just big enough to cool down and have fun! Between them, the buffet for lunch, the pool bar, the Mexican "à la carte restaurant", the pizza restaurant and the gourmet cafe! Very nice resort!!!! The beach: WOW!!! Thought Varadero (Cuba) and Punta Cana were gorgeous, but this beach is very, very beautiful: Carribean Sea, white sand, you can walk on both sides for hours!!!! Also, by the beach, you can easily reach Playa Del Carmen in about a 20 minutes walk... that's pretty cool! The only thing I kinda disliked about the beach is that people put their cigarettes in the sand (a bit disgusting) and there's lots of seashells, so wath where you step!!! More palm trees or palapas to hide from the burning sun would also be a point to upgrade! But for us, that's a detail! The food: have known better (and always traveled in 3 and a half or 4 stars hotels), but it was ok! If your not too picky, you always find something to please everyone! The rooms: big enough, but VERY humid... even with the air conditioned on! We had a second floor room with the roof made of palm tree leaves... it's ok, but you hear everything from the room next door.... so if, like us, you have neighboors who listens to the TV loud ALL NIGHT... well you call the reception and they send someone!! Haha!! Ask for a first floor room... maybe a bit less noisy! The staff: wonderfull! They don't bother you, the are friendly, always kind and smiling and do everything to please you! Even better when you tip a bit: not much for us, but a little 2$, 5$ once in a while to your waiter at the buffet, to the roomaid makes a big difference! We can afford a week in paradise, we can afford a little appreciation to the staff, no??!!!! The nightlife: shows at night are ok, entertainment staff and activities are also ok... not too much, not nothing at all, just ok for those who enjoy the activities! Havn't went to the discotheque, so can't talk about it!!! Resort well located: at about 1h15 from the Cancun airport, at 20 minutes walk from Playa Del Carmen, at 5 minutes walk to a little shopping Plaza, at maybe 5-10 minutes taxi ride from a big shopping mall and the Wal-Mart!!! Playacar is a safe private district! Could talk about it much more, but the essential is there! If you have any questions, don't hesitate to write, I'll try to answer!!! [--] Have a good stay at the Occidental Allegro Playacar in Riviera Maya, Mexico!!!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough, don't stay away....”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Feb 21st to Feb 28th. I did my research before I got there so I knew what to expect. It was everything I expected but it was so much more. Yes our room was rustic and small, but everything worked and it was very clean. The maid service was great. A new towel animal on our bed everyday. The staff were amazing and very helpful never a rude moment from any of them. The beach, well it has to be one of the best in the world. The staff would make sure the deck chairs were in place and the sand raked for the morning rush of beach goers. The grounds are keep very neat and tidy and the grounds staff were always keeping busy with trimming bushes and cutting the grass. There are some funny animals who live there like the half rabbit and rat, the long tailed looking raccoon and yes the lizard family. There are three cats, my favorite was the little orange one he has a funny face but so friendly. The buffet was good lots of variety, we enjoyed it. Never got to go to the al la carte kept forgetting to reserve. You can also purchase a romantic dinner on the beach. The massages are really good, best ones I have ever had, yes they cost a little extra as well, but well worth it. The bartenders are friendly and they will even come to the beach to take your order. The pools were a bit cool, not to many people ventured in there but the deck chairs around the pools were always full. Lots of deck chairs at the beach but best to get them early for a good spot under a palapa or the yellow canvass shelters. If you go there expecting a 5 star, please stay away, but if you expect a 3.5 star then that is where you want to be. Allegro is so close to everything. Remember it is one of the first resorts in Playacar. It is about 27 years old. I hear they are going to renovate this fall. I would go back here a gain, it was a great place to stay. The entertainment was not that classy, we have seen better before at other resorts but they try. Say hi to Jorge in the little shop on the way to the beach, my husband and him became good friends. Have a good vacation, we did and we loved this place.....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0286
Reviews.Content: Booked with hotel and then they were telling us that they did not have any rooms. They wanted to send us about 30 minutes away. The staff and manager were extremely rude. By far the worst hotel in Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, relaxing atmosphere and friendly service= great $$ value”
Reviews.Author: charliessavannah
Reviews.Content: We recently had our wedding at the Occidental Allegro Playacar with 59 friends and family in attendance. I can honestly say while my experience with vacationing at all inclusive resorts is limited, I have traveled and stayed at places on both a higher ended budget as well as a low end budget and felt this resort hit the mark when came to an overall value for your dollar. It seems as though the whole 3, 4 and 5 star ratings are pretty varied in Mexico and while you would not put this in a 5 star category I would definitely consider this to be very close to a 4 star resort as far as quality goes. The food for the most part was pretty typical as far as buffet goes...fruit was always nice and fresh and plentiful as well as the salads. Each evening there is a different theme at the buffet and the fish entrees consistently seemed to be the best tasting dish. Sure it gets a little boring after 5 days of being there but there were plenty of options to mix it up everyday. My only complaint was that there were only the two a la carte restaurants to dine at, and if you don't make reservations the first night you get there good luck trying to get a dinner reservation the rest of the week. We only ate at the Mexican al a carte the one night and the food and service was excellent! The bar staff were friendly and always very appreciative of any gratuities you would throw their way. $1 for a round of drinks goes a long way, and for those who complain that the drinks were weak all you have to do is ask for a little more alcohol in your drink and they will gladly top you up! Rooms were kept very clean and the housekeeping staff was excellent and very friendly. Beds are a little firm but I believe that is the norm there. Air conditioning and fan worked great we slept no problem. We personally loved the bamboo thatched units, and the fact the each room had its own little patio with table, chairs and a hammock. The size of the resort was a nice advantage for us as we had a fairly large group and it was always a short walk to the pool and restaurant area or beach. The grounds were gorgeous and well kept, and the fact that you could walk into Playa del Carmen in 20mins made the location that much more convenient. Lastly if you are considering this resort for your wedding I highly recommend it- Gloria (the Guest Services/Wedding Coordinator) does a fantastic job of organizing everything and putting on a fantastic event. We couldn't have asked for things to have gone better, and the resort photographers Matius and Augustus are phenomenal- they did an amazing job on our wedding photos and were around everyday taking photos of everyone at the resort. I highly recommend this resort for anyone looking to get away for an relaxing week in the sun who doesn't need all the comforts of a fancy resort. The staff and atmosphere definitely make it a great value for your $$ indeed!

Reviews.Title: “great location..needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: kcir
Reviews.Content: there is no better location in Playacar and the beach is as good as it gets.....the resort is very dated but well maintained...outside of the breakfast buffet the only place to eat or drink is down by the beach until the evening when the other bar opens plus the small disco, and we certainly did not care for this...the rooms are ok in size, nice balcony, but the shower is really quite in need of an upgrade, but at least the water was hot....we had an opportunity to move and took advantage of it and lucked out with another resort in Playacar 5 minutes away.....with the appropriate renovations this resort could be out of this world as it is the right size, and the location is perfect......a 20 minute walk on the sidewalk or beach gets you to town, and a little plaza 2 minutes away with a Starbucks and free internet just buy a coffee....this is a 3 star resort at best but a 5 star location....

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: WendyRLadysmith_BC
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to the Mayan ...it was fantastic! The staff at the Playacar was great...poolside bartender...Viktor & Humberto at the breakfast buffet...JT at the front desk..the efficient housekeeping staff..the resort is located in a gated community near Playa del Carmen(20min walk or $5 taxi ride)...well kept grounds, lots of available outdoor activities..the best just sunning on the white sandy beach...catching a few waves..or sitting in the swim up bar...enjoying the scenery and sipping that ever thirst quenching marguerita!!! A great place to have a week of R & R in the middle of winter...would definitely go again..miss it already!! If you would like to try a little of the nightlife and some different fare...Playa del Carmen has some great spots...Tequila Barrel (good for sportswatchers), Babes (great Mango Margueritas), ...there is also lots of tours that are not too far away from Playa or the Island of Cozumel ...ferry ride away(25 min) which has the world's 2 nd largest barrier reef..great snorkeling! The resort is rated 3 1/2 stars which I would agree with...just a small note, the rooms' bathrooms may need an update as well as the linen supply...however, never in the room that much for it too be too much of a problem...still like to be on that deck chair sipping a cold one feeling the warmth of the Mayan sun...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Wonderful Staff, Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: winterbaby_65
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews so we were prepared for the time-share scams, the "we're booked" scams and all the other warnings. Although this didn't happen to us, we had spoken to a few that were approached and were able to advise them on our findings. Just say no and don't fall for the pitch. Remember nothing is for free! As stated, rooms were not ready until 3pm, even though we arrived at 11am. We enjoyed full use of the facilities while the bellman at the front watched our luggage. We were asked our preference of rooms and didn't get a single request BUT we voiced our opinions and moved into a room that we knew was coming free. Front desk help was always extremely helpful. We were first put in 2111, top level beside tennis courts. Although extremely private, we had trouble sleeping as it's a top level and those birds are up cooing and chirping and pecking etc on the thatch roof before the crack of dawn. We did see some small holes in the roof and could see the light of day through them so we were concerned if it rained. The upper level rooms 'seem' larger, but it could be because of the open space. The bathrooms are bare minimum, but what more do you want other than a place to shower/bath and use facilities. I have long hair and never had a problem with water pressure or rinsing my hair out. The rooms were always cleaned and towels replaced. A little skimpy on the soap, but they provide bath gel and shampoo in dispensers on the wall in tub. Beds were a little hard, but we expected this. The pillows were comfy and it just made us appreciate our own bed all the more :) We were moved to room 2703 and it was great. Although not as private, it was on a main walkway and on a corner, we were close to the pools and close to the main building. A good mid point. This had the king sized bed we requested and had a little bit of greenery outside of terrace for a bit of privacy. We didn't use the hammocks, but the terrace had plenty of room for sitting and enjoying the beautiful weather. We sat there and watched the heavy downpour as well and were quite comfortable. There are no dressers but there are shelves and both rooms had a lot of hangers, so we were fine for the week. The food was a bit repetitive but we didn't starve. The lunch buffet at the pool bar was excellent and they had a grill that served hot dogs/hamburgers, nachos etc... There was also a Pizza Bar that filled the void. Nestor at the pool bar gets high marks from both of us as he was always smiling and really made our stay enjoyable. Take a moment or two to talk to the wait staff and get to know a bit about their lives. The entertainment staff really tried hard and seemed to have willing participants for the games around the pool and during evening shows. We enjoyed the Disco and Las Vegas nights, they were quite humorous. The beach and location would have to be the best part of it all. The beach was always busy as it was a major walk by with tourists heading to Playa del Carmen. About a 20 minute walk along the beach. Excellent stroll! Lots of loungers to be had and the vendors were there but they weren't pushy or annoying. Wait staff were willing to serve you on beach as well. As said in previous reviews, bring your own bubbas or big cups. We had no complaints as to the alcohol content. My boyfriend asked for bacardi and got it. They were very generous with their portions of alcohol in drinks :) Only Corona on tap though. We booked our Xel Ha excursion through Juan. He has a booth set up just outside lobby by the ramp to upper level in main building. He was a bit cheaper but the service was the same. All in all we had an excellent vacation. It was very relaxing and stress free. No worries about walking around in your bathing suit all day. We felt safe and secure. There was a good range of guests ages. The disco can't even really be called a disco, it is small but has a pool table and a big screen t.v. for sports fans. We were usually so beat from our long days in the sun that when the bars closed at 11, we were good to go back to room and crash. If you're hoping to sit in room and watch t.v. all day, this might not be the place to go... unless you understand spanish :) We did get 2 channels that were english and they played movies for the most part. We also got CNN so we were up to date on world events. A week without t.v. isn't necessarily a bad thing. The grounds were very well kept and all in all a clean well run resort. A good solid 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, POOR CORPORATION”
Reviews.Author: polillor
Reviews.Content: The resort was clean, staff was very friendly and exeptional service. Food was only ok. With that being said, I unfortunately cut my foot STANDING in the pool on a broken tile on our first full day at the resort. I received 10 stitches at the local hospital. I had to walk the entire length of the complex on a profusely bleeding foot. We were told there was no cart available (mind you our luggage was taken to the room on a golf cart!). I was not able to get my foot wet for four days, which ruined the vacation. It is over one month and I am still nursing the injury. It was that severe. Cost at the hospital was over $1,000 US. As a Occidental Vacation Club Member I wrote the company regarding this issue. I have since contaced four different people by email and by phone. All messages have been disregarded! I strongly recommend NOT BUYING into the Vacation Club, as the customer service from a corporate level is NON-EXISTANT!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: ervegard
Reviews.Content: There were 7 of us staying at the hotel over Christmas and new years. We loved the place and the best part was the beach, so nice and the pool area was full of games and such wonderful, playful and helpful staff. They really took care of you. Juan is one hell of a champ! The rooms were lovely aswell and the surrounding of the rooms were gorgeous, trees and flowers and quietness. 5 minutes in a cheap taxi to playa del carmen. Walking approx 20 min. There is a small souveniershoppingarea closer by, but not too much there, but you can find chemist, starbucks and the essentials. I am totally satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations completely”
Reviews.Author: BDEP0810
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allegro Playacar from February 4 to February 11 with my wife and 24 year old son in 2 rooms and we all had a great time. One of the best words of wisdom I read on this site before going was "If you go expecting a 3-star resort you will not be disappointed". This description holds true. It is not a 5-start resort but even though the rooms are very basic and could use painting and some minor repairs they were always very clean and I never felt uncomfortable going to sleep at night. The buffets were a bit repetitive but we could always find something good to eat....great burgers and pizzas around the pool. If you want a really nice meal be sure to book early and go to the Italian restaurant. If you are a wine lover bring your own....the house wine is awfull!!! The resort is a nice size and not too spread out so getting around is easy. The beach is one of the nicest I have ever been to. The resort grounds are always very well maintained, and the pools were very clean, and the staff were always friendly and pleased to help out. I am not sure where the comments about being hassled by timeshare people are coming from as we were never bothered once the whole week. One concern that I will agree with however is that this resort is notorious for getting overbooked and then sending guests off to other resorts. While we were there they were asking for volunteers to go to the "5-star" Occidental Grand in Cozumel with all the travel covered and extra resort vouchers while there so we decided to take them up on the offer and go for 2 nights. They delivered on everything promissed, however, although the resort had much nicer rooms, and better food, we actually were glad to get back to the Allegro. So be prepared for this happening as even the front desk staff voiced frustration with it happening all the time. Bottom line.....would I go back again? Absolutely!!!!

Reviews.Title: “FOUR STAR ON NOLITOURS WEBSITE-2.5 OR MAXIMUM 3 STAR AFTER SPENDING A WEEK THERE !!!”
Reviews.Author: calator43
Reviews.Content: Before booking the trip I and my wife spent few times on reading the reviews with pros and cons and decided at the end to give a try base on the location (few min from Playa del Carmen) and the amazing beach.We are not a grumppy or picky couple but the experience overall with the resort was something we will remember as one of not so pleasant. Awfully conditions inside the room with a strong sewer smell persisting the entire time,very annoying sales people -timeshare stuff right in the center of the main access-stay away from them as much as you can-a very basic BUFET MENU day after day with no variety and the list goes on. Location and the beach are the point of sales here.Short walk-15min on the beach or 3-4 min Taxi (50 pesos) to the 5 ave in Playa.The beach large-huge and soft-with plenty of chairs and ...vendors but they need to make money also. For some people looks like having plenty of drinks is more important than having a full package as a 4 STAR resort with no further comments. Overall for us was a big" FIASCO" and the management needs to pay more attention to the rooms which WOW--they are bagging for a MAJOR FACE-LIFT. Good luck to you all !!!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Mexico and we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 1smokie1
Reviews.Content: Same as others, I had some trepidation about where I finally chose for us to celebrate my husbands big 50, but I have to say we will definitely go back! I wanted a more real Mexican feel not just a big hotel and the Allegro has that. All of the reviews about all of the staff are true - they are amazingly friendly and helpful. I took to heart and would advise the same, don't go expecting 5 star and you'll be satisfied. Also had a number of friends who have been to the area comment on the beautiful beach in our pictures. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A FOUR STAR RESORT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nan779
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spent two weeks at the alegro with our son, daughter in law and two granddaughters. The wait staff, the activities staff, the kids club staff, the cleaning staff were all AMAZING. The food was "adequate". The grounds are very well kept but everything is very spread apart and there is a lot of uneven ground, witch makes it hard for someone with problems walking. The night show are very good! If you plan to stay at the alegro make sure to take a drinking glass/bottle of some kind, because, the glasses they serve drinks in (other than at the buffet or restaurants) are chipped, cracked plastic glasses....unfit to drink out of!!!! We have stayed at several all inclusive resorts in Mexico, and , at most, would call this a two star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort for a 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: WpgTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our stay first week of February 2011. We purchased our all-inclusive vacation via Nolitours in mid January for less than $1000. This is a charming rustic Meixcan feeling resort. If you want an American type of 5 star high rise resort, then book that. All the Canadians we partyed with had an awesome time, some have returned several times -yes there are a lot of non-speaking english people but it looked like they had fun. You get a resort on a 5 star beach walking distance to Playa del Carmen. You get a good selection of food all day. You get premium liquor if you ask. I always asked for Barcardi and got it. Our family enjoyed the variety of drinks = blended or mixed. The Corona beer was cold. The bartenders would fill up any size of cup you had or just use their cups. Ask for a GO cup if you want to walk or go out of the resort. Some days we tipped other days we didn't. The service was awesome no matter what. You get 2 pools - quiet or fun with music. The fun team - awesome. They always made sure you had a good time, or left you alone. The view from the pool was amazing. Always a chair both at the pools or on the beach. Yes, the rooms are OK. But if you aren't happy, just ask the front desk and they will move you. Some people complain about everything - so just know what to expect. Sites like this are so helpful - no surprises if you do your research. Take your money with you...don't leave it in the room. As most people had trouble with the safes. We had no problem around the pool with our day bag. Just get to know people and you will have a safe time. We never felt unsafe. Also there was a kids club, be we only seen a couple kids in it. This resort is perfect for teens and up. The shows are ok. The 6 professional dancers are great. But each show is just dancing and some fun. Yes the games and dancing is a bit risky, but the show starts are 9:30. Usually any young children were in bed. We had the most amazing weather, so this made our week abosolutely incredible. For the price we loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: tequilarogero
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the allegro. Food at the buffet was very good,different themes every night. We went to both a la cartes both were excellent. Rooms were a bit dated and run down, could use some rennovating. Maids kept the rooms spotless. Grounds were beautiful. Beach was the nicest we ever stayed at. Staff was very friendly and helpful.very close to playa del carmen, just a short 20 minute walk. Some of the entertainment was a bit riske with some foul language in the music. not many snacks available at night but we were not that hungry beacuse we usually had a late dinner. overall i would definitly stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Value & Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Ootskapiinii
Reviews.Content: I picked the Allegro Playacar based on Trip Advisor submissions. My wife & I spent 2 weeks all-inclusive at the resort 24 Dec., 2010 - 8 Jan., 2011. Most of the time we were there had breakfast and dinner at the resort except for the times we were in Play del Carmen (PDC) or out exploring the country side or scuba diving. We did spend a few days at the pool and the beach in front of the resort, just hanging out and taking in the sun. By far the Allegro beach is the least crowded and most convenient for those long walks to PDC (45-60 min) or to go snorkeling at the far south west end of the beach about 3/4 hour in the opposite direction of PDC. The Allegro is a 3 star Mexicana style complex. If you want high end go somewhere else and pay the $$$$+ We enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel from the immaculately kept grounds to the very friendly staff. We had a second story suite (3615) away from the beach and that was perfect. Very little noise for morning coffee on the deck and evening drinks before dinner. The all-inclusive buffet selections were good. Remember, this is Mexico and the food is Mexicana style, so North American food is not on the buffet menu. There are several things to be aware of when staying at the resort. Firstly, I love red wine and the red wine at the Allegro is terrible. My wife said the white wine is tolerable. I ended up going to Wal-Mart in PDC and buying some L.A. Cieto Cab. Sav. at 110 pesos per bottle. A reasonable red and worth bringing it back to the room. In the complex, the units are built to Mexican standards and complaints about smells are occasionally valid. The toilets, bathtub/shower and sink drainage are all connected to the sewer system w/o outside venting. Thus, you sometimes get sewage "smell" backup. I went out and bought some room deodorizer spray and we survived quite nicely. It was no big deal. If you like to sit out on your balcony in the evening and/or at night, take some Off insect repellent with you as the no-seems and mosquitoes come out. Our suite was up in the palm trees. The bats also put on a good display feeding on those insects. The rooms are comfortable, beds are solid, however, the walls between the rooms paper thin. Again, Mexicana style. Most annoying were the drunks at 3AM arguing next door or hollering nearby outside. If you take your laptop, do not purchase the Allegro WiFi packages. They are expensive $20 for 2 hours and generally do not work because of a poor Internet service provider, not the Allegro's fault. Go to the Playa Plaza down the street, buy a Starbucks coffee and get your connection for the price of the coffee. Oh, take your own large mugs from home for mucho grande coffee and cerveza when at the resort. Cab fare to PDC el centro is 50 pesos, but further into town 70 pesos. The walk to PDC via the sidewalk is about 1/2 hr. Finally, remember that tipping is part of the service culture in Mexico. We always ensured that we had 20 peso notes <$2.00 to tip (la propina) at each meal for the waiter, the maid who cleaned the room every day, bar tenders at the pool bar, dining room etc. Also, try to pick up and/or learn some Spanish words as that will serve you well with the locals. Overall, the resort is just fine, the staff extraordinary and Santiago one of the managers at the desk terrific. He solves any problems you might encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Penny0
Reviews.Content: We have done a fair amount of traveling so I would rate this hotel as average for the money. This is the tropics so its not going to compare to home. There stuff does not have to have the standards that we do in Canada or the US so when you are comparing -compare apples to apples. If you want a 3 star price but a 5 star hotel - you will always have something to complain about. Pay the price and go to a 5 star and you still might have the same problems....life has no guarantees!! Our room had the same sewer smell coming up the drain - obviously they have a little problem when it comes to their sewer system....again this is the tropics and how many people are using this daily - 365 days of the year?? The walls are paper thin and some people are just not considerate enough to keep it down when talking or having sex???!! MAKE SURE YOU TAKE YOUR EAR PLUGS!! All hotels are like this to some degree - not enough to give them a bad review though. The staff are all very friendly and try to be helpful (within their means). You must remember - these people make about 7.00/day so they make it possible for us to go to their country to visit for so cheap. If they made what we did, we wouldn't be going there for a vacation!! They don't have the same luxuries as we do and when you are all complaining, maybe you should think how lucky you really are!! The location is excellent!! Nice walk to Playa del carmen. Took ferry across to Cozumel (40 minute ride). I recommend just taking small denominations of American money as that is what all their prices are compared to, and even though the Canadian dollar is par, our dollar is still lower?? It might be easy to get money as there are thousands of ATM machines but the charge is terrible so save yourself the trouble and just take the money with you. You need to experience "fifth avenue" in Playa Del Carmen once but after that just go to the Plaza closest to the hotel - their prices are the same and you can deal just as well. The beach is great - not enough chairs though. The hotel in general needs an overhaul but that does not have anything to do with the staff - they sure try hard!! Thumbs up to the chefs at the beach buffet!! and Nester and the boys at the beach bar!! They work for their money!! All in all, we had a great holiday and tried to spend minimal time in the room. The main buffet had a good selection of food (not great) but they sure try hard! Recommend the mexican restaurant - awesome food!! Did not go to the Italian - too busy but it also got good reviews. A little tidbit: The higher the room number, the closer you are to the beach and the pools....we were in the 5600 blocks which was one building away from the beach.....we loved it! The winds from the ocean are a little cool at night and on a cloudy days so make sure to bring a light to medium weight coat. It is their winter too. Just remember where you are and what you are there for and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “STICKY FINGERS WITH SMELLY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: kenworth32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 16 others spent from 1-22-11 thru 1-29-11 in this resort . It was a nice place as far as location at the resort , (next to the pool ) , food was O.K. , (one week of that was enough--Missed U.S. food ). Now the problem........When you get a safe, make sure it works 24-7. Ours worked the first two days.Next morning it didn't. Went to the front desk and reported it at 7:30am. They said they would send someone right down. Told him we had to leave at 8:00 for a tour. No show, We left assuming that they would come down and fix the problem , Yea right.. Didn't think to check it when we got back late that nite. When the wife looked in there the next am.,her extra watch was missing along with 2 diamond necklaces which were all in a baggie. They left the FAKE jewelry and some loose change in there. I went to the lobby and when asked if I could be helped , I said yes , someone stole jewelry from my room ,he was on his radio and the phone at the same time, Other visitors were watching this and there people had me in there office in less than 3 minutes !!!!!! Imagine that. They put on a good show down at our room,the five investigators they had. I had to fill out a report, tore our room apart , checked everything. Found nothing--NO KIDDING---Talked to the assistant manager everday--said they were checking outside videos,,our card lock on the door, said that us and the maid were the only ones in the room. talked to the maid, and she said she didn't take it. I laughed and told him--What did you think she was going to say ? Would I waste parts of my vacation just to come up here and deal with this ? (4 days) He was gone on Friday which I figured would happen as we were leaving the next am. He was there and we went the rounds 1 more time before we left. He told me he had to believe the maid,,Told me she had been there 15 years--earlier in the week he said 8 years .He told me that everything was recorded and sent to CORPORATE IN MIAMI from his computer and for me to check with my travel agent and she could check on this for me when we got home for some possible reimbursement. Called her this am , and she done everything but laugh in my face. Has nothing to do with any of that and he was just trying to get me out of there.I agreed. The dollar value does not bother me as much as the sentimental value. After the maid was brought to the stand , we never recieved bottled water , kleenex's, or cute little towel animals on our bed. The way to stop the sewer smell in your room is to wet a towel and put it over the drain in the bathroom, the same place I left her tip!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “FIRST....AND DEFINATELY LAST TRIP TO MEXICO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BahamaMama2011
Reviews.Content: We don't like to complain, but this experience was unbelievable. We were... no kidding, counting the days to come home. Reading the reviews prior to going, we kept an open mind. However, the trip was so negative, we HAD to write this so that hopefully nobody has to go through what we did. The good: Location on the beach. Pool/Bar staff. The Italian Theme dinner night. The Bad: There is almost too much to list. Almost everything eles. The resort was labelled a 4*. This is definately NOT true. Maybe a 2*. MAYBE! Resort looks good until you get to your room. Old. Smells like mildew and sewer. You can hear the conversation word for word of people in next room. The bed, no kidding, is concrete on the bottom with a old mattress on top. The mattress is covered with an old egg crate foam. On top of that is a plastic bed cover. HARD AS A ROCK! We were told there were soft drinks and snacks supplied. Not true. You get water in your room if you are lucky. After 2 days of no water and going up to the front desk 4 times, we were finally given 3 small bottles. My husband unfortunately got sick down there due to a pre-existing condition. I am a nurse, and due to the medical insurance runaround, we were not able to get the hospital. Think I got any help from the Resort????? Nope... Instead, I got yelled at from the Nolitours Representative in the middle of the lobby because I wouldn't pay $150 to see their resort doctor. When I explained all he needed was an IV, I was told I could buy one at any Pharmacy and just needed to talk to their doctor on the phone. The doctor proceeded to tell me I had to go the the hospital to get one and I was charged to speak to him regardless. Needless to say, he never got one because it was the weekend, and our Insurance Office wasn't open and the Mexico Hospital charges you $3000 cash upfront to be seen. When we finally did make it home to Canada, my husband went straight to the Hospital Emergency Room and spent 3 days there in Acute Care. Another thing to watch out for, collect calls. They don't inform you that there is a "service charge" for making a collect call. Works out to $4 each. Regardless of if you get through or not. We were also warned about time share cons. We fell for it. The resort invites you to receive a free welcome gift. IT IS NOT!!!!! We were told the resort was full, and they were trying to upgrade people to their sister resort to empty some more rooms out. We asked flat out if it was a time share and were told no. Under no circumstance!!!! So we figured fine. No problem. Ya, right. It will only take 90 minutes to show us the other place and if we like it we can move there. 4 hours later, it was a gimmick to show us a HUGE resort that I admit was nice, but most definitely a time share. Or as they worded it, "A promotion within our hotel". We are both in our thirties. We thought it would be a nice relaxing vacation. Not so. During the 5 days my husband was sick, the chambermaids actually got mad at me because I wouldn't let them clean our room. I don't know if they get paid by the room, but holy crap! !!! I got clean sheets and towels and did everything myself. Please please please take our advice and DO NOT GO TO THIS RESORT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: wendyunicorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Jan 19 for a week. We spent the week prior at a condo in Cozumel, and wanted an inexpensive second week in Playacar. The Allegro was a good value. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The rooms are in a bungalow type building with 8 rooms to a bungalow. They are quite small but clean and we got coffee packs and bottled water everyday. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The beach is magnificent. We have not been to Playacar for three years and we were amazed at how much beach has been reclaimed since then. There are two pools on either side of the bar/restaurant. Two ala carte restaraunts, Italian and Mexican. We ate twice at the Italian, very good food. Didn't have the chance to do the Mexican. The Buffet was okay, better than we expected. The entertainment staff were great, and the evening shows were cute and funny. We love the location right in playacar, easy walking distance to Fifth Ave. Our only critisism is that during the day the only bar open is at the pool. It would have been nice to have another place to sit and enjoy a cocktail. The Allegro gives good value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Safe, friendly, enertaining, accomodating, value for your money resort”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayMissy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a week at the Allegro Playacar. The resort was very different and unique. The 4 unit rooms are thatch covered and mexican style colored walls with ceramic tile. The top units are the same as the bottom other than they have balconies and although the bed was rock hard, I still had a good sleep every night. The maid service was exceptional and very thorough. The first night we arrived, we were put in a room with a wobbly ceiling fan and the air conditioner did not work well, but when I went to the front desk and asked to be moved, they accomodated our request the next morning and were put in an upper unit closer to the pool. The food was excellent every day and the staff were very friendly. If you visit this resort, ask about their 4 course lobster dinner served on the beach in the evening, excellent and the waiter was so good to us, very nice and reasonable. The community of Playa Del Carmen was beautiful, the architecture of the homes and condos was breathtaking. We walked down to 5th avenue(about a 20 minute walk from the hotel, 5 minutes or 50 pesos by taxi) that went for blocks with many many little stores and very lively and entertaining, we enjoyed ourselves at night down this street and went back a few times, very safe and friendly. The only disappointment for us was that the sun did not come out much the week we were there but it was still very warm. The ferry to Cozumel is a must and we saw huge cruise ships docked at the port and this little island, about a 20 minute ferry ride, was very nice. For the value, this little resort was well worth it and I would definitely go back. Do not visit the bird sanctuary on the way to 5th avenue, not worth the 22 american dollars they charge per person, we saw maybe 5 different types of tropical birds and really not worth it. Make sure you see the hotel shows at night, unbelievable talented staff that perform these shows, a must to see. Great vacation!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: jayfish82
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Allegro Playacar. We got a good deal on an all inclusive trip, and it was worth every penny we paid. I don't know if I would pay full price for the resort though. The rooms were nice, they had air conditioning and a ceiling fan, we were in an upper room, so we had a thatched roof, which was really neat. The downside to the thatched roof was that the last night we were there it was pouring rain and there were a couple of leaks in the roof. The beds are a bit on the hard side, but they have to be because of the humidity. I didn't mind them though and slept well every night. Each room had their own hammock as well which was great for relaxing, they also had a safe for our valuables. We could also hear our neighbors through the walls, but I think that the roof had a lot to do with that. There are also family rooms which are right down by the ocean and looked like they'd be really nice. The resort has two pools, one of them has a swim up bar, and a great beach. The food was great. They have two a la carte restaurants, a Mexican and an Italian one, I'd say that the Mexican was better. They also had a breakfast and supper buffet, yes they did have hot dogs in the buffet, but they also had a lot of other different foods, and every night the supper buffet was a different theme. During they day they have a pizzeria and a lunch buffet as well as a grill cooking lunch right down by the pools. At night they have different live shows performed by some of the workers in the resort, some shows were better than others. The resort itself is in a great location, it's about a five minute walk from a little market (with a Starbucks), and about a 15-20 minute walk from 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen (faster if you take a taxi). The one thing that I found strange about the resort was the amount of French Canadians that were there. About 70 percent of the guests were from Quebec. All in all it was a great trip and I'd go back if we found the same deal again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Karl B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro from January 8th to January 15th, 2011. Booked through Nolitours. The grounds of the resort are extremely clean, and although the room we had was a bit sparten, it was very clean, lots of hot water, and the beds a little hard, found no problem sleeping. The food was excellent! Lots and lots of variety, something for everyone, and never boring even after 7 days. The beach is great, and there were always lots of chairs to be found(the hotel was almost full when we stayed there). A normal walk from the hotel along the beach to 5th Avenue on Playa del Carmen takes 15 - 20 minutes. For the lazy people the taxi rate is only 50 pesos. The staff we met were very friendly and helpful. Nolitours Rep. Vicki was really helpful at the hotel for booking tours. Paid only $854.00 plus tax for one week. Real value for your money. Safe, clean place to stay, with a great location. Would visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for our dollar”
Reviews.Author: Growe53
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Allegro Playacar and would probably stay there again. If you go expecting a 3 star, you won't be disappointed. We really liked the layout and that it's a small resort. And as much as we liked the 8-plex accomodations, your sleep really depends on who your immediate neighbours are. (Read; no soundproofing). The staff are great and there's always something for picky eaters at the buffet. We especially liked the Mexican ala carte and could have easily eaten there every night. Well, almost. The rooms are small and the towels are (quite literally) grey, so don't expect a 4 star hotel. We enjoyed our stay there and could have easily managed a second week.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach makes it a great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: wannabestaff
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel we look for in Mexico. Two story bungalows with lots of pool room and a great beach. The entertainment staff were great with lots of activities on the beach and poolside...(not enough in the pool but it was quite cold the first 5 days so the pool was freezing)..kept our teenage daughter busy and we had fun with the games too. The restaurant service/staff was good and the food had lots of choices so even the picky could find something. We enjoyed the mexican meals. Wouldn't recommend the Italian alacarte. We were given a wheelchair access room when we checked in and it wasn't suitable. No tub, sink & shower to low, Double bed & Single...it took 4 days to get moved to another room. We found the staff to be really friendly but not most of the other guests... a lot of french speaking guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Affordable, Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: AnaGreen155019
Reviews.Content: The Occidental Allegro Playacar is a really homey, and cute hotel. The rooms aren't the most beautiful, but they have everything you need. I had no complaints. The airconditioner works, water preassure in the shower was great, beds were fine, they provided water bottles, the room had a safe and was very clean. I think that the hotel is a little old looking, but other than that, it was great. The beach is gorgeous, the location is excellent. It's only a 5 dollar cab ride to 5th avenue where there are tons of clubs and bars and some great shopping! The staff are so sweet and the entertainment is excellent! The food wasn't excellent, but they had a great selection of everything. There was something for everyone! I would definitly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Christmas! Want to go back NOW”
Reviews.Author: lalita74
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I start to get nostalgic in just thinking how wonderful this vacation was. I stayed at the Allegro Dec 21-28, 2010. We were 3 families, 7 adults, 2 teenagers and 2 children for a total of 11 of us. This was our second time staying at the Allegro but first for the other 2 families. We stayed in rooms 4101, 4112, and 2105- good location and comfortable rooms. The rooms were fine, nothing fancy. YES, the beds are hard because they don’t have box springs, they have them made out of cement so there is no bounce in the mattress. What they add is bed padding and it does the job. The mini fridge was always stocked- no complaints. The maid service was great, with the kids brining in so much sand and water into the room, I was grateful someone else was doing the cleaning and not me. We had wonderful service throughout the resort. Everyone in the front desk, pool, beach, restaurants, and activity areas were always pleasant and greeted you always with a smile. I also have to compliment all the Canadians that stayed in the resort. You guys ruled and were very nice people! I have to say, most guests in this resort were from Canada and not too many Europeans or Americans. There were a few Mexicans (ME) but they were also living abroad like my family. The resort grounds were absolutely immaculate. They really take care of their garden and make sure all plants and grass look green all the time. The pools cleaned every morning from the leaves that may fall into the water. Every morning you wake up to a well maintained resort even though you know very well that the night before the guests made a mess of it all. The staff work very late hours and make sure everything is left the same for the next day. There is no need to reserve a chair on the beach or pool. Although the resort was fully booked, 700 guests, you never even noticed it was full. Many people went on excursions or left the resort to go shopping or walk around. The location of Allegro is ideal for walks and for tours. Everything is so accessible and near. The pool temperature was a bit chilly, but nothing stopped us form going in! The temperature of the ocean water was just right. It’s not your normal 90-100F water temperature, it was about 75-80F which was perfect. The beach is definitely the most attractive part of the resort. It is enormous! The change from the first visit to this second one is radical. If you like to collect seashells and even if you don’t, you will certainly find them and bring some back home to decorate your home or just simply stare at remember where you were not too long ago. Like I mentioned before, the resort was packed and they offered guest a deal. I thought it was but did not take the offer. The offer was to go to Allegro in Cozumel. You would leave Dec 25-and return Dec 26 or 27. The resort would pay for cab and ferry fees both ways. There would be no difference in hotel fees. They would have loved it if we had said yes, but it involved packing again and unpacking, that is why we said no. Otherwise, it would have been a good excursion on the resorts expense. The food was OK. It was not the best or worst, they had their good days and their BLAH days. They certainly out did themselves 3 times out of the 7 we stayed. Christmas Eve, Christmas Day and Dec 27th. They closed down the restaurants and served buffet style out in the open for all the guests. They had every dish you can imagine and it was never ending food from 6pm-10pm. We were amazed on how good everything was. The drinks were great! I don’t know why some people complain about the drinks being too weak. I saw enough drunk people at this resort that I am sure will agree with me in saying that the MOJITOS were awesome! Since this is my 4th visit to PDC, I feel comfortable and travel using the ADO bus. We went to Tulum (again) and Cancun. For those of you thinking about or not sure, DOIT. Traveling by public transportation is safe, cheap and comfortable! The ride to Tulum was $56 pesos one way and the entrance to the ruins was $51 pesos. The trip was under $15 usd per person. At the resort they were charging $40 usd per person, what a difference if you do it on your own. The ride to Cancun is even cheaper, $42 pesos one way. We went to the public beach, “El mirador”. As soon as you get off the ADO bus in Cancun, cross the street or ask where the R-1 bus stop is, it’s just across the street on the corner. Anyway, hop on the R-1 bus, pay $8 pesos (under$1 usd) and ask the driver to let you know when to get off. Enjoy the ride, the scenery and take in the culture! Once you get off at the beach stop, you will be glad you did it all, the view of the ocean blue is like no other. The beach is clean and has been upgraded. They have restrooms and some umbrella stands. The beach is free, this is where the locals and some tourist hang out. Go, I guarantee you will love it! As for the resort, I give it a 10+. My entire family and I would go back in a heartbeat. You can’t beat the location and staff. The rooms could use an update, and they will. I spoke to a few people that run the resort and they are aware that the rooms need an upgrade and that is exactly what will happen this year. The first thing they renovated was the BEACH, and boy did they do a good job. The grounds are fine so no worries in that dept. As for the view, just remember, no matter what resort you stay in, they all share the same beautiful beach. So if you don’t mind paying 5 star prices go for it, otherwise stay at the Allegro that is rated 3 stars and splurge a little more on the shopping and tours. In my eyes, the Allegro is not given the credit it deserves. BUT I can tell you that there are a lot of returned guests at this resort and that means a lot, more than any star rating in my opinion. I’m one of them! If anyone has a specific question or concern feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Playacar- Family Oriented, Great Location, Good Food!”
Reviews.Author: Commenting_88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. It’s not your typical hotel tower with rooms. Instead you get to stay in Mayan style hut. The room is just big enough for 4 people. It has a bar fridge with bottled water that is free. Your room has a safe, iron, ironing board, blowdryer, coffee maker, no alarm clock, tub/shower and approx 5 hangers. It’s definitely a Family oriented hotel. They have a kid zone for kids to play in. The service staff is extremely nice. It’s a good idea to tip! You get even better service and they service staff definitely deserve it! Do not exchange your money for pesos at the hotel. The rate is far too low. You are better off going to a ATM machine and taking out money (it will come out in pesos). US$ dollar is EVERYWHERE but pesos are preferred and the Canadian dollar is so close to the US$ (a 0.5 difference). Food is very good, lot’s of variety. Definitely book your à la cartes right when you check-in because one of the restaurants isn’t open every day! They do have 2 domestic beers (canned Budweiser was one of them). For people who drink wine forget having anything decent. The wine at the resort is (or must be) made locally from wine kits. It’s full of yeast and tastes horrible! I recommend going to Playa del Carmen which is 20 minutes away walking from the hotel to purchase a decent bottle of wine for 110 pesos. Evening entertainment isn’t too exciting, you are better off going to Playa del Carmen. I highly recommend the Coba Mayan Adventure Tour which is an all day tour. The women in charge of booking these tours are very knowledgeable but ask questions about the tours (what to wear, what to bring) because they are always busy and they do not always remember what to tell you. Overall, the hotel was great! I Give it 8/10. The only disappointing factor was the wine selection only because I’m a wine drinker!

Reviews.Title: “Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: preciouspebbs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled christmas day to mexico and stayed at the Allegro Dec 25th to Jan 1st. I was a bit nervous after reading all the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised at the location, the beach and even the hotel. The hotel is made up of about 25 small cabanas with 8 units each, 4 up and 4 down. My only complaint with the rooms is that there is no privacy as the walls are made of cinderblock and hollow and noise travels very easily between rooms and floors. Another couple we spoke to at the resort was in an upstairs room and said that the walls didnt go completely up to the roof, so that made it even more noisy. The room itself wasnt fancy, but it was clean and functionned well (except for the low water pressure and a grumpy toilet that didnt always want to flush :/ Our room had a kingsize bed ( a bit hard but ok), plus an old tv with one english channel and lousy reception, plus a bathroom and closet with a safe, two chairs and a coffee maker. The maid cleaned our room daily (mostly around 3pm ) and left 2 bottles of water each day. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is a 25 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen, which is a major shopping location that runs along 5th street for 28 blocks. There are shops full of tourist souveniers, cigar shops, diamond stores, silver jewellery, and a scattering of large and small cafes. There are even 2 mcdonalds and 2 subway restaurants and a wallmart store located up the road on 8th avenue. Playa Del Carmen is a gaited community and very safe. We had no problems walking either along the beach or on the sidewalks in the evenings though we were told not to walk to beach at night. Our hotel staff was great. The waiters in the breakfast buffet sang and joked with the guests, and always had a smile on their faces. The front desk staff were polite and a bit reserved, but if you engaged them in conversation they were happy to chat. There are two computers located in the little shop in the main lobby, surfing the net is 2 bucks for 9 minutes but beware the internet is slower than a turtle.... 9 minutes gave me time to check my email and say hola on facebook before it was done... My only complaint at this hotel would be the food quality and quantity. Having stayed at the RIU in Montego Bay last Christmas, there was no comparison. The food at the Allegro was boring, bland and the same every day. For breakfast there was a reasonably good spread of eggs, toast, fruit, some hot items like pancakes and french toast, and after a hint from another guest about the bacon, we asked for it only to have it produced from a back room... apparently the is a big secret.. so if you want bacon you have to ask for it LOL. Lunch was at the pool area.There was a pizza bar that made OK pizza, and a grill that made hamburgers, hotdogs, nachos and a variety of grilled fish and chicken. The Lunch buffet was located by the pool bar and served the same thing every day - a collection of cold pastas, a few salad items, and the spaghetti bar at one end where you could get spaghetti made with tomatoe sauce or alfredo sauce. We had spaghetti most days for lunch. Our last night at the Allegro was New Years Eve. The staff spent most of the day setting up a gala dinner on the beach despite the high north winds that plagued us for the last few days of our stay in Mexico. The spread of food that was put on was great. Shrimp at least 5 inches long, shishkabobs, grilled chicken, grilled pork, a huge variety of potatoes, noodles, salads, bread and of course all the drinks you could manage served to your table by the waiters and waitresses assigned to each section. There was even a show put on, but since we had to get up at 3 am to get ready for our return flight, we didnt see much of it before retiring to our room to pack and organize for our departure. Would I stay here again? probably not. Why? because of the food and the noise of the rooms. Was it good value for the money? yes I think so as this was an inclusive hotel so taking into consideration the flight to and from, the meals and the drinks, it was decent value for money. I would try to get a last minute deal and save as much as possible so you have some leftover money to travel to Playa Del Carmen to take in some of the excellent restaurants and save yourself the monotony of the food at the hotel. Lastly, the two theme restaurants at the hotel, the Mexican and the Italian were a huge disappointment. I rate this hotel at 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Xmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jo_fromontario
Reviews.Content: I suggested Christmas morning 09 to try a Xmas vacation in 2010 to avoid the stress-that was my first good choice, the second one was the Allegro Playacar. Myself, three adult sons and one girlfriend spent a sunfilled week at this resort from Dec 10-17th and have great memories. Just a note to single travellers, this resort had several and I wouldn't hesitate going to this resort on my own. The resort is somewhat dated but we all loved the fact it was a smaller resort; the staff was fabulous; the activities staff, Jaun, Angel & Moses couldn't have been more entertaining. Although I went to sit on my lounge chair for the entire week, they made you want to take part. Our maid Rebeca was fantastic as well, fresh sheets, always lots of supplies and extremely friendly. Staff always had a smile and a friend "Hola", bar staff was fantastic as well-my favorite drink for the week was a Cabana with no banana-fantastic! Each room has a hammock on their balcony/porch which is fantastic. I would highly recommend if possible getting a room right near the pool/Mexican restaurant-ours was 5403 with was a perfect location. Food was good as well, the buffets were somewhat bland the odd night, but the pasta bar was fantastic. We ate at both the Mexican and Italian which were exceptional. The pizza stand and burger/fries and nacho spot were great, always tons of food. Wine-you decide, I wasn't crazy about it. The grounds and beach were extremely well maintained. I walked to Playa del Carmen almost every morning along the beach, gorgeous walk and only 10-15 minutes. I would highly recommend a full body massage from Elizabeth at poolside and stop in and say Hola to Jorge along the walkway up to the dinner buffet. If I was the type of person to go back to the same resort, I wouldn't hesitate to visit the Allegro again-but my theory has alway been if you are lucky enough to get away, never go to the same place twice. Enjoy Jo & Family from Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “disappointing accommodation”
Reviews.Author: bradless
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute and arrived 5 days later to be offered an upgrade to the Grand Flamenco Xcaret as it was overbooked. We spent 4 nights at the Allegro, decided to be upgrade for a week to the Flamenco and returned for a further 3 nights at the Allegro. This suited us as we like to keep moving! One single lady we met had been before. She booked 10 months ago for a 4 week stay and was very upset and in tears at having to move for the first week. The Allegro had very disappointing accommodation. They looked lovely from the outside(small units with thatched roofs) but the interiors were VERY basic and in need of a refurb. The first room was near the pool and quite noisy with people walking by. The bathroom had nasty stained wall tiles, a broken washing line and an erratic shower. The second one was an improvement with a bathroom in better condition. Both rooms had faulty lights, which were quickly repaired. One small but annoying point was a shortage of power points so you could not have the TV, fridge and coffee maker all on at the same time. There were holes in the thatch which were easy for the mosquitoes to gain entrance, so make sure you take a plug-in. I could easily hear the neighbours through the walls especially one who had a 6.30am call every morning. Despite the stains, the rooms were immaculate and the hammock on the patio great fun. There was a large selection of food at the buffet, but after a week it all seemed much the same. I would not have liked to have eaten there for 2 weeks. There was only one restaurant to eat at for lunch. It became very crowded and the food not very inviting. What is it with this hotel--you could never get a spoon- they were like gold dust! On a positive note, the grounds were beautiful and very well maintained. The location was good. We walked into PDC twice (25 mins) once along the beach and once along the streets passing the aviary (22USD!) and some Mayan ruins. The town is bustling and has many tourist shops. The beach was lovely, but the red flag was flying almost every day. The staff were very obliging and friendly, always smiling and seemed pleased to help. We enjoyed the evening shows

Reviews.Title: “Very good for holiday”
Reviews.Author: Pavol14
Reviews.Content: When we came, we got horrible room, but next day we got room which we wanted. Very good bed - kingsize, no problem sleep. All areas of the hotel are very clean. Hotel is very good situated near the 5avenue, nice beach,sea. Good food. No problem walking around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and sent me to Xcaret”
Reviews.Author: esg727
Reviews.Content: Less than a week after making my reservation through Jet Blue's Getaways I arrived at the Allegro (12/5/2010) only to be told they had overbooked and were shipping me south to their Flamenco resort in Xcarat. They were barely apologetic but did offer me a free (120 pesos) taxi ride to Xcarat. That's it, nothing else. Take it or leave it. Don't get me wrong, the Flamenco was an excellent resort but I had made plans to be in Playa del Carmen and had already hooked up with a dive shop. So every day I had to taxi back and forth and was stuck in Xcaret where there's just big resorts and no town to Xplore. So far Jet Blue has offered me a $25 coupon that expires in a year and I spent more than double that on taxi's I was forced to take. Grumble, grumble...

Reviews.Title: “There is a lot to love about this resort”
Reviews.Author: blacktop_gypsy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a several resorts on the Mayan Riviera, including the Barcelo and Riu locations. The rooms may not be as large as others, but I love the funky grass roofed accommodations. The grounds are gorgeous, and the beach is to die for. It is only a short walk along the beach into town. No shortage of beach loungers, and you get bar service right on the beach!! The staff was great, especially Johaan at the front desk! We were never approached by the Club Allegro timeshare reps. The entertainment and food were on par for most all-inclusive resorts. The Italian and Mexican restaurants were very good. Night life is quiet at the resort, but only 5 minutes away by cab in Playa del Carmen. For the younger set, try the Blue Parrot, for great live rock music, the FAH bar on 5th Avenue. The activities staff were also great. Our fellow guests were friendly, and there was good participation in all activities, especially beach volleyball. The swim up bar does need to be refurbished, and yes, there are some tiles missing. There was a crew restoring the beach bar area while we were there. I have paid a lot more money for less than this resort offers. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “YIKES!!!! MY POOR OLD BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: Africanannie61
Reviews.Content: I have booked 5 trips through Apple vacations. This I think will be the last. The beds in the hotel were so hard that I had to take two Alieve pills just to go to bed at night! I have never ever slept in such an awful bed, and I even went to boarding school. The grounds were beautiful and for the most part the staff were good. Things were just not in the butffet restaurant. The food was horrible, in that you could not determine WHAT kind of animal had been cooked. The pork chops were cooked on the metal grill sheet with octopus, the two just do not go together! If you wanted anything other than cuppacinos you were ok, otherwise I was just plain ignored, so in the end, just went and ordered my own from the bar. The beach was amazing expect for the awufl Eastern European people who felt the need to honk their snot on the beach as they walk and once done smoking while in the ocean, kept throwing their lit cigarette ends right in the ocean where we were all swimming. I will not return to this resort. I will find a higher price point one, as there will be nicer people there who do not live like pigs and who have manners and understand the principle of standing in a line to wait for something.The apple driver forgot to pick us up for our flight out of Cancun, so we had to get a taxi after waiting half an hour, and of course he did not have any change for the only cash I had, $100.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Playatraveller
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Allegro Playacar -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- We just returned from a week at Allegro Playacar and really enjoyed our stay at this resort. The location is perfect - along the ocean within Playacar, a gated community right in Playa Del Carmen. The beach is beautiful with no rocks or weeds in the water. During the day you can walk on the beach all the way to 5th Avenue. A ten minute 5 dollar taxi ride from the resort takes you into town. We have been travelling to Playa for more than 10 years, stayed in hotels, condos and apartments and other all inclusive hotels. We found the cost of a week's all inclusive stay including flight at the Allegro to be a very good deal and are happy we picked this resort. We booked through Nolitours and the total cost for the week was less than we have paid for just airfare in the past. When we have stayed in Playa for months at a time, it has been more economical to rent an apartment. For a week or two family vacation, especially with children and teenagers, this resort is ideal. It is not a large resort and to us it is an ideal size to walk to the resort beach or to the restaurant with children or an older family member. There are connecting rooms for families who require them. There were a mixture of young couples, singles, teenagers, families and retirees at the resort when we were there. The young couples and single people tended to gather wherever the activities were during the day and appeared to be having a great time. Guests were from all over North America, Europe and South America. We were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful and well kept the grounds are and how nice we were treated by all the staff. The activities staff were friendly, professional and made sure everyone had a good time. Activities are offered all day, but there is no pressure to participate. Most daily activities were offered by the pool. People who did not wish to participate in the activities were happy sitting on the lounge chairs with a drink and snack socializing with other guests. Families with small children tended to use the large pool on the other side of the snack bar. The beach is beautiful and right next door to the 5 diamond Royal Hideaway Resort. The rooms are not luxurious, but are what the average 3 star hotel in Canada would be. Our housekeeper Lucy kept the room spotless and we have no complaints at all about the room. We loved the balcony with the hammock and table and chairs when we wanted to relax. The TV is outdated, but has the standard area Hotel Cable TV package. We spent very little time in our room, so that wasn't a problem for us. The evening entertainment was good and the theatre was full every evening. There was a half-hour mini-disco each evening at 9 in which children from the kids club were given an opportunity to perform on stage. Children we saw with the Kids Club staff were having a great time during the day and they were very excited when we heard them telling their parents what they did during the day. Breakfast consisted of pancakes, waffles, fresh omlettes, eggs, fresh fruit, fresh breads and pastries, toast and a hot breakfast buffet. Lunch at the Snack Bar consisted of a hot lunch buffet, soup, fresh pasta, hamburgers, hot dogs and fries in addition to the salad bar, a variety of different breads and pastries and desserts. Pizza was also served from noon until 6 was made fresh all afternoon. Evening buffets were good and there was a section where pork chops, chicken or fish was freshly grilled. There was a fresh pasta station, numerous hot dishes in the buffet section, desserts and serve yourself ice cream. There are two restaurants at the resort where you can order off the menu - the Mexican Restaurant and the Italian Restaurant. If you want to try an excellent authentic Mexican meal, take a 5 dollar taxi drive to El Fogon by Wallmart in the evening. There are always taxi's waiting at the bottom of the escalators in Wallmart to take you back to the resort. Or, take a walk down 5th Avenue and catch a taxi by the Bus Station. At the bar in Allegro, order a "Banana Momma" drink and take it back to your balcony for a relaxing afternoon drink. If you want a high end resort with excellent al la carte meals and are prepared to pay a much higher price, we recommend The Royal Hideaway next door where we have had great food and excellent service. If you want a night life after the evening entertainment, take a 5 dollar taxi ride and head to 5th Avenue where all the action is - many night clubs, bars, etc. Taxis are always waiting outside the front door at the resort. We recommend the Allegro Playacar resort for its location, its beach, the beautiful clean grounds and the wonderful staff. Other guests we talked to really enjoyed their stay at this resort and plan on returning. We were not bothered at all by the time share people and assume it was because we did not go to their desk to accept their offer of a free gift.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sillygoose1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Allegro Playacar with 6 other friends. The rooms were better than I expected after reading reviews. The style was very charming and we loved the thatched vaulted roof. There was rain one day and it did not leak at all. There was a musty smell in the room which was expected because this is Mexico and it is so humid. We had issues getting warm water for showers and our tub leaked on the floor. That said, we did not spend a lot of time in the room. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and were well maintained. The staff was very friendly, despite many reviews that said otherwise. We had no problems at all and our waiters were all extremely helpful and kept our beer galsses full. (we tipped them very well. they deserved it) The bartenders at the pool bar were slightly less friendly but they spoke less English and were very busy most of the time. The beach was fantastic and swimming in the ocean was awesome. The pool was fun but the constant techno music was very tiresome (catering to the Europeans, I assume). We went to almost all the shows at night, which were a lot of fun. The dancers were very good and the audience participations shows were hilarious. The disco was ok. It had a very funky odor in there and it was very hot. We ate most of our meals at the resort. We really enjoyed the buffet although most of the food was lacking flavor. The Mexican buffet was the best and the variety was huge. We ate at both the Mexican and Italian restaraunts which were both excellent. The drinks were always very good. I highly recommend the Miami Vice. Soo tasty. Overall, we had a very good experience. Most of the other guests were European and not very friendly. I'm not sure I would stay again but I don't regret choosing this place. For the value, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Well I've been back for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: lennyh3244
Reviews.Content: It tends to be people with a bad experience who are more motivated to write reviews. Having stayed here in 2007 & had great time, we returned. I checked recent reviews & was a little apprehensive, but, once again, we had great time...so thought I'd give a good review!!! Best part is the location. Some of these resorts can be isolated. I love the fact that town's just a 20 min walk along beach or a $5 taxi (set rate). Someone has said they didn't go because they thought it might be dangerous. Don't worry! 5th Avenue is main drag with all shops bars & restaurants. More on side streets & beach. Well worth a visit (or 2). Some will try to get you in there shop, but they aren't persistent, & can be quite amusing ("come & let me sell you some rubbish"). In 2007 the beach had been washed away by hurricane. That has been replaced & it's back to it's former self. The grounds are also very well kept. I thought the variety of the food was pretty good. Lunch buffet by pool area - always the fresh pasta option, bbq area where there are always freshly cooked burgers/hot dogs & daily specials, salads & enough choice surely!!! And there's the fall back option of the pizza bar from 10 - 6 daily. Evening buffet theme varied, again always the pasta on offer & something being cooked fresh as well as the rest of the buffet. Agreed - the wine isn't great. We caught the evening show a couple of times, which was quite fun. But there wasn't alot going on at night, just people sitting around by various bars having a few drinks. It's a quiet time of year, but then if you want something livelier - town's a 5 min taxi with plenty going on. I found the staff very helpful & friendly, from the ground staff, cleaners, maids to the bar staff, waiters & entertainment. Most spoke English - or enough for whatever their job was! I was told by the staff that the hotel is being refurbed next year. Probably about time. The rooms are starting to look a little tired. The TV is poor quality - but I don't go on holiday to sit & watch tv so not a huge issue. The shower always had hot water & the air con worked. Some of the trips they push can be done alot cheaper if you do them yourself. We took a 60 peso collectivo (taxi) to Akumal, & paid 15$ each to hire boat with our own guide & hire snorkelling equipment to see reef & see turtles & stingrays. I think they wanted about 50$ each at hotel to do it (with atvs included). Tulum can also be easily reached by collectivo & a 5$ entry instead of Hotels charges. But we did a couple of good trips through the hotel as well - Xplor was a good fun day. Someone from States complained about the Europeans behaviour on here which made me chuckle.
