There was a broad range represented from USA, Canada, Mexico & most of Europe. I'm not going to go into stereotyping, but people in glass houses shouldn't throw stones (don't know how that English saying translates to anyone else!). Everyone I saw got on together. And Europe covers alot of different cultures. Don't lump us all in together! It's not a 5*luxury hotel, but it is very good for a relaxing break in a great location at a reasonable price. And we'll probably be back again...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for sun and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Misskitty_JL
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was worried that the vacation I just booked would be a disaster. But, I went with an open mind and was pleasantly surprised. I went with a couple of girlfriends for a relaxing getaway. We wanted to stay at a villa-like resort, not a big hotel and were willing to give up a few conveniences for some character and culture. Maybe the time of year people go makes a big difference, I would definitely recommend traveling in October as there was little crowd and the weather was wonderful with the exception of a few short rainstorms. The beach was amazing, perfect white sand and turquoise water. Some of the chairs were a bit weathered, but it wasn't a big deal. The pools could use some updating, there were a few missing tiles and chipped/peeling paint on the ledge, but it wasn't dirty. We were approached a few times by the entertainment staff to particpate in activities or take a tour, but it wasn't excessive and they just took 'no thanks' for an answer and moved along. The room was small and a little outdated, but very clean and fine for what we were looking for. The air conditioning worked fine, though the first night it was a little stuffy and I can imagine a summer stay might put a strain on the system. We were upgraded to an ocean front room, and it was just great...5703...right on the beach, close to the pool, but private. It was on the first floor, I don't know what the second floor rooms are like. The food was pretty good. Mostly the same things on the buffet every day, no matter what the theme for the meal was. The egg station was very good, and the pasta bar was always an option. The restaurants were ok, but the service was average and there were a lot more choices at the buffet. We weren't going for a gourmet food experience, and survived just fine on tacos, chips and guacamole. Not many options for vegetarians, but rice and beans were always available. As with most all-inclusive resorts, the drinks were weak and the bartenders were busy. Lots of fruity frozen stuff with plenty of calories and not much liquor, even when we tipped. Corona was on tap. The wine was really inconsistant. A few times the house red was really good, other nights it was just drinkable. I'm no wine snob, but it was fine by me. The alcohol situation would probably be my biggest complaint. Not that we were planning a Spring Break-like drunken vacation, but we did think we would be able to get a little tipsy. The service was good, everyone was friendly. Most people spoke some English and my Spanglish kept us going. There were very few American guests. Lots of Canadians and Italians. It didn't bother me, after all we were trying to get away from it all! But, the speedos, topless sunbathers and smoking were a bit distracting. The indoor places were non-smoking, but it was hard to avoid it outdoors. At least the staff kept the ashtrays clean for the most part. We were on a budget and didn't go on any excursions. But, we did splurge on a massage. It was fine, $70 US for 65 minutes...not a deal but better than the price at home. If I had it to do over I probably would've spent the money on zip-lining since I had plenty of time to relax the rest of the trip and could've used some more adventure. We weren't big on nightlife either. We went to the show in the theater after dinner each night and found it entertaining. There were groups going into town to the big clubs each night for $15 you would get transportation, cover charge and drinks. Seemed like a good deal if you were looking for that kind of thing. The disco at the resort was basically empty...but the whole place was pretty quiet while we were there...mostly couples (young and older) and a few small groups. The only other thing I remembered from the other reviews was the complaint about town being so far away. We decided not to go into town because our family and friends were worried about crime and we really didn't want to spend extra money. But, there was a mini shopping area just across the street from the resort that had plenty of carts and little stores with the souveniers you would expect. So, I have no idea how long of a walk it is. The ride from the airport was longer than we expected. About 1.5 hours with construction and traffic. I think the hotel website said 40 minutes... Last but not least...we made the vacation plans through Apple Vacations and were happy with all of the arrangements. Their representative was nice and not too pushy about adding extras. Everything went smoothly and we were happy with the service. I know this is a long review, but I think some of the negative comments from others are a little unfair and picky. Like I said, maybe the peak season is different. If you want a luxury vacation this isn't it, but it was definitley not a dive or the 'worst vacation ever'. I've been to the Mayan Riviera a couple times and stayed in nicer places but this was just what we were looking for and I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Pilier3
Reviews.Content: The hotal was a surprise, it's not a highrise style building, the main frint building simply contains the reception and upstairs, the main restaraunt and a bar. The rest of the hotel is spread out arund the grounds as individual four up four down thatched roof blocks. Different to the usual hotel. On arriving booking-in was efficient, quick and we received a nice fresh papaya fruit drink in welcome. Our room was always clean, we had no problems with shower or toilet. The room looked a bit small but with the patio/balcony (with it's hammock) the overall footprint was the same as a standard hotel room. We felt it was better than a standard hotel room with no balcony so were pleased with it The buffet breakfast and dinners were very nice. Lots of fresh fish served at lunch and dinner which was great. We saw the occasional coypu wandering about the grounds. The pools were genarally clean. The beach was fantastic. The ocean was a dream, the aspect of water changed from day to day as waves grew, and diminished, from white horses crashing onto the beach to flat calm clear water. Although difficult to see, fish of all sizes were everywhere around the shoreline. The cocktail bar at the pool/beach was good, served a decent Mojito and if the mint was scarce then a Caipirinha was quickly offered. Generally the cocktails were good. The animation team were friendly, enquiring but not intrusive and they worked really hard! The watersports and voyage team down at the beach were very good, I'd happily recommend them for snorkelling and scuba; their set up at the hotel next door (Occidental Royal Hideway) is impressive too. Go snorkelling for free down at the southern end of the beach but take water with you, it's only a mile but it's hot on the way back. Walk up the beach to Playa de Carmen, hop on the ferry to Cozumel and go snorkelling or diving there too. Go to the square opposite the ferry terminal in Cozumel it's pretty and really neat. Great holiday, we could easily have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely holiday in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: seattle3052
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews we were a bit nervous of this holiday. Our doubts were totally unfounded. The place was lovely and the only two small criticisms were not enough shade from the sun on the beach and althought there should have been entertainment by way of shows for the two weeks it was repeated on the second week. These areminor faults and the shows were very good. I can recommend this as a lovaly holiday with friendly and good services.

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: 1234gilps
Reviews.Content: I honestly dont know what people expect from their holidays I was seriously worried when reading the past reviews from this hotel. I went with an open mind and was pleasantly suprised.Firstly after a huge downpour on arrival yes the rooms did smell a little musty due to thatch roof.After sun dried it out it was fine. The grounds are immaculatley kept.Staff are polite helpful and friendly.Food and drinks are plentiful and lots of choice (i sometimes wonder what the people that complain eat at home (caviar ?) The views are unbeatable. ok i agree rooms could do with updating but i dont go on holiday to sit in my room if you are planning on going here have no fears youll have a great time Remember some people havnt had a good time unless theyve got something to complain about

Reviews.Title: “Hey Americans! This is a European Playground. If you don't speak spanish, don't go.”
Reviews.Author: MadisonNicole
Reviews.Content: Ok, ok... the title is very true but, there are good things about this report as well. For instance, the food. The buffet was really, really tastey for breakfast and dinner. Lunch was always at the pool and the burger bar was delicious. The specialty restaurantsa re The Mexican and The Italian...both yummy and the service at those two restaurants was much better than in general at the resort. As far as nightlife, non-existent. There is a show at 9:30 every night but, really not much to do between dinner and then. The bar at the pool doesn't have any music and rarely had anyone at it. And the bar located in the dining area had the rudest bartenders and servers that surrounded it that you just felt like they didn't want you there. The resort claims to have a "disco" or something. This is a room the size of a decent sized family room that has a rancid odor...the best description I can think of is the outhouse at my grandparent's cottage with a hint of dead animal. It is a very unwelcoming place to be. So that being said, if you're interested in a resort that is relaxing and quiet after the sun goes down, this is the place. The beach is AWESOME. White sand and great swimming area. Downside - old european men in banana thongs. Yeah, I know you're all so free with your bodies but, some things are not pleasant to look at when trying to enjoy beautiful scenery. One of the things that stuck out in almost every situation we had was the rudeness of many of the staff. After an hour and a half shuttle from the airport (we were told it would be 45 minutes when we booked) and traveling since 4:30am, we tried checking in to our room. It wasn't ready yet. It would be about an hour wait. We headed to the buffet, it was closed. We sat in the lobby for an hour and approached the front desk again...another 20 minutes. Just then another traveller tries checking in and he's told his room will be ready in 2 hours. Check-in is supposed to be 3pm, by now it's going on 5. All the while the two women at the front desk are put off by us and the other traveler upset we couldn't get into our rooms. HOWEVER...there was one front desk employee who was very sweet and nothing like the hyenas when we checked in. Also, most of the staff act put out if they have to speak english. In fact, we had staff who would continue speaking spanish even when we told them we didn't understand what they were saying. At the bar in the dining area, my boyfriend endured two bartenders and serving staff speaking spanish and laughing at him after they gave hima shot of tequila. Finally he asked them if they were making fun of him and one of them told him yes because he was a gringo. Nice, huh? I also had a member of the staff tell me that I should learn the language when I visit their country again. I guess the $2K we spent vacationing in their country wasn't good enough. Lastly (and then I'm done with my rant), if you aren't a fan of Europeans DO NOT GO TO THIS RESORT. The ratio had to be 10 Europeans to every American. They will walk directly into you if you don't move to the side, they reach in front of you to get whatever they are interested in, they stand close enough to you to feel the hairs on your arms, and they stare like it's their job. On one occasion I stood to the side for a gentleman to walk past me so we didn't collide and he looked at me like I was a lunatic. Hey Europeans - a nice "excuse me" goes a long way when you absolutely have to be the first one to get a croissant! That's it, rant over. I am recommending this place though (after all that). Reason being, it is a beautiful 20 minute walk on the beach to Playa del Carmen, it's relaxing and quiet, good food, and very affordable. Just ignore the occasional blasting techno the europeans find so soothing while they relax and the rude staff and you are good.

Reviews.Title: “An under-appreciated gem.”
Reviews.Author: melindamccrady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned this morning from two weeks in Playa del Carmen with another couple. We stayed at the Allegro Playacar in spite of the very mixed reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites. Naturally, we were a little skeptical but we scored a great deal and went for it. Well, we are certainly glad we did! Yes, the hotel rooms need some updating. Ours was upstairs with a king-size bed and a fantastic view of the beach, the pool, and the gorgeous blue sea. The bed was a bit hard, the tv only had a few channels, and the sink dripped. The bathroom tile would have benefitted from a good mason. OK. But it was clean, airy, and the housekeeper was terrific. Our air conditioner and fan worked perfectly, despite all the negative comments we heard. The grounds and the beach are beautiful. Simply gorgeous. The staff was fun, attentive, and professional. Starting with the check-in, our experience was great with the whole staff. I really don't understand what people have been complaining about, frankly. The food at the buffet was pretty good, overall, although I did get a bit bored with it after awhile. But the Mexican and Italian restaurants are simply fabulous, the Mexican fiestas on Friday night were delicious, and the snack bar and pizzaria were great. There is no shortage of food at any time, that's for sure. The drinks were plentiful and available pretty much all the time. The pool area was being worked on while we were there, and it looks great. The landscaping is wonderful, the beach is clean and wide and there were activities going on all the time for those interested. On the other hand, there is a quiet pool for those of us who want to lay in the sun and read a book. Overall, we thought the Allegro was a great find. It may not actually be a five-star resort, but it is comfortable, clean, friendly, and reasonably-priced. We made good friends there and will return. One addition: the last two days of our trip were seriously threatened by Hurricane Paula. We escaped being hit directly, but I cannot say enough about the way the staff helped prepare, just in case. We were offered (and accepted) a room further from the beach for our safety. Everything that could possibly be blown around was picked up and tied down. Trees were trimmed and coconuts removed. Again, all this was done without alarming or over-sensationalizing the situation. Very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, but not the best food”
Reviews.Author: leash_44
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Cancun and we definitely enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect and close to everything. The pools were fabulous and the entertainment staff were great! The only downside was the food. My boyfriend and I ended up popping pepto bismol everyday. Other than that, the service was pretty good and the rooms were just what we expected: nice, but nothing fancy. (If you are planning on doing any tours...Mexico Blue Dream was amazing!!!)

Reviews.Title: “WORST VACATION EVER....”
Reviews.Author: MarlboroMom22
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is, **The Allegro Playacar ** was our worst nightmare. As a Travel Agent I have to tell you do not stay @ this property...I'll not even attempt to sell this property to my clients. The front desk people were very rude, ignored you every time we had a complaint, the food was the worst, , always the same thing, there was one night that our 8yr. son went to bed without eating nothing that he really liked. The Italian restaurant had no service at all. The wine they served @ dinner was so bad....you have to buy your own wine if you want to drink a nice glass of wine.... The pool was dirty....the swim-up bar the tile was old & dirty always with dead bugs around...Had a few problems with our safe deposit box, called the front desk it took them forever to fix the problem....the rooms are very small, no place for storage... Time share people always trying to sell you something.... Please don't stay here....It's just makes me sick to talk about it and lost a week vacation staying @ this horrible resort. DO NOT STAY HERE..... ***My advise to the Occidental Group is put this property down & extended the Royal Hideaway, with beautiful villas ,****

Reviews.Title: “Good shows”
Reviews.Author: mcfly747
Reviews.Content: Good shows (nightly), staff, and food. The beach was still under repair from the hurricane so that sucked. We had to cab into Playa del Carmen to swim in the ocean.They have fun games everyday ex:drinking contests, horseshoes, ping pong tournament, etc. Overall this place is really good. I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “lovely grounds, friendly staff, accomodation poor!”
Reviews.Author: mel5
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an 8 night stay at the Allegro, We were quite concerned as what to expect after reading the reviews on trip advisor. On arrival we checked in without any problems, we did however request a second floor room . However after reading some of the reviews about the thatched roofs leaking we didnt bother to complain when we were allocated a room on the ground floor. We arrived when it was dark and my initial thought when we first enetered the room was oh my goodness i`m not going to like staying here. The room was quite small, dated and quite depressing. We decided to give it a couple of days before moving hotels. The hotel grounds are very well kept, its in a perfect location near the beach, two nice size swimming pools with plenty of sun beds. The swim up bar was in the pool where most of the activities took place, we preferred the quieter pool, we never had a problem finding a sun bed. The staff were always friendly, the food was fine plenty of choice, pizzeria open from 11am till 6pm each day, burgers, french fries, pasta , salad etc. The hotel also catered for mexican food which is fine as there were lots of mexicans staying there and we were in mexico! We did tend to warm to this hotel even though we hated the room, its in desperate need of a makeover. We had connecting doors through to the next room which is great if you need them but we found we could hear the poeple in the next room talking as clear as if they were in the same room! The tv was old and the picture very poor not that I was that bothered as I dont go on holiday to watch tv. From the outside they looked so nice with the thatched roofs, and i liked the hammocks that each room had on the terrace/balcony. We did make the most of our stay had a nice relaxing holiday, we would not return to this hotel because of the accomodation. I feel so sorry for the staff they work so hard, so come on management get your act together and update your rooms before you start to loose bookings!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst resort my friends and family have ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: newlywedjuly2010
Reviews.Content: May i just explain what happened to us there? My family and friends went to this resort for our wedding. My fiance (at that time) and i have little children who came with us. Our group were suppose to be together including our children having rooms next to us (adjoining rms) ----The resort separated every single one of us, with our LITTLE children SIX buildings away from us! Need i say more?

Reviews.Title: “its ACCIDENTAL Allegro... NO Air conditioning only in your room!!!”
Reviews.Author: cutetoes
Reviews.Content: Hello! I am writing a review about our stay at Allegro playacar because I believe people should have a CLEAR idea what they are getting themselves into before booking. Overall my stay was ok, the beach made up for all the encounters and upsetting moments I endured during my stay. For starters, The hotel is NOT, I repeat IS NOT within a 5 minute walk to the main avenue ( Quinta avenida (5th and 2cd) Its more like a 25 minute walk. The cab gets there in less then 5 minutes and charges you 50 pesos. These last week the weather was EXTREMELY Hot and very very HUMID, I live in Canada, and have travel to several different countries and have stayed in tropical resorts too. All the resorts or hotels that I have been in and were a 4 star hotel had the basics of AIR CONDITIONING in the main lobby and where the breakfast/lunch and dinner are served. This hotel does not meet a 4 star rating, by far!!! The food was plain, repetative and super hot. (since there was no air conditioning) one was hot, humid, sweaty and trying to eat food was a total turn off. Most of the time the staff seemed agitated or upset, I assumed it was because of the heat. Most of the servers we would have to flag down to get a simple glass of water. Our best server was Manuel, ( he was only around for dinner time) We had 2 choices of a la carte and I was so SHOCKED!!! In the Italian a la carte we decided to have a ceaser salad as a starter. Low and behold we were served 2 lettuce leafs ( yes, whole lettuce leafs) with some creamy sauce and a slice of panini bread that had been toasted ( I guess this was their version of croutons??) and to top it off there was an achovy in the centre of the bread. I was DISGUSTED. (no offense to the people out there that may have liked this) Took over 30 minutes to get someone to help us open our safety box. I called twice once I was put on hold for over 5 minutes and then they hung up on me. I called back and again they put me on hold ( another rep) I got tiered of waiting and then I hang up. We had no water in our lil fridge and 1 day noone came to clean our room ( not good) The only place one can escape from the HUMIDITY and heat is to run to your room and cool of there with your air conditioning. It would def be nice to have another place aside from your bedroom to go sit in and feel so kind of heat relief. The snack bar was just burgers and fries ( although I heard there were fries I never did manage to eat any cause there was never enough!!!!!) The pizza was tasty. It would have been tastier if the food wasnt boiling hot (since it was just sitting outside). I decieded to have strawberry daquiris to cool off. I noticed there was either too much ICE and it didnt taste right or it was too sweet and didnt taste anything like the drink. my partner order a long Island Ice tea and it was just PURE alcohol. Just gross. There were NO straws with any drinks they either said they had ran out, then I heard that it was an ECO hotel and so and so. Surprisingly enough when they tried to sell us a "vacation VIP" pacakage they gave me a coke with a straw. So I guess all the straws go to the VIP guests! ( SUCKS) BEWARE of eating the food outside on Mexican Night, My partner and I ( and other guest) encounter food poisioning!!!! I guess it was exposed to heat for too long. In the bedroom there were a bunch of tiny tiny lil ants. Be careful to leave open suitcases or any snacks around. The hotel def needs a FACELIFT if it wants to come close to a 4 star. maybe tell their workers to be a little nicer and offer them some AC so they arent so misarble when serrving guest. Overall our stay was just ok. Like I said previouslly the only thing good was the beach. who go. Remember NO Air Conditioning anywhere but the 1 a la carte restaurant and YOUR bedroom!!! Lastly the night life SUCKED!!!! nothing to do. The show ends around 10pm. their "disco" is about the size of my living room with a pool table. the hotel offers to take you to town to some discos in town for 50 US dollars per person!!! Coco bongo... mmmm.... $50 dollars each??? I felt it was TOO steep!! Hope all this info helps!! and good luck to you all

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to visit if your into camping in hell.”
Reviews.Author: Drockwell73
Reviews.Content: We checked into our room and instantly called to try and change rooms due to no air in the room. It was hotter inside the room than outside. The bed was actually damp due to the humidity and the guy at the front desk sent a kid with a screw driver and ladder up to "fix" the ac unit. After looking at the unit and adjusting the vent for 5 minutes he told us the room would cool off after 20 minutes. We went a got some food and came back and the room was just as hot. We called the front desk and we're told we would get a call back and they would see what they could do. No call back and we decided to have a few drinks and just sleep through it but it was so hot we laid in a bed of sweet and couldn't sleep. The upper rooms have no air due to the straw roof and gaps in the ceiling that you can actually see outside, good luck if it rains! Now the AC was our main issue but the other negatives: 1. We checked in at 4pm and we're told it was too late to make reservations at the sit down dinner so we got to eat at the buffet which was nasty to say the least. 2. TV remote didn't work and they only had a few channels. 3. Beds we're hard as a rock. 4.Requested wake up call and never received one, there are no alarm clocks either. 5.Poor service from front desk. 6.Very dated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for. If you are a Diver, stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: CLazanich
Reviews.Content: Food is mediocre at best. The only good food was in "The Mexican". The buffet lacked imagination and flavor. It was very difficult for our vegetarian to find even rice dishes that did not have meat in them. Staff really does not care about your well being. Most requests were met with attitude and rarely a smile. They had my sons name down incorrectly and even when I told them it was wrong, he continued to get notes addressed to Carmen. We reserved one room with two beds for our sons and they were given a room with one king bed. The staff acted quite put out that two teenagers would not want to sleep in the same bed. They finally brought a twin bed up to their room for the night and did switch them the next day. We chose this resort because they were supposed to have an onsite dive operation - 4 boats leaving at various times during the day. I am SO glad we did not book our trip inclusive of the diving because this resort DOES NOT HAVE A DIVE SHOP. Or so we were told by the front desk staff. We were told to contact the Tour Desk. We did and we booked a dive through an "in town" dive shop. The Tour Desk charged us $70 per person inclusive of a $5 taxi ride each way. At the dive shop, the trip was listed as costing $55. DO NOT USE THE TOUR DESK for diving. Later, we discovered that there is actually an onsite dive concession - Barracuda. However, they do not actually have a boat at the resort and you would need to get to their dive shop elsewhere - also the boats do not leave 4 times a day. You can only get on a 2 tank boat in the morning. Our first room did not have working air conditioning. Our second room had air but it was loud and rattled. In fact, besides your room, the only air conditioned area is "The Italian", one of the reservation only restaurants. This resort REALLY needs a place where guests can gather that has air conditioning. We ended up congregating in each other's rooms because it was the only place to escape the heat. Most of our party of 16 got some form of "Montezuma's Revenge" leading us to conclude not all the water is filtered. The resort does provide bottled water in the room each day. You are not supposed to put paper in the toilets and some reviewers have commented on this - rest assured this is common practice almost everywhere else we visited including Xel-Ha, every public bathroom, dive shops and restaurants in both Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. The sanitation systems in this area do not handle paper of any kind. The beds were hard as the concrete platforms that the mattresses are on. They did put a layer of egg crate foam on top of the mattress but it did not really help. The maid washed out our glasses and coffee cups each day and put them back in the room. I watched her clean the room one day and she did not bring any cleaning solutions into the room so I am not sure how she actually "cleaned" the glasses and cups. The upper floors all have the thatch roof and are vaulted. There are NO DRAWERS in the room, only some shelves - see photo. For me, one of the benefits of staying at the same resort for an entire week is the ability to unpack and stay awhile. We had to live out of our suitcase the entire time. The grounds are beautiful. Pools and bars close at 10 or 10:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: redpoppa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Allegro Cozumel in 2009, this hotel is basically an exact copy of that one, but with a lot better and new Playa del Carmen Plumbing. (When I stayed in Allegro Cozumel the sinks and showers shot dirt out) Staff - 5 stars always helpful and very nice, completely polite other than the beach probably the best asset. We asked one of them how much they make and they said $6 a day, they break their backs all day to make the people happy and we only saw two other people give them a tip. Grounds - 4 stars everything was very nice clean, pretty, tons of vegetation Rooms - 2 stars Beds are hard, A/C is minimal on the top floor if you like it cold request 1st floor room Activities - 3.5 stars Shows every night and tons of activities planned throughout the days Food - 4 stars, the Italian restaurant is awesome! it would be at least $100 for two people for a meal like that in the states, the buffet is good. After 7 days of the same food anyone would get bored but the food is delicious. fish and seafood is primary, but they have pasta bar, sandwich, and omelet bar. Drinks - 3.5 stars always about 3-6 people in line for drinks at the beach had to wait but the drinks tasted great! Beach - 4 stars this resort is right next door to the Royal Hideaway which is $600 per night We declined their VIP member pitch So on the last night they upgraded us to the Occidental Grand Flamenco Xcarte which was much newer and nicer than this hotel but overwhelming. Basically it was the Gaylord Texan (or any Gaylord hotel) in Mexico, but the Allegro is like Days in or Hampton. But we like the Allegro better it had a better beach and was a lot more quaint , romantic, and chill. We booked our room for $123 a night so at that Price I would stay at either Allegro anytime at the drop of a hat. Now I wouldn't pay over $200 a night I don't think it's worth that much. We also went Scuba diving at Chankanaab its great for beginners, if you go, go to the second hut (second of 4)and ask for Eduardo he's a master diver and give a great beginners lesson. It was my wife's first time and she loved it she was scared at first but thoroughly enjoyed it. It was $50 for us per person, but we had to take the ferry over to Cozumel ($25 round trip) and taxis too and fro so about $200 for the day.

Reviews.Title: “needs some serious updating”
Reviews.Author: 5Kimba5
Reviews.Content: My biggest concern with this resort was that we had a room with working air conditioning after reading the prior reviews. We did luck out in that respect and while not icy cold, good enough for us to cool off and get to sleep. Be sure to get a bottom floor room! Good: Grounds are well manicured, beach and pool areas keep fairly clean, food was so-so, Italian restaurant was very nice, clean towels and sheets everyday. Cute towel animals for about half of the week. Wait staff was friendly and brought drinks in a timely manner. Safe was not working at first, but they promptly fixed it. Bottled water supplied each day and we requested more and that was given without any hassle. Bad: Greasy handprint on the full length mirror in the closet (not mine) and was never cleaned off my entire stay. Bathtub and sink look extremely old, cracked dirty and patched. May have been as clean as they could get it taken the current condition. Toilet was patched and leaked slightly at the hose conncection. I traveled with a group of 16 who had a variety of problems, but the biggest was that the top floor rooms all had thatch roofs that you could see sunlight through - this made it a tough job for the air conditioner - if you were lucky enough to have one that worked. One of our group had a bat come in and fall in her pillow early in the morning - needless to say she changed rooms to a bottom floor, then had enough and left the hotel completely. The top floor rooms all had a musty smell. This disco also had a thatch roof was an extremely musty smell - so bad I only stayed in there about 10 minutes. Truly the thatch roofs should be for appearance only - they don't keep the rain out and they are a health hazard with respects to mold! I came to dive and was told that there was a dive center at the resort (there was not) so that was disappointing and we had to find an alternative. I really don't care about frills so much as that was not my purpose here, but this place really needs an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: AllisonF3
Reviews.Content: this resort was outstanding! the service was incredible, and the entertainment at the pool was so fun. if you're young and looking for a fun night life experience the staff at the pool will take you to the best clubs around like coco bongo. amazing experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay there”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a day 8day trip. I enjoyed everything expect for the resort. Hotel needs to be remodeled and get better chef's. It is an old place. The food was bad. On most days you would see leftovers. After my third trip back to cancun, i am planning to not go back. This was very disappointing for me. All other places i have stayed were much better. There only good thing about it was located at a private secured location. That only residents and hotel guests are aloud. It was about 15 mins walk to playa del carmen. For this trip we did not book tours. We mostly use the bus ADO busline to visit new places we have never been before. Such as Belice, tulum, coba,X-caret and cenotes. A way to safe money. The bus will take you the nearest city to belice in mexico and just take the taxi to the border and walk through.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: bschatzel
Reviews.Content: The beach is amazing. Landscaping, food, and service are very good. The rooms are pretty bad. Quirky shower, hard beds, scratchy sheets. It was strange because everything else at the resort was very well done.

Reviews.Title: “worst resort in the world”
Reviews.Author: vickibud
Reviews.Content: if u want to throw ur money away..this is the place to go....we were told nothing but lies from the minute we arrived . after sitting in the dirty room at 145...am watching a repair man try....to repair the ac...i called my travel agent an got out of that dump as quick as possible....we moved a few resorts away..to the sandos.....omg....it was wonderfull....the allegro playacar room..was so bad that the shower handle came off in ur hand...the leak in the ceiling ledt an inch of water on the floor ..u couldnt use the blowdryer or u would get electricuted...the bathtub had so much mold an mildew...why shower???the pool was old an un maintained....and the mangement was the pitts......everything was broken...copy machine...room key machine...ac....etc...etc.....dont stay here.......

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars all the way...”
Reviews.Author: steelhdr80
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews after we had already booked the trip, and honestly went there with an open mind and had an idea of what to expect. That said, there were still a few things that managed to bother us a little bit. Rooms - No joke when people say "rustic". Its a very basic, standard room with either a king or 2 doubles and really need to be updated. The A/C in our room worked for the most part and kept the room cooler than the outside temp... the ceiling fan helped a little. There were 2 leaks in the bathroom area right above the sink and after calling the front desk a few times, they sent someone down to fix it. I am not a handy-man by any means, but even a 5 year old child could tell that the guy had no clue what he was doing... needless to say it kept dripping. somehow though, on the 4th of the trip, the drip was fixed. I guess they finally got the hint when we kept using their clean bath towels to wipe the floor with our muddy shoes. The tub also drained poorly, but that too was fixed the same day as our leaky ceiling. Beware - even though our bed was a king, it was pretty much designed for people under 5'10". I am 6'1" and had my feet hanging off the edge. Regardless... we took in stride, since all we did was use the room to sleep and shower. It could have been worse. Food/Drink - Read all kinds of horror stories about the food, but we found the buffet and both the Italian and Mexican restaurants to be pretty decent. The buffet food was pretty good with a good mix of food every night. The theme restaurants were also fairly good. Alcohol was watered down, but since it was included, it's quite easy to get drunk if that's your goal. Staff - Front desk people were Ok, but definitely in no rush to help you out. Maids, waiters, bartenders on the other hand would bend over backwards to help you in any way they could. Time-share people got a hold of us on our first day, but after saying no once was enough for them... we weren't bothered again. Ammenities/Activities - We didn't really take part in any group activities at the resort, but it seemed like the staff would always have something planned by the pools every hour. We did get an hour long massage for about $70/person which was not bad. Sorry, but don't have much else to share for this. Guests - Seemed like the majority of the other guests were European or Canadian, and very few Americans. I am an American, and I hate to say it, but the lack of Americans was actually a nice change. Didn't have to deal with too many obnoxious and loud folks acting like they own the place, or complaining and whining about every little thing. Met a few real nice couples who were there to just relax and unwind. Playa del Carmen - The town is very close to the resort (a very short 10-15 minute walk or you can take a taxi for about $4). 5th Avenue, which is the main drag, was nice and pretty much lined with restaurants and shops. Plenty of Souvenir shops around, so take a look around before you buy something... chances are that you will pay less money if you walk a few stores down. The Ferry to Cozumel is nice (approx $11 one way), but it does get packed, so be sure to get there at least 30 minutes before your departure time. Cab drivers were pleasant and fluent in English. We wanted to immerse ourselves in the culture and found the people to be very helpful. There are a lot of small "hole in the wall" restaurants that I would recommend over any of the more popular restaurants on the 5th ave strip. Do yourself a favor and take the time to walk around town... The Mexico you read and hear about in the media, does not exist where we were... not saying there aren't some sketchy places, but we never felt out of place or threatened. Surrounding Area - Tulum and Chichen Itza are definite must do's. We have traveled the world and taken in some really cool places, but this definitely blew my mind. If you plan on going, check out InfoCenter tours (they have a store front on 5th avenue). We paid $49/person that included transportation (they picked us up at our hotel), tickets/guided tour of Chichen, lunch, a stop at the Ik Kil Cenote, and a stop over at an old Catholic church (circa 15th century)... pretty cool. This is an entire day activity, so don't plan anything else on the day you go. Lots of other stuff to do around the area, all within a 15-20 minute drive from the resort. All in all, our trip was great, minus the few negatives at the resort. Go with an open mind, read the reviews, but formulate your opinions. If you want a 5 star resort, this is definitely not your place. If you have an open mind and can look past a few minor nuisances, then you will enjoy yourself. There are a lot of other great resorts surrounding in the area... some around the same price and quality and some that will blow Allegro out of the water. Do yourself a favor though.... go explore the area and don't spend all your time in the resort...where ever you end up staying. This place and the people are amazing! We are already booked on our next trip in May... but going to check out a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: MikeRamsey
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to more that 30 countries, including India and I have NEVER stayed in such a terrible place before! Do not stay there even if the hotel pays you to stay there! The rooms are tiny, dirty and the roof leaks. My wife got shocked by the hair dryer, my sons suitcase stuck to the floor because it was freshly painted and they didnt bother to tell us. The food is so bad that I wouldnt give it to my dog. the all inclusive alcohol is just garbage. It is generic and watered down, no lie! The hotel staff do not care about you or anything else. Dont be fooled by the virtual tour of the resort like I did. The pools are dirty, crouded and stink. The only thing the staff care about is selling you a time share for that hell hole. My family and I were ready to go home on the first day and had to live thru the nightmare for the next six nights. Please learn from our experience, dont think that it cant be that bad, because it is and worse!

Reviews.Title: “The truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth.”
Reviews.Author: footzzDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: I’m not going to tell you not to stay here, but I’m going to give you an objective review of our experiences the week of June 28th until July 5th. FYI: We are a pretty well traveled couple in our mid 50’s who have been to numerous resorts in Mexico. We have also been to the Allegro Playacar 8 years ago. Believe what the most recent reviewers have to say. Your money will be best spent elsewhere. First off this “resort” is over 40 years old and shows signs of its age. The grounds are very nice, but the condition of the buildings and their infrastructure is dreadful. We had to change rooms 3 times before we got one that had a properly functioning air conditioner. After 2 days of nothing but excuses we told the front desk staff (pleasantly but firmly) to either find us a room that had a working a/c or send us to a hotel that did. Amazingly, they immediately came up with two keys and had two rooms to show us that actually had working air conditioning. After speaking with numerous other guests, it seems that the hotel staff plays a form of musical chairs with the rooms that have working air conditioning. The people that complain the most get the rooms that are cool. This isn’t my idea of a relaxing vacation. The staff is great (especially considering what they have to work with) but the food is below average and repetitious. The ala carte restaurants have a very limited menu and they use the same one everyday. The house wine is hideous. Hey… but guess what… they’ll sell you some drinkable wine for an extra charge. Go to the Mega or Chadraui stores and bring in your own. The alcohol is watered down. The beer being served is Corona on tap and it’s weaker than the 3.2 beer I drank when I lived in Kansas. The food and drinks are mediocre at best. Unless you get a screaming, incredible, I can’t believe how cheap it was deal to stay at the Allegro Playacar, your money will be best spent elsewhere. And that’s the sad truth. P.S. If you don’t believe the management could care less about the comfort and legitimate complaints of their guest, ask yourself why they have NEVER responded to any reviews on this board.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: laclar
Reviews.Content: After reading some of negative reviews I took a chance on the good ones and now I regret every moment. Because I hate writing I will list the good the bad and the weather! Good: 1. Waiters at the buffets are very hard working. 2. Although the was monotonous, it was okay and plentiful. Do not expect gourmet. 3.Swimming pools were clean. 4. Nice beach area 5. Lots of security officers around 6. Best food on the resort was the home made pizza 7. Nice agoutis running around on resort. 8 Landscaping is well maintained Bad: 1. We stayed in room number 5515 which was NASTY. 2. We found two roaches, one walking on my bed and one under our suitcase. 3. Room smelled musty. 4. Air condition was not cold. 5. Bathroom clogged constanly. 6. Face basin was grimy looking with green stains. Was not cleaned properly. 7. Refridgerator did not cold properly. 8. Front desk personel not too helpful. We arrived with 2 children and two adults and had only two bottles of water. Requested additional bottles but did not get it, although they said that they will send over. 9. Although the pool was clean, the swim up bar pool is in dire need of a makeover. 10. Rooms small and not suited for families with kids. 11. The kiddy pool was not in service. 12. This hotel is very small do not be fooled by the pictures. Not a lot to do with kids. 13. The TV is very old and small. (looks like the 60.s) There were just about 2 cable channels. 14. I had bad fish at the Mexican restaurant. 15. Bed and pillows very uncomfortable. weather It rained for fours days due to tropical storm Alex so we were stuck in the small smelly room. This resort advertise for families but don't be fooled. The worst part was being stuck in a stink room with not cable and no kids shows for my young children to watch. They are 8 and 10 years old.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad sides. will not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: tournesol60
Reviews.Content: I spent a week with y husband and my 2 years old son. The location is great, the look of the hotel is good too ( little house instead of a big complex). The food was good, the waiters are nice and friendly and the pools are well design, meaning that if you want to be part of the party there is one pool for that and another where you can be with your family and not be disturbed by the music or activities. On the other hand, the management is not super, we took a superieur room to be close to the beach and pool but end up with no A/C for the all stay. they didnt tell us when we arrived and when we complaint it was not working they told us they will fix it> (a lie). we complained again at the end of the day and they told us, it was broken and they were waiting for a part . that they never received before our departure. we ask for a fan and it took 10 hours before getting it, and my husband had to start being mad!!! during our stay the pool were never really clean, sand was in it for the entire time. The coffee machine in our room didn't work and they didn't fix it and the shower was not working well either. the beach was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more money and get a decent hotel - DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: CarPwales
Reviews.Content: Resort looked fabulous on our arrival - beautiful gardens, 2 lovely pools, and situated right on the beach. When we got to our room we immediately asked for a transfer as we had a problem with the beds. We were moved the following afternoon. In the second room they had to remove the safe twice as we had problems with this, had problems with the key card, and the air conditioning, although working, was very poor. We put up with this until it rained, and the thatched roof leaked all over the bed. We reported this, and although they said it would be fixed nothing was done, and we slept with our bins on the bed to catch the rain water. Then came the tropical storms, and after another 3 days we had run out of bins the bed was soaked, and it wasn't until we stood in the lobby and refused to move until we were moved we were transferred to another room. Again we packed and unpacked wasting more time, and the following day, as it was still raining, decided to catch up on some shopping. We got back from the shops looking forward to a shower to freshen up, only to find that whilst we were away from our room, our shower had been used, all of our towels were on the floor, wet and in a pool of water, and whoever had used our shower also helped themselves to our toiletries. According to the manager, they had not given the key to anyone to use as a courtesy room, and just 'couldn't understand how anyone could have got in there'?? We certainly could given the attitudes and service (or lack of) from the staff. The rooms were dated, and in need of upgrading. We managed to get into the air-conditioned part of the restaurant on most evenings, but this was more like a canteen than a restaurant. The food was never hot, occasionally warm, but mostly cold, and often the trays were empty, as were not replenished regularly. The service in the restaurants was appauling, in fact you only got any kind of service if you shouted loud enough. I was only offered coffee twice at breakfast during a 2 week stay. The pool restaurant was small, and if you wanted lunch before 1.30pm had to fight for a table. Many times we had to eat our lunch at our sunbed on the beach. There were never any glasses available at the soft drinks machine, and often had to wait for the waiter to collect glasses to get a drink. There was only 1 barman at the pool bar, so you always had to queue for your drinks, unless you were female and under 25. The pool bar and restaurant bar closed at 10pm, so after this, the only place you could get a drink was in the nightclub, which had 3 tables, a pool table and a 12ft x 12ft dance floor. Most of the staff had bad attitudes, and offered no kind of service whatsoever. I think they ought to be reminded that we actually paid to stay here, and therefore should be treated accordingly. We are typical Brit's who tend to take things as they come without complaining. However, there were so may things wrong with this place that we felt that we had to share our experience with you, and maybe save you from experiencing the holiday from hell. In case you have already booked this place the good points: Nice Pools, nice gardens and close to the shops. Beach towels are provided, using a card provided by the hotel, but be aware that if you loose your card you will be charged 50USD. If you are looking for somewhere to stay and haven't yet booked: DON'T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here under any cicumstances even if free ,dreadfull realy dreadfull”
Reviews.Author: wingman11
Reviews.Content: hotel is well situated thats its only good point ,we had a realy unpleasant stay .all the staff we had occasion to need were disinterested in what we wanted or how to rectify any problem .They have no clue of any service standard at all let alone what would be required indeed expected in a four star hotel ,(two star if thier lucky) resturant - no cutlery we had to scrable around to Find our own on nearly every visit tables not cleared had to clear our own along with other guests ,lunch was a nightmare every guest crowded into the pool resturant 600 people wanting food in room with 60 seats and two members of staff food- poor quality espcialy at dinner and not refilled frequently bars- Staff (all male)usualy busy with those of a female gender under 25 and would blatantly by pass anyone else, very ignorant . no glasses especialy by pool bar at lunch ,only one member of staff on duty to opperate swim up bar and lunch bar he was swamped every day we had no chance of getting a drink for 30 mins . reception -when they werent trying to sell you a time share they had no clue and were not interested ,very dismissive with any requests Rooms - old style starting to fall apart poor condition (upper rooms have thatch type roof) wall paper thin you can hear all that is said in the quietest voice nextdoor .our roof leaked heavily in both rooms we occupied in the first when we complained they took three days with a wet bed to move us ,when they did some one entered our room when we were out for a short time 2 hours ,used shower and our fresh towels left them in a pool of water in the middle of the floor used out toliterys and my partners cosmetics and the hotel did not have a clue whothety were how they got in , and the management (miguel and santiago ) did not give a dam and showed a total lack of regard or concern for us or our saftey and that of our property in the room they are a disgrace to their profession We made some friends with a few other guests who had a worse experience than us ,staff showing them nothing but contempt rooms with dangerouse electrics and poor wireing etc we could go on and on ,I have been all over the world stayed in loads of hotels I dont whinge ordinaraly but this place takes the biscuit .Trust us DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES NOT EVEN IF IT WAS OFFERD TO YOU FOR FREE

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: Mrbp1
Reviews.Content: After 3 days I checked out of this hotel. The food selection and quality was very poor. No food after 10:00 pm even though the website says otherwise. Front desk staff not very friendly. I had 3 different rooms. None of the rooms were clean. Two out of the 3 rooms the AC did not work. One out of 3 rooms the refrigerator did not work. Two out of 3 rooms had a horriable sewer smell. The grounds, pool and location are A+ but that is as good as it gets. I have stayed at many all inclusives and this was the worst one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star”
Reviews.Author: cal141
Reviews.Content: The only air conditioned place (other than bedroom) was a small restaurant that was only open from 6 pm-10 pm. Lobby area and main buffet dining area were open to birds/bugs. Rooms were in a four-plex unit that was covered by a thatched roof. The top rooms shared a thatched roof and you could see light and hear noise from the neighbors side. Small bugs came out of the faucet when it was turned on in the mornings. Hotel staff very aggressive at trying to get guests to go to an information session about becoming a club member. Food in all the restaurants (except the Mexican restaurant) was bland and hotdogs were substituted for ham/peperoni. The location was great and the grounds were very nice, but these were the only good points.

Reviews.Title: “Not too sure what to say about it-read on............”
Reviews.Author: MX2010
Reviews.Content: Okay, so one of my very best friends & I chose this resort because, for one, we got a super deal on staying here for the amount of time we were looking at; however, the day we checked out of the hotel (Tues, 6/22 around 5:30-6:00am), the manager that was working that specific day was a complete rude, disrespectful, unprofessional & a straight up jerk, even threatening that we may "never get out of Mexico", if we didn't pay in full. We were sort of hoping for some sort of compensation for our troubles, but he was in no way trying to work with us, let alone listen to what we were telling him that happened during our stay. My friend that I was vacationing with is actually a Travel Agent & will NEVER send anyone their way EVER! Throughout our 5 day, 4 night stay, we had multiple maintenance issues that mostly were left unresolved. When we brought it back to his attention, he became completely defensive & stated that we were, basically "dumb", for not having spoken to him, personally, before our check-out. To be perfectly honest, I had NEVER seen this gentleman at the resort prior to this, not one time. We had multiple, multiple (I'm talking 4-6 times per day, each day we stayed there, having trouble with our room key, would not let us in from time of check-IN. This went on every single day since then until the time we left the resort. They even, at one point, maybe the second day, sent a maintenance worker to change the entire lock on the door. Also, we didn't have a light in the bathroom for 2 1/2 days!!!!!!!!!!!!! That makes it a little difficult if you shower at night. We told management, amongst other workers multiple times, from the time the light in the bathroom burnt out, but it was still out when we left the resort. Our electricity went out during our last night stay for about 30 minutes (that means EVERYTHING), so did several other peoples'. We waited 3 days for TP & Kleenexes for cryin' out loud. Where else can I go with this?!?!?!? The resort itself was gorgeous though, but NO ONE got in any big hurry to fix anything or make sure we were having a nice stay that we saved up for & paid a lot of money for. Girls' Weekend Gone Bad FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: mariaguerra
Reviews.Content: Nice Small All Inclusive Hotel 20 min. walk to Playa Del Carmen or $5 usd. by taxi. Very nice pool close to the ocean, not to far to buffet in the lobby just a nice quite small hotel , with excellent nightly entertainment. The food is pretty good but not excellent. I would say its a great hotel to unwind and just relax. Beware of the Time share people!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: jwhite4304
Reviews.Content: We did the First Club at the Allegro in Playacar and had a fantastic vacation. The grounds are immaculate and well maintained. The staff is outstanding in trying to please even if they are not sure of what is being asked they will go out of their way to try to help. The food at the buffets were ok and the food in the themed restaurants was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort to vacation at.”
Reviews.Author: snowman49
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort four times and have enjoyed it each time. The staff is wonderful as they can not do enough for you. The food has always been very good and a large selection to choose from. We were very happy to see the beach was back, just hope it is maintained. For the golfers, the Playa Golf and Spa has a great twilight deal. We will return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money, don't expect...”
Reviews.Author: JAV060
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money, don't expect to find five star rooms or facilities, but be ready to enjoy a great fily holiday. The best things is the friendly staff and being at a stone throw from the town. The worst, the communicatons capability, be ready to pay $4 just for trying to get an outside line, and $15 for 30 min of Internet connection

Reviews.Title: “We're not picky and we even found some things dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: NikkiJoeJD
Reviews.Content: First off I would like to say that we won our trip, so we were a bit lenient on the resort. -----Pros------- * Nice Landscaping * Great Housekeeping * The Italian (a reservation restaurant in the resort) had great food * Friendly staff * Nice welcome robes and slippers as well as a plate of fruit and some sort of liquor. * Housekeeping left an interesting towel art on bed everyday * Beautiful Beach ----Cons------- * Not sure if the air wasn't working properly or if it was the 2 inch gap on the top and bottom of the door or the small window that wouldn't shut that made our room hot. * The entertainment was a bit lacking and dated * Constantly asked for a massage * Mexican cuisine was not authentic nor fresh. * Not much on alcohol selection, would have paid more for it but no option. This was our first time staying at an all inclusive resort and we thought it was rather pleasant. All we really did was sit by the beach and drink Corona. If that's all you really want to do then you'd probably like it. Entertainment was silly and seemed like an after thought. The disco was kind of a joke, but that was okay, we were there for the beach. I also wanted to say that I read many reviews complaining about the plastic cups, but I wanted to say that I have worked at a resort before and to ensure the safety of the guests plastic cups are used so that our drunk butts break them leaving it there for someone to step on. I also found that the beer stayed colder in the plastic cups vs. the glasses. The Rooms are kind of designed poorly... I don't need a huge closet space on vacation. Televisions were old, but didn't really care about that since we watched for like 2 hours max. Bed linens a bit rough and old, but it wouldn't keep me from returning. If they would update things a bit such as the entertainment I think the resort would keep people coming back. For example.... * Keep a DJ around by the pool so people can request songs. They have wireless internet so get a laptop set up the sound system and you can download any song people want to hear. * at the stage area forgo the chairs and put in a live band for people to dance to. That seems much more entertaining than watching people impersonate celebrities and then lipsync their songs. *IMPORTANT* I feel very naive for not having researched before leaving about tipping at these resorts. Sure it says tips included, but they are paid like 4 dollars a day! These resorts make millions... Tip your bar staff, servers, and maids. I wish I knew this before we went so that we could have tipped everyday instead of doing it on the last day after seeing people tip that day. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ All in all, No I probably wouldn't recommend this resort as is. If they did a bit of change then possibly.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely be back to this quaint beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Omiart
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this trip knowing that it was a 3.5 star resort. We didnt expect much and when we got there it was nothing but the best. The one and only thing i could complain about (I'm not a complainer) was that the walls between the rooms were not insulated... you could here everything. With all the reviews on here about this resort and how horrible it was , I would like to suggest to people who want 5 star service at a 5 star hotel to actually book and spend the money to stay at one.....and stop complaining about every little thing about a 3.5 star resort that I thought had the best of everything compared to the ones we saw along the beach and in Cancun. If you are there to party.... this one is not for you.....if you like the best of the best....this one is not for you....families ..I would definitely recommend this hotel.... it is close to everything you need....we had a relaxing and fun time and I will definitely be going back soon.....! I miss it already and all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “great place to be”
Reviews.Author: robertmagaly
Reviews.Content: we love it the room was great we was there 4 our honeymoon the beach was beatiful the pool worm and clean the food was delicious and the service very nice we had alot fun we would love to go back wit the kids the only thing i will change will be the aircondicin the need to get fix it to hot to sleep at nite other then dat was great

Reviews.Title: “Five stars for this three star”
Reviews.Author: Darto98
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant surprise. Even though it is an older resort it was clean and very friendly. Stayed over Easter week in villa #35 top floor which are not to sound proof but has a much nicer ambiance.This villa is directly behind the gift shop which was centrally located on the resort. A small resort but still offered all we wanted and needed. Never had an issue finding a lounge chair either by the pool or on the newly rebuilt beach. Drink service was always available and never had to look to far for food or pizza snacks from the buffet breakfast, the pool side lunch buffet which usually was bbqing some seafood to the excellent dinner buffet. Tried the a la carte but prefered the buffet. For dinner they would open the a/c dining lounge and if Encarnatio is your waiter treat him right and you will have a great dining experience. Found the resorts evening entertainment first rate with a small group of very talented dancers. So if your looking for a 5 star resort keep looking but if you are looking for a comfy, relaxing,claen and friendly place to go give this a look

Reviews.Title: “Would not return..............lol”
Reviews.Author: beachbum2006
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this resort hoping for a great time but....... The good parts -arriving at the airport was very easy in getting a ride to our hotel. -The room was clean. -The food was good but that is a personal opinion. -The beach was nice. -Most of the people at the resort were nice. -Playa Del Carmen is only 15 min away or a 5 dollar taxi ride. -Ride to the hotel was good and check-in was ok as well. -Airtransat service was good The bad parts - one confirmed case of H1N1 and another pending -people grabbing and running with your luggage upon arrival, hoping to get a tip. -did not get a cot as requested. -room was too small, not like the pictures -beds were too hard -putting toilet paper in wastebasket was disgusting -could hear other people in next rooms -no food available after 10pm -no swim up bar as shown on brochure -staff at check out tried to charge again for safe -could not always open the safe -a la carte had no dress code - Italian restaurant "maitre D" was rude -no nightlife -pool had a film of scum on it everyday....did not use it

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Cris_Dinslaken
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at the Allegro Playacar, after staying 7 days at the Allegro Cozumel. To our surprise, the hotel is ALMOST like the one in Cozumel. Staff is not as friendly and the insistence of the staff of the hospitality desk are so pushy in trying to show the hotel and bla bla bla that really got on my nerves. Food is okay...not gourmet and unfortunately the after 23h snack is......let's say..something to full your belly. If you like BAD WINE, try them at the Italian Restaurant..... Otherwise, the pool view of the beach if fabulous! Ah, if you want to rent a car at Avis, there is one 100m at the Plaza Playacar...something that the staff don't tell you, only push the service of the in-house renting company..

Reviews.Title: “2 STARS”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Piedade
Reviews.Content: You can consider staying if you never stay in another hotel in Riviera Maya, is really a 2 stars compared to others, me and my wife stay in others, such as Baiha Princepe Tulum 5 star, and you cannot compare, there is no point that even comes close, very bad food, YOU EAT IN BREAKFEAST THE DINNER FOODS!!!! The fruits with no taste, buy a fruit outside in somewhere and compare. Drinks only water. Room clean only at first look, look arround, windows and other things i think never was cleaned, toilet smell sooooooooooo bad, had to sleep with windows opened all nights, ants averywere in the room. For me the worse hotel i have ever been, and i been in many.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place with EXCELLENT staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bludolfin64
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sister and this was our first time to Mexico. We stayed for 1 week. I was unsure of what to expect because of the mixed reviews on this site, but also VERY prepared for the negatives. Other than the confusion at the airport everything went smooth - we were immediately approached by multiple people with white shirts and tan pants after we went thru customs. ADVICE: If you already have transportation arranged then walk past them and go directly outside and find your driver. Our transportation service was right outside (Olympus Tours - orange T-shirts) and we were on our way. I can't imagine driving there - very congested and no clear lanes - very glad we arranged for transportation to Playa del Carmen with travel agent! Our room was Ok....not great but it was clean. Took awhile to get used to throwing toilet paper in the trash but wasn’t a big deal – better than flooding the bathroom! We later figured out it our room was in the perfect location on the resort (Building 25). It was close to both the beach and the lobby - where the breakfast and dinner buffets were located. It was also far enough from the disco and the nightly shows to just barely hear the music but not be a disruption. The walls are thin so we could hear our neighbors if they were talking loud and we tried to keep our voices and TV low when in the room so that we were not bothering others. Also...we were sad that we were on the lower level, BUT it was pouring rain the night we arrived and I had heard those on 2nd floor had leaks in the roofs so it turned out to be a good thing that we were on lower level. Our AC worked wonderfully and we speculated that those on top floor probably had a harder time keeping things cool with those high ceilings so it worked out for us. We walked to where the resorts end one evening and are happy to report that our little stretch of beach was just perfect in comparison. Some resorts allowed people to drag the chairs right up to the water and were way overcrowded. Allegro didn't allow you to pull chairs past a certain point so when we were swimming in the ocean, we didn't have a whole crowd of spectators. Also, Allegro's activity pool appeared to be the only one so close to the beach so you could look right out to the ocean from the pool as well. After checking out the other resorts from the beach, I would have to say that the beach proximity at this resort was the best and we were glad because the beach and the water were what we came for! The staff was exceptional! You would see the same faces from dawn to dusk performing different jobs so these people work really hard. We tipped everyone who served us and that helped.....they would recognize us whether on the beach or at the buffet and service was wonderful. Everyone smiled and said "Hola" and we know very little Spanish but tried to order drinks in Spanish and always say “Gracias”. Tip: if you don't specify liquor brand, you will get the cheap rot gut stuff, however after tipping staff on the beach, shots of Cuervo and Cervezas would be delivered before asking for more - needless to say our first day we were a little tipsy and enjoyed a full day of sun, beach and swimming in the BEAUTIFUL ocean. FOOD: Not gourmet but a wonderful selection for everyone and wonderful fresh fruits and breads every meal. Personally, I was a little bored with breakfast and am not used to eating 3 meals a day so several days we skipped breakfast, walked down to the Starbuck's at Playa Plaza and were fine until lunch at the pool was served. We ate Pizza and fresh fruit almost every day for lunch except for the two days we went on excursions. The last day, we skipped the pizza and had Mexican and it was very good. Only ate at the Mexican restaurant one night and it was tasty. We ended up cancelling our Italian dinner because there was so much variety at the buffet and we wanted to go to dinner when we felt like it instead of the scheduled times for the 2 restaurants. You did see some leftovers, but there was so much to choose from, I can’t imagine not finding anything you can eat unless you are extremely picky. Fresh fruit at every meal was awesome and I already miss it. Friday night was the outside Mexican Buffet and it was really good. Most days I wished I could try more of the dishes but I just couldn’t eat that much! I enjoyed Oriental and Caribbean buffet nights the most! We took a cab down to 5th Avenue one day and that was an adventure. Two American blond females so we were bombarded by the vendors on the street – kind of annoying but we had been warned. I would suggest starting farther down 5th Avenue instead of right at the end near the Ferry Dock…they were the worse there and it was hard to take 5 steps without being bothered by vendors or tour guides. We had lunch at 100% Natural and both agree that it was the best meal we had while there. It was a little garden oasis in the middle of 5th Avenue – we sat upstairs so we could enjoy the garden and the people walking by. We decided to walk back to Playacar, but took a wrong turn and ended up walking thru all the privately owned homes, but also got to see the Mayan ruins scattered throughout so it turned out to be a nice adventure, although it was very hot and we finally found a public beach access to get back to the Allegro. Note to other Newbies……Playacar is a gated area where the resorts are located so you feel very safe walking the streets and going down to the Plaza where there is a Starbucks for coffee lovers and a little mart for various items…we went down there 3 or 4 times. If you buy with American money, your change is in Pesos so be prepared. My sister was ill one entire day but I never got ill once. She had ordered different food at the Mexican restaurant on the resort but other than that night, we ate the same things. Also…she forgot one day and rinsed her toothbrush in the tap water – I brushed and rinsed my toothbrush in bottled water and never felt ill so be safe and brush/rinse with bottled water only. We left tips and gifts for housekeeping each day with a note that said “Mas agua por favor – Gracias” (More water please, thank you!) and received 5 new bottles of cold water in our little fridge everyday. You could also find water dispensers to fill up your bottles at the pool bar and in the morning where they had a little continental breakfast station down by the pizza bar each morning. Thanks to the tips on this site, we brought extra hangers, our own beach towels, hats and plenty of sunscreen. Our faces got a little burnt one day on the F1 Offshore Explorer excursion, but we think that was mainly due to being sprayed in the face with salt water. Even though signs say not to reserve beach umbrellas – everyone did anyway so if you plan on spending the day at the beach, go out early and put towels on the chairs with umbrellas. Not sure I could have spent all day on the beach without the shade of those umbrellas. WARNINGS: the beds are very hard – which was the worse part for me. I spent a lot of time when at our room laying in the hammock outside instead! Also….massage people on the beach are annoying and we found the prices they were offering to be way too high for Mexico so we even turned down the free 10 minute massages they were offering. I was going to get a massage, but it was set up right next to the activity pool and didn’t feel like having a hoard of people watching or listening to techno music or the activity announcers while getting a massage – didn’t seem very relaxing. Also, I got eaten alive by mosquitoes on the very last night we were there – bites started appearing AFTER I got home yesterday and were very small but itchy. Took a shower, applied tons of Aloe Vera gel and today they are much better. Glad it was our last day or I would have been miserable so take some bug wipes or spray with you just in case! Timeshare people were nice but didn’t bother us too much because we were 2 women – couples and families seemed to get bothered more. If you love the beach and water – this is the place for you. Spent many hours on the beach or at the quieter pool and it was just lovely and relaxing. Hard to go from the go-go-go lifestyle to so much free time but we got into it more towards the end of the trip and it was worth the price we paid for sure!!!! We planned excursions online before going…should have waited and price shopped so if you want to go to excursions, you might want to shop online for idea of prices and then see what they offer when you get there. Prices were all different. Oh…one more thing! Our safe had an issue the day before we left – it wouldn’t open. Staff was there in 5 minutes and after not being able to fix it, they removed it, opened it from the back (with much trouble – which was good to know) let us retrieve our items and installed a new safe. All very quickly and politely. Say “Hola” to Santiago at the front desk and Jacabo ('Okey Dokey' waiter). So many others we just loved but Santiago and Jacabo stood out! Bottom line: not a 4 or 5 star but VERY beautiful and charming and you really felt like you were in Mexico instead of some huge commercialized resort. The staff and the beautiful beach/water was what made this trip fabulous! Besides Americans and Mexicans, there were lots of Europeans and Canadians so that made it even more fun and interesting. If you want more tips….I would be happy to share what I learned.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly???”
Reviews.Author: Parrotheads67
Reviews.Content: Well, we went with another couple Wednesday thru Sunday. We were a little apprehensive as there were some pretty bad reviews about this place. But, we knew it was a 3 star going in and we aren't that particular. I would rate the food and service we received as good. The grounds and pool were well maintained., the rooms clean. The Italian place was our best meal, it was spectacular. Great food, great wine, nice atmosphere and cool. While on the subject of cool, the rooms were not. They did have A/C but the humidity was such that the rooms never were comfortable. We kept the windows and doors open much of the time. Still, we were okay....had a great time during our stay. They did approach us on the first day about a complimentary breakfast, when we asked what they would be going over, they would not tell us. "Just bring a credit card".....not thanks. They did call our room several times the next day. The bummer of the trip was on the last day. We were told a shuttle would pick us up at 3:00 AM from the resort to take us to Cancun Airport. We were up at 2 and my husband had a bug or food poisoning or something and was still feeling bad along with being sleepy while we packed. On the way to the airport, he discovered he'd left his rings on the ledge above the bed. We immediately called the hotel from the shuttle and they said they could not find them. We've been on the phone with them for two days and still have not gotten a straight answer. Had he seen his rings, he would have immediately put them on. We have been hung up on repeatedly and avoided. They even blocked our number as one of the numbers we were given was a cell phone, I was told this by an International operator. We realize this is not their fault,but they come accross as very dishonest and uncaring. I have called Occidental's Customer Care line and just got a recording. Based upon the customer service we're receiving or not receiving, we won't stay at an Occidental property ever again.

Reviews.Title: “What is wrong with you people....”
Reviews.Author: Fridays13
Reviews.Content: Well the title should say it all. We stayed at the Allegro for one week with family and our 2 young daughters. We booked this hotel knowing it was a 3.5 star hotel and have traveled allot and knew what a 3.5 star should bring us. Well this hotel was allot more then a 3.5 star hotel.
