The Staff - 5 star and nothing less. The staff on the resort in days knew us all by name and anything we needed they went out of their way to keep us happy. The kids club was great and our girls begged everyday to go. The resort had their own vendors that were polite and were never pushy or pressured you into buying anything. Stop by and say hi to Louise. He went out of his way to let our girls paint their own pottery and fired them for us. Also George in his jewelry shop, what a great guy and will find you anything you need. Tell them both your Canadian friends say Hi. The Food - We are at a 3.5 star guys. No there is no 3 buffets or 5 restaurants to choose from, but the quality was - EXCELLENT. Also all the staff in the kitchen went out of their way to keep our girls happy. Every night was a different theme and we never got bored or ever found that we left hungry. Lunch at the pool was wonderful - GREAT Pizza and ladies in the kitchen were wonderful. Poolside bartenders served wonderful drinks and great guys to sit and joke with. The Resort - Grounds are beautiful. Very quite and well kept. At any time there is plenty of beach chairs or pool chairs and shades to choose from. The resort you can walk from one side to the other in a few minutes. Lots of room to still have your privacy if that is what your looking for. The rooms were great. Clean Clean and let me say it again CLEAN. Yes the resort is a bit older and is working on upgrading but come on people what do you expect for few hundred dollars for a week stay. The cleaning staff was great and everyday had a new towel creature to keep the girls dreaming of what was going to be next. The room walls are bit thin but if this is a problem for you ask for a second story room as they are allot quieter. Loved the hammock and spent some great nights in it. Location - Close enough to walk to Playa but far enough to keep the rif raf away. HAHA Took us about 15 mins to walk to town and would catch a taxi home for 50 peso's. We were in town almost ever night. Shows at hotel were great but love to people watch and what a better place then Playa to do this. I would recommend this place to families and couples. Very laid back and great place to relax. If you want to PARTY wrong hotel. Small night club but small is the word. Have fun and stop the complaining your on vacation. If you want 5 star go somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “the great staff make up for any shortfalls”
Reviews.Author: lthiker
Reviews.Content: Leaving the airport in Cancun there are some very nice ladies that will say they want to help you find your ride to the hotel. Keep walking. Tell them this is not your first time here. Your people are just outside the next door. These people will kidnap you and try to force a timeshare/vacation club on you. KEEP WALKING. This is an average mx. three star resort. The people are overall very freindly, very helpfull. Their vacation club people are everpresent but will not bother you if you just explain that it is the worst waste of cash you ever heard of to buy into that sort of stuff. They write you off as a lost cause. The shows are pretty entertaining if you like to watch dancing shows. They are very talented. The girl that does the kids "mini disco" is great with them and seems to enjoy working with kids. The rooms are what you would expect. Very clean but some what out of date. Lots of little things that might bother some people like the sink that needs to be bleached, the bathtub/shower that was built with concrete. Oh and the one common thing I have found in these places ....the bed is as hard as a rock. We asked for a pad. and they brought one very quickly. The aircon. was pretty weak but the fan made it great. We went to tulum 38 usd guided tour awesome place. we also went snorkeling from barracuda co. the reef is dead there but there were lots of fish. I lived in HI. for three years and judge it by what the north shore snorkeling was like. Overall we had a good time. My mother and step father went with us 72 and 69. Their northern maine taste for food is on the bland side so even the most non-spicey stuff they thought was "wicked spicey" I thought they tend to be on the bland side just for "gringos" I like the spicey mex foods and thought they should have had more of the original stuff. They did have a good variety and we all found some thing to eat every meal. Two meals that week were an outside bbq. Lots of extra work and they seem to take it in stride. The place by the pools had really good burgers and fries and lots of other options. The three month old beach was very impressive. we were there when there was no beach last year (sandos). The palapas were easy to get if you got there right after breakfast. Very secure and and an easy walk to town. Don't miss the mayan ruins near town. If you go to cozumel be near the fisrt in line for the ferry as you might end up sitting in the bottom of the boat. ( Mom got seasick down there) We like Playa in general and will be back...will try a different resort next time. Not because of any negitive but for variety. The complainers expect 5 star for two star price. we were happy over all. The staff is 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: KristaPEICanada
Reviews.Content: After reading alot of negitive reviews on this place ,I was worried about what our experience would be. In all I would agree that it does need room updates,but outside of that our trip was excellent. The food was very good ,their were 19 in our group and some very picky eaters but at the end of the day we all had enough to eat and were happy with it. The staff was simply amazing and went out of their way at every chance to make your stay more enjoyable. We had 9 kids between the ages of 11 and 20 and all were completely satisfied with everything. Overall a great family resort with an amazing beach and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Married, kids, rest, rich? then here you go...”
Reviews.Author: VICTORIA-ISLAND-GAL
Reviews.Content: **Check in was smooth Our room was on the bottom of the four plex. They had the beach towels in there. The safe needed to be reset you dial 0 on the phone. Some guy comes and he resets it. You press your code and close it and then you use the same code to open it. Use the shelves and/or suit case folding shelf because the one night i didnt i had little bugs crawling all over it. Which I sprayed with my Deet outdoor bug spray. Luckily, I didnt actually "pay" for the chameleon package and was upgraded when we booked. because I really do not know what it gets you? Seriously. Finally on the second day we were able to move to an upper suite. All the rooms have the same bright beautiful colors. but I wanted an upper suite so that I can experience the thatch roofs. You can hear the birds better from the upper suite thats because they are nesting in the roof. But I like that kinda thing. The beach has shells on it and someone playing beach volleyball cut his foot on one of them. it was weird - other resort didn’t have shells. its a long beach, but the half by the water is public so you cant take the yellow covered chairs too close to the water. They need to stay on the resort grounds. You have to go to the neighbouring resort if you want to boogie board, catamaran etc. The bathrooms were always clean. Just a heads up you cant flush toilet paper not even after #2 everything goes into the garbage. Thank goodness they clean your room every day. You are suppose to get goodies in your fridge (chocolate bars etc with two bottles of water) but i think because we didn’t tip enough we only got our water bottles. The concierge desk is perfect for explaining the area and giving you a map. Paula is amazing. They do try to sell you something that’s "not a time share"..hah yah right... but i told them i wasn’t interested in even hearing what they had to offer. I didn’t care about a suite by the ocean or a free trip to Cozumel for hearing their deal. Serj was our nolitour tour rep he is French Canadian and was helpful. Although didnt have the cheapest rates but had good rates. for example. you can catch an ADO to Tulum for cheaper than an arrange tour. Its air conditioned and safe. The drink menu at the hotel was excellent and they will make changes for you (cran/soda/vodka). They have Heineken. The food is good. The Mexican al a carte was three FULL courses. Don’t go after a day of drinking. You get a shot of tequila when you enter. And you can put on the hats to take pics if you wish. The Italian al a carte was delicious and they know their fine table manners-which was a nice surprise. The food was excellent. It may have been leftovers from the buffet re-sliced and diced but it tasted excellent and its nice to see the food not wasted. At night you can hear the other resorts PUMPING but our hotels night life died early.. the disco is small, one pool table. One maybe two bartenders...The party people have to leave the grounds by 11pm but you can go with them. The grounds were lovely. Two pools. You put your dirty dishes outside in these neat little carts. There are stray cats, geckos and iguanas. There is a store, you can have interenet. You go into the hotel store and its $1 for 6 mins. Good luck you will need $2 to send one email if you completely hurry. Not much to play as for sports the tennis courts were nice. Beach volleyball tournaments (watch the shells), ping pong, there is water aerobics and soccer. There is a massage booth set up by the pool restaurant but it wasnt for me. Location: The cabs were always outside. If you want peddle bikes you can barder with Hotel Tequilla and see if they will lend you some (for free) but.... if they are full they wont. 450 pesos to XCaret. taxi with other pple. $5 to town $5 to walmart (buy your booze there) 20 minute walk to 5th avenue. In summary, we never got our treats in the fridge that we heard others did (cookies, pop and chocolate bars) which would have been nice on our day trips. We did tip and brought a nice spa package gift set. The place was clean, the staff were nice (one guy in the buffet meowed at me-kind of annoying). Its a great place to relax. We payed $900 for one week all inclusive flying out of vancouver. You can bring all inclusive big cups if you want but theres are not too small. thWelayed in the hammock on our porch and watch the sunsets... its a relaxing time. will be posting a review on playa del carmen shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Picture perfect beach, excellent location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: BCsenorita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last march and were so impressed we decided to return for another visit. We were extremely impressed with the amount of work that has gone into improving and upgrading this resort. The beach is now huge and lined with beautiful palm trees and there were plenty of loungers available at all times of day and shade for all. The beach was lovely and not overly crowded like many of the others along the same stretch. The food at the resort was delicious and the selection was vast- something to please every palate. We ate in the Mexican restaurant at the resort twice because the staff were so much fun and the food was so authentic and delicious. Especially the ceviche, it was out of this world- fresh and flavorful beyond belief. The grounds were lush, colorful and extremely well maintained. We enjoyed the cozy cottage style lodgings with their private entrances and felt right at home at this resort. All of the staff were very hard working and did everything in their power to make us feel comfortable, welcome and well taken care of. Over all it was a very enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “It was FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maggieaggie
Reviews.Content: Right from when we arrived Selene at the front desk was helpful . Any time we had questions she answered with a smile . The food at the buffet was very good and lots to choose from. Our day always began with a song from Jacobi. My coffee cup was always full. The Mexican and Italian a la cartes were excellent.The beach buffet had great choice. The rooms are small but very clean. We had different towel animals each day. The beds are a bit hard but that didn't stop us from sleeping. The beach is beautiful and never had to get up for a drink, there was always a waiter close by. The pools were being cleaned daily.Lots of happy waiters there too. The best part of our holiday was meeting so many super people especially the ones from Vancouver! We will definetly go back. Maggie Aggie from Winnipeg

Reviews.Title: “Trust your instincts and stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: SunSandSurf77
Reviews.Content: I booked for 10 nights thinking I was getting a great deal 40% off room rates WOW only $227 a night for an all-inclusive Superior Room. I read through the reviews trying really hard to find the positives but felt very uneasy about this place. We were traveling with 2 other couples who also booked here. When we arrived we were told they were sold out and they were moving us to another hotel for 3 nights. First off, how can this happen to 3 separate bookings not to mention the others we ran into at the other hotel who were also shuffled there because of overbooking. This is a major inconvenience to live out of our suitcases for 3 days knowing we needed to pack up and move again, not to mention the wasted move day checking out and into another hotel so we could not plan any activities. Prior to checking out of the hotel we CONFIRMED with Allegro that our Premium Rooms were indeed available. There is nothing to say except that the manager finally admitted that we were not given Superior rooms and he offered us a robe. Really, a robe to go with the filthy rooms. There were bugs crawling all over the sink and walls and on the pillow of the rock hard bed with the soiled bedspread. Loved the bug with the pinchers. The lizard on the wall was apparently not doing his bug-eating job or perhaps he was just too full. The walls are so thin you can hear your neighbors as if they are in another room in your house. There was only one bottle of water in the mini fridge--that's it, now that is what I call all-inclusive <NOT>! The TV was a small tube TV with poor reception and limitied channels. Another review I read mentioned they had been in better Motel 6 rooms and we have to agree. Now to the food. We went to the buffet and were so grossed out that we ended up picking things we thought might be safe to eat, like bread and a hot dog. The ketcup looked like corn syrup was added to make it go further. The drinks (you need to get them yourself as there was no service that we could find) are served in plastic cups like you would find at a cheap diner and they had no straws. Mine had some left over lipstick on the rim, nice huh. As we sat there arms sticking to the dirty table we tried to keep an open mind and consider the low room rate thinking we should not expect much for the $$ we paid. Problem is that people are mislead by the supposed discount, truly the rate of $227 is the normal rate and could even be lower for this 1 to 2-star hotel. I'm not sure how anyone would like or recommend this place but perhaps they were drunk the entire time or live in worse conditions at home. Thankfully, we checked out of this dump and found another hotel for the remainder of our stay that far exceeded our expectations. Paying only $100 more a night got us a 5-star all-inclusive resort with a 5 diamond award in Playa. Check out The Royal, it's incredible. Be warned to stay away from Allegro!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff were incredible”
Reviews.Author: HollieVancouver
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and many were right. The staff were nothing short of amazing. - Conceirge staff Alex and Paula were wonderful and had a knack for knowing who could benefit from the upsell time share and who were not. They realized that we were not a candidate and never gave us the spiel - other conceirge staff were not as intuitive. - Waiters and hostesses and the housekeeping staff go way beyond the call. We were told by Serge (Nolitour Service Rep) that the average person working at the resort makes about 50.00 pesos a day (less than $5.00 Canadian or US). Tipping is very appreciated - take a stack of US $1.00 bills. - The 10 minutes free massage left me wanting more. I should have booked the one hour massage and regret not doing it. Not sure how he spelled his name - but Jose had magic fingers. - The activities staff had endless energy. It was not uncommon to see the staff working as activity staff by day and hostessing at night. They were not pushy and did a great job. The pools and beach were spectacular. - Beware of the other guests running out and throwing towels down to mark their spot and eliminating your chance to sit under one of the umbrellas. We found it frustrating but did not do the same. Be patient and you can find a seat. - The pools were clean and regularly tested - I witnessed this myself. - The beach was immaculate and endless and the water was crystal clear, warm and the most brilliant hue of blue I have ever seen. We swam in the ocean everyday. The rooms were not amazing. - They were in need of a reno but they were exceptionally clean. The mattress was cruel and the thatched roof, while quaint, made it impossible to sleep after 6:00 AM because it sounded like the local birds were inside your room. Set your air conditioner to setting 3 and use the ceiling fan because it will make it less loud and easier to sleep. The housekeeping staff are very creative with the towels and made amazing looking animals and left them on the bed. The food was not amazing. -The food was less than stellar - and if you plan to go to the ala carte restaurants pack some long pants and dress shoes for your husband - because without them you will see the same foods day in and day out at the buffet. - Red wine lovers - do not drink the house wine. I am not sure what it is, but it was not wine. Wal-Mart is not too far to walk to pick up a decent bottle - take a corkscrew with you because you will not find one except if Wal-Mart is not sold out of their 90.00 peso model. - Beer lovers - Corona on tap may have been refreshing because it was cold but not because it tasted great. For beer in a can you are looking at paying - so go to the local Oxxo or Wal-Mart and pay a lot less. Overall you need to remember that if you are paying budget dollars you get what you pay for. If food and beverage and a comfortable mattress are high on your priority list - then don't stay at the Allegro - you will need to pay more to get what you need. I believe that in terms of the hotel room and food - we got what we paid for. In terms of the staff - we got far more than we paid for. I personally would not stay again because I love food and wine and a comfortable mattress. That being said, I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to someone who was looking for a value vacation.

Reviews.Title: “1st.& Last time I will go to Mexico if this is the norm.”
Reviews.Author: occidentalhater
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived at the Occidental we were told that there was a little problem and our room had been double booked. They sent us to the Iberostar ( a very nice hotel) which is close by for 3 nights. But the room, as nice as it was, looked out onto the storage yard on one side and the side of another hotel on the other. On our return to the Occidental we were put in a disgusting room in the middle of the complex and not the oceanview superior deluxe room we had paid for. The room was dirty, had a broken mirror, badly discoloured and chipped paintwork, ceiling panels loose and dislodged over the basin area, faulty light switch that had to be hit 6 or 7 times to make it stay on and a bath that you would have been dirtier after bathing if you had used it. The mini bar was supposedly fully stocked but had only 2 x 500 mm bottles of water. The concierge who was showing us around the room sneaked off when the bell boy arrived with our suitcases. I later caught him, and he promised to speak to the hotel manager for us. We never saw him again until the day before we were due to leave. On the 5th. day of our holiday we finally got the room that I had booked 9 months previously. The standard of service is extremely poor except for a few of the waiters. Some of the staff are in the wrong job and do not want to serve you. Others are totally rude and virtually refuse to serve you. The staff on reception will not look you in the eye and just brush aside any complaints. The food was poor and luke warm although there was a variety. Im sure the beer at the pool bar was watered down. I could go on for a few pages more, but to sum up, do yourself a favour and steer well away from this dump.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in Motel 6's that were better”
Reviews.Author: pocoma
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, tired from 10 hrs. of travel, we were informed at the front desk that we would have to go to another hotel because they had overbooked and that we would return in 2 days. The staff was not apologetic at all for the fact that in 2 days we would have to pack up all of our stuff and unpack again. They didn't seem to care in the least. The room was small, the bathroom was disgusting, stained tub, leaky sink and smelled of mildew. I had to call each day to request wash cloths, coffee, cups and creamer for the 3 of us. The housekeeping staff were very friendly but the people at the front desk made me feel like I was inconvienencing them with any request and they were extremely unfriendly.The food was okay but the same every meal. Nicely presented but not much flavor. The pool was small and usually taken up with an activity and loud blaring music. I can't say I liked anything about staying at Allegro. This was my first trip to Mexico. I was traveling with my two adult daughters, 23 & 21. We will definately return to Mexico but not to Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back Anytime.”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl1969
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here during Spring Break in March, and would go back anytime. We have both been to Mexico numerous times and this place was absolutely terrific. It was immaculately maintained and extremely clean, the service was always friendly, the beach was lovely and the entertainment was terrific. There was a eclectic mix of nationalities staying at the hotel which made it more interesting. The hotel was casual and fun and although not luxurious, was everything we wanted for a fun and relaxing vacation. Remember, this is Mexico, not Canada or the USA and things are not the same as they are at home, so don't expect them to be the same. The rooms are palapa huts with 8 hotel rooms per hut. If you have a room on the top floor, you get an extremely high ceiling. There is a fan and air con, but we often just left the windows open at night and used the fan. The room was always cleaned and re-stocked and although not huge, had everything we needed. Sure the beds are a bit hard, but this tends to be typical for Mexico. On each balcony or patio is a hammock for you to relax in. We could hear the waves from the beach some nights. We tipped the maid at the end of the stay, but also 1/2 way through our stay. The property is not one of those huge properties where you need a golf cart to get from one end to the other. It is the perfect size. There are two pools, one close to the beach which is where all the entertainment is and one a bit further away which tends to be quieter. The entertainment staff worked extremely hard and long hours and were tons of fun and had so much energy. Each night they put on a great show. Sometimes there were dancers and singers and sometimes they had a variety kind of show. One night I went back to my room and realized that my stomach hurt from laughing so much at the show. There was always a lot to choose from at the buffets---breakfast is the best, but try the Italian restaurant, just make reservations the night before. We found the waiters at the resort were incredibly friendly and kind but were dismayed to notice how many other guests basically ignored the service staff and definitely didn't leave any tips. We enjoy chatting with the staff and always go out of our way to be friendly and low maintenance and we always got great service in return. I might suggest you bring your own mug or thermal cup with you and use it during the day when you are lounging around the pool. We would just go up and re-fill our mugs with pop and the pop dispenser and didn't have to bother a waiter or bartender and we also didn't have to go and get a new glass each time. The barbeque at lunch was really great---and smelled so yummy. We walked intp Playa del Carmen a few times---you go to the end of the hotel driveway and turn left and keep on walking for about 20 to 25 minutes---mostly through a residential neighbourhood and you end up in the town of Playa del Carmen. It is worth going to at least once. Btw, it is better to exchange your money here than at the hotel which tends to have a slightly lower exchange rate. We would definitely go back to the Allegro Playacar and would recommend it for others who want a relaxing and fun vacation and who don't need the height of luxury when they travel. We loved it and are so happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: shaqfan4732
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with three 17 year old boys and stayed at the Allegro Playacar. My wife and I felt the food was excellent. Two of the 17 year olds really liked the food. Our 17 year old son thought the food was good. We stayed in the huts on the bottom floor. Our rooms were fine, nothing fancy but we didn't spend alot of time in the room. On the reviews you heard alot of complaining about the noise, honestly we didn't have any problem with noise. There are two pools, one considered the quiet one where families hangout and the other one where you see more teenagers playing water pole etc. We were there for a relaxing vacation and hungout at the quiet pool and found it very enjoyable. The 17 year olds hungout at the busy pool and had a blast, they loved the pizza and hamburgers served by the pool. The entertainment in the evening....this is something my wife didn't enjoy. She complained that the resort was family oriented and felt that the girls costumes were a little to revealing. They were strutting their g-strings under their costumes for everyone to see. I myself really enjoyed watching them so much so that I left my wife in the room to go watch them. The timeshare people that everyone keeps talking about did ask us if we were interested in attending a breakfast and we said no and they never bothered us again during our stay. The beach is large and really nice. There were plenty enough chairs to sit on the beach. We walked to Playa del Carmen along the beach, it took about 20 minutes. You can also walk along the street this is a 20 minute walk also. You can take a 5 minute taxi ride for 5 dollars. If you turn left out of the resort there is a mini mall with shops and a Starbucks with free wifi. It is about a 5 minute walk. All in all I would stay at this resort again because the price was well worth it. We paid 700 plus taxes for a total of 1005.00 Canadian each. We

Reviews.Title: “Awesome would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: JennyBEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say we had the most amazing time at this resort. I have no idea why people leave such bad reviews because it is absolutely beautiful! We went with two other coules and each of us enjoyed it so much. The only one thing I can see why eople complain about is the rooms because they are simple and not fancy, but very very clean. How much time do you really spend in your room anyways?? The food was great, the a la carte dinners were very good. The building where they have their breakfast buffet and dinner buffet is beautiful. At lunch time there is a pizza place and a buffet down by the pools. Also a burger and hot dog station. The drinks are amazing!!! The employees that work there are SO friendly, always smiling and happy, truely amazing people. The grounds are so well kept, there are always working cleaning, sweeping, trimming trees, it is SO clean there. The beach is BEAUTIFUL, absolutely beautiful. You can actually walk all along the beach right to 5th ave in Playa del Carmen. Its only about a 25 minute walk. Or you can walk along the road or take a cab. Shopping on 5th ave is great fun! The one thing I really loved was jut being able to step out of my room and be outside. You can walk down by the pools first thing in the morning and get a coffee, go sit on the beach or your own little patio. Its great. Oh and just a bit of advice, wear sunscreen!! I did, even though I was wondering if I would still tan. At home I dont tan with sunscreen on. Here I burnt with spf 30! Spf 50 is defnitely needed. You will still tan with sunscreen. Bring lots of aloe, and lots of sunscreen because they will charge you a fortune for it at the little market down the road. Anyways, myhusband and I plan on going back to this resort for our tenth anniversary and I cant wait. It was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Revolting food, rude staff. DO not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: samsara1
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks lovely with its well kept gardens but the food is revolting and I ended up in bed with food poisoning for 3 days. The staff seem to think it is beneath them to be polite. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. If I was offered a free holiday here I would not take it. I have traveled extensively throughout asia, central and south america and I am not fussy...........this place is the worst place I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: therais
Reviews.Content: Three of us travelled to Playa Del Carmen this past week and were immediately impressed by the resort. The grounds were beautiful, the staff were incredible and the hotel was immaculate. The beach, pools and weather were outstanding. We were in a great location as you could walk to 5th Avenue or take the ferry to Cozumel as well as shop at the plaza just down the road. There is something for everyone at this resort, whether you just want to lie on the beach, by the pool (in the sun or shade), exercise, play volleyball or have a massage. There was entertainment each evening as well as a Caribeann night and Mexican night during our stay. The meals were outstanding and presented very beautifully. The staff are so friendly and accomodating. Couldn't have stayed at a nicer place and can't wait to go back. Thank you for a wonderful vacation

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKED!!!”
Reviews.Author: crazylady59
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were told the resort was overbooked. We had reserved our 4 rooms back in December and that was not our fault! We had to move to another resort for 3 nights and back to the Allegro for 2 nights. We were given no compensation for having to move twice. When we moved to the other resort it took several hours to get into our rooms since they weren't ready. We had to move and unpack, and then were supposed to repack and unpack after we moved again in 3 days! We asked if we could stay at the new resort so that we didn't have to be inconvenienced again, but were told we could not do that. We were told our rooms would be ready at the Allegro when we returned - they were not. We were told we would receive travel vouchers as compensation - we did not. We would have been happy to stay at the Allegro the whole time - that was our plan! But we were not given that option. Beware - as we were being moved back to the Allegro, the people that were checking in were being sent to another resort because the Allegro was overbooked!!

Reviews.Title: “Over-Booked - Spent vacation packing and moving”
Reviews.Author: JoanEureka_MO
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Allegro with 6 teenage girls and 3 moms. Two of us arrived on Saturday; the other 7 arrived on Monday. Before the trip, we had called to request that we all be housed in close proximity and repeated this request when 2 of us checked in on Saturday. On Monday, we were told that they had over-booked the hotel and despite the fact that we had confirmed and paid for our vacation 3 months in advance, 7 of our group were being moved to another hotel. When I stated that they couldn’t just break up our group, they offered to move all of us to the same hotel (I was later told that this meant I voluntarily requested to move...not exactly what I would call it). So we re-packed up our suitcases and went to the Iberostar (which in all fairness was a wonderful 5 star resort). When we arrived at the Iberostar, they did not have rooms ready for us. We waited for another 2 hours for our rooms to be ready and then unpacked again. The problem with the situation was that we were only allowed to stay at the Iberostar for 3 days. We talked to the manager at the Allegro (Miguel) to request he just leave us at the Iberostar for the remainder of our trip to avoid another interruption to our vacation. We had already lost several hours of prime daylight hours on Monday and did not want to lose several more hours again on Thursday. I have to say that Miguel was very unsympathetic to our situation and we felt that he was very rude, but he did offer us travel vouchers for a future stay at the hotel. We responded that we really just did not want to lose any more of our vacation time to repack, move, and unpack AGAIN. He said that this was against their policy since the Allegro was not overbooked on Thursday. We asked to speak to his boss and Miguel told us that his boss was a very busy man and did not have time to speak to us. He took my cell phone number and said he would have his boss call me. We asked to be upgraded to oceanfront rooms upon our return; Miguel said they would do everything in their power to ensure a pleasant stay and they would place us in upgraded rooms if they were available. Miguel assured us they would make sure all of our rooms were cleaned first and would be ready for us to move into by 11:30 when we returned. Every single one of Miguel’s promises turned out to be a lie. On Thursday, we packed up again and moved back to the Allegro. Of course, we had to check out of the Iberostar at noon (the Allegro refused to pay for a late checkout), but the rooms at the Allegro were not ready when we arrived and they did not have upgraded or oceanfront rooms available. Of course, this was Miguel’s day off. We then asked for our travel vouchers and were told that we had already been compensated because they put us at a 5 star hotel (Miguel seemed to forget that he had offered the vouchers after we were already at the Iberostar). As expected Miguel’s boss never called us either. And the kicker…when we checked back in at the Allegro, there were people being moved to another hotel because the Allegro was overbooked! Our entire group would have been very happy at the Allegro if we hadn’t been treated in such an unprofessional manner. We were not responsible for their policy to intentionally overbook and then to inconvenience the guests by forcing them to repeatedly interrupt their vacation to be moved.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: Barry-Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: This is really the definition of a vacation. Great service, great food, great location at the beach. If i could, i am going back right now, it has been great! The only thing i have missed is a gym, but further than that, it's totally complete. Cheers from the Netherlands!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO TO ALLEGRO!!”
Reviews.Author: canucktraveller78
Reviews.Content: I had a similar experience to another reviewer. The vacation started out well, nice beach, nice looking grounds, but by the end of the week I couldn't wait to get out. I agree that the front desk flat out lies. When I was checking out I paid my bill, which was way to high, but I just paid it so I could leave. As my husband and I are waiting for our shuttle, the front desk comes out and says he needs more money. I told him "no." I had my receipt that showed I already paid and I wasn't paying any more. He YELLS at me and calls the COPS (by the way, this was over 47 pesos, $5 US). Our shuttle arrived, we proceeded to board and he told the driver not to leave because the cops were coming. My husband decided to pay him because we didn't want to hold up the other passengers (although I was hoping the police would come...) and even told him to keep the change since he obviously needed it more than us! The recycled food, dirty pool (in which a child sliced open his foot on a broken cup in the bottom of the pool, which was never evacuated or cleaned), a lady getting screamed at by a hostess because she was 4 minutes late for her reservation, and the unscrupulous staff, dirty reused towels, paper thin walls, holes in roof, I will never go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location....Room not so Lovely”
Reviews.Author: rudycan
Reviews.Content: Great beach location (and beach has recently been restored). Easy 20 minute walk into Playa. Grounds are beautiful and small 4 unit buildings with palapa roofs are quaint. Nice to have a choice between the regular pool overlooking the beach or the "quiet" pool more toward the interior of the grounds. Sunshades for beach lounges were nice if you missed out on getting a beach palapa. Service was great and staff was friendly and helpful. The buffet food was pretty mediocre but the Mexican ala carte restaurant was quite good. The Italian restaurant had some good entrees but the pasta was terrible! Generally, all the fish and shrimp dishes were okay. Poolside pizza was good for snacking. The room was a bit disappointing. Two days of nothing but cold water or no water at all out of the hot taps. Called for maintenance but never got things rectified before we checked out. Although we didn't use the a/c much, when we did need it a couple of evenings before bed, it leaked terribly from the ceiling and left a nasty, rusty puddle and streaks down the wall. Maintenance looked at it but it wasn't fixed....they left our ice bucket on a bath mat on the floor to collect the drips (something to think about when you go to get ice for the room). The beds were comfortable but the linens were pretty threadbare. Room was made up nicely every day but just didn't seem overly clean. I think this could be a great resort and perhaps maintenance and upkeep-wise they are just recovering from a brutal year last year, but don't think I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Is your wife in the hospital? We don't care.”
Reviews.Author: saki13
Reviews.Content: After three days in "Allegro" my wife woke up with food poisoning (you guess where the food came from). I took her to the ER room where she spent the whole day connected to the IV with a lot of medicine. I talked to the people in the hotel to extend our stay so I don't have to check out and find another hotel while my wife is in the hospital. The answer was to checkout before noon because the hotel was completely booked. I had to leave my wife alone in the hospital to checkout.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE!! HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: saints1471
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed when I first entered allegro but by the time I left I was begging to get out of there. The hotel staff is quite possibly the most rude and unhelpful staff I have ever seen. For instance when I lost my key to my room, I went up to the front desk to ask if they could give me another one. The front desk attendant then proceeded to lie to me saying, "the machine is broken sorry can you come back in an hour." Keep in mind there was not a single person there waiting for help but me. I then told her that it was 12 AM and I need a key to my room. A few seconds later she made me the key. The purpose of a hotel staff is to help the patrons not LIE to them. This happened countless times either from the front desk lying to me saying they would fix my door that broke only a day after being there or my favorite the maintenance guy that stole my money when he was fixing my door because it took 2 hours for them to find a new door lock. This was one of the most miserable experiences of my life . My suggestion to you spend the extra $200 and get a better place then this place. DO NOT GO. Oh and buy the way there internet is a hoax. Every time you click on internet explorer the screen goes black and you have to restart the computer, every time. And don't forget the nickel and dime charges they rack on to your bill at the end.

Reviews.Title: “never again terrible for the price i paid”
Reviews.Author: brody12
Reviews.Content: i read some of the reviews after my trip home so i was not aware of any one elses reivew prior to my visit which was not good. from the moment we arrived i tried to be put into another hotel which my apple vacation personel was supposively working on. he was putting us into upgaded room then moving us to another hotel. never happened! from the recycled food at buffet to the brown looking linen and the matchin yukky sheets this place is in need of upgrading. occidental hotels are a certain grade of hotels this hotel was recently purchased by the hotel chain and were trying to upgrade. the price i paid for was four star hotel this was not. Buyer beware! the staff was great ! location great! the over all experience wasnt.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: VancouverKgm
Reviews.Content: We were at the resort from March 3-10th.. We absolutely LOVED Playa Del Carmen! Gorgeous beaches, went on some fantastic tours. Loved snorkling through the underground caves, & ATV'in through the jungle! As for the resort, it was well kept, the grounds were beautiful, great location (could walk to shops, 5th Ave, etc) It was also great that the beach wasn't busy, always lots of chairs..(Other hotels on this beach were packed, people would have to get up at 7 am to reserve seats!) The staff was friendly, good service, food was decent...We all loved the thin crust pizza by the pool, lunch buffet, & bbq..As others have said, the rooms are pretty run down..I would suggest a bottom floor room as they seem to be more sound proof..We had a bottom & top room as we travelled with our 3 kids..The top floor room (as it's roof was made with straw) had some holes in it, and we had little lizzard's coming in the room, , & you could hear everything....All in all we were happy with our stay...We would never have been able to afford a 5 star with a family of 5..For us, it was a nice family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: NWTFTOM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Allegro Playacar fromFeb. 27 - March 6, 2010 and had a wonderful time there. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel grounds were very well maintained. The food was mostly buffet style, although you can make reservations at a Mexican and a Italian Restaurant. We did eat at the Mexican restaurant and did not find it to be all that great, so mostly ate at the buffet. The food at the buffet was good but was nothing spectacular. We actually ate in Playa del Carmen 4 times in order to get some good Mexican food. From the hotel, 5th Avenue was only a 20 minute walk, so we went to town every other day. Lots of action there, so the hotel location was great! Our only complaint would be with the room. We found the closet to be very small and the bathroom was not big enough for two people to be in at the same time unless one was in the shower. The bathroom also lacked any shelves, so there was no place to put your stuff. Other than that, the room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. We decided that the Allegro Playacar was a great value for the money. We have stayed at 6 different resorts in the Playa del Carmen area and this was by far the least expensive. For what this costs, compared to some of the others, this is a great value. Also, they have built a new beach which was fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great!”
Reviews.Author: mikmac17
Reviews.Content: Nolitours did a great job of getting us there and had a rep. greeting us with a non-alcoholic drink. Check in fast and easy. Rooms need renovating, and plumbing a issue.Walls are thin, we could hear everything from the next rm. Families with kids be warned. Housekeeping- two days of having to call them to get rooms cleaned, but by third day,the rooms were done and little towel animals left for your amusement. Bigger the tip the bigger the towel animal. Food mediocre at the buffet, but italian al'carte was decent.Never made it to the mexican restaurant. All drinks were good, and house wine suprisingly good. Beach was amazing and we never had to rush to get a beach chair. Smaller resort so chair availablity was good. Staff very accomidating at bar and restaurants but first two days female staff at front desk not so friendly. Better staff later in the week. Nolitours rep presentation good, but recommending buying biodegradeable sunscreen for XEl-ha. We did and than had to buy more from bus tour host d/t ours was not acceptable by Xel-ha standards. Than they didn't even check us at Xel-ha. Big claim that they will make you shower before entering and than stay out of park for two hours before allowed in. Never happened. So don't get sucked in by the biodegradeable sunblock sale. Overall for the money we paid worth going for the sun, the sand, and the cerviza in your hand. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - we would go back.”
Reviews.Author: wclay
Reviews.Content: Service was great, food was good, they had grounds and gardens which Jamaica didn't and they were beautiful. The hotel disco and hotel night life were nil, but if you went 10 minutes downtown the Coco Bongo was crazy fun. The rooms with thatched roofs had character. The mattresses were firm which I happen to prefer. Beige towels were old, white towels were bigger and brand new. Wonderful mourning-doves will wake you up. Staff wasn't as friendly as Jamaica, but who is? Some staff were as friendly as Jamaica and those are the staff we stuck to. There was more food than Jamaica, no lineups and better open hours. Plus there was a barbque and mini-bufffet at the pool open 16 hours a day. There's always a way to work the food angle -- I ate at the Italian restaurant 3 nights -- (great food small portions) AND then went to the buffet right after. We paid $300 for two per night including airfare and taxes all-inclusive. We got what we paid for PLUS 7 days of sun. A great value - we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JandLVacations
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay at the Occidental Playacar and upon arrival realized that this is a very pretty resort set in the very scenic town of Playacar. The check in Process went very smooth complete with smiling faces and some fruity cocktail. Resort: The resort is kind of small but I very much liked the look of the resort with the arranged plants and the wooden balconies and stairs. Our room was comfortable and very clean with a hammock on the balcony that we used often. It was a very short walk to either restaurant or to the pool which was always live with music and activities. Food: The food was OK very good buffet style dining. There was a grill at the pool restaurant that made some very good burgers and steaks. Drinks were good although the language barrier got in the way sometimes and I wouldn't get what I ordered but all in all the service was great. Overall I loved the service and staff at this resort and Playacar is a very nice location and you should explore the town it is quite lovely to walk down the street. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Stang77
Reviews.Content: We arrived Feb.2/10 @ 11:30 am just before they reopened the brand new beach. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. There was a bit of a mix up with our reservations but the problem was resolved quickly. We found the reception staff always smiling and willing to help. The rooms are a little run down but they were passable. The grounds, restraunts, bars and pools were all in good shape. The tv choices were slim. That's not normally a problem but while we were there the Super Bowl and Daytona 500 took place. Oh well always next year. I would suggest a 2'nd floor room as the balconies are a little bigger and more private. The beach was beautiful but for our first week there were no chairs allowed on the beach as they were still putting the finishing touches on it. By the end of our 2 weeks there were palm trees planted, palapas installed, a volleyball net put up and lots of chairs on the beach. They put brand new lounge chairs @ the pool. There was definetly no shortage of chairs. The resort was a short walk from Playa del carmen ( about 20 min ) and well worth it. We ate at Los Comales on 5'th Ave one night. we had the surf and turf for 2. You got 2 8oz filet mignon, 5 lobster tails, 4 large prawns, baked potatoes, veggies, rice and your choice of 2 large margaritas or a bottle of wine for $54 US. We did the Coba ruins tour it was very good. We booked through our Nolitours rep. It cost $110 US each. I would advise to book through Juan Pablo at Lomas tours located at the bottom of the ramp for the buffet restraunt as he was only $69 US. we also did the Corona rally which consisted of 12 ziplines 25 min on dunebuggies and then about a 1/2 hour at the cenote before a lunch of fajitas and coronas. This tour we booked through Juan Pablo for $120 US each. The hotel was offering two 1 hour full body massages for $99. You could have this either out by the beach or at the spa. We opted for an early morning beachside massage. They did an excellent job. I would recommend this to everyone as the beds in the rooms are quite hard and the massage helped loosen things up. All in all it was a good time for the money we paid. The weather was warm but it did rain a couple of days. Most of the guests were respectful but as always there were a few bad apples in the bunch. If you've travelled down south at all you know that there are usually some Canadians who don't speak English that can be quite rude and obnoxious. They certainly tried to ruin our vacation a couple of days. I would recommend this resort as long as your expectations aren't to high. It is well worth the money. What the place lacks in grandeur it makes up for in their employees. If you want to bring home Tequila buy it at the airport. They have a large selection and great prices. people will tell you to buy it at Wal-mart or Mega store but the airport is better. Also you can just put in your carry on and go.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, great!”
Reviews.Author: rodriger
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review, just do not pay attention to bad reviews about this resort, like somebody wrote before, you will find a crack paint, smelling problems etc anywhere you go. Nothing is perfect, not even at your own home! the resort is a small one with great personel and amazing views to the turqouise waters right in front of Cozumel island. Some people are complaining about the food. When you have a buffet all the time, you always going to find some of the same dishes from lunch to dinner to breakfast next day, why? because the resort needs to have enough food for everybody and you never knows how many customers you will have, so you will find something next time... would it be a shame if they put it on the gargabe. At breakfast you will always find the omelette station and the cereal station and frest fruits, at lunch, a bbq and pasta station, besides the fresh thin and crispy pizzas at the Pizzeria. At night you had the grill and pasta station, not to mention you also can visit the Mejicano and Italiano restaurant. Maid service every day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: jjanisch
Reviews.Content: This was a awesome resort, some musty smell in room, some paint cracks, nothing major, you are in mexico. Staff is soooo nice. everyone says hi and is smiling. Food is very good for buffet and waiters are very fast and nice. Beach is awesome and always an open lounge chair, drinks are great. The bartender in the disco lounge, Enricque is very nice and remembers every face and drink, could use a little more night life, no ones ever in the disco lounge, they can't compete with playa del carmen. Nightly shows are very good! bungalow style rooms are so nice! Great landscaping, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Occidental hotel in the group”
Reviews.Author: bja1945
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to our room the AC did not work, lights did not work, curtain in shredds, towels like rags. Second room not much better. They gave us better towels and the TV worked after 2 repairs. In order to turn on wall light one had to turn exterior lights on the building down stairs. Lights in room not good enough to read a book. Food except for breakfast omlets was very bad. Same thing every night just called it by a different name. Speciality restaurants did not live up to any of the other Occidental resorts. House wine was undrinkable. Like bad grapejuice. Grounds and beach were beautiful. Book any other Allegro hotel except for this one unless you like sleeping on a cement, yes cement bed with a mattress on top. So glad we did not invite friends. They will up date hotel this year but just cosmetic tuch up for regular rooms and First Club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old-style Mexican Resort......for a good $$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: zapperu
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort off Apple Tours web site 2 weeks before going .Started having 2nd thoughts after reading some reviews ,we have been downover 25 times have seen good an bad . Well .....we thought it was not that bad as some people were saying . You can find a crack , bad lite , drip all most anywhere if you go down looking hard enough you will probably find it. We went down open minded and had a great time on new 100 yard wide beach.... close walking to Playa.....great scenery around resort.....food : good drinks : could have had a few more domestic choices.The cost was a great deal .....so go spend a little cash for a big fun time .

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JanWilmington
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third stay at the Allegro Playacar in about 6 years. The location and the wonderful staff have always made it one our favorite vacation spots, but the beach erosion was a detraction. This year, however, we were pleasently surprised to find a magnificent new beach about 80 yards deep, complete with new palm trees and new thatched umbrellas. Also, our unit had just been renovated. John and Jan Sergeant, Delaware, USA

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Week”
Reviews.Author: KobieCalgary
Reviews.Content: The staff at the resort is amazing. Everyone was smiling, friendly and attentive the entire week. The beach has been restored beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: beachlover1962_10
Reviews.Content: I was also a little nervous after reading all the reviews online. This resort is a 3.5 star. I have stayed in nicer resorts but they were 5 star. For those that complain about the resort I don't know what they expect for a 3.5 star and if they paid too much for a 3.5 star they can't blame the resort. We paid about 500 Canadian less for this resort than when I stayed at a 5 star. I found the resort clean and well maintained. The rooms did smell a little musty but that is not uncommon when you are at a beach resort with high humidity. The rooms are basic and clean and we actually liked the hut type rooms it was a nice change from your typical hotel room. We felt like we were in Mexico. The beach is beautiful and a short walk from 5th Ave. We did not have any issues with the time share sales people we just said no we are not interested and they left us alone. The food was good...and there was lots of it. Having lunch available by the pool and beach is a nice touch. Entertainment was ok it is hard for the resorts to compete with 5th ave as there are tons of bars, ect there. I do think it would be nicer to have a covered lounge area with maybe some live easy listening music for the evening as no one really uses the disco and there isn't anywhere to go later other than the smoking bar or the pool bar. Tipping the staff a dollar here and there will be appreciated and get you better service ie water in your room ect. We would go back in a heart beat. For the money we paid it was an awesome deal.

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy this one........”
Reviews.Author: johnnybgood1
Reviews.Content: Great Beach now big and beautiful with all kind of seashells.....renovated last week... Service , Staff, Grounds, Ambience, Food , were excellent....Superb thin crust Pizza and Italian food...Made to order omelettes were exceptional...... Clientele was a great mix of families, couples, newlyweds, seniors, ...half European and half Canadian... --very few Americans......everyone seemed freindly and courteous...wish we were still there.....walk to Playa on the beach, .exceeded expectations......Johnny B.... White Rock, BC

Reviews.Title: “a three star at best”
Reviews.Author: PHIILYGEORGE
Reviews.Content: Worst all inclusive Ive stayed at. Booked thru apple was very overpriced for the quality. Visited other hotels in PLAYACAR that were much nicer, better food, beach entertainment ect.. for less money. ROOMS WERE MUSTY WITH MOLD. Food was ok but far from great seemed recycled from days before. Stay somewhere else for the money. All the bad reviews seemed to come true.If the price was half of what we paid it would have been possibly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - of noisy birds”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Blow_RD
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from Jan. 16 to 27, through Nolitours Cameleon Select. The price was the best part of the trip as we stayed 11 nights for the price of 7. The Cameleon Select rooms are close to the beach, some with ocean views. Request the top floor (they are two-storey, eight suite palapa-style buildings) - if you want to have a better view and more privacy. Negative - your neighbors will hear you well through the paper thin walls. If you are prone to flatulation (loud gas-passing) - you've been forwarned. Also, you won't get away with late-night partying, either in your room or on the balcony. The food was getting repetitious after a few days. Next time, we would change resorts after one week. Don't plan on sleeping in here as birds start their chirping, cooing, etc. at the crack of dawn (ie. 6:00 am) and together with early-bird holidayers on their way to get their am java (whilst talking loudly outside your windows), no doubt you'll be wide awake. So, get up and go for a sunrise walk on the beach - just heavenly. Weather was wonderful, windy at times; beach reclamation was coming along well all along the beach. The taxi to 5th Avenue was $5 and if you walk, about 15 minutes. Don't bother going to Wal-Mart in Playa Del Carmen - it's not what we are used to in Canada, and definitely no deals. Rather go to Soriana's in PDC, its tidy and better prices too. The Nolitours rep was very helpful and available in the lobby for any questions and concerns we had. In fact, the best rep service we have had in all our trips to Mexico. As we like to go to a different resort each time, we would not go back to here again. But, if you get a good deal, try it. It's not a five-star but then we didn't pay for one either. Oh, and don't forget a clock for your bedside, as there wasn't one in the room. Bring extra facecloths and hangers, as there was no an abundance of these. The in-room safe is digital but must pay $2 day to use it. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: PatnLou
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 11 night stay at the Allegro - Great Place! The best asset the hotel has it its staff. The staff there is awesome! They make you feel welcome and at home - just like family. They go out of their way to be accommodating, fun and helpful! Our room in Hacienda 28 was very clean (Dulcie made the cutest towel critters!) and the A/C worked very well. The grounds were very well kept. The pool activities staff were very enthusiastic. The bartenders at the bars really knew how to mix great drinks! The buffet food was always plentiful and a lot of variety. People who complain about this resort are full of beans! This is a 3 1/2 star resort and it definitely reaches and surpasses its mark.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Eavabug
Reviews.Content: I wouldn’t rate this hotel as a three and a half star like its rated on expedia but it’s at least a solid three. There were some problems but that’s to be expected at a place that sees thousands of people each year. The location is within walking distance to the town of Playa del Carmen and is located in a gated community which made it nice for us to let the kids walk around without feeling like we had to be right with them. Our only complaint is the timeshare people. I know purchasing a timeshare is big money for hotels like this but it’s rather annoying to those of us who have no interest what-so-ever in purchasing them. As said in other reviews the beach is pretty much non-existent don’t blame the hotel for this since they have no control over Mother Nature. The kids actually loved the sandbags. They used them as slides, ladders, and everything else you can imagine. The rooms themselves could use some improvement but we didn’t go to Mexico to lie around in our rooms all day. If you’re planning on spending much time in your room then I would advise staying at a spa or a five star resort. Try to remember when you find a hotel like this for hundreds of dollars less then the next all inclusive hotel there is a reason. Although this is a very accpectable hotel it’s not the RUI nor does it claim to be.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jungle204
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was kinda like what are we getting ourselves into. As soon as we got there it was always friendly service, Rooms were ok you don't spend alot of time in there, you are on vacation for the nice weather. Food was great even for a vegentarian. Juan the the extursion organizer was great I recommend going to the xplor park with zipling and cave swimming. It was awesome. We liked this resort because it was smaller close to the beach and alot of activities to do throughout the day. This was one of the best hotels we have been to in awhile!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service, but Definately a solid 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoodchildWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Service at this hotel was the best we have ever had from the bar staff to the cleaners. Very friendly and the english was very good. Tips make the service even better and only a couple of dollars at breakfast and dinner. A few to the bartenders. Tip by the pool and you will never have to get your own drink the whole day!! Location in Playacar was great. 20 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen or $5 US cab ride. Weather was unseasonably cool for this time of year. Food was very good. My husband in on a restricted diet and was able to find something at every meal. If you can't find something to satisfy you then you are too picky. Fresh fruit at every meal was amazingly sweet. Rooms were clean. Could us a little updating in the shower area though. Tables, chairs & hammocks on your patio area. Smaller property compared to others in the area, but is nice not to have to walk 10 minutes back to your room if you forgot your sunglasses. The Occidental Grand Flamenco next to Xcaret has a shuttle service from the beach to your rooms and is a massive property. No thanks! Pool area was always well kept and had plenty of chairs so no need to put towels out at 7:00 am to get a spot. There was a very tiny beach but the hotel said by next year it should be built back up. Nightly entertainment was surprisingly good. The majority of guests are European 25% from Italy, 25% from Germany 25% from the UK and 25% from Canada/US. This property was advertised as a 4 Star and is definately not, but is a solid 3 Star even a 3 plus. There is nothing bad I can say about this property or staff. Just be prepared for a 3 star vacation spot. We got great value for what we paid and defintely consider returning to this property. Can't say enough about how great the Staff were!

Reviews.Title: “Stay well clear!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shysterLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: If you are used to a nice home & surroundings stay well clear of this hotel. Rooms disgusting unclean and shabby wouldn't even keep our dog in it, be warned it's disgusting & horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Try another resort instead.”
Reviews.Author: cancun_Traveler_2009
Reviews.Content: Pros: Water is good, sand is good, nightly shows, cool idea of the rooms in hut/bungalow type buildings. Cons: Small beach, small pools, no jacuzzi, unfriendly front desk staff, small resort overall, small lobby, only 3 restaurants with poor variety of food from day to day, if your room is on the second floor you will have mosquitoes feasting on you, no fitness center, no doctor in the hotel, no alcohol in drinks (have to constantly tell the bartenders to pour more) P.S. Not sure if it was good value but I would probably recommend airport transfer service so you don't have to worry about transportation to/from airport. Tours on the other hand seem to be way overpriced. Don't get more than one tour if you're staying only a week. Just enjoy the sand and the water. You can always walk to the beach of the other hotels, just can't use the lounges there. I would definitely not recommend this hotel, it seems like there were much better ones in the vicinity and I've been to a better one 20 minutes south of Playa Del Carmen in 2005, I wish I could remember the name of it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to much going here”
Reviews.Author: maxandmarianne
Reviews.Content: This place is outdated, dirty rooms (horrible towels, blood on blanked, cockroaches, ants and lots of mosquitos in our room). They promised us to send a guy with insect spray, nobody showed up after waiting a couple of hours. No beach (well, just a very little strip of sand, swimming is uncomfortable, rocks just below the surface, lots of seaweed). The bar is horrible, it's just a hole in a wall with some big pillows to hang out in front of it. If you want luxury and bling bling don't go here, check the neighbours (the Reef). If you're not to demanding you can certainly go here but check the rates, we paid to much for this place that really needs a big upgrade. There's no fitness ( we were told there was a place to work out) and also no room serive. The restaurants are ok, staff is friendly. The rooms are very noisy, you can hear every little thing your nieghbours are doing. We we're lucky, we had quit neighbours but you are really [--] when you have loud speaking persons next door. Keep that in mind! Certainly not 4 stars (as the travel agency told us). Max 3 i would say.

Reviews.Title: “Are these towels supposed to be white?”
Reviews.Author: jujudetroit
Reviews.Content: Traveled many times to inclusive resorts, this was the worst. Rooms were disgusting! Bathtub and shower curtain had mold all over it, sink had a film of mold and was gross. Soap dish was moldly! Toilets backed up consistanly, because you had to throw your toilet paper in the trash can. Pool was filthy, pool lounge chairs were covered with seagull poop and were never cleaned. Wouldn't tell my worst enemy to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the dough”
Reviews.Author: poopee19
Reviews.Content: Went to the Allegro for a Christmas break, was very pleased with the place the food was average but plentiful, the room was very well cleaned everyday had lots of hot water acatully to hot had to turn down or would get burned (building 26) the service was very good, if your not cheap and tip a little your drink never goes dry and get service around the pool never had to leave my lounge chair. The beach is small but if you can read the reviews all said that before we left. The nightly shows were very well done and quite entertaining, the Christmas Eve dinner and show was very good and there was tons of food and drink, the night bar away from the Disco was nice and relaxing and a great place to meet other guests and have good conversation, The groungs were immaculant and clean. The location was great 20 min walk to town and a $5 cab if you want. We had 3 boys aged 20,20,23 with us and they had agreat time and met lots of people around the resort band at the Pool during the day, the activites people had lots plannned and the boys were in there glory, then again they are very outgoing and get involved in everything so they had a great time. Overall a good place to go in your not picky but reading some reviews if someone is'nt kissing your butt the whole time it's not good, so if that's what your looking for don't go here, besides the easy going people in the world don't what you there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Some reviewers need to learn the difference between a 3 star resort and a 4 star resort.”
Reviews.Author: Treewhale
Reviews.Content: Could this resort be better? Sure. It is old, the rooms could use a refurbishment, the pool bar is a bit understaffed, and the food, while of very good quality, could stand a bit more variety as you are seeing the same things over and over by the end of the week (this didn't stop me from getting the same breakfast every day of the trip). The beach is small and loaded with sandbags to prevent further erosion. If you flush toilet paper, you will clog the toilet eventually. So that having been said, This is not a 4 or 5 star resort, and doesn't pretend to be. The grounds are beautiful. The people who have complained about the "steep hill" from the beach to the dining room must be incredibly out of shape, it gains 8 feet in 70 yards, one flight of stairs is much harder work. The TV in the room (gasp) is not a flatscreen hi-def! Dear God! How will we survive? Perhaps by going outside and enjoying the weather! The location is great - a short walk to Playa Del Carmen and all the cool stuff there. The food was very well made and there was a huge selection every day. If you couldn't find something to eat, you must have been blind or so picky that the only acceptable food is a happy meal. You are in Mexico. I think you ought to consider eating some of the mexican options placed before you instead of waiting for the steak and fries. People have complained that the staff wouldn't bring them a drink on the beach or by the pool. carrying a couple of USD singles or a few pesos in your pocket To Insure Prompt Service has an effect similar to placing your right hand directly on the bar all the way from the beach. The most I ever tipped the beach/pool waiters was $3.00 a day, and they were bringing me drinks I never even ordered. Remember folks, just because it says on the website that gratuity is included in your trip doesn't mean that the people who tip $5 a day in the right hands aren't going to get all the service while you sit stewing and waiting for a margarita that will never come. Speaking of service, if you want your teenagers not to drink while you are in Mexico, good luck. Maybe get a henna tattoo on their forehead that says, "NO ALCOHOL" If you leave them at home, they'll drink while you are gone anyway. If your kid is 17 and you don't want them drinking, an all-in resort is not the place for them. Good luck at Disneyland. You get what you pay for at this resort. Are there better resorts? Of course there are! That is the nature of a 3 star resort. This resort is a very good 3 star resort. If you want modern rooms, american-style food, 300 channels of cable and a huge beach artificially rebuilt after the hurricane, pay the extra 300 bucks per person per week and go to one of those resorts. We don't need to have our cheap holiday ruined by listening to the person in the next lounger whine.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: foohbah
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the other reviews we took the view that is was a cheap week and you get what you pay for, so if you are OK with the following but get a deal then go food - boring, left overs reappear for lunch everyday bars - unimaginative, understaffed, under-provisioned they frequently ran out of key cocktail ingredients. The main bar is located in the dining room on the 2nd floor, there are very few comfortable places to hang other than the beach loungers. rooms - old need refurbishment, we moved from 3114 to the other side of the resort as the generator noise was so intrusive, towel rail falling of the wall, hairdryer only had 1 speed not 2, cable reception bad and very limited choice, the bath towels i would only use for my dogs beach - tiny location - good for trips and walking to Playa reception staff - apart from 1 guy pretty poor and then they try and hit you up for up-selling the first club. This hotel is 20 years old and looks and feels it We wouldn't stay here again, the Wyndhams looked nice, the Riu and the Royal excellent but much more expensive, having said al of this we have stayed in worse places!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: livenloven
Reviews.Content: I really loved this place. It was a great location for tours and to see the sites. Food and entertainment were great. The best part this place wuld be the peole who work here!! The staff who was in charge of entertainment and leisure activities thorughout the day made my trip fabulous!!! They truely were the best and I plan on visiting again in a month or so. I can honestly say I fell in love!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are horrible! When we arrived a guy at the front desk named Santiago was very rude and had a really bad temper.”
Reviews.Author: jessUs
Reviews.Content: Less than 2 star hotel. We stayed 7 nights and not payed too much, and not did not expect too much. But this hotel was worst than what I expected. Very dissapointed with the rooms! I believe that all bathrooms at this hotel have problems, toilets, sinks, showers etc. We changed rooms 4 times, all rooms had problems. Bad service at front desk!! Food is not good, they serve the same food every day. Very small beach. I hope you think twice about staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: iswimfaster
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here and have a few things to point out that I think would be helpful. Number one -if you expect the rooms to be pristine, forget it.. They are old and worn and in need of updating. The rooms were acceptable for the amount of time we spent in them. The grounds are beautiful and the 2 pools were large, clean and warm. All of the employees we met were friendly and helpful. I thought the food at the buffett was good. The Italian restaurant food was not very good but presentation and service was above average.It seemed as though they were trying hard. The Mexican restaurant was much better. The beach is almost non-existant, with just a very small area for lounge chairs. It looks as though this is due to erosion. This was a very inexpensive vacation for us but if I could find a resort with nicer rooms for 10-15% more I would pay it. Other wise I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: P-Diddle
Reviews.Content: If you have ever enjoyed the true hospitality and attention to detail at some of the Mayan Riviera resorts then you will be very disappointed. I've read that the staff is friendly, compared to what? Nothing like the other hotels - here your requests are like an intrusion to their lives. The food - I lost weight - Was the same thing day after day and not good at all. The beach is as everyone says, almost non-existent. I've read in other reviews that you could go to the adjoining beaches - yea right - try it and they swarm down from the other hotels to kick you off and tell you to leave. I was traveling with 3 girls ages 15,16,17. Amazingly I turn my back for a minute and they all end up with alcoholic beverages compliments of the staff who told them it was OK, just don't let the non-existent security see you with them.. Room keys, I believe anyones room key will probably work on any door - We had two rooms and the keys from one certainly worked on the other. The rooms being outdated and in ill repair is an understatement - everything you read in other reviews about their poor state is dead on and I would add that they are about half the size of other hotels rooms. They say you get what you pay for - in the case of the Allegro this saying does'nt hold true - you get less. I stongly reccommend spending a little more and going somewhere else. I've been to the Bahia Principe 3 times and would strongly reccommend it over the Allegro anyday. I'm generally an optomist and look for the good where ever I can - the "good" here was in leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 2 times 5 & 6 years ago. This time VERY disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: bjretired
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff are friendly and the property is kept beautiful. However, the rooms need repair!!!!! Tub looks very old and doesn't drain while showering. Water above ankles by the time your done. Makes you really wonder if anything is backing up into tub! Yuk!. Also, sink doesn't drain either. Mirror on wall is rusty. Rust on base of toilet. The bath towels are DISGUSTING!! Probably would wash my with car with them. Ya, dingy grey and are stringy along edges. Never seen anything like it. Everyone talked about the towel. Beach towels bad also. Room keys didn't work well. Beach bar was understaffed as 15 people waiting to get drinks. Rarely was offered a drink around the pool. Even though the staff were friendly they didn't seem as attentive as before or in comparison to other resorts. Also, NO perks for staying multiple times. Not going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Serious lack of security”
Reviews.Author: Tiilie
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband, two grandchildren) stayed at the Allego Playacar (12/9/09 - 12/15/09). We booked two adjoining rooms. While we found the place serious lacking in several areas (rooms smelled, air conditioner never worked properly, phone never worked at all, extremely small beach) We decided to make the best of it. On our second night, around 11:20 p.m., while I was sleeping in room 2814 with my grandaughter, a drunken man used his key card, entered our room, and started to argue "what are you doing in my room?" I screamed, tried to call security, and found out the phone did not work. The door between our rooms had swung shut, so my husband could not come to help. After I had called security (from his phone) I also discovered that neither of the rooms windows would lock, and could quite easily be slid open from the outside. I and my grandaughter were upset and frightened. We walked up to the lobby and requested that the locks be reset, and the windows locked. The night manager, Manuel, took care of our request, but the general attitude was that it was no big deal. It still frightens me to think of what could have happened. The phone in our room was never fixed. I know I should have doubled locked the doors (and certainly did thereafter) but with two kids running from room to room, this was overlooked. We travel quite often, and have stayed in many different hotels, and I have never had an experience quite like this.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation experience for those who don't need luxury.”
Reviews.Author: chlovis
