Reviews.Content: We just got back from enjoying a great week. We read all the mixed reviews and were a little apprehensive but our stay was fine. The staff was the friendliest we've ever had. The beach was very small because of erosion but the water was warm and inviting. There are a string of adjoining hotel beaches which you can walk to along the beach with more sand and there was generally a mix of calmer areas and waves to frolic in. There are two clean warm pools adjacent to the beach; one with volleyball and water aerobics and a larger one which was never too crowded to swim. There was stretching, step aerobics and dance lessons by the pool, pretty lame but still something to do. The food and drinks were good and plentiful. We ate in the Italian restaurant one night and although the presentation was elegant the food wasn't nearly as good as the buffets; if you do use the restaurant we found the only excellent thing on the menu was the shrimp entree. The buffet had a wide selection and the meals hours were long enough that it never felt crowded.The nightly shows were a lot of fun. Our room was near the stage and we were worried but the shows end promptly at or before 11 pm and we never heard noise after that and slept soundly. The crowd was very mixed, from families with young children through singles, couples and up to seniors like ourselves. There was a separate early show for the kids. The grounds were beautifully maintained and there was plenty of lounges available. However the resort was not full so we don't know if gets more crowded in the high season. The room was adequate but the bathroom was pretty beat up and the air conditioning was barely enough but not as cool as we're used to and you need the ceiling fan in addition to the AC to keep it somewhat comfortable. To sum up, this was a terrific value, very relaxing and if you're not too fussy about the room or the size of the beach you should have a wonderful time. There were signs around to not throw paper in the toilet; my guess is that some people did and some didn't but I wouldn't let that deter you as I was told that this is common in Playacar. It's definitely a place we would go back to!

Reviews.Title: “Come with low expectations”
Reviews.Author: joshpad2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Allegro Playacar extremely disappointed. I will give a quick a simple outline of the stay. The staff is great, very personable and helping. The hotel hammers you on the exchange rate, 11.50 pesos per USD while the in-town exchange is anywhere from 12.50-14.00 pesos per dollar, so exchange on 5th avenue. Rooms are less than to be desired; musty, bug issues, out dated TV's and decor, however the staff did a great job of cleaning. The grounds were immaculate. The food was horrible. Reservations were required each night for "The Mexican" and "The Italian" otherwise you were stuck with their buffet. Might I remind you the specialty restaurants could only handle 15-20 reservations per evening, so plan on eating the buffet. Don't buy your excursions through the hotel, they rip you off. Go to Plaza Playacar and there are excursion booths that had great deals for us. We paid $85 a piece for Xel Ha vs. $99 at the hotel, $55 for 4-wheeling vs. $85 at the hotel, and rented scooters for the entire day in Cozumel for $30. The staff did a great job with the nightly shows. The main point, when you arrive you will see the resorts that border Allegro and you will understand why you should have reconsidered. I recommend that you do your homework and maximize your experience in Playacar. The area is beautiful and has much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed! Believe the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: ksecary
Reviews.Content: I have read alot of reviews about resorts and found people just generally like to complain. For example; when I read the reviews about the Riu Jalisco in Nuevo Vallarta there were some complaints about the property and the food, however I found it to be a wonderful resort, good food, beautiful property, great rooms, etc. So when I read the complaints about Allegro Playacar I just thought they were the same, very picky people complaining. Not So! The food really is bad, and it is the same every night, they just change the names depending on if it is French night, Carribean night, etc. Breakfast was okay, the other meals were not good. I actually came home lighter, which is usually hard to do with 3 buffets a day. The beds really are hard, they are a mattress laid on a cement slab. You really can't flush paper down the toilet. The beach really is non-existant. On the plus side; the grounds are well kept and the staff is nice, but that didn't make up for the bad food and bad rooms. We had a 6 day package and I actually paid a fee to come home 2 days early.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Lodging”
Reviews.Author: tpearson65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to the Riviera Maya several times and have stayed in all types of lodging. We always read the trip reports from past guests for the location that we are considering. We feel that this is the best way to prepare for what the place has to offer. Weather it is good, bad, or indifferent. Having said that, let me say that just about all of the reports given for the Occidental Playacar are accurate. There are good things as well as not so good things about this resort. I'll begin with check in. Friendly staff, with moderate English skills. After check in, you will be greeted by a resort employee that will give you a brief tour of the resort. Keep in mind that this person will attemp to enroll you in a Occidental Vacation Club presentation. A "gift" will be offered if you participate in the 90 minute sales pitch. This is similar to time share, but with a different concept. My wife and I decided to go along with the offer to hear the presentation. For our time, we were given round trip Cozumel ferry tickets as well as a return shuttle to the airport (value $95 US). Although the Vacation Club offer would be appealing to some travelers, we just said that it wasn't for us. The sales representative simply said OK and sent us on our way. As for the grounds, very beautiful and well maintained. The beach is non existent in front of the resort. However, we took a couple of opportunities to stroll the beach to either side. About 1 mi south of the resort, will be the end of the hotel zone and empty sandy white beach. As for the room, it was a bit dated but clean. This IS Mexico, and there is a musty smell. However, after a while it's not noticable. We had an issue with our shower head on the first day and called the front desk the following morning, and by late afternoon it had not been fixed. I simply took the shower head off, took it to the front desk and said "I need one of these". About 30 minutes later, a maintenance guy showed up with a new shower head. The last day of our stay, we noticed that the air conditioner was not blowing cold air. Again, we notified the front desk of the issue around 6 PM. We returned to our room around midnight to discover that the repairs had not been made. I called the front desk again, and a maintenance guy showed up about 10 minutes later. By this time, it was too late to do anything to fix it. We simply opened the windows to the cool sea breeze and slept well. The food is typical all inclusive food. A good all around breakfast, tasty hamburgers and pizza by the pool at lunch, and a variety of dinner buffet options. Reservations are required at the specialty restaraunts a least one day in advance. We chose this resort simply because of a travel agency's incredibly cheap deal, and spent a large amont of our time away from the resort because there are soooo many other things that we enjoy doing around the Rivera Maya. The entertainment staff works hard to keep everyone entertained and we did catch their "Las Vegas Show" night and had a great time. Lots of lip syncing and dancing, with some laughs in between. One just has to understand that this is an "affordable" type of accomodation. If enter into, not expecting 5 star accomodations, this is a good place to stay. However, we are a more adventurous type of vacationer and will probably not return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you expected”
Reviews.Author: irek1977
Reviews.Content: All the best for the value. Just small beach is the down side but fighting against tornados is not easy. Bryliant place with easy reach to city centre. Good staff and animation. 2 swiming pools with bars, etc. 2 restaurants including the traditional mexican food. One day trips by hired car to all culture centres - much chipper than orginized trips. The hotel provided us with just what we wanted from our holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: unauva
Reviews.Content: Lovely place that lives up to it's stars. Friendly, hardworking staff, tasty food and beautiful scenery. The pool goes right up to the beach/ocean, so you can have an amazing view of everything while in the pool. Scenic 15 minute walk into downtown Playa del Carmen. If you don't want to drop a lot of money, but still want a nice vacation, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice place for the money !!”
Reviews.Author: lovethembuckeyes
Reviews.Content: When arriving we too were followed by a girl selling trips ...we ignored her and walked away, no one ever bothered us the rest of the week. Our 1st room 1603 was up towards the front was musty and toilet didnt work vey well. We then moved to 5603 alot nicer closer to the water and the pool. It dont take much to change rooms they were good about that. We also got approached by the same guy in previous comments on 5th Ave except he said a different name. He takes you from shop to shop he says he owns but actually they are his family. He is a BIG lar you will know him by the skin tag on the left side of his face kinda like a wart thing. He dont work at the hotel he is a rip off artist. Ignore him and walk away. Staff was fun esp. the guys at the Baraccuda rentals down by the pool...funny & helpful ...Hola George!! I would go there again for sure they even have top shelf liquor just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Brookie2
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Occidental Allegro Playacar. It is an ideal size, great location and very good service. The beach is a little on the thin side but the quality of the sand and amazing blue water make up for it in spades. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: slackdawg
Reviews.Content: The staff at Allegro couldn't have been friendlier or more accomodating. It was a pleasure to speak with them in our broken Espanol and they always responded in good cheer, with humorous attitudes and instructional assistance. The food was almost always top-notch. Can't say that they know how to do Italian in the restaurant, but that is a minor complaint. We enjoyed fantastic breakfasts every day and terrific dinners every evening. The rooms aren't near Westin quality, but we found ourselves pleasantly oriented by the basic approach of the Allegro. Showers were hot, toilets flushed, towels were renewed, etc. We slept very soundly in our room, which was midway between the lobby and the beach. No noise from the late-night disco. Watch out for that, when booking your room. One major complaint: We were harassed by the Tour Guide Operators, at first. They insisted on drawing us into booking excursions (Xcaret, Xel-HA, etc.) claiming that they had the best prices. Fact is, you pay far less at the entrances of these attractions. A basic entrance to Xcaret, for example, was $79. The people at the hotel want you to pay $99 for the exact same admission. Don't ever book through the tour guides at the hotel. They are there to rip you off. They called us and woke us up at 8am for the first several days of our stay, until we had to tell them to "back off." Very unpleasant. Despite the lack of a deep sandy beach, we very much enjoyed the warm Caribbean waters in front of the Allegro. They have "Geotubes" in place, to abate the erosion. One or two of the shows were a bit hokey, but mostly they were very sincere efforts (some of the staff appear in the shows) Often, the entertainers were quite excellent. Kind of a Mexican vaudeville of sorts. Unfortunately on our last evening, we experienced some plumbing difficulties, and were moved to another room. Their infrastructure and systems are a bit aged, but mostly functioned well. There are a few agoutis and iguanas on the property, little creatures which are quite delightful. Lots of mynah birds as well. In all, a terrific vacation and a very good value for the money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at a great price”
Reviews.Author: travelswith2teens
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend all day in a chair on the beach with hundreds of others doing the same, pick one of the other hotels to the north or south of this one. If you enjoy moving around a bit more, this is a great place to be based out of. Having saved $1,000 for our family of four (compared to the next price up for an all-inclusive), we used the money to rent a car for 2 days and stayed in a hotel near Chichen Itza for a night. We climbed Ek Balam, swam in the cenote at Dzitnup and had Chichen Itza practically to ourselves at closing. The next day we rode bikes at Coba, swam at Tulum and hit one more cenote. We also booked the Rio Secreto underground river/cave tour from the hotel. We enjoyed the buffets and both of the a la carte restaurants at the hotel. Staff were great. Evening entertainment was fun. We participated in a few poolside activities and enjoyed walking the beach and swimming. If you walk south you can have a gorgeous beach to yourselves with no sandbags. There are ruins to explore on the walk to Playa del Carmen and the taxi ride back is cheap. The only negative comments I have are that the rooms are pretty basic and have some maintenance issues and, what they refer to as the disco is a musty smelling bar with a pool table. My kids enjoyed playing pool after dinner while waiting for the show to start though. Hard to believe we packed so much in to one week. All around - a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Gariukas
Reviews.Content: Travel to Mexico at least twice a year. This is the first time we returned to a resort we had visited before. Small, quiet and clean with a great staff. The location is close enough to Playa to walk if one is in fairly good shape. In my opinion,the food served is the best I have had in Mexico, be it a smaller selection. The beach used to be beautiful, but Wilma did a great deal of damage, noticeably reducing its size.

Reviews.Title: “last minute trip - great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: snorkelgirl61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this as a last minute trip 3 days before our departure. For the price with air, this was a great value. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the grounds are immaculate. We had a top floor unit that was a perfect distance from the beach and pool area - room 3214. It only rained one day for about 20 minutes in the late afternoon, and so we never experienced leaks from the palapa roof as mentioned in another review. Our King size bed was extremely comfortable compared to many other beds in hotels we have stayed at in Mexico. The shower / bath area was fine with an adjustable shower head and plenty of hot water. The towels are large and are fine. It was great to have the balcony with the little table and chairs and hammock to sit and chill with cocktails and watch the sun set, and to hang our suits out to dry each evening. We unplugged our unit telephone immediately upon our arrival, and did not get hassled even once about time shares or anything else. Our last night we requested a wake up call, so plugged the phone back in and were awakened by a cheerful voice at exactly the time we asked. The beach is rather small, but we met a geologist who was doing gps measurements of the area and learned from him that the state will be expanding the entire beach another 30 to 50 meters at the end of 2009. If the beach were larger for our stay, it would have been a nearly perfect experience. The noise from the near by "activity" pool could be a bummer at times while laying on the beach, but fortunately the crashing of the waves drowned most of it out or just made it a faint background sound. The food isn't fabulous. Breakfasts were our favorite meal as far as options and quality. We always found something to eat though, and never went hungry. I do not eat beef or pork and was able to make do with other options as there was always chicken and fish or vegetarian pizza, fruit, etc. We ate at the Italian restaurant twice, and enjoyed those dinners the best. The baked goods were very, very good. The ice cream is also quite delicious. 2 of our days we took a taxi to Akumal to snorkel - it cost 600 pesos round trip, so around $50, which we felt was well worth it. The driver will wait for you as long as necessary. Depending on where you go in Akumal, there may be an additional parking lot fee - no big deal. We love snorkeling and so we spent one day with giant green sea turtles that feed and nest in the water and beach area behind the dive shop, which was amazing. The other day we went to a snorkeling lagoon area / park in Akumal called Yal Kuu which was also amazing and cost an additional 110 pesos per person if you are not staying directly in Akumal or are a resident. Again, well worth it. If you are going here you should bring eco friendly sun block, as Akumal is like a snorkeling nature preserve, and they don't allow toxic sun block. We had a wonderful time and met very nice people from all over the world. We did avoid the nightly "shows" - not our style - although it looked like they always had a good crowd attending. This place was a great last minute get away.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Yorkieteacher
Reviews.Content: We had a quick stop in Playa and wanted to stay only one night in an all-inclusive. Found this hotel while surfing another hotel's internet in the location we were. Called in route to make reservations, and were told we could only get that low rate on-line, so we had to call family back in the States to book it for us. When we arrived, the staff was a little cool while we were checking in, but the staff member who took us to our room was very friendly. We wanted beach front, and luckily were in the units right on the beach. Some units are far away from the beach. Our room location made this a remarkable stay. The beach and pool were right outside our door. They had a Mexican fiesta that night for dinner, and a huge breakfast buffet. The drinks were very good and not watered down. The grounds, pool, and buildings are well-maintained. If we could get this rate again, we would return for another stay. The only negative for us was it is in a very crowded location, and we usually prefer more secluded beaches

Reviews.Title: “Try to go somewhere else, really”
Reviews.Author: blauerMond
Reviews.Content: Location is not a problem for this hotel, it is situated 1.5 km away from the center of Playa del Carmen, so you walk there without a problem, there are other hotels in this area, so you have many others to choose from. We arrived at 2:00 am due to a problem with our flight, so the check in was quiet and fast. No share time sharks that day. In the morning they tried to talk to us but since I had read about them I just firmly told them I would not discuss that. Thanks. I think that was enough since they never tried again with us, but again I didn't use my polite face, sorry. When we got there it was raining, so going to our room was dangerous: we were about to fall for at least 2 times, but we didn't think this through that night. The first room we were given was right in front of the pool in the ground floor (5602) it was fine (with 2 beds, not one how I reserved but ok, no fuss) but being in front of the pool meant a lot of noise and people, it also meant we wouldn't be able to open the curtains during the day... we asked for another room and was given the 3814, not so near the beach but quiet and on the upper floor. This was good until it started to rain (from 8 days, we had 6 days of rain :( ) it seems that the roof can't take heavy rain, you get leaks right away, good thing is that the leaks did not touch our bed (unlike the next room, the Canadian couple there had the leaking right in the bed! they were sent breakfast at their (wet) bed for the inconvenience) but it made the floor wet and dangerous. Almost starting our 4th day there, still with the rain, my companion fell down the stairs because everything gets SO incredibly (really unbelievably) slippery with rain. We had to ask for an ambulance, go to the hospital, spend the night there, etc. I called the hotel from the hospital, asking if they had insurance: the answer was NO !! how can they have no insurance?? outrageous! Anyway, apart from the stress, pain, extra expenses, rib contusions, tour cancellation... that it caused us, when we talk about it with one of the managers (or so) he said the hotel can not bear responsibility for the fall, since they have signs which say it is slippery: well yes, I can read, but reading didn't help my companion not to fall (walking cautiously since everything was so wet from rain). For their bad luck, I'm an architect and know the minimal things they could do to solve this problems at least in stairs. I told the manager this, along with asking them to do something about it, because people staying here are in danger!! (I saw many older people and I'm sure some would not be as lucky with such a fall) I asked for the refund of at least the night we had to spend at the hospital but they said it was not possible. They offered a dinner. A DINNER, it's a joke right? a dinner and we would have to sign something taking away our right to make future complains (like legal ones, I assume).. no way. So the rest of our 4 days we had to stay indoors (of course, I had to ask for yet another room, near the reception and on the ground floor again: funny smell, electricity circuit failing and barely hot shower No.1604) since he was in pain, could not really move much, we missed our tour to Tulum.... sigh... Food was average, they like their salt. After 3-4 days you are tired of it. For lunch I had to go for pizza everyday (which was good enough) and my companion took the hamburgers... not really other good options at that time of the day. Breakfast is good, you can always have an omelet. Espresso is good. Dinner is not so good, but well, you will not starve to death. Of course we took most of our dinners out in Playa del Carmen.. much better. Humberto, a waiter in the breakfast buffet and at lunch near the pools is really a nice guy, he was always really nice to us. The grounds are kept perfectly nice and clean. That's about it. Please if you have other options consider them well. I can't recommend this place, at least until they do something about their stairs and floors, which are not adapted for rain. Sorry. Oh, about the beverages: just try pure things, not cocktails. Really not good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not a 5*”
Reviews.Author: eltanocuervo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Its bedrooms and the F&B deparment are 3* according to european standards. Common areas and leisure facilities are pretty good, though. If you plan to make excursions and not to stay in the hotel more than 2 days, then its a perfect choice. Mostly taking into account the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: rss120172
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel online after rave reviews from the agent,on first appearancevery good ,clean and over the top friendly,the following day we were followed around and hassled to buy time share with them,you're hassled when you're by the pool at least every half an hour to go on trips or have a massage,we were put in a room with an adjoining door where we could hear every word the people in the next room were saying,we asked to be moved only to have a german woman trying to get into our new room(reception had given her a key)the air con leaked everywhere and the food gave us and many others stomach complaints,hardly any bars open,no gym,no jacuzzi.The only plus was Natalie the receptionist who really did try to make our stay good.One of the guests even went as far as to say that the food tasted like s***!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation at Occidental Allegro Playacar!!”
Reviews.Author: lehohun
Reviews.Content: Although we got an excellent package deal from a travel agency for two week all inclusive service and flight ticket, not just this is the only reason why we think this hotel is great value. I was a bit concerned about the negative comments and reviews I read here. I found most of them invalid based on my two weeks holiday at this hotel. We stayed there with my wife my 5 years old daughter and 4 friends. HOTEL,LOCATION: 1,5 km (20 min walk, or take a taxi for a fixed 5 USD / 50 Peso one way) from the very centre of Playa del Carmen. Hotel is located in a cozy villa/rest area with nice environment, nice tropiocal plants etc. Hotel has beautiful and well maintained tropical garden with lots of plants too. CHILDREN: I must say we were very happy with the services of kid's club, Ana took good care of our doughter they made together lots of beautiful handcrafts. Pools are great also for children, they have a swalow part wher our child could play in the water the whole day throug when she was not at the kids club. ROOMS: This hotel is different from other hotels on the hotel line in Playacar. This was the only one which had bungalow like buildings ( 8 rooms in one building, 4 upstairs, two each side, and four downstairs. ). The interior of rooms is simple, but it had all amenities we need on holiday ( clean bathroom, TV with some English channels- but we did not really have time to watch TV, I think we did it only onec during 14 days-, fridge with complimentary mineral waters, safe, aircon, fan, coffe/tea maker,closet.)Daily cleaning, daily change of towels, what we did not really needed.The least time actually a man spends while on holiday in an all inclusive hotel is the hotel room, when we were there only with our eyes closed ( sleeping). We liked the rooms anyway. All rooms has a terrace where you have nice hanging beds to chill out in the afternoon after lunch. Some rooms might not have a view or might be at a location not too good within the hotel, do not worry, for a small tip and smile, front desk will be assisting you with changing to a nicer room as soon as they have one available. FOOD: really excellent, despite of some previous review none of us from the party of 7 had any stomack problems, we all loved the food ( variety, taste and quality ). It is said that tap water is not drinkable, not even for washing your teeth, but I did so and did not have any problem at all. Food is very aboundant, if you want you can eat and drink nearly all day long :) . Amazing service at the poolbar, with kind staff, you can order you all inclusive coctails straight from the pool. Coctails are great!Lunch buffet is served by the pool. Dinner is at the main restaurant also great. There are two a la carte restaurants where booking is necesarry, the regular one was so good, so that we did not hassle with the booking. ACTIVITIES:Amazing! Animation team consist of funny guys doing their best to entertain you almost the whole day. Aerobics,aquagym, salsa lessons, Spanish lessons, water volleyball, crazy game in the pool each afternoon, realy really awsome shows every ninght after dinner at the theatre ( dance shows, magician show, mini disco for kids beforehand ). We really appreciated the free sea kayaks and small sailig catamaran we could rent for free on the beach, we spent very enjoyable hours on the beautiful incredibly green sea. SPORTS: I missed the fitness room, but did not really let it spoil my vacation, since on my everyday morning jogging I run 3 kms to a near by gym where local people do the training it was only like 2 EUR. Aerobics and aqagym is held by animation team members. Hotel has tennis court , basketball ground also. We played beach volleyball every afternoon at the neighbouring hotel's baeach. BEACH: Sea is clean and green, sand is increadibly white.Allegro Occidental does not really have a big beach as sea has flushed away due to hurricans. It has a small beach, but if you walk 40 meters you can find a big one. To get rid of "geotubes" (big black whale looking sandbags put along the beach in order to avoid fluishing sand away) you must walk on the beach ( or kayaking - FREE ) 1,5 kms ( towards Tulum ) to the end of the hotels line, there you can really enjoy quiet deserted paradise like private beach with crystal clear water , white sand, and very few people. INTERNET ACCESS: wifi is available in rooms and hotel lobby, even computers are provided in the lobby, but fee is very high in my opinion so we rather went to the nearby (2 min walk) Starbucks where we could have free wifi access in return for buying a hot chocolate, cake or coffee. ( After the first buy you get an access code on your bill, which you can use later too from outside the restaurant , so you don not need buy further coffees the next days, the first code is valid it seems forever :) SPECIAL THANKS TO STAFF MEMBERS WHO MADE US HAVE A LOT OF FUN: Ana from Kid's Club, Stefano,Giovanni,Adan and Ariel from animation team Jorge from front desk Erica and Antonio from restaurant. Kind housekeeping staff After all, I would return and stay here again if I come back to Playa del Carmen.Thanks for the nice stay and wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “relax,kick back and just say no to the timeshare folks”
Reviews.Author: DevonTripster
Reviews.Content: Booked as a late deal so were a bit worried and mixed reviews caused a little concern but went with open minds and the place far and away surpassed expectations! Luckily we had a good rep at airport who warned us (the whole mini bus) that in almost all resort hotels have some timeshare people in hotel/resort uniforms that will be overly attentive at all times but they are there to sell at the end of the day. We simply said no thanks, not interested and apart from them continually saying hi it was never an issue for us. Check -in took 2 mins and we had a room down near the pools with a sea view which was fab. Sure the room smells musty but in that humidity and with thatched roof what else could you expect? If you want sterile ultra modern then stay at a Holiday Inn or something. Beds were harsh but the plentiful alcohol eased that issue. 19hrs a day food and drink available so i cant believe people complain about lack of room service! As a European traveller we are used to Med countries that have low water pressure and where you cannot put paper down the toilet so its not an issue and anyway how much time you gonna spend in there before the cleaner next visits? Staff were really friendly and helpful and sure it wasn't the liveliest place in the evenings but Playa del Carmen nightlife is only 10 mins away in a cab so location wise the hotel is spot on too. Someone here stated the clientele to be 80% European but we found that we were in the minority with most being US or Latin American, no issue with that for us but just to set record straight that its prob a holiday time /seasonal thing if you want to stay 'amongst your own' as it were. All in all i wish we could have stayed longer and yes i have stayed at and been unhappier in, 5+ star hotels in the past ,but went with open mind and rolled with the very very few niggles we encountered. Go and just chill out Carribbean style.

Reviews.Title: “hovel”
Reviews.Author: debs111
Reviews.Content: absolutely rotten given four rooms in one day thomas cook says this hotel is acceptable but they would say that all they want is your money...

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here pay a bit more and stay at one of other HOTELS available in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: dizzy1714
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a holiday at the Occidental (means timeshare) Allegro Playa which I was led to believe was a 4* Hotel when in fact it is a timeshare complex and certainly not 4* but somewhere between a 2/3*. Upon arriving at Cancun the rep from Thomas Cook was nowhere to be seen and I had to find her by asking at a desk I was then directed outside to where I eventually found her. I am used to travelling on my own and finding where everything is but if I were not so independent it would be quite daunting to arrive in another country with absolutely no directions as to where to go to pick up my coach for my resort. Once on the coach no check was made to make sure everyone was on board that should be. We were all handed out a Welcome Pack which had nothing in it except information about who she was and what time the Welcome Meeting was – there is no way you could describe this as a Welcome Pack in a million years. Arriving at the Hotel if you can describe it as such it’s really more of a timeshare complex than a Hotel. I was checked in (the rep Rosa didn’t even come into the hotel with us). I was given a room and told the Bellboy! (Timeshare salesman) would show me to my room. Told me he had a welcome gift for me and would I meet him tomorrow so I said yes. (Don't bother going its a con) I started to unpack and found that the room was swarming with ants they were on the bed, everywhere, the floor was filthy, the covers on the chairs were stained, there was fungus and mould everywhere. I went back to reception and asked to be moved they gave me a choice of 3 rooms and I picked another one out that at least wasn’t as dirty although it had no bath and the shower that was fitted on the wall was for a person no taller that 4ft you needed to sit on the floor to have a shower without having to hold the shower in your hand (not 4*) At least it was cleaner although there was still mould and mildew in the shower and bathroom area – which is really harmful when you breathe in the spores. Bites are a whole new subject - my bed was crawling with I don’t know what, because I couldn’t actually see what was biting me every morning I woke up with bites around my ankles how do you get bitten when you are covered with bed clothes and you have a mosquito plug in the room, anyway they weren’t mosquito bites more like flees or bed bugs. It may even have been from sitting in the restaurant. Who knows? Although the maids came in every day and changed the sheets I think they just turned them upside down. After spending the first 3 hours of my arrival running around I found the restaurant where I sorted myself out and figured out what the process was regarding meals. I had calamari and salad for dinner. Within an hour I found myself sitting on the toilet feeling extremely unwell thank god for all the medicines I had brought with me. I unpacked yet again and went to sleep. Next morning I felt fine but decided not to eat the fish anymore and stick to food that I could see exactly what I was eating. Breakfast was good until I saw the cats walking around the restaurant, and insects walking along the glass shelves above the food after seeing this I always had an omelette which was made fresh in front of you and fruit or yogurts. I waited 15 mins for a waiter to offer me tea or coffee and when it arrived I wished I hadn’t bothered the hot water was tepid and then had to ask for a teaspoon to add sugar which I always had to do as well as always asking for a spoon to eat my yoghurt these utensils should be laid on the table if it were a 4* that is. This complex is just not a 4* hotel and never will be. The waiters are scruffy and dirty looking and expect tips every day if you don’t give them a tip they ignore you - just wouldn’t happen in a 4* hotel and anyway I already paid for my holiday! Went to meet the friendly bell boy who turned out to be a Timeshare Salesman. The Timeshare salesmen and women were situated just outside the reception area behind a rectangular desk where they sat or stood, you could not walk through reception or go to breakfast or dinner without passing these people who made out you were their best friend in the world and who would not leave you alone for love nor money. It made my stay (and many many others) very uncomfortable. I go on holiday to relax and at this particular time I really needed a holiday. Beach what beach there isn’t a beach it was washed away in 2005 when they were hit by a hurricane. This has happened all along the Playacar Beach and it is still being eroded by the sea despite the massive sandbags that have been put on the beach. Lunch was only served in the Polynesian style hut on by the pool, cooked in a kitchen next door to the toilets which stunk and had no locks on the door. Food should have been available from 12-4pm but the snack bar always seemed to run out of the freshly cooked food by 3pm – mmm I wonder why! One plus - the pizzeria – fresh pizzas available from 12-6pm – this became my dinner they were lovely and edible. I don’t know how they have the gall to say there are 4 bars the only bar open during the day is the pool bar and there aren’t 4 bars only 3 and the Crystal bar is only open from 6-10pm (although this isn’t open when dinner is served al fresco) There is only one other bar and that is open from 6pm – 1pm, where at 11pm snacks are available. The food is brought out in what I can only describe as giant BBQ kettles – the food whenever I tried some was always cold as was a lot of the food at lunch time. What I did notice was that it looked like they were using leftovers from the night before both for breakfast and lunch dishes of course I can't prove this. Relaxing time sitting by the pool not a chance in hell - “you want a massage lady free 10 minutes” every day maybe 2 3 times a day. If I want a massage I’ll book one. Although I wouldn’t bother here as the Spa is a room about 12ft square. No way could you describe this as a Spa. The pool, dirty, scum floating around on the top and all round the edges full of dead insects- broken cracked tiles everywhere, dead bird floating around in one of the outlets of the pool for 3 days before the General Manager finally did something about it and that was only because an American who owned a timeshare complained so much. I actually got bitten in the pool whilst swimming – how do you get bitten swimming in a pool? Air Conditioning – none of the facilities have doors therefore the air con really doesn’t work the reception is so hot I really do not know how the staff work there. And of course when it rains as there isn’t a single place to sit because everything is outside you can only stay in your room, you can’t get to dinner and if you have booked the Italian or Mexican and you are late because you have to wait for the rain to stop then the snobby guy in the Italian won’t serve you! Oh and all the rooms are linked by a locked internal door so you can hear everything being said in the room next to you including things you would rather not hear on holiday. Oh yes and where was my rep to complain to! not in the disgusting mouldy, damp, filthy, stinking dirty room behind the stage I wonder why?

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay in this palce again!”
Reviews.Author: koroleva04
Reviews.Content: We arrived in this hotel on 09/28/2009 and hotel stuff were very rude to us when we asked any questions. The worse customer service i had ever recived. We stayed in moldy room and the floors were wet every day after cleanning. The food was not good at all. Even fruits were put up next day from the day before, crazy. On top of that all we by excident left our cashmier blanket that out 8 month son adore and when we tried to get it back they are saying that nobody found anything, yeah right, ofcourse nobody found the blanket because it is not cheap, we are just trying to get it back that is all. Before Occidental hotel we stayed at Dreams Cancun. That is the place i will always reccomend!!!! With a greatest people and customer service. The food was wonderfull. Try there spa with Juanita she is an angel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: sharona1120
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel not knowing what to expect after all the mixed reviews we read. This resort is definately not a 5 star but has enough strong points to make it a great vacation, especially for the awesome deal we got!! We arrived early before it was check in time and our room was already ready for us and we were able to start using the resort right away. We had originally booked a single king bed but got two double beds. I called the front desk and they said that they were booked for the night but would have a new room for us in the AM. After exploring the grounds a little, we realized that we actually had a great location (room 5702) right near the two pools, the beach, and the pool bar so we decided to drop the issue and kept the room given to us. The room was cozy but the shower could have used a little help. A couple dollars left for the the cleaning people goes a long way....everyday our room was cleaned spotless, fridge refilled with water, and beautiful towel animals on the bed. The only downfall was the pretty steep hill that we must have walked up a million times to get to dinner, lobby, other bars, and the show. We just considered it good exercise to work off all the food and alcohol we consumed! Plumbing was an issue....it sucks! There is a sign on the bathroom wall telling you not to throw "paper" down the toilet. Yes, this means toilet paper everyone! I know this from personal experience. After a day of flushing toilet paper down there, our toilet became clogged. I called maintenece and they were there very quicky, within 5 minutes. Plunging didnt work and they asked us to leave the room so they could replace the whole toilet! Food was pretty good. Lots to choose from at any time of the day. Breakfast and dinner are served in the buffet upstairs from the lobby and lunch is served by the pool. They even have a midnight snack from 11-1am. There are also two restaurants that require reservations....good luck! We had a reservation for each and were only a half hour late for the Italian restaurant and they wouldnt let us in and said they were booked for the rest of our trip. The next night we made our reservaton at the Mexican restaurant and it was great! They greated us at the door with a shot of sweetened tequila and the meal was excellent! The beach has definately been shortened by the weather which is very sad because what is left of it is beautiful. White sand and crystal clear water! The sandbags kinda sucked and got in the way a little, but I understand why they are there. The staff were great! Not one complaint in this department. Everyone is super friendly and always says hello to you as you walk past them. Meet them once and they remember you for the rest of your trip. Just to mention a coulple are Jorge from the little shop on the walk way. He isnt like the rest of the guys working the shops in Playa....he doesnt try to just get money from you. Luiz from the front desk area was a big help with some of our questions and always pointed us in the right direction. Manuel at the pool bar was a character and always remembered who we were, where we were from, and what we were drinking(again, a couple dollars goes a long way). The fun club staff were pretty good too. They organized some pretty cool activities during the day and were part of the show at night. Overall it was a pretty good place to spend 5 days. The grounds were beautifully kept and everyone always tried their best to keep you happy while you stayed there. If your not looking for anything too spectacular and you are able to get a good deal at this place, its a pretty decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “stay someone else”
Reviews.Author: jsenx
Reviews.Content: went to the Allegro wth my wife and 3 chldren 17, 13 and 8years of age. The reception on entry was extremley dissapointing since weve stayed at other hotels in mexico before and they have all had the whow factor. After arguing the point that I do not wish to stay at the hotel when allocated a room furthest away from the beach they gave me the coral suite. The view of this room was amazing and it was the best room in the hotel room 5711. We had the whole top rooms but were disappointed that if this were the best rooms at the hotel then I would definately hated the other rooms.We went in low season but as the other reviews state the sun loungers were gone and did go early. One would have no chance in high season. The rooms at times have little ant like insects everywhere especially on the beds urghhh , aircon isnt the best, the fridge is dated and had only 2 bottles of water one would expect some cold beers and some soft drinks but no chance. The food is very average same every night just postioned differently.Cheap house wine is served but if you ask for something better they expect you to pay for it so much for all inclusive. The hotel is understaffed and the drinks seem water downed or replicated with cheap plonk, The staff really need some attention to staff development. We went into the Riu Palace two doors down just to look around and the staff were very attentive and helpful. The actvities staff were by far the most helpful at the Allegro. There isnt much for children the kids club really didnt do much for my 8year old and the other two were quite bored. Some of the watersports you have to pay for which are free at other hotels. Health and safety where do I start. If your old, disabled or have a walking disorder beware, There is steep walk from the swimming pool area towards the buffet reatuarant and walking down the slope is so dangerous that we witnessed a number of people slip.The walkway from the reception to buffet has another slope which is extremley steep and dangerous which I mentioned to management on several occasions which I felt needed addressing, I,m no slouch or unfit i,m actually extremley fit and energetic but felt sorry for those that were not so. The whole complex needs a revamp and attention. Those people who have reviewed and stated that this place was awesome have never stayed at a decent place and nothing to compare against. This is my 4th trip to mexico with my family and the Allegro is the worst hotel ive stayed at it is no way a 4star it is a 2/3 star at best. The niteclub its a run down bar which no one attends with a few flashing lights and a pool/ billard table with torn cloth and you cant play pool on the table with your kids because the bar doesnt open till late and then kids are not allowed in. OH by the way theres NO room service!!!! The good points fantastic views from the pool and our room. Only go here if you get a cheap deal and want a quick getaway with no frills. Any questions dont hesitate to ask?

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway besides the timeshare scam!”
Reviews.Author: sunshineyyy
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I just returned from our stay at the Allegro Playacar from Aug 29-Sept 5. It was a perfect time to go! Low season made our stay enjoyable with little crowds and hot hot sun! My critiques are coming from a 22 year old Canadian traveling with my Mom, just looking for some good relaxing time before the cold winter sets in. Let me warn you so you dont have what happend to us. Everything went very smooth and quickly at the airport, but once you get your bags and go through customs, a welcome host takes you over to what looks like a tour rep. They tell you some information like when and where you get your hotel shuttle, but then they try to sell you good deals on Excursions only if you go to a hotel for an hour and listen to them. DONT BUY INTO IT!!! Its a timeshare, and what we heard even if you do go sometimes they wont give you the deal they promised and you leave just wasting your time. They also do the same thing at the Hotel, which is such a shame because you go to enjoy yourself, not to be bothered everytime you pass by the consierg. But other than that our trip was great!! There were alot of Europeans at this restort. We were told that Playa De Carmen attracts 80% Europeans and 20% North Americans, while Cancun is opposite with 80% Canadian/American and 20% European. Because of this, we found a huge language barrier with other travelers, but its cool to see people from all over the world all sharing a common interest! Our room was halfway between the dinner buffet and the pool/beach. It was a good location. It would have been nice to be closer to the beach but those rooms are usually reserved for VIP (timeshare members) If you have kids, you might want to be far from the theatre because they are pretty loud. The rooms are nice, there is a bit of smell of mildew but we just accounted it for the humidity. The beds are a bit on the hard side, but by the end of the day we were so exhausted it was easy to fall asleep. Theres not much of a sound barrier between the walls and you can hear the blow dryer, TV and phone next door. The food was good but not great. Theres always something to find to fill the belly. I always looked forward to the pizzaria at lunchtime! Lunch is served at the pool, Breakfast and Dinner at the buffet. We did the Mexican ala cart, which was good but they serve SO MUCH FOOD!! Go with an empty belly, we were full by the second coarse!! They offer hair braiding and massage but if you go into Playa Del Carmen you can find a way better price than on the resort. The staff are friendly and helpful. We found the pool bar made the best drinks. The beach is nice, the sandbags are there to keep the rest of the beach from washing away.. they are slippery I'm not sure why people stand on them because I saw many people slip and fall off of them! The water is awesome, no rocks or coral and pure white sand. Theres very few places with shade, so I ended up going down early in the morning to reserve a shaddy spot, and the resort wasnt even full! We enjoyed our stay, it was a cheap last minute deal full of sunshine and tequila! I probably wouldn't go back, but if this is where your going I'm confident you'll have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -shame about timeshare piranahs!!”
Reviews.Author: Desire4travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 12 nights and enjoyed my stay except for the timeshare vultures! The room was nice, one kingsize bed, bathroom, safe, tv (with very little English speaking channels), ok you won't want tv on holiday but when you are fed up reading/chatting etc its a nice alternative. The food overall was excellent.Breakfast was really good, great variety.Lunch was the same.Dinner was a bit samey but I am picky and found something everynight.Also you can eat in the a la carte a few nights dpending on how long you stay. The bar staff were fab, as were the reception.The maid service was poor and I had to repeatedly ring to get things she was supposed to leave and her cleaning standards could be improved. The day and night activites were very good.The night shows were mainly dance which could be varied a little more. The best thing I did on hols was go see the whalesharks with a tour from the hotel organised by Juan Pablo from Lomas tours.It was amazing.Everything from start to finish was superb, from the bus to the boat, to the food on the boat!It was awesome!I heard others around the pool say they had done tours with companies in Playa and they turned out to be extremely poor.You get what you pay for and this was well worth it.Would highly recommend him, he was honest and really well informed and unlike others did not try the hard sell. When I arrived no one bothered with me and I wasn't allowed check in as it was earlier than advertised (even though I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival and was told it would be fine).Other people were being showered wih attention, given drinks and tours.I later realised that these people were being given the vip treatment asthey had purchased someone else's timeshare time and the hotel was eager to sell them a timeshare.This was the downside to the hotel.Everyone kept asking "Do you want a tour?"The tour turned into half a day and it is impossible to get away from them without buying.They are so persuasive and 97% of what you are told is crap so stay away from the timeshare guys! Oh and avoid the massage ladies, they tout for business every day and are most annoying, though not as bad as the timeshare guys! It was mostly families with young or older children and couples.There are two great pools but not much of a beach if that is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday -super value”
Reviews.Author: dixonstalbert
Reviews.Content: We booked a 7 day package here without doing any research because of the unbelievable price. Like most people, we had a terrific holiday. I was concerned when I went through the reviews and saw many really bad reviews along with the mostly favorable ones, so I thought I would post something to address the issues in the bad reviews. 1. the rooms: I have posted the layout of the resort. the rooms are in 58 2-story 8-room huts over a large area. The all-day buffet, the open bar and all the activities are located around the the beachside swimming pool. We ended up in the 2nd level of hut '53' facing away from the sun. This was a perfect location! Our balcony was shaded and the room was cool, but we still had an ocean view from the side and we were close to everything. If you had your mind set on a beach side resort and you ended up in one of the huts several hundred yards from the beach, you won't be happy. I was prepared to pay the $40/day differential (plus if necessary a 'cash donation' to the front desk clerk) to get a beach side room but luckily this wasnt necessary. 2. The beach Although the black 'geotube' sandbags spoil the fantasy of endless white sand, I have posted a picture of the beachfront (the rail is around the pool) . there are breaks in the geotubes where you can swim/play in the waves and bottom is soft sand with no sharp rocks. In the background you can see a guy walking along the retaining wall of hotel on waters edge. On the other side of this hotel is a very long stretch of beach. one morning i walked for an entire hour one-way and could have gone further - very nice and still very beautiful. 3. poolside/ loungers. My wife and I are very fair skinned and despite spf 50 sunblock we burnt to a crisp the first day. The 40 or so palm leave sun umbrellas ('La Palapas') are small and only offer shade to about 60 guests ( who have to 'reserve' them by putting their towel over lounger before 6:30 am and are prepared to fight off poachers all day long) This is not nearly enough shade for a resort that can accommodate 1000 guests. We were lucky in that our shaded balcony was just perfect with its ocean view and ocean breeze. If we didnt have this, I would have gladly spent the 50 peso (about $4.50 US) cab fair to Walmart and bought a cheap beach umbrella. the $40 or so cost would be nothing compared to the cost of the trip and there was always lots of 'full sun' loungers on the resorts beachfront that you could use with your own umbrella without getting into a territorial fight with another sunburnt guest. 4. The Food The main buffet had at least 40 different items. We found the food to be absolutely delicious- if you avoided the 3-4 items that had succumbed to the +100 degree heat. We always found something we liked this wasnt an issue for us. 5. The Bathrooms. Like many places in Mexico, the plumbing system cannot handle toilet paper. You have to put your used toilet paper in the wastebasket beside the toilet. We were used to this and didnt find any noticeable odour. Our room had a 'Lo-flow' toilet that even without toilet paper didnt have the horsepower to properly flush. I discovered if I removed the plastic bag liner from the plastic wastebasket, and filled it with water from the tub, then dumped it in the toilet, it gave a proper flush. If you do this at the first sign of trouble, you will avoid a totally plugged toilet- something you do not want if you have been overeating rich food all week! 6. The TV. our TV was set to pick up 25 satellite channels- all in spanish with occasional in english movie with spanish subtitles. I brought a portable dvd player (actually my laptop) with some movies and TV series on dvd. Our party all-night days are over so we enjoyed this and would recommend it. I was a little hesitant to go on holidays to Mexico in the summer time, but we had a great time and we ending spending less than if we stayed in Canada

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Ariz0naFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family had stayed twice in a different resort on the same beach (Reef Club Playacar). This was our first stay at Allegro Playacar, and there was no comparison. We traveled with two kids (10 + 12) and had a great time. The staff was always friendly and helpful, beginning at the reception, to all the waiting and entertainment folks. The property is beautiful, and kept very clean. The rooms are comfortable with good beds. If possible, ask for a room upstairs, which offers a little more privacy. The food was excellent. People come to expect a wide variety of food at dinner time, but even at lunch time, there was a full buffet, with anything one could possibly expect. This resort offers something for folks that want a quiet, relaxing vacation, as well as those that want to be active and entertained. We strongly recommend that you visit the various Mayan sites (don't miss Coba), as well as the extraordinary 'Selvatica' zip line tour through the jungle. Make the Allegro Playacar your place to stay on your next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Our First Visit”
Reviews.Author: annbillNJ
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the good. The waiters were great,very friendly, very helpful,and most of all very professional. We are putting the pictures of our favorite waiters on this review, these guys were great,Umberto was very funny, good guy,Manuel,Hermelindo,and Encarnacion were all very good at their jobs and a asset to the hotel. oops i can't forget Eric he was the youngster of the bunch real good kid. Our hostess at the restaurant was named Eva, she was absolutely wonderful, always had a smile for us, spoke and understood english well. We really enjoyed seeing her smiling face when we went to eat dinner. Unfortunately our last night there was also hers.Allegro lost a good asset and wonderful person.If any other hotels reads this they should really think about hiring her.... she's very good. We found the food to be pretty good there was plenty to eat. No need to go hungry here. We thought that Mexican night was the best night for food.mmmmm it was good. But i must say we were satisfied with the food everyday. Our main Complaint about the food was that the food that should of been cold salads/drinks/fruits,were not close to being cold. was little better than lukewarm. maybe its an American thing. Again First the good.... Our room was plenty big, being a time share owner we had a two room suite,bedroom and living room two bathrooms plenty of closet space it was very clean, well stocked with towels washcloths ,beverages adult and kids... the room was also spotless thanks to Conchis she did a wonderful job and took very good care of my wife and I. we enjoyed talking to her as best we could, her english was spotty and my spanish was even worse... BUT we did manage very well... she was great . Ok now the not so good... the bed was a king size but was like sleeping on the floor. I slept on the couch 5 nights out of 7. had 2 tvs but only 1 worked and not the one in the living room. I did report it to the club one desk . they thanked me and that was that, nothing was done to fix the tv.Oh and very little in the way of watching tv in english... I know its a vacation but you'd be surprised how much you miss it... Allegro Has 2 very nice pools, very clean,one pool had a swim up bar..it was a nice touch. The grounds were spotless and very well maintained also the grounds were very pretty. had a few creatures running around, that was pretty neat.their ocean was Beautiful!! just a little on the small size Now to sum it all up. I have to say the very best part of our stay were the employees of Allegro Playacar they were truly wonderful a real asset to the company. I am adding pictures of the employees that we grew to have a friendship with. We really did have a good time with them. And they did make our stay a very pleasant one. would i recommend to a friend... maybe it depends on what they are looking for in a resort... overall we had a great time. We added little comments to the pictures ..to be honest we really enjoyed all of them and all were true professionals

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thirsty_Gringo
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff provided the opportunity for a great holiday - sorry for the late review, but i just discoved Trip Advisor and thought a late review is better than none. The hotel's atmosphere was created in a large part by the staff; whether serving you at the bar, clearing the restaurant table or even cleaning the bed & restrooms. Above all though the entertainment team was superb. Everything was offered from Spanish lessons through to Tequila Volleyball! The professionalism and unending energy a credit to Jose, Stefano, Janet, Vergy and Adan. In the evening we enjoyed a top quality show every night, whether dancing, magicians or circus the performances were top notch as was the hosting from Adan. And for sportsmen there were great tennis courts, a long swim pool, sheltered beach area and easy access to booking Jet Ski and snorkeling. Food and drink was plentiful, high quality and sufficiently varied for a week's stay and language was never an issue for non Spanish speakers.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, best vacation i have ever been on”
Reviews.Author: llong9789
Reviews.Content: Before i went to this resort i did tons of research and i was very wary because of all the bad reviews i read, but the reviews cannot be more wrong, the staff was outgoing and helpful, the resort itself was beautiful, there was always something to do, the beach was not the biggest but i loved it it was beautiful, our room was fabulous bed extremely comfortable. they always gave us extra bottles of water in our room every day, and the alchohol was not watered down, it tasted great to me. the food was amazing, we went to the mexican and the italian and the food was great, but i preferred the buffet because i liked being able to eat whenever i wanted. the snack bar at the pool wasnt even a snack bar, it was a full buffet. at the end of our trip we didnt want to leave and we our already planning our next trip back. so definately go here ignore bad reviews. this place is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic holiday - rooms and pool could do with a refurb though”
Reviews.Author: VFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks on the 24th june 2009. The hotel is located along a main road with other hotels. They all shared one beach - the further you walk up the beach the nicer it is. I saw an eel near our bit one day! There are a lot of sandbags on the beach which doesnt make it look attractive. They have a contract approved to start wrk on the beach next mnth and will take a year to look like it did before the hurrican hit. The rooms need a good refurbishment - there were a lot of scuff marks here and there and just need remodernising but they do have the biggest beds!! There is not a lot of space for your clothes - I brought my own hangers and glad I did as needed them. The rooms all have balconys with a hammock and 2 chairs and a table. And rooms come with a fridge that the maid stocks daily with water and in the room there is tea and coffee making facilities. The maid makes different animals with the towels daily but i dont think they do that great a job at cleaning rooms. There are 2 pools here. One is a lot warmer - and quiet and the other is where the bars are and where the activites during the day take place. There are huts where you get your towels from daily - you can change these halfway through the day too for clean ones. opens about 0830 till about 1800. Near this hut is another hut where you can book excursions and good value for money if you dont want to go through your tour operator. You can also haggle with the price. The pools could do with sprucing up - there are tiles missing and just doesnt seem clean. The tables near the sunbeds are never wiped down and sunloungers could do with a clean from time to time. The entertainment team are good during day - they do origami, spanish lessons, yoga, aqua aerobics, volley ball, water polo,drinking competitons etc etc. Stephano and Victor are great! The shows they do at night are not that great but are ok to pass an hour from 2100-2200. They have a disco room that is open after the shows and the outdoor bars are open till late. The main buffet restaurant for breakfast is brilliant - lots of choice and they make up fresh eggs for you - i never had one but were told they were nice. Lots of fresh fruit and yogurts, croissaints, breads, cereals etc etc aswell as a cooked breakfast or last nights dinner if you fancied it. Lunch is served by the activity pool - they do a bbq daily of burgers chips, hot dogs, bbq'd fresh fish and meat and they also do selection of hot food and cold pasta and salads inside near the bar. There is a themed night every night for dinner, its not great but theres always something for everyone and also plain meat and salads and a pasta station to make up ur own dish. There are 2 a la carte restaurants - the mexican and italian. I never tried the mexican as was told it wasnt great but I'm half italian and loved it there. Very small portions but worth it. You have to make reservation day before you want to go. The gardens in the grounds are lovely and you always see wrkers wrking in them. There is a local shop within the hotel which is reasonably priced and out of hotel and turn left onto main road you will find more shops and little market stands 5 min walk up the road. Theres a pharmacy here and also a bank tochange up money - good rates here 0 dotn change up money at hotel - bad exchange rate. There is a pay phone and cards at reception. Look out for the time share people near reception! we just told them we werent interested but they still didnt leave us alone!! It is very safe to go walking around at night - 5 min taxi ride into play del carmen or 25-30 min walk. Go to Senior fFogs and have a burito they are lush - try not to get stung with a £10 cocktail though. Also Coco bongos in playa is a must also. Smaller than the one in Cancun but amazing all the same. There are people offering free 10 minute massages round the pool - have one they are well worth it and they dont make you buy one if you dont want to. I brought a 30 min one though and she was amazing at it. really sorted out my neck and back problem. £20 for 30 mins. I have stayed in better 4 star hotels but overall i would go back as had such an amazing time and met a lot of nice people - Hi janet and Barry and Mark and J. Vicky

Reviews.Title: “Average as the ratings suggest, closer to 3 star than 4”
Reviews.Author: huggy69
Reviews.Content: First off, don't let the swine flu put you off, there is no problem here as to anywhere else in the world. There has always been flu, and there always will be. This time is no diifferent to any other. More fool the people not coming, see it as a way off getting a bargin price like we did! The staff were delighted to see us on our first day, because they had been shut for a month as the story was breaking. They were extremely friendly and plentiful in number. It would be unfair to jump to any firm conclusions because they were not many guests at the beginning and at the end of our 10 days only 50% capacity. I could not say how the amineties and facilities would cope when stretched to their limits. The dissappointing thing was that some of the attractions in the hotel were not running due to the low numbers. That makes sense from the hotels point of view, but from ours we paid our money, and expect to get the normal services that the hotel offers. Hotel is probably 3 and a half stars if such a thing exists, comfortable but not luxurious. Room is small with a lack of closet space, but has the basics, bath was there but no plug to use it as a bath. Plenty of hot water for showering, fridge to put drinks or snacks in, doesn't get too cold in there though and is small. Room maids came everyday, change of towels, and they did clean and mop. Food was repetative, but then again, there was not enough of us to make the usual efforts to provide variety. Average food, plenty of selection, probably enjoyed the breakfast the most. Lunch was at the pool bar only, unlike when it is running normally, and the buffet restaurant is also available. They did a barbacue everyday which was enjoyable. Sport facilities were ok, watersports which we didn't do, two tennis courts, basketball, two pool tables-one was unusable due to a big rip in the cloth. Activities on offer during the day, 4 nice people did this, genuinely nice staff. It's up to the individual as to how much they want to get involved with this. They would put a bit of pressure on you to do things, to make up the numbers. Some people would have there arms twisted which is no bad thing, to get some exercise, but if you said 'no' they would not badger you or anything. Depends what kind of a holiday you want, like the shows in the evening, you can participate if you want, or if you find it a bit cheesy or embarrasing do you own thing. Some people don't leave the hotel complex, and chose to join in everything on offer. Right on the beach if that's you thing, as others have said here the beach has lost a lot of sand because of two recent hurricanes. Apparently the sand used to go out a long way, but now not. This just means that you have to walk 50 yards along to get some width in the sand. They have these big sand bank things they call on the sign 'eco tubes' , but no big deal unless it worries you that it is not quite the fantasy beach, water is clear though, beautiful colour as you think of in the Caribbean. Sun is very strong, as I know you would expect in the tropics, but just to remind you. I got caught out on the first day, it was very overcast but still does damage. Watch out until your body gets adjusted to the heat and sun, a few days in I developed prickly heat. Unbearable itching and burning. Rather than going to the doctor that the hotel will phone up for, I went to the 'Red Cross' in Playa del Carman. The on site doctor would have been $110 just to see him and then a lot more for any treatment/medication. Whereas the Red Cross was the same price as the locals pay, say $5! If you have travel iinsurance you could get it back, but why take the risk, the treatment was fine from the Mexican doctor. Admittedly, if it was anything serious you would want the perfect english speaking doctor. Just to warn you, watch out for the timeshare selling, they call it "vacation club", less conotations in that term! The sellers make you think they are part of the staff, with the way they dress and by speaking politely- asking how you holiday is going etc. They are employees of the hotel, but timeshare reps, so have other motives. Just be aware of that. They will eventually try to get you to look at a sister hotel down the road and offer a free meal if you listen to the presentation etc. You know the drill! Go if you want to see! Hotel is right next to Playa del Carmen, which is a fun beach/holiday town, a lot of activity along fifth avenue but go down a side street to see the locals and their part of town. Hotel is actually in a gated community, no one had mentioned this on here. Playacar is the name of this, there are maybe 20 big hotels and a few hundred private villas. I guess this makes it safer, although in this part of Mexico, I generally found it safe and relaxed out and about. This strip of coast is very different to other parts of Mexico which I have been to myself. They call this Yucatan area "Little Miami" and it is very comfortable and well maintained, like being in the States or Europe in some areas. For day excersions, don't go to Cancun- nothing to see. I was expecting a big holiday place, with a big beach where everyone goes to, a prom with tourist shops and restaurants, people selling things etc. But there was none of this. Two distinct areas of Cancun- hotel zone: full of obviously hotels and there own private beaches and facilities all on one road. On the other side of the road are smart boutique shops, so nothing you haven't seen in the States. The other distinct area is Cancun itself, the town. This is a place for the natives, the Mexicans, and there is nothing in the centre to note, no civic centre or historic sights. Quite a good place for a visit was South from Playa de Carmen, 20 miles down called 'Puerto Adventuras'. This was very upmarket and posh - affluent, gated community, expensive boats and pleasant shops. The highlight was being able to get close to dolphins without paying a penny! They are contained in individual pools, where you can swim with them for a price, but pay nothing to still get quite close. A lot of people go on fishing boats from here, and they are hired for a fee per hour. Quite a good tip if you are into this, is that the money you pay for the boat you can make some or all back if you sell your catch to the restaurants. Makes sense, everyone's a winner! In conclusion, Occidental Allegro is a safe bet, nothing special, nothing terrible. By the way they are renovoating later this year and improving, so see it then! Gardens are spectacular already, look out for the long back iguanas lazing in the sun, they blend into the rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: kdub2384
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Allegro. It was my first time in Mexico, his second. We both left with very mixed feelings about the resort. (If I could give a 3 1/2 rating I would have...it was above average, but 4 stars is a little generous). My boyfriend was in the Playa del Carmen area over Christmas/New Years at a different resort, and a common theme of the week was him saying "at the other resort..." If you're looking for luxury, book a different resort. Everything here was just kind of simple, which wasn't bad, but in comparison to other resorts we saw walking along the beach, ours was just average. We got an amazing deal though. We found out towards the end of the week that the resort had actually been closed up until a few days before we arrived. With all the flu scare and the low tourist season this seemed to be a common occurrence at other resorts as well. I have a strong feeling this attributed to many of the issues we had with the resort... it just seemed like they were a little out of practice or something. The grounds themselves were great. The rooms are in free standing "huts" of 8 rooms each, and every room has a private balcony with a hammock. The resort is set on a slight hill, and has an amazing view of the ocean. If it weren't for the slightly taller resorts on each side, you would feel like you were at a cozy resort in the jungle. The rooms on the other hand could use some updating. Everything was very clean, but the beds and curtains looked a little out of the 70s, and the pillows are not very comfortable at all. Luckily we weren't in the room all that much, and we had a great view of the larger "bridge pool", so that made up for it. We found the food service to be just average. The staff at the buffet was unorganized and not all that quick. The food itself was decently good, but don't wait too late to eat or pickings will be slim. One day we waited until 10am to get breakfast (which is from 7-11am). Everything was extremely picked over, and nothing was being refilled. There are two sit down restaurants, the Mexican and the Italian, which require reservations. Both were good and had great staff, but the Italian was by far the best food we ate the entire trip. We had planned to eat their a second night, but unfortunately I had one too many shots of "pool water" at the swim up bar and wasn't feeling up to dinner (watch out of that stuff!) On that note, the bar staff is AWESOME! They are not skimpy with the alcohol and are super fast. Margaritas and (good) tequila shorts are in plenty, and they have a well stocked bar of name brand liquors. Just beware of those pool water shots! A few other random notes... the beach isn't huge, but unlike other resorts in the area it's not very rocky, which was nice. They were doing free welcome massages, and the message staff was super nice. I seriously regret not making the time to get a full one. There is little to no night life at the resort. We were exhausted every night and went to bed on the early side, so we didn't care much, but if you want a crazy nightlife, this isn't your place. It's not a very big resort, and was at less than half capacity while we were there. This seemed like the perfect amount of people. What they do when they are full is beyond me, because they hardly seemed set up to handle double the occupancy. We had a great relaxing week, and for a first time trip to Mexico it was great, but in the future I will be looking for a resort with a bit more to offer. However, for the deal we got I can't complain too much. Based on other people's reviews I think they are usually more on top of things, but we must have just been there on an off week.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Relaxing Break”
Reviews.Author: sunbathinsisters
Reviews.Content: me and my sister had a fantastic holiday here..gorgeous sunshine everyday we sunbathed from 7.30 am till 6pm..if it rains its brief and welcomed!! You will need high factor cream we wore 40 everyday all day and burned!! Staff are fantastic food is excellent lots of choice in the buffett and you also can book into either the Italian or Mexican. Alcohol is real not of the cheap stuff Corona on tap, and if you ask for a JD thats exactly what you get. We chose Italian and were not disappointed was lovely. Recommend you take dollars to tip the staff here and there and also there are little markets that come in the evening that sell some lovely gifts.. What can i say everything ticked the boxes, hotel on a white sandy beach and turquoise sea as far as the eye can see...30 degree weather everyday..does it get any better?????? Booking to go back in October!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Yuncha
Reviews.Content: I am a little late writting this review but better late than never. My sister and I stayed at the Allegro from April 24 to May 1,09 and loved it. I read a lot of reviews from other people and was some what hesitent, but much to my surprise it was wonderful!!! I am not sure what people are expecting but this place had everything anyone would want. The food you could always find something good to eat and lots of it. I never ate at the two other resturants because I was always to full, maybe next time. Very close to Playa walked every night to town good way to exercise the booze off!! The staff were excellent!!!
