I guess the only complaint which isn't much would be yes the rooms do need upgrading but they were so very clean and you only are in your rooms for a short time sleep change maybe a nap. I also read about all the bad time share people I never once had anyone at the resort talk to me about timeshare, the only place was in town so I don't know what all those people were talking about??? Anyway please if you are going to Playa this is a great place for your dollar do not hesitate. Bye the way we were right in the start of the H1N1 so very sad for Mexico I think the press Canadian and American blew it out of porportion!! Debbie Vancouver BC

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: hazel62uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great and the all the staff were very helpful, I stayed here for a week with my daughter as a girlie week away. Food was fantastic and the Italian restaurant the best of all. We did not see much of the enterment but what we did see was great. I would like to take this oppertunity to thank all the staff for how helpful they were.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Wooly27
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to say that please do not read the negative reviews. I did and was anxious to see what I paid for in a negative way and I was quite suprised. This is my husband and I's third time to Playa/Cancun area and we have stayed at the mega resorts and paid almost triple what we paid here and we thoughourly enjoyed this resort better for several reasons: 1. Its smaller and more quaint. I like the bungalow style vs. the marble-mall like styles. You get to know the staff very well and they were GREAT!! Very friendly! The VIP personalle was excellent (Hi- Jorge, Israel, and Yolanda!) , 2. The room is a little smaller than the mega with just a room with a bed, TV , and bathroom area with closet area. This is the standard room but they're are bigger rooms available such as studios. But like the others say, how long are you in the room? It was just perfect for what we needed. I loved the hammocks on the deck....nice to relax in at the end of a long day in the sun. I liked them..more authentic in my opinion. 3. The pools- one quite and one activity pool with the pool bar. Both were great! We enjoyed the activity pool more. 4. The Beach- first of all, any beach that you go to in this area is erroted from the hurricanes. There is no perfect beach but it is still beautiful. The other resorts we stayed at had no beach what so ever. This resort had beach and you could get in the ocean, no problem, It is gorgeous. If you walk down the beach each way there are a little better beaches if you prefer. I was in the ocean everyday. 5. The diving..beautfiul..Barracuda and Tortagus (sp?) were awesome. Best diving ever even have dove in Cozumel. There are new reefs in the Playa Del Carmen area so they are much nicer than Cozumel,in my opinion, as everyone goes there. I saw turtles, sting rays, eels, barracuda's, and very colorful fish and coral. Dive with the Barrakuda staff on site at the Allegro (with Wilie or Hugo) as they are very safe and great dive masters. You go on the boat right off shore. Convienent. 6. Food- All inclusive..what else can I say. Not great but does the trick for me. I can get great stuff in the US and I prefer drinks more ..LOL! 7. Overall, great small resort for both families, singles, couples, and everyone we met (which we met ALOT of great people) loved the resort! I will definetly go back! Enjoy! AP

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Value + Location if You Get a Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: jjjen
Reviews.Content: This is a long detailed review so I will post my conclusion first in case you don’t want to read it all. This resort is very good if you get a very good deal like we did. Do not expect 5 star and do not pay what you would pay for a big fancy resort. If you follow this, you will really enjoy this resort and be very happy with your stay. If you want to be able to explore Playa del Carmen and the rest of the area without feeling guilty about leaving a resort you spent a lot of money on, then I would again recommend this resort. We were off the resort quite a bit and we didn’t feel bad about it because we still only spent about as much as we would have if we had just booked, for example, the Bahia Principe (for a week at the price we saw it going for consistently) and had not done anything but stay on the resort. Details: Rooms Our first room smelled very bad. I forget the number (maybe 50something) but it was right beside the bigger pool with the bridge over it. It was bad enough that we went to the desk and told them before we had even set our stuff up in the room. However, we were moved right away to a new room. We ended up in room 1111. We were happier in this room because it had a king size bed, which we had requested, while the other room had two separate beds. The good things about this room were that we were the first building so we were closest to the reception, buffet, and outside bar, and we could watch the show from our balcony. It was a definite plus that there was a hammock on our balcony to do this from as well. The one complaint I have about the room is the noise at night. We first thought it was the disco on our resort, but we later realized that, while we could hear the bass of the disco from our room, the worst of the noise was coming from the show of the resort next to us. Their show went later than ours and they seemed to have a loud outside party afterwards. The shower in our second room was also not working but a maintenance man came within 15 minutes of our complaint to fix it quickly. Location We just loved the location. The resort is in Playacar which is a residential area very close to the town of Playa del Carmen. It is full of both resorts and very nice houses. There is also a little strip mall sort of thing in Playacar which includes a bank. The prices are higher than those in Playa del Carmen but it is convenient. There is also a bird sanctuary in Playacar which we wanted to go to but we ran out of time. We went into Playa del Carmen 3 times. We walked in because it is only a 15-20 minute walk and the walk is very nice. We then took a cab ride home because we would be tired and that cost 50 pesos. Do not pay in USD because the driver will charge you 5USD and 10 to 1 is not the correct exchange rate. It was posted at 12.5 pesos to 1 USD at the trading booths when we were in town. Another tip is that the cabs do not have meters and you must ask the cost before you get in. Playa del Carmen is just GORGEOUS and I could see myself staying right in town without doing an all inclusive because we felt so safe and there is so much to see and do. You must go in to town if you go to this resort! Beach When we first arrived, there was only one section of beach on one side of the pool. Sometime near the end of the week, they put some more sand in so there was a beach all around the activity pool. So, they have very recently increased the size of the beach. However, it is still a very small beach. This wasn’t too much of a problem for us because when we wanted to lounge we chose to lounge by the pool, and when we wanted to swim in the ocean, we simply walked to the resort next door. You can go to all of the beaches of all the resorts in a row and no one will stop you. There is also an amazing beach in Playa del Carmen so you can use that if you go in to town. However, if it is important to you that you have a nice beach right on your resort with plenty of space for lounge chairs, do not book this resort. Pools There is a bigger quiet pool, and a smaller activity pool. Both pools were very nice and there are three different places to get food between them as well as one bar (with a walk-up side and a swim-up side). The little restaurant is buffet, there is a BBQ area with burgers and hotdogs and such, and then there is a little pizza stand. It was totally unnecessary to go all the way to the buffet for lunch if you were having a lazy tanning day. The activity pool is right beside the ocean and the view is wonderful. Activities Lots of activities happened around the pool. We were only there for the whole day a couple times and we didn’t do too many of the activities but there seemed to be a lot of fun things to do. If you wanted to stay on the resort all day every day you would probably still have things to do all day. There isn't much nightlife at this resort. After the show ends at 10pm, everyone who stays awake hangs out at the outside lounge and sits around and chats. This is a very nice atmosphere but that's really all there is. There is a disco on this resort but the music was far to loud and we never saw more than 4 people in there (probably due to the volume of the music.) Maybe if they would turn it down it would be a nice place to hang out as well. Food There are lots of places to get food all over this resort. All the places by the pool I mentioned are open until about supper time I believe. Sorry I don’t know the exact time. The main buffet is open 7am-10pm. A little snack station is open at the outside lounge from 11pm-1am. I personally found the food to be good in the buffet, and very good in the a la cartes. The Italian a la carte had a very nice atmosphere. The buffet had a different theme every night so if you know you don’t like a certain kind of food, then you should look at the sheet they give you the first day outlining the schedule and book one of the a la cartes for that night. If I was disappointed with anything it would be the eggs. I don’t eat meat so I pretty much relied on these for my breakfast protein every day and they were really watery. It wasn’t that nice. Everything else I can remember was good and there was a ton of variety. My boyfriend had various chicken dishes, and the meat lasagna on Italian night and he seemed to enjoy it all. He doesn’t really do seafood though so we don’t have an opinion on it all. They had an 8 person mariachi band in the buffet on Mexican night and that was a wonderful surprise! Service As I said before, the front end staff responded to our room complaints immediately and they were resolved right away. All the other staff was very friendly and seemed to be happy overall. Poor Felix at the pool bar always had a great attitude even when he was left working it alone and there was a big line. They could use some more pool bar staff more consistently. The guys at the outside lounge bar beside the lobby were great. The woman who is hostess at the buffet was very welcoming and bubbly all the time although she seemed to work 13 hours a day every day we were there. The man who cleaned our room was very understanding when we slept in one day and I had to ask him to wait because I wasn’t finished getting ready. Our room seemed to be cleaned well from what we noticed and he even lined up our shoes in nice little rows and nice little touches like that aside from the towel art. One day we were in a rush and didn’t remove a suitcase from our bed. I felt kind of bad about it but figured maybe he just wouldn’t do the bed but we came back and it was lifted off and placed neatly over a chair and everything was all done. We tipped $2 a day for the maid and $1 a day in the fridge and, on the last day, our fridge was crammed with 3 waters, 3 pops, and a whole ton of bags of chips and peanuts. (A normal day was 2 waters, 2 pops, 2 bags of chips, 1 of peanuts, sometimes a chocolate bar if we actually used what was in there.) The internet was fast and it cost 2 pesos a minute. We thought this was reasonable as it was right in the lobby and we conveniently checked out email every day. My boyfriend was disappointed by the lack of a gym on site. Excursions We signed up for the following excursions through our Nolitours representative in the lobby. Xel-Ha Full Day $119USD – This place is amazing. It is a very expensive price but we didn’t want to have to worry about transportation and we just had to visit this park. One day is not even enough. It is a very nice place to snorkel if you are completely inexperienced like me. I felt safe the whole time and the everything was gorgeous. We also paid extra to do the Sea Trek ($45 USD) and it was definitely worth it in our opinion. You walk along the ocean floor with the help of divers and you are surrounded by fish and rays. I don’t think there is any experience like it. You only have to wear the helmet and the rest of your body is completely free in just your bathing suit. Mayan Encounter $120USD – I will not give you the details of the excursion because you can read them right here. http://www.alltournative.com/tours-products/maya-encounter First of all, I should say the ruins are closed right now as a precaution against the spread of the flu. So, the visit to Coba was excluded from our tour and they gave us a refund of 20USD (in pesos). The excursion overall was a pretty good experience. I’m not sure if it was worth the price, but it was definitely enjoyable and interesting. I would like to say that the zip lining portion only includes one zip line about 10 seconds long in case you are expecting more. What made it most worth going was probably the huge cenote we rappelled into. My boyfriend jumped into it instead and he said that alone was an experience of a lifetime. It was also interesting to see the small Mayan ruins in the jungle, see monkeys in their natural habitat, and eat a very delicious lunch prepared by Mayan women in a Mayan village. We signed up for the club hopping tour but it was canceled due to flu precautions. In conclusion again, this resort is a good deal if you get a good deal. It is nice and the location is great. However, if you need a very nice beach right on your resort and using the beaches at the neighbouring resorts won't do, do not book this resort. Also do not book this resort if you want something 5 star or very fancy.

Reviews.Title: “great value at this location”
Reviews.Author: tklauke2000
Reviews.Content: we just returned may 02 from a week at this resort and have nothing but positives despite the beginning of press on the h1n1 outbreak. Great value for the-price far below any other area 4 stars. Excellent food-buffet and a-la-carts. Good variety and freshness. the outdoor grill at the pool everyday was great! beach was a washout but neighbouring resorts have great beaches you can frolic in all day without any trouble. the service throughout the hotel from front desk to bar service to maids was outstanding. pool was clean and well maintained with lots of seating always available. Only negative was that there was only 1 bartender at the poolbar most of the time so long line-ups sometime but no big problem. All in all great time had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: Sotagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Playacar. For those who don't travel in April (we usually go in Jan/Feb) the temps are much hotter in April, and the sun is powerful. But, I loved it. The resort was very nice. I loved the 2 story bungalows, and the hammocks on each patio was a plus. We used our daily!! Yes, it held 2 people. ;o) We met some great people on our trip and I hope we can stay in touch. Tom, Michelle, Dan & Sue.... email me. The food was great! It was nice to have the grill out near the pool to grab a burger, hot dog, salmon, fries.... They also had Pizza- home made, very good--esp when you got a piping hot piece. The beach was close to nothing, but like many said, you could walk to the resorts next to you and get in for a dip to ride the waves. The weather was perfect. We played paddle ball on the beach every day. The rooms weren't that great, but who stays in the room anyway. They A/C was so-so, but over all we had a great time. We'd go back in a heartbeat. As many have said, it's a small resort and you make friends quickly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful resort wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: traewatkins
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this resort April 22,2009. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make your vacation fun and personal. The bartenders were amazing they looked after all your beverage needs. The food was awesome and lots of variety with barbeques as well. The grounds were spotless and the staff work sooooooooooo hard. The beach wasnt all that great as there were alot of sand bags and erosion of the beach do to the hurricanes but overall the resort was great. The rooms definately need some upgrading but for the money you spend you got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Humble Property, Great Staff, Good Overall Value”
Reviews.Author: mhill0406
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, even though the beach was mostly gone...we could swim at the property next door and the large "sand bags" actually became a fun part of the ocean play with people being washed on top of them by the waves. Really enjoyed all the people we met there..Brian and Kelly from Minnealpolis, Andrew and his wife from Bolton, Ont. Sean and Shelly, Sue and Dan, etc....Loved the mix of people..many Italians, French, Dutch and even Czechs... The staff was very nice and the proximity to Playa Del Carmen is great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: nbsc
Reviews.Content: This all-inclusive resort has the worst food I've had since jr high cafeteria. The house wine is some sort of watered down Manoshevitz. Also it's not really all inclusive. they charge by the minute to use the ONE internet terminal in the lobby. They are trying to sell cheesy tours all the time. The snorkeling equipment was in very bad shape and though there was an array of upscale liquor bottles on display, that is not what they used! The pools are nice but there is relentless bad disco music blasted from fuzzy speakers from 10:00a.m. to 11:00 p.m. Okay, to be fair, the beach area, though small, is lovely and connects to a long stretch of other resorts' beaches so you can walk a long way. With the exception of the desk staff who were downright nasty, the staff was courteous, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “what more could I ask for?”
Reviews.Author: suesue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Allegro Playacar, April 18 – 25th, 2009. Since the entire trip was really inexpensive, my expectations were quite open. We were delighted to have the very best vacation imaginable – especially at such a low cost. The hotel itself is rather small, but the bonus with that is that you will meet almost every guest at the resort. Also, Playa del Carmen is a pleasant 20-minute walk (or 5-minute cab ride) from this hotel. These were the reasons that made this hotel our vacation-spot of choice. Our room was in the middle of the resort, which I was happy with, as it was not far from anything. The rooms are a little old, and if your room is on the 2nd floor, you will have a thatched roof. (see pictures) Not very efficient, I think, for the air conditioner. The drain in the sink was slow, and a call to the front desk had the problem rectified in short order. The toilet and shower are a separate room from the sink, and the closet area is separate again. (see pictures) The room could use a dresser. Our king size bed had 6 pillows, the mattress was rather firm. A small television is over a bar-size fridge which houses 2 water bottles, snacks of chips, peanuts, and a chocolate bar. The fridge is restocked every day as necessary. The maid will create a towel animal on the bed. Towels are replenished daily, with 2 bath towels, 2 had towels and 2 face clothes. There is a blow dryer for your convenience. There are 2 chairs and a table as well as a hammock on the balcony outside of your room. Our pool towels were delivered to our room, and we exchanged them every day. At the end of the week, we simply left them in the room, no need to turn in a towel card. Our room was non-smoking, as indicated with a sign on the door. The grounds are impeccably maintained, gardeners are working every day. There are 2 pools, with a restaurant/bar in between. The animation team does a great job of getting the guests involved in some extremely fun activities – stretching and step exercises, water exercise, water polo, water volleyball, learn to make towel animals, bartending class, etc. The most fun was the water-balloon fight in the pool. (see pictures) You can also have your picture taken with a monkey, snake, iguana, birds... the photographer, the exotic animal and an animal handler appear around the pool about 11ish. The beach has been terribly eroded by hurricanes, and I hear it is up to the government to rectify. Sand bags are evident in front of this hotel as well as others along this shoreline (see pictures). The sandbags did not keep vacationers from swimming in the sea. The buffet restaurant is perfect for every meal—with ample selections to satisfy anyone’s appetite. Breakfasts consisted of all kinds of fruits and breads, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage or turkey sausage, cheese and cold cuts, cereals. You could also have scrambled eggs, an omelet or fried eggs. Dinner had a great display of beef, chicken, pork, fish, seafood dishes, potatoes, rice, veggies (cooked or fresh), fresh breads, 2 different soups each day, typical Mexican dishes as well, more fruit, and scrumptious desserts! Other guests were happy with both a la carte restaurants, “The Mexican” and “The Italian”, although we chose not to indulge in the a la cartes. There were 2 nights that the evening meal was outside and the show would start right after dinner –it was lovely. The bartenders made pretty good cocktails – Pina Colada, Miami Vice, Daiquiris, Cabana, Mojito, Margarita, etc --- all made with a blender. There are very few – if any – straws. Take your own. The bartenders were happy to fill your insulated mug. Because the hotel is not overly large, we were able to meet many, many people – Chris and Bob, Marie and Ronnie, Rachel and Greg, Brian and Kelly, Tony and Grace, Shellee and Sean, Pam and Marty, Diana and Bruno, Tom and Michelle…. I know I’ve missed some names, forgive me. It sure makes for a fun vacation!! Taking everything into consideration, I was quite satisfied with this hotel, and would certainly consider it for our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “WISH I WAS BACK THERE...”
Reviews.Author: schatze23
Reviews.Content: Just came back and we had a great time. It was our first trip in 30 years outside Canada so we are not experts on Mexican hotels but it met our expectations and we are looking forward to going back soon. If I'd wanted a big fancy room with noone knowing who I was I'd have stayed home and gone to WestEdmonton Mall??The rooms were clean,staff very friendly and helpful, food was great,everything we needed within walking distance,and we felt like family. We had our 7 year old grandson with us and he loved the kids club...Hilda and Lizabeth were wonderful with the kids...they give them a holiday of their own and that's all he talks about is his Mexico club. The shows at night are really good, We just had friends come back from a larger hotel just up the way from the Allegro and they didn't like it..to big and not very friendly...so you choose? Gracias to the staff and hasta luego

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Oceansings
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Allegro Playacar from vacation (4/7-4/12/09) with a friend, and honestly, the hotel and the service were the worst that I have experienced on a vacation! The grounds are beautiful and the food is pretty good, and I will go as far to say, very good, in the 2 ala carte restaurants, but that is as far as it goes. We were greeted with a welcome "cocktail" of juice. I thought a cocktail would have some sort of alcohol in it, but, at least we were given a refreshment. The man who greeted us at the desk then proceded to explain to us that the use of the phone for non-local calls was very expensive. He was adament about this. Is that what we needed to hear on our welcome? He then told us that if we didn't return our towel card, we would be charged $50, and if we lost our room key, it would be $15. I understand that hotels need to keep their guests informed of their expenses, but it was said in such a way at our arrival that we felt like we had already done something wrong! We were then shown to our room by another employee, who was quite pleasant, pointing out the amenities of the property. Our first room had mold on the inside of the drapes and smelled of cigarettes. We said we had requested a non-smoking room, and he said that all the rooms were smoking rooms. He did agree to move us, finally, to another room on the top floor. This room did not have ashtrays, as the last room had, but it still had a bit of a musty, moldy, odor. We left a decent tip for the maid the first night, only to return to a room that had not been cleaned well at all. There was still some toothpaste in the sink and nothing had been wiped down on the vanity or in the bathroom. Also,the used towels that were hanging on the hook in the bathroom were not replaced. Another time we had requested water (4 bottles) and only 2 were left, on the window ledge outside of our room! The beach was COMPLETELY UNSWIMMABLE, due to the sandbags that were used to prevent more erosion. The hotels next door had sandbags, too, but not nearly as many as ours, so each day we walked to the other hotel beaches to swim. The pictures of the beach on the Allegro Playacar website do not reflect the damage to the beach at all. Even though the neighboring hotels had to use sandbags, too, there was much more beach at those hotels and it was easily swimmable. We were lucky that the beaches in Mexico are federal property. There was also a bad smell in one of dining areas (the one off the main buffet dining area...it is a separate enclosed room). It was a musty smell, and we had to stay there for a meal, since there was no other table available. The musty smell made for a most disagreeable meal. The smell was there the entire time we were at the resort, and if we were seated near that area, we made sure that we were not right near the door, where the smell permeated into the main buffet dining room. The other areas of the buffet didn't smell. Don't stop reading yet...I am saving the best for last! There was a PRE-PLANNED POWER OUTAGE that the hotel arranged so they could fix some electrical problems. They didn't inform guests that this was going to happen, but we had heard it second hand through people talking at the pool the day before. On April 9, during breakfast (the one time we had to sit in the musty dining area), the power went out. It was out for 14 hours...and the hotel KNEW this was going to happen. Did they plan in advance for this? NO! They had some paper bags with sand and candles (illuminatee) only halfway up the path at night. We had asked for a flashlight, but they said they only had candles and we had to get them ourselves in the DARK, going down steep stairs from our second floor room. They said they were short-staffed, and could not bring candles to the rooms. They gave us PAPER CUPCAKE HOLDERS to use to put the candles in...PAPER!!! It was extremely dangerous- a fire waiting to happen. The lights (and AC, fan) came on after 11pm. At lunch, they had the restaurant area by the pool open, as there was a generator there. That was planned in advance. Why didn't they plan to make the outage known to the guests in advance and provide safe lighting for us? The show that night was also cancelled, because of the power outage. When I went to ask for some compensation because of the dangerous conditions, a man at the desk said...What? The darkness was dangerous? We also had problems getting to sleep at night. There was loud music coming from the main building until 2 am. In addition, this is the first hotel that would not call and confirm our return airline flight for us. We were told that there would be a $7 a minute fee to use the phone, since Cancun is not a local call. My friend's cell would not dial the 800 number that we had. We crossed our fingers and hoped that our flight back was on time. This hotel did not offer decent service to its clients. I have been to Mexico several times, and was really impressed with the hospitality. In my other visits, hotel staff knew our names, they offered gracious service, there was no problem confirming our flight, the beach was beautiful, and it was a pleasure to stay at a welcoming hotel. Allegro Playacar did just the opposite. There were some staff who did make a good impression, especially the staff in the Mexican and Italian restaurants, and 2 women who worked at the front desk who tried to help us. Perhaps the problems arise from the fact that this hotel is understaffed and the employees are not adequately trained and they are overworked. This was confided to us by an employee who was in the process of relocating to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff wonderful, hotel needs a little help”
Reviews.Author: Phoebeonthelake
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpfull, they went out of their way to make you feel welcome. The hotel is getting old, and the fixtures, towels, etc need to be replaced. The airconditioning needs a "boost". The food isn't gourmet, but it was tasty and fresh. There was no beach, and the big sand bags made it impossible to get out and enjoy the ocean. You had to get up early in the morning to save your spot by the pool, or the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Mexico several times and wouldn't recommend this place at all!”
Reviews.Author: jerseytravelingirl
Reviews.Content: I actually won this vacation through a local radio station so it was not hand picked by me as this was my 5th time in Mexico. We decided to take the kids (3 & 6) since it boasts a kids club and it was a kid freindly resort. We were greeted fine upon arrival and we were pleased with the location of our building #55(one building away from the water). The beach is prettty much non existent so if you like the beach- do not stay here. The beach is covered by slimy sand bags and it was hard to take my 3 year old in for a dip. The pools were nice but if you wanted a chair you better get up at 5 a.m. to stake your claim with a towel or book because they were all taken by 7:30 regardless of the sign that says- please do not reserve chairs! The lines at the pool bar were long but had your customary drinks. The staff was not overly friendly as we had experienced in the past at other resorts. Be sure to make your reservations immediately if you want to dine at the Italian or Mexican places- if not you are left dining in the dimly lit buffet area where you will see a repeat of foods-just in different forms. The grounds were well kept and the activities staff really got people involved. Now onto the rooms...the beds are absolutely horrible with a mattress on top of a concrete slab. The rooms say they were recently "renovated" when I am pretty sure that means a lot of paint and a bad caulking job! I have stayed at nicer motels! The bathroom reaked of sewage more than once and if you were sitting on your veranda you could hear every time your neighbor flushed their toilet- yeah! Our shower curtain was too short to even cover the openings on both sides of the shower so we had constant water all over the floor after showering. You do have a refrigerator in your room with 2 bottles of semi cool water in them as I think our refrigerator had just been turned on upon our arrival. We did miss our initial meeting with the Apple representative due to having 2 small children who could focus on nothing more than swimming after travelling for 4 hours in a plane and an hour on a bus. My husband made 3 more attempts to find an "apple representative" who was never found. He had to have the front desk reception call to be sure of our departure arrangements. On our first night there I called to request more pillows- yes I like a lot of pillows and considering there was one per person, I didn't think my request for 4 more pillows, one each for my husband and I and the two other so my 3 year old didn't fall onto terracotta tiles at 3 a.m. was unreasonable....when I asked for the pillows the man on the phone said "4PILLOWS? What do you need 4 pillows for?" I'm sorry but I don't even have to explain myself at work let alone explain my self on vacation- I didn't think it was a very extreme request- after 45 minutes a lovely girl showed up with 3 pillows. Guess he told me! The night we made it to the show when both kids could actually stay up that late, it was the special "surprise Show" which was basically composed of embarrasing the hell out of 4 very willing participants for the entire show making them do ridiculous activities to gain the crown of "Miss Allegro". Although my 6 year old son enjoyed the conga line at the end, I was disppointed because I had heard that the shows were pretty decent. We may have just caught a bad night but it was a Saturday night! After the show, there was a small snack area set up outside the swing bar and our kids wanted a snack so we made them a cheesburger to share. Upon getting back to the room and cutting it in half, it was practically raw inside! Gross! Needless to say, if you want to stay at an occidental resort, this one I would not recommend- I would receommend the Xcaret more as we stayed there June 2008 and this was lovely with good shows, beach and adults only salt water pool. I was also disappointed that there was no where to eat dinner and look at the sea which is always a highlight of any trip I have taken to Mexico. I strongly recommend taking your money and spending it elsewhere- there are a lot of beautiful places to stay in Mexico and this one was extremely disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Memories Made”
Reviews.Author: MichiganZing
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 11-year-old daughter and I had a WONDERFUL time at this resort. The recreation staff were attentive and totally got everyone in my family involved. We did water aerobics, volleyball, the 3pm Silly Games, water polo, stretching and loved every minute of it. The food and beverage department did an super job and we enjoyed every mouthful. The evening shows were top light - the dancers were superb. We made a lot of lovely family memories at this piece of paradise. Carolyn - Petoskey, Michigan U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: feline101
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided we wanted to go on our own vacation and this place was cheap and had a great location. It was only a short walk (25 mins) or even shorter cab ride (5 mins) to playa del carmen. We went into town twice and felt safe and enjoyed looking at the shops. We absolutely loved this place and had a great experience. The villa that we stayed in was also great. The only complaint would be that the water pressure sucked ... it copped out a few times, but it would come back. Also, you had to pay for internet use which was a bummer. It was about 20 cents a minute though so it’s affordable! The maids were good and our room was always clean. The staff was amazing as they always seemed interested and were quick to serve you drinks. The beach and pools were very nice. The beach was basically non-existent since the sandbags were everywhere. But there were still places to lay in the sun. It just wasn't the prettiest sight, but the water was still wonderful. As well, there was really great entertainment at night. We watched a bunch of different shows - boogie dreams, the magician and others I can't recall now. All were worth the watch. Oh and I'd recommend bringing ear plugs. There were crazy obnoxious birds living outside our room that would wake us up EARLY every day! I brought plugs so I was fine... I know the birds are situational and you have to expect it when you're living in your own little villa, but if you want a little sleep bring them. What was the most important though was that we felt safe and didn't get sick from the food! My boyfriend ventured into the seafood one night though and he did get a tad sickly ... but it didn't last very long. To be careful just stick to what you know. They had a great buffet and seeing as I'm a picky eater I was a bit worried about the selection, but there was something for everyone! Variety of juices, bottled water and food. I was a bit disappointed they only had coconut ice cream. That's just a personal concern though.... haha. We did two tours. We went to Xcaret park and had a great day. It was basically like a zoo, but we also swam in an underground river, which was amazing. When I heard they wanted another $150 to swim with the dolphins I almost choked! I was upset about that considering the admission to the park was $175 cdn. For our other tour we went to see the Coba ruins, a mayan village, zip lined, swam in a cenote, and kayaked. I really enjoyed that excursion except our tour guide, Miguel was a mad man. His driving skills (?) were terrifying. I couldn't really enjoy the scenery because I was scared for my life. We were driving 140km/hr down a winding dirt road with tall jungle on either side of us. A bird ended up smoking the windshield. We also saw goats crossing the road up ahead but he didn't even use caution when we passed them. I'm hoping other tour guides were more careful drivers ... since the tour itself was spectacular and something to see! I loved the things we got to see and do though, but the ride getting there made me pee my pants!

Reviews.Title: “An Awsome Resort for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: dmills77
Reviews.Content: This resort is great for the price, it is not very large but you have the ability to have facial recognition by staff. The resort overall is just what it is listed as "3 Stars", If you want luxury beyond your wild imagination go next door to the Hideaway and air out your wallet!. The resort was hit hard in the past couple hurricanes and they did their best to rebuild and improve it. This was the first resort I stayed at 7 or so years ago and I have been back 4 times since. I purchased my vacation club membership here and I have totally benifited from it ever since! people talk bad about the "Time Shares" but It is the greatest purchase my family has made. Great night shows, beautiful views and good times.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front desk management help ruins otherwise good service”
Reviews.Author: T0nyP
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Allegro. We enjoyed our first trip two years ago and we chose to return. However, we spent our last few days trying to make arrangements to leave via our Apple package transfer that we didn't enjoy or last day and we probably will not return. We missed our first day appt. with Apple to arrange our return. After that we kept getting the run around by the front desk people. Finally, we were told we would have to call Apple on our own to make arrangements. Speaking only a little Spanish we were unable to make out the message or make contact. We were told that the "Manager" would not allow the front desk people to use the phone. What kind of service is that for foriegn guests? We offered to pay the $2 fee if someone would interpert. An employee outside the front desk let us use his cell phone to call and also got us to an English Speaking person. An otherwise great relaxing vacation ended with frustration.

Reviews.Title: “what a trip what fun people”
Reviews.Author: CLYDEHareBay
Reviews.Content: very clean place,food was excellent.lots of games in the day time at the pool,and the nightly entertainment was amazing. these people went out of there way to make sure you were not bored.the secenery at nite time was beautiful. also you must visit the ruins they are amazing also.there is also a theme niet at the buffet everynite,which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “After reading some reviews, this was MUCH better than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaycee4253
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar from March 12 - 16. When we arrived around 11am we expected to wait until a room was available (check in was 3:00pm). However, much to our surprise we didn't have to wait at all. A room was available and we were in it within minutes of check in. Not once during our whole stay did we get approached by anyone trying to sell a timeshare (maybe this was pure luck, not sure). All the food was great, however the Caribbean night stood out. On occasion there was a short wait at the bar near the pool, but this didn't seem to bother most people. In our opinion the Allegro Playacar was exactly what we expected from a three star resort. We had a wonderful time and we don't have one negative thing to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “buyer beware of timeshare, misrepesentions----”
Reviews.Author: Gograndma
Reviews.Content: Met by timeshare saleswoman, said she would orient us etc. At 1pm arival our room wasn't ready, food at the pool buffee'been sitting for hours, no ice, no servce, dirty tables and no orientation. Our room at 4pm, a.c. didn't work, fridge didn't work, phone didn't work and no hot water. In one week once we had warm water for showers mida afternoon, the a.c. circulated but didn't cool the air. The food was eatible if one was hungry, no choices of beverages beyound alcholic and caffine at the bars. The enertainment was surprisingly good. The swim pools were very cold and the beach was only doable. The staff alowed visitors to place hotel towel across beach chair early am and claim them empty all day, not nearly enough chairs available for all. Our room was musty and linins were worn, staff was ok except for timeshare misrepresentation. the location is faboulous and felt safe, the grounds were clean and lush. It is a three star, about right is everything worked, I did expect hot water.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should respect a reservation,just for a change!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vanessacardozo
Reviews.Content: In january me and my friends have booked this hotel for the period of 21th to 28th Feb.Like many other guests when we´re about to check in we´re told the hotel was overbooked.A rude woman from the staff tryed to upgrade us to another resort.The problem was that this resort was 20 min by car from Playa!!And our goal was to stay in the heart of Playa,close to the 5th av.After talking to another member of the hotel staff(Jair) we´re were transfered to a hotel on the 8th street near the beach.Obviously we lost money with this downgrade,since we already had paid the whole trip to a agency travel.This is not a first time the hotel deal with this problem,so why it keeps happening??Absurd!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Occidental resort, there are much better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: likingwhatIsee
Reviews.Content: Staff were generally nice and some of them tried hard but the jaded indifference is hard to hide as they deal with each new batch of "fresh meat" for the money machine. Watch out for the telephone trap. the hotel has an arrangement with a third party service provider and routes all call through them. You can try your calling card and will be told that the calling card has been denied but they will put the call through with your credit card. DON"T DO IT! Likewise don't use the pay phones in the lobby. Most major phone companies will have a local phone number you can call which will accept your calling card at resoanable rates. So far I'm on the hook for about $1300 for roughly 16 phone calls, only three of which actually got through and roaming charges on my cell. I was also double billed for the same calls by both the third party provider and the hotel when checking out. You will likely be encouraged by the staff to attend a time share presentation as well. The information the enticement is low key and the staff entice you by suggesting they you will be provided with a tour of the facility and local information and orientation. Additionally they appeal to you that they would receive "points" from management so it would be a win win. Talk about false advertising. High pressure and insulting would be a better description of the tactics used including "If you weren't interested, why did you agree to come"? The resort is old and in need of maintenance and upgrades. Rooms are clean but looked to be dated from the seventies. The beach has been washed away and covered with large rubber breakwaters with a small 20 foot wide opening to access the water if you are willing to risk being run over by a tourist on a jet ski. Finding a two mile slick of toilet paper and garbage floating by with the current did not make me much feel like swimming in the ocean Food was ok, nothing special and the wine was atrocious. I also found it amazing that that I could consume two or three drinks over the course of an evening or over dinner and not get even a small buzz when the same amount at home would leave me dizzy. Let's just say the mix must be interesting. You might be surprised to find out that overall we had a wonderful time in Playa Del Carmen and Quintana Roo. The eco excursions were fantastic and we had a wonderful time when we got out of the resort. Take the ferry to Cozumel and rent a scooter . This is an incredible country for snorkeling some great reef areas and lagoons. Try caving and scuba diving some well layed out underground rivers and cenotes. Ixcaret is worthy of two days or more and there are some wonderful beaches further north and south where not everyone is hell bent to pry some bucks from the tourists. Avoid this resort and perhaps by association any Occidental properties.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: EndriV
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just got back from Playa. We took my in laws and my 6 months baby girl. I have to say that the 1st night we got there i was not very conviced about this place but next morning when we got ready to go and walk around the hotel i felt in love with it. the beach, the amenities, the Villas etc were BEAUTIFUL!! the palms are georgeous!!!!! lots of trees. ppl wery warn and friendly. the only thing is that the ppl that works in the hotel want you to be part of ther sales shows. they try to make you go to a speech so they can sell the membership for you to staty in their thers properties kind of like timeshare. I was always nice to them and say that i was not interested and that we wanted to enjoy every minute of our stay and did not have time for that. Beds are a lillte hard but it is ok you don;t go there to sleep....The capuccino cofee in the morning was awesome! :) take a taxi to go to the 5th street it is only $5 to get there... it is so much fun!!! nice restaurants, shops and you can take the ferry to go to Cozumel. YOU HAVE TO GO TO COZUMEL! it is worth it!! I was impressed in how the mexican ppl really take care of their island. We rented a Jeep and drove around the island.. beaches are georgeous! long story short. I would go back in a heart bit and i already lloking for a pkg to go back in the summer. A member from Dallas, Texas :) Have fun! OH i forgot!! take lots of 1$ bill for tips, they ask you for tips like crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the upgrade to Gran Flamenco Xcaret!!”
Reviews.Author: pastachiomustachio
Reviews.Content: I only made it as far as the lobby. upon check-in we were told they had over-booked and they were offering a free upgrade to the Occidental Gran Flamenco Xcaret, 15 min. away. I was skeptical at first but was reassured it was a very nice resort and a genuine up-grade. Was it ever!!! We felt lucky to have been offered the Flamenco, it was fabulous! 4 1/2 stars! So if in the future you should find yourself in the same situation at the Allegro, don't hesitate to except their offer !!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Cooleeo47
Reviews.Content: I really had my druthers about this resort after reading some of the reviews. We just returned yesterday after 5 glorious days and it was a great vacation! The staff go out of their way to be helpful, the grounds were gorgeous and clean. The food was also good. The rooms were clean although a bit on the small side. However, who goes on vacation to sit in their hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Winter Escaping Winterpeggers”
Reviews.Author: Winterpig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro from the Januray 17th-31st. We were among the 70 + wedding group. After reading reviews about this resort, we didn't know what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised. It is our first time to Mexico, so we don't have anything to compare the resort to, but we liked the quaintness of the the Allegro. You have the ocean right there as well as the pools. What more could you ask for. Yes the sandbags aren't pretty, but what can you do, Mother Nature is taking its toll on the beach and they are doing their best to save it . It doesn't stop you from taking a dip in the ocean whenever you want! I never heard any complaints about not being able to get a beach chair (but you have to be up early to pick your spot!). The food was great and plentiful, and the food service staff was always cheerful and extremely accomodating. Thanks to Vincente, and Umberto and all the staff. (Those are the names that stand out in my mind, but they were ALL great!) As a matter of fact, you didn't pass any employee anywhere on the property that didn't say "Ola" to you. The Allegro is close to a lot of things. Just to name a few, Playa del Carmen was just a short $5.00 cab ride away or a 20 minute walk. The ferry to Cozumel leaves from Playa del Carmen and is only about a half hour ferry ride. The recreation staff at the pool was exceptional and again like the other staff very accomodating. Thank you for the laughs and the volleyball games and other activities, Luis and Ariel! A few suggestions I would have to the hotel would be that they update the furniture in the rooms, put more bartenders on at the pool bar and maybe keep the pool bar open later, and maybe put their menu on a two week rotation. We were there two weeks and noticed that the food was on a weekly rotation and thought that if they put it on a two week rotation, people like us would not have reptition. Not that I am complaining, because like I said before the food was great and plentiful. The wedding was lovely ,but we thought the bar should have stayed open later as it closed down at 10:00 p.m. There were other bars open at the resort, but there were enough people at the wedding to warrant keeping the bar near the reception open. We didn't want to come home and would definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: medic3132
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a last minute trip to the Occidental Allegro Playacar and had a great stay. The rooms were more than adequate and clean. The facilities were fine although a hot tub would be a nice addition especially during those cooler Feb. nights (there is one but it's only for the guests of the most expensive suites). The food was excellent and plentiful although the drinks seemed watered down (something I'm sure is common with the all inclusives). For the most part, we were very impressed with how hard the staff worked to make things pleasurable for the guests. A small gift for the maid and some cigars for the good waiters guarenteed great service. We always had extra bottles of water in the room and extra Tequila shots at dinner time. Overall, we found it difficult to find much to complain about. Most staff were friendly and helpful. Some very minor issues were being constantly bugged to attend the time share talks and a seemingly difficult time making local calls from the hotel. Often when we asked for information, staff would give us different stories and often didn't really seem to know the answers although they tried hard to assist (seems like the Mexican way). The hot stone massage was amazing. Definately wouldn't have any problems staying here again. For the people who complain about having a gecko in your room once in a while - stay home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food, Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Happytravellers2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently attended a Wedding of 70+ people at this resort. We were somewhat apprehensive about staying at a resort that was less than 4 1/2 Stars as we had always been warned to avoid these. This was our 4th trip to the Mayan Riviera & we booked 1 week at the Allegro Playacar & 1 week at the Barcelo Maya Colonial. We were quite amazed at the quality of the food, the best we have had at any resort we have ever stayed at. Cudos to the head chef! We only ate at the Buffet however as never had a chance to make it to the a la cartes. (Note: To book the a la cartes you MUST book 1 day in advance). We were not disappointed at all as we were so impressed with the Buffet restaurant. Such variety! Great presentation! The rooms are very basic but we found them to be adequate. TV's are rather antiquated. Though no one goes on a trip like this to sit in your room and watch TV, it would still be nice to be able to get the weather channel. Don't count on it at this resort! Poor reception, bad picture quality and very little channel selection. A dresser would be nice and a FULL shower curtain or shower door would improve matters as well. Yes, the pool water was cold but when we were there they had just had a stretch of cooler weather. As always, it was great once you were in! The pool activities were great and the activities co-ordinators were AWESOME!!! The Beach area is very small but you can walk a long way down passing resort after resort & will eventually come upon open beach. We particularly enjoy walking on the beach and were not disappointed here. We walked 45 minutes in one direction before turning back to head "home" and could have gone further. The grounds are beautiful and extremely well maintained. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. More bar service during the daytime would be a good thing. We quite enjoyed the location. It is a 20 min walk to Playa del Carmen in 1 direction & approx a 3 min walk to a fair sized Plaza in the other. This is a very small resort & we found it had a lot more charm than some of the larger resorts we have stayed at.. In summation, would we recommend this resort to others; we already have. Would we stay at this resort again; absolutely! Would we return to the Barcelo; not likely.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Kora0880
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro 14Jan- 24Jan 2009. Our expectations were not very high after reading the reviews here, but since my father has timeshare with the Allegro, and he loves it, we decided to give it a try. CHECK IN- smooth for us, but somewhat inconvenient for all of our guests as they had to change rooms after one night. The Hotel was overbooked throughout our stay. At one point we were given the option to transfer to Xcaret 5 Star hotel, all inclusive as well, with free passes to the Xcaret part. WE decided to stay with Allegro after all. STAFF- very friendlly and always smiling, very helpfull and pleasant to deal with all around. GROUNDS- Meticulously maintained and beautifull. ROOMS- Our 2 BR/2BA sweet was fantastic, with a little bar which was refilled promptly and daily with bottled water, and every third day with soda and beer. The other guests of ours stayed at regular rooms and studios (room with a living-room) and they reported the rooms were adequate and comfortable. Overall the hotel needs a facelift as compared to the surrounding ones. But all of our guests enjoyed the homey huts. BATHROOMS- somewhat of a joke with that 1/3 glass cover that is not adjustable, allowing water to run free everywhere. We layed a ton of towels to prevent it from flooding the rest of the bathroom and delt with it. The bathroom itself was very clean with complimentary toileting items, a sawing kit and many others. BEACH- day by day a bit more is eatten up by the sea. At this time there is a strip left enough to enjoy the sun, but you may want to get your spot earlier during the day. And yes, more sand bags are being added to save the little beach that is left. Further down the beach, approx 15 min walk towards the South, there is a fantastic beach, wide and not crowded at all. There is a reef with colorfull fish and crabs, large snails and many more shells to pick from. It is almost secluded. FOOD- Excellent buffet with many different things to chose from ffor each meal. Each day had a theme, ranging from French to International. We also enjoyed twice during our stay outside fiesta, wery well organized with great food veriety. The only complaint I have is the temperature of the food. Although buffet may not be served as hot, I found both restaurants, the Mexican and Italian to be serving room temperature meals. Honestly, the wuality of Italian and Mexican restaurants were surpassed by the buffet. WEDDING- the decorations and set up- by the 7 poles next to the beach, were very beautifull. The reception was fantastic, and the DJ played what we wanted, including our own music we brought in. The food we ordered was Italian, and it was OK, once again rather cool in temp. Wedding cake- excellent. Service- Excellent. Many thanks to the Wedding coordinator. The original wedding coordinator was difficult to keep in touch with and finaly resigned. The new one should get a star for making all the arrnagements in such a short time (2 weeks) and doing such a great job. Thanks to Daisy M. Romantic dinner for the newlyweds- excellent, very good and much higher quality than regular food served at the restaurants! also food presentation was very professional and splendid. We enjoyed it very much. SUPPRISE GIFTS- Appreciated :), the flowes were just amazing! The only small complaint would be just one jaccuzzi for the whole complex which was not working anyway. But overall, we had a great time and unforgetable experience! K A S

Reviews.Title: “Occidental is a timeshare nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Bicki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 7 - Jan 21. When we decided to stay at the Allegro we were told it was a 4 Star resort, it most certainly was not! I read the reviews on-line just like everyone else and I often think people are too picky, demanding etc. We expected comfortable accomodations. I do not spend alot of time in my room when on holiday but when I return to it I would like to be comfortable. No beach to speak of. We had two chairs in the room, both were broken, we had no dresser, all clothes were placed on two shelves, we had a thatched roof that leaked when it rained, there was a hole around the faucet that you could look into, there was a drain hole in the bathroom floor that reeked like sewer, the caulking in the shower was all off. This place needs to renovate before it can call itself a Fourstar Hotel, although in all the brouchures it says it has! If you request a different room you must sit through a 90 minute or more Timeshare speil, and believe me these people are relentless. They jump on you as soon as you walk trough the door. They are dressed exactly like the Hotel staff so you are decieved into believing that they are just that, STAFF! They escort you to your rooms and start in asap. They do this I belive because they know that if you speak to others you will not want to bother with them! They call your room, they put notes under your door, they accost you as you go for your meals. All this even when you have stated clearly you are not interested, you really have to be RUDE!!!! And this is all done with Managements okay. The grounds are lovely, there are a large variety of things to eat and food is always plentiful, as well are the drinks. You get a stocked fridge in you room or so they say, every third day you get two pop and they wil freak out if you ask for an extra pop and you will not get it! This Hotel could have alot of repeat customers if they gave this place a good cleaning, paint, new furniture, and got rid off the Timeshare people!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't change a thing!!”
Reviews.Author: realgeamma2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and we will definitely be back. This was our first real holiday ever. Never been to Mexico and was a little wary as we had heard some negative things about it. We had a wonderful time and am really glad that we stayed here. The service here is amazing and the staff were so friendly. ( Except for the timeshare maniacs)!!! How annoying is that???The rooms are a little old but to us that just added to the charm. We stayed for two weeks and by the end were definitely not ready to go back to the Canadian cold. The beach is a little eroded, but still very much enjoyable. Beautiful grounds, absolutely spotless and we had one incident whereby we left our room with the safe open, credit cards, cash, sunglasses, cameras, wedding rings everything of value and when I realized what I had done, I felt sick! I ran back to the room I saw that the cleaning staff were around and I almost cried, after all I heard about Mexico. Went in and everything was there! So I locked the safe-- I tracked down the woman that had cleaned our room and thanked her from the bottom of my heart and gave her a big tip!! Nice to know there are still some honest people in this world! There was lots of fun stuff to do at the resort and as much food and booze as you could ever need. The bartenders were all so much fun. I am ready to go back already! I honestly cannot say enough positive things about this resort and the staff that work there!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: animallover2009
Reviews.Content: We loved the property - it's beautiful & very clean. There isn't much beach in front of the resort, but there is plenty along the coast. The food was not good. What you had for breakfast, you had for lunch & then again at dinner. The food was edible, but disappointing. You'll never go hungry as they have a buffet for breakfast, lunch & dinner. The Mexican was great. The food & service was awesome. We never made it to the Italian resteraunt. The good booze (top shelf) is served at the bar for the dinner buffet. The pool bar only has "rail" booze. The beer tastes stale, but after a few it all tastes the same.

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: KitchenerDutchess
Reviews.Content: this is our second time there and both occasions it has been a wonderful time . we have two children ages 11 and 16 who refused to go anywhere else.they enjoyed all the activities by the pool and Stefano will be missed. we have no complaints it,s a smaller resort and we felt safe leaving our children enjoying the daily activities. the entertainment was great every night and the staff very freindly .

Reviews.Title: “Beats the Winnipeg cold anytime”
Reviews.Author: OlalaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec 31, 2008 to Jan 7 2009. We were a large group (23 in total) of 5 families with different age brackets including children, teenagers and adults. All in all everyone had a great time. The atmosphere is ideal, the beach is a bit eroded but workable, the amenities are great and the rooms are clean. While the rooms could use a bit of an uplift, they are acceptable and the staff keep them really clean. Besides, if you're the type who complains about the rooms and the TV channel selections, then you should stay in the room where you came from - no sense going someplace if you want to stay in your room any more than necessary. The food at the buffet and the pool side bars was great. If you did not like it, then I think you are a hard-to-please type of person and would normally complain anywhere you eat. If you expect to have similar experiences as in Canada or the USA, then stay there. Service was excellent and staff were very friendly especially Humberto (coffee with tequila!!). We stayed at different places in the Riviera area and we consider this place to be among the most friendly. Its closeness to Playa Del Carmen makes it an ideal place to go especially if you have teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: vicvitale
Reviews.Content: Reviews on rooms needing updated is true. Sand pillows on beach but still able to enjoy swim. Walk to town and shopping was great.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: wildings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro from Nov.28 to Dec.5 A group of 12 adults We got a really, really good deal. Hate to say what we paid, don't want to make others feel cheated- email me if you want to know. Travelled with Nolitours. We were supposed to get the chameleon select. Gives you preferred rooms, a gift, special seating for some meals. Don't count on it, it was no different than what everyone else gets. The Rooms: older rooms,a little worn but clean and satisfactory. Although if you get an adjoining room, hope it is someone you know-you can hear everything from your neighbours.They might as well be in the same room with you-this really sucked. The thatched roofs are quaint-especially if you have the second floor. The table and chairs as well as the hammocks on every patio or balcony is a nice touch. The Beach: very,very small. Not for beach lovers. No fault of anyone's but the weather, and the hotel is built too close to the ocean. You can't walk out too far and the ocean gets deep fast with a good current. Not good for snorkelling-absolutely nothing to see. The Grounds: lovely, the resort itself is very nice and kept clean. Small, which is nice, nothing is very far away. The Pools: one a swim up bar where all the games were being played and great service at the bar. Fun! the other- no games, a little quieter, but this is also where the young children played. The Food: Italian- small portions for some items and they do seem to love their salt! The mexican-again, small portions but overall very good food. The buffet-you could always find something to eat, but one week of it was long enough. Breakfasts-great!! And the buffet lunches by the pool bar were great. The Staff: we found everyone very friendly, especially the entertainment staff and the waiters and bartenders. Tours: instead of going with our Nolitour rep we were recommended by other vacationers to go with the tour company set up right beside the hotel lobby. Cheaper prices! Great service, great guides! We did a tour to the ruins in Coba, our guide was Sergio, ask for him, so informative! We had our own bus with 10 of us. They catered the trip to our wants. Climbing the ruins in Coba was amazing and so interesting. Also went to a cenote and had a swim-so beautiful, a must see!! Booked an ATV ride and all drove our own. Saw some ruins and swam in a cenote. Fun, fun! We had some scuba divers go on a 2 tank dive to the cenotes. Not your usual dive in the ocean, but the dive master was excelllent and the experience was well worth the intial concerns of diving in an underground body of water in some very dark and cramped spaces. A great experience and the divers were glad they did it. Shopping: went to 5th avenue, lots of stores just like a big city. Small mall a short walk from hotel, lots to choose from. Some will barter, look around first and get some prices to work with. All and all a good holiday. We always enjoy Mexico and have never had trouble with illness. Would not have a problem recommending this hotel to friends if the price is right . We enjoyed our time at the Allegro. Keep in mind- you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Cradled in the hands of Mexican Love”
Reviews.Author: olsonick
Reviews.Content: My family and I escaped the Utah icebox to Allegro Playacar for seven days and I'll remember it should I ever go to the Yucatan again. The three best things about this place vie for remembrance; the staff (impeccably helpful and friendly), the grounds (crews are keen to pick up every new-fallen leaf and article of garbage within minutes of its arrival), and the inclusive alcohol. There are three watering holes on campus and each bartender in each shift remembered my drink, so I gladly remembered his tips and the cycle continued. Lots of similarly-classed tourists arrived throughout the week. I got to know some French-Canadians, some Germans, some Mexicans, but almost no Americans. Perhaps that's for the best. The food here is just fine by me. There was always something at the buffet for everybody. The only unfulfilled eaters were the picky little boys, who during the day would eat the 'papas francescas' in a manner similar to a .50 calibre-gun's ammunition intake. Enrique, the bartender in 'The Disco' is a patient man who listened as my father got drunk and recommended irrelevant youtube videos in broken Spanish, then happily wished us farewell and a quick return. The entertainment is, well, entertaining! They are well-animated, professional, and genuinely interesting. Different shows every night draw decent percentages of guests out of their respective condos and under the palapa for an hour-and-a-half of family-friendly fun. Prior to the main show is the much-celebrated Kid's Disco which the little ones in the resort found highly enjoyable. The beach is small, yes, but it's big enough. This resort is not at all in a state of disrepair. Current bad reviewers are lying or had an experience very much excepted from the paradigm. The resort is also plenty safe. Children were not worried about. Lots of activities for the little ones; ping-pong and giant connect-four were big hits. For the money it was a very good time and I'll go back when I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here”
Reviews.Author: 4Richardson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week Dec.13-Dec.20, 2008. Our children are 20 and 18 and they brought friends along and we all had a great time. Not sure what people find to complain about except for the simple reason on complaining. You have the ability to make the best out of everything. Food - Every night was a different theme. Buffet had lots of variety and it was good. The Italian restaurant was very good and our daughter had a candlelight dinner on the beach which she raved about. Service - It was awesome! We loved everyone and literally got to know them by name. Show interest in them and they show it right back. You people that complain probably have never heard of tipping. Entertainment - Every night was a different show. The first night there our kids were involved and for the rest of the week people laughed at them. Lots of activities going on at the pool if you wanted to get involved. Great entertainment. Resort - Good size rooms, clean and it was nice having our own hamic. Rooms were cleaned daily. The resort was on the smaller size which was nice because you got to know people. Pools were clean with plenty of loungers. The 6 of us used the spa and enjoyed the massages in the cave. We all agreed that we would return and have no idea what people complain about.

Reviews.Title: “One Star At Best”
Reviews.Author: bruce1230
Reviews.Content: Although it says newly renovated I don't believe it. Yes the staff was nice, however, the facilities weren't. We had no operational toilet for 4 days. Each day maintenance was performed to no avail. Hardly any water pressure. Complaining to the front desk was like talking to the wall. The bathrooms are pretty outdated and dirty. The beach is severly eroded and good only if you walk to another resort. Food was limited and average. The Mexican Restaurant was best. The disco played the same music, 7 nights in a row, just new-wave boom-boom stuff that most of the older adults couldn't stand. How about something most of our visitors can dance to? Also, no ventilaition in the disco. Feels like they didn;t even want anyone to go there. This felt like a Spring Break resort where kids can party cheaply. The description does not match the property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LoriLovesMexico
Reviews.Content: We had the best experience at the Allegro Playacar. The hotel has little huts and each hut has 4 rooms. The rooms are smaller but big enough to live in and really how much time do you spend in a room? You have your own patio with table and chairs and a hammock!!! It is clean and the staff are great. I left small tips $2/day... each day and they give you ten star treatment.There was one night where a man was way too drunk; he fell and his head was bleeding, the staff came quickly and took care of him with dignity and respect. The food was awesome with lots of variety. It's hot and very tastey for some who are watching there calorie intake and for someone who isn't!!! I felt very safe.We brought four children with us and I let them do what they wanted because I felt so safe. I would stay there in a heart beat again and again. You are close to a little market; one block to the left, the bank and starbucks. Also you can go to Playa de Carmen (5 minutes away) and to Cozumel; a 30 minute ferrry ride from playa de carmen (great place to shop and snorkel!!!). Do the Mayan Village/ cenote /Chichen Itza tour with George and Noltours; a five star tour.You can stilll climb this pyramid, one of the last few. Bring little gifts (from your culture) for the Mayan children it will be the best tour/reward of your life. The hotel has lots to do (Spanish lessons, dance classes, yoga, water volleyball, water/land aerobics, water sports etc... and the beach is great. The sand is like no other your feet will touch and the water many shades of blue.. There are still a few shells to find. A few sand bags in front of the beach but you can still enjoy it. If you like buying stuff on the beach there is enough of that but they don't hound you if it's not your thing. Parasailing is fun, safe and not expesive at $50 and you can go as many as three at one time. It is the best hotel I have stayed in and I have spent half my life in Mexico. Don't listen to the negativity (nothing can make those people happy) just go and enjoy!!!! Lori P. from Canada-January 2009

Reviews.Title: “activities staff are excellent”
Reviews.Author: amyhiltonhead
Reviews.Content: My family vacations every year between Christmas and New Years. This year we went to Occidental Playa del Carmen. The food was fair. The rooms were small and had a musty odor, probably from the thatched roof, however the staff and weather were fabulous. Jose Luis one of the activity personnel has what it takes to get people up out of their lounge chairs and play volleyball, take dancing lessons and/or play games. He obviously loves his job along with Luigi, Elisa and Hilda who are other activity personnel. Jose Luis can be found around the pool or being the emcee at night for the nightly show. My dad was called up on stage New Years night to perform in a skit and Jose Luis made him feel very comfortable and made the audience laugh. Hilda and Elisa were very helpful with my niece age 4 and my nephews ages 8 and 10. This hotel is a great place to take children. The tennis pro Isaac gives great lessons, so be sure to take your tennis racquet!!! Once again, the staff is great along with the bartenders in the First Club. Jose Luis is outstanding in his field of activities!! Amy Freund Abernathy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation At The Allegro”
Reviews.Author: pbsdeb
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT WEEK @ THE ALLEGRO ! Just returned from a week at the Allegro from Dec5-12/08. Would definitely return to this resort. HOTEL - very clean but the rooms are in need of some upgrades, VERY MUSTY & DAMP & be sure to bring air freshner for the rooms SERVICE - very accomodating, outgoing & helpful FOOD - very repetitive but never in need, PIZZERIA was awesome, ALACARTES - not so great - -- MEXICAN did not enjoy, COFFEE, not good at all DRINKS - huge selection & would make what you wanted BEACH - OK, many a sandbag along the shoreline but be sure to walk to the end of the resorts, BEACH is much nicer further down, no troubles gettin lounge chairs but put towels on early morning WEATHER - warm but not as warm this time of year ENTERTAINMENT - the best I've seen in Mexico, COSTUMES were amazing FRIENDS - HELLO to all the friends we met from all over CANADA & also to Gary & Diana from LONDON, ENGLAND CHEERS to all of you - - - MERRY CHRISTMAS & ALL THE BEST IN 2009 ! ` - DEB & ELAINE from HAMILTON, ONTARIO WE WOULD DEFINITELY RETURN TO THIS RESORT AGAIN !

Reviews.Title: “perfect resort but the rooms spoil it”
Reviews.Author: mega1258
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from england & were taken to our room & my wifes first reaction was that the rooms were not of the standard we are used to & because she was so tired she went to bed but found the mattress were so hard that she had a job to sleep. We woke in the morning & inspected the room & they were very badly decorated & the bathroom was a joke, very run down & the shower head was fixed in one position & flooded the floor as only a small splash screen. The good things were the staff, the cleaners,the entertainment,the cleaniness of the resort,& the beach were fantastic,if all this had not been so good we would have moved. We met some lovely people including fred, kim,martin & his new wife& debbie & elaine. I did air my views to the manager who knew the problems with the rooms but said that the owners were making a decision on whether to update the rooms or turn the whole resort into a timeshare resort

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: TheBono
Reviews.Content: Nothing great as far as I can see to write about this hotel , this is only to give heads up to someone thinking about staying there. If you do not have high expectations then this is a good place for you.Clean , friendly. 2 big pools to choose from..the water was not very warm for the Nov-Dec. season they ,..could put some kind of solar heater to keep it a few deg. warmer The food is pretty much what you'd expect at these types of resorts. Breakfast always fresh and good and if you don't have a demanding palet you'll do ok. All in all I/we had a very good and relaxing time. TheBono

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon18
Reviews.Content: First off.... the hotel grounds were awesome. We had friendly staff at the front desk and in the restaurant, food was average, but nothing to rave about, but tolerable. But I had some major issues with the rooms and the timeshare agents constantly hounding you to sit in on their presentation for a vinyl bag and some very cheap tequilla. I was shocked and disappointed at the room size, the cheap decor, the rusty mirrors and hangers, damp smell in the rooms, the awful shape of the terra cotta tile, the dirty grout in the bathroom, the 1/4 shower door, mold and dirty grout in shower stall, the very hard and very gray towels which looked dirty, the cheap bedspreads and linens and I could go on and on, but you get the picture. I wasn't expecting Trump Towers, but when I pay good money for a room I expect it to be clean and presentable. If I'm paying $50.00 a night for a motel room in Wildwood NJ( no offense NJ) I expect it to look like a standard beach motel room, but I don't expect to get that from an Occidental properties at $150-200 a night. It's almost like they put all their remodeling budget into the Vacation Club rooms and said to heck with the average vacationer. The vacation club members pay $12,000 + to be a part of the " vacation club" or let's call it what it really is and that's a timeshare, but they seem to get the rooms that are clean with the up to date furniture, comfortable beds and top shelf liquor in the drinks. I think that's why the timeshare reps are located right smack dab in the middle of the hotel lobby, as you exit and head towards your "room".
