If you complain enough, the timeshare rep will come and offer you to get you an upgraded room if you listen to the presentation. Everything about this property was dissappointing and if I didn't have 7 people in my party, I would have cancelled the reservations and found rooms elsewhere. I was ready to come home the minute I walked into that room. I avoided going to the room at all costs, which is too bad because some times you just want to relax and have a romantic evening with our partner or spouse and that didn't happen for me on this trip, as I was so angry from day one of the trip, that it took everything I had get through the 5 days in Playa with a smile on my face, so I wouldn't ruin the vacation for my myself or my loved ones. Based on rooms alone, I would NOT recommend this property to friends or family. I think the lack of care given to keeping the rooms updated and focusing on little details with the painting, tiling, repairs etc.that has been overlooked in all of these rooms make the rooms look very cheap and dirtly. No matter how great a job housekeeping does, the rooms will still feel, smell and look dirty based on the fact that these details have been missed. I know people aren't supposed to spend all their time in the rooms while on vacation, but you still want to shower, change and spend time in a room that is warm and inviting and you won't find that at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great mexico!”
Reviews.Author: gintare29
Reviews.Content: Great animacion team, but specially STEFANO!!!!!!! Gintare, Lithuania P.S. The food is not good

Reviews.Title: “Great Annimation Team!”
Reviews.Author: Janneman1965
Reviews.Content: We went there for 7 nights from 22 until 29 oktober. Our general oppinion of this resort is very good. We staid in room 5301, it's near a kids club. The site was very clean. And the staff was very friendly. A little minus was that the food on the buffet wasn't always hot. The annimation-team was GREAT! (Thanx Adan) We did have a lot of fun together. Especially the evening entertainment. We did enjoy it very much. And if we can find the time, we go back for sure! Willy & Jan The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sgarant
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time to Allegro Playacar. We went in Dec 2007 with a group of 16 people and had a great time even though it was a little cooler than we expected and the pool water was cold, but not so cold we didn't go in it. We had so much fun that our group wanted to return when it was warmer so we went back in May with a group of 17. We stayed in the First Club section and everyone had lots of fun. No complaints. Our rooms were kept nice and clean and mini bar stocked. The service we had from Sergio in First Club - Outstanding, Abel at the Swim up Bar - Outstanding, the restaurants and the Acitivies Group were all great. It is much more fun if you join in and participate in the activity events. They had everything, water balloon fights, dance lessons, step areobics, arm wrestling, tequilla volleyball, tequilla darts. Everyone is nice, friendly and always smiling. They made sure we were taken care of and had lots of fun. A little tipping goes a long way. We had 2 kids with us, age 7 & 10 and they had a great time too. They went to the Kids Club 1 day, played on the beach, played in the pool, chased lizards and even were allowed to play pool on the pool tables in the dance club on the off hours. The dance club is small but good music and we had lots of fun dancing in there a couple of nights. The shows at the resort were good too. A little variety of everything from comedy to dance to magic. While we were there they had a Mexican Buffet outside with a show and on another night it was Carribean Night. The food for both of those events was great. I have seen some of the other reviews where people complain about the food, but none of our group went hungry. There is always something to choose from. Even the kids were happy, they lived on Tacos, Pizza, burgers and nachos and plenty of desserts. They were good with that. We went into Playa Del Carmen which is a 5 minute, $5.00 taxi ride or about a 10 - 15 minute walk. We found a little taco stand that had the best tacos and margaritas in town. It was so good we went there in December and May and the guy remembered us, of course how could you forget our loud group. We went on an excursion to Coba and swam in a cenote and zip lined in the jungle. That was an experience. If you visit Coba, be sure to hike to the top of the ruin. The view is gorgeous. On another day we visited Maroma Beach which was about 25 minutes from our resort. This is a beautiful beach with a small restaurant - good food and cold beer. We swam there and we went horseback riding. They let us take the horses into the water and swim in the waves. Another day a few of us did the Swim with the Dolphins. What an experience that was. We also visited Xcaret - the eco park. We had fun there too, but a little crowded, that was the only negative to that trip. Lots of people that day. We had lunch at one of the Park's restaurants that overlooked one of the coves. We went snorkeling in the underground river. Everyone liked that. Lots of fish and caves to be seen. The Mayan dinner show is not to be missed. Very entertaining. So much to do and so little time. We all had such a great time we are planning another trip back in May 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Good entertainment”
Reviews.Author: windsurfMonterrey
Reviews.Content: My wife and me were there 6 nights ending 21th of October, room 5312. All your services and installations are good to very good. Your entertainment at the theatre is very good to excellent: toastmasters, dancers, etc. One day the room was not cleaned a 3pm, at which time we refused to be disturbed to permit the entrance of the maid. I went to your hotel to practice windsurf which I couldn't because you have not the equipment in spite of your advertisement on the contrary this really disappointed me. Rafael Garza

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Playacar - It's Not Perfect, But Neither Are You”
Reviews.Author: sandbarfly
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second awesome stay at the Allegro Playacar. We upgraded from the standard resort room to one of the three 2-Bedroom suites at the resort. Not sure how we scored it, but we are club members, had five in our party and it was low-season. My wife and I would like to interject right now; What is all the whining about! If you are lucky enough to be in Mexico, you are lucky enough. No, the resort is not perfect but there are many great things about it too. First, the food is decent, but by the time you add the atmosphere, it makes it even better. Unless you are capable of only eating one thing, there is more than enough variety to pick from. The staff is super, overly accommodating, and extremely hard working. As a guest in their country, paying or not, don't be RUDE! Tipping is also a nice gesture, it is not expected, but is appreciated. The grounds are beautiful, and the ocean is stunning. To all of those crybabies who complain about the sandbags and the lack of beach, how much do you need? Sand is sand, whether there is 20 feet or 50 yards. There is ample room to stretch out and enjoy the sand, water and a cool drink. They are working hard to reclaim the beach. If you need more than that, go to the desert. This may sound a little harsh, but you are on vacation to relax, not nit-pick everything you see. The resort is a fifteen-minute stroll past some beautiful homes I wish I was fortunate enough to own. There is always something fun to do or see in town. Lots of good food, plenty to see and great shopping if you are willing to haggle. All-in-all, our family finds the Allegro a great little resort, moderately priced, beautiful to the eye, and quite comfortable. Don't believe all the negative reviews. If you are looking to find fault, you will. If you looking instead, to have a great time, you will find that too. If you need more detailed info please feel free to contact my anal retentive husband, he is bursting with useless information that he would love to share.

Reviews.Title: “Top entertainment & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Brightbyname
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff provided the opportunity for a great holiday - and even the rainy season played ball and stayed away! The hotel's atmosphere was created in a large part by the staff; whether serving you at the bar, clearing the restaurant table or even cleaning the bed & restrooms. Above all though the entertainment team was superb. Everything was offered from Spanish lessons through to Tequila Volleyball! The professionalism and unending energy a credit to Jose, Stefano, Janet, Vergy and Adan. In the evening we enjoyed a top quality show every night, whether dancing, magicians or circus the performances were top notch as was the hosting from Adan. And for sportsmen there were great tennis courts, a long swim pool, sheltered beach area and easy access to booking Jet Ski and snorkeling. Food and drink was plentiful, high quality and sufficiently varied for a week's stay and language was never an issue for non Spanish speakers. We couldn't wait to jump out of bed each morning and start our day....... Matt&Ali

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to Relax.....”
Reviews.Author: picarrelli
Reviews.Content: It was a great deal for the price we paid. The room was nice and neat, Stuff was very nice and helpful. Food is available all day by the pool, The italian restaurant a great place to eat, When we arrived we paid extra to move to a room close to the pool and beach...big mistake they have blasting music from 10am to 6pm. we mencion this to the people in charge nothing was done, the age group at the place was 30's and up, the music was good for a spring break type environment.. was absolutly crazy....the only reason I will never go back to this hotel P.E.C NYC

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: jimsNY
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Aug 25th and encountered problems immediately. First there was difficulty in finding over reservations but after several tense mins our reservations were found. We added a third person and once I told the individual at the front desk this he looked perplexed. Again we waited a few tense minutes and he finally found the notes about the additional person. Amount for her to pay was figured out and she handed over her cc. We were able to get the room keys and our wrist bands. A nice lady then walked us to our room. We walked in and were in shock. I knew the rooms were small for three people but they are super small. We req'd a rollaway and knew there was no way it would fit. Besides that the musty smell of the room was very strong and it just seemed damp and not cool enough. Third person traveling with us decided she wanted her own room so she was off to the front desk to see about pricing. We also asked her while she was there if she could see about getting us switched. After waiting and waiting my other friend and I went to the front to see what the hold up was. Apparently front desk manager told my third friend that she was not allowed to request a room change. And as for another room for herself they quoted her something very very expensive. So my friend decided to go online to find herself another hotel. My other friend and myself decided to see about a room change. They gave us another key and we went to look at the room. Same problem and friend just sneezed walking into the rooms. At the point we knew we had to switch. We spent a total of 3 hrs or so at the resort and eventually checked out. Third friend got her refund immediately as she paid them that day. Myself and the other friend need to call who we booked with to see about getting a refund. Will never stay there nor will I recommend this hotel for anyone else. Front desk did not seem to really care as when we first arrived there were people coming in constantly asking to be switched. We winded up next door at the Wyndham Azteca, which was a nicer resort and definitely had a friendlier front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, with a couple caveats”
Reviews.Author: DCDeaconblue
Reviews.Content: The basic facilities are quite fine, somewhat midrange for the area. The bathroom in our room the first night smelled quite bad, but we were able to upgrade to an ocean view at a fair price after the first night (and a dose of griping). Otherwise, the room was ok, the maid service proficient, but the air conditioning is simply inadequate to August in Mexico. Not intolerably so, but close. I've seen a lot of complaints in the reviews about the food. This is not del Monicos, but the food is quite good and varied. No complaints at all on that score, and the Italian and Mexian restaurants were especially good. The staff was uniformly very helpful, polite, and engaging, and just nice to be around. If you visit Chichin Itza, strongly recomment you talk with Erika to arrange the tour through Georg (sp). He's an ethnologist in the area whose knowledge and passion for the mayan culture is captivating. There are a lot of deals that can be worked, if you're willing to sit through a 90 minute presentation on timeshares. Be clear -- despite all the talk to the contrary, this is a hard sell exercise and the salesmen are well trained to get you to commit quickly to a financial obligation that probably should be done after extensive thought. Unless you've already decided you want the deal, just say no and keep on saying it. If you decide you like the deal, there will be another day/year. The beach was pretty minimal, so this isn't a beach vacation but an ocean vacation. One gripe is that they only have one kind of beer -- Corona, which is about the worst of Mexico's many fine offerings. A lot of Europeans come to this resort which is great for the variety of interactions, but if you detest smoking as I do, this is a problem. One final word of advice -- this is a cash based economy. Don't expect to get far with your credit cards even for a $300 trip to Xcaret. Fortunately, there is an ATM at a nice mall just 100 yards down the road. This resort is fine for families with small kids and anyone who wants some basic fun and relaxation. If you want peace and quite, or if you want to party hearty around the clock, you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: HMW3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early August with our two sons (9 and 12) for six nights after booking via an auction site for approx $130/night - as kids were free. I'm glad we didn't pay much more because it wouldn't have been worth it. Bottom Line: If you can book this resort for a decent price and have low/minimal expectations, you'll be fine. If your paying $175+/night, you should consider other options as there are many. The 3-star rating is appropriate but be careful and don't pay a 4-star price. The Wydham Azteca and the Iberostars are definitely a step above Allegro. This was our fifth trip to Mexico in the last three years. Prior to arriving, we had spent four nights at of our favorite remote outpost in Mexico. In our travels, we have stayed at AIs, local hotels, eaten at very small local restaurants, and eaten food from a variety of street vendors. We have never experienced a bout with Montezuma's revenge. Within 24 hours of our arrival, we were all paid a visit. Our experience was not unique during our stay as many other guests were visited. It's our belief that it came from the water we were served at our first lunch. The resort either does not filter or has issues with their water filtration system. This issue will be difficult for you to avoid as this water is in your pop, ice (and thus frozen drinks), and coffee. We switched to bottled water and limited our in take of resort liquids (except beer and wine). We took our bottled water to meals and made coffee in the room with it. Within a day or two of the switch everyone was fine again. The rooms are adequate, a bit dated, and starting to show signs of age. The air conditioning worked quite well and the ceiling fan ensured air movement. There are eight rooms in each building which gives the resort a nice appearance. Unfortunately, the walls are very thin and sound travels easily (conversations, tv, etc). Luckily we had few neighbors and quiet ones in our building - unfortuantely the same couldn't be said of my crew. Overall, the food is just barely average. The buffet is generally disappointing with a very minimal selection of items. The main 6 meal items (meat, starch/bean, vegetable) are repeated four times on the buffet - one wonders why they couldn't offer a bit more variety rather than having four of the same dish? For dinner, the themed restaurants are slightly better than the buffet and recommended versus the buffet. The themed dinner nights are also a savior from the dreaded buffet. We missed Caribbean night (as we ate in town) and found the food on Mexican night very good (avoid the al pastor station as it was simply terrible - the skirt steak off the grill was quite good a long with numerous side dishes including the salbutes). The grill by the pool for lunch is, again, a much needed rescue from the buffet offering burgers, chicken, fish, vegetables, and pork. Food here is good but did you really come to Mexico and pay $200+/night for hamburgers? The pizzeria is also decent and help to add some variety for lunch or nice late afternoon snack. They do a nice job on maintaing the grounds and the pools are ok. The "party pool," nearest the ocean and bar, is where the normal AI activities take place. A larger quiet pool is directly behind this and offers some peace and serenity and a more appropriate play place for younger children. The outdoor bar area is typically understaffed so expect some lines and wait times for an adult beverage. The plastic bar glasses will also be in short supply on a daily basis so keep tabs on your non-alcholic cup and re-use it. Non-alcholic beverages include a pop machine, purified water (not cold), and two juice choices. The water and juices typically will run out and the pop machine is also subject to break downs and outages.

Reviews.Title: “What really was Franko `s job (alias the rooster)”
Reviews.Author: moonflowerbis
Reviews.Content: As I have been saying to everybody this was a nice vacation, I really have appreciated the hard work of all the employees......just one thought. Franco, one of the staff member also known as the rooster for his hair, what does really do beside hiting on young (mostly minor) girls? His behavior was really unprofessional and unethical. Plus, he is introduced as an italian but not only he doesn`t speak and understand italian, he also doesn`t like Italy. All the other staff member did a good job I wish they could eat with us at the table, on that I was also disappointed. Big Mama :-)

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bleggett
Reviews.Content: The customer service was amazing. The front desk employees went out of their way to help us. Unfortunately, the food was pretty poor. It was never the right temperature. The rooms do not have roofs. They are made out of straw so your room never really cools down. Also, the last few days we started having little bugs in room. The pool is okay. Needs some repairs for the tile but overall okay. Overall, this would be a great place for a family with kids but not for just a couples vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Playacar does it right”
Reviews.Author: Bluewaterben
Reviews.Content: If you want a fail-safe vacation on fablulous beach that has it all, Allegro Playacar is the place. I took my two boys, 18 and 20 (a highly discerning age group!), and they loved it too. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Don't look for high-end luxury--the rooms are simple and the TV channels can be a little fuzzy, but they are clean, comfortable, and quiet, and we slept very well. Food is very good with wide variety of selections from multiple buffets. After a couple of days, the waiters got to know my preferred drink and brought them to me without me asking. (And they genuinely seemed to enjoy their jobs.) I thought there was a slight musty smell in the room, perhaps from the AC, but nobody else noticed, and open windows cleared it out. In any case, hardly a problem compared to all the pluses. I've traveled all over the Caribbean, and this place offers the one of the very best values for your money. Ben

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO FRIENDS”
Reviews.Author: b0b68
Reviews.Content: We were sooo excited to be on our honeymoon, checked in...everything ok so far because we were excited to be somewhere warm not knowing what awaited us just around the corner.....and then we saw the room that we would be staying in for the next 10 days and everything came to a screeching halt. Not what we expected! The room was small and once you take a shower you are painfully aware of how small it is because there are no shower curtains and the water gets everywhere so you have to mop it all up with the 2 towels that you get. The bed, what a nightmare, so hard with springs fighting against your body we woke up sore all over. The only reason we were able to sleep at all was because we were exhausted from our early flight. Everything felt wet and damp including the bed! There were lizards in our room, mold in the bathroom, no beach, the food was mediocre at best and the place was not more than average in every way. We couuldn't bare to stay another night so we made arrangements to stay somewhere else, switching rooms wouldn't have helped since all of the rooms are identical with the same problems. We heard plenty of complaints from other visitors staying at the resort but we were all hostage so to speak since we had purchased an all inclusive package. We cut our losses and took our chances and left . Oh I didn't mention THE MANAGMENT was the worst part of everything nobody help us.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: magicrain3
Reviews.Content: The Staff was mostly friendly, the grounds were beautiful. The pools were clean. The beach are was intact. The food was mediocre at best.Typical buffet food with lots of repeats. the grill was ok for burgers and hotdogs if you had kids. It was nice to have the pizza place open most of the day. The fountain machine on the bar did not work so you had to wait in line. The two restaurants were nothing special. At least the Italian place had A/C. All the room have NOT been remodled. The rooms were small, but you don't spend much time there anyway. the beds were horible. It was a foamy on a box spring. the shower tiles were horrendous. but there was a hand held and lots of hot water. The huts are very spred out so you are either close to the pool/beach or not. The staff to sign you up for the look see of the other hotels were very pushy and called your room. My biggest complaint was there was no free internet. They did have wireless but charged you for it. I took my own computer to do some work and had to pay for wifi. then found out there was a plug in directly to the router in the little computer room, so i used that and didn't have to pay. I had a problem with the water. It made me and many people I met sick. That includes pop, smoothies, drinks, soup etc. I had diarehhria all 10 days. and drank 4 bottles of pepto bismol. Apparently they do NOT FILTER.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations by 110%”
Reviews.Author: claymc
Reviews.Content: We were reluctant to decide on the Allegro Playacar resort based on reviews that we have read. Our main concerns were the quality of the rooms mentioned and the amount of children at the resort. Both were absolutly false. Our room was very nice. Not extravagant, but much better than I would expect for a rated 3-star resort. Also the resort did cater towards children, but did an excellent job with the activities. The kids that were there, did not bother us at all. Honestly could hardly notice them. Food was good for a buffet. Drink were excellent. Victor at the 'time share recruiting' desk was our friend all week. He was the best. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone that is look for an excellent place within this price range. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BathshebanDavid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Allegro Playacar from July 7 - 12. It was a thoroughly enjoyable vacation. I took the advice of another TripAdvisor reviewer and upgraded to an oceanfront room - a definite must for $20 extra per day. The food was great, the drinks fine, and the location terrific. Yes, there are geotubes in the water - but that is true for the whole coastline. There are plenty of places to go swimming that are close by. If you go, and I highly recommend you do - you will be impressed by the well-kept grounds and attentive staff. Once you make it clear to the time-share sharks you are not interested they will leave you alone. If you need a 5 star experience, you'll have to pay 5 star prices, but for the money the Allegro is great. I'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “a let down”
Reviews.Author: Anne032
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico and I can say that I will not return. Between the hotel totally ignoring us to the language barrier this was the worse vacation I have ever had. We were delayed 15 hours on Monday due to Dolly and did not arrive on resort until 3:30 am. The bus driver did not give us a voucher when he dropped us off and we had a little trouble getting our room, but after threatening to call Apple vacations and my travel agent they said "not necessary". We received no orientation or follow up by any staff. We did not even know we had a mini frig in our room until my son discovered it in a cabinet. This was the first time I have taken my boys abroad and I specifically requested a "family " resort for this reason. The nudity on the beach was unexpected to say the least. No where in brochure did it say there was topless sunbathing. If I wanted to see that I would have stayed in Cancun. The brochure also showed beautiful sandy white beaches, not sand bags as far as you can see all up and down the beach. The room was so small. I didn't expect a suite but at least a door on the bathroom so I could change since sharing a room. Only the tiny shower/toilet had a door, there's no way to get dressed in there. My 9 year old did enjoy the kids club pool games and water balloon fights. Patti(kids club staff) did keep both of my boys busy in the pool. The ocean was a beautiful blue if you could just get past the sand bags. The porch light was hanging by a wire and the hammock was broken. I did bring this up, but nothing was done. Food was terrible the first 2 days. Buffet did get better as week went on. Pizzeria by the pool was what the kids liked and the snack bar. Drinks were very weak. On Tuesday I drank beer and strawberry daq's all day and not even a buzz (I'm not a drinker). The ambience at the big pool was good..good music and everyone having fun. Don't plan on relaxing on the beach. Just when I would get lotioned up and relaxed in the sun the vendors go on attack mode. You will be ask if you want to buy almost everything under the sun. We made the best of it. The staff did not even follow up with us on our last day. I have stayed in a few 3-3 1/2 star resorts and was always acknowledged because I was a paying guest. This resort has thumbs down from me. I will definately not be back and not to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, beach sucks”
Reviews.Author: nedgulden
Reviews.Content: The best features of this hotel are its swimming pools, gardens and friendly staff and service. Rooms are spartan with very little storage but kept spotless. They are trying to restore the beach area but in my opinion the beach sucks. If you are a beach lover then try a different area of the Mayan Riviera as the hotels around the Allegro all have the same problem with lack of beach area, some worse then others. Playa del Carmen, a 5 min cab ride or 20 min walk, has the type of beach as shown in brochures and has great restaurants, beach bars and a vibrant nightlife. The hotel has a very international clientele and ambiance and again, the service and friendliness of the staff sets it aside from other properties. I would highly recommend this hotel for its value and location.

Reviews.Title: “A Little of everything”
Reviews.Author: Acer898
Reviews.Content: Well I am always prepared for the worst but in this case nothing could have prepared me ...... The car I arranged for our arrival to Cancun, was late, over an hour late. The driver sped through cancun and was stopped by cops, had to stop for gas, and wasn't very friendly. Upon arrival to the hotel at 330 the room wasn't ready - (note: check in is 3 PM). Because I was at noticeably boiling point, they gave us another room so my family didnt' have to wait.. But that was a nightmare in itself because they gave us a microscopic room that stunk and i can't even explain it. Room: Smells, No room for kids to play, old, mattresses are dirty old, and they put a foam cushion to make it more comfortable. Upside, the origami's the cleaning people do to make the rooms more pleasant, the extra towels the organization - is fantastic. they are the friendliest people you will encounter.. at least on the premises. Bathrooms - floors get wet, smells, but its a bathroom. and it has hot water. Premises - spectacular 5 star i give them. Buffet staff - hostess... I personally think its racial my husband thinks its money issue. We tipped her but nothing more than a $1. But I don't think she liked us and two other families we spoke to... if we asked for the air conditioned section she said it wasn't open yet.. (we woudl go eat about 6 PM to avoid over crowding) but if someone walked in a few minutes later with the same request she would sit them in the section we were just told was closed. We complained after 3 incidents and it never happened again.. although neither did her greeting us. She was just plain rude and very obnoxious. Food - eh not too good not too bad... in between. They had very few selections for breakfast and for dinner, for lunch we would eat by the pool area and that was 80% better. The waiters. There are a handful that are great. there are some that can see you dragging the high chairs or need help and won't assist you and then there are others that we look forward to talking to while we are at a meal. disco - Needs more TLC. Good music but you walk in to smelly place. old gringy. No decor nothing that will call your attention. Night shows. 1 to 10 i give 20+ they are awesome. I loved going to the shows. VERY ENTERTAINING. Especially Mexican Heritage night! I was touched. It was a spectacular show! the dancers are talented and are grand! Fun Club. With the exceptions of one or two incidents. (they woudl tell my son and his new found friend that the balls to the iping pong table was not available.. and two minutes later a couple would ask for it and they were given the ball and raquet.. I have to say they really do try to keep everyone entertained. Good looking folks.. the organizer the manager very nice pleasant people. The First Club - The one person who stood oout - I got sick in one of my trips and she really helped us.. Hilda really nice girl.. very friendly - outgoing and did her best to make our stay as comfortable as can be. I heard a rumor that they were going to close the premises for major repairs in the next months or so - i hope so because it would be ashame if because the chain in my opinion is a good chain and well worth the money you spend. We normally wouldn't complain but this place got out of hand on more than three occasions. Once you are ok twice you start having doubts, third time is a charm and that is when i speak up. Hope this helps.. Feel free to email me

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Sabower1
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our stay at the Allegro...what a great resort! This was our third trip to the Riviera Maya area, so we feel we know what we're looking for now in a vacation. The staff was very courteous, any help we needed was given within moments! Our room would be described as "earthy" with tile floors, and a thatched roof. We paid a little extra for the "premium" room closer to the beach, and we thought the location was perfect. Other than the occasional tiny lizard popping in or out, it was kept VERY clean and there were always plenty of fresh towels. The food at the buffets is what you would expect, and pretty good, but the Italian and Mexican restaurants were really terrific. The activities staff always had something fun for every age group, and they were very nice. They never pressured you to participate, but they always made you feel welcome. There were plenty of couples, families with children, and retirees, and everyone seemed to blend well. I would love to return to this resort on our next trip to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lalita74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allegro from June 23-June 30. I have two girls (6yrs and 2yrs) my husband and I and we have absolutely no complaints! I know, some of you might think I'm lying but I'm not. I am a true tripadvisor fan and take the website serious when it comes to being objective and like to be honest when I do my reviews. We stayed in building 44, our room was 4402, close to the beach, the pool and towel area. We had two beds in the room, yes it was a bit tight but I expected that when I requested two beds. The room was always clean and it was kept clean all week thanks to the wonderful maintenance staff. I had a different towel animal each day and found the room spotless everyday-trust me, with my two girls the room was never fun to clean. The mini fridge was stocked as needed. The hammock is a nice touch to the room when you want to lay on it and just nap- did it twice. The beds are firm and have a mattress pad for all the complainers who want something softer. We all slept like babies and never woke up with any back problems. I never had a noise issue, my girls were a bit loud at night before going to bed but I never heard my neighbors, if they heard me, they never complained. The resort is spotless. I have never seen so many people dedicate the time to picking up leaves, yeah leaves! There is always someone cleaning the pool daily, washing the sand off the path, cutting the grass, sprinklers keep all the property nice and green, the place gets touch ups everywhere you see. It's not that big but I would not consider it small, it has 58 buildings, each building has two floors. There is something for everyone to eat at all times. I don't like the people that complain about the food or the closing of the buffet. I think there is always something for everyone and if they close the buffet it’s because they have to prepare for dinner and dress the place up but they always open the another area for food. You can never go hungry in this place or thirsty! They have a daily grill lunch with your American goodies if you miss home (burgers and hotdogs) steaks, chicken, and ribs too. The dinners change daily and have a variety for everyone not get bored of the same thing. All the staff is wonderful, attentive, and very hard working! The beach is small. It was really hit bad last year with the hurricane. I need to be clear on this issue- all of PDC was affected by this hurricane. Therefore, all the resorts on the PDC strip have the same problem of erosion. They pump sand into the beach and block the current with large sand bags. So it doesn’t matter if it’s a 5 star hotel or a 2 star hotel, the beach is the same for all. You can’t mess with Mother Nature and expect to reclaim it in a year. It took Cancun almost 4 years to recover and some resorts simply did not reopen. So please understand that Allegro Playa del Carmen is doing its best for the guests to enjoy the beach. Having said all that- there are plenty of beach chairs and canopies for shade but if you want to reserve some seats before breakfast, it doesn’t hurt. I never had any problems getting four chairs. The pool area is always a favorite for me and my girls. They have two pools. One is more active than the other-only because they use it for fitness exercises so it can be a bit loud but nothing you need to worry. The other pool is more family style for kids to lay and jump in. please do not think you can not relax, yes you can. Drinks are great-try mojitos, caipirina, miami vice, strawberry dackaries, and don’t forget the coronas. The location of Allegro is perfect! It is the third resort on the strip, $5USD to 5th Avenue (shopping area) or a 20-25 minute walk. The walk is pleasant and not dangerous. After two or three times of walking to 5th avenue you enjoy it so just take the cab on the way back if you are too tiered to walk or too tipsy to make it back. The Ferry to Cozumel is right on 5th avenue and its $24 round trip for all those who are wondering. The ferry is top of the line, take the yellow ferry, they have a live band. For those of you who have never been on a ferry, you might get sea sick. I recommend this resort for couples and families. It’s not a place for singles to party like spring breakers. The food is good, service is fantastic, location is perfect, and the place is clean. It’s up to each individual to make the best or the worst of a vacation. Go with a positive mind and just remember why you went on vacation-to enjoy the time away from everything that reminds you of work!

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Gives a little bit More”
Reviews.Author: vablu56
Reviews.Content: My wife ,our 16 year old son and myself stayed at the Allegro Playacar Resort during the week of July 5th through the 12th.We were able to move up to the First Club package for a modest increase.Our First Club unit consisted of a king size bed on a concrete "pyre" and our son had a 1980's style sofa bed in the adjoining room. We had the access to a 4 bottle bar in a mini kitchen and refreshments that were to be stocked in a mini refrigerator. By Wednesday, both were suppose to be restocked but were not. The room safe did not work, and after several pleas and request (to no avail) we just gave up and hid our valuables in the rooms. The showers had a 1/3 piece of glass covering the front portion of the tub, and we had to lower the shower head to keep the room dry.Of course in Central America you cannot place the used toilet paper in the toilet, you have to use the trash can for disposal.The front door had a 1/2 inch gap at the bottom to allow all sorts of critters inside. The daily buffet was abysmal. Running eggs, leather tough beef and constant diarrhea were the daily themes.The 2 restaurants were much better, the Italian had a delicious menu and the Mexican (although not much of a selection) was very good. The entire complex was kept immaculate and very clean, and the entertainment was ok (a show every night). The Geo tubes at the beach made swimming quite challenging. All in all beside the wretched buffet and its accompanying diarrhea, we did have a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: jwhit451
Reviews.Content: We were in Playa del Carmen May 19-25. Stayed at the Occidental Allegro. Very nice resort. The buffets were mostly very good if understaffed. Recommend the poolside buffet for lunch, excellent. We were not pressured by the time share people that are immediately outside the lobby but were approached. Alex from FunJet was extremely cooperative and I personally thought what we booked thru him were extremely good trips, didn't check to see if he was higher than locals, but I believe we came off better. One regret was that there were red flag warnings everyday but Monday, ie. no swimming, waves washed what little beach was left away by Friday. What swimming was available was between the "sandbags" that lined the beach and you had to watch and make sure you were not swept over them as the waves receeded (wife and our friend were swept over and were in danger ) The harbor was closed due to waves and no boating activities were available, ie. snorkeling, diving, fishing. Ferry was operational, went to Cozumel to snorkle. When we arrived there was mybe 25 feet of beach to walk or sunbathe on, on the morning we left this was down to less than 12 feet of usable beach. Overall, I enjoyed the trip but will not go back until I know for a fact that the "beach reclamation project" that the resorts, state gov. and Mexican gov. are "going to do" is a reality.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Nskwurt
Reviews.Content: To try and keep this as simple and short as possible a word of advise: You get what you pay for! Don't get me wrong, it's not the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, but it's not even close to the best either. My partner and I have travelled to Mexico several times this past year. She has TAN which is like a time share but you don't get to pick your hotel, just the location and a certain amount of weeks and then they tell you where you'll stay. We figured we'd use one of the weeks that she had and get away since the room was already paid for- we just had to pay for food and flight. We were told that this was a 30+ hotel and no kids. Wrong. Not like we don't like kids but when you don't expect them to be there it was a little bit of a surprise. Anyway, we were there I guess on a "Promotion" Basiclly that means they try to sell you into thier Occidental First Club, which is a vacation club. Mercedes (our rep) was... animated. If you have to sit through the presentation just be patient. This hotel is not a good representation for what they're trying to sell you. The other reviews are pretty spot on. The walls are really thin so if you have noisy neighbors it's a drag. There are good points to buying into the club if you travel often though. The friends stay for FREE was huge for me, just couldn't afford it. Anyway, because they wanted us to buy in we got a little bit of an upgraded room. It was OK that's it. They did have a mattress pad on the bed which was so helpful since the beds are usually rock hard in Mexico. So expect a hard bed. Food was ok, and so was the staff. I guess I'm just spoilied and know that I've stayed where it's better than here. Dreams Hotels are Outstanding FYI. I will give kudos to the night time entertainment staff. They worked their butts off all day and put on a fab show every night! Oh, and yes the birds make a bunch of freaking noise, but what are you going to do when you're visiting their home? One lady we met brought ear plugs. Might be a good idea if you're a light sleeper. Oh, last bit of advise. Invest in some biodegradable bug spray online www.mexitan.com has some (Skeedattle) and it's so much better to smell like lemongrass then DEET every night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: stolenpassport1
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. Here is a recap of the week. We arrived June 28, and were given a disgustingly dirty room, with broken A/C, no soap, towels, broken safe, no drinks in room, and a bed that was as hard as a rock. The lighting fixture were covered in what appeared to be calf skin, and they were wet, sticky, and smelly. The bathroom was filthy, and looked like a child did the construction work. Dont let your clothes in the bathroom they will get soaked because the shower has a small piece of glass that covered maybe 1/3 of the shower. We were what they refer to as "First Club" or VIP, and were given even the wrong TYPE of room. We were given an economy/standard room instead of our VIP suite (with a bar, kitchenette, larger TV, etc.). After we complained that evening about the room to get it switched, they couldn't move us until the morning. First thing in the morning we switched rooms, and were still given a Standard room, but atleast the A/C worked and it was habitable. The bed was still hard as a rock, but it was like that in all of the rooms.. The room was open to the outside at the ceiling and there were geckos in bugs in all of the rooms. Shorltly after we switched rooms, our passports were stolen out of our room. It was reported to the staff who simply said "no, that doesn't happen" They told us NOT to report them stolen at the police station, and gave us a run around for almost 2 days as what we should do. Finally I called the US consular in play del carmen, and she straightened everything out for us. The pools close at 8pm which i thought was strange, and there were barely any activities to do after that. On a Good Note the entertainment was awesome! The food was ok, but made me sick for 3 days while I was there. No, I didn't drink the water. Some of the employees at the front check in were helpful, and maybe one of the First Club employees. The other first club employees were useless at solving any minor problems. They tried to double charge for spa services and took almost 45 minutes to remove ONE massage from the bill. The setting was nice, but some of the quality of craftsmanship was very poor. Railings were hanging off of the stairs, some stair tread were loose and rotting, and the doors had about a 1/2" gap the whole way around them. The rooms were barely soundproof and you could hear the people in surrounding rooms even when they were just walking around. Oh and we had to have our safe unlocked two times by security because it kept freezing up.. "Satellite TV" that they claim to have consisted of 24 channels that were so fuzzy i might as well had an antenna, and there was exposed wiring in our room. So basically -Customer Service was ok for most people -VIP customer service was horrible (odd right?) -Food was ok -Rooms were disgusting and cheaply built -Entertainment was AWESOME -Evening activities did not exist -Security is poor and were not willing to help when our passports were stolen -Amenities misrepresented

Reviews.Title: “Such a pity”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed23
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you the plus side. The hotel is set in beautifully kept, well manicured grounds, which are home to a variety of harmless wildlife, including iguanas, lizards, birds and some little creatures whose name escapes my memory, but I believe are a cross between a hare and a squirrel. The hotel atmosphere is pleasant, the staff (without exception) are first class, the waiters are especially happy, efficient, eager to help, nothing is a trouble to them. Can't fault the food, either, there was something for everyone's taste and I am not a person who is easily pleased as far as food is concerned. Here is another bonus point, the cutlery and crockery were beautifully clean, which is something of a rarity, even in some of the higher rated hotels. The entertainment is first class, didn't do much during the day, but there was always something for those who wanted to. The evening entertainment was professional and polished, very talented dancers and superb costumes. The pool area could benefit from a bit of TLC. A nightly hose of the loungers and tables would help to spruce up their jaded appearance. Now to the downside, which I consider to be a major problem. Having read lots of reviews of this hotel, I feel that I must have stayed somewhere completely different. The 4* bedroom was definitely no better than a 2*, but in fairness the bed was kept spotlessly clean and I did get used to it. BUT, the bathroom was the worst I have ever had the misfortune to use. The decor was dowdy, patched up plastered walls, scruffy, marked. The bath was absolutely disgusting, it was possibly spray painted, old, tatty horrible. It was an insult to the standards of decent people. I honestly did not hear a favourable comment from one other person. Good news however. I understand from a reliable source that the rooms are to be refurbished. So fine for future guests, but that is no advantage to me. I would possibly return to this hotel though only if the bedrooms, but especially the bathrooms were brought up to date and would merit its 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Rum Punch & The Dog Cat Gang”
Reviews.Author: PJdogcat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days at the Allegro playacar ' paradise ' ! I was there from June 20th to 27th. Weather absolutely fabulous, sunny and sizzling, until the last day when we experienced a beautiful morning, then a very minor tsunami hit us. Credit to the activities crew for keeping everyone calm and entertained. There was lots of rain and wind, but it soon passed and we enjoyed the beach, which was being reclaimed slowly. Yes, there is definitely a beach, which they keep trying to extend, but lose everytime there is a hurricane. The beach is decent and way better than the small beach at the Riu Palace' As per previous reviewers.......Allegro has great staff, which is a credit to the resort, along with all the great new friends you meet. Corona on tap and great rum punch drinks ! The rodents you will see roaming the resort are officially called Mexican Agouti. They eat fruit and they do not bite. They are docile creatures with incredible hearing. Google Agouti for more info. Our gang had fun and tagged them as Dog Cats (LOL). Hola to the Dog Cat Gang - Barret, Amanda, Chris, Alanna, Kat & John. It was a blast and can't wait to do it again ! Woof meow & a round of cervaisas!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time!”
Reviews.Author: scienceguyNebraska
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and it was fun to get to know them as people...not just our "servants". We appreciated everything they were doing to make our stay comfortable and fun. I especially enjoyed the sense of humor of many of them and how many of them were enjoying their jobs. It was a little sad to say good bye to them. One note of concern was some of the evening shows bordered on inappropriate (scantily clad dancers and some sexually suggestive dance movements) for young children or youth or for adults with conservative values. The dancers worked very hard and were very good. Some of the dancers were excellent and one could tell they had a passion for their craft. And yes...the beds need to be softer....but we were grateful for a clean bed and room at the end of a long day in the sand and sun. All of the grounds and facilities were in great shape. This is a very nice place to spend a vacation.....

Reviews.Title: “one relaxed mom!!”
Reviews.Author: mommsp
Reviews.Content: great " mommy" get away, my girlfriend had a great stay...nice weather and perfect time of year, right after spring break.Staff is wonderful and pleasent...will definately stay again!Will bring family next time...plenty of kid stuff to do.So relaxing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Travler2010
Reviews.Content: We just got back from celebrating our honeymoon at the Allegro Playacar. We stayed there from May 25-30. I was a little concerned about going to this resort after reading some of the reviews. However, it really was a great place to stay for honeymooners, families, or just with friends. We had notified the resort that we were going to be honeymooner's at the time of booking and the resort upgraded our room (closer to the beach!), gave us vouchers for free 10 minute massages at their spa, a breakfast meal brought to us one morning, and a fruit basket in the room at no additional cost! The resort was kept very clean. The grounds were beatiful! Our room was upstairs and for the most part was a great room. The A/C worked great. The maid service did an excellent job of keeping the rooms clean. The safe worked fine. The only small complaint is that the matress was a little harder than I'm used to. The buffet was average quality. It was not great but by no means was it horrible. On the Monday night that we were there they had a Mexican party and the food was really good. The snack bar down by the pool was good. The two reasturants, The Italian and The Mexican were excellent! You have to make reservations for those two but it is worth it. The hotel always had something to do if you wanted or you could just relax by the pool or beach! The entertainment at night is fun. The resort is close to 5th Avenue and the ferry to Cozumel. There are large sandbags on the resort's beach, but on the bright side it created a pool that people and children could play in without the crashing of waves. If you really want to see an undamaged beach (like I really did), Playa Del Carmen has beautiful beaches that you can walk and swim in and it is only minutes away by cab ride.. This was a great resort and we would recommend it to anyone as a great vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “awesome destination wedding”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinStrongbow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we're recently married at the Allegro. The staff and Dominique the resort wedding planner did an outstanding job . The flowers, set up, and all details we're painstakingly taken care of. I can't say enough about how well our day and the rest of our trip went.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LfDrgFly
Reviews.Content: wonderful mexico vacation, all inclusive

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: celestemonique
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel to stay at. The beach is wonderful. Be careful not to trip and fall over the geotubing that is there to protect the erosion. The view from the pool was wonderful. The five minute cab ride for $5 into Playa del Carmen is worth the money. Make sure to check out 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Broken shoulder, but wonderful sun”
Reviews.Author: jmoonrn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Allegro for a short mid-week to weekend getaway. It was our two year anniversary since we first met across the waters at Allegro Cozumel and we really wanted to go back there. However, the hotel was closed for renovations so Allegro Playacar was the next best thing. We arrived late on a Wednesday, enjoyed the buffet dining, got drunk and then went to sleep. We were awakened approximately 5:30 by the birds, as our room was on the top floor and must have been the home for a flock of black birds. My boyfriend was up and ready to go by 6, but me being lazy and on vacation opted to get a few more ZZZs. If you are used to running onto the beach from the shore, don't go to Playa! Poor Playa, all the beaches are inhibited by GEOTUBES to stop beach erosion. They are as large as school buses filled with sand, placed on the beach, right where the tide comes in. It has taken the beauty away from the beach. Well, my boyfriend ventured out to view the beautiful ocean on a geotube and, not knowing the danger involved in the geotubes, attempted to walk across one, ultimately landing on his shoulder and fracturing it! Ladies, if you know how men complain when they are hurt, you definitely have pity for the rest of my vacation. We were not able to kayak, wind sail, SWIM or do anything physical because he was obvsiously in such pain. At any rate, the food was great, especially Friday night's outdoor buffet. The drinks were great and the people were quite friendly. The room was freezing cold and clean, but noisy with birdies early in the morning. I slept better after I got used to the noises. The hammock on the porch was awesome and the anniversary was memorable! Shower water was hot if you hit it before 10 AM, but don't expect a hot, full pressured shower after 5 PM. There were plenty of beach and pool chairs to lay in. There were plenty of activities if that's your thing. We never left the resort, but it did appear there were excursions galore. Make sure you confirm your ride to the airport. We were never told of the time our transfer was going to pick us up so we came down to the lobby about three hours early to find they had just left the hotel without us. The cab ride was $45 to the airport, but worth the money and not having to stick around at the airport for two hours waiting on our flight. All in all, it was wonderful sun and a great time, minus the broken shoulder and whining boyfriend :)

Reviews.Title: “Casual Beach resort”
Reviews.Author: nadineq
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Allegro. It is smaller than other all inclusives and the service is the best. We have been to Mexico over 10 times and love the relax atmoshere and great food. Although the beaches are struggling to survive after 2 Hurricanes, the resort is making every effort to preserve them. You can't control nature. I would recommend the Allegro if you are looking for a smaller, layed back, beach bungalow getaway. I would also recommend joing the Vacation Club, which offers the exclusive private First club room for snacks and drinks, upgraded rooms and private outdoor area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and especially the staff!”
Reviews.Author: StoweSunlover8
Reviews.Content: My family and I just visited allegro playacar and had a great time! Not only was it beautiful, the staff made us feel very welcome and we couldnt of asked for more! The shows and the classes were highly entertaining to say the least! Thanks again and hopefully I/we will return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “"Think Twice"”
Reviews.Author: chance2be
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort 6days 5nights Apr. 21st-26th. It was an experience I wont soon forget. The resort 's ground is beautiful, the staff friendly and the food was good. However, the rooms are much to be desired. They weren't very clean and the bed if that is what it was, was horrible. It was a cement slab with a foam(egg-crate) as a mattress. On our third night a pipe burst on the property and we were without water for several hours. The toilet had to be unclogged three times. Housekeeping were called twice because they forgot to bring fresh washcloths two out of the five nights. The water activities were non-existent. The activities that were available cost a arm and someone eles's leg. Some staff members were like corporals. The either bugged you to death about buying an excursion and/or property. The most enjoyable part of the stay was the beautiful ocean and the short distance to the Playacar Market. Please consider the reviews when planning your getaway. Think Twice Upstate New York

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MplsTraveler96
Reviews.Content: Despite some negative reviews I had read about this resort before traveling, this was a wonderful resort and place to stay in the Riveria Maya. Each and every staff member we encountered from check-in to restaurant to maid service, all staff were extremely helpful, friendly and cheerful. The food was excellent in each particular restaurant, and the staff service unbeatable. As for negative reviews about the food, I believe that it is relative to each persons tastes and likes. Some may not like food that others do, and it is as simple as that. Each day the entertainment staff had many activities for adults and kids in the pool area, and the nightly entertainment was enjoyable. There were always plenty of chairs near the pool or the beach for lounging. This resort is also very close to many shopping centers in Playa Del Carmen, in addition to the ferry crossing to Cozumel. My only complaint (and it is small) is that the beds were indeed uncomfortable. They are cement slabs with a mattress, which makes for a very hard surface. Otherwise, the rooms were clean, the air conditioning worked well, and the water pressure in the shower was great. The entire resort was well maintained, clean and landscaped beautifully. The beach did have sandbags still due to rebuilding, but it still allowed for some shallow water swimming. Overall I would definitely return to this resort for a future vacation and recomment it to aduult travelers as well as families, for we saw many of both and all seemed to be enjoying themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Love Those Entertainment Boys!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brittanyspearsdrunk
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother (miss allegro 2008) went to this resort from April 13- 20th 2008 first day we broke the ice by playing tequila pong! haha... anyway we had a fab time and all thanks the the staff and entertainment crew!!!! Manuel, Luis, Stefano, Chino, Adan, Christian, Franco, ALL OF YOU WHERE UNBELIEVABLE!!! We will definatly come back to this resort sooner than later!!!. The food was 4* the rooms where 4* and the service was excellent!!! I recommend this hotel to ANYONE, including families and friends!!! I miss it so much already!!!. The beach was small but nothing you could do about it! doesnt matter anyway because we spent all our time playing games with the boys!!!! thanks again for the AWESOME! experience!!!! SEE YOU SOON!!!! Brittany xoxo

Reviews.Title: “Review llegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: QuetzalFish
Reviews.Content: This hotel and resort is really nice. The service is excellent. As always when you book a seaview cabin, they don´t have it on arrival. But in 2 days we could move into a seaview cabin. And that was really the best place to reside in this resort. The beach at date (april 2008) is still short. There were still sand bags looking like "whales" in the water. But it was not bothering. They are actually winning sand back at the moment so that is a good thing. There are plenty of activities to do, as well in the 2nd swimming pool as outside. There are for example shows in the night, but also the possibility to do some kayak or catamaran sailing. one hour free. Also other watersports can be done, but they cost money. In general you can say that tours that the hotel offers are some 20 USD more expensive than the tours you book in the centre of Playa del Carmen. Have to say that a taxi ride costs 50 pesos (or 5 USD one way). Walking is a possibility, but only when the sun is down (because of the heat and humidity). It´s a 15 minutes walk. What is so nice about the hotel is that it is not a typical hotel concrete block of a building. It´s like a tiny village with 8 rooms in every cabin (4 downstairs, 4 upstairs). The problem is that with one of the other rooms you compare an in between door (in case you book 2 rooms for one family) and because this is not wall, the noise comes through this door. But we had that problem only one night out of 7. Not all the rooms have this in between door. The hotel is all inclusive, and that includes all alcoholic beverages. After check out they do not cut your bracelet, so if your transfer back is later than 12.00 you are not obliged to pay for drinks or food. The buffet is good, but after a few days you see a lot of items returning and get somewhat tired of eating there. There are a Mexican and Italian "a la carte" restaurants for which you have to make reservations. Every night they serve the same, so probably you only go ones. But these restaurants are really good. 2 Swimming pools (one of which for activities), tennis court, giant chess court, snacks inthe day as well as normal food around the pool area. Towels for everyone (1 p.p.). Enough seats around the pool and the beach. We had a perfect week. I recommand it to every one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sheehyfarms
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked 7 days here. We would not ever stay here again! The beds were HORRIBLE concrete slabs with a 2inch foam mattress. The beach was gone. The food was terrible. I had read several reviews before we went. I thought it could not be that bad. IT WAS!

Reviews.Title: “I actually liked this one!!”
Reviews.Author: -OhCaNaDaEh-
Reviews.Content: The first thing I will tell u is dont judge this place strictly by the reviews, I was pretty apprehensive at first. Wasnt sure what to expect...but then we got there and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. The staff were nice, but I have to be honest, I was afraid to talk to anyone who wasnt front desk staff because I wasnt interested in a time share! I asked someone where the bathroom was, and 5 minutes later he was still inviting me to a "special breakfast". Also dont buy any tours or excursions from the hotel they claim they have the best prices, but if u walk 3 minutes to the plaza up the road the prices are about $30 - $50 cheaper!! Definately go to Xel Ha, its amazing!!! You also have to go into Playa del Carmen, its about 5 mins from the hotel, and spend the day shopping and sightseeing. Grab the ferry into Cozumel, you wont be sorry! There is a bar there called Mr. Chiles that has $1 Coronas!!!! Even if u are not a big drinker, u cant beat $1 Coronas;) Which brings me to the nightlife in Playa Del Carmen, if u are a party animal they party till about 5 am there! The resort tends to quiet down after about midnight. The size of the resort was ideal, not too big, not too small. I liked that it was a short walk to anywhere, the beach, the restaurants, the theatre...and the rooms were comfortable. I LOVED the hammocks on each balcony. Also loved the oragami the maids did with the towels each day. We had a nice king size bed with a mattress pad on it that made it fairly comfortable. My only real complaint would be the food, but honestly I think thats just foreign food for ya, we ate both on the resort and off, and sadly the McDonalds we grabbed on the way home from the airport in CANADA at 4 am was the best food we ate all week:( I guess the fruit was okay, but I wouldnt reccommend eating too much of it! The beach was a little beat up from the hurricaine, they had sandbags in the water a little ways out, but quite honestly, the water was nice, and the beach was great for sunbathing. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a low budget, good quality holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: tarranm
Reviews.Content: My brother and I just returned from a two week stay at the Allegro Playacar from March 23rd to April 7th. It was a first trip to the Caribbean for both of us. We are both in our 40's. We couldn't get a flight out of Ottawa on the date we needed so we drove to Montreal and flew from there. It seemed we were the only English people on the plane. Our trip was with Nolitours and we flew on Air Transat. The flight was good except that the form we had to fill out for Mexican customs was in French and Spanish. A flight attendant helped fill it out but it was irritating not to have one in English. When we arrived in Cancun, we got to the bus and a person from Nolitours got on and gave a five minute speel in French. We thought that she would give it in English next but she jumped off the bus and disappeared before we could say anything. Surprisingly all the people on the bus only spoke French - not a bilingual person among the crowd, so we still don't know what she said. The people trying to get you to go for their timeshare sales pitch at the resort got to be a bit hard to take after a time. We would kid around with them and put them off nicely. They are stationed right next to the entrance to the buffet and lobby so it is hard to avoid them. It got to be a bit much when they would intercept you on the street in front of the resort and try to badger you into giving them "90 minutes" of your time. We spoke to people who did agree to it and 90 minutes became three hours. They would give you a t-shirt or discount coupons on tours or rental cars, but three hours is a lot of vacation to give up to listen to a high pressure sales speel. The resort is very nice. The buildings are open and airy with thatched roofs. We even saw some Iguanas on the grounds. There were some animals that I've never even heard of before - about the size of a cat but sort of looked like a cross between a pig, rat, and squirrel. Someone told me what they were called but I can't remember. There was even the odd gheko in the thatched roof in our room. They make a nice chirping sound at night. The landscaping at the resort was very nice. The beach is a little lacking from the hurricane damage but they are constantly working to restore it and made a lot of progress enlarging it while we were there. There was plenty of room for everyone and we even managed to find loungers on the few occasions when we forgot to reserve them early. I liked the sound of the birds in the morning - It was the first time I heard that particular birdsong. I still don't know what they are called but they look like a common grackle with a really long tail. There was a pair of doves nesting under the eve of the roof just outside our room and they were very entertaining to watch from the hammock. The waiters and bartenders were very friendly and efficient. During busier times at the buffet it was sometimes hard to get a drink or second drink but it was just because it was so busy. We really loved the staff - everyone was very friendly and always upbeat and very helpful. I literally fell in love with Pilar, the hostess at the Buffet. (Being the shy type I just admired her from afar though.) We had a room on the second floor with two double beds. The room was kept very clean except for the floor which always looked dirty. The room initially had a musty-mildew odour but it seemed to go away after the first day. There wasn't much of a shower curtain on the shower stall and it was hard to keep the water from spraying all over the place. There was always plenty of hot water and the pressure was good as well. The AC worked well too. There was a thatched roof on our room and it was nice except that it didn't do much to block noise from outside on the few occasions there was some. If I could make a suggestion to the resort it would be to put rubber wheels on the carts that the staff use early in the morning - people are on vacation and the noise from those plastic wheels going over the rough walkway at seven or eight in the morning isn't conducive to a nice sleep in. It sounds like a freight train going by. Some hydraulic door closers would go a long way to reducing the noise level as well - lots of slamming doors all the time. I don't know if people are just inconsiderate or if the wind would get behind the doors but it seemed there was a lot of slamming going on sometimes. The food was good with a lot of variety at the buffet, although it seemed to get a little repetitive toward the end. We really enjoyed the omelette bar at breakfast. We ate at "the Mexican" A-La-Carte one night and really enjoyed it. We never tried the Italian one as it seemed we could never remember to make a reservation during the hours when you could. The beer was very weak - I'm not much of a drinker but I drank at least 20 glasses on the first day and didn't even get a buzz. The mixed drinks weren't the best either - you could sometimes get bacardi and coke but more often they would pore a cheaper rum. If you like rye, forget it, there isn't any. The glasses didn't always seem to be the cleanest either and there were times when they would run out. Someone would make the rounds and gather them up and they seemed to wash them in a big hurry as a result. We went to Xel-Ha for a day and the beer and liqour were much better there - you could actually get a buzz from the beer and the mixed drinks were noticably better tasting. We met some very nice people during our stay but found there was a lot of younger people there especially during the first week. As always there were also a few noisy, rude people. We were awakened by screaming drunk teenagers on two nights but the noise didn't last long and I had no problem getting back to sleep. I am an early riser and I managed to get some really nice pictures of the sunrise from the beach. There was some coffee pots between the two pools and usually some fresh coffee after six o'clock. The coffee wasn't the best but was usually drinkable. Overall, it was a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation at the Allegro Playacar. I'm not sure that I would go back, not because of anything specific at the resort but because I plan on seeing other places. I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the tropical grounds”
Reviews.Author: cdlallak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allegro the week before Easter with my 16 and 19 year old kids. I really enjoyed the beautiful, tropical grounds of the hotel! The website doesn't capture the beauty of the place. I especially liked that it was not a high rise hotel where you always wait for an elevator to get to your room. Our rooms were very accessible to the beach and pool area. Enjoyed the hammock on our balcony alot-- a nice touch. I had read reviews of how hard the beds were, but was very glad to find nice foam pads added to the beds. I slept great on them except for the fact that the rooms are not very sound proof at all. Our 1st night there we woke up at 3:30am to the people below us coming in from partying all night and they were rediculously loud! The rooms are not really very big but it was fine for us. Liked the thatch roof in the room! We didn't use our air conditioning much at all, but the few times we did, it did leak water out of the ceiling in the bath area. Absolutely loved the sound of all the tropical birds on the grounds that would be my alarm clock every morning. What a great way to wake up! Because I wasn't traveling with my husband we were not approached for time share once,YEA! I did miss that there was no fitness center and wished they offered more yoga or pilates classes earlier than 10 or 11am. I didn't think the entertainment was all that great most nights compared to some other all inclusives we've been to. The food was good. We ate 2 nights at the Italian restaurant- very good and nice to be served a sit down meal a few times. I highly recommend planning your own excursions- the hotel does charge way too much. Go into Playa del carmen and use the "Servicio" vans. They go up and down the hi-way and you can go anywhere you want on your own. very easy! and cheap! Also the "Playa Express" takes you to Cancun for cheap. Don't pay taxi's to go most places. We would stay at the Allegro again,liked the location to town also. If you have young kids take note there is some women topless sunbathing and the activities guys really like to make the girls "pole dance" by the pool and even at the show some nights. We got tired of that and they embarassed alot of girls and some women that were good sports to go along with it but not wanting to do it . That was the activities guys favorite saying "DO IT! DO IT!" Whatever! We found a great lagoon in Akumal called "YAL-KU" for a day of snorkeling. It was $7.50 to get in,$10.00 to rent equipment, beautiful and great fish to see! We took the vans down to Akumal, walked into the plaza area and payed a taxi $7.00 to take us to the lagoon. You could walk about 30-45min to get there too. A really cool looking restaurant along the way on the ocean but didn't have time to go there. Next trip!

Reviews.Title: “we had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: susan051
Reviews.Content: My husband and had stayed at the Allegro several years ago, and when it came time to take our whole family (23 people with 12 children ranging in age from 3-16, we knew this hotel would be a perfect fit. The staff was wonderful; friendly and appropriate with children. The children were at the beach or hotel pools constantly. Teenagers appreciated the pizza for snacks. Although the buffets are not "gourmet", there was plenty to choose from, and everyone had a favorite. A few of the children took advantage of the "kids club", and they loved being a part of the nightly entertainment. We all enjoyed watching the divers and other workers as they worked tirelessly to replace the beaches. At least five more feet of sand were added during our stay. The Allegro is not a 5 star place, but it is perfect for families. The only negative comment we had was the agressive attitudes of the condo salesmen.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the Allegro!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvinplayaMn
Reviews.Content: After reading other reports we almost canceled with Allegro and went to another resort. This is truly a 3 maybe 3 1/2 star resort and that is it, not a 4 or 5 star!! I'm really glad we stayed here as we had a wonderful time! We simply said no to the timeshare people who offered you free gifts. Never had any problems with them after that. Our biggest problem was calling home, our calling card we bought in US would'nt work. One of the timeshare sharks working there told us to walk 3 minutes down the street and use the internet cafe phone and had no problems after that. So all he asked when we got back was to go listen to the timeshare deal so we did. It took 1 1/2 hours then we said thats all the longer we would spend and we were off to the beach by 9 am! Other than that, the food at the resort was very good, little repetitive by the end of our stay but thats anywhere after 7 days! The buffet area was totally redone in 2006 and was very nice. The theature where they put on nightly shows is new as well and the shows were very good also! The grounds were emaculant and very well taken care of every day. At night it was lit up and looked very nice as well. The rooms were out of date and small but were clean and showers were always warm with great pressure. My biggest complaint would have to be the noise flowed right through the walls exterior as well as interior! We could here our neighbors conversation with out even trying, and the birds were crazy in the mornings, but that could happen other places as well! The pools were nice and the drinks were good so if you cant sleep you just need to drink more!! All in all we had a great time, the location is great as it took us only 15 mn. to walk into town and there is lots to see and do. My advise to you would be do not book day trips through the resort as you will get trapped into the time share, however if your looking for cheaper entrys, spending an hour and a half may be worth it. All in all the trip was great, don't worry as I did just go and have a great time and keep in mind it is a 3 star resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dhkrn
Reviews.Content: Was a nightmare from the beginning, but Occidental worked it out for us, although I signed a release stating I would never sue them after what happened. The rooms are very dirty, and I am used to Mexican hotels and culture. They stated no spring breakers allowed, however it was nothing short of a huge party. My fourteen year old son was asked if he knew where to get some morphine, while I was standing next to him! The rooms are extremely loud. The worst though was when I bite into a meatball to find a metal knot, the kind used on the end of sausage casings. That was my last straw, and I immediately insisted management move us to another hotel or I would consider a suit. Management moved us to their sister property the Occidental Grand Flamenco Xcaret only after I signed all my rights to liability away. I was going to go next door to Royal Playacar, or another hotel and pay the extra cash, however everyone was full. I took the offer, and was overall satisfied there. The problem again at that hotel was that our rooms were right next to the theatre which was so loud we couldn't hear a T.V. until 11:00 p.m. each night, so once again I had to switch to another room. The other room was much better, but we could hear an endless stream of people walking over our heads each night. I'm not one to complain, but at neither hotel did we sleep. The Riviera Maya is my favorite destination, and we have traveled extensively and lived in Europe. We had a wonderful trip, however next time we will stay in no less than six stars. My cousin and I took this trip with 4 teen boys, and figured a moderate hotel would be fine. Not so.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Four Day Getaway”
Reviews.Author: k2titus
