Reviews.Content: I was leary of this hotel because the price seemed to good to be true, but thanks to Trip Advisor, I felt more comfortable going into resort based on the positive remarks from others. I would strongly reccomend this all-inclusive resort to anyone that is spending five days or less in the yucatan peninsula. Everything is taken care of, the food is great (if you only have to eat it a few days) and the entertainment is fun for a few days as well. The hammock on each patio is great for taking afternoon naps and both pools are well maintained. The beach is small due to the hurricane, but the "geotubes" can be fun to climb on if you are game-- note that when the tide is high, it can be rough to get back over them to the beach! The best restaruant will be the Italian- make sure to make reservations, and I reccommend eating there towards the end of your stay, or the other food will disapoint you! The only complaints we had were the maids tended to not refill our complimentary toiletries and the bar staff seemed not to clean the glasses very well-- one of our travel partners came back with strep throat that probably was not caught any other way.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled by the Hard Sells & Ripoffs”
Reviews.Author: thebaron007
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good time, but I recommend checking out the other local hotels as they are likely better, especially the 5 star. I'll start with the negatives, because these are the reasons we would not stay at the Allegro again. The Hard Sell: Every single item or activity purchased at this hotel was far overpriced. DO NOT BUY any activities or tours from this hotel...you are better off shopping around Playa del Carmen for reasonable prices for tours to Tulum, Chichen Itza, Xelha, fishing, etc. Alex, the head hospitality guy whose job it was to ensure we had fun, seemed to be the biggest scammer, and indeed charged us $184 US for one day at Chichen Itza ($72 per person) while tour guides in town only charged $40. We already had purchased two free tours to any place we wanted with a competitor hotel for $40 and a "presentation" but Alex confiscated our receipt without permission, telling us it was a scam and that he would give us the best deals in town. When we complained about some of this employee's unsavoury practices (overcharging, not issuing receipts, confiscating receipts purchased from other businesses, etc.) the Front Desk manager assured us that this was an isolated incident from a rogue employee acting on his own. To compensate, the Manager agreed to return our $184 in cash, provided we sat through a 90 minute presentation on vacation packages, the next day. He also promised that the employee would be layed off for a week as punishment. The next day and for the rest of the week, we noticed that the employee was still there (hence he was doing his job exactly as instructed and condoned by management) and we had to undergo 2.5 hours of excruciatingly distasteful hard sells that, to get your money's worth, you would have to live 150 years, travel once a year for 100 years, and take 5 other people with you. We basically had to fight to get out of this nightmare, which used all the classic brainwashing techniques, that, quite frankly, insulted my intelligence. To add insult to injury, they then refunded my money in "Allegro dollars" meaning it was like Monopoly money that could only be spent at the hotel. After another 30 minutes of some choice words with management, I finally received my refund in US dollars. Buying a car is even less painful the this vacation package hard sell experience. The room: We had arranged for a non-smoking room but were given a smoking room. We were then forced to move our own luggage to a new non-smoking room that had a musty smell and two separate beds instead of one king size bed. We were promised that we would get the room we reserved properly by the next day, but that never happened. In addition, if you have noisy neighoburs, forget sleeping as the light and the noise carries over the ceiling. No prob if your neighbours are quiet though. The food: The a la carte Italian and Mexican were top notch. 2 thumbs up. The buffet was ok, if you just like luke warm food. However, you could get hot food if you waited for an omelet fresh from the grill. The outdoor restaurants by the pool were also impressive with good selection. The cleaning and cooking staff: Top notch and very friendly. The activities: Lots to do, but I suggest the Allegro start using proper hygiene when teaching scuba lessons. They DO NOT sterilize the mouthpiece in between users. Fortunately I only caught a bad cold as a result, instead of Hep A. We also went to Chichen Itza, Tulum and Xelha, and I recommend all three as a must! If you can do Xcaret, do so as well...we ran out of time, alas. The beach: Unimpressive and small, with large sandbags due to hurricane damage, but we walked a few kms down into the jungle and found some great swimming places. Two armed guards approached us one day and suggested this may be unwise, assuming we did not want to get robbed and murdered, so we vamoosed back to civilization after 3 hours of great swimming. The Allegro has a nice pool, but who the heck wants to fly for thousands of kms to swim in a pool that you can do at home? The warm ocean is a prime reason for coming here in the first place! Nightly entertainment was good. This type of hotel and location should only be visited by people who do not have difficulty saying no or ignoring annoying solicitors. In Canada, we keep these types away from the hotel grounds, but in the Mayan Riviera, it appears the hotels and particularly the Allegro, invite them in and employ them. A vacation, in my mind, should be to get away from this nonsense, not to see more. Except for the neighbours having unusually noisy sex every night, the grounds were quiet enough, with most of the drunks sticking to Cancun....this was also one of the reasons we picked Mayan Riviera, as Cancun seemed to be for drunks while Puerto Vallarta has cold ocean water. At least I think we picked the best of the three choices.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: islandgirldreaming
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spend a week at the Allegro Playacar. We had a pretty good time, but we're also pretty easy going and probably would have been happy with a hut on the beach :0) The location is awesome. We walked into Playa del Carmen a couple times, and it's only a five dollar cab ride if you're tired or wearing heels ;0). We caught public transit (the collectivo) to Tulum and totally recommend it. It only costs $3 one way and it's not much slower than a car ride. Don't let any try to convince you that you should take a tour with their cousin or whomever. You'll have more fun on your own, you can set your own schedule and save $$. The food was okay. The buffet was understaffed, so it was difficult to get more than one drink with your meal. The variety of the food didn't change much from night to night, but what they had was good enough. Sure, it wasn't piping hot, but it's a BUFFET. I didn't get sick, and it was pretty tastey. The snack bar by the pool was awesome. I ate sooo much guacamole. It was nice to just wander up from the beach, get a bite to eat, then hop back in the ocean without putting on pesky clothes. I really enjoyed the Italian restaurant, but I wasn't as taken by my meal at the Mexican restaurant. The entertainment was... entertaining, but for the wrong reasons. I found myself cringing in embarassment for the staff on more than one occassion. It was amatuer to say the least. They had special entertainers in one night, who totally blew the usual entertainment away. Our room was nice enough; it was clean and in good repair. We woke up to the birds everymorning at 6 a.m., but I can think of worse ways to be woken up. It was better than the sounds we got to hear from the couple next door at night (don't come here for a romantic getaway!) The grounds are beautiful, and the beach is...well, being reclaimed, but it serves it purpose. The daily activities were humourous. We took a dancing lesson and I've gotten better moves out of step class at my gym. As for the toilet paper thing, that is standard through out Mexico because the whole country has been plumbed with 3" pipes and not the 4" we have in N. America. So, overall, we had a good time, but I probably wouldn't go here again. I prefer that my neighbours and I not hear each other, I found the daily activities lacking, and I'll go somewhere with some beach.

Reviews.Title: “15 in the group”
Reviews.Author: Ethel-Thayer
Reviews.Content: 15 of us were there in January. 13 of us had a very nice vacation and would definitely recommend Mexico in general to anyone. We are in our late 40's and 50's so we are not spring breakers. We are working stiffs who are able to travel once per year. We enjoyed the place very much. Compare it to a cruise, well "no" in areas of food and entertainment. However, unlike a cruise we were able to get a chair by the beach or by either pool each and every day - (before 7 A.M. which seems to be the norm on a cruise). We also did not get the "bar bill" at the end. Also we enjoyed the freedom of moving around easily and being able to visit Playa Del Carmen, Cancun and Cozumel very easily and safely. The area is nothing like Jamaica which can be scary... The breakfast was more that anyone would need - what do you normally eat everyday anyway??? Lunch fine. Dinner at the restaurants (at no additional charge) was very good. OK - buffet dinner was not that great, but not that bad. We only ate there twice in 6 days - we were busy moving around all the area has to offer. Anyway, we are not used to the best of the best... It was more than adequate and we only paid for 3 stars anyway - I did not expect 5. If you are a world traveller in the "high rolling spaces" - don't go there. One of our fellow travelers goes round the globe for his job - he called it great. Depending on who you are and what you expect you may love it or hate it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spring Break Ever”
Reviews.Author: anet474
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before coming to Allegro and I have to say after being there I DISAGREE with almost all of them. First of all, the food was great, especially after living in Boston and having bad mexican food, the mexican food here is great: refried beans and quesadillas for breakfast if you prefer, yet also fresh eggs and french toast etc. Allegro is a small resort but I think that is why it was so great. My group became close with the activities staff and met a lot of other people there. After staying at large resorts I strongly prefer the closeness of the small resort. At night the activities staff took us to the best clubs on the right nights. They knew which nights were ladies night to get us in for free and which ones had better shows on certain nights. They didn't try to take our money as someone before said, they actually got us better deals. We went to Cancun for 2 nights and spent less for the ride there and for open bar than the normal price just to enter. I highly recommend taking a trip with the activities staff to the club coco bongo, it was an awesome time. The staff are also great entertainers during the day, never a dull moment from kayak races to beer drinking contests to tequilla shots from losing at darts. The highlight was the water balloon fights where everyone around the pool got really into it, really a fun experience. The rooms were small but comfortable. Not many channels but enough to watch while getting ready for the night. The ONLY downside was the small beach, which grew 5 feet wider just during my one week stay, so they are obviously working on fixing it. All in all, it was the greatest vacation I've ever been on and I can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Cold food, concrete beds, awful entertainment, poorly maintained rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jenny097
Reviews.Content: I simply do not understand how anyone could have enjoyed themselves at this resort unless they were used to cold mush for food, slow service, awful nightly entertainment and rock-hard beds. And you know how they boast about 5 bars? Let's count. They consider the front and back side of their pool bar as "2 bars". The other one is a 5-foot window that they call their sports bar. The other bar has 5 barstools and plays awful elevator music all night long, or the "disco", a badly painted shack whose music was either ear shattering or the same elevator music from the other bar. The nightly entertainment was nothing what you'd expect out of a resort. It was amateur to say the least. Service was poor and slow and uncooperative. Many of the rooms (we looked at several as we tried to change rooms) had cracked bathtubs, non-functioning airconditioning, or a musty smell. The only thing that was nice was the pool and the location (close to town). So if you JUST want to sit by the pool all day and night and not eat or sleep, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the not so great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Jaeger_10_08_05
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Allegro Playacar from March 6-10th. Before going, I read all the reviews and thought maybe some people were just "complainers" when they mentioned all the bad things. Well, take note! I knew what we were getting into and I know you get what you pay for, but this resort is not worth spending your money on. We had three rooms, and as requested, we all got lower floor rooms near each other. Out of the three rooms, only one room was in working order. My parents switched rooms the second day because of a dripping, non-working air conditioning unit (among other things in their room) and my sister tried switching rooms due to a rattling air conditioning unit. And when my sister tried to switch rooms after my parents vacated their old room, the front desk tried to give her that room! As for the entertainment, I have to say what entertainment? I've been to other 3 star resorts in the Riviera Maya, and have been far more impressed with the activity staff than here. I hardly ever saw them walking around during the day and the shows at night were horrible! At the other resorts I've been to, you would know their names and faces by the end of your stay. Not the case here! Also, I really wanted to like the food and thought that it couldn't be THAT bad. Well, it was. Cold food at the buffets and almost the same version of food every day, just mixed with other things. Again, I wasn't expecting a lot, but this was terrible! Good things - the pools were nice and being able to walk into Playa del Carmen was nice. (We needed to walk to town to get any type of entertainment!) The resort overall was in need of a lot of care. I will not recommend this to anyone and hope if you go, you don't mind wasting your money on a very poor 3 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: Susie1016
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Occidental Allegro Resort, it was our 4th holiday here. We prefer this hotel due to the nice location, friendly staff and the homely atmosphere. The food is really good, have a wide of selection. We had a first floor room which was nice and the pool were excellent as well. I recommend this place if you like the fun, the Activities Team is very attantive and excellent , thanks to all of them , specially to Adan who coordinate the team. We had a great stay and we would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome!!!! Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lbscheck
Reviews.Content: Have to admit... after reading some of the reviews & seeing some pix .... I was a little apprehensive???? But I shouldn't have been..... it was sooo nice!!! We arrived at 2:00am & the staff were great. I loved the 4plex vilas with the thatched roof. We were lucky enuf to get the top floor. Loved the decor in our room:-) Had a bit of water on the bathroom floor... the Bell-boy offered to have it checked then:-) Opted to leave it til later. The maintenance crew were very punctual:-) Stayed at the Barcelo last yr so the buffet was a smaller version, but as the day/days/weeks progressed there was more than enuf selection as they had a different theme each nite. The "Italian" al a carte was awesome:-) Took it in 3 nites. The "Mexican" only once & the staff were great there as well:-) The Pool Bar was great!! My lunch consisted mostly of nachos, chs & Guacemole daily:-) A must to try!!! Can have burgars anytime:-) But they did look good:-) Lots of seafood dishes.. hot & cold:-) COLD Cervesa was just what I needed!! Pizza... was good. Not loaded like home but still quite tasty:-) Ham buns at the Snack Bar by the Bar up top were delicious. Strawberry Margaritas were the best there too:-) ALL in ALL... the food was great!!!! Bed..... KING size .... ours had a foamie on top of mattress so wasn't a problem:-) Found it quite comfy:-) Cleanliness ...... had a great "Camerera"!!! Tila was soo cute. Everyday she left us with a different animal, baby, fish Towel Origami :-) Our room very clean:-) The entertainment staff always had something happening:-) If you were bored ... it was because you wanted to be:-( Disco ... nothing fancy but served it's purpose. Sometimes you even got to "Serve yourself & Save" as the bartender would vacate for a bit:-) Pool tables weren't like the one you may have at home, but they were there if you wanted them:-( A mini mall only 5 min. walk. Playa about 20 mins. Lotsa shops to browse thru:-) Even have a Wal-Mart if you get homesick... hahaha!!! $6.00 tax fare into W-M. Time share persons .... Yes .... they were there to greet you, but once you were tanned and you were polite " No Gracious" at refusing their invites ..... they didn't bother you much. They have to make a living too:-) Just BEWARE!!! I did take in one presentation & was $150.00US richer. It was an experience & it was tempting but I declined in the end. Quite the process they have!!! The beaches ..... the sand bags looked like "Beached Whales". If I would've had any idea that they could deteriorate as fast as they did... I would've taken pix when I got there & when I left. It was sad to see the sand being swept back into the ocean. The staff at our resort seemed to be the only ones able to keep what little beach there was in tact:-) There was quite a distance we could walk:-) & Lord knows we did lots of that:-) The last thing we did each nite:-) Love the sound of rolling waves. Felt very safe. Security was always around:-) Pool chairs.... I reserved ours each morning, but wasn't really necessary. Between the two pools & beach there seemed to be ample for everyone. Loved the "friendliness" of staff & most visitors:-) There were some that should have stayed at home as I don't think you could please them anywhere. Then there were those that wanted to be in a 5+ Star but pay for a 4. The resort is small but laid out well. The grounds are very well kept. The staff are very conscientious!! Would I go back or recommend this resort... DEFINITELY in a HEARTBEAT!!! I hope to take my Family & Grandbabies there someday:-)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Stay at Allegro”
Reviews.Author: banjolou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 2 weeks in the Mayan Riviere - first at Occidental's Allegro and the 2nd week in Occidental's Xcaret hotel. We arrived late afternoon and were one of two families to check in - very smooth. I happened to ask if they were busy and was told that they were actually overbooked for the coming days so I asked what they do about it and was told they move people to their sister hotel, the Xcaret. We were going there anyhow the next week and it was a 5* as opposed to 4* at Allegro so we volunteered to be "upgraded" to the Xcaret if they allowed us to spend a couple of days at the Allegro so we could do Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel before moving. They did allow us this plus gave us one extra day at Xcaret so we wouldn't have to move back to Allegro for just one day and then get back to Xcaret for our 2nd week. They also shuttled us there (we were going to have to pay for this on our own in the original plan) - this upgrade went very smoothly. They have large "cabanas" with 8 rooms each - 4 up and 4 down, each with a hammock on the deck. We had a morning dove who perched outside the door and were awakened each morning by the beautiful cooing. We saw a gecko in the room high in the ceiling (we were on the top floor) once, but never down in the actual room area. I think it quite normal to find geckos in your hotel room in Mexico - no matter the standard (we had a regular one in the 5* Xcaret as well). I thought the place was quite nice. If you have noisy neighbours though and are on the top floor I suspect that could be annoying, however in 3 nights we only heard our neighbours once. Beach as previously stated is being reclaimed but every hotel along the beach stretch is the same. Pool was nice and there was always lots of action in the water with parasailers, water scooters, boats and ships to watch. If you prefer a quiet beach - you might find it kind of "busy" Food seemed fine for the few days we were there, service seemed great. The one down side for us was the time share set up. And like others have said each hotel tries to get you on this. We were aware of this ahead of time and tried to avoid it (watch for them at the airport as well as in Playa Del Carmen on the strip - they may be a snorkel tour guide but he's probably also selling time shares at the same time!!). At the hotel they are also sneaky! It turned out a "concierge" was our first contact and he helped us find our room. I figured a concierge would not be someone selling time shares so after trying to dodge the people we thought were obviously sales people, we figured the concierge would be safe....wrong! He was the one who was first in the line of "sales" people. We made the mistake of going back down after settling in the room and he made mention of our "welcome gift" and that was the beginning! Next thing you know we had signed up for something the next morning (which then caused us to miss our orientation meeting for our tour group). No mention of time shares or the like was really ever mentioned so we really weren't sure what was going on until we saw something about taking up 90 mins. of our time, then we started to get suspicious. We should have walked away at that time, but we had been told they would show us some information on the Xcaret hotel where we were moving and that's what we were interested in so we continued on. We were to be taken for breakfast with another friendly "sales" guy (the breakfast was nothing special and in fact was just at the regular buffet). He takes you on a tour of the complex and then he passes you to the hard nosed sales guy who is the annoyingly cliched sales man! This totally turned us off! Once we transferred to Xcaret we were a little more aware of what to look for (at Xcaret the maids put an "invitation" and mention of free gift in your door to snag you in!). Note; the fellow in Allegro told us by Mexican law they can't bother you a second time. We finally told the guys in Xcaret we'd done the spiel in Allegro and they never asked us again so this must be true). Generally we enjoyed our short time there but can't really judge it too seriously as we only had 2 full days and nights at this hotel. I had been nervous from previous negative reviews that I'd read AFTER I had paid, but was happy to find things not as bad as I had read.

Reviews.Title: “Alright time at the Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: bseggewiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar from Feb.13 to Feb.20 all inclusive. We arrived late wednesday evening, with no problems checking in, very speedy, and very friendly. The resort it self is very nice, well kept, and reletively clean. They have neat little villas you stay in, about 4 rooms to a villa, depending on if there is a suite above you or not. They are very small, and everything you can expect from a mexican 2-3 star hotel. Nothing special, with rock hard beds, and semi clean bathrooms. We didn't have any problems with our room, our party consisted of 12 people, and some of us had problems with air conditioning and what not, but were taken care of very quickly. They have one main buffet in the main building, with very repetive food selection, it was decent, but same thing every night. Another buffet was located at the pools, and open for lunch accompinied by a BBQ, with burgers and fries, which were decent. Two Al a carte restaurants, one italian, one mexican... They were also decent. The two pools were very nice, and clean, with plenty of room to accomodate everyone. Entertainers are friendly and always looking to have a good time. However, this is where I rate the hotel poorly... Trust only the entertainers to on site activities, when it comes to off site activities such as pub crawls, or nights out on the town, they CANNOT be trusted. All 5 of the entertainers took our group of 12 people out on our last night to a club. It was the worst experience I have ever had in Mexico. They took 20 dollars from each on of us (Group of 12 people) to get a ride to the club and back, entry cover, and one drink. The night consisted of almost getting in a fight with unionized cab drivers, almost getting run off the road by the same cab drivers, getting rejected from a local club, they managed to have us pay for ALL of their drinks, they made us tip more on a bill, that they clearly took for them selves, and to top it all off, they asked for more money from each on of us, to get back to our hotel at the end of the night... that was 10 dollars from each on of us, for a 5 dollar cab ride home. By this time all 12 of us had enough of it, and walked away from these scam artists, who were suppose to be our hotel entertainers, and dropped them for the rest of the night. Other than the horrible entertainment staff, the hotel was great, great service, friendly bartenders, restaurant staff, and great house keeping. If you are traveling to Playa Del Carmen for the beaches, do not waste your money. As mentioned in previous reviews and according to the pictures, the locals are trying to reclaim the beaches. Huge whale size sandbags are placed along the beach and about 15 from shore to break the waves before they reach the shore... They then pump sand section by section back on to the shore from the ocean floor trying to build up the beaches to what they once were. We made the best of it however by climbing on these sandbags, and jumping into the water, and making games out of it.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutRoberto
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of an e-mail that I sent to the manager of the Allegro/Playacar after returning from a 2 week stay there. =================================== My wife and I have recently returned home after a delightful two weeks stay at your Occidental Allegro resort in Playa del Carman. We arrived on February 6th and we departed on February 19th. The purpose of this letter is to thank you for the wonderful time that we enjoyed at the Allegro. My wife and I have had the good fortune of traveling all over the world, including Europe, China, Japan, and India. I am delighted to tell you that your Allegro was a most delightful experience. The setting, the facility, the accommodations and the food were outstanding. However our greatest delight was in your staff. The loving hospitality that they displayed was the high-light of our stay. Their care and affection toward us went far beyond what ever training they may have received. It may simply be a part of the Mexican and Mayan cultures. Whatever the source, they made us feel like family. Unfortunately I don't have the names of all the people who were so kind to us but here are three who were outstanding. Pilar, the hostess at the breakfast buffet Victor, a waiter at the breakfast buffet Dominique, at the Guest Services desk in the lobby Alberto, a photographer These people are a credit to your resort and to the full experience of restful peace and welcoming hospitality. Thanks again for a truly delightful experience in Playa del Carman and for your wonderful resort, but thank you especially for your staff. We will return. ===========================

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!! Well worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucyandRicky
Reviews.Content: I would like to put all the bad reviews to rest.!!!! We stayed from January 22 - 29th 2008 and had a great time. We had sun everyday and no rain at all. The staff were excellent and the check in was a breeze. The people who complain about check in time being 3pm obviously do not do their homework before hand as just about every where check in time is 3pm. Take a later flight if you do not like it!!! We arrived at 9:30am got our bracelets they looked after our luggage and we spent the time we had to wait to explore the resort and sit by the pool. Just put your swimsuit, sandals in your carry on, buy suntan lotion at the airport as you cannot go through security with yours and wear summer clothes on the plane. Yes there were the time share people (but they are at every hotel along the strip) and they are a pain but just keep on walking. It was hard to tell who were the real hotel people as they all dressed the same. We kept saying we were broke and they would leave you alone after the first two days. The resort was vey nice, well kept and the food was good as my husband is a picky eater and he found lots to eat. The Italian Restaurant was good. They served Corona as the domestic beer and they even had lots of limes. We had a ground floor room which was nice. The base of the bed is concrete but there is a thick mattress and a memory foam also on top and lots of pillows. It was very comfortable. We saw a fly once other then that no bugs. We did see an Iguana on the property an some baby gekos. The pools were excellent and there were always loungers. The beach was fine if you walked down the beach a little bit you could get into the ocean and swim out with no sandbags in your way. I would also like to say in some reviews they make it look like this is the only resort affected ,well it is not as it is like that all the way down the beaches in Playacar even the 5 star hotels have sandbags on the beach!!! There is plenty of sand and loungers. They are out there everyday working on the beach it is actually quite interesting on how they do it. You are 20 mins away from Playa del Carmen(walking) and it is a great shopping area. You can walk ( 20 mins,it is very safe there) or take a Taxi (5 mins) for $5. There is also a small strip mall you can walk to 5 mins away. A must day trip is to Coba it is well worth the money and has the only Ruin you can still climb, you visit a Mayan family and swim in a senosa. There is plenty to do and see I wish we had booked a two week vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the stay”
Reviews.Author: evalok
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, all inclusive. We traveled about 8 hrs total and were dead tired, we looked forward to a speedy check in and grabbing some food- didn't happen! Check in took at least 45 mins, then they try to sell you on the time share and then will continue to hassle you each morning about it. we tried hard to avoid our 'host' each morning since we didn't want to be put on the spot again. Food wasn't very good, except for the mexican buffet. Booking a sit down dinner was a pain, since you could only do it at certain times the day of and on the last night, they 'lost' our reservation so we had to make do with the carribean buffet (not very good). The bungalows i thought were cute at first, until we could hear our neighbors late at night and early in the morning, they weren't being loud, we all shared a thatched roof which has no insulation. floors are dirty and the room was musty. Luckily we went in the off season so our rate was reasonable but if i paid more than the 140/nt that we did i'd have been upset. beach was terrible due to the hurricane- they should mention this on their website as other properties did! they had 2 pools that looked very clean. otherwise, the property itself is well landscaped and pleasant. great quiet location, about a 15 min walk to town.

Reviews.Title: “im going back soon!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonLMCM
Reviews.Content: Im going to be completly honest that was probly the most memorable vacation ever. I have to admit, for a 14 year old it was very suitable i went there with my dad. Im a well traveled kid, been all around the world but it was SOOOO fun, The staff is so nice, so helpful and very personal they get to know you by name and thy make your stay there so much funner. Entertainment is insane, it was like mild circus solay hahah but they were acually extreamly good. Food was awesome, Not me nor anyone there get sick it was hot fresh and there was a huge veriaty. Rooms, to be honest werent my favorite, but its not like you go to mexico to stay in your room i dont really have any complaints, it close to town, 5 minute taxi to shopping too. I Highly Recomend you go on the Adventure Park tour, when you go on the quads then on zip lines and such SO MUCH FUN but ya go to the resort it was sooo much fun, and even being 14 the night life was fun (snuck into alot of places) but i hope this helped Please go it wwas soooo fun

Reviews.Title: “good time for the price”
Reviews.Author: djkc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allegro from January 28/08 until Feb. 3/08. We left the hotel at 10:30 p.m. on the 3rd so we had 7 full days of sun. This hotel was overbooked, as they sent two couples to Grand Xcaret for 2 days, and then back to the Allegro. The beach is improving and the 2 pools have plenty of loungers so there is no need to reserve one in the morning. There were a variety of activities going on all day, i.e. step aerobics, aqua gym, pool volleyball, water polo, spanish lessons, bingo etc. The other pool was mainly for relaxing. The food was very good. We thought there was a good selection even if you are a picky eater. We tried the Italian restaurant and really enjoyed it. It is a nice change from the buffet food. Staff in the main restaurant were very friendly as were the housekeeping staff. All in all we had a good time and would return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great time”
Reviews.Author: rjnewengland
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Allegro Playacar.The beach, though erroded some was enjoyable. The pools were and grounds were beautifully kept. The food was very good and fresh with as much variety as a buffet allows. The staff worked tirelessly for guests and were very friendly. My only complaint (this pops up often) was the timeshare sales desk just beyond check-in. I let one man know in no uncertain terms that I wasn't interested, and that was that. The rooms were functional, we had plenty of hot water and slept very well on the firm beds...after swimming, parasailing, snorkeling, night shows, etc we were tired! The nightly shows were entertaining and the staff seemed to enjoy putting them on. Would I go back? Yes, but I would forst look for a resort with more beach front (as shown on their web site).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, Not great”
Reviews.Author: ajohnson7279
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, however there were a few things that were not up to par. The beach is horrible, it got eroded during a tropical storm, which is not their fault, but by December you would have thought they would have had it fixed. So all you have to look at is these huge black sand bags that look like beached whales. The rooms were nice but damp. Everything is concrete, even the bed frame. I personally like harder beds, however this may cause back pain for some. We also awoke a couple of mornings with fresh bug bites, some in places that were covered up with clothing when we were out the night before which led me to believe they might have been in our bed. The two pools are very nice, the activities staff is very attentive and tries to get all involved in activities. The main buffet was pretty good and the lunch buffet by the pool was nice each day. I highly recommend the chips and salsa! The only thing that I found quite odd was that they did not supply you with drinking straws. I am not sure how you are to enjoy a frozen drink without a straw. So make sure you bring your own! Not a big deal though if you like Corona, they have that on tap!

Reviews.Title: “Gone from best to worst”
Reviews.Author: superbb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 4 years ago, had a really nice stay for 2 weeks. I wanted to book this hotel again, until that hurricane (I believe Wilma) had other ideas. So, this year dec 2007-jan2008 I booked again... What a mistake! Had a room next to the theatre and nightclub which meant we stayed up till about 2am every night! The beach is completely gone apart from about 1m. We had no hot or even warm water for the whole stay (8days), we did complain every day... The last day they asked us to move room, which we refused. Upon arrival we were unable to go into our room because the lock didn't work, took about 2 hours before that was fixed... The only thing that was really good was the food, that was about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: indygirl27
Reviews.Content: I was recently at this resort with a group (9 total). We were there to suprise one of the group for her birthday. The staff was amazing - they really went out of their way to ensure our surprise came off without a hitch. They knew and remembered our names after the first day. The rooms are average, the beds are a little hard but the only time I spent in my room was either showering or sleeping. Everything in the room worked. Fancy rooms would be a waste in my opinion. The food at the sit down restaurants was very good. A buffet is what it is. The lunch buffet had fresh grilled meat and fish every day and the salsa and guacamole were very good. The breakfast buffet had a huge variety and the made to order omelets were very good. There have been a lot of complaints about the lack of beach. It is not fair to blame that on the hotel. They are working hard to repair the beach and we saw men out there working hard early every morning when we took our walks. There is plenty of sand to allow you to sit on the beach but the water directly in front of the hotel is not very deep for swimming. A few steps to the next property over and you can fully swim in the ocean. All in all we had a great stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The simple truth”
Reviews.Author: 4pugs
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star resort. The initial check in is fine as long as you stress that you are uninterested in the timeshare. When you get to your room you will be very disappointed. They are musty and outdated. Some reviews state that the first floor rooms are nicer or less damp but that is not true. The rooms are quite dated with very limited closet or storage space. You will live out of your suitcase. The beds are on concrete bases with poor quality linens, a shower half enclosed, which drenches the floor. There is no way a person would ever take a bath in the rust filled tub. It is all inclusive, only one choice of beer draft Corona, I doubt that it was Corona. The drinks are limited , mostly bottom shelf. The food was quite bad, mostly buffets with plenty of choices. It was all covered in sauces, or left in the sun or trays for hours at a time. We left the resort to go into town for 4 dinners over 7 days, just to eat a good meal. The staff was hardworking, and pleasant. Their is no beach to swim in, only to lay out on. They are attempting to fix the erosion. I am surprised that an Allegro resort would have such a misleading website. It makes it seem that the beach is long with access to the ocean. The website also makes it seem that they have a golf course, but that is done the road for a mere 190 dolars a round? That website is a lawsuit waiting to happen. Overall, i would not recommend this hotel umless your budget was bare minimum, you are 18-25 and dont mind cheap drinks and greasy food. Buyer Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “What Beach! do not trust their website!”
Reviews.Author: GSPSouthWest
Reviews.Content: We wanted a restful beach holiday and having viewed the resort on their website we decided to book the Occidental Allegro.We viewed a beautiful resort surrounded by lush vegetation with a long white sandy beach. When we got there we were immediately pounced upon by the resorts representatives trying to sell us holiday or timeshare; this we did not take kindly to as we had been travelling for 22 hrs. We agreed to see them the following morning just to get them off our backs! When the morning arrived and we had our breakfast we were told that we should attend the meeting as we were on their schedule, we walked passed and went on our way, much to their annoyance. We went down to the beach and found to our horror that there was no beach. The beach was blown away 2 years ago or so when a hurricane hit the area. They are currently trying to rebuild the beach by using 5-6 ton sand bags!. They are sucking sand from off shore into these bags on the beach and trying to build up squares so that the sand can rest inside the squares.Consequently on the beach there are huge hoses and petrol/electric driven engines sucking the sand from offshore. This is making just offshore very deep and forcing rip currents to speed up and down the whole beach area, as far as the eye can see in either direction, making it dangerous to swim in most conditions. There are even signs on the beach advising to watch out for underwater obstructions as these are dangerous. All the hotels as far as the eye can see on that piece of coast have this problem. We spent the whole holiday beside the pools that they have on site. If this was the type of holiday that we had wanted then we could have gone to anywhere in the Mediterranean and spent a whole lot less! We wanted a beach and warm sea for swimming and snorkelling and this resort seemed to offer the deal, but there was no lush green vegetation surrounding the site, no beach, and just other resorts hard up to the wire fence surrounding this site. If you view the Occidental Allegro Playacar website it shows nothing of this problem it just shows a beautiful beach, and the site surrounded by lush green vegetation. The beach in fact is the size of a tennis court with sea defence walls built to stop the sea pounding away the rooms that they have close to where the beach was! The green vegetation is the golf course which is across the road to the west of the site with north and south of the site other resorts The beach problem is known by the resorts highest management as the areas General Manager was at our resort for 3 days in our final week. He flew in from Porto Rico so they cannot deny knowledge of the situation there. We had not had a holiday in over 2 years and we were really looking forward to a complete chill out, walking on the beach type holiday but you cannot walk more that 30 yds in either direction. The food, house keeping and general staff were very good and could not do enough for you, however even this high standard does not make up for the disappointment and the hassle from the in house time share/holiday reps and the total lack of beach. The reps were even conducting business during breakfast with other guests, something which I really object to! I really do not wish to know other guests financial details when I'm eating! If we had known all this we would not have booked this holiday and would have gone back to the Maldives, but Mexico was new to us. We will not be going back to that area again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlnycNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is not luxury, but it has many qualitites that make it a great value. Allegro was a good choice for us because we didn't want to spend a fortune, we did want a clean hotel with some ammenities, and we weren't planning on being in our room for much more than sleeping. The food is not gourmet, but it is enjoyable and they do have a good variety for each meal. Our room was on the top floor and we thought the thatched roof added an authentic feel. The bathroom was not pretty, but it seemed to be clean and it served its purpose. If you are bothered by little things like minor rust or a shower without a complete door then don't go here, but if you are on a budget and ok with some aspects that need upgrading then you will have a great time. The grounds are lush with flowers and plants and the landscaping is immaculate. The pools are nice, and the staff is very friendly. When you first arrive it is annoying that they try to convince you to go to a meeting about some sort of timeshare deal, but I've heard that happens at a lot of the resorts. The location is also a plus being at the beach and within walkng distance to the town. Also, if you like to go out just be warned that there is no nightlife past 11pm at the hotel, but the town is so close that it is easy to head there after having a few drinks at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best accomadations”
Reviews.Author: kirstenBoston_Ma
Reviews.Content: RCI was our trip provider. We actually stayed at the First Club which is within the same resort. We were treated like royalty!! My-self ,husband and 2 boys ages 3 and 7 went the third week of Oct. We were given a 2 bedroom 2 full bath w/ dining room and living room # 4811. Great front veranda overlooking the ocean, with nothing in front of us but the beautiful blue water and beach area.There were 2 big pools,activities by the pool all day every day(even thru some rainy spots).The kids center was well done, and Janet was lovely to my children. Although I wasnt able to leave my 3 y.o. unattended she did watch him for an hour while I got some things done.I gave her 10.00 U.S. and the next day she bought my little one a toy! Very nice. The beds in our room were fantastic!!! I found fluffy feather pillows in the closet wrapped in plastic. The mattress was great although some other guests we talked to complained. I guess it's the luck of the draw.I would have asked for a room change instead of asking them to change the mattress because of the work for them involved. Happily there wernt a lot of Americans there so it was relaxing for us not to have to babble or be babbled at! The food was pretty good, especially on theme nights. The Italian rest. was Fab! The Mexican rest. was not. We never went hungry.The weather was a bit unsettlted but good and hot and humid. Rain came in spurts and quickly went away. We did bring home some kind of sand fleas I suspect.( not bedbugs). When you return home wash ALL your clothes in HOT water and leave your suitcases outside while you do this. My huband put clean unused socks back into his drawer at home and got about 20 bites over his feet and ankles. At sunset on the beach we noticed little thing biting us.We were even treated to a complementary snorkelink trip aboard a catamaran that inluded lunch at an offsite rest. I know right!!The capain of the boat threw in the life preserver and hualed my 3 y.o. around with us in the water for 45 minutes!!! I've been to Mexico lots of time but the rest of my family had not. They all loved it and would go back in a second. I got a free massage by listening to the sales pitch and it was the best massage ever by Mike. In the Spa room not on the beach.There were some topless sunbathers but the kids didnt even notice nor did I.. until my Husband brought each one to my attention. HaHa.I miss the luxery of daily maid service and all the food selectins that I didnt have to prepare.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: LAllan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the allegro and would have to say that it is a probably a very good 3 star hotel. I travelled alone and found the hotel, resort and area of playacar extremely safe and even travelled up to cancun on the local bus with ease. Local taxis from the hotel to playa del carmen are fixed at 5 dollars or you can walk in 20 mins. Well worth a visit with great shops and restaurants. Try the blue parrot for lunch, overlooks the beach and lobster tail a steal at £13! Local buses to cancun are about 360 pesos (£1.80 each way) and takes about 1 hour and a quarter. The hotel is exceptionally clean is all areas and sits in lovely well kept gardens. The rooms are in blocks so nicely dotted accommodation around the grounds with pretty thatched roofs. Be warned though if you are upstairs in the thatched roof roooms as you will hear EVERYTHING from next door!!! Some have two double beds and others a supersize king bed or at least thats what it felt like. Rooms have a fridge, tv with lots of spanish or american channels, hairdryer which is functional and an iron an iron board if you need them. They supply fresh towels daily along with bottle of water - usually more than you need! Shampoo and shower gel as well in the bathroom although you need to provide your own conditioner. Restaurants were fine although would say that both my experiences to the Italian and the Mexican were great. The food was good and ala carte. The main restaurant serves buffet style and although every day it is a bit samey there is always lots to choose from. For the fussy eaters that just like to complain perhaps you should just stay at home or better still eat out and not book an all inc. I wonder what some of them eat at home! There are 2 pools, one is at the back of the pool/snack bar area and quite quiet and relaxing, the other is between the pool bar and the beach and thats where all the games/activities happen and you hear the activity team over the mike from10am to 5pm. Just a hint.....don't lie on the left if you don't like to get smoke from the barbeque all over you. Activity team are all friendly and organise several trips up to cancun nightclubs or local nightclubs in playacarmen. If they take you to "Cocobongo" you should have a great night...worth the bus trip (1 hour and a quarter) but if its "The City" unless you like techno pumping music give it a miss! Local club in playa called the Mambo Cafe was a fun night with mixed disco and also 10 piece live band. Salsa, mambo if you like to dance go along. The beach has been a bit hit by the last hurricane but they are working hard to improve and started to look great when I left. Just past the hideaway next door you can actually take a long walk along the beach so get past there and you're sorted. The only downside to this hotel is it was very quiet when I was there so after the show (which I didn't really watch much) everyone disappeared to the rooms or someone so the bars at night were almost empty! I had a great time and everyone of the staff were extremely friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Reception went out of their way to help, bar staff were always attentive and the housekeeping staff were very creative with the towels. Go and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok only because the trip was free”
Reviews.Author: tbensler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort because we got the trip as a wedding present. Since we never spent any money on it ourselves I can say that it was ok. The food was pretty bad. It was buffet style so everything was always covered in sauces and always the same. If you like to eat healthier - do no stay here. Don't get me wrong, I was on vacation and ate pretty bad, but after 5 days of it you start to feel sick with all the grease. We found that when my husband went up to get the drinks they would pour lesser shots then when I went up. The front desk staff were HORRIBLE and treated us like crap when we declined the timeshare (which we were pushed into attending, DEFINATLY not something I wanted to do on my first day in Mexico) The staff who are in charge of the attractions were amazing, very knowledgable and incrediably helpful. The massage I paid $130 bucks for was a joke. The worst part about the massage was that I was tricked into getting 2. The lady told me that since I was getting their deluxa massage, I got another one included in the price. After I had the second massage however she told me I had to pay $50 bucks for it. I was really upset and when I went to management about it, they made me feel even worse since they said the staff member who booked the appointment had to pay for it!!!!! So I paid anyways, even though I knew it was probably a con. Like most people said, the beach is gone but that's not the hotels fault so I will not really talk about that. They are making efforts to fix it =) My favorite part was the 10 min walk into Playa Del Carmen - very beautiful and there was tons of shopping and things to see. It's a very safe walk since there is people (tourists) everywhere. If you are spending more than $700 per person for a week to stay here, DON'T. There is SO many hotels around this area and trust me, this one is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Watch out for Airport Taxi”
Reviews.Author: Modeler
Reviews.Content: I went alone down to the Allegra Playacar to check out Cancun and meet some freiends. I had a great time! The accomodations, while not 5-star, were a supurb value for the money. My room was always clean and functional. The bed was firm, but I brought my own pillow and slept fine. I arrived to a fruit basket and got cool folded towels every day (swan, elephant, pig - weird and fun!). The beach is coming back, and there was plenty to hang out on, under huge thatch 'umbrellas' - the sun was intense some days. The sand is white, clean and the water a beautiful opaque Carabbean turquoise, at a constant refreshing 85 degrees. The food is as good as a buffet can be at an all-inclusive place like this - I've read reviiews from others and all I have to say is that they should chill - if food is your priority, try the buffet or the (excellent) pool-side food bars. If you don't like these, there are dozens of great restrauants $5 away by taxi. To expect fine dining at this price might be a little optomistic. I ate three nights at the hotel, and three nights in near-by Playa Del Carmen. The best part is that I did not contract any stomach problem my whole trip - a first for me in Mexico. Unlike the West Coast, Cancun has a steady breeze as well so I had zero problems with bugs - even while golfing. THE ONLY DOWNSIDE of my trip was the taxi service to and from the Airport. The 'Grey Line' monopoly apparently now charges whatever they want. I was told by the hotel beforehand that the fare is about $40 one way. I picked up a Frommers 2008 nook, which also quoted $40. At 9:30pm, when I arrived, I was told $82, period. That was their 'car / evening charge', since vans 'did not travel' at night. I was told to look for a car outside the terminal. After I paid (with a credit card) I went outside to fine only vans. I rode with another similaraily gouged person down the coast to my hotel. The hotel concieairge rolled his eyes when I told him this story, and told me that since I paid by Amex, I would be able to contest the charge. On the way back I purposely took $40 American with me for the trip, which is what the hotel told me to do. After we left the driver said $50 American, I told him I had only $40, so he drives me to an ATM!! I took out $100 pesos (about 8 bucks and change at the time), and said he could have my $40 American and the $100 pesos, or I'd walk back to the hotel. He grumbled and didn't say a word for the 45 minute drive. Having this one dark spot on an otherwise brilliant vacation was unfortunate - everyone at the hotel and surrounding areas were so nice. I snorkeled, ate and drank like a pig, went golfing, and hung out with abandon. I will definately go again and again. But I will pay for all Taxi rides to and from the airport with my cards.

Reviews.Title: “Grear holiday”
Reviews.Author: AndyP80
Reviews.Content: We had an excellant 6 night stay at the resort, please ingor negative comments you may have read, they are all wrong. WARNING - do not go to the "welcome breakfast" and first club presentation unless ou want to be sold timeshare but in a diferent guise, it is the only negative thing about our stay. ROOMS Yes did smell a little musty on a few occasions but nothing that caused much trouble. Cleaned and well made every day with wonderfull towel origami. A good "firm" matress which is great for people like me who can get a bad back. Pleanty of storage. Sink area was very good though we didn't have a plug. Bath was huge! Hot water can be a bit hit and miss, you have to get it at the right time of day. Warning - do not put any paper in the tilet, we did once and it got blocked. Was sorted very promtly though after a call to reception. STAFF Are all pleasant and helpfull and made efforts to make do anything you needed. While the reception staff can seem a little cold they sorted any problem I had efficienctly and promptly. Waiter and bar staff were excellant, frindly and courteous. A little tipping at the bar goes a long way! Animation staff worked very hard and kept up a good reange of activites. ENTERTAINMENT Good run of the mill hotel entertainment nights. Magician was brilliant. FOOD Good selection for all meals. Snack bar by pool was excellant at lunch time. Italina and Mexican restaurnat we very good. GROUNDS Extreemly we kept and beatifull. Watch out for the Geko's! Pools are good. Slightly annoyed at some parents who let their children jump about in the "relax" pool. Plenty of loungers and shade if wanted. BEACH Yes they were severly effected by the hurrucanes but the staff are working extreemly hard and have already reclimed plenty of the beach to lounge on. Sand was lovly. Good lifeguard coverage of the swimming area and availiablitty of boggie boards, kayaks and sailing boat was ok. AREA Playacar is a gated community and felt very safe. Play de Carmen center is worth a visit. Xcaret is a must as is swimming with the doplhins. Cozumel is also a worthwhile day trip. While the mexicans will try to sell you things what we really liked if if you say no thank-you then they are happy and will leave you alone, much better than places like Tunisia where they just keep hasseling you. OVERALL A very good a pleastant hotel to stay at, would reccomend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners - Great Time Had”
Reviews.Author: robomax7
Reviews.Content: We went to the allegro for our honeymoon and had an absolutely fantastic time, would reccomend anyone going there. Althought the beach is not great, this is as a result of the hurricanes, so not the hotels fault for doing this but the Mexican government is doing all they can to restore them so if you go and find pumps on the beach, this is what it is for, but we really didnt notice them, plus the hotel offers to take you to their other hotel in Cozumel for the day where the beach is fantastic, plus you get all the all inclusive package as you would at the allegro. Our room was great, we had a sea view, normally you dont get this as this is for vacation club members, but I think I managed to swindle this by emailing the hotel directly asking for a nice room for our honeymoon and building up a rapor with the guest services manager so would reccomend contacting the hotel directly after making reservation. The food was great, we loved it and they do try to change what is there each night, but there are plenty of restraunts to go to 5 mins down the road. One tip, do not take american express travellers cheques as the mexicans dont like them and we struggled to get places to accept them. The staff were great, but we agree with the comments about reception staff, they can come accross quite cold and unhelpful, but if you have any probs go accross the room to Guest Services, the people there are lovely and really helpful. All in all, we had a fantastic time and would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!! STAY AWAY!!!! DON'T Bring you children!!!”
Reviews.Author: LovesWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: Don't EVER stay at this Resort. The staff is very unhappy looking and unfreindly. We loved the location, but there was NO BEACH, due to the the Hurricanes. We have been to Cancun many times and this was the worst. I rate it like I would a Motel6. The rooms were noisy and none of the 5 roomes we had had proper screens for the many misquitos that will make into your room. The walls look roten and nicked up and nothing ever looks clean. When we went down to get in the water. It was full of wires and pumps, due to sand pumping. It ruined the beach experince and we couldn't really go swimming. The liquor is generic and mostly in walmart looking plastic bottles. Bottled water was hard to come by and if you wanted any at all, you had to chase down the housekeeping people and beg for it. They have NO ROOM SERVICE, BEACH SERVICE, OR POOL SERVICE. Basicly NO SERVICE. You have to get everything for yourself and everything tasted so bad, it was caffateria food gone wrong. We stayed with a group of 10 people. ALL OF US BECAME VERY SICK, including my six year old daugther. from the buffet style of food. At one point I was consiedring being hospitalized. They have 2 resturants that only serves buffet suprise every meal. All of the food is nasty. They try to cater to Americans, by not serving mexican food. We came to Mexico to eat great mexican food and got none. You are allowed to eat at the Italian resturant and mexican resturant only once during your stay. They were both ok. I would have been happy to eat at Mcdonalds instead of their very scary buffets. When I tried to ask for late check out the front desk person requested a personal tip and if I didn't they weren't going to give it to me. That was so tacky. The staff seems underpaid because, if you ask for anything as little as a straw, they tell you it will take them about 30 minutes and then they will ignore you for next time if you don't tip them everytime. It's awfull. At this resort you feel like a second class citizen, esspecially if you do not own a timeshare. They say no to most reasonable requests. Their internet was always down. Please for the saftey of your children don't bring them here, because they will get sick! I also noticed that this is a prime destination for lesbian couples, so I would recommend this destination if you are a gay couple traveling together, who don't mind bad service and food.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks at Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: strawberry1986
Reviews.Content: Check In The check in was problem free. You are met with a welcome drink and walked to your room. Your luggage follows shortly after Rooms I would recommend asking for a ground floor room. The upper floors have thatched roofs and are apparently very musty and damp. The standard room is set up with a bed/seating area with a television and mini-bar, and then a seperate area in which there is a wardrobe and mirror. We thought the rooms were nicely decorated, but the bathrooms could perhaps do with a little updating. We liked the terrace area with tables/chairs and a hammock. We had no problems with air conditioning. The hotel provide an iron, ironing board and hairdryer, so you have no need to pack any of those items. There is a safe in the room which is free of charge too. We spent little time in the room, we would watch tv (The Warner channel!) while getting ready for the evening, it was adequate for our needs. GHD hair straighteners do not work, due to the voltage in Mexico - you are better off taking a cheaper pair & leaving them to heat up. Pool/Beach There is an activity pool, and a larger pool. There is always something going on at the activity pool e.g. volleyball, water polo, aquarobics. There is also a bar area within this pool, which is nice. The other pool is more for sunbathing/relaxation. It is generally not as busy. The beach is badly affected by recent storms, but the sandbags were fun to sit on and there are still enough loungers for people to enjoy the beach. Food & Drink Breakfast: Every type of pastry you can imagine, a toast machine is available, lots & lots fresh fruit, cereal, juices, smoothies, continantal style breakfast, eggs, sausages,. The coffee served at breakfast is delicious. Lunch: Lunch is sometimes served at the buffet, but mainly served at the snackbar near the pool. They have a barbeque going from about 11am - 3pm at which fish, beef, hamburgers, hotdogs, chicken, pork and even barbequed vegetables are served. There is also the snack bar for salads, natchos, pasta and various other meal options. Dinner: Served at the buffet or A la Carte restaurants (Italian & Mexican). We did not enjoy the Mexican so much but the Italian food was amazing. The Buffet also have theme nights, e.g. Oriental, mexican etc. There is a carvery with chicken and beef, pasta, various salads, lots of types of bread, chips, hotdogs for the kids, chicken and beef marinaded, potatoes..there seemed to be something for everyone. Pizzaria: There is a Pizzaria by the pool area open all day with many different pizza types, this was good for a snack or light lunch. Drink: The drinks were amazing. Named brands and a lovely cocktail menu. I recommend the Mai Tais. Self serve pepsi and fruit punch machine for non-alcoholoic refils during the day. The barstaff will also bring drinks to you while you sunbathe. I never had a problem with the bar queue Entertainment There are various types of entertainment during the day including xcooking competitions and water activities. We mainly relaxed during the day at the other pool so can't really comment on this, but the entetainment at night was fun - there is a large stage and seating area. We saw many shows (Mexican Hacienda, Carribean Show, Mr Allegro) and the costumes, lighting music and dancing are very professional. I enjoyed and thought that the staff worked very hard to make the shows entertaining. Disco/Bars The disco was a disappointment. the Disco plays bizarre music asuch as 'YMCA' and 'In The Navy'. It is also very small and not at all like a disco/nightclub. It does open until 2am though. Usually, we would go out for the meal, watch the Show, and then go to the Amber Bar (next to Reception) and then back to the room with drinks. If you are hoping for a resort with an exciting night-scene, this may not be the hotel for you. There is a nightclub tour to Cancun you can go on for $50 however. I think that runs once a week. Staff I found all the staff to be brilliant. We could not fault the maid service (and their towel origami!) and when we phoned for a repair, a repairman was at the apartment within ten minutes. The waiters and barstaff cannot do enough for you, and the gardners are constantly maintaining the land. The Animation Team are fun. They work at the pool all day and then at the night shows too. The only staff I have an issue with are the Reception staff. They are rude and often unwilling to help with problems. All in all we had a wonderful holiday and found it to be better than the 5* in Mexico (Bahia Principe, Tulum) we went to last year. Aside from the Bathrooms and nightlife which are only small details..our trip was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLee43
Reviews.Content: Sept15th to the 22nd 2007 hi there I just returned from Allegro Playacar for the second time in 2 months and the second time was even better than the first.I cannot say enough good things about this resort it is a three star but should be rated better the staff All of them are comparible to none.The General Manager Jesus Cordosa is always visible and great to talk to and very accomodating with such a nice man I can see why he has a great resort.Any one visiting playa should stay at this resort it will by far leaving you counting the days until you can return.The entertainment staff are talented beyond belief and so pleasant to be around.The pool staff are out of this world fun fun fun.the grounds keepers do a spectacular job the guys building up the beach work so hard .there is not a bad thing to say about his place it is ALL good ...I suggest you go and see for yourself

Reviews.Title: “Great all0inclusive”
Reviews.Author: mezzacca41
Reviews.Content: We were at the Allegro Playacar from Aug. 11-18th. We had an excellent time. I do not understand why others are writing about mold and musty smell in the room. My husband has allergies and he didn't sneeze the whole week. We booked through a time share package we inherited. It wasn't the Occidental time share, but our room was very clean and the air worked great. We requested a ground floor room close to the pool and we got it. The room was small, but we managed. We had our two kids with us. Our 4 yr old and 15 month old. So we also had a pack n play in the room. I used the shelfs in our closet that was very big to put clothes in and we opened my suitcase and my husbands. One was on the suitcase holder and the other under the wetbar. The staff was excellent . They really got everyone involved. The kids club was fun for my 4 yr old. He only went twice but loved it everytime he went. The pools were great. There was not much beach, but the sandbag area right by the entrance to the beach was good for us because it made a wading pool for our kids and we didn't have to worry about the waves the whole time. We just went down the beach a little to go out into the ocean. We didn't mind it at all. The food was great. I liked the different theme nights. And we really enjoyed the shows. The have many talented dancers here. I would recommend this to anyone and actually did recommend it to a friend who is going in Jan. Hopefully, they have a wonderful time too.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!! Do Not Go To This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ggnutz
Reviews.Content: I'm adding to the prior review (who is one of the people I travelled with). Anyone who says this hotel is "great" or that they "loved" it is either lying or has never been to a decent resort. I have been travelling on a moderate budget for the last 10yrs and this was the dirtiest, unkept resort i've ever seen. We spent 10 minutes in the room and decided to switch rooms and then checked out completely. We were not the only ones at the front desk complaining. The grounds are ok. The front desk could care less about your complaints. We told them we were leaving and they didn't even bother to try to stop us. They tried to have me sign off on a form that said we left voluntarily "not because of anything wrong with the hotel." I crossed out that line and wrote that the hotel itself was the reason. We were not given a refund as we booked through a "website." The rooms are absolutely disgusting! We were given a room in front of the activity pool, which we were excited about being that we're 3 single women (29, 30, 40yrs) looking to have fun. The rooms are tiny, there was no way we could fit a roll away bed (which by the way was left thrown at the bottom of the stairs and was streaked with grime and who knows what else!), there are no drawers and the "hammocks" on the balcony are falling apart. The bathroom was dirty, old and moldy. The rooms REAKED of must and mold and as soon as I walked in I began sneezing. Front desk told me it was because of the hurricane. We moved next door to the Wyndham Azteca. The rooms there are triple the size, have absolutey NO musty smell, have drawers, closets, dressing area and separate bathroom. We had an AMAZING time and just walking through the resort you could tell the difference. The front desk at Wyndham accomodated us in less than 30 minutes although we literally walked in off the street. and it cost LESS than the Allegro!! DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT go to the Allegro. It is a waste of $$. For the same price or even less you can visit a much nicer resort.

Reviews.Title: “NIce for the Price”
Reviews.Author: jlg3922
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Alegro in late June fror a week and had a good time. food was good, staff was helpful. Got a room that air didn't work to good and staff quickly moved me to another room. Do request a 1st floor room cause 2nd floor rooms have high ceilings which your room will never get cool. The resort was half full, so there was no waiting for anything. Bartender at the disco Made the best Micheladas (Texas Style), I can still taste them. For you beer drinkers, They have Corona and Modelo Negro.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: lidsorlee
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sat Aug 25th and encountered problems immediately. First there was difficulty in finding over reservations but after several tense mins our reservations were found. We added a third person and once I told the individual at the front desk this he looked perplexed. Again we waited a few tense minutes and he finally found the notes about the additional person. Amount for her to pay was figured out and she handed over her cc. We were able to get the room keys and our wrist bands. A nice lady then walked us to our room. We walked in and were in shock. I knew the rooms were small for three people but they are super small. We req'd a rollaway and knew there was no way it would fit. Besides that the musty smell of the room was very strong and it just seemed damp and not cool enough. Third person traveling with us decided she wanted her own room so she was off to the front desk to see about pricing. We also asked her while she was there if she could see about getting us switched. After waiting and waiting my other friend and I went to the front to see what the hold up was. Apparently front desk manager told my third friend that she was not allowed to request a room change. And as for another room for herself they quoted her something very very expensive. So my friend decided to go online to find herself another hotel. My other friend and myself decided to see about a room change. They gave us another key and we went to look at the room. Same problem and friend just sneezed walking into the rooms. At the point we knew we had to switch. We spent a total of 3 hrs or so at the resort and eventually checked out. Third friend got her refund immediately as she paid them that day. Myself and the other friend need to call who we booked with to see about getting a refund. Will never stay there nor will I recommend this hotel for anyone else. Front desk did not seem to really care as when we first arrived there were people coming in constantly asking to be switched. We winded up next door at the Wyndham Azteca, which was a nicer resort and definitely had a friendlier front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jclove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel from 7/29-8/6. It was a very pretty resort, the grounds are kept up very well. The staff for the most part was very friendly also. The taxi ride into town was $5.00, or it's a 20-30 min walk. There is no beach really because of the hurricane, they are working on fixing it though. There are 2 pools, 1 has a swim up bar that it seemed only 1 bartender was ever at. You had to get out of the pool and walk around to get served. The food was average. Nothing special, but if you ate in town somewhere it was very expensive.(even for a couple of tacos and beer). The Italian rest was very good though. They have shows nightly that were OK, it passed the time. The clubs in town didn't get busy until 10 or 11PM. I recommend the Fire show at the Blue Parrot. It says it starts at 10p but it never started earlier than 1130. Also they say they have a LADIES night but they had only 1 bartender for the girls and the line was so long it wasn't worth the wait. We changed rooms 3 times while we were there due to A/C problems, other people at the resort had the same issues and also had to keep changing rooms. We had to ask them several times to replace our shampoo and soap when we ran out. We did actually enjoy Playa, it was a very beautiful town so we stayed 2 days longer. They helped us change our reservations at the hotel but didn't ever tell us what time we were supposed to leave out(even after 6 or 7 attempts to get an answer) The day of our departure we almost missed our flight because they never told us what time to leave. They will try to talk you in to a time share but they were not pushy about it. Over all, we will for sure go back to Playa but we will not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: JackieMurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar August 2-7 and it was wonderful! We didn't have our kids with us, but think they would love it if we brought them here, which we plan to do on one our next family trips. The food was above our expectations, especially the Italian Restaurant, the Mexican buffet night on Monday, the lunch buffet at the pool and the breakfast buffet. We thought we would go to 5th Avenue to get lobster one night, but ended up eating at the resort the whole time. We had read the reviews about the beds, but they didn't bother us. The room is not luxury but it is clean and plenty bigger than what you would get in NY City. Besides, we were hardly in our rooms. The activity staff is phenomenal! We loved that we could participate in the many activites (ping pong, balloon toss, bingo, dance lessons, aqua aerobics, etc.) at the "party" pool or relax more at the quieter pool. The staff was very nice and friendly. The grounds were pretty and immaculate. The beach was small but didnlt bother us. We prefer the pool anyway. 5th Avenue was fun and close for only a $5 cab fare. We felt safe staying out until 3 or 4 in the morning at the clubs and eating at a late night taco restaurant before heading back to the resort. There was always staff walking the grounds that late also. I would recommend the "Fire Show" at the Blue Parrot on 5th Avenue. It is at 11:30 pm and it is a cool show on the beach. You can have drinks while you wait. What is more perfect? Overall, we really liked the Allegro Playacar and would definitely go back. We have even recommended it to friends already! You cannot beat the value and if you are going to relax and have a good time then this is the place! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: hayze129
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful - the grounds are perfectly kept and the food is great. The staff is friendly and I never had a problem getting a drink at any of the bars - even though I didnt tip until the end. I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The beach is a very narrow strip but it runs a long way so I always found somewhere to lay out. The water does have those ugly sand bags but only on certain parts so they can be avoided. I dont understand the complaints about the food. I have stayed at all inclusive several times and this was by far the best food. They have a huge variety and everyone should be able to find something they like. My only complaint is that the a/c in rooms does not work that well. We were on the top floor which has a very high thatched roof and I think the air was escaping from there, next time I go (and I will) I will try to get a room on the ground floor which may help the a/c. Oh yeah - no food is served between 11am and 12:30 so don't eat breakfast to early or you will be starving by the time lunch rolls around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool..But a word of caution”
Reviews.Author: jtbbydol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Occidental Allegro Playacar On 8/13-8/18/2007. Overall it was a fairly enjoyable experience. The recreational activities offered are very good.
