The food is good overrall. The pool is good and generally clean. Likes: Dinner is the best meal only at the buffet. Pools (2) are clean (most of the time) and one jacuzzi Staff and Tourists are friendly. Housekeeping staff do a great job of keeping the rooms clean. When you do get a drink. It's generally good quality a bit weak but overall good. Recreational Activities are SUPERB! The BEST cappuccino (in the main buffet room I ever had) I liked that in the main buffet room there is a different theme everyday for dinner. Ex: Mexican, French, Chinese, Etc. Dislikes: You will live out of your luggage. There are NO drawers to put your clothes. The room is not very big. If 4 people are staying in the double bedded room it will be a VERY tight fit. There is half a shower door. So water tends to spill on the floor. Staff do make you feel as if they should be tipped for serving you any little thing. (Even though my tipping fee was included in my package) I still spent over 200.00 US dollars in tipping the staff for the week. The Mexican and The Italian the two seperate restaurants which need a 24 hour reservation are not worth the reservation or the wait. The food is NOT great. Your Best bet is the buffet. The 90 minute tour is excruciating. My husband and I were there well over 2 hours and when you say NO a hundred times another person (the manager) comes and talks to you for another 15 minutes. The sales people aren't really pushy. They just don't take no for an answer. Geckos EVERYWHERE in your room, outside your room, all around the resort. Instead of who let the dogs out.. The slogan of Allegro should be who let the Geckos out. Do not under any circumstances do the parasailing (you have to purchase it next to the rec. stand by the pool) I paid over 300.00 US dollars supposedly for a 12 minute parasail. We were up there 5 minutes and brought back down. Supp. Because we were the last ones to go up and they were closing. Bring a cell phone that can call outside of Mexico. It will cost you a small fortune to call the US. I paid 4.00 US dollars just to connect the call and then a 1.00 US a minute. Do not buy an international phone card in the USA it doesn't work in Mexico. Bar service is very slow. Especially at the pool. I waited over 20 minutes for a drink. (If you tip the bartender well you will always go to the front of the line and your drink will be a bit stronger)

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but NOT great!”
Reviews.Author: ltp01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar from June 24th through 27th, 2007. The hotel is adequate although it looks like it is still trying to recover from the damage from the hurricane last year. Our Room: The room was damp the entire time and when we got home, our clothes smelled mildewed. The beds are mattresses placed on top of raised concrete forms so don't expect a soft cushy bed. The room itself was very small and the bathroom was wet all the time since there is only a partial glass partition keeping shower spray contained in the tub. The Food: OK but predictable for an all-inclusive. Some nights were better than others. Drinks: Have no complaints about the bar service. Beach: What beach? Like another reviewer said, the beach is virtually non-existent due to the hurricane erosion. Huge sandbags line the narrow beach. Our suggestion: Come stay if you get a really good deal. Otherwise, shop around for another all-inclusive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no luxury, just average”
Reviews.Author: vacationers_7
Reviews.Content: My family (me, wife and 2 kids) stayed at this resort July 20th-25th and for the most part enjoyed our stay. I will be honest, we were dissapointed in the rooms. They were way too small even for just two adults. If you are expecting a luxurious room, you will be dissapointed too. The only time the room was cool enough was in the middle of the night...if we wanted a place to cool off in the heat of the day, our room was not the place! The beach is fine. The sandbags are unsightly but the water is clear and the sand is fine. The food: The Italian Restaurant was dissapointing. The Mexican Restaurant was AWSOME. If we would have known how good it was we would have booked it for another night. The buffet is good and Mexican night at the buffet is a must. Lastly, I will not ever ever sit through another 3 hour Time Share presentation again. It was supposed to last 90 minutes....They are VERY pushy and agressive and made my wife and I feel bad because we wouldn't spend fourteen thousand dollars on a timeshare membership. If this is a prerequisite for traveling to any resort in the future we will not go there. Would we go back to this reort? No. My wife and I decided that we need and want a little more out of a resort

Reviews.Title: “family of six trip”
Reviews.Author: lbjsjm
Reviews.Content: After many hours of reading everyones revieves I decided to stay here. This was a last minute trip and I was traveling with my husband,2 teenage daughters(20 and 18),my son 14,and my 11 year old daughter. I booked every thing through Expedia. We flew with US AIrways which was a big mistake. Never on time,and then they made us miss our connecting flight and then gave us another flight one hour away from our original destination home.But back to Allegro, our reservations included two rooms, one of which turned out perfect, while the other presented several problems for us. The room did not have enough beds as we had requested, the air conditioning didn't work, and the room was handicapped equipped which we did not need, not to mention the room had a bad smell. However, the next day we were moved to a better room which fullfilled our requests. The rooms weren't incredibley large, but we were never in them during the day. The showers are not enclosed, so water typically spills onto the floor. The staff was very friendly and everyone spoke very good english, along with several other languages. My teenage daughters also found the male employees to be quite attractive. The food was good depending on the day. They served different food for every night of the week, some nights better than others. The pool side entertainment was great, along with the hotel's nightly shows. We were rather impressed by the various perfomances we saw each night. The hotel also has a kids club which hosted activities for kids all day nad all night in order to keep the younger guests entertained. One of the drawbacks to the hotel is their timeshare presentation which lasts three or more hours, despite the promised ninety minutes. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the beach was nice despite the large sandbags which we found a way to play on. If your accustomed to fancy dinning and upscale rooms, this is probably not the best place for you. We would however, probably stay there again, although i would like to try staying at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the relaxed”
Reviews.Author: CHRISTINA76
Reviews.Content: This resort is only for those who love to lounge around the pool. It's a small resort with midday activities but nothing to really be excited about. If you plan on going off resort then this is the place for you for your necessary accomodations. If you have kids who want to be active and get involved - choose another resort. It's a pretty resort and the staff is great but be prepared to also be asked to go to a time share presentation. Room is very small for more than 2 people!!! I'd go again only for price, otherwise I need a more active resort.

Reviews.Title: “loved allegro playacar”
Reviews.Author: jasgirl13
Reviews.Content: i booked the allegro playacar through jet blue getaways and got a great deal $1900 for me(21yrs.) my boyfriend(24yrs) and our 2 year old son round trip tickets and hotel all inclusive. rooms are clean and neat a bit small but managable. the beach is a bit small but theres beautiful white sand and turquoise water what else do you need? we usually headed out to the pool and beach at about 11:00-12:00 and never had a problem getting chairs so i don't understand what everyone is complaining about. breakfast is definately the best meal of the day they have everything you can think of quality was good. dinner and lunch was a bit repetitive but alot to choose from and good quality my son is a picky eater and ate well everyday better than when were at home. drinks are strong and yummy! i never walked by any employee at the hotel and wasn't greeted with a friendly smile and hola! this hotel has a wonderful and staff. i had gotten a bit of an allergic reaction to the sun after a few days and my lips and eyes swelld i had my boyfriend go to the front desk so they can call for a doctor at about 6:30 in the morning and he showed up at my balcony by 7:00am gave me a quick shot in the tushy a few pills to take every 8 hours and i was fine within 24hrs. i'll say again the staff is amazing very friendly and will go out of there way for you. the entertainment staff if great. the night shows is a hit and miss some were a wast of time others were good the MR. Allegro show was histerical don't miss it, it was on thur. night. Id say this is a great hotel for families,adults and people who are just looking to have a relaxing vacation. we went to 5th avenue once at night it was crowded and people seemed to be having fun but if your coming with a group of friends looking to party cancun is the place to be not playa del carmen i was there in 2004 and it's by far a better choice for a party vacation. so in conclusion me and my boyfriend are planning to come back next summer with a few other couples minus our son to stay a few nights at the allegro playacar and than the last few nights in cancun so i would definatley reccomend this hotel. If your planning on going don't worry you have nothing to worry about it's a beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest people you'l ever meet”
Reviews.Author: lydiamay05
Reviews.Content: I would go back to this hotel any day just for the staff, excellent is an understatement. Firstly the pool and activities staff were AMAZING, the range of activities and quantity was unbelievable to name just a few : yoga, step aerobics, canoeing, and games everyday. My teenage daughter and friends she met were busy every minute of the day and thoroughly enjoyed it, so much so she's begging me to take her back this year. Secondly the maids, waiters and chefs were lovely always happy to help with huge smiles on their faces. Also the rooms were clean and bright and quite large with fresh flowers everday. I would recomend this superb hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: mmNewYork
Reviews.Content: My family vacationed at Allegro July 14-21. This was a RCI exchange for us. We travelled with our two children (18 and 20) and three of their friends. We had a hotel room for us and a two bedroom suite facing the ocean for our children and their friends. The suite was magnificent although we encountered some air conditioning problems. The hammock on each patio is a nice touch. The grounds were pretty and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We knew prior to our trip that the beach had been severely damaged but you can still enjoy the beautiful ocean. We were able to walk the beach and once you walk down 3 or 4 hotels to the right, the beach was so much nicer (no ugly sandbags). We went to 5th Avenue and enjoyed the Blue Parrot and Las Parillas for dinner. The most disappointing aspect of our trip to Allegro was the food. I would say breakfast was the best meal of the day. We have been to other all inclusives and realize what resort food is, but this really was subpar. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wheres the beach????”
Reviews.Author: pokerjoker
Reviews.Content: I was extemely disapointed with this "all-inclusive'resort.Upon arrival,Iwent to the pool bar and waited for the one man bartending crew to make at least 25 to 30 drinks before it was my turn.I then walked 20 yards to where the beach once was. If you want to get in the beautiful Carribean water you have to climb over or go around these massive ,white, and ugly sand bags. When I cooled off and swam up to the pool bar, the line up for drinks had not changed, I realized that I was the only adult at the swim-up barwith about 10 elementary aged school children.It is a very small property that narrows when you walk to the pool/beach areaThe cabana style rooms are basic and boring. Food was awful /Show was great. Felt like I was camping.Called travel agent day 2 and went to Sandos Caricol [Select Club] *****

Reviews.Title: “Had fun but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: LIN
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week at the Allegro, but would try another resort rather than going back. There's a reason the resort rates 3.5 stars rather than 4 or 5, and if you are willing to spend the extra you'll probably be glad you did. (As an aside, American Airlines was a nightmare in both directions. Think carefully before flying them to anywhere in Mexico). Here's what we liked: - The grounds were very pretty, well landscaped, gave a nice tropical feel - The pools were clean and spacious, great for frequent dips to cool off from the heat. - The ocean is absolutely beautiful with shades of green and blue, and it was shallow enough to walk out and swim by the beach. Also great to hang out at night under the stars. - We took the $33 USD snorkeling trip which leaves from the next hotel over - fun trip, just to swim around with a mask and see some colorful fish. - The bartenders make good pina coladas and strawberry daiquiris. - The breakfast buffet was usually quite good. We liked being able to have an omelet made to order, the authentic Mexican beans are very tasty, we liked the various sausages and meats, and were surprised that the instant decaf coffee tasted good - We liked some dinner buffets but not all. Be warned that the "Intercontinental" buffet night is code for leftovers, and that the chefs tried hard but couldn't make Asian dishes work. Also they didn't seem to grasp what Americans mean by salad. On the other hand, the ice cream was fun and plentiful. - One word: tiramasu. Fabulous, unbelievably good, better than what we've had at good Italian restaurants in the US. Imagine how excited we were that it showed up at the buffets the next day. - The air conditioning in the room was a life saver - we set it to a low temperature and kept it (and the ceiling fan) on nonstop the whole week. - The staff were helpful and friendly. American Airlines was terrible in both directions, including losing our luggage on the trip to Playa. The hotel staff helped us call and reach the slippery luggage staff at American to ensure our bags were delivered. They also helped us call the van company that took us to and from the airport to confirm our return trip. - The games at the main pool were cheesy but harmless. I played water polo with other guests most days - We liked walking to the shopping center a few minutes away. Disappointments included: - There is very little actual beach. We knew this from Trip Advisor reviews before coming, but it still surprises you in person. Especially since most of the nearby hotels have substantially more beach left than the Allegro. - The hotel does a terrible job of making sure guests can get chairs by the pool. There just aren't enough chairs period, and literally by 7:30 am people have saved all the good chairs with umbrellas by both pools and on the beach. This is despite the signs that say 'please don't save spots.' For much of the day the saved seats are empty, because the savers are elsewhere, but tough luck for everyone else. We resorted to sending one of us out to save seats in the morning when we first woke up - annoying and not what you should have to do on vacation. - The photographers were too persistent coming around with their iguana and parrot and lemur and pushing you to have photos taken. Several times they would not just take 'no' for an answer and we had to waste time fending them off. - In a similar vein, the onsite tour salespeople were pushy and irritating. Our first morning a woman named Marisol followed us into the gift shop to try to strike up a conversation. It took several minutes for her to bug off. The next day she chased us down again after breakfast, and tried to guilt us into talking by using a cheap sales ploy "I'm getting the idea you don't want to talk to me." My fiancee had to put up with her for several minutes. When you're paying for a vacation you shouldn't have that kind of treatment. She finally got the message and left us alone. - The restaurant reservation requirement was just silly. We had to reserve several nights in advance, at an earlier time than we wanted. Then at both the Mexican and the Italian, we were one of 2-3 tables in an otherwise empty room. It appeared to be similar all week when we peered in. - The irony is that the restaurant food is mediocre after all that. Beautifully presented but little worth tasting. - The cable TV had only a few channels, mostly in Spanish. It would have been nice to have more when we were in for a siesta to escape the afternoon heat. - The room was adequate but nothing special. In particular there was almost no dresser / drawer space, so we had to live out of our suitcases the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro = AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: amila221
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were attending the wedding of my best friend at the Royal Hideaway - and we were told to stay at the Allegro next door. This was THE MOST AWFUL traveling experiences ever. I travel often and often stay in places that aren't even $10 US a night. So when we planned this trip - we stayed our first week elsewhere at an all inclusive in puerto aventuras) and had a great experience. Thinking it could only get better staying at an Occidental resort. Sorely mistaken on our part. Not one person said "hola" as you walked by. There is only one restaurant open per night - either mexican or italian. But if you dont make your reservation the day before - you are herded into their less then good buffet. In the morning I served my boyfriend and I coffee - as no one paid us any mind after we were seated. Went up to the front desk to ask for more packets of coffee for the room coffee maker - and 3 hours later they were brought to my room. huh? The beach? what beach? all 10 feet of sand between the resort and the water. oh and i couldnt forget the 2 foot wide sand bags covered in sea algae that you have to walk over in order to get to the beautiful sea behind it. I could go on and on.... all negative of course... the only positive thing was that they offered day trips (like everywhere else) for things to do off the resort. The only saving gracfe. I will never stay there again - for anyone that does give this place any kind of positive review - needs to check out other places in Q. Roo. There is so much more to be offered.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort for families...but not really suited for young partiers”
Reviews.Author: Frontlinewinner
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends stayed at the Occidental Allegro from June 27-July 1. This is a great value for families with children, or any traveler seeking a relaxed environment with good food, friendly service, a close proximity to the beach and good value for their dollar. The staff really goes out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and taken care of; they also tend to be extremely friendly and good-humored. The grounds are clean and well manicured, the rooms have all the necessities. The group I was with consisted of 8 singles (both guys and gals) who enjoy a loud, crazy time with booze flowing and new friends to be made. We met new people at the resort, but there did not to be another group like ours staying at the resort (which was a huge surprise to us). We enjoyed the all-inclusive situation, and took advantage of the free drinks during the day, but had to take a cab into Playa del Carmen to find the type of environment that we were looking for at night. We had a great time, but I think one of the other resorts would have been better suited for us. A few of the places we visited in town were the Blue Parrot, Coco Maya, Bali, Santanera and Senor Frogs. Blue Parrot and Coco Maya are right next door to each other and offer similar environments. Both are on the beach, have two dance floors, a separate VIP area upstairs and a good turnout of visitors from all over the planet. They both also offer quieter areas where you can relax and talk, and I recommend checking them out. The fire show at the Blue Parrot is also worth seeing. Bali is a big nightclub with loud music, lots of locals and a good looking crowd. Drinks are reasonably priced for the environment, and you can negotiate with the doorman to get around the cover charge (say you are going to go elsewhere if you have to pay cover, and be willing to do it). Santanera is right across the street from Bali and appeared to be almost entirely a local crowd; while most places in Playa close at 4am, both Bali and Santanera are open until 6. Senor Frogs was very disappointing and the barkeeps were very uninclined to provide change (I had to request change after giving $40 USD for a $28 tab). I was expecting an entirely different environment (with more excitement) and would not return. Sports betting is legal in Mexico, and Playa has a race and sports book called Caliente that wasn't bad. It is in the shopping center at the south end of 5th, caddy-corner from Carlos & Charlie's. I don't bet much on baseball or horses, so my visit was more to check things out in case I am back in the area during football and/or basketball season. It's a nice place, and I recommend stopping in if you want to place any wagers. I didn't compare their lines to those in Vegas, but I'd venture to guess that they're the same. Vig on sports was the standard -110.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro family vacation”
Reviews.Author: DD1114
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Allegro Playacar. We were a group of 6 - four adults and 2 toddlers. This is a great resort for families with small children. it is a smaller property which makes it very easy to walk everywhere. We had no problems with the time share agents. When we checked in, we simply said no thank you and were never bothered again. As far as the rooms, yes they are on the smaller side and the beds are a little hard, but still comfortable. The beach is small, but there is still plenty of room and lounge chairs were always available at the beach and at the pools. The kids shows each evening were great. The food was good and varied. The Mexican theme night was especially fun since the buffet was moved outside and there was entertainment throughout dinner. My only complaint was the lack of air conditioning in the buffet restaurant. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was the fact that they advertised an air conditioned dining room. The room was there, but it was never open. We inquired about this and were told that they only used the air conditioned dining room when the hotel was at 100% capacity, and this never happened during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay At The Allegro.”
Reviews.Author: Gravesy166
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights early June and the Wife and I loved every minute of it.The hotel grounds are truly stunning and kept in immaculate condition.The gardeners are forever working to keep the place spotless.The rooms are very clean and the air conditioning was excellent.The beds are huge and all the complaints about the hard mattress are nonsense.It's firm but very comfortable.The towel arrangements are a nice touch. Food was again excellent,plenty of choice and always available.We dined at the Mexican one evening and it was superb.The drinks were nice and refreshing and the Corona on tap was as good as any lager we get over here in Blighty. Before we went to Mexico we kept up to date via Tripadvisor with regards to the beach as this was our main concern but we needn't have worried.While the beach is small it was never overcrowded and there was always plenty of chairs and shade available. Evening entertainment was ok but we preferred to sit on the beach with a few drinks and relax.For us the hotel was exactly what we were after,a smaller resort which was nice and laid back and perfect for a relaxing chillout holiday. As for the timeshare moaners,if you politely but firmly say no thanks at the first attempt and do not get suckered in then you will have no problems for the rest of your stay. Would we visit the Allegro again?.......YES YES YES.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: mighty2078
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the allegro on May 27th and left on June 1st. We had great time there. The only thing I would say ruined our vacation was the rain. I rained every single day except for the last day we were there. We still enjoyed the pools (they have 2) and the activities despite the rain, we tried to make of it the best that we could. The food was really good and they give you aot of variety. I felt like everything was pretty fresh, the desserts were delicious! The rooms were were decent but after a few days I felt like they smelled of mildew. The cleaning ladies did a great job and they left us a mermaid made out of a towel which my daughter loved! It is close to the plaza and La Quinta avenida, about a 20 minute walk or a $5 cab ride. THere you can find markets, a mcdonalds, starbucks and other american stores like american apparel and diesel. The souvenier prices are very expensive so its best to buy from street vendors because you can negociate. Take the ferry to cozumel, its $20 dollars per person, round trip and it is very fun and a chance to do something else. One thing i didnt like was that the resort did not have a kiddie pool. our three year old wanted to spent her time in the water and it made it difficult because we had to stay there constantly with her. the beach is a bit non existant but not as bad as I thought. you can go to playa del carmen ($5 cab fare) and they have a beautiful beach. The staff is amazingly sweet and attentive. Israel is funny and always energetic even if its 8 in the morning. My favorite thing of the resort were the shows at night. They were fabolous! They have one every night at about 9:30 and they are incredibly well prepared, entertaining and the costumes are beautiful. They have a great time of dancers, my favorite one was Luz Maria from spain. They also have a kids show at 8:30, my daughter looked foward to participating every night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Oh, the last thing, I would have liked their to have been more activities during the time it was raining. If anyone stayed at this hotel during may 27-june 1st we would love to hear from your experience at allegro. We are the couple from new york (originally from the dominican republic).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: jesikah6
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I decided to book our honeymoon at the Occidental Allegro Playacar and it's one of the best travel decisions we've ever made. Since we were honeymooners, we made sure our travel agent alerted the hotel as such so that we could take advantage of the complimentary honeymoon priveledges the hotel offers. It's not much, but the hotel gives you a priority checkin (which we think was the representative escorting us through the property to our room), fruit basket, spa services discount, and breakfast in bed one morning. It was all perfect. Once we checked in, we were escorted to our room to wait for our bags to arrive. Well, we were starving, so we just took off to the pool to find some snacks. On the way there, we passed by The Pizzaria which was great! The pizza was hot, fresh, and tasty! After our quick slice, we headed over to the Snack Bar. OK - where I come from, "snacks" are things like chips, fries, chicken nuggest - you know, small portions of finger foods. Nope! This place lays out a whole spread at the snack bar. It was great! Everyday we noticed that there was always a beef, chicken, pork, fish, and vegetarian entree choice plus a potato dish, pasta dish, and a steamed vegetable. There was a full salad bar to make your own fresh salads and a grill off to the side which served fresh burgers, hot dogs, and a chicken or pork dish plus french fries. Oh yeah, there was a mini nacho bar with chips, cheese sauce, fresh pico de gallo, fresh guacamole, and cevice. It was great! After our first "snack", we headed back to our room to unpack and change into our swimsuits. Once down at the pool, the real relaxation began. (We opted to hang out at the activities pool everyday. We may not necessarily be the type to participate in every activity offered, but we certainly enjoy watching everyone else participate. Music is played at the activity pool and there's a swim-up bar there as well.) We hung out at the pool for a while then went to the lobby to try to make dinner reservations. I don't particularly agree with the whole reservation scheme since you're only given a choice of 600pm, 730pm, or 900pm to dine. I've been to much larger all-inclusives in the past that have ala carte restaurants and they use a first-come first-served seating policy that works just fine. You go when you want to eat then decide if you feel like waiting for a table or not. I guess it didn't much matter with our stay at the Allegro since we were able to get a reservation at our preferred time (730pm) each time we tried. Of the two ala carte menus, I preferred the menu at The Mexican over the menu at The Italian, though the food at both places was outstanding. We ate at the main buffet for the Oriental night and we also ate at the Mexican Fiesta. All of the food was delicious. Neither me nor my husband had anything we didn't like. Don't get me wrong, we're not talking gourmet-quality here, but it was all good. So, regarding our room. It was large, clean, and beautiful. We decided to go for a garden-view room since we knew we'd be spending every day-light hour at the pool enjoying the view AND the fresh air! Plus, it looked like all of the ocean-view rooms were situated near the pool and you know how water carries sound! We were assigned in building 41 which was just perfect. Right about in the middle between the pool and the main buffet. I will have to agree with some other reviews that the beds are a little hard but it is NOT due to the cement platform. They are just FIRM mattresses on the beds. The cement platforms are to help with hurricane rebuilding, not the "cheap Mexican shortcut" that others have claimed it to be. The vanity seemed to be newly remodeled with a fashionable bowl-style sink and round-framed mirror. The closet area could use drawers instead of shelves, but we didn't have any problem finding space for all of our things (10-days worth!). The bathroom houses only the toilet and tub/shower. Its just the right size for what you need to do in there. We had a second-story room which meant we had amazing cathedral ceilings all the way to the top of the palapa roof. If I had to guess, I'd say those ceilings are at least 25-30 feet tall! Truly magnificent. On our front porch was a hammock (which came in handy for siesta time) and a small table with 2 chairs. The whole set-up was really cool. There are only 8 rooms to each building (4 on the bottom and 4 on the top) and that gives the whole hotel a village-like feel. The grounds of this property were absolutely immaculate. I've included pictures so you can see for yourself because I'm not really sure how to describe it without sounding redundant. I've also included pics of the lobby building which the hotel fails to show on their website. I don't know why cuz the lobby is beautiful. Also, this staff was one of the friendliest staffs we've ever had the pleasure of being served by. Anytime we passed a staff member walking about the grounds, we were greeted with eye contact, a smile, and the appropriate verbal greeting for the time of day. We also liked the staff uniforms. They were neatly pressed and professional looking but also carried a tropical vibe. It was our first stay at an Occidental property, but if this is how they maintain all of their resorts, we'll look for an Occidental the next time we take a vacation. We only had 3 small annoyances. They really are quite petty as none of them had ANY bearing on our ability to enjoy our vacation. Here they are: 1. THE TIME SHARE HASSLE: We were approached by a rep on our first morning to attend the "VIP Breakfast". We've traveled around enough to know that the hotel staff doesn't want to eat with their guests just for the heck of it, and we didn't suddenly become a "VIP" out of no where and for no reason. If you can't realize that, then I'm sorry for you. If you're not interested in hearing their pitch, politely tell the rep that you are there to spend time with your family, husband, wife, boyfriend, girlfriend, friends, or whomever you're there with and you would prefer not to deviate from your plans. It worked for us and we didn't hurt anyone's feelings or act like those "Ugly Americans" everyone expects us to be. 2. THE PHOTOS WITH ANIIMALS: The hotel has a professional photographer on site that goes around and takes pics throughout the day. If you've ever been on a cruise, it's kind of like that, only each day they bring in some kind of exotic animal and push for you to have your picture taken with it. They don't want to seem to take "no" for an answer, so I found that telling them I was allergic seemed to steer them away successfully. You don't have to pay them to take the picture, only if you want a print out. 3. NOISE FROM THE ROOM NEXT DOOR: As I said before, we were on the second floor with those amazing cathedral ceilings. Well, on our second to last night, a family with a BABY was checked in to the room next to us. We quickly learned of the disadvantage of the palapa roof - no effective sound barrier. At times it sounded like that darn baby was laying in bed with us. Fortunately, the baby didn't cry too often or for too long so we were able to still enjoy ourselves. There were times that we could hear our neighbors conversations and TV clear as day, but that was only when we were in our room which was not very often. *NOTE: The beaches of Playacar (and much of the Caribbean coast of Mexico) were severely damaged at the hands of Hurricane Wilma in 2005. The government is doing the best they can to assist Mother Nature in rebuilding the beach. REMEMBER - THE LACK OF BEACH SAND IS NOT THE HOTEL'S FAULT! That said, there is still plenty of soft white sand and chaise lounge chairs to go around. Enjoy it and save your complaints for things that the hotel CAN control.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, no beach ”
Reviews.Author: bertal
Reviews.Content: Food was fine for all nationalities, from spicy to mild choices at all meals. Rooms were VERY clean and the maid each day left a beautiful sculptured towel arrangement. There is NO beach due to past huricane. The two pools, one quiet, one active were more then enought . Plenty of chaise lounges, tables, shade from huts and trees. Snack bar near "beach " bar was excellent variety for lunch including grilled cacts! Try it! Staff were all VERY pleasent. Grounds are picture quality and always being worked on. WARNING: if you have a rental car as we did, stay UNDER the speed limit. The Mexican "Banditos" are the police in Playa. Going to a wedding at another resort, stopped on route 307 doing "a little over the speed" accoring to the police. Choices: go with him to police station and pay fine ($150 U.S.)and get my license back, or PAY HIM! Late for wedding, not speaking language perfectly, paid him, and if I wanted a receipt, I could go to the police station. Spoiled our taste for anything to due wih Mexico in the future and my wife and I travel monthly!

Reviews.Title: “About what we expected”
Reviews.Author: e42180
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor before our trip, I was a bit apprehensive about our trip. Well we just got back a couple of days ago and overall we had a really nice time. It seems to be the perfect time to go. Weather was perfect. The sun was intense but, there was a nice breeze coming off the ocean. The place was fairly empty so, it was nice and relaxing. The beach is ,as others have stated, is small due to the erosion problems but, with the small number of people there, it reall wasn't a problem. The rooms are small and probably in need of some sort of refurbishing. But, we never stayed in our room that much. Overall the place, is nicely laid out. The food was decent with good selection. As with all buffets, after a few days, it starts to get old. They really try to sell you on the vacation packages. Just an FYI, you can get freebies if you negotiate with them about attending the 90 minutes sales pitch. They gave us two massages at the spa ($160 value) for our trouble. The staff was great and the nightly shows were not bad. Overall it was pretty much what we expected for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!! ”
Reviews.Author: nyrosa
Reviews.Content: I was here for 5 days, and let me start by saying it was the best vacation to date!!! from the moment you walk in to this place from the time you leave you are greeted by the most friendliest people ever!!! as soon as I checked in I took a walk around to see where everything was... which is a big deal for me cause the worst thing is when you stay in a huge resort and get to the hotel drunk and cant find your room LOL LOL LOL. Everything was very easy to find! As soon as I went to the pool area I noticed the guys getting everyone hyped about all the games and activities that they play. The first day, I sat back and watched everyone play and have fun. From that day on, I was involved in EVERY single activity there was... I was on stage EVERY single night! I never won any of the competitions, but I would definitely do it again in a heart beat!!! One of my best memories from this trip was getting to know one of the employees named Israel. He was so fun to be around with and always wanted everyone around him to have a good time. He knew all the H-O-T places to go after hours which IS ALWAYS a good thing!!! I miss you Israel**muah**!!!!! WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOT!!!

Reviews.Title: “friendliest place in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: brantrider
Reviews.Content: We travelled in a group of eight friends. Six of us were compliments of the hotel due to an overbooking problem in a past year.On our arrival we were assigned to various parts of the resort but when we asked to be closer we were put in the same building with no delay. The staff fell over themselves to meet your every need. This was from the housekeeping staff and bartenders right up to the GM who was very visible during our stay. The swimming was great. The beach,although small had a good number of lounges and cabana shades as well as palapas.We were served drinks on the beach by the ever smiling waiters. The food was good at the buffet but the lunch at the pool was more than adequate. The a la carte restaurants were good with the Mexican one being superb. The location was handy to both Playa del Carmen and the ferry to Cozumel. We all agreed we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort "Not a Mega Resort"”
Reviews.Author: THawks
Reviews.Content: Great Resort because it's not one of those mega resorts. It has 2 pools, 1 Italian restaurant, 1 Mexican and a buffet restauant at the main resort building plus a buffet each day at the swimming pool building. We just got back April 21, 2007. We traded through RCI which worked out for us this time. We were listed for a hotel room, but we got a mini suite with 2 rooms. This is part of the "first club" owners suites. I think we got the upgrade becasue they didn't have us registered at the resort for check in. But, always bring your confirmation letter that is your only proof from RCI. One room had a king size bed,television, closet, vanity sink and a bathroom. The other room had a sofa, television, sitting area, full bath, closet and a fully stocked wet (alcohol) bar. Yes, the bed frame is made out of concrete, but the mattress is fine. We stayed in another resort two years ago with the same bed design. Easy to rebuild after a hurricane. Our building was located on the 2nd row which made an easy one minute walk to the beach. This resort is so quaint most units are an easy walk down to the pool or beach. Unlike, the mega resorts where you have to take a shuttle to the restaurants or beach. All the food is good. If you get tired of the food on the property, you can walk downtown to Playa Del Carmen and try a variety of restaurants and bars. The walk is about 20 minutes away. It's a safe walk or a 5 dollar taxi ride. If you eat at the night time buffet, you have to ask for the waiter EDGAR CRUZ. He's great! We sat in his section every night. You can even ask for him on the nights they have the dinner shows. He's very professional, quick, remembers your drink orders every night, and he'll give you a spanish lesson during dinner. He made are dinners! The resort has worked very hard to maintain the beach. Heavy storms and erosion has taken much of the beach. Not just at this resort, but at all of the resorts up this stretch of Mexico. They have the most beach based on the number of rooms per each resort. In two weeks, they will start a beach rebuilding program. They will bring sand from the ocean to rebuild the sitting and walking part of their beach. Resort employees say they should gain 30 feet of new beach. I ask them to post pictures on their website for potential visitors. We laid out on the beach every day, only about 5 feet from the water. You can't beat that! Plenty of things to do, on and off the property. Just ask the front desk activities director. You don't need a car, taxi's right out front. Tip: When you arrive at the airport, just walk by all the baggage handlers that would like to carry your bags to a taxi.(For a Tip) Walk out front of the airport and grab a taxi yourself. A regular taxi car, not a van, should cost you $45.00 dollars to the resort. A van will cost you around $65.00 dollars for 2/4 people. I haven't had time to upload pictures into the computer. The other people who posted pictures did a great job of capturing the property. It's a beautiful property. If you want a fancy, posh and crowded resort, this is not for you. This is a small authentic mexican resort. We had a great time and we'll probably revisit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob082
Reviews.Content: We've been there from March 10- March 17. For the first time we flew across the Atlantic. We were used to having sun all day (Egypt, Greece, Spain) but that was not the case in Mexico. Nevertheless we were verry lucky with the weaher. The previous week there were only clouds and rain. The big pool should be ready by now. The beach already has been given an extreme make-over: beautiful! Staff was very friendly like also all other Mexicans we met. Food was good, drinks even better. Many Canadians and Americans over there. It was spring holiday in the States so a lot of adolescent girls and boys flew in. And some of them started with drinking Tequila at 10 am! Certainly advisable this hotel. And it is true, the beds are very hard, but not leading to any pain! We have been 1 day to Chichen Itza. Long day, but certainly worth while. We walked from shade to shade, it was very hot that day! And Playa del Carmen (easy reached by foot; also got for burning your cal.) is a touristic place, but a good place to be. After all after 9 pm the bars at the hotel are almost empty!!

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: woldsgirl
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from our time at playacar and had a great time. after reading the negative remarks left on this page i was almost dreading our holiday - i nead not have worried. the accommodation was clean and dry and the efforts of the room cleaning staff were appreciate. the beds were not uncomfortably hard - and i cannot sleep if the beds are too hard - but no worries there. the food was very extensive - although i would have liked to have seen them make more effort to provide typical mexican food. the lunch time 'snack bar' was amasing - you could not want for anything else. the pool side entertainment meant there was something for everyone - it was not peaceful by the main pool due to the activities - but if you want to escape you can go to the quieter pool. activities included spanish lessons, aqua aerobics, salsa and latino dance lessons, etc, etc and all free - the pool side staff are excellent and very accomodating of all standards. one negative - time share! - beware - they look like hotel staff and offer a great 'raffle' where you have a 1 in 8 chance of winning a 2 week holiday there. it's all [--] - the 90 minutes turned to 3 hours and i felt dirty after the experience - do yourselves a favour and just don't sign up for it - although the sweetener is that we got a couple of bottles of spirits and a mexican towel for our troubles!! woohoo!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was amazing”
Reviews.Author: angieIndiana
Reviews.Content: I am 16 years of age and i was there for spring break and i just loved it most hotals don't really do activites with you but the guys at the pool not only told you what to do but they played games with you it was great!!!,The staff was involved with the guests. We really need more staff and hotals like this one. I was pulled in to the shows there i never thought i would like it. It was so much fun and you get to meet different people there from all over the world. The staff you can really become friends with when you there and after you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: peppercita
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time. Friendly staff. Great activities and shows. Great place for teenagers. Yes, the beach has some sandbags but who cares. The hard beds people complain about are comfortable. My back never hurt there but hurt when I got home and slept on my own bed. Did Hidden Worlds, bikes on the cable and snorkeled a cenote, it was like our own private tour. Can't wait to go back to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: sunseekersengland
Reviews.Content: The Occidental Allegro resort was fantastic! My partner and I stayed there for a week and we did'nt want to come home! The service we received we could'nt fault one bit and would certainly recommend it to other couples. The staff were all very polite and nothing was too much trouble, The cleanliness of the resort (and our room) was always impeccable. The meals we had were very nice and there was always lots of choice and variety to choose from whether it be morning, noon or night. We will certainly be going back in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Vacation Club Scam”
Reviews.Author: Bing02dimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar last week. We were not happy with the rooms. They are very small. No room for two suitcases and your clothes for a week. Beds are like concrete (they are on concrete slabs! - no box springs.) These rooms might be acceptable to spring beakers, but NOT people who like to travel. Not much restaurant selection. WARNING: Do not buy into the Vacation Club! Just say NO to even their request for "five minutes of your time." We did last year and we were sold "upgraded rooms," "a studio," and premium services. Big time "bait-and-switch" scam! Met many other guests who felt ripped off by the vacation club scam also. The Vacation Club people are well practiced in stonewalling and doing absolutely nothing about your complaints. We will never stay in another Occidental Property because we were treated so poorly. Their management is criminal for letting such practices continue. In the USA they would be guilty of fraud. Maybe if enough people complain they will be forced to change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and the beach is nicer than the 5 star next store”
Reviews.Author: jvb326
Reviews.Content: We came to Allergro from March 21-30 for 9 days. We loved it. We stayed in a room right by the pool. The beds were firm but fine. The rooms were upgraded and there were tubs put in as well as new very modern sinks. We loved the food. For lunch they served steaks and spanish pia and lots of grilled hamburgers and hotdogs and fries. People from the Royal Hideaway wanted our barbaque they smelled it. They were coming over to use our beach it was better.We had great drinks we brought our own thermal mugs and tiped every other drink. We had top of the line liquior. We brought our own towels and we used them because we worried about losing them. We went on the lobster cruise out of Cancun which was great we loved the lobster the drinks on the cruise were just okay order wine or beer. We had a fabulous time at the resort everyone was so friendly I brought a welcome gift for the maid a set of Rosary beads and a sterling silver belt and she also got tips she was very happy her name was flora a sweetheart. I would definately go back the breakfasts were super anything you wanted was there. We tipped the girl making eggs too at the end Lita she was also very nice. I took 350 dollars in singles and they worked out great so remember to take dollar bills. We went over to town to the beach one day but the beach right there was just as good. The hotel packed a lunch and sodas or beers whatever you want for free 6 of each. I took cancun express from the airport it was 95 for two in a private van it was very very pleasant and they were very professional. Bought crocs(35 plus charms 3.50) sandals the hottest shoe in the UK now and bought a leather duffle at Playacar for 104, at the airport it was 300 dollars great deal at the golden duck in Playacar. Its 50% off there bags now so if your going aviod the junk and buy something you'll keep.

Reviews.Title: “Good family spot”
Reviews.Author: ILEvanston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar from Jan. 1-7, 2007. We had beachside rooms on the north side of the pool. Excellent service, clean, felt the kids were safe going off on their own. Enjoyed the evening shows. Ok to take the shuttle to the town beach. Kids enjoyed walking to town. The avairy along the way is great, but a bit expensive. Food had enough interesting highlights for us adults, but enough hamburgers, pizza, nachos and fruit to keep the kids not complaining. Just wish more access to kayaking off the beach. Enjoyed the experience immensely. The kids all want to go back. Did not spend a lot of time in our rooms!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful holiday . Lorraine and Colin Northern Ireland”
Reviews.Author: lozNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner went in the middle of August and had an absolute ball. We were the only people there from Northern Ireland which is unusual but kinda nice. Met some wonderful people. The hotel staff were fantastic they would do anything for you at the drop of a hat (especially if you give them a dollar) which is nice to do as they work so hard and are just the friendliest people. The beach was lovely so how you imagine the caribbean to be. The grounds were beautiful especially if you are a plant lover, they are very well kept. The beds are fine you are only sleeping there after all. The rooms are a wee bit musty but again its the humidity, you get used to it after a day or 2. They are clean and that is the main thing, The hammock on the balcony is great fun especially after a few drinks. Oh and the drinks are certainly not watered down,I found this out very quickly. No mini bar in the room though, so what you just bring your drinks up with you. The Barstaff get to know you and if you give them the odd tip soon get to know your drink and have it on the bar for you before you even ask for it, they are brill. We had planned to go on a few trips but never done it you really dont need to leave the resort. The entertaining staff work so hard day and night. We had the odd storm but do you know what so what. The storms were usually at night. All I can say is thanks to the Allegro for making this a memorable holiday, it has spoilt us. Hi to Andy from Yorkshire, Mel from London and Ami from London from Lorraine and Colin

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: mc
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time in the area - definitely go back, but to maybe a bigger resort with more things to do??? Playa del carmen GREAT little town!! 5th Avenue was lots of fun - great shops & great bars (Senor Frog's was just plain crazy - threw 2 different waiters into the ocean while we were there; saw a couple short dance contests; VERY loud & rowdy!! and had a great time with the bartenders at the Tequila Barrel) The resort was just OK, but that may be because of what we limited our budget to; the "Disco" was DEAD every night, so until we went into town, there was nothing to do at night at our resort. The food was mediocre with a few really good things on the menu (I expected it to be like the cruise with everything being great; maybe that was expecting too much). However, the Mexican fiesta was great & ALL the food was great!! Their beach is still all be non-existent, but told guests they could (1) go to the beaches on either side or (2) they would transport anyone to Mamacita beach. We just stayed at Allegro, but did walk both beaches. We think it would have been better here with the kids. ACT; st louis

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar from Feb. 23 to Mar. 2. We knew in advance about the beach from reading these reviews so it was not an issue. My girlfriend and I had requested 2 double beds and were given a room with a king bed. We had no problem changing rooms the next day. Yes, the beds are hard but I didn't have a problem sleeping on them. Other than that the rooms were very clean, everything in working order, lots of hot water. The air conditioner wasn't very powerful but not a problem. The best thing about this hotel is the staff and the activities. The staff does everything in their power to make sure you have a good time. A special thanks to the activities staff: Oscar, Tito, Adan and especially Israel. They worked all day by the pool and then participated in the shows at night. We participated in stretching classes, water aerobics, water volleyball, water balloon fight, horseshoes, bingo, beer drinking, waitering competition, latin dancing, paella making, and had a great time at each one. The shows at night are great, the dancers are very talented and professional. One day by the pool the general manager took the time to introduce and acknowledge staff from every part of the hotel, from the front desk to the dishwashers and groundskeepers. I thought this was a really nice gesture. The food in the buffet was fine, lots of variety. The two restaurants were good, especially the Italian which is a fine dining restaurant where we had four waiters catering to us. This is not the fanciest hotel but I didn't expect it to be for the price we paid. It was small, intimate and fun, and we got the chance to meet some really nice people. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “WANNA BUY A TIME SHARE?”
Reviews.Author: DougieMidland
Reviews.Content: Returned home to Midland Ontario March 04 after spending 7 days at the Playacar. The hotel staff were great and the food was quite good with lots of choices. You cannot complain about the quality and selection. The rooms really need refurbishing and our room , which was closer to the ocean , had a musty smell. The ceiling in the bathroom area dripped from the airconditioner above us, so we learned to not waste a lot of time in front of the mirror or you would end up wet.The pool activities were good and the bar staff were eager to please. They made every tropical drink you ever heard of . I saw a number of guests will their own large insulated mugs and the bartenders filled them up without hesitation. A group of partiers bought their own American beer in town, and just had their 5 gallon bucket filled regularly with ice. The beer on tap is corona. The beach is basically non existent due to the rising water level and the heavy winds. The main pool, located overlooking the ocean is damaged and will need to be repaired again. We were told that it was damaged in January and was already repaired once. The entertainment is amateurish but fun. My only real complaint is the sales tactics used to sell time shares. You could end up giving up most of a day of your vacation being toured and talked up. We didn't participate and returned their free offers to attend the information session. We initially thought that the staff were going to tour us around the property and provide a small orientation to the resort but this was not the intention. The resort brings in crafts, artwork and jewellery a few times so you don't have to take the trip off the resort to buy souvineers if you don't feel like it. We went off a few times to shop in town on what they call "Fifth Avenue". Lots of stores and bars. We ate at the Italian speciality restaurant and I had the shrimp with lobster sauce and it rate a 10 in my opinion. One evening they featured a quitarist in the bar opposite the dining room and this guy was good. He played a lot of the Gypsy Kings and I was drawn away from my dinner to go and listen. My wife gave me the look, when she caught me sitting over by the entertainment. We fortunately met another couple and shared meals and some activities. We will exchange photos with our new found friends and may meet again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Rromy
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place. Staff is friendly as can stand to be. There is pressure on the guests to look into and possibly buy their time-shares. We did not. You will get nice gifts for going to and listening to the information. Buffet was not bad for each meal. Our table guy in the morning was a charm to know. We tipped him well. The grounds and pool area are set up well, so as to keep noise away from the living areas. Good food at the pool if you can get there in time. Drinks were good, but small glasses. Close to the downtown Playa area,; we used taxis to get there, about $5 each way. There is a very nice and quaint shopping area right down the street from the hotel. Was fun to explore. The side trips available are great. Deal with the guy right out back of the hotel. Better deals and they are nice to work with. We did the Mayan ruins trip, Xel-Ha (which was wonderful), the ATV day trip and the Dinner cruise trip. We had a GREAT time on all the above. Our stay in Playa was memorable; the hurrican hit 3 weeks later. We want to go back again maybe next year. The sight of the Carribbean Ocean was spectacular. Gorgeous!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: xz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro Feb 21-28 2007, and I thought it was wonderful. I have travelled extensively and have stayed at 5.5* places. This place was friendly and the service was wonderful (better than at the Riu Palace in Cancun!). The entertainment staff do a good job, especially one guy (I will attach his photo since not sure of his name). You can tell he loves his job, and he chats with everyone. He was so excited I won a snorkel trip, more excited than me! He remembered our names and would always stop to talk. They add fun twists to the contests, such as belly flops into the pool if you lose the beer chugging contest, and kayak relay races in the pool (using your hands). Some of the enterainment staff are a bit arrogant, but most are very nice. Tito (spelling?) who wears the skirts acted like we were bothering him for a photo. However, he is very brave to be wearing skirts everyday! We went to the sister hotel in Xcaret (the Grand Flaminco) for one night, and it was gorgeous but huge! There were golf carts to bring people around cause it was so big. We found it too big, and were happy to come back to our little Allegro. They were overbooked so we volunteered to go over to Xcaret for 1 night. Food was good (buffets are always ho-hum everywhere you go), but there is an a la carte for lunch (in the buffet area), and an outdoor lunch BBQ everyday by the pool. There is a snack bar by the pool (nachos, tacos, salad etc). The snack bar closes at 4pm , but there is also a pizza bar till 5pm (thin crust and pretty good). They have a theme night (International I think) with a Fire Show, people on stilts etc, all the tables and food are outdoors (nice change). They also have a great outdoor Mexican Night (Mondays) with Mariache and other entertainers--fiesta! The buffet restaurant seems recently renovated and is one of the nicest I have seen. There are 2 a la cartes for supper, Mexican and Italian. We liked the Mexican better (we had fajitas and coconut shrimp) but the Italian is fancier (cream cheese bread is good!) but the shrimp had balsamic on them (strange!). There are also vendors at the resort at supper if you wish to purchase some souvenirs (not that much to chose from). Yes there are sandbags on the beach, they are everywhere (even at the posh resorts in the Playacar area). There is still about 3 rows of chairs, and a swim area. The resort has a shuttle to a beach in town and provides lunch and drinks (boxed lunches). We didn't bother. There is also a taped off area (only a small area) of the activities pool. Rooms are average, ones on top have thatched roofs (some like downstairs, depending on your taste). We had 2 rooms, and 1 was a weird shape, so if you don't like just ask for another. We also had to wait a day for a safe key (they ran out?!) so we had to carry all our valuables with us. Also, when we tried their 5* Xcaret resort, we were promised free tickets to the Xcaret park next door, this is only for 2 nights or more. Probably the guy wasn't lying but was confused. They also stuck us in a 1 king bedroom 2X, and we are 2 women. Logically, they should give us 2 beds (I even requested this upon booking and they didn't know anything about it). We had to wait another day to change rooms. These are only minor annoyances, and didin't ruin my trip but things you may want to be aware of. Also time share people are right outside the lobby (going towards the resort), and have a desk right there. All in all, great service, drinks were great (vodka, rum, kahlua, tequila, Corona etc etc) and so was the food and theme nights. Minor things like confusion at front desk were things I've gotten almost everywhere, and the service/friendliness outshadows this--I would definately go back. Furthermore, the service does not change in the absence of a tip. Sometimes we tipped and sometimes we didn't and it never made a difference in our treatment. Of course they thanked us and smiled when we tipped, they were appreciative. I haven't been to many resorts where I can say the treatment was the same even if I forgot my tip money in the safe! Also this resort is a 15-20 min walk to town (gorgeous!) or a $5 cab ride, there is also a resort mall 2 minutes down the road---all so convenient. Playacar is a gated resort area so you can walk around at night and feel safe. I've been to Cancun and hated it (cheesy!), but Playa Del Carmen is more like Puerto Vallarta and more authentic, with a Starbucks of course!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: MsFingas
Reviews.Content: We retruned from a week on Sunday 2/25/07 The property is lovely but there are signs of neglect. Our bed was like sleeping on a brick. Before you think I'm a total grouch, the activities staff were wonderful, there are LOT's of activities by the pool nearest the beach. We also had massages (totally reccommend the hot rock massage). The food was alright, tasty but lukewarm for the most part. My biggest problem was on the day of our return, we encountered severe weather problems. Our destination airport was closed, and we knew it. The hotel was completely un concerned. ALL of the outgoing guests were picked up after waiting at various resorts for 4 or 5 hours, taken to the airport and left sitting. No cot's, no blankets, not a bottle of water that wasn't for sale. We sat for 8 hours with no information forthcoming. Suddenly, we were directed to board, and off we went (thankfully) but I found the front desk staff to be very snobby and unhelpful. Also this was the second Apple Vacation that I had problems with, so I won't be using them again. The resort IS doing a great job restoring the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard”
Reviews.Author: beaches34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Allegro from Jan 27-Feb 17, 2007. Unfortumately, this resort and the other resorts south of Playacar have NO beach so we were unalbe to take our daily walks. The beach is so eroded that only major beach restoration will now fix it...such a shame. BUT the staff of the resort ( activities, food and beverage, housekeeping) really work extra hard to make up for the lack of beach. This is our 5th trip to this resort and Eduardo ( new food/bev mgr) had really improved the atmosphere and taste of the culinary delights. The host at the Mexican restuarant was always willing to help out the guests. We are owners at Allegro Vacation Club and do feel they ( the individuals connected to the AVC) have to make an effort to either include us or just treat us like a regular tour group....otherwise why would you buy into the timeshare concept?? We still enjoy many aspects of the resort and will return when the beach is rebuilt. Also hope that Allegro hurries to finish the rebuilding of the resort in Cancun...another favorite.

Reviews.Title: “What to be expected...”
Reviews.Author: CanuckBC
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week from Jan 22-29th. We had read the reviews before we left so we knew there wasn't going to be any beach and weren't expecting much. The rooms were comfy, the hammocks on each deck was heavenly. Typical Mexico rooms/beds - this is my third time being in Mexico and everytime the beds have been hard so that's nothing to complain about at this resort. The staff was great and accomodating. Not really any beach - esp on the really rough days, but the resort beside the Allgero allows access to their beach and there was no problems using it. The staff is working very hard at getting the beach back - but honestly there is only so much they can do against mother nature. The pool was great, always a chair or two if needed. The only complaint I would have is that the other guests never wanted to participate in the activities so there wasn't much going on. The food was ok as were the drinks - usual all inclusive menu. Gets a little old after a few days, but decent enough This is a great place for people who want a very relaxing and quiet trip. VERY close to town so if there is the need for social contact. Also, if planning on going to Cozumel for the day - get a letter from the front desk and access to the Cozumel resort is allowed. They have a wonderful beach there!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Just a little southwest of Baltimore, Maryland
Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: sylcefire1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with much to do! The beach is still being restored but there is a small beach area. Interesting to watch restoration! The hotel shows were wonderful and the food was very good--alot of variety but enough "repeat" dishes where you didn't have to try everything at one sitting. The chef, Eduardo Zacarias, was gracious enough to share one of his recipes with me via email after my return to the states (I couldn't find it online)! How awesome is that! The staff, including "George", the young man who showed us around the resort and answered all our questions, was great! Everything was convienient, including money exchange (the local shops took American dollars-but not coin). Our room was nice, but make sure you get an upgrade (much nicer safe in the room & refrigerator). If you have a problem with steps, be sure to request a lower level room. The polynesian look really works here! The ground maintainence crew does a spectacular job as well! 5th Ave shops are a 20 min brisk walk. Cozumel a short ferry ride. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back......”
Reviews.Author: relics
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar Jan 17-31. Check-in was at 3:00, but we weren't given a room until 5:00. We didn't feel it was too big of a deal as it gave us time to explore the grounds, have a few drinks and get some food in us. The grounds at the Allergro are absolutelty beautiful, some of the prettiest weve seen, they should have more pictures of the grounds on their web-site. We had an upstairs room with a palapa roof. Room was average, we did have a issue with the screens, as they were torn and pulled out of the frame in areas. One call and Manuel from maintenance replaced them. We preferred having the windows open verses air conditioning in the evening. You will need a sense of adventure if you choose an upstairs room as there will be little lizards crawling about up high. They seem to stay up high and wont hurt you. There was no mold or musty odors, the bathroom did have a strong urine odor at first, but our maid Wilma took care of that. We found the staff to be very friendly and eager to please, some of the best we've ran into. The staff makes this resort. We found the food very good, and a good selection to choose from. Drinks were fair to good. The beer was on tap, sometimes flat, sometimes fizzy, sometimes very good. I drank mine with some ice cubes and lime, and almost always enjoyed it. After the first day, and a tip or two, the bartenders knew our preferences and they also knew where to find us for refills. We booked in Nov. and knew the beach was lost in Dec. but decided to come anyway, because it looked like a small laid-back resort, and are glad we did. We like the location as it is only a 15-20 min. walk to town. They are working on restoring the beach area, you could see a difference every day. You do have the timeshare people to deal with. We told them the first day we weren't interested and they really didnt bother us until the second to the last day, then it was visit a little and another no. This isn't a 5 star resort, but we didn't pay 5 star prices for this stay. We feel we got our moneys worth, and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: TMFowt
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at an all-inclusive resort, and our first time in Mexico. We stayed for a week and then spent a week at the Gran Flamenco (also Occidental). Two very different experiences. We felt extremely comfortable at this resort. It's small and cozy. There are eight rooms per two level, thatch-roofed building. Ours was on the lower level of a building by one of the pools. Our room had two double beds; as we're a family of five we needed a cot brought in. Things got pretty crowded in there, but as we essentially only used the room for sleeping, personal maintenance, and storage of our luggage it was not a problem. Everything -- from our bedsheets to the little sugar packs for the coffee -- was slightly damp, but considering we were right on the ocean this wasn't surprising. My wife was bothered by a musty smell from the air conditioner. We just turned that off at dinner time, and by keeping the curtains closed during the day and the windows open at night we slept comfortably. The beds were firm, but that's the way we like them. The mirror by the sink had rust spots on it, as did the kinda goofy (but functional) room safe, but apart from that the room was clean. The bathtub/shower had no curtain or door but a small partition to keep the toilet and fresh towels from getting wet. It took a little finesse to keep everything else from getting wet in the bathroom, but taking short showers helped (the resort asks that you help to conserve water by minimizing shower times, so maybe this was by design). There was no fridge, but we got fresh bottles of water every day, and our room was cleaned and made up daily (including a new towel sculpture -- the kids loved this). Not sure if it made a difference but we left a small tip on a pillow every day. We also tipped at meals (10 or 20 pesos). The staff were all exceptionally friendly and courteous. I learned a touch of Spanish beforehand which the staff seemed to appreciate, even if mostly I just said "gracias" (not "grashus") and "por favor". The Kids Club was nice when my wife and I just wanted some time to ourselves; the staff played games with the kids, but mostly our kids wanted to play Playstation/Xbox or watch movies on the big screen TV. The food was good but not great, and while the selection is quite good we were getting tired of it after a week. The themed buffet dinners were a nice change, especially Mexican night which was quite an extravaganza, with the buffet moved outdoors and a mariachi band. For snacks, there was pizza (several kinds), hamburgers, hotdogs, salads, tacos, and tortillas... pretty standard fare, but very conveniently placed by the pools. The bars were well stocked and the bartenders knowledgeable. I suspect the drinks were a bit slim on the alcohol as no one (myself included) seemed to be experiencing particularly ill effects. They tasted good though, and as they're already paid for you just need to keep drinking to get where you're going. That said, I ate and ate and ate and only put on a couple of pounds so maybe it's something in the air. The one real criticism I have regarding drinks is when I asked for cerveza I got Corona. That was my only choice and I've developed a real distaste for it. Dos Equis is available everywhere in downtown Playa del Carmen, but Corona must have locked up beer rights at Occidental resorts because it was the only option. Both pools were fully functional (including the swim up bar) when we were there (Jan. 12 - 19, 2007). Lots of activities, and with the cozy setting everyone was getting involved in some way or other (if just throwing errant water balloons back at the people in the pool). There was still no beach, but we just walked over to a gate maybe fifty feet from our beach to the beach at the resort next door (beach chairs and facilities belong to the respective resort, but beaches are under federal jurisdiction). All the beaches in the area are in pretty sad shape, but when we wanted to swim in the ocean we did, and when we wanted to sun in chairs we did that by the pool. We wanted to get as much sun as possible, so we generally skipped the evening shows (which seemed alright if not particularly cultural), went to bed early, and got up with the sun before the kids. Older folks seemed to grab the poolside chairs earlier in the morning, with the young adults showing up to party in the afternoon. There was a nice international feel to the place: we met Canadians, Americans, French, and Italians (and, of course, Mexicans). The resort is essentially a long strip with facilities (pools, bars, tennis courts, etc.) running down the centre, so the faces became familiar and it was easy to meet people. The only real big negative was the lack of a laundry facility. They'll do laundry for you, but at prices like US$5 to wash a single shirt. We ended up taking our laundry into town and getting it done there. There's a laundromat (lavenderia) just past Calle 11 on 10 Avenida that washed all our clothes (a couple of kilograms worth) for 110 pesos. Even with the cab fare there and back to drop it off and again to pick it up, it's a bargain. It costs half that if you get out of the touristy part of town and find a place on 30 Avenida, and it's even cheaper if you load the washers and driers yourself. We would definitely come back here, and actually prefer it to the impressive (if a bit less friendly) Gran Flamenco. The deciding feature is definitely the friendly staff. From chatting with Ina and Remco at the front desk about their travels, to the buffet waiters who did cat impressions that had our kids looking under the tables, to the Kids Club staff that played with the kids, and the cheerful "hola" from every single staff member we passed, we never felt anything but welcome to this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Choice!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTravelersx2
Reviews.Content: We were more than pleased with the Allegro Playacar for our Jan18th-21st visit. Helpful, friendly, hard working staff, clean rooms, good food, fun shows, good location. We were particularly pleased that we were more than happy with the resort after having read the scathing reviews from the Christmas holiday/early January visitors. We found that it lived up to, if not exceeded, our expectations. Is the hotel beach gone? As compared to the photos, yes. But beach chairs along the fence overlooking the ocean are sitting on sand and we went into the ocean from our little beach as well as the one to the north so we brought enough sand home to feel like we'd been at the beach! The staff was working hard to restore more of the beach but there's only so much they can do. The two story thatched roof "houses" holding only 8 rooms each was an intimacy you don't get with high rises and long corridors. The little porches for each room, complete with hammock, allowed you to feel like it was really home, complete with lovely tropical gardens. The atmosphere is casually upscale. The recreation and wait staff were always friendly and cheerful, and the shows are varied, entertaining, and fun. The food and drink were plentiful, nicely presented, and always included fresh fruit and vegies and something grilled. We enjoyed the 15 minute walk past some ruins, into town easy and worthwhile. You can use the beach there or haunt the plentiful opportunities for shopping. Only a block off 5th Avenue the less touristy mexico exists. There are plenty of off-site excursions/experiences you can pay for (and arrange directly from the hotel, including car rental) but we didn't really find the need or have the time.

Reviews.Title: “They have come a long way in a short time!”
Reviews.Author: Wisc_Visitors
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 1/14 through 1/18 and I am sooooo glad I did not read the reviews before going. It sounds like Mother Nature did quite a job with the beach front of this resort and most of the other resorts. However, after reading the reviews I can tell you that these people are trying very hard to fix the problems encountered in December and early January. Not that it helps you folks who have already had your vacation. When we arrived on Sunday it was extremely windy and swimming in the ocean was not possible. It looked like there had been mass destruction along the beach front in front of most resorts, Allegro Playcar included. They had opened up access to the resort beach immediately to the north and it was very usable. To the south was not yet. However, by the time Tuesday came and the winds finally died down the beaches were usable and they were working extremely hard to fight Mother Nature. Each day showed signs of much improvement and I give then credit for their efforts. The food was very good, and there was a good variety. The food at the activity pool from noon to 4 was delicious and plentiful and the staff were delightful. The drinks were great, the staff was extremely gracious and wanted only to please. They tried extremely hard to understand whatever language was spoken and I did not find it a barrier at all. The grounds were well taken care of.
