We liked the individual bungalows and the porch on each. The rooms could have been a little cleaner, the beds a little softer and yes there were som geekos present inside and out--welcome to Mexico. I would definitely stay there again and look forward to seeing how the beach will be changed by then.

Reviews.Title: “New York/New Jersey group”
Reviews.Author: ny/nj30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from January 11-16, 2007 there was 30 of us. We travel once a year for our family reunion and we try very hard to find a place that will suit everyone in our group and this hotel came through. Before we went we were very nervous about the condition of the hotel and that there was no beach. The week before the trip the hotel Manager of the Allegro hotel called me personally to reasure me that things would be good. So when my family arrived at the hotel we didn't know what to expect. Well let me tell you we had a great time. The rooms are what you see on the internet they are basically a bed, shower and dressing area it was fine. The rooms were kept clean, the maid service did our rooms two times a day so there was always fresh towels and little towel animals on your bed when you went in for the night. The air condition in the rooms were fine and the air quality in the room was fine. I recommend taking a candle to get rid of the musty smell you get when you stay in beach resorts. The food was decent and there always was something to do. We went with children and adults of all ages and no one was bored. The shows everynight were entertaining and they made the audience part of the shows. The pool area was clean, had plenty of lounges and the the activities were endless. Now let me tell you what this hotel has that not many hotels I have gone to have, they know you personally. The couldn't do enought for my family and remember there was a lot of us. They accomidated our every wish and took care of any problems we came across. I have to mention some of the people I met who went above and beyond to make us comfortable and they are Oscar, Arielle, Jesus, and so many others that made us part of their family. We had a great time and we don't regret ever going to this hotel. We are a very picky and loud bunch of people and they satisfied our vacation needs. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: E-Dub412
Reviews.Content: I have been to Mexico in the past and never have I been so disappointed as I was at this resort. There is no beach. The pictures on the website are entirely misleading. The beach and hot tub were wiped out by a hurricane. All of the beaches in the area are public beaches, but you cannot use the chairs from other resorts. The resort provides a shuttle to one of the public beaches that is about 15 minutes away, but the schedule is entirely unreliable even though it is supposed to run back and forth every half hour. Our room was extremely small, it smelled musty, and there was no alarm clock, refrigerator, or room service offered. We had to call every single day to get our room cleaned, they didn't just do it. The only positive thing I have to say about this resort is that it had pretty good food, and some good activities going on throughout the day...however, there is no beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year, Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SB321
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful time at the Allegro Playacar from Dec. 29 - Jan. 5. It was our first visit to the Rivera Maya. We’d read about the problems with the beach so we were disappointed but prepared. Our plans included visiting Xel-Ha, Tulum, Xcaret, and Chichen Itza. We enjoyed the pool at the resort and public beach in Playa del Carmen. Location - The hotel is in a great location, easy walk into town. We saw the beach shuttle but didn’t take it. Rooms -We were lucky to get a first floor room in a building right by the pool. We really liked the separate buildings. I just stayed at the Gaylord Palms in Orlando and it seems quieter with separate buildings versus long hallways. It wasn't musty at all and looked just like the website photos. We had a wonderful view and excellent cross ventilation. We loved the porch hammock - so relaxing. Be prepared for hard beds and air conditioning that is difficult to keep adjusted overnight. I liked having the in-room safe for our travel documents. Staff - The entertainment and front desk staff worked very hard over the holidays. My son (11) reported that the Kids Club didn't have any interesting video games. We were happy he spent more time swimming in the pool. Food – We thought the food was delicious, lots of pork, beef and fish. There were plenty of cooked vegetables but not too many fresh choices. The made-to-order breakfast omelets, sweet bananas and the ice cream were super. We loved the convenience of the buffet restaurant and friendly waiters. This was our first time at an all-inclusive resort. We usually stay at resort hotels or rent condos and cook. It made the trip much more relaxing and it was a good value. It is challenging to get a reservation for the restaurants. I wish they had a more convenient system. We ate in the Italian Restaurant on New Year’s and the food was delicious but not kid-friendly. It was a fixed menu and that was it. On our last night, I had shrimp for dinner and I paid for it later on. Shows - I thought the shows over the New Year’s weekend were excellent. We enjoyed the Mayan/Mexican show and the New Year's show, Boogie Nights. The MC was warm and welcoming. I danced in college productions so I loved the dancing. The open-air theater was comfortable and there were plenty of margaritas. I also liked the kids program – Janet, Sadie and Pablo(?) from Acapulco kept the kids busy before the main shows opened. Things to Do - I wouldn’t miss the evening show at Xcaret. They play two riveting Mayan games and the music and history of Mexican dance is fascinating, not to mention the hawks and parrots that fly in during the show. Wonderful. We also enjoyed the Xaman-Ha Aviary about ten minutes walk from the hotel. Bring your bug spray but the birds and grounds are beautiful. The snorkeling at beautiful Xel-Ha is super; we wish we had spent a full day there. We did a combined Xel-Ha and Tulum tour. Alejandro at the hotel tours desk was really helpful. Most tours leave from Playacar Plaza Shopping Center, just a few minutes walk south of the hotel. The tours drop you back at your hotel. Another good tip is that you can get a letter from the hotel allowing you to use the Occidental Cozumel resort for the day. We considered going but didn’t make it. The ferry costs about $22 U.S rt each (tickets at the hotel – for use on both ferry lines) or $10 U.S. rt at the ferry terminal (buy one way so you can get on the next ferry coming back on the return). We had a wonderful vacation and I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very good time”
Reviews.Author: Linda32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Allegro Playacar from Dec 30 to Jan 6. It was our third trip to the Mayan Riviera and it was better than the last one. I was very worried about pool/beach situation because of all the negative reviews and was preparing for the worst vacation. This is what we found: activities pool is fixed and both pools are fully functional now. Seawall is still not fixed, so there is no beach access in front of Allegro, but they opened the fence and built stairs to the Viva Azteca beach. Beaches are eroded in front of several resorts: Reef Playacar, Royal Hideaway, etc. Blame the storms and the fact that the coral reefs that used to protect the beaches are mostly dead now. We did not find it difficult to step down five steps down to the Viva Azteca beach, the beach was not too crowded and there were actually very few people in the water. The sandbags that protect the beach are visible. The width of the beach changes every day. Most of the time there was enough wet sand area for children to play and build sand castles. The resort itself was quiet, obviously not at full occupancy. Good side of it: there was always plenty of empty spaces for lounging around the pool (during our previous trips we had to get up at 7 in the morning "to reserve" a spot for the day). We loved our room and patio, especially hammock. Switching off air conditioner and opening both windows for cross ventilation was enough to remove any possible smells. Overall we had a very good time - perfect weather, warm water, quiet half-empty resort, decent food that is served almost around the clock - hopefully it will be the same next year.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT AN OCCIDENTAL RESORT!!”
Reviews.Author: beachloverSeattle
Reviews.Content: This was a trip that had been planned since last July. I was very concerned seeing previous negative reviews. Unfortunately we could not change resorts due to the fact that we were travelling with 4 other families and required 5 rooms. The idea behind this trip was to spend the holidays at resort so we could skip the hassles of Christmas and spend time with family who are spread throughout the country. The trouble started at check in and degraded from there. The reception staff-useless and rude. Thay announced to us that we had no beach and could not use the facilities at the little sliver of land that they were allowed to use (also owned by Occidental-the Royal Hideaway-again we were treated like second-hand citizens). They were very unapologetic and actually created more bad feelings with their attutudes and lies (yes, promises were not kept). I am not going to go into the day-by-day accounting of grievances, but suffice it to say that this resort needs a serious revamping. I would not recommend any resort at this time in Playa Del Carmen due to the serious erosion of the beaches if that is what you are going for. The beach that we did have access to was built up on bags that were used as breakwaters-very sad to see. Stay as far away from this resort as possible! Hopefully, they will change their website and let people know the reality of the situation at this resort; it is a 2 star at best with access to a sub-standard beach that the guests are not really welcome on. We managed to have a good time at the pool and with each other, but as my father said we could have been anywhere warm with a pool, rather than one of the most beautiful places in the world-it really is a shame. The fact that the staff is somewhat untrained and the food is not good (my mother actually got to the point where she could not find anything she could eat towards the end of our stay) with a major lack of variety really proves to me that the management has no interest in revamping this resort-just taking your money. They didn't even have a special Christmas dinner-it was VERY disappointing. The rooms were very rustic and tended to smell. The access to the upstairs rooms have very rickety railings with loose stairs. Overall, the resort is in general disrepair and needs work. So please, please, if you have plans to visit this resort in the future change your plans-you will have a much better vacation for it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst vacation I have ever had !! No kidding.”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaRiley
Reviews.Content: This resort should be Closed. The pictures of the beach are misleading. There is no beach!!!. The pool has been closed since Dec.6th not the 13th and it has been cracked and will probably not be ready for use anytime soon. The only access to the beach is a wooden stairway they built after cutting a hole in the fence. You can wade in the water but don't try to sit on the chaise lounges (owned by Occidental as well) on the south side of the resort. You will be asked to leave. No water activities and the bus that management says will pick you up every 30 min. and take you to the "public beach" in Playa del Carmen, does not come every 30min. and sometimes doesn't show up to pick you up....leaving you stranded and having to find your way back to the resort on your own. This whole experience has been a Nightmare and I would Never recommend this hotel or any other Occidental Resort to anyone ever! I am not impressed at the way we were treated...and I find the photos that they have of this resorts beach, entirely misleading.

Reviews.Title: “This resort should be closed!”
Reviews.Author: Neshamah
Reviews.Content: The pictures on this resorts website are completely misleading! False advertisement! I took my two children there December 4th and by the time I was rescued by our tour company (My hero, Alex Medina our American Express rep) and moved to another resort they had closed the ocean side pool and had put up huge pieces of plywood to keep the waves from destroying the ocean side buildings and finishing off the ocean side pool. There was absolutely no beach! They even closed off the area that you could lounge on a level above where the beach once was. We were promised several things to compensate for the lack of water sports and beach access, and management never followed through, or the compensation was inconvenient and incurred more cost (time and money) to the guests. I cannot believe that they are still accepting reservations and still have the same photos on their website! Do not waste your precious vacation time and money at this resort! Make sure any resort that you book with is north of the Playa del Carmen ferry. There are no good beaches south of the Ferry! Betty King California

Reviews.Title: “Where is the beach????”
Reviews.Author: Spartan5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro December 8th thru December 15th, 2006. There was no beach or beach access when we arrived, and our first full day, the huge waves cracked the "activities pool" and it began to drain. The hotel manager called a meeting, and said that the pool would be fixed in 48-72 hours. I would bet it will be closer to 48-72 days. So, the Allegro stepped up and offered a free shuttle service to Mamitas beach north of town. It is a beautiful beach, but the shuttle system is inconvenient, and you aren't all-inclusive when you get to Mamitas, either. You get a voucher which entitles you to 6 beverages of your choice - beer, pop, or water - any combination adding up to 6. We did the beach shuttle twice. The first time, things ran pretty smoothly, but it started to pour when we got there, so it wasn't very busy. The second time, the shuttle got lost going to Mamitas. This time it was a beautiful day, and the beach was very crowded. Our voucher system became mass chaos, and none of the Mamitas staff seemed to know what to do. So, we made the best of it. The shuttle bus was supposed to run every half hour, which seemed odd, because it takes about a half hour to get there from the Allegro. After waiting an hour and forty minutes, we gave up and payed for a taxi back to the hotel. We informed the concierge at the Allegro on the hopes of getting reimbursed for the taxi ride, but had no such luck. It wasn't about the $5.00, it was just the principle. The gardens at the Allegro are very well kept, the staff are very, very nice (hey, Remco!) for the most part, and all in all, if Mother Nature had not prevailed, I would have given a 4 out of 5 rating. I have stayed at over 10 all-inclusive resorts in Mexico, the Caribbean, and Costa Rica, and have been on one cruise. That being said, the hotel did move it up a notch when it came to the food. Every meal we ate their was fantastic. Steaks, grilled shrimp, fresh pasta made to order, roast beef, grilled pork loin, etc. Lunch and breakfast were equally as good. You would have to be pretty picky to not find something that you liked. The bars and bartenders were also very good. The drinks were not watered down at all - if you wanted a double or a triple, they were more than happy to accomodate you - thanks for the hang over Felix!!! So, if you want a beach, you won't find one at the Allegro. All of the resorts around the Allegro had little or no beach as well, due to the erosion, so keep that in mind as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very misleading”
Reviews.Author: fixer93
Reviews.Content: No beach! All photos of the resort are either prior to last years Hurricanes or of the Allegro on Cozumel. When I arrived (Sat 12/2) there was only about 20 ft of sand from the stairs (leading to the beach) to you end up in the water. On Friday the pool and the beach access was closed due to parts of the resort wall starting to fall into the ocean. When asking customer service to make arrangement to access the beach from the resort to the south (sister resort, owned by the same company) we were told no we can't help you. The customer service rep then told us that we can visit the public beach in downtown Playa ($10 round trip cab fare), but did not offer any way or compensation to get there. Rooms: The rooms sport very firm bed and have a lovely basement smell will take about 3 days to air out (or you just get immune to it?). We notice that water was leaking out of our bathroom light fixture. We called customer service twice before for maintenance showed up to look at it. Maintenance went upstairs to check it out the problem, we received no follow up and assumed it was fixed. The next morning I woke up at 5am to what I thought was rain outside. Nope, my investigation lead me back to my bathroom to find water leaking out of the ceiling light fixture faster than before (filled up a trash can in less than 1 hour). Food: The food was no more than average and was very repetitive by the third day. I will say all the wait staff and bartenders do a pretty good job of keeping you happy. Must love Cats There are several stray cats roaming the resort, these cats enjoy singing between 1am and 4am ( I met many others that enjoyed the cats). Keep your expectations low and will will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “There is no beach!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simondolby007
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I would say most on the reviews posted are accurate, but don't stay at this hotel if you are a beach lover! We stayed in early December, and the whole beach has washed away, which has also effected the foundations of the hotel, and the swimming pool is now falling into the sea! When we were there, cracks were appearing in the pool, and it had to be drained, and there was NO access to the beach (the steps had been washed away). If you like beaches, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: luvdblus
Reviews.Content: This was our second all inclusive trip to Playa Car. From the start it was a huge disappointment.They had no record or our reservation and it took them an hour to find us a room. Then another 45 minutes to get our luggage to the room. This happened to others during our stay. Second, there is NO BEACH AREA and no access to the beaches of the adjacent resorts from there.They are bussing people to town to another beach and you have to walk a few blocks to get there and there is no all inclusive food there, however they are providing 6 drinks. The rooms were small and everything worn, no dressers to put clothes in so you live off the other out of your bags.The safe did not work. No in room refrigerator. The bathroom was nasty and when you took a shower, everything got wet in the shower and toilet area. Toilet and sink did not flush and drain well. The air conditioning was either on and too cold or when it was off everything felt damp. The beds are hard as a rock, built on a concrete pedestal with and extra firm mattress on top. We complained but all they wanted to do was give us a tour of the grounds to try and sell us on the place and we know from talking to others, the rooms were all the same except for the suites. It rained everyday while we were there and the ceiling leaked (of course the rain was not there fault). We informed the people at the desk about the leaking ceiling and all we received was a nod of the head. Room Cleaners forgot to leave towels on one occasion so I went to the desk to let them know.They brought towels and then expected a tip. There were supposed to be two restaurants and one was closed. So you have your choice of Mexican, Mexican or Mexican food in the restaurant. The buffet food selection was very limited and often dry and pretty much repeated each day so don't go there hungry. The service in the buffet area was poor. If I might give one compliment it would be on the nightly shows. The performers were talented but there were only two tiny tables and several hundred plastic chairs to sit on. The floor was 1/2" deep in water in many places. All in all it was the worst place we have stayed on our many vacations. We also grew tired of the constant pushing by the staff to take time out of our day so they could give us a tour and tell us about other hotels they have. I would never recommend this place to anyone. Some people were so disappointed they checked out. We tried to, however since we booked online we could not. We are not rich or high brow people but we do expect nice rooms and good service. Since there were no beaches the only place to sit was one of the two pools. The other pool was closed down while we were there because it was about break off and drop into the ocean. So, consequently there were lots of screaming kids around the pool. Maybe we expected too much because the resort where we previously stayed was fabulous and for nearly the same cost and just down the street.Should I name it?

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but...”
Reviews.Author: boondock
Reviews.Content: We went down with a large group, including a couple of young children and had a very good time. The staff was friendly, everything was clean and well kept. However, the beds were hard (mattress w/o box spring) our room along with a few others smelled bad. We found that covering the floor drain in the bathroom helped (maybe they didn't use sewer gas traps). The food in the main cafeteria was decent but had very little variety and seemed to be the same foods everyday. The beach, I understand that they can't control the ocean but the pictures of the beaches on the website were misleading. We arrived and found only a small beach area to use with workers constantly trying to repair retaining wall. By the end of the our week what remained of the beach was gone, the retaining wall had collapsed and the main pool had cracked and had begun to drain. The resorts on either side of them didn't have these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gretchen05
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing..... My one and ONLY complaint was the hard bed. Food was great, staff was friendley, the grounds were beautiful, drinks were full of alcohol, pool was relaxing, and the ocean water was crystal clear. We are already planning next years trip. Dan and Gretchen Byron Denver, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “For the budget minded.”
Reviews.Author: CopaSis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort through a group trip planned by someone other than me. It was a 3 day trip get away. I have been to this area staying in Playa Car for the last 6 years. I have experienced the Iberostar (Tucan and Quetzal), and last visit the Bahia Principe closer to Tulum. (reviews soon to follow on those)This place is a dump next to those 2 resorts. We checked in and had to take our own luggage to our rooms. Thank goodness the resort isn't that large and I have a husband to carry my bags up the stairs for me. The room was small, which was fine...it was only 2 of us. The bathroom had a vented screen to the outside. If left open, guess where what little air conditioning you got went? So we kept the bathroom door closed all the time. (It helped keep the sulfer smell out as well) It was clean. If you want a safe, make sure you get the key at check in, it will save you a trip back to the front desk. There is a refrig in the room, they give you 2 bottles of water a day....that's it. View from the room was great and they have cute little hammocks on your patio.....which is open to anyone who walks up to your room. If you want any kind of view, spend the extra $$ to get one by the pool. Also, if you have a room on the second floor, your air cond. may not be so good. This resort is very casual. Men can wear shorts to dinner. There isn't a wait staff to tend you while sitting at the pool. Waiting in line for even a water sometimes took 5-10 minutes. Major downside. We ate at the buffet every night except for the Mexican restaurant night. About half of our party of 14 liked their food. The buffet food was not very good. They tried to make it international, but gave very little options. Desserts stunk. (If any indication of the food, 6 of our group got sick after eating the tequila banana......that's what we think did it.) The beach here is virtually non existant. I don't know if it has something to do with the tide, but when we were there....very little sand. If you are on a budget and really don't mind mediocre. Book this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, we will return!”
Reviews.Author: Chuck-06
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, we will return! All I can say is that we totally enjoyed staying at the Allegro Playacar Resort. Everyone has the right to their own opinion; if there was something really wrong with my accommodations I would ask to have it corrected or have them change my room. We found nothing to complain about. Sure, you can find something wrong at any place you go to. And believe me we don’t have low standards. I worked in the hotel industry for many years when I was younger and I don’t have any association with this chain. My wife and I have a positive attitude and always look to have a good time (go with the flow). However at times she says I am very picky in restaurants and hotels. Having experience in the industry I expect good service and a smile at all times. This is what we experienced for the week at the Allegro Playacar. The service was great and the employees had a big smile at all times. I’m sure the guest service training for employees is intensive and it shows. All that being said, “You do get what you pay for”. We didn’t pay for steak & lobster so I wasn’t disappointed. What you do get is a really nice resort set in tropical gardens, great location right on the beach, good food & drinks and a lot of fun things to do for all age groups if you want to do them. WATER: There is an activities pool and a quiet pool. There’s a team of people arranging activities by the pool all day; they are a lot of fun if you want to get involved. Too many activities and fun contests to mention. The beach area is small (due to Wilma) but there are both shade and sunny places to lounge at the beach. Plenty of lounge chairs around both pools. Non-motorized water sports are included. We reserved a kayak for an hour and a small catamaran sailboat for an hour another day n/p. You can rent Jet-Skis, $50 usd for a half hour, $85 usd for an hour. ROOMS: All rooms are the same size (not huge but not too small either), set in small thatched roof buildings of eight each. The buildings are not in a straight row (that’s good), they are set in little clusters with walkways through grassy and tropical settings (nice feeling). We had an upper room that we liked very much. Yes you know there is a thatched roof above you but we didn’t find it offensive at all. We tipped the housekeeper $2 usd each day. Always got towel art and sometimes fresh flowers were in the towel art (nice touch). Left a note for four bottles of water and got it each day. Also called the front desk for four extra pillows and they were delivered to our room in five minutes. The bed was very firm, however we both slept great. My wife said it was good because if I got up at night I didn’t disturb her. We even said we might think of getting a similar bed at home. FOOD: The food at the buffet was good and somewhat varied each day. Like I said we didn’t pay for steak & lobster. Breakfast; after being seated we were asked if we want coffee and/or juice and were served that. When you get up to get another plate of food the old plate was always taken from the table quickly. Fresh and different pastry was baked each day (too good). Continental breakfast started at 6 am and full American breakfast started at 7 am. We tipped between $1 to $2 usd each day. Lunch; we ate by the pool each day. There was a full hot and cold buffet set up at the snack bar hut area (varied choices each day) also dessert. The pizza bar is about 25 feet away. The pizza was OK but the Mozzarella Bread is very good. Also the BBQ grill on the other side of the pool cooked good hamburgers & hot dogs and had great french fries. Dinner; there are two a la carte restaurants at night served in the snack bar hut. A Mexican and Italian, you will need to make a reservation in the lobby for each. If you want to go to either again they will put you on a secondary list if there is an opening. The Mexican is a little better of the two, tipped $5 usd. The main buffet at night is good but a week of buffets was enough for us. There is a very nice wood and brass bar up near the buffet we went there sometimes for a before dinner cocktail and also an after dinner drink. You are also served drinks & wine at your dinner table. We tipped between $2 and $4 usd each day for dinner buffet. BARS; there plenty of bars set up all around the property. Service was always good and quick. For the pool we brought big insulated mugs from home. The bartender quickly fill them with any drink of our choice to any strength of alcohol we desired. Tipped the bartender $1 usd for each round, he always served us quickly. Theater and Disco were good. The shows were enjoyable went three times and the Disco was fun also. Playacar is a very nice area. There is a very nice shopping area less then two blocks away. We walked there a few times to make phone calls on a TelMex phone and also to shop. We rented a car for the week at the airport because we had many activities planned, all worked out well. We really enjoyed our whole vacation. Chuck

Reviews.Title: “stinky room, awful bed”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPT
Reviews.Content: We won a trip to this hotel, so we were unable to compare it to the other hotels in the area before booking this hotel. I totally agree with the others on this site on the overwelming mildew smell and the hard bed on a concrete slab. But I must also add that the food was not great and there was hardly any beach. I guess this place must be very popular with Europeans, since they all seemed quite satisfied, but I just don't think this place holds up to the standard that most Americans are looking for in a beach resort. Bottom line, I was dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review and Some Tips”
Reviews.Author: beany123
Reviews.Content: Booked two weeks for £800 each from the UK. Here are a few things about the resort and the Allegro hotel which I hope you find helpful before you go (if you decide to, after reading this): The hotel itself is in very pretty grounds, which are maintained daily. Lots of plants and grass gives the resort a jungle-ish feel and this is further emphasised by the thatched Polenysian style villas. The hotel staff are constantly cleaning and maintaining the grounds so the standard of cleanliness was very high. The rooms are quite small. Ground floor rooms more so as they have a low celing. Upper floor rooms have the exposed thatched roof so seem larger, however, there is very little space as it is almost all bed. The beds are actually concrete slabs and are very hard as there is not give under the mattress. Shower room is also small and is a semi- wet room; it can become very slippery. Air con is OK but the noise it makes is quite loud, although there is also a roof fan. Food was fine but the main restaurant where breakfast, lunch and dinner is served isn't air conditioned. It can get very hot near the steam trays. There are two air-conditioned sections off of the main dining area. TIP - restaurant staff don't seat you there by default, so it seems exclusive, but will seat you there if asked. The buffet itself - breakfast was excellent with continental, English and other options including fruit, omlette and loads more, Lunch was more like a proper restaurant with a menu and table service. Dinner was varied each night; oriental, Spanish, Carribean, Italian, French, Mexican etc. Quite nice but cheap ingredients; don't expect steak or juicy prwans etc. "A la Carte" restarants were disappointing. There is actually only one, which alternates between Italian and Mexican. The Italian is sometimes set up outside by the pool, which is romantic on nice evenings. The Italian food was disappointing; crepes for starters and desert and only four main courses. The Lasagne was a mass of Mozerella. The mexican was much better and food very good and totally authentic; grilled cactus in your Fajitas..... rounded off with Tequila and nice service. Other food includes a Pizza bar by the pool which continually serves nice thin-crust pizza, a grill bar for burgers and hot dogs, a nacho bar with dips and cheese, a pool-side buffet and a midnight snack bar serving burgers and Nachos by the bar. There are two pools, one by the beach which is the focus of all daytime activities and one quiter pool; be aware of people reserving parasols. We found people would reserve a parasol and then move to the beach, where they would also reserve parasols. Both pools were kept pretty clean. There is a spa but it's reserved for timeshare owners. Dont' be fooled by photos of the beach in brochures. The beach is only 20 yards or so deep and most of it has gone. The sea now reaches the main pool and has exposed it's foundations. The sea can come in so far that the beach is completley covered. What is left is clean but it's a public beach; expect tat sellers and other traders. Entertainment is quite cheesy. Daytime Bingo and volleyball are routine, although there are Spanish lessons which are pretty useful. Night-time entertainment is dire. Bring something to do. There is one "show" between 9:30-10:30 which is normally a few dance routines with the odd magic trick. They are very good but it gets a bit boring after two weeks! Drinks are ok but limited. Corona is the only and the usual all-inlcusive cocktails such as pina colada and daquiri. There are some nice Tequilas though and it is worth asking for cocktails to be made with branded spirits i.e Smirnoff vodka instead of the horrible generic stuff. There is no mini-bar in the room and only a couple have fridges. A tip here and there is recommended; room cleaners leave more towels, more bottled water and make cute towel animals if you tip (one dollar or 10 pesos every couple of days). There is no waiter service so tipping bar staff helps speed your drinks along :-) One big watch out - the staff are CONSTANTLY trying to sell timeshare, from the moment you arrive. We eventually ignored them and they got the message. Another tip - don't pack any towels. There are plenty in the room and you get beach towels that you can swap for fresh ones when you want. Overall we had a great holiday; the area is lovely; Playacar is very safe and Cancun is only an hour away. There are loads of excursions and the people are great. Be aware of people trying to sell stuff; they can be very high pressure. Recommended for a Carribean holiday on a budget but if you are looking for a comfortable room, evening entertainment and more luxury, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: mich22rob
Reviews.Content: WHERE DO I START THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!! I WON THIS HOLIDAY THROUGH WORK AND I CANT WAIT TO GO BACK JUST A SHAME I WILL HAVE TO PAY THIS TIME!! THE ROOMS they feel so like the caribbean as soon as you go in, they are decorated in a bright yellow and orange walls makes you feel awake!!! the beds i found very comfy but then again they were a little hard but i had a great sleep every night of my stay!!! The bathroom was fine bath quiet big and plenty of room you have a glass screen for ur shower which is fine, just becarefukl getting out of shower as if floor gets wet it can be quiet slippy, but thats jjst plain coomen sense! THE RESTAURANT Plenty of choice at all times of the day, the breakfast you have toast, full english if you want, cereal, yougurts, continental, omlettes, and of course the strange things like vegatables and a few things u would usually see at ur evening meal!! i read on here somewhere that the sausages tasted like mcdonalds and OMG they were soooo right, they were wellll nice. dinner time yu could either eat in the main buffet restaurant or there is a buffet snack bar down by the pool which i found very very nice. also you have the pizzeria by the pool aswell, this just made things easier u never had to to and get changed to eat u could stay in your swim wear, and stay in the sun for longer!!!! THE POOLS There are 2 pools here, you have the relaxing pool, which is huge what i liked about this pool is that the steps to get in the pool were massive aswell, so u could just lie on the top steps all day to keep you cool and sunbathe at the same time which was great!!! i think alot of people got the same idea as me here though as it is so hot here!! There is also the activities pool which i realy enjoyed as there is always something going onlike water volley ball, aqua aerobics, step arobics stretching, spanish lessons, so even if you didnt want to get involved yourself you find yourself enjoying watching other people taking part. i especially enjoyed watching the reps do this dance after the aqua aerobics infront of the activities centre. anyone who has seen this will know what i mean!! lol THE BEACH What can i say about this it was paradise, white sands clear blue waters was just heaven. Water sports going on all day, there are a few included but for the motorised watersports you just ned to go to the barracuda centre which is by the pool area. THE HOTEL ITSELF very well maintained, always being cleaned constanty. the staff here are soooo friendley, they really cannot do enough for you, they become your friends during your stay and are genuinly sad when you leave, Dont be suprised to see the a few iguanas walking around on the grass, they are wild but are completly harmless they are more scared of you. u will see hundreds of tiny lizards but again these are harmless, was quite worried when i first seen them but after a few days i staarted toi think they were quiet cute as some of them are no bigger than your little finger!! room was cleaned daily with fresh towels each day and also everyday there was a different towel design on our bed. DRINKS my boyfriend only drinks beer and they had Corona on draft which he lived on all week, i made my way through the cocktail menu as they have so many to choose from, i can higly recomend the miami vice which was a a strawberry daikarey mixed with a pina colada (excuse my spellin) and again they have all you spirits also. i think i have covered everything here i will defo be returning here soon it was just amazing, i wasnt expecting it to be this nice and it was just heaven, so what ever else you read ignore any bad reviews as the people who wrote them must be deluded or just generally very picky. i hope this helps, if u wanna ask me nethin, drop me an email michelle1roberts@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: paus
Reviews.Content: I am from chile and loved all in playa del carmen.. its beautiful. In the hotel everithing was perfect , we haved a great time!! If you want to ask me something this is my email: paulascarzella@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Shame about the Kuoni rep Gail Stevens!!”
Reviews.Author: chenzi
Reviews.Content: You wont be dissappointed with this hotel and the staff must all be on drugs because theyre all so very very friendly and always keen to help you. My tip is to not take a towel - they are changed daily in your room and when you check in you are given a card which you exchange for a beach towel every day! for free! but beware If you have booked with Kuoni please please please try not to deal with their rep - shes crap - she books you on the wrong excursions, doesnt apologise. Doesnt tell you what to expect on the excursions so while everyone else has plenty of water, money and a wet suit - you're there looking like an idiot! because she didnt tell you anything! Oh and if you dont go to herwelcome meeting after 36hours of travelling - on your head be it - its just a marketing scam and she hates it when you dont turn up. Really though - great place, great holiday - but the rep needs to either get fired or get trained - either way.... the Kuoni rep Gail Stevens is lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Best two weeks of our life!”
Reviews.Author: missixty
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to go the Iberostar Costa Dorada in the Domican Republic but three weeks before we were advised to cancel due to beach renovation, we were of course gutted at the time but it came as a huge blessing in disguise as we chose this as our alternative holiday and it was the best place we could have ever gone! THE HOTEL AND GROUNDS From the minute we stepped into the lobby and could see the beginning of the grounds we were amazed. The gardens look beautiful and are well kept and maintained. The polynesian houses are brilliant, I would rather stay in one of these any day than a high rise hotel. The whole place just looked ideal, so much nicer than you're regular hotel. ROOMS We had a room as close to sea view as you can get without having a timeshare. It was really peaceful and it was as if the whole place was there just for you, you couldn't even hear anyone else. We had a ground floor room and it was lovely, can't fault it. Not sure what people have complained about the beds for, didn't find them hard or uncomfortable in the slightest. The bed was also huge, me and my partner seemed to end up sleeping a mile away from each other we had that much space! The shower was fine too, people complaining about the shower spraying obviously don't have any real problems, the floor got a little bit wet, I mean a little bit wet, and if it hadn't been mentioned before it wouldn't be anything I'd even mention as it was not an issue at all. It had a walk in wardrobe with plenty of room for mine and my boyfriends clothes etc. The downpoint to the room was that there was only one plug socket. For all you ladies, my hair straighteners heated up fine so no worry bout that. However our psp and ipod wouldn't charge I don't know if that is to do with the voltage? My camera battery charged fine as did our mobile phones. The maids cleaned every day and left fresh towels. Our maid was a little too eager and even if we left the do not disturb sign up he would come banging waking us up early in the morning and if we ignored him he would come back ten mins later doing it again until we answered the door....when my boyfriend opened the door and tried to tell him we were sleeping and could he come back tomorrow he just stood there smiling going "Si si!" and smiling waiting to come in and clean, in the end we had to get up and let him clean...this was a tad annoying but not a major issue. Also we only had one swan made out of a towel the whole holiday but we saw in someone elses room he had done two swans, rose petals etc etc. Tipping didn't seem to help in the swan matter either! Again not a big issue though lol......Also someone wrote in their review something like "imagine my horror when there was no news channel in my bedroom, how could i possibly enjoy my holiday" or words to that effect - um this wouldn't ruin my holiday at all HOWEVER there is news channels on the TV (just to put your minds at rest!)... POOLS There are two pools, the activity pool and the relaxation pool. The activity pool was fun to be around, it had music playing most of the day, everything from UB40 to Pussycat Dolls....there was water volleyball/polo/tequila darts/beer drinking competition/kayak racing etc etc....you can get as involved or as uninvolved as you like....This is also where the swim up bar was which was lovely. You can stay in the pool till 11pm if you like so you can stay in and drink all night if you wish. It doesn't get cool even at evening so you wouldn't be cold. This is the pool that goes right out to the sea and the view is spectacular. It's great having the sea right there when you're swimming or sunbathing. The other pool was quiet and a decent size, this was great for the days you just wanted to relax. BEACH Now I don't know where the rumours of no beach has come from, maybe at one point thats how it was but certainly not now. The beach is a great size and has enough sunbeds for all without it ever seeming over crowded. The sand is white and soft and the sea is turquoise. No seawead or grotty bits just clear blue water....It's paradise...There are sunbeds under thatched parasols and ones in the sun. Also inbetween the hotel and the beach is another layer of sunbeds on a raised level with sand flooring and hoods (think pram hoods) over them to give shade to your head and shoulders...we found these a godsend after getting burnt! There is also watersports available from the beach including Jet Skis. The Jet Skis are i think about £15 for 30 mins which is quite good value. We were told its impossible to fall off them unless you do something really extreme because of the way they're designed. We however managed to fall off :-S We were fine but lost our sunglasses! Make sure you wear the wrist strap however as this stops the jet ski if you fall off. THE DRINKS The cocktails were great, sometimes strong, sometimes not so. The beer they served was Corona on draft. My boyfriend liked this but was convinced it was watered down and he couldn't get drunk on it. They had a huge selection of spirits including some brands like Bacardi, Smirnoff etc. The big let down was the soft drinks...they were branded (Pepsi) but were all completlely flat and horrible throughout the hol....the pineapple and orange juice were nice though. THE FOOD The food in the buffet resteraunt was good. They had plenty of selection, most nights me and my boyfriend would end up with completely different things from each other as there was so much selection. One word of warning though - aviod the chicken - it's very pink and very bloody everytime it was there. I never ate the chicken but however I have been very ill since I got home, I can't say whether it's been food poisoning or a virus but just be careful you choose food that is well cooked. Everything other than the chicken seemed fine. There was a great selection of food and it was all gorgeous. The breakfasts were great too and the sausage and hash browns were very like Mc Donalds which I thinks great. There was also things like waffles/pancakes for breakfast and fruit or cereal. Also I think they had smoothies and omlettes. They also had some strange things like lasagne out at breakfast, and cauliflower and carrot. People seemed to be eating them too! The food at the pool bar was mainly poor but they did have a nice potatoe salad there one day and some nice meatballs. The potatoes were usually cooked well too which is something I'm very picky about. They also had a nachos thing with cheese sauce, gaucamole, salsa etc at the pool bar which was nice. The pizza place was fine, nothing special nothing bad. The Mexican resteraunt was lovely but we loved the food at the buffet so much that we only visited the resteraunt once. LOCATION Playacar is gorgeous, it feels very safe and posh and for the first few days it was hard to believe there was a world outside of it. It only costs about £2.50 maximum to get into Playa Del Carmen by taxi which are always about outside the hotel so this is very easy. Playa Del Carmen is nice, posher than most tourist places I've been but with all the usual touristy tat....Nothing much worth buying, we bought ourselves some photo frames. NIGHTLIFE The 'club' at the hotel had loud music playing but was dead at all times, however the one pool table was always occupied. In Playa Del Carmen the best place to go was The Blue Parrot. It had one dancefloor inside that consisted of sand this played proper dancy type music. You could also dance on the speakers here. The seats at the bar were swings which seems to be the local gimik. We still loved it though. Outside, on the beach was a wooden dance floor and here they played mainly RnB and Hip Hop which I loved and although my boyfriend isn't a fan of that sort of music we managed to have one of the best nights of our life here. The drinks are stronger than the hotel and the beer you can get is Corona or Sol. A round consisting of a beer and cocktail came to around $5. Brilliant place to go highly recommended. There is also a Senor Frogs which is fine but not lively like the one in Cancun. Deseo is the place with the beds on the rooftop and it was a great place to start off the evening, really classy and chilled out. For amazing nightlife head for Cancun, a taxi will cost about £25 each way but you can get transportation via trips like the Disco Rolling Tour, or the Coco Bongos tour etc. We visted Cancun twice, once on the Disco Rolling Tour and once on the Coco Bongos one. The disco rolling tour was well organized with a guide who is very friendly and fun who looks after you all night and gets all your drinks for you. He supplied us with plenty he was never far away. You visit Congos which is supposedly a bar but it's very crazy and a lot of fun, then Senor Frogs which is slightly madder and then Coco Bongos which is the peak of the night. You spend 1 hour in Congos and then 2 hours in each of the other two places. The trip to Coco Bongos on it's own was brilliant. We had someone pick only us up, no other people, take us into Coco Bongos and then return to pick just us up all for £30 each. This was with drinks included all night. Coco Bongos is the most amazing experience you should check out the website it's really a must do on your holiday. We loved Cancun night life so much we will return there next year for our whole holiday. It is very much a young crazy place though. EXCURSIONS We did the two trips menitoned above. We also did a pirate ship tour which was probably the worst trip we booked but was still ok. The show was very funny, the pirates are great and really had us laughing. The letdown being you had a pirate assigned to however many people to bring you your free drinks, other pirates got there people loads but we got two drinks and then didn't see our pirate again and it was impossible to get drunk. There was a bit too much forced interaction, trying to dance with absolutely no space and being forced to get up and pull people you didn't know up onto the floor and rub noses with them etc.....ok if you like that sort of thing but even if you don't you HAVE to join in. Bear in mind you may well be sober too! The thing that topped it off for my boyfriend was a forced game of someone coming round collecting everyones shoes, so they took our shoes and then we were forced to go and eat while the game was still going on and we had to walk around bare foot. My boyfriend finally got his brand new trainers back completely soaked in beer so the evening went downhill for us from here. Also you are on a boat so you are completely trapped there for the duration whether you enjoy it or not. Onto a good trip was the Dolphin Swim. We did this at Dolphin Discovery which is about 15 mins from the hotel. It's around £80 each for the Royal Swim which is the best package. You have around an hour in the pool with the dolphins, you get to do a dolphin kiss, touch the dolphins, hold the dolphin like a baby, swim out and put your arms out and the dolphins come behind you and you hold there fins and they pull you along. You then do another one where you lie flat and the dolphins come behind you and push there noses into your feet so you fly out of the water. It's very fast and exciting and brilliant experience. They take lots of photos which you can purchase for around £7 each. We purchased just the one. The DVD is a brilliant memory and is a bit steep at £25 for a 5 min or so dvd but its well worth it to capture that memory. Downside of trip you dont get picked up till about two hours after you've finished your swim, I presume to try to make you spend money at the bars/resteraunts... Another great trip we did was XelHa. I never thought I'd fancy it before we went but it turned out to be one of the best trips we did. It's a full day trip and I think it cost about £40 all inclusive each. You get to snorkel in a huge lagoon (its very cold so be warned!), free hire of snorkel, flippers, rubber rings (double or single) etc... You can jump from the cliff of courage (we did this) and I have to say its not really that high. It's about 4m. It hurt me a bit when I landed but only momentarily and I was glad I did it. If you do this trip I'd recomend buyin a waterproof camera to capture the day. We did this but have yet to have it developed. It was about £13 but you couldn't take your normal camera around with you as you're in and out of water so much. There is a cycling bit which we did just to get somewhere quicker but it was suprisingly fun. The bikes had no breaks which made it slightly more scary and fun they really went fast! There was also a hammock area for relaxing which was as close to paradise as you can get. We booked only one trip through our tour operator and the rest through Gray Line. If you turn out of your hotel and go left there is a small shopping area in Playacar, they had a stand outside here and were brilliant and 100% reliable. On a downside, we booked to go Coco Bongos through a tour place in Playa Del Carmen. We paid $14 deposit and the tour never turned up. We were not so much annoyed about the money it's only £7 but that it wasted a night we'd been looking forward too. This tour company was on the left hand side as you walk down and was a tiny little place, just near a tree with a seat around it. Avoid at all costs. When we went down to complain it was shut but if it's open again do not go here. I don't know if I've included everything! No doubt I've missed something but the top and bottom of it is go!! Ignore the bad reviews, some people must be impossible to please, this is the nicest place in the world! You will love every minute!! Any more information please contact me at lucynickson@gmail.com Having probs uploading photos, if anyone wants any sending just ask!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family holiday”
Reviews.Author: giffyboy
Reviews.Content: We left London Gatwick on 13th aug whilst the security alert was in full swing so after a 91/2 hour delay at the airport we finally arrived at the Hotel 27 hours after leaving our house Should have arrived at the Hotel at around 3pm but 11pm we finally arrived. Quick and friendly check-in. Much needed drink at the bar then off to bed. The next morning the 27 hours travelling was soon forgotten once we saw the view from our balcony. Our room 5612 most of had one of the best views. Our 9 year old twins had the time of their lives swimming every morning both in the swimming pool and in the beautiful sea. Yes the beach has been eroded (Thats natural when hurricans hit) but compared to the other hotels nearby this beach felt homely compared to the rows and rows of sun beds in front of the other hotels. The grounds of the Allegro are so green and plentyful we felt like we had arrived in the Garden of Eden. Food and Drinks we great. Especailly when travelling with a very fussy eater. Yes this is not 5 star but l would'nt want 5 star with 9 year twins. It was more importmant that they felt at home, is they did (Crying when we had to leave after 14 days. Went of some very special trips whilst we were their including Swimming with dolphins at Xel-Ha. We did the All inclusive option their which is the only way to do it. Horseback riding was fantastic as well as a Trip Xcaret in the afternoon to see to Mexican Show. But we wish we had done the whole day their as well We are now planning our next trip back their hopefully next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at Playa”
Reviews.Author: Morena75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six day stay at the Allegro Playacar. Overall the vacation was nice. Playa del Carmen is a beautiful place with great beaches and many other forms of entertaining (snorkling, sight seeing, eating and partying). What follows is a brief breakdown of the hotel and playa del Carmen The Good: The hotel staff was great; everybody always had a smile and were quick to please. We have absolutely no complaints regarding service. The hotel is cute and is always very clean. There are two pools, so people have the option to lounge at one or participate in activities in another. The sea is simply beautiful with shades of aqua and deep blue. The Mexican restaurant is very good, but you need reservations. The town of Playa is great is more upscale than cancun, so don't be surprise if you run into a star or just some really gorgeous people. The Bad: The food was not really that great. We have stayed at other Allegro/Occidental resorts in the past and the food has been much better. We found that the best meal of the day was breakfast. The Italian restaurant is just some tables and chairs by one of the pools; no reservations required, but there is always a wait. There is no public transportation in this part of town, so if you want to go to Playa you have to take a taxi($5 flat rate each way) If you are very athletic, you can walk into town. The despicable: The guest. These people were so rude, it actually made us uncomfortable. We were told by the hotel staff that many of the guest that were staying there at this time of the year are Europeans, particularly Spaniards. I am of Spanish descent and I had never had to deal with such an unfriendly bunch. No good morning, thank you, sorry, excuse me, nothing!!!! It got very tense after a while. Neutral: Yes, the beds are firm, but I slept like a baby. Yes, the beach is narrow, but there are plenty of chairs and shady areas. the beach was eroded due to the huracanes last year. The rooms are small...very small. The showers do not have curtains, a design oops, but some towels on the floor resolved the water problem. The first room we were in had some condensation and musty smell, we asked to be transferred and the next day were in a new room. Most of the rooms do not have ocean view; ask for rooms in the 50's and you will be closer to the beach and might get partial ocean view. Hope all this information is helpful and hope you have a great time at Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: angel1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro in May '06, and I was very disappointed in the room, as the tile floors just didn't feel clean, and my AC could not be adjusted, so it was either off or freezing us out of the room. When it was off, the room was so full of condensation that the floor was wet and my passport curled up as if I'd thrown in in the ocean. The ambience was nice and the staff was friendly. There were lots of activities in which to participate. The food and entertainment left much to be desired. I would stay somewhere else if I return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: olpas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this resort from July 30th until August 6th and it was perfect , food was very tasty especially mexican restaurant and the italian one near the pool was very pleasant. The buffet was good too but a little bit less good after 4 days but still acceptable just less tasty. Breakfast was impressive with tons of foods hot and cold , never be stressed by the water drink, all is done with purified water and I never been ill for that just use bottle of water for brushing tooth. Kids were very happy of the entertainment of the night they have one hour for them to dance on the satge and participate to a game each day. Polls are very clean, and all is well organized . Only one thing is boring the first day of your stay, some people from the Occidentasl resort seller are there to try to sell you some time sharing so they ask you if you want an invitation and present you the resort never accept that , you will lose 90 precious minutes of your vacation time !! That's for us the only negative fact in our saty there . Beach was great , it was windy so the sea was not very clear but kids loved it . If you need further information you can write me at : olpas@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Mystery
Reviews.Content: when i came on this website before i went to the allegro i was petrified by some of the reviews. however when i got to the occitetal i wasnt disapointed. The food was good but it got boring after the 1st week. The mexican was alright but the italian was very nice. The staff are very friendly especially the entertainment staff who are very social. I advise giving the bartenders a tip as they will remember who you are. The rooms were alrite but my friends room smelt musty and my mum had a lizard in her room one night coming through the thatchedn roof. I stayed on the ground floor which i would of prefered to the thatched roofs on the upstairs rooms. The beach was nice for the 1st week but sea weed came to it on the 2nd week and it wasnt nice. Playa Del Carmen is a nice little town aswell.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gtrbt0101
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Beach was great , food was good along as you ate at the main buffet rest.. The only drawback is kids, there everywhere and no parental control. Largely Spanish tourist crowd which was fine. If your a big partier then this is not the place, pool bar crowded always and usually loaded with kids ordering drinks instead of using drink machine. Rooms are small but okay, a little noisy. Overall a nice resort with a nice beach and you can walk for miles on it.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of Fun”
Reviews.Author: laliloo
Reviews.Content: This resort was no more or less than I expected. I went with my family; Mom, Dad, Me, Sister. All of the posts are mostly true but if you are an easy going person you will enjoy yourself. The people and service were great! They loved to make conversation, help, and entertain. A few of the waiters never stopped making us laugh with their Mexican laughs, howls, and asking you if you wanted tequila in every drink you ordered. We did not think the beds were hard or uncomfortable but the lack of a shower curtain took some practice! Tipping the maids, bartenders, waiters, and drivers is a good idea, they really appreciate it and they remember who tips! Although the beach is small, it is nice, plus you have the 2 pools. There are water sports, suh as sailing, kyaking, windsurfing, jet skiing, parasailing, snorkeling, scuba diving and a few more. The sailing, Kyaking, and windsurfing are free but lessons and the others are not. I reccomend going to xel-ha. It is beautiful and reasonable- $95 per person- all inclusive- snorkling equipment, locker, towel, food, drinks, Bikes, yours, cliff jumping, rope swing, etc. It's a must see. Also right down the road is a shopping mall where ou can buy clothes, jewelery, handmade goods, cigars. Also around 9:00 people come to the resort who paint pictures, and sell most of what I mentioned. My father and I went fishing and caught a big barracuda (54") and some snapper, they kind of pushed us over by not going back to where we caught the big fish but it was fun. The food was very good but if you eat at the buffet every day it gets old. And finally, The shows at 9:30 are entertaining and hilarious. This is a fun resort but don't hope for fancy, just fun and nice.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: lady_of_leisure_10
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a romantic getaway, this is NOT the place to go. Our room was very uncomfortable - hard bed, thatched roof where you could hear everything from your neighbors in the next room to people walking outside to the birds waking you up every morning. Bathroom was a bit scary - broken toilet seat cover, shower and toilet did not seem clean. Food was bland and drinks were weak. Nightly entertainment and the resort's "bar/disco" was cheesy - go into downtown if you're really looking for fun! Staff was friendly but watch out for those sitting just outside the lobby as you're heading to your room. They are trying to sell you some time share! One guy bugged us EVERY SINGLE day. The pools were ok. The beach was small but nice. Overall, this place is OK but definitely not the place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Rooms...never again”
Reviews.Author: rosstennis
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. The rooms were very small. The air conditioner broke. The toilet smelled like a sewer and kept stopping up. The room fan was very noisy. The remote control for the TV didnt work. The beds were very hard, like sleeping on the floor. The dining room was not air conditioned or it didnt work. We had to sweat while we were trying to eat a meal. Very disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Allegro is O.K.”
Reviews.Author: backtracker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro from July 17th-July 24th. Positives: The majority of the staff were nice. The activities staff are wonderful, they should be given a raise. The nightly show with the dancers was Fantastic with a different theme every night, very talented dancers. Two nights there were no dancers (Thursday and Sunday) and they did a Mr. and Ms. Allegro night instead with audience participation. These would be two nights to miss the show and head into town or do something else. The maids did what you asked when you left them a note and a tip such as extra water bottles. The grounds were beautiful. The water was beautiful. Beach was small but adequate. Plenty of chairs at beach and pools...Safe worked great, never had anything stolen. There was a restaurant/hotel in Playa on 5th avenue by the name of Don Emilone that had great fajitas and reasonable prices/good service, great iced tea. At the resort, fresh fruit and breakfasts were good. Mexican restaurant o.k. Acitivites by the pool were lots of fun. They offered water aerobics and regular aerobics every day we were there, and for a full 45 minutes...I recommend this. Lots of water volleyball. There was a line at times at the pool bar, but it went very fast, maybe you had to wait 2 minutes max? Snorkel trip for $33. per person from the resort called Barracuda was good. Husband and two kids did Parasailing on the beach for $120 for all 3. Swimming with Dolphins was great at Xcaret, for one full hour. We booked this online in advance because they book up, don't count on doing it if you wait until you go to the park. They do have a 20 minute dolphin program if you sign up that day, but the people didn't get near the interaction with the dolphins. also, if you sign up online with Xcaret, the dolphin program costs $102, vs. $125 if you wait until you are there to sign up. There is a snorkeling inlet at Xcaret that was good, lots of fish. BUT, if you are really interested in just Snorkeling, go to Xel Ha instead, snorkeling is MUCH better there, we went 3 years ago. The plaza that is a 3 minute (not 5) walk to the left of the Allegro entrance was nice, but RX there was overpriced. I found the best prices on pottery there at a shop where everything is ALREADY priced. If you try and buy stuff in Playa, nothing is priced and you usually don't get good deals unless you know what something should sell for... I walked to Playa one day for excercise and it was a nice, hot, safe walk. You walk into Playa on 10th avenue. On the way, there were two very interesting stops at some Maya Ruins. These ruins are everywhere, and if you are into history, you will like this. I price drugs at several local RX's and found the best prices at the first RX you come to when walking into Playa, it's on the right side, next to some other stores, up about 5 steps. Stock up on antibiotics while you are there... Negatives: We were given the room farthest from the beach possible, next to the front entrance to resort where we heard several drunks over a period of a week's time coming to their rooms at all hours, waking us up. After the first night, they did offer us another room closer to the beach, but it was on the second floor, which we couldn't due because of physical limitations of a family member. So, in all honesty, they did try to relocate us, but we had to stay put. Also, on the last day, we spoke to a couple who got an oceanfront room because they payed an extra $20 a day more, they negotiated upon check-in when they arrived. The drinks were VERY weak, however, when we asked for a margarita made with Juervo Gold, they gave it to us with a smile and it was strong... The food was just o.k., we didn't care for the nightly buffet at all, but honestly, there was so much food, you could always find something that you liked. The ice cream was good for dessert, all other deserts will disappoint you, they are soggy creations ordered in from the outside I believe...in honesty, I think Americans are accostomed to really sweet desserts, in Mexico they are not very sweet... We never received clean washcloths, had to call for those and toilet paper twice, but they were really quick in responding to our needs... The last day at checkout was a total turn off for me. The front desk clerk said I owed $1 (one dollar) for an internet charge. I had used the internet twice and paid cash both times...I told her I paid this, and she told me I had to produce my receipt or pay again. I told her I didn't keep $1. receipts but from a principle standpoint, I refused to pay the $1. again and asked for manager. I was just so amazed they would argue about a $1. She actually called a manager over a $1.!!!! When he appeared, he looked at the clerk as if she were crazy and told her to credit my bill...So, I guess you should keep all receipts relating to the hotel in case they try and charge you again. Espcially if you spend a lot of time on the internet and have a large bill... We have stayed at a 5 and 1/2 star resort in the area before (Bahia Principie) and I can tell you there is a big difference in that and the Allegro, but I will have to say that the entertainment and pool activities exceeded the Bahia's, but those two things were it, with the rooms/food/service at the Bahia being much better. BUT, you truly get what you pay for... Take care, have a great time if you are going to the Allegro!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, great value, AAAA++++”
Reviews.Author: Beachbum4ever
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 20-24 and had an awesome vacation! Don't listen to those complaining, this is a great value for the price. If you want 1st class/5-star then pay for it and stay somewhere else, that's all. Here are some positives: caring, friendly staff throughout, fun activities if you want, free snorkle equipment, Hobie catamarans, nice, clean rooms in good repair, manicured lawns and gardens, no elevators, short walk to everything, good security, no rules, no loud rednecks, great nightly shows in theater, Kids Club, great pools, convenient to Playa del Carmen's 5th Ave shopping area. Yes, the beds are hard but we slept like babies everynight (no, we weren't drunk, either!) Beach is smaller than in the resort"s web pics but you can walk as far as you want in either direction, water was perfect temp, too. Allegro has two pools divided by the bar and buffet building. One pool has music and activities guided by the staff (Hey Adan!) and the other is the relaxation pool. Food was great and plentiful but after 5 days you will probably be ready for your native food again. Dining room looks like it is a 4 star resort. Note: don't be cheap, tip a little money to the service staff. The maids, bartenders, wait staff work hard for you and a little tip will get you prompt service and extra bottled waters and towels in the rooms. We received fresh flowers on our pillows everyday which was very special. The resort is located in a gated area of 24 other resorts and vacation homes and is very secure. We took our nine year old daughter and felt very comfortable leaving her with the Kids Club or roaming around the pool area on her own. Our daughter met other kids from around the world, made friends and had a blast. We met several families with kids and we would all watch each others children if the parents wanted to go off to do something. The nightly show begins with the Kid's Club staff, Janet and Sadie' leading the kids in danced onstage in the theater. There is some European sunbathing (that means "topless" for you country bumpkins) but it was mostly on the beach and only a few by the pool. If bare boobies offend you, then look away, I guess. This resort is for families and kids so I you want beer-bonging and Girls Gone Wild then check out Cancun hotels. For a great dining experience in town, try "Aqua". Very nice. If you desrie something very local to do, then try going to a Luche Libre wrestling show (see "Nacho Libre" in theaters now) in Playa del Carmen. They hold it every Sunday evening at 7:30 in the public basketball court only a block from the main drag where they convert it into a mini arena. It is the craziest show with the crowd consisting of drunk Mexican guys, families still dressed from church, little kids selling cold drinks and of course, the Luchedores, who dress in the wild masks and outfits. $5 bucks a person. Leave the area as soon as the show is over because the park area is not the safest at night in spite of it being next to the Police Station. Overall, we highly recommend this resort for it's great service, food, location and value and can't wait to return. Don't listen to those complainers on other posts!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jmwill22
Reviews.Content: The stay at this resort was my least favorite out of 4 previous visits to the area. The rooms were falling apart and the repairs were very noticeable. The beds were so hard, my 8 and 10 year old were complaining. The food was average at the buffet and the service was poor due to understaffing. Same problem with the pool bar, always a line to get a drink. We did not get to eat at the Mexican restaurant because it was always booked and we were told by other guests that the Italian restaurant was not very good. The staff was very friendly and the activities kept my children entertained even though it was the same thing everyday. The grounds are beautiful and kept very well. The beach was clean but small. The picture on the web page is old and the beach looks totally different now. If you want shade, get to the pool or beach very very early. The evening entertainment was fair. The show was OK but it was only about 30 minutes long. I stayed at the Occidental Grand Excaret in June and it was much nicer all the way around. I would not recommend the Allegro unless it is your first time going to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our party of 3 (two adults and a 13 year old) spent 6 days at the Allegro recently and had a great time. The rooms are small (or cozy, depending on your optimism level), but everything in ours worked - the A/C, TV, hot water, hair dryer, safe, etc. The service is efficient, cheerful, and friendly. We asked for extra bottled water at the front desk and by the time we arrived at our room, it was on the front step. We carried a strap of singles ($50.00) with us and tipped 1-2 dollars each meal and left the same for the maid on a daily basis. The grounds are immaculate, as are the pools and the beach. Every bungalow has a porch or balcony with table and chairs and a hammock. Yes, the beds are rock hard and the drinks are a little weak, but if you ask for double shots, the bartenders cheerfully oblige. By the second or third day they will juice you up without being asked. The food is typical resort buffet stuff - always chicken and some type of fish, as well as pasta. But you can find shrimp, sushi, and duck, too. Each night has a different theme at the buffet. The Mexican requires reservations. The food there is excellent. If you don't want to listen to a 2 hour time share pitch, just say "NO" anytime someone mentions "free gift". If you don't mind the trade off, you can get a $40 voucher for your trouble. If you are looking for luxury, the Occidental owns the Royal Hideaway next door. It is a 5 DIAMOND resort and will only set you back about $500 per night, per couple. We paid $65 per person, per night at the Allegro. For that price, we didn't expect Egyptian cotton sheets or lobster. Prices are outrageous at the hotel and the little market close by. I paid $6.00 plus change for a box of Band Aids. Bring your own sun screen and burn ointment. Anything imported from the USA is unbelievably expensive. We saw Pringles for $5.50 a can. Take a can of Lysol or air freshener, as this is the Caribbean and the high humidity leaves a musty smell. There are internet cafes in Playa Del Carmen (a 20 minute walk or $5.00 cab ride) that only charge $2.00 per hour. At the hotel, it's 25 cents per MINUTE. We paid $40 per person for parasailing (booked thru the hotel). Hair braiding (full head of long hair) should not cost more than $30.00. If you have children and find nudity offensive, you should be advised that you will see a fair number of topless women - mostly on the beach, but some at the pool area. E-mail me if I can answer any questions about the area in general, or this hotel in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent five days at this hotel. This was our first time to the carribean and our first time to stay in an all inclusive hotel. The best food was at breakfast and I use the word "best" loosely. The bed nearly killed my back! I normally don't sleep on a concrete slab with a mattress and this is exactly what I had. We complained so they did come and put a little pad on the bed. My husband discovered an open sewer drain beside the commode under the garbage can in the bathroom. We asked for wake up calls so that we could go on our excursions and I just happen to wake up myself. They DID NOT WAKE US UP! We ask for a wake up call one night and then called and cancelled it and they obviously didn't cancel it because they called bright and early the next morning. I was a little irritated when I went to ask for tennis rackets they proceeded to examine my shoes to see if it would mark the court. If they only want you wearing certain shoes, make it known to all travelers before they book. I certainly wasn't about to buy new shoes and I PAID TO BE ABLE TO DO ALL THE ACTIVITIES THERE! BEWARE OF THE TIME SHARE PITCH AS SOON AS YOU GET TO THIS HOTEL! They do not present it as a time share but it is! The staff was friendly and the beach was awesome but other than that I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND this hotel unless you are really on a small budget!

Reviews.Title: “Got Horribly Sick”
Reviews.Author: paslea1987
Reviews.Content: It's hard to give this place a bad review. My Mom owns a timeshare there. The view, the beach and the ambiance is great. The staff went above and beyond !! All the time. We left tips often. It's amazing how little these people get paid. I saw many many times where people would get up off the table and not even leave $1. It's all inclusive, yes.
