But the servers and bartenders barely see any of THAT money. The drinks were Very weak but the bartenders would make them stronger or Fuerte. If you asked. The food was alright. We ate at the Mexican restaurant. The garlic shrimp were very good. The Italian restaurant was awful. The buffet at the main building was good. There were many things to choose from and we always found something we liked. You always hear about not drinking the water or having ice in your drinks. That is very hard to avoid. I've even heard of someone getting sick from rinsing their mouth out with water when they brush their teeth. Our entire party got sick. Well, everyone except my Mom and my 9 year old. I went with my Mom , husband and my daughters. Out of 7 people 5 of us got sick. I got terribly sick. Wound up at the emergency room when I returned home. Our room had a horrible smell in it and the bathroom always smelled like the sewer was backing up. The ceiling vents in both bathrooms were constantly leaking. So we had to put our towels down so the little ones wouldn't slip. Our building was 58 and our villa was right on the beach. The view was awesome. I don't know if I will go back to this particular resort. My Mom has the ability to visit other resorts. I think if we return to Mexico we will be trying Cozumel or Xcaret. I do know that some people go to Mexico and never get sick and others get really sick. We had friends that were staying at another resort 10 minutes North of us and they were there at the same time and NEVER got sick. You either are OR your not. You can't live in fear of that or you'll never go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: Glorisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allegro for our honeymoon, with zero expectations and a bit of trepidation after reading some of the reviews. All of that went away as soon as we arrived. Upon check-in at the front desk, we were given fresh fruit juice, which was perfect after a 45 minute ride from Cancun and feeling sweaty and tired. We were given the honeymoon treatment, which includes one breakfast in bed (breakfast to your room) and a lovely flower arrangement. We were not bothered at all by pesky sales people, just friendly staff who always greeted us with an "hola" or "buenos dias." The pools were great, the activity staff was very outgoing and personable, but not pushy. The evening shows were great, we were really impressed by the dancers! Food and drink were available at all times practically -- there are actually two kinds of beer there (not just one like someone had written in their review). You just have to ask -- they have Corona regular and dark. We didn't figure it out until our 5th day so it's not advertised! Although the water is not bottled at the bar by the pool when you ask for one, it comes from a water cooler with purified jugs of water. All the food was pretty good, the pizza and burgers were below average. The buffet foods were great, every night. The pool snack area had a great variety and all the food was fresh (except I saw the guacamole came from pre-made plastic tubs). The Mexican restaurant was pretty authentic (I'm Mexican American) and the meals there were great. The Italian trattoria was set up alongside the relaxation pool and I felt like I was at an outdoor cafe. The food there was delicious! The juices were great at breakfast -- try the nopal (cactus) juice -- it's green and great! The other guests were great, no obnoxious people to speak of. Definitely lots of characters, but that's to be expected when there are people from all over. We loved it so much we are planning to go next year with a group of friends!

Reviews.Title: “paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking the holiday at this resort i then read about the so called horror stories on the web.......all i can say is that the mexicans are really friendly the food fantastic and the whole ambience just blew me away! The only thing spoiling the holiday were the so called adults acting like spoilt brats!!!!!!! Give this resort a chance i enjoyed it so much i am planning to return next year to stay for longer and to explore this wonderful country even more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...bad food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Mexico with my friends and had a great time. The resort was clean and the room was great. Very simple and clean. The staff was helpful and very nice. The location was awesome. The drinks and food were awful. The bar only had one beer and didn't give you bottled water. The cocktails were ok. The bar itself was dirty and did not seem to have anything fresh. The juices were not great and the garnishes looked old and brown. The food was very average. Nothing stood out. Breakfast was the most tolerable. Nothing exciting jsut normal breakfast items. Tip the maids to get extra bottled water. They will also give you extra towels. They were great and the room was spotless. We had a great time in town and had a great time on the vacation. Stay here but make sure you go out for food and cocktails in town.

Reviews.Title: “You get what ya pay for plus a little more.”
Reviews.Author: SuperSnorkel
Reviews.Content: My family and I went there with open eyes--there was really nothing that surprised us except that the Allegro has a beach that stands up to any in the area and surpasses most. Plenty of Palapas but not enough for everyone. Plenty of lounge chairs but just not enough. The beach area is great and the water is usually very clear. Be advised--this place is very European! The good news is that these Europeans seem to love us Americans. The food is just above average but tasty. Plenty of fresh vegetables and fruits. Forget about the Itialian resturant--it's non-existant. The Mexican Resturant--fair to great. Skip the Coconut Shrimp. The buffet always had something good and breakfast was my favorite. We really liked Mexican theme night at the buffet. The nightly entertainment was refreshing--Don't miss the Mr. & Mrs. Allegro nights!! It's too much! Would we go back? Probably not only because we like something different every time. Would we recommend it? A big yes here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average- you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, you get what you pay for. Don't expect a swank place. The rooms are very average, if you are a woman.. forget the tub it is cement. The beds are on a slab of concrete. The food is very average actually, my stomach bothered me a little bit there so buy some pencilin at the pharmacy in Mexico (always good to do anyway). Also, book your excursions before you get there or you are going to blow 2 hours worth of spiels your first day there in this meeting room area. Personnel are very good. Food very average. Beach is small. If you want something nice , this is not the place.I doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Scarey but Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The area is absolutely beautiful. So, if this is the best that you can afford - go for it. If you think this is anything other than a two-star resort read on. Been to this part of Mexico several times and have always been pleased. The beaches are the best - beautiful view, very swimmable water, clear graduated sand. Nice location so that you can walk the beach strip and into town. The resort is old. Our first room had mold under the paint and smelled musty. It had a leaky toilet so you had to wear shoes to the bathroom. If you turned off the nonstop ac, you woke to the smell of raw sewage. Plus, the fire alarm outside our window kept going off (just an accident or malfunction). Not to worry, the next day they moved us to a different room. Still very simple but so much nicer. Everything worked except the ac kept breaking. That's ok - we like it hot and only sleep there at night. The room was charming in it's simplicity and decor. The maids do a wonderful job. I think they offer the best service of any place I have been. The staff is friendly. We couldn't always get activities off the ground, but that was more a problem of the other guests who just wanted to relax. The other geusts were very friendly. Lots of friendly children too. The food was terrible, barely edible, and scarey. The same dish would appear all week long. I swear the same bowl of salsa cooked everyday. It was wonderful Monday and Tuesday when we got there, but started looking rather old towards the end of the week. Every family was getting sick, seriously for some reason every group with a male in it would be ill. You may want to bring your own medical remedies for - red eyes, bee stings (yes, i was stung and they didn't have any cream for it), diarhea and food poisoning. We have been spoiled so I didn't bring these things and should have. Still in spite of that, the area is paradise. I would go back but to a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Allegro from Jun 11 to the 20th. I was a bit skeptical given some of the other reviews but all in all it was pretty good. When we arrived we were taken to our room right away, we had a top suite with the vaulted ceilings. The air conditioning worked fine but the fan was broken and it took three complaints, the last being a bit rude on my part before someone fixed it. Our toliet was also plugged but they came right away and fixed it and we had no further problems. We had no problems with bugs/insects and we did have several small gecko's running around the walls of our room. We loved to listen to their noises. Our room was small but as we hardly spent time in it, what does that matter. The pools were awesome and the beach was excellent. We were always able to find a lounge chair. We had no problems getting a Hobie Cat or boogie boards. We just went to the booth at the edge of the hotel and were given what we asked for right away, no problems. As for the food it was tasty, well presented and plentiful. We ate one night at he Mexican restaurant, the food was not that good but well presented and the service was excellent. The staff was always friendly and helpful. My biggest problem was the service in the gift shop which insisted on giving me all my change in coins which I could not figure out. Their excuse was they had no bills. We were not bothered by the timeshare people as we did not engage in any conversations with them. We would go back again and have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: FastEddie60136
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort June 10th -17th, this was our first trip to the Rivera Maya, and we loved it. We were greeted promptly and escorted to our room, nice size room,AC was working fine, the bed is on a concrete slab, so it's an extra firm mattress.LOL Lots of things to do there besides eat and drink, and they have lots of activities for the kids. Food was Excellent, it wasn't Steak and Lobster Tails, but they had a good variety and it actually tasted good. Drinks were a little on the weak side for my taste, but bartenders would fix that if you asked. Staff for the most part was extremly helpful and friendly. Overall a great place, I will be going back in November.

Reviews.Title: “terrible food, entertainment show rocks...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: terrible food.but the entertainment show rocks...after seeing the show for 6 days in a row, it gets predictable with the m.c. going on with the same material. food was terrible anyone with a tastebud will tell you. the dinner reservations was generic, i had order the enchiladas with the steak. steak was delicious but could only make 1 taco as for the enchilada they had made it with mole sauce. for those of you who never had mole sauce it tastes like dirt. my parents had stayed in the room downstairs. their room was always very cold, but had no smell. but all the bugs crawl into the room from under the door. my husband and i stayed upstairs it was always smelly when there was a short rainfall and the lizards would crawl in through the roof and croak in the middle of the night. the upstairs rooms had cathedral ceilings but did not keep the coldness to well from the a/c. you can also view the thatched roof from inside our room. my spouse was sleeping and the roof leaked on his head and there was always a strong smell of wet hay in the room after it rained. if you do not like the smell of wet hay ask for a room downstairs. we had problems with the front desk people trying to change our room. so we just decided to stick it out and if i fell from the wet staircase i would have gotten hurt. after reading all the reviews from other people about the beds. my parents bed was a softer mattress, while ours were very firm. but they both sat on concrete slabs. i would take naps on my parents bed to make up for the lost sleep due to the very hard mattress in our room. the toilets are another thing. the toilets would always back up when a new guest arrived into the building. one toilet gets back up they would all follow one right after another. we were not hounded by the timeshare people at the hotel, because we did not seem interested in why they set up tent just right outside the lobby. and they would greet everyone as you came and left from the hotel. the snack bar they provided after 11pm was a joke. it was a table with food (hotdogs, and nachos and lousy finger sandwhiches) set up on it. the hot food was always cold and the cold food was always warm. every person that worked there had the same catchphrase of 'tequila' , want more, or need more, it got pretty tiring after a while. the all-inclusive watersports was a joke in itself. you would have to walk down the beach to the neighboting hotel and get your boogie boards, kayaks, etc. after getting there they tell you have to have a card to use the things and get from the front desk people. then the front desk people would redirect you back there to take it up with the people in barracuda services. it was and endles circle that had ripped the fun and life from me. in all honesty if you are budget traveler this place is for you, if you enjoy vacations with no hassles do not stay here!!! my parents are the budget travelers they loved it , i was not my spouse and i were very dissatisfied with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: LC123
Reviews.Content: My friend and I vacationed (mid 20's -females) at the Allegro Playacar for 4 nights and 5 days June 2nd-June 6th. After reading some of the negative reviews we were a little apprehensive about staying here., BUT we can honestly tell you we had the BEST time. The staff is so friendly and nice!! . We stayed on a second floor villa and like one of the reviews mentioned, we had an unanticipated third roommate for most of the trip....a gecko! It came in thru the tiki-hut roof and hung out in the corner of the roof most of the time--- It really didn't bother us--it was so small...and gave us something to laugh about. The room was not a 5 star hotel room--but was very cute and really gave off a mexican feel. The room was equipped with all of the standard amenities and each room had a hammock on the balcony. The grounds of this hotel are absolutely beautiful---so many flowers and gardens--- Everyday you would see staff doing some type of landscaping---they really take pride in their work. As for the beach, although it is not the Largest--it is still certainly beautiful. Besides, it's too hot to lie on the beach all day, without taking a dip in the sparkling blue/green ocean--which was amazing. We took advantage of the free boogie board rental and found ourselves lying on the boards in the ocean for 2-3 hours a day. The food was plentiful and good--again, not a gourmet feast--but tasty----We enjoyed the french toast and omlette station at the breakfast buffet, nachos and pizza bar during the day, and the Mexican Themed restaurant for dinner. The swim up bar and activity pool were also great---we participated in aqua aerobics and salsa/latin dancing everyday, and ended our vacation with a massage on the beach our last day. They also had a quiet pool, in case you wanted to lounge around. Overall it was a fantastic vacation and we were both very sad to leave=( We can't wait to go back...We hope next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not For Me...”
Reviews.Author: alland
Reviews.Content: Firstly, thanks to everyone who posted reviews of this hotel, I expected some good and some bad things based on them. Also, before people start getting upset over my opinion of this hotel, I'll start with the good things: - Water and fresh towels supplied every day by Maid - Nice towel art for 3 out of 7 days (must've got bored the other 4!) - Nice 'Relaxation Pool' - Hardworking Entertainment Staff - Nice Gardens As for what I did not like, these areas heavily outweighed what I would look for in a good hotel: - Horrible Room Room 5304, musty damp smell, dirty walls and floors. - Rubbish Bed I can confirm what I have read in previous reviews that the bed was simply a mattress on a concrete block (photos attached). - Lack of choice for restaurants Website states: The Buffet, La Trattoria, The Mexican, The Snack Bar and Pizzeria...don't be fooled into thinking these are five separate eating areas...the Snack Bar and Mexican are one in the same, 'La Trattoria' and the Pizzeria are also one in the same...only with a few poorly lit (if lit at all) tables placed by the pool area. (photo attached) - Lack of Variety on Menus Buffet did not supply the stated Cuisine...for example...since when did pasta, refried beans, and pumpkin cream soup be classed as 'Oriental'. Choice of approx four dishes in both the Mexican and La Trattoria...Pizza was ok during the day, as were the burgers. - Poor Service at Pool bar - Poor Service at main outside bar - Terrible Music both poolside and at 'Fast Eddies' Songs repeated two and three times in a row at poolside (after the cd jumped for the umpteenth time). The Banging Hard House music in the 'club' area was not quite fitting for any single person there...in my opinion...(as a DJ) - Still working on the wall at the beach Obviously unfortunate due to the hurricanes, but quite unsightly all the same (photos attached) - Nightime Entertainment Despite the fact that the Entertainment Staff worked incredibly hard, the shows and MCs were pretty much replicas of the previous night...variety never hurt anyone. Although it was a tough crowd at times! - Occidental Allegro 'Reps' I appreciate its their job to sell...but the two guys that approached us were verging on creepy/sleazy...a nd I don't appreciate BS. At the risk of sounding 'snobby', I would say that this hotel is no more than a 2 Star accomodation....3 at a very severe push. I wouldn't say don't go, but just be open minded about what you are or are not going to be getting. I enjoyed my time in Playacar, but a good nights sleep and good food are key to a good holiday for me. In comparison to my stay at the Golden Crown Paradise in Cancun in November, this establishment didn't even come close with regards to quality and variety of food and comfort of the rooms. Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had an AMAZING vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Allegro Playacar with my 2 girlfriends at the beginning of May. We could not have asked for a better vacation! The hotel is beautiful. Yes, the rooms are slightly small, but...if 3 young women can make do, so can anyone! The beds, despite being on concrete, were firm, but noone ever complained of not being able to sleep. There were a few days where we were able to sleep in until 11 without being disturbed by noise from birds or other guests. There were some geckos in the room, but we found in humerous. The beach, I'm not sure if its small. It seems you can swim anywhere along the stretch. We never had trouble finding a seat in the shade along the beach. Had trouble only once finding some shade along the pool, but we didnt' wait long. We didn't have any trouble with anyone trying to sell us timeshares. The food was good. Breakfast, when we made it there, was a good selection, although the same everyday. We didn't eat lunch in the buffett, rather we ate by the pool. There was a good selection with pizza, hamburgers/hotdogs, pastas, salads, fruits. You can eat all afternoon long. Noone complained of going hungry. The dinners at the buffett were good. Its a different theme each night, which is nice, with good variety. We had no complaints about the drinks, they mixed them how you wanted them. Plenty of activites by the pool to keep you entertained during the day, you just have to be willing to take part! We watched the shows in the evening and enjoyed everyone of them. However, our only complaint is that after the shows there is not much to do. The Disco was small, and hardly anyone was in there. We usually drank around the hotel and then headed out into town. The Blue Parrott is an amazing bar, right on the ocean. Go there! The staff at the hotel were amazing. Everyone ensured we had a good time, and they were lots of fun...and very tolerable of drunk girls constantly bothering them! We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that I have actually seen bad reviews of this hotel! When you drive from the Cancun airport to Playa del carmen you can still see some damage from the hurricane. But once you pull into the Allegro you would NEVER know they were hit. My boyfriend and I just got back this week and we had the best time of our lives. The staff were unbelievable kind and helpful. I have never had such great service in my life. We NEVER had trouble finding a cot and never had to wait for a drink. The beach is a little bit smaller than in the picture but it was still beautiful. The workers have spent months rebuilding the beach and they have extended it out quite far. We spent alot of time lounging on cots right on the beach and did not feel crowded at all. I think those who have complained about this resort are just WAY TOO picky because we couldn't find a single thing wrong witht the place. The room were in great condition, not that it mattered as we hardly spent any time inside anyways. Every room has a small patio with a table chairs and a hammock. I think people need to give these poor workers a break. We spoke to one of the workers who almost began to cry as he explained to us how hard they have all worked to get their lives and the resort up and running again. I have to congradulate these people for being so resilient and remaining so positive. I look forward to visiting the Allegro again!

Reviews.Title: “I really can't understand the people who moan about this place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAM12345
Reviews.Content: My b/f and I went to the Allegro Playacar in February 2006. From beginning to end we were treated like royalty. Our room was airy and spacious and I didn't see one mosquito, trust me, they'd have found me! The bathroom immaculate, the maid service impecable. The beds are NOT rock hard, yes the mattresses are on top of concrete but there are mattresses there all the same! The TV had SEVERAL English speaking channels (although we only flicked through - we were, afterall, on holiday!). All the rooms also have a massive hammock on the veranda/balcony. Just heaven lying there, swaying in the breeze watching the world go by. The grounds of the hotel were constantly being attended to by an army of workers, the gardens are beautiful, the pools clean and safe. The staff? They just made the holiday a blast! They are so friendly, funny and courteous, they really couldn't do enough for us. We had absolutely NO problems with food, the range was impressive everyday. The restaurant was still being repaired but they had put up a lovely marquee while it was being finished. The beach directly in front of the larger pool has unfortunately been eaten away by Hurricane Wilma but if you walk down the steps and turn right, there's a lovely bay just for Allegro guests, so all those moaners out there were simply unobservant! I really can't understand the people who moan about this place, they must be the types who you just can't please, ever. Ignore them at your cost, this is a fantastic place to stay in EVERY aspect. We've booked up to go back for a fortnight in November and we can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “No Worries....”
Reviews.Author: PNowak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro May 5 - May 14. Was a little worried based on some of the reviews I read on this site, but we had a wonderful time. The room we had had a view of the ocean and was on the top floor and very clean. Yes, you will hear birds (I don't know if you hear them on the bottom floors due to the thatched roofs), but they really were not that much of an annoyance - just roll over if they wake you up. The rooms are not huge, but ok for us - no dressers for clothes though but some shelves and hangers. No refrigerators for keeping water cool, but we were provided with plenty of water. Use it to brush your teeth, we did have a sickness bout for a few days. We ate yogurt at breakfast and it helped to feel better (wish we had done it sooner). Stayed at the pool most of the time as there was not very much room on the beach with shade - very hot there. Did not have alot of trouble finding places with shade at the pool. Hamburgs, hotdogs, buffet food available at the pool most of the day. Activities at the pool every day which were alot of fun. Also can paint some ceramics if you get bored. They come out beautiful after Victor touches them up for you. Never worried about our things being stolen or had any problems. Food was good with a different theme night at the buffet (Asian, Spanish, Mexican, Carribean, Italian, International). Breakfast had a great variety as well (never ate there or lunch as ate at the pool). Did not eat a ton since it is so hot there you tend to get full very easy but you will not starve. We ate at the Mexican restaurant (try the bean/bacon soup!) which was good and ate at the Italian restaurant (along side of pool) but was not that pleased with my meal there. Chicken & accompanies were cold but my boyfriend's was good - beef tenderloins. You do have to make reservations for the Mexican restaruant and I did hear you only can eat there one time per week but I am not sure if that is true. Shows every night and after the shows, not much to do but go to the "disco" after which is basically a room with a bar and a pool table. We met some really nice people from England and spent some time here with them (Hi Wendy & Mark), but it is definately not a "disco" by any means. Go in to Playa Del Carmen at least once to 5th Avenue - $5 cab ride. Be warned though, you will get asked by every vendor about booking trips with them, etc. - just say "all set" or "going home tomorrow" and they will let you be. Also was asked EVERY day at the hotel to get a "free gift", etc. etc. which is the timeshare deal but just told them EVERY day, we're all set. They are persistant however. If you are in to snorkelling, please book the "Mayan Adventure" snorkelling tour. They take you to three sites (ocean, cave & cenotes) and I saw the most variety of fish (& stingray) that I ever saw on any snorkelling trip I've been on. Tour guides were wonderful and always took great care to make sure everybody was all right and the food they provided was very good. If you are booked at this hotel, don't worry -- you will have fun. While it is not the "Ritz" (and thus we did not pay for the "Ritz") we were not dissapointed. Stay cool & have a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great and Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: gruuven
Reviews.Content: A group of us from the Hoosier state made a pilgrimage south of the border for a little bit of R&R. In general we had a great time - and will return next year. As stated below, the rooms are small but clean (leave the maid a tip for more water), the grounds impeccable (although the mowing equipment was a tad loud during siesta time), pools were wonderful, and the beach, although, small, was beautiful. We all bought our trips off of Skyauction so we paid about 80/day/person. I have spent way more than that to get a hotel in Cancun - without the all inclusive package. With respect to fellow Americans (some of whom were very boisterous in their complaints) here are a few tips when traveling abroad (Mexico or elsewhere). 1. Turn the handle clockwise for hot water, counter clockwise for cold water. 2. Yes, cheese and cold cuts are a breakfast food (beans too) 3. Ice waters-down soft drinks, so in the lands of no refills, very little ice is put into drinks. If you want ice in your soft drink, go to the bar. 4. Women take their bikini tops off to tan. Men wear skimpy suits by the pool and the beach (Walk passed the RIU north of the resort for an eye-full). Oh, and feel free to change clothes in public. 5. Plan on eating at one of the other restaurants on Mexican Night. 6. 100 Pesos does NOT equal 1 dollar, nor do 10 Euros/British Pounds 7. Penicillin, Viagra, Cialis, Rentin-A, Phentermine, et. al. are over the counter 8. If you leave your (very rude and racist) child(ren) unattended, he/she/they will be disciplined by me and others. 9. Never ever say, in America we do it this way - it tends to annoy people. Well, that about does it. If you’re at the Allegro from 9-19May07, feel free to say hi to the Hoosiers. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: estrellaluna
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the ALLEGRO from May 1st to May 5th 2006 we are members of their allegro but in a try out period, we wanted to use the first club area but were told that only PLATINUM members could use it (we were never told about this) so we are glad we are only in a try out period of 2 years, of course we will not buy the full membership. The hotel is very nice, very well kept, the food is different for dinner every night, the breakfast is the best, and lunch you could eat in the pizzeria, or eat hot dogs, hamburgers, nachos or a mini buffet near the activity pool. Regarding the beach there is still a place where the sea reaches the front side of the hotel but there is enough beach area to hang around all day, also if you walk south down the other hotels, you´ll reach a beach with no hotels it is an area that has not been filled with hotels, very nice. They also have a kids club with their own tiny pool, so if you have small kids that´s a plus. The theater was rebuilt, it is very nice. Close to the hotel a 5 block walk you´ll find a small area with shops, pharmacy, etc. Or you can take a cab ride to 5TH Avenue in Playa del Carmen (it´s filled with shops, restaurants, banks, etc.) In the end the hotel is very nice, well kept , good service, rooms cleaned very nice and the food is o.k, (not excellent) but you won´t go hungry. Overall we like the Occidental hotels but not their Allegro Membership.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Allegro, Hate the time share scam”
Reviews.Author: kayemor
Reviews.Content: This was the 5th trip to the Allegro Playacar and the last. The resort was wonderful. Our room was the best they offered (one bedroom suite) with ocean view. The reason we will not return ever to this resort is because of the scam of the time share employees. My husband and I bought into the timeshares during our last visit there. We got the usual "90 minute" tour which lasted for 1/2 day( they always manage to eat at least one meal with you). They showed us what all was available to us with the purchase of the time share. We were showed the Vacation Club rooms, Club House, Hot tub, and top shelf liquor that was ours as well as a bar stocked with our favorite top shelf beverages. After we paid in full the dues, we are now told that our plan no longer exists. We are entitled only to a room near the front entrance. But, we could "upgrade" for around $7000 and receive the plan we initially bought. There is a statement on the contract which says they do not have to honor anything you were told verbally in the tour by any of their employees. That's the catch, because basically our thousands of dollars bought us absolutely nothing. We spent a great deal of our vacation listening to excuses about why they could not honor our contract. In summary, they added new levels (more money) to the plans and ours was pushed downward. We will not return to this resort although we love it due to the time share scam. If you want a cheap time share plan, approach an existing member and they will be more than happy to sell you their plan. There were several members there that we talked to that was so very unhappy with the time share plan that they said they will not return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my husband and two children stoped at this hotel may 05, never again the rooms were a disgrace we moved rooms 3 times. When we complained the staff were not bothered, our Kuoni rep was rubbish. One morning we pulled the sheets back and the bed was full of ants at least a thousand. The rooms were cleaned every day but the hotel is past cleaning our roof was full of holes I would never stop at this hotel again even if it was free, I am a travel agent myself even we make mistakes but once bitten twice shy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I wanted to vacation somewhere with a great beach and great water...we definately achieved that in the Riviera Maya. Three days before we were supposed to leave, our hotel was changed from the El Mandarin to Allegro Playacar. Our travel agent said it was a $600 upgrade but we will never know since we never saw the El Mandarin. (Their pool was being rebuilt--construction from 9a.m.-7p.m.) I loved the layout of the Allegro...very tropical, two pools, and activities. There are some annoying, loud black birds that squak in the night and early morning that do annoy, but it's the tropics! The rooms are okay...tile floors, odd showers without a door, not alot of light. But who spends that much time inside anyway?! They always replenish you daily with purified water bottels...more if you leave a small tip ($1), and left towel sculptures of a frog/swans on bed. Nice touch. The buffets get repetitive, and I have a food allergy so I couldn't try everything, but very nice presentation...They have both natural air/air conditioned areas to eat in. We went snorkelling with Barracuda water sports on premise which was a rip-off, a big disappointment! We saw maybe three different types of fish and that was it. Promised a lot more! Sea turtles, sting rays, etc....Mayan Ruins/Jungle were never seen. Pedro promised us alot and let us down for $33 a person. Plus, there was bloody gauze on the boat floor which was unsettling! The worst part was the "Membership Program" that we were tricked into being part of. They ask you if you want to save 40-50% the next time you come...which we said "yes" to. Then, an Allegro Playacar rep comes to breakfast with you and 2 hours later they try to sell you a $10,000 membership for 100 years worth of vacations. Yet, when they start the speech they say they are not here to sell you anything or take account numbers from you! Thomas was nice, then there is a numbers guy who gives you all the mathematics of beng a "Member," then there is Alfredo---who totally pushed us and made us feel like real lowlifes for saying "No!" to all their "Membership" deals. It went from $10,000 to $7,000 to $2499 to $750 until you finally say "No Deal!" That was horrible, since they totally misconstrue the whole breakfast "chat." Alfredo dismissed us like we owed him something for his time!!! That is the main reason I will not return to Allegro Playacar. I loved the scenery and the tropical sights...we may return again to another hotel. It is worth your money and I do reccommed this hotel, but beware of the few things mentioned!!!! Have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but in a busy hotel zone”
Reviews.Author: Symphony2006
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I enjoyed the Occi Allegro Playacar as we'd not stayed at an 'all-inclusive' Mexico resort before. However, the hotel did leave a bit to be desired. First, the current aerial photos of the hotel's beach are deceptive as there isn't a lovely 40-50' beach at the end of the main pool. There is a very narrow 20-30' beach with many people crowded into the few beach chairs. As with the pool, people come early and lay 'claim' to a beach, or pool chair, for the day - even if they're not using the chair. This means that many people have to do without a chair or squeeze into the sand. The kids club is really for very young children as the kiddie pool is a wading pool and the activities are designed for toddlers and kids under 8. My daughter spent one day in the kiddie club but was bored. The two attendants were quite pleasant but didn't take the kids out of the single room except to toss toys in/out of the wading pool. The buffet is quite extensive and offers many choices. Most items were tasty but not 'gourment'. The Mexican theme restaurant was quite good with some local dishes. The need for reservations seemed a bit odd as the times we ate at the restaurant the tables were not fully occupied. The outside (by the second pool) Italian rest. was nice also, especially if the weather is pleasant as the tables are in the open. The main lobby/office staff is quite friendly but not particulary helpful. Ex, The Internet access room was rarely open and most of the tiem the PCs were not working. If you want to check email, send mail to family, check flight times, etc. you were better off going into town to find a Internet cafe. You also had to pay for the use of the PCs and with the PCs dropping connection it was costly. The nearest pay phones are in a small shopping plaza, about 5 min. walk. I'd suggest purchasing a phone card at the plaza pharmacy as the pharmacy sells cards that work in the plaza phones. The 'town' is a working town and is a nice break from the hotel scene. It's a 20-25 min. walk (depending on if you're older or have kids) and passes by some local Mayan ruins. Take the ruin walk as it goes near a beach with nice, small hotels, condos and leads into the town. The ATM/banks in town dispense in pesos and the exchange rate was 11.50 pesos/US dollar vs the 10.00 pesos/US dollar at the hotel. The brochure we had said that the non-motorized water sports were 'unlimited'... well, unlimited is 1 hour per day per sport (ex., 1 hour of wind surfer, 1 hour of kayak, etc.) even if the sport equipment sat their unused. I wanted to take the Hobie Wave out for a couple hours (I sail in Colorado) but was told that 1 hour/day was the limit. Keep in mind that the area around the Occi Allegro is filled with other large mega-resort hotels, vacation homes, condos, etc. There is also the never ending stream of timeshare sales reps. If you walk down the beach, in any direction, you'll find thousands of tourists. The only quiet beach is South, about 1 mile and past the resorts. It was full of trash so we did some clean-up but the area needs a bulldozer to keep the refuse from blowing back into the ocean. Looks like a local Boy Scout or Rotary project is needed. The local travel agent, MLT Vacations/WorryFree, rep. was unfriendly and useless when it came to selling us tours. We eventually purchased Xel-Ha/Tulum and Coba (EXCELLENT) tours through another travel company. You can get better tour deals in town through the tour operators. *We really enjoyed the Coba tour though it was a long day of driving/stopping at other resorts to pickup tourists/and HOT. Our tour company also stopped at a Mayan village to hand out school supplies and pick up trash collected by the kids, swim in a underground cave/cenote (refreshing), and lunch next to a lake with alligarors. A good tour but lots of walking on uneven ground - bring sturdy walking shoes/socks, as well as TEVAS for swimming the cenote and a swim suit/towel. Tips: bring at least SPF40 as the sun is intense, bring a large brimmed hat/visor, bring a 1/2 sleeve or long swim shirt (Speedo) for yourself and the kids, bring a mesh bag for wet clothes/towels and to get rid of sand from the beach, plastic beach toys, wind breaker for cool evenings, leave your jewelry at home, travel pouch/waist pouch for passports, money, credit cards, Gatorade powder for long days away from the hotel, small first aid kit/bandaids. If we take the Coba tour again we'll fill a suitcase with school supplies, small metal toys, etc. for the Mayan kids. Bring at least 2 cameras - my digital camera stopped working and I'm glad I had a disposable/water proof camera as a backup. It took decent photos and we didn't mind taking it to the beach, snorkeling, parasailing, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was amazing we got there right after they renovated from the hurricance. No complaints at all. Near the pool there was always something going on like a vlleyabll game or basketball game but theres also a pool if you want to relax. theres a litte place with shops about a 10 minute walk away which is nice. rooms are very nice and clean but one bad thing is that there are no showercurtains but its not the end of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing week ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a week at the Allegra Playacar in Playa del Carmen. We had a fabulous time! The resort was charming. We loved the Polynesian-style huts with thatched roofs and balconies. Each room came equipped with a string hammock. Our room, with two double beds, was not spacious, but it was certainly adequate. We barely spent any time there, except to change, shower and sleep. The air conditioner worked very well, and there was also a ceiling fan. There was an electric room safe for valuables and passports. The beds were a bit hard, but the comfy pool lounges more than made up for that. There were two pools, the activity pool (with a swim up bar), which always had something going on, and the relaxation pool. Even though we were there during Spring Break, we never had any trouble getting lounge chairs under a palapa. I understand that the beach was devastated by last seasons hurricanes, but the sand was soft, and the water was shallow pretty far out, which was great for the kids. The food was plentiful and delicious. My daughter was fairly picky, and wouldn't try any of the more exotic foods, but there were plenty of breads and cut fruit to satisfy her. If you have a particularly finicky child, you might to do well to bring along some peanut butter. Breakfasts were great, with pancakes, french toast, eggs, breakfast meats, and omelets made to order. The snack bar by the pool was available from approximately 11-4, and there were always nachos, burgers, pizza, and salads, in addition to other dishes. The drinks really are all included, and available all day long. The tourism scene was a little chaotic, with various agents trying to sell you excursions. Ask guests who have been there for a few days where they went and what they paid. We went to paradise beach to snorkel for a half day, and had a great time. We also did the full day Chichen Itza trip. I think if I were to do it again, I'd go to Tulum instead, as it is much closer. Chichen Itza was a three hour bus ride each way, but the trip also included lunch, a show, a couple stops (including a water hole swim and a church). The mini-town of Playacar is a 5 minute walk away, and there are several souvenir shops (don't forget to bargain). The best kept secret is the aviary, which is a 15 minute walk (or $5 cab ride) down the road to the right. It's open from 9-5, and costs $15 for an adult, and is free for kids under 12. (there's also a kid's price, for children over 12, but I don't remember what it is). Every night there was a mini-disco for the kids at 8:30 and a show at 9:30. If you don't like staying up late, I recommend requesting a room away from the stage. Our room (a premium room) was close to the pools and beach, which worked well for us. The only complaint I had was that the internet was down most of the week. However, I found that you can use the internet at neighboring hotels, if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sarahq19
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this resort from the 18th to the 25th of march and had a blast! You could tell that the whole town still feels the effects of the hurricane and are taking measures to clean up, re-plant, re-build (The new stage) and get back to normal. The rooms were on the smallish size, but no smaller than some hotels I've stayed at in Winnipeg! The food was hot, there was allot of variety and tasted great (Especially since I didn't have to cook it!!). I thought the place overall was very clean and the staff were nothing short of amazing and always went out of their way to say hello (Hola!). The beach was small, but breathtaking! If you were up early enough (8 or 9) you still had a chance to snag a lounge chair right on the beach and veg for the day. The only complaint that I had was the check in time. We arrived at the resort around 12:30 and couldn't get into the room until 3. But other than that, our vacation was incredible. There are always the people out there that are unhappy about the food, or the drinks, but I think in general, this place should be rated as a 5!

Reviews.Title: “I would give it a 5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip was wonderful! Very relaxing-Allegro made it that way. Great activities-Adan was the best! A variety of food was served with great Presentation and tasted great. The Mexican meal by the pool was very good. Room was alittle small but who spends that much time in there any way!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, don't get mislead”
Reviews.Author: ManuelFR
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days (march 18th to march 21st) at this resort and found some advantages over upgrated ones. For instance, the Grand Flamenco Xcaret, bigger and more expensive, has no ocean view at all. At the Allegro, you have the pool right in front of the ocean (no big deal for some, made a difference to me). For those who complaint about the food being served in the tennis courts, eat this: the restaurant area is new, clean, and they serve good wine. I have two kids 8 & 4 and had a super time. The Good: 1.-you can smoke in your room, they provide matches & ashtrays (I'didn't because of my children, though). 2.-casual, relaxed, atmosphere, everyone having fun. 3.-cold a/c and firm beds (great for backbone). 4.-drinks strong at first, but to taste on request. 5.-rooms have two windows, wich slide open and connect to the balcony area (bigger rooms elsewhere have only 1 window) The Bad: 1.-swimp up bar is ornamental, they don't serve there. 2.-from 4 pm to 7:30 pm you can only have pizza, nothing else to munch on. The Ugly: 1.-not a lot of spring breakers...sometimes they bring you back to life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time! The rooms were small, but clean. The food was good. The drinks were great! The activities programs were the best...especially Adan!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Dirty, Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have camped in a tent with cleaner facilities. The lobby looks nice. The washrooms in the lobby are nice and clean and thats it! All inclusive-what a joke. Try to get a drink at the poolside bar. There is self serve soda, coffee,tea and a water jug, but NO glasses, when there are glasses, you cannot tell if they have been washed or not. The rooms are beyond horrible. The beds are on concrete slabs, is that even a bed? Toilets did not flush properly. Dirty floors, TV did not work, final straw was when my child awoke with bites all over her legs from the BUGS in the bed! No help from the front desk, Checked out 2 days early.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, we found nothing to complain about.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I just got back and we all agree that the Allegro is really a four star resort for a great price. We are not "that" easy to please but we really couldn't find anything to b--ch about--nothing. No, it wasn't the SERC--but well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My g/f and I stayed at the Allegro 3/15-19 and had a great time. We had read all the reviews and were a little apprehensive. All I can say is either we were easy to please or all the complainers of this hotel are too fussy. We chose this hotel for the value and that's what we got. I'll try to address the main concerns people raised about the Allegro. Rooms The rooms were small, but always very clean. (Maybe this was due to the daily $2 tip we left for the maid?) The shower stall was unique. No door or curtain was present, instead about 20 inches of glass extending from the wall which did a very poor job of keeping water off the floor of the bathroom. Other than this annoyance, the room was great. Plenty of hot water and the a/c was always working. Our room had a small safe that worked flawlessly. We had no problem with bugs and didn't observe any of the spraying for insects that many people had complained of. We both slept like babies on the supposed "hard" beds. Construction/noise We too were woken by birds in the morning, but come on, you're on vacation, is this really a big deal? Would you rather the hotel staff shoot the birds? The theater and some of the units were still under construction, but we never heard any of it while we were there. It was hot while we were there (85-90) so we had the windows closed and the a/c on for most of the days, but a couple of times we had the windows open and still didn't hear any pounding. Our room was on the ground level, so perhaps that helped as well. It sounds as if the upper level rooms are less sound-proof due to the thatched roofs. Additionally, our building was two units in from the ocean and two units away from the pool, a perfect location in our view since we were far enough from the pool to not hear all the activities, but close to the ocean. Food/drinks The food at the buffet was ok. The breakfast was by far the best meal of the day. Additionally, the snack bar by the pool was good. As was the pizza available by the pool during the day. The drinks were plenty strong. Again, tip your bartender a couple bucks the first time you see him and you'll be fine. I would also recommend bringing an insulated mug to use for drinks. We enjoyed walks down the beach and this came in very handy. Beach Speaking of the beach, it is smaller than the neighboring hotels, but it is big enough. We had no problems finding chairs under or near the palapas. If you're concerned about this, place a towel on the chair in the morning before breakfast. There are some rocks in the ocean. We found this in front of the Allegro and other hotels. We didn't wear beach socks, but you may want to consider this. If you're careful, you'll be ok. Timeshares The staff in general is very good. However, we quickly figured out that anymone who offers to show you around or meet you for breakfast is going to try and sell you a timeshare. Just politely decline and you'll be fine. We heard other guests complain about being stuck listening to sales pitches for a couple of hours. The only person you need to spend some time with is your contact for setting up your return ride to the airport. Be warned, this ride will leave 4 hours before your scheduled flight's departure time. There you have it. To sum it up, we had a great time at a modest hotel in a great location. I may go back, or I may try another hotel further south down the beach. Any questions, feel free to email me at dawg220@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Was pleased with my Stay”
Reviews.Author: Buddy047
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro March 11-18,2006. There is some beach which is enough , the theater is under construction and the buffet restaurant is open. The food is 9 out of 10. Tip and you'll find the staff go the extra mile for you. I give it a 8.5 out of 10 and would go back again in an instant. Hurricane damage has construction going on all over Playa Del Carmen; so we had a few short periods without electricity and one 4 hour strech without water. If your are a diver, Vincent and Gulia at Barracuda Dive Center are tops and very trustworthy to dive with. They are working very hard to get everything back to 100% around the city, but there was a major hurricane, so expect changes Do not use the internet or phone unless you want to spend a LOT of extra cash

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and great time, will go again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wellman, Iowa and just returned from 7 days at the Occidental Allegro Playacar. We stayed here at this same place exactly one year ago and wanted to come back. Our only concern was what hurricane damage had occured. Allego once again definitely met our expectations. Other than the beach erosion, from the hurricane, it is fantastic. We love this place and what impresses us the most is the great food, variety daily, and the wonderful staff. The staff is always very kind, polite, clean and neat and continuosly grooming the grounds. Don't forget the frozen drinks, wonderful! We are once again planning a trip in March of next year and will only stay at one place, the Allegro!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our week at the Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank you Allegro for a wonderful, relaxing week. Allegro Playacar is low key, well maintained, fairly small and intimate with accommodations located in multiple buildings with 8 units each - 4 upper and 4 lower. We had a lower floor unit which overlooked the relaxation pool and a bit of a view of the ocean. The room had 2 double beds which was not large, but was adequate for 3 adults. The staff was pleasant and helpful and our room was always clean. A minor problem with our shower was repaired promptly. Food was good and plentiful for most of the day and served buffet style; however, later in the evening the menu was pretty limited. We made reservations at the beachside restaurant one night and although it was a bit windy right on the ocean the great food and service more than compensated. You had the option to relax quietly or there was always something to do such as pool volleyball, aerobics, bingo, etc. and nightly shows. We tried the kayaks - small sail boats and boogie boards were also available. The beach is small and kept very clean. The evening shows were very entertaining - great dancing, elaborate costumes and a good mix of different themes. The highlight of our week was our visit to Xcaret - don't miss it ! Playa del Carmen, Tulum and Xel-ha are also well worth visiting. We found the best deals for the sightseeing trips at Walmart. This resort is good value for the money. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this hotel and I will say that it was a nightmare (at best) from start to finish. We started out with a terrible flight. We flew a charter flight on Funjet. Got to the airport and many people there waiting for the next person to "scam". Terribly busy airport esp on Thurs and Sun., so keep that in mind. So, we get to the hotel....more people waiting to "scam" you for excursions, which by the way, are cheaper if you buy them in town. We were taken to our room via concierge. It was a rude awakening upon entering. Musty,damp smell and mold can be seen in the ceiling tiles. Very dirty floors. The shower has NO shower curtain so every time a shower is taken, there is a river of water to clean up from the shower to the bed. The worst part of the room for us was the mosquito infestation that it had. I had to literally try and kill all of them for an hour before bed to keep from getting bit during the night when the sheets slipped off. We spent several dollars on repelent and mosquito coils, but that didn't help anything. I came home with about 30 bites esp behind my ears and on my ankles. We did tell the desk, but nothing got done about it until the day we were to leave. As we were walking out of our room, there was a nice man walking up to our door with a sprayer. 5 days later!!! Had complained at least 3 times during the week, and to no avail, nothing was done. It didn't help either that the maid kept the door propped open during the day to clean, allowing anything insect wise to enter as it pleased. We also had NO electricity or hot water during some of the days of our stay. That means NO air conditioning in the heat of the day in an already musty, moldy, swamp-like room. Imagine it! Also the bed is perched as a mattress on a concrete slap. It was honestly a lot like sleeping on a rock hard floor. Awful! The TV had 2 channels available in the English language which were E and Cartoon Network. Pathetic! I was sooo disgusted by this. Felt completely tuned out from the world with absolutley NO news channels. Also there was NO beach to use. If you wanted to go to the beach, you had to walk over rocks to go walk to the nicer beaches down the way. The ocean in front of the resort was also NOT swimable as there are rocks that cut your feet upon entering the water. Another disappointment was that the hotel will not let it's patrons have the water equipment at times ie: windsurfers, boogey boards, catamaran. All things that were supposed to be part of the all-inclusive package. What a crock! Couldn't even really give an explanation why---- other than if the water was a little rough that you could get hurt. Funny the other resorts down the way let their patrons have all those things! Was VERY frustrating NOT to have more to choose from restaurant wise. The 2 offered are a mexican cantina (which the food and service were good) or the other was an Italian style set up right next to the pool. It was very chilly at night and windy, so if you want to brave that, you can.....it's a set up outside....not restaurant style. I thought it was a poor choice to have people sitting outdoors during the evening hours. Both restaurants, however, are set up that way. The few good things that I can say are these. I was never served anything without a smile. All the workers were especially cordial and did the best they could to be of service (aside from the front desk staff). I was impressed as well with the amount of work done by the maid services. They are very hard workers and did the best they could with what they had. My overall review of this hotel is that it was a pathetic excuse for even opening. I do NOT feel that the renovation needed, after the hurricane wiped it out, is adequate. It should NOT be open until the mold problems and the lack beachfront are irradicated. It was very frustrating having NO electricity due to the workers needing it to be turned off. Not to mention the incessant pounding and nailing and sawing in the middle of the night was also ridiculous and completely rude. People are there to be on vacation, not to be awakened at 3 am by construction. Good luck to anyone staying at this hotel! It was a joke from start to finish. I would NEVER stay here again. I'm sooo utterly disappointed at the amount of money we spent on the whole trip for all of it to be ruined by the lack of accomodations. Wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back actually. No electricity when I got to my room, waited for them to fix that, no working TV until a nice maintenance man showed up, I tipped him. Food was terrible, I stuck to certain things that I could count on. No room service as advertised by my travel agent. If you wake up hungry, too bad. Drinks were fine but I'm not a big drinker to be fair. Web site boasts in room safe, I use these for my passport and credit cards, it was broken and gutted. The roofs have huts on them instead of roofs so plan on no rest, entertainment each night that actually vibrated my room until 10:30 PM, woke up to power tools and construction at 2:25 AM that went on all night. I love birds, but these horrible black birds scream at the crack of dawn at each other on the roof tops of each "hut". The people who work there are very nice, it's all this place has going for it. The grounds are beautuful and maitained well, but no beach at all anymore. there were many beautiful hotels on the same street, go to any of them. The Mayan ruins all down the street were facinating and I would love to go back..to a different hotel. The bathtub was stained, filthy, and broken, as was the shower head until late in the week. No shower door so be ready to wipe up all the water off the floor, which by the way, was always dirty. The pools were very nice, but good luck finding a chair to sit in. My favorite, I like to chain and bolt my door when I sleep at night, the trim on the door was broken and a gentle push lifted the trim away and the bolt was useless. The maids are over worked and have so much to do, I tipped her 2 times. The bed is concrete with a mattress, I could go on but you get the picture. A beautiful paradise and a horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for money”
Reviews.Author: shank99
Reviews.Content: ALLEGRA OCCIDENTAL PLAYACAR-FEB 25, 2006 THE HOTEL IS ABOUT 45 MIN-1HOUR FROM THE CANCUN AIRPORT. BE CAREFUL AT THE AIRPORT FOR PEOPLE TRYING TO SELL YOU TIME SHARES, ASK YOUR TRAVEL AGENT WHO TALK TO AT THE AIRPORT. YOU MAY STOP AT A COUPLE OF HOTELS BEFORE REACHING YOUR HOTEL. HOTEL:The Hotel is Mediterranian looking. Actually a pretty nice set up. It was devastated from the Hurricane and Was shut from 6 Months and Re-opened on January 15, 2006. Part of the hotel by the beach was Destroyed. ROOMS:Check in time is at 3pm. We got in our room at 3:15pm. We go to the hotel at 2pm and went and looked around and had some lunch while we waited for our room to be ready. Our room was fairly clean. We had 4 People (2 Adults, 2 Kids-aged 5 & 7), and the room was pretty small. If you had only 2 people, it wouldn’t be that bad, but we had trouble finding a place to put our Luggage. The Beds: They were Terrible! Hard as a Rock. I would suggest you have the hotel staff bring a fluffier Mattress (I saw a few of them being brought to other rooms). Every Room has a deck with 2 chairs, table, and a Hammock, which is nice for lounging. SERVICE: We found the Employees to be very nice. They kidded around with our kids and always had a smile on. MEALS:The Hotel, again, was devasteded and the restruant was being Re-done. In the meantime, we ate on the Tennis courts. The meals were to good to very good. I didn’t have any problems with the food At all. We ate Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner there, but you could also eat at the restaurant at the Pool, which was good as well. And they had thin crust pizza in the afternoon that was outstanding. DRINKS:My wife and I drink only occasionally and we found the drinks to be very good and we got them quickly. But you don’t get a lot of alcohol in them, so I would suggest you ask for “doubles”. They are free. ACTIVITIES: The second day there, we went parasailing and snorkeling. Both were a lot of fun. Might I suggest you trying to “Talk Down” the price. They are like Street vendors, they want your business, so give it a shot. We went shopping at “5th street”, where you can buy all of your souveniers. Taxi is $5.00, but ask first to make sure. You can also walk to a small, but nice, shopping center across the street to the left. BEACH:Not much beach left. The water is beautiful, but there are huge rocks left for the part of the hotel that fell into the water. I actually cut my foot as I was getting off the boat that took us Snorkeling. I would recommend wearing the “Water Socks or Beach Shoes” in the water. POOLS:The pools are very nice, right on the water. They have 2 pools. Both are for Adults, one is for Kids. There is a nice “Swim up Bar”. There is a lot of activities such as pool volleyball, Yoga, Dancing Classes, you can learn how to speak Spanish as well. We didn’t need to get up at the crack of dawn to get a Pool or beach chair, we did in Aruba and hated that. (The line was huge and you literally waited for over and hour just to get a chair in Aruba) OVERVIEW: It’s not a 5-Star Hotel, probably a 3-star, but for the money if was pretty nice. If you want to pay more money, I would suggest the RUI, there are 2 RUI Properties on Playa Del Carmen. Both look Very nice. We walked through to get a look and the beach and pools are huge. One bad thing: The hotel staff was always pushing the Time Shares and their other properties, this after My wife and I told them we would think about it and if we wanted to talk to them more, we would contact them, but they kept pushing it every day.

Reviews.Title: “no beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: there is no beach at the allegro. and when you do go in the water watch out for the rocks. there is about 8 yards of rocks under water that you have to walk over. saw alot of people get hurt. the staff was wonderful. rooms just ok. we didnt have any trouble but heard of numerous people with no hot water or no water at all. we lost power for awhile but called them and it was fixed within 30 minutes. had to ask for reprosado when ordering tequila or they would serve some crap tequila. i will say we were dissapointed with the accomadations when we first arrived however we did have a good time. just know what you're in for with the beach(meaning theres not one) and so on. stay liqured up and you will think you had a good time regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time visiting this Allegro chain of resorts. After two devestating hurricanes the resort is making a come back but without the wonderful beach it once had. Some construction is still underway but compared to other resorts they are further along than most. Service and aminities are above what you'll find along the strip and the quality is above average (food, accomodations,). Many people we spoke to during our tour of the beach daily from other resorts complained of being sick and having the lack of bottled water available to them. The food seems to be the same at other resorts with theme nights and common everyday dishes prepared morning, noon, and night. Thus far Allergro is better as we had top shelf liquors (Bacardi, Beefeaters, etc), other neighboring resorts had (Arrow, Appleton lines of cheap booze)and some with ..no ice. If your looking for a nice place to beat the weather back home and to not worry about carring a wallet around this is your place. Pool is maintained and is in superior condition. Nice thing was......NO SPRING BREAKERS! to pee in and foul the pool water and puke every ten feet. Considered a family resort this is a great place to kick back and relax while your chidren are off playing and learning about another culture. If we had one complaint it would be that Cancun airport stole our luggage (from a direct flight) which we never recieved after 7 days. Allegro took us to Wal-Mart to get the thing we needed to get by with and help us in everyway......try that someplace else! Suggestions if you are going to this or any of the Allegro resorts: Take a large insulated cup to hold your drinks and ice. The bartenders will fill them up and let you place the amount of liquor in them..."say when". Always request a safe for your money and important belongings. Do not pack a bag to be checked by the airlines! They are stealing the luggage in large numbers! Take two carry-ons and pack to a minimum! Tip your housekeepers a buck a day and ask for more bottled water....you'll get it. Bartenders will take a $1.00 bill a long way if you are a tipper. Finally.......Be polite! and avoid the Europeans as anti Americanism is rampid and don't stare at those bodies in speedos!......EECK! Have fun in the sun and enjoy the surroundings....it beats the cold. If you have champagne tastes on a beer income look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went back to Allegro Playacar in March 2006. We had been there previously in May 2005. We were very happy about the excellent service, and wonderful time that we had yet again. This time, we brought our four young children with us. Our kids absolutely LOVED the staff in the Kids Club, which is all inclusive free child care. They did arts and crafts every day, played games, listened to music, swam in the mini pool, and played on their new playground. It was fantastic! The service was excellent. The food was good, too. We were surprised to see how much had been rebuilt already after the hurricane. What dramatic improvements already! If you are looking for a great place to stay, and you have kids, this is it! If you are looking for many organized activities, and sports, this is also a place to go! Thanks to all the staff there, we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1. Separated my wife and I from our two kids (4 and 6) despite promises of adjoining rooms. Didn't fix for the first two days. (three of us slept in one room) 2. No air conditioning (despite about 5 attempts to fix it) for the last four days. 2. Beach is about 12 feet wide, packed with three rows of broken beach chairs. 3. Better save youself a seat by 8:00 AM if you want to sit at the beach. Same goes for an umbrella by the pool. 4. Dining room was a hot, fly-filled tent sitting on the tennis court. 5. Beds are hard. 6. Make sure you know your neighbors well - the walls are so thin you can hear them cough and enjoy whatever they watch on TV until 5 A.M. 7. Construction starts at 7:30 A.M. seven days per week and ends at sundown. 8. Bring your own soap, shampoo, conditioner. The "bulk" ones they provided in our room weren't refilled the entire week we were there. 8. Kids club is great. Pools are clean. Food was mediocre (at best). If you have little kids, bring your own peanut butter and straws. And a cellphone that works.

Reviews.Title: “Whats all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: MNPebbles
Reviews.Content: To all of you that have doubts about this hotel, I am a travel agent and I stayed at the Allegro Feb 17-20, 2006. I have to give the hotel and staff 2 thumbs up. Prior to leaving and reading all the reviews I tryed to changing my hotel but didn't suceed and I am glad. Upon arrival and using Worry Free Vacations (which I would also recommend booking through) they are just that "Worry Free". The hotel was correct about the hotel rebuilding they were very up front on the information. I knew when I booked the hotel what the rating was and have no problem with it, if you really know what the rating means. I thought the staff was wonderful we barely got checked in and 3 differnet employees approached us and showed us around. The bartenders were fun and friendly and so were the restaurant staff. It basically comes down to if you treat them with respect they will do the same to you. The rooms were ok nothing fancy but clean you can, however, hear your neighbor next door the reason being you have a grass roof which doesn't keep much noise out, and the showers were a bit interesting with just a half piece of glass for a shower door so the floor gets wet. The beach is ok, there isn't much and actually allot of the beach was getting washed back out to sea while we were there. The resort also need more lounge chairs on the beach and in the pool area's, it was kinda annoying when there all these chairs but no one on them except someones towel. The thing I really enjoyed was having a hammock on our deck, it was wonderful to lay in it listening to the ocean. The food was just ok, I have had better at all inclusives but I am not a picky eater. The grounds were very nice and kept up. The bottom line is if you have a Champagne taste with a beer budget this is not the place for you, but if you have a beer taste and a beer budget then you will like the resort and have fun. One thing I just have to say is how I noticed how rude and messy some of the tourist were, I was disturb at the amount of garbage people just threw around and expecting someone else to just clean up their mess, I can see why some of these employees get a tad upset and aren't kind to the customer. These employees work hard and long hours for pennies on the dollar they work 7 days week doing there regular jobs during the day and then allot of them also do the shows at night. So if they have a crabby day here or there I guess I can't blame them if they are putting up with rude tourist. Just respect the resort and the people and you will have a great time in the sun and sand! If you have any questions or would like to see some pictures (I can't get them to load on this review) please email me at kms315@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back and was looking for an e-mail address for the Allegro Playacar. I've taken many trips to the Yucatan & Cozumel. I enjoy going the all inclusive route and of the different resorts I've stayed this was the best for sevice and food. The staff was extremely hospitiable and the food was the best we've had as far as all inclusives go.

Reviews.Title: “lovely paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after reading all comments above this hotel, I just can see how unfair people can be...I stayed during one week on this beautiful hotel and I spent a wonderful holiday there, the food was really excellent, in variety and quality, the service was friendly, warm and polite, all staff members wanted to gave a good impression and look after tourists even if the behave in a rude and unpolite way; I'm mexican and I had travelled nearly all around the world, and I had never found such a good service in a hotel with such a low rate; even more, I got very dissapointed when I saw that neraly all guests were foreign people who pay the same rate as us, and that they waisted food and drink alcohol all day and still have the face to complain about everything, why do they come to my country then? If they found it just like a terrible nightmare the should stay at their country, but the wouldn't do it becuase they won't get a king life there as the can get it in the paradise that is Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Stractroop
Reviews.Content: I had never been to the region, so had no preconceived notions as to what I should expect. Having said that, I didn't expect the poor quality of this hotel considering the amount of money spent on lodging! First off, we were told to come back at 3pm (we arrived at noon) to get our room. Okay, big sign says check-in is at 3pm so we're fine, we'll just go to the pool. At 3pm we show back up and are told to take a seat, someone would be with us in a minute. 30 minutes later we go back up to the desk and they say, "someone would be with us in a minute". 15 minutes later we go BACK up and finally get keys to our rooms. When I finally get to my room and open the door... there is someone else's stuff in there! My friends are in the room next door, they're expecting double beds as there are three members of their party, they get one king size bed! We go back up to the main desk to inform them and get the run around for the next five (really) hours! We got shown several rooms that clearly were not ready to be occupied (filthy, safe broken, AC inop, tile reinforcement wire exposed, exposed wires, and hanging light fixtures). During our brief stay we ate two meals at the hotel and were very disatisfied with the quality of the food served; it was plentiful, but not very appetizing and all the same. We sat down to eat dinner (still no rooms) at a table that had spider webs growing between the napkins and the silverware! The hotel management was not accomandating at all. At one time we were speaking to a gentleman who said "wait here", then never came back. We got helped by another gentleman, who pawned us off on a lady, who asked if we wanted to see the manager. We said "yes" and imagine our surprise when in walks the first guy who initially blew us off! The best part of this trip was when the manager came to us and said that they had no more rooms to accomandate us and they were moving us to the Grand Flamenco Xcaret (GREAT HOTEL). This may have been a great hotel once (you can read the reviews) but either they opened too early, or lost their good management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “No beach - stolen money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in playacar 11 times over the last 3 years have always loved the beach,people,and hotels.was there 2/2-2/8 they had just opened after repairs the beach is gone-(just south the beach is great as usual)the resturant is closed you eat on the tennis court with a tent over it food was terrible .the workers where very nice magement was rude.my son had money stolen by an employee with a key and management covered for them.

Reviews.Title: “Oct 6-9th”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bottom line on a vacation is whether you would come back or not and we definitely would. Very laid back, clean facility. The maid service was a little hetic but I think they were still trying to re-open the facility. I think if we would have waited a few more weeks, it would have been perfect. I have two boys, 7 and 12 and they loved it. For the money, it was well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “It will all be fixed next week.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was closed for approximately 6 weeks after Hurricane Emily for repairs and opened a week too soon. We were among the very first guests to return, and they were definitely rushing things. Good Points: The food, when we figured out when and how to get it, was pretty good. The buffet wasn't great, but a few menu-meals were spectacular, specifically the fish dishes. The pools were nice and clean. The hotel has more pool space at the expense of a deep beach, but the narrow strip of beach they did have was really nice. Sincerely nice staff. Bad points: The normally-free calls outside the hotel from the rooms was broken, but they wanted to surcharge us $4 to call from the lobby. No air conditioning until the fourth day. The temporary restaurant schedule was confusing and limited because they weren't all repaired. Lots of minor glitches were blamed on not being ready yet. I can't count the times I was told "It will be fixed next week." Downright Weird: A manager found us around the middle of the week and said the general manager wanted to give us a special dinner to make up for the problems. Did we want steak of lobster at the restaurant tonight? We said it wasn't necessary, but he insisted and so we said lobster would be nice. At dinner that night no one said anything and it wasn't on the menu. Nobody said another word about it, including the manager.
