We didn't want the lobster in the first place - we just wanted air conditioning - so we never said anything either. But it added insult to injury so to speak. They shouldn't tease guests like that. Long story short, it's a fine hotel that would have been great "next week". They opened too soon, they knew they weren't ready, but they took our money anyway and gave us a mediocre vacation. Once they really get their act together, it might be a nice place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to this resort in June with our 19 yesr old twin daughters and we all had a great time. The girls were out having fun everynight but somehow still managed to get up to sunbathe at 9 every morning?? Anyway my husband and I also loved it. The food was excellent, especially the buffet. The rooms were clean and spcious and we had a lovely view from the balcony. This was our first time in Mexico and would definitly go back to this hotel. Marie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel in July and had an absolutely wonderful holiday. The accomodation was lovely, the food was delicious and the staff were very friendly. During the first week of our holiday it rained for a few days, although we didn't let that ruin it for us. We went to Cancun a few times, one for a tour and the other was to go to a dolphin swim at the sea centre. I would highly reccommend both. The rooms were very clean and nicely furnished, the maids were in every day and did a great job. There are a variety of restaurants to choose from and there is also a buffet which is great also. Would definitly reccommend it !!

Reviews.Title: “Was a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of July 4th and I have to admit that our stay was disappointing. I do not understand why it is rated a 4 star hotel, I think I'd rate it a 2. The lobby has no air condiitioning, so you have to sit in the heat until check in time which is 3:00 p.m. The rooms smell a horrible musty smell, that you try not to be in your room as much as possible. The mattress sits on a concrete slab so the bed is obviously rock hard making it uncomfortable to sleep. The food could have been better and not enough kid activities. The staff was friendly though as well as the maid service. The beach and water was beautiful, though and we did get a preview of their STUDIO rooms which are ocean front and that room was nice and did not have an odor. It also looked cleaner. Of course that kind of room costs more, but next time consider that one instead of a superior room. I guess my main problem with this hotel was the room, although you are out most of the day, and their menu can use some improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Also survived storm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also made it through the hurricane, but had three nice days to play before it hit. Resort was nice and clean. Grounds were kept up nicely pre-storm. Food was just so so, breakfast being the best. Breads very good. Dining area is very hot and humid even during breakfast. Would be nice if dining hall upstairs was closed in some for air-conditioning. Staff at food area good. Pool staff kept everyone very involved until the storm. Front desk help nice but evasive concerning the storm's impending arrival. Denied that it would be bad, but CNN told us otherwise. Lucked out on storm surge being lower than predicted. Our room was second from the ocean and survived with no damage. Many other building suffered major damage and staff told us resort would be closing for repairs. Once storm arrived staff worked very hard to keep us comfortable under hard conditions. No air-conditioning in our designated area, so we just found a hallway with some air movement. Somehow as the second floor fell apart around us the staff kept food and soft drinks flowing. Even with many water leaks and broken windows they would stop by and make sure you were OK. Next day they put out a hot lunch and dinner while trying to clean up the mess... Would like to return someday to try all they offered.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: JulietteEH
Reviews.Content: We spent $8,000 to take our family (7 of us) to the Allegro and were not impressed. We were told the hotel was 3.5 stars and the service was 5 star. I would give the hotel 2 stars and the service maybe 3. I will give you the good first: 1. Nice grounds 2. Beatiful Carribean water...warm and clear 3. Nice maid--very kind 4. Lots of food 5. Nice pools Now the bad: 1. Small and somewhat dirty rooms 2. Misquitoes galore, in the pool and smashed on the bedroom walls 3. Snippy hotel workers. While some were not bad most were not very helpful. We just got tired of having to beg for service if we needed anything more than the basic basics. They were especially rude to my teenagers, who are pretty respectful kids. 4. Food quality was "iffy". Out of seven not too picky eaters we found little that ayone really liked. 5. Sanitation in general was scarey. We watched the bar waiter wash the glasses and decided not to drink from them again. 6. Everybody has their hand out--next time we vacation it will not be in Mexico. We got extremely tired of having to gaurd against being ripped off. 7. The "free" catamarans come only after a $40 lesson. The "free" wind surfing comes only after a $30 lesson. The "free" bikes were ALL being serviced and were not available. 8. What is written in the hotel book is not always what you get. 9. The hot tub is only for time share guests. 10. The restaurants are not air conditioned, which is not a problem as long as you don't mind your waiter dripping sweat (literally) in your water glass. 11. We paid $65 for a rental car at the hotel rental service...a tiny little euro type car that STANK. We had to ride with the windows cracked and the air conditiong running at the same time. The first day I just wanted to sit and cry. After I adjusted we were able to enjoy our vacation. We went diving on cozumel which was wonderful. We drove to the Mayan ruins and loved them (except for the smelly car). We really enjoyed Xcaret. (It was cheaper to take a taxi and buy our own tickets than to book through the hotel) All in all it was a good mediocre vacation, just not what you wanted to spend 8 grand on (over 10 grand by the time we took all the tours and tipped, tipped, tipped). PS. for all of you that think I am just picky, please understand that I have spent weeks at a time in Tjuana doing service for the local people, sleeping with my whole family on cots in one room of a run down community center. I don't mind roughing it...just not at this kind of price! MY ADVICE--SPEND A LITTLE MORE AND FIND A NICER STANDARD OF ACCOMODATIONS!

Reviews.Title: “Post Hurricane Emily”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't want to give the hotel a bad review as my visit during the hurricane was extremely unusual. I had stayed at the Allegro a year earlier and really loved it. Was very surprised at the beach erosion. Not much space to walk around people sunbathing and no room for volleyball at all. But the hotel acted like the hurricane was not big deal right up until the last day, which was extremely troubling as we were dependent on them to keep us safe. We arrived on Thursday and they acted like it was silly to be concerned and they received storms all the time and most hurricanes would veer off at the last minute despite reports on CNN in our room that it was heading straight for us. They first told us that we would each be in our rooms or if we were in a 2nd story room with the thatched roofs then we would be moved down to the 1st level. A little frightening when news reports said it could flood 6 miles inland with storm surge. Finally by Saturday, we received news that we would go to a shelter. It wasn't until Sunday morning that we had a briefing that we would be moved to the Royal Hideaway theatre next door and the families with children would stay at the Allegro. I will skip the stories of the hurricane itself... After the hurricane, we came back to the hotel and it was pretty demolished. The lobby roof fell completely in, all of the windows of the main building blew out including their main dining rooms and Italian restaurant. The inside of the upstairs looked mangled and there was pretty bad water damage. The theatre at Allegro was demolished as the whole roof and structure collapsed. The pools were dirty but easily cleaned up. The restaurant by the pool that is open air had minor damage but this is now the only place to feed people. Most of the rooms were ok, some with flooding, some with roofs damaged, some windows blown out closest to the beach. Beach erosion looked minimal as there wasn't much room there anyway after Ivan. The worst part was the loss of so many trees.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade shows”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa many times and will go again. The Occidental Allegro Playacar hotel had a substantial upgrade about a year ago. Their efforts show and the staff seemed to be pleased with the improvements. A happy staff makes happy guests. A very good hotel. All the hotel in Playa have their own character. We first stayed at Club Maya, a smaller hotel, food was not very good, but it has a crazy, fun Italian/Mexican feel to the place. We then went to the Riu ClubHotel next door which is more formal and Spanish, very good food, but it is so large it is a long walk to the beach, a large number of Europeans (including a number of 200+ pound topless German vixens). Our third was our favorite which is the Iberostar Tucan. They used great architecture to have the two parts of the hotel surround a lovely garden jungle so the walk to the beach was fun. But everyone is different and a vacation is more than a hotel, so we will likely go back to the Occidental Allegro hotel on Cozumel. It is not as nice as the Playacar Allegro, seems to have an occasional sewage odor problem, but it may have the best SCUBA diving in the entire Caribbean, and amoung the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: longhorn1989
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were greeted by the hotel clerk with a smile and a Cold glass of pink lemonade. We really needed it to refresh after a long trip in. Then the front desk clerk told us that we were unable to get connecting rooms as we requested per our reservation and was told that they would accomadate us on the next day, which they did. But, for the first night my kids were adjacent to us without a connecting door. No help for the first day. We had to wait about 2 and half hours before our rooms were ready for check in a 3pm. So we ate at the buffet and waited. The rooms were smaller than I expected. The entire building is concrete, including the headboard, which makes for a safety concern for young kids standing on the beds and falling. The shower does have a half wall with no door, which allows the water to spray onto the floor. The plus is that the shower head is detachable and can be used to direct the water away from the opening. The beds are firm, yet did not bother me or my family at all. The a.c. works too good and will freeze you overnight even at the lowest settting. We usually turned it off in the early morning and coasted with the cold air in the morning til we left. The rooms do come with safe, which you have to check out a lock and key with a $100 fine if you lose the key. A $50 fine is also charged if you lose any of the beach towel keys that you are assigned to. Something else to worry about on your vacation. The resort grounds were very nicely landscaped with tennis courts, basketball and volley ball courts throughout. Plenty of shady areas throughout your walk to your 4-plex Palapa style housing with an outside patio and hammock and table and chairs greeting you upon your entrance to your door. An occassional Iguana could be spotted on the grounds along with plenty of butterflies and a wierd looking animal that looked part rabbit and part pig running throughout the grounds. The guests were a mix of many different countries which I was suprised of how many people were from overseas. It makes for nice conversation with the guests. The pools are very nice and clean with food and drink bars surrounding the pool along with planned activities at the front louder pool and a second relaxation pool for the tranquil sunbathers and swimmers. The drinks were good, yet all the beer was all beer poured onto a small glass. I would have preferred the bucket of beers and sit by the beach for a few hours, but that was extra. You would have to walk up the bar each time you wanted a drink, which was aways from the beach front. Hard to get a buzz that way. The buffet was great at first and was downgraded to o.k. after the 4th day of eating basically the same thing everyday. I got an allergic reaction the the pasta served with SHELLFISH and red sauce. I was itching all over until I took Benadryl and it subsided after about an hour. It must have been bad or something because it has only happened to me once before in my entire life. The service is good. The breakfast was great with omellette made to order. The variety is good for all visitors worldwide. The lunch & dinner buffet had burger, pasta, pizza, mexican cuisine, italian cuisine, luncheon meats, fresh fruits, vegatables, etc. The Italian restaurant was the BEST! With five course elegant dining from appetizer, salad, soup, entree, dessert. All excellent! Service was great and the kids also got the star treatment. You must wear pants and no flip flops according to the dress code, yet my wife and kids got in with sandals and nice spaghetti strap tops. You must make a reservation upon arrival to secure your limited seating. We missed out on the Mexican restaurant, so no advice there other than make a reservation as well and casual attire is allowed. The entire lobby, restaurant and hotel entertanment is without air conditioning! Just Palapa tops with air flowing through. So be prepared to cool off in your room as needed. The only other air condition areas are the gift shop and The Italian restaurant and maybe the downstairs disco, which I didn't attend. The outdoor evening shows are entertaining and helps you spend the night with the family and to have some drinks. Nothing of the Las Vegas caliber, but helps pass the evening on with audience participation throughout. The entertainment staff was fun and energetic. The kids also got to dance on the stage for about an hour before the show with the staff. The kids loved it. On the courtyard around the stage is a makeshift market with some artwork, jewery, soveniers, pictures with you and your family with a donkey for sale. The beach front offers free non motorized sports as needed. Along with excursion for scuba, snorkeling, fishing, etc. all at your doorstep for a fee. The beach front is narrow only about 20 feet and gets deep rather fast for younger kids. We preferred the Playa de Carmen beachfront for the kids and drinks under a rented table and umbrella. Oh yea, topless women do come by here and there so prepare yourself and family..... wear shades. The hotel has its own travel excursion department which can assist you on any travels you may desire with ground transport available at your doorstep. The taxi to Playa de Carmen shopping and beach is 46 pesos, ie. $4.60 usd. I highly recommend Xcaret as a full day excursion at $85 an adult and 42.50 per child over 3. The hotel also offers currency exchange at the front desk as needed. Internet access is also offered at a price and International calls to the U.S. are at $5.00 a Minute! Bottled Water is given to you at your room daily. We would tip our housekeeper 1 or 2 bucks and we would get an extra liter of bottled water. At check out we requested a late check out, but was denied. But we were offered a Hospitality room for 30 minutes for a quick shower before our departure. To our dissappointment the room had not been clean prior to our arrival. So we rushed to get the housekeeper as time was ticking down before our departure. Overall, I would stay at Alegro again if it was the only package deal available at that time and the price was right. But, if had a choice to venture off and try another resort for basically the same price I would venture off.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in the Bed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We knew, from reading the reviews, that this was not a five star hotel. But, we were still very disappointed. The staff was not very welcoming upon arrival. The first room we were taken to smelled so horrible that we requested another one. Unfortunately, this room did not have much of a roof. The buildings have thatched roofs and they don't bother to finish out the rooms. So, the only thing between you and the rain, bugs, animals, etc. is that thatched roof if you are on the second floor. The first night I found several black bugs in the bed and my husband and myself figured that they were falling from the ceiling of the room. The birds wake-up at 6:00 in the morning and so do you, because you can hear everything. We wanted to relax so we had to come back to the room to nap during the day when the birds weren't so loud. Air-conditioning in the rooms barely worked. There are no doors on the showers, so water leaks all over the floor and runs out into the room if you are taking a long shower. The beds are very hard and the only thing good about the buffet is the breakfast. I didn't find the staff the be very friendly and they couldn't seem to bring soap to the room even after we called a second time. The beach has been washed away by a storm, so it can get pretty crowded when everyone tries to find a spot in what beach is left. When we complained upon check-out, the staff looked annoyed and told us to complete a comment card but we never heard anything back. I would never stay at this hotel again. We went down for a wedding and most of the wedding party was staying at a resort about a mile down the beach. Pay the extra money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, where to begin this nightmare? Lets start at check in. We reserved the "Superior" deluxe room with either a pool or ocean view 2 months ahead of time. We recieved confirmation of our reservations. We arrived on June 25th 2005 to the hotel and were promptly told that we did not have the room we reserved, all the superior pool and ocean view rooms were full. When I showed them my confirmation and complained, their response was..Oh well. Also we reserved a smoking room with 2 beds (my wife and I both smoke), and we needed the extra bed for my 10 year old daughter. The room they put us in was non smoking with one bed. (Beds there are hard as rocks I should add). Also we arrived at 1 pm and were told that we could not get into our room til 3:30 pm. So there we sat..in the heat..in long pants and shirts for 2 and a half hours. By the 3rd day..after hours of arguing about our room with management they Finally gave us the room we were supposed to get. I dont know how this hotel got a 4 star rating..but trust me...in the states in would be rated 1 star...maybe. Did I mention NO room service? No fridge in the room..and only half a door on the showers? and also..NO dressers or anywhere to put your clothes..exept a small shelf. Now, on to the restaurants and the food. There are only 3 restaurants in the whole place...a buffet restaurant (no air conditioning), 2 specialty restaurants, one Mexican, One Italian. Only the Italian restaurant is air conditioned. Now here is the surprise they dont tell you til you are there..you can only eat in the specialty restaurants ONE time per week..and you must make reservations. The food....to say the food was bad is an understatement..I have never had such bad food..and there was very little variety..its the same food all the time..what you see on Mon..you will see again on Tues..and Wed..and Thurs...Also make sure you have plenty of snacks in your room..because there are a lot of times that none of the restaurants are serving food....so you can get very hungry if you dont keep a supply of snacks. The Bars...there are 4 bars at this hotel..again..no air conditioning. Now in your room you will have a welcome book telling you the hours of operation of the bars and restaurants. You can pretty much disregard whatever they say in that book...the bar that is supposed to stay open til 11 pm will close anytime they feel like it..usually around 9 pm (this was the only bar close to my room) So now you walk all the way up to the lobby area to get to the other 3 bars. The first is an outside little tiny walk up bar which is supposed to be open til 12 am. Again..it will close when it feels like it..9 pm..10 pm..whenever. Next to the inside bar by the buffet...this bar is usually open til 1 am..but its sweltering..no air. Which leaves their DISCO. Never has the word disco been so inappropriately used. Its a room about the size of an average home living room..with a big pool table in it and a juke box. Although it usually will stay open til 1 or 2 am. The beach....WHAT BEACH?? Its virtually non existent! You walk down the steps...take 5 steps and you are in the water. If you are going to Mexico to enjoy the beach...this is NOT the hotel for you. The pools...2 pools....both shallow. One is a relaxation pool....the other is an activity pool. Not much to say about the pools..they were clean..the water in them was hot..but again..they are supposed to be open til 1 am..and again..they closed when they felt like it. Room service..Forget it..they dont have it..and no little fridge in your room either. Cleaning Staff...They were very good...they kept the room clean and the towels stocked. Helpfulness of the staff.....with the exception of one or two good people...the rest of the staff was VERY unhelpful..and most of them do NOT speak English. If you call the front desk to ask for something...like the roll away bed I requested..you will get it..EVENTUALLY. I asked for it at 3 pm..I got it at 10 pm. Also there seems to be some problem with the key cards they give you and the locks on the rooms..Every single day I had to walk all the way up to the lobby and get new keys because my keys would stop working EVERY day.....their explanation was....well they had none..they just did nothing about it...and acted as if it was no big deal. Overall impression....this is a terrible hotel. For the price you can get a much nicer place in the same area. If I were rating it I'd give it 1 star..and thats stretching it. I've stayed in nicer places along a highway for about 80 dollars a night. Do yourself a favour...look elsewhere. I'd suggest XPU HA Palace. Now THAT is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I left I read some of the recent reviews and felt that this would be an okay resort. Boy was I wrong. When we checked in our room was not ready. We were told to wait and could have lunch. The first young lady who took care of us was very nice and answered all of our questions. When we came back after lunch, the man who took care of us was a bit rude and uncaring. I found the rooms to be depressing. Not enough light (artifical) in the rooms. Realizing you are here on vacation, but I would at least like to be able to see what I am doing when the drapes are drawn. The beds are ROCK HARD. I am a back sleeper and don't mind a firm bed, but I couldn't sleep on my back because the bed was so HARD and UNCOMFORTABLE. The rooms have a unique odor to them. Couldn't quite figure out if it was the cleaning products or what. It rained the last day we were there and the roof leaked. The food got to be tiresome after the first few days, breakfast was the best meal of the day. I ate at the snack bar one afternoon and two hours later I was sick. When I reported this to the management I was told it could not possibly been the food. However, the morning we left I went to have their "continental breakfast" and found fruit flies all over the uncovered fruit and sweet rolls. Needless to say I did not eat. I will however commend the restuarant manager for allowing me to see the doctor at the hotels expense. The food in the Italian Restuarant was rather salty. I was unable to eat at the Mexican Restuarant because of illness. When I went down to the beach to get towels, I was asked where were my towel cards. I didn't get them at check-in. When I went to the front desk to ask for my cards, the desk clerk acted as if though I was lying about receipt of the cards. It is true the beach is not that big but that wasn't such a big issue for me. We found chairs to lay out in and were able to soak in the sun. Also, if you plan on departing before 7:00 a.m. from the hotel do not look to have breakfast before you leave. They do not serve before that time and will not bring anything to your room either. I have stayed at other resorts and hotels and found this to be my worst experience in over 20 years of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time By All”
Reviews.Author: 2thebeach4me
Reviews.Content: We just got back and we loved it! I would definitely return. If you want more bang for your buck then this is the place. The reviews that I read had me nervous I must admit. Some people complained about the beds, some the beach and others just ramble to complain about something. We went in a group of 7. The ages ranged from 60 to 4 with something for everyone. First, the food is not spectacular and I would say the buffet is probably your best bet if you are with your family. Second, the beach is narrow but not crowded. We were able to get lounge chairs every day that we went to the beach and usually with a couple under the thatch umbrellas. Third, the beds are firm but not hard and are comfortable enough to get a good nights sleep. These seem to be the biggest complaints that I have read in these forums so I hope this helps. We did some extra activities and you definitely want to look around for the best deals. For example, 4 of my group (and only us 4) went snorkelling and paid $30 USD each for 2 hours. The agent at the hotel wanted $33 USD for 1 hour in a group of 10! Trust me and see Carlos Lopez when you hit the beach and tell him Jerry from Illinois sent you. He was excellent for us and produced on the spot with no waiting like the agents at the hotel. We didn't do any of the ground trips but I can tell you to buy your tickets to any of the parks online and pay a cab to take you there. It is much cheaper that way. We would have gone to Xcaret if I only knew this ahead of time so I hope this helps someone. For a more thorough review and one that I agree with see " an Honest review~~we had a great time!!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Most fun ever had on a family trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Playacar resort, it was like 2 o clock in the morning and we were all so tired! so we went to bed as soon as we opened the door. Our room was towards the back of the hotel and in a nice quiet area. I think our room number was like 2604 or something like that. The beds are awesome i loved them and the room was very big and very nice. I loved the shower and how it only had half a door even though water got everywhere! The maids were awesome and we tipped them about $1 american each day and they greatly appreciate it so much. They give you extra towels, bottled water, and make cute statues out of the towels and the fresh flowers around the resort. The food was very good, i enjoyed the buffet very much and it was alot fun everyday going there and eating. The breakfast buffet is the best! Didnt really go up there for lunch mostly stayed by the pool for that! Dinner was very good and they always have the same thing but some nights they had a theme and they tired to revolve around it. The mexican restaurant is very good if you like mexican food, it is very mexican (not like taco bell)! Very spicy! The Italian restaurant is very yummy! loved it! you pick a appetizer, then soup or salad, then main course, then dessert of coffee! The pools are awesome and so much fun to be around during the day, the activity people try to get you involve but they give up after awhile if you refuse to do it! The main pool facing the ocean is cold but nice and refreashing after baking for a couple of hours! There is always something to do, always activies going on and always people you trying to do it! When we were there in decemeber and january this past winter, then beach wasnt really there! lol there was alot of sand bags everywhere because they were trying so hard to perserve it as much as they could but it was hard with the high tide and winds, The nights shows were awesome and so entertaining! There were different themes each night and basically 2 different kinds of shows. Dancing and performers for one and audience involvement the second night! The dancing ones were amazing and the dancers were so good! very talented! The audience participation ones are hilarious they had every kind of contest possilbe. They had mr and mrs allergo!! Which i one of course! heh some much fun though! Overall this hotel is so much fun! so much that we just book for next at the same time and so i hope i can reclaim my title! I love this hotel and every single worker there!

Reviews.Title: “an Honest review~~we had a Great Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellenphant
Reviews.Content: I read a ton of these reviews before our trip and was extremely nervous before i arrived. so, my goal is to give you a very unbiased, honest review that will help you to set your expectations to the right level. we arrived on the 1st of june, and just got back tonight, the 6th. one thing i noticed immediately was the lack of air conditioning. there was no air conditioning in the lobby, and the air is very humid. we had the buffet the first night of arriving, and discovered there was no air conditioning where they seated us either! however, the buffet restaruant is divided in two different parts, there is in indoor area that there IS AIR CONDITIONING. if you go, request to the person who seats you that you want to be seated indoors! there is plenty of room and they're willing to accomodate. when we arrived they gave us wristbands, and one coupon for a night at the italian and a night at the mexican. to be honest, we preferred the buffet over the two restaurants! the buffet food is not exceptional, but very good considering it is always replenished quickly, a lot of variety and not too bland. the breakfast buffet is delicious. the best part are the 4 diffferent FRESH fruit juices (try the pineapple mixed with the orange, it is great!) and they make omlettes for you on the spot. another favorite was the hashbrowns as they were on par with mcdonald's. :) fresh fruit is always available at the buffet. when we ate there for dinner, we tipped $2. the service was just too good not to. i didn't see anyone else leave tip at the buffets, but people usually did at the restaurants. For lunch we usually were in our swimsuits around that time so we just ate around the pool area. they have a pizza bar, which i thoroughly enjoyed. they also have someone grilling burgers. I went with my family of 5, so we had two rooms. i know everyone complains about the beds, but i might be the first to say that i LIKED the firmness of them. soft beds really hurt my back, so these beds were perfect! i had no trouble sleeping at night--if anyting, i felt like the pillows were a little on the high side. another thing that annoyed me about the room, was that there was a musty smell in my room, but not my parents. Also, the showers were annoying, in that they only had half of a shower door, so the water would spray out onto the floor if you stood a certain way in the shower. the maids did an awesome job, and i left them $1 a day. i think they appreciated it a lot, as they left 2 bottles of bottled water and made gorgeous sculptures out of towels on the bed. i stayed in a room with my brother and sister and i believe we had one of the best rooms on the property. it was rooms 5801 and 5802, and they were literally RIGHT next ot the beach and the pools. there was no noise at night, like i read from some of the reviews. my mom "complained" of the loud ocean waves the first night but changed her mind and enjoyed them the 2nd night after she was used to them. we loved the hammocks hanging outside each room. the way this resort is set up is very practical. each little hut consists of 4 rooms on the bottom, 4 rooms on top. it is very convenient to go back to your room. there isn't a hotel lobby to walk through, or a long ride down an elevator. you just walk outside your room, and you're at the beach or the pool. it is great! another thing that is great are the resort grounds. they are absolutely BEAUTIFUL and are some of the prettiest gardens i've ever seen. there are people maintaining them day and night and really a site. i felt very safe at this hotel and everyone is just SO friendly. there are nightly shows that i really recommend. the show differs from day to day, but there are basically 2 kinds. one kind is the "audience" invovled kinds, where it is completely based from the crowd. another type of show was the dancers and performers. i enjoyed both of them. the dancers/performers are extremely talented, one girl especially. look out for "tonya" --she is absolutely gorgeous and one of the most talented dancers i've ever seen! (i included 2 pictures) i saw men walking up to the stage and only taking pictures of her. she might make it big one day, so catch her there for a treat! the "audience" based show were hilarious! most people laughed until tears almost came out. they do have sexual references, but the little ones usually don't pick up on them. another thing to note: there are many vactaioning europeans there, so you WILL see breasts on the beach and near the pool of all shapes and sizes. some firm, some big, some saggy, some small. just don't stare too hard. most come with their husbands, lol. last but not least, the beach: it is not as bad as some of the previous pictures have shown. i guess the sandbagging they're doing is paying off. there are 1 row of chairs next to the water...it didn't bother me that much because the swimming pool is RIGHT next to it. if you want to lay out there are PLENTY of chairs, maybe we went at a time where it was less crowded because you could find a lounge chair at any time of the day. waking up at 6am to reserve one was not necessary! the water is crystal clear and just gorgeous....... Another thing to keep in mind: if you want to take trips such as x-caret, xel-ha, etc, do NOT book them with the travel agency at the resort! they jack up the prices with no bargaining power. if you go to the shopping plaza literally a 2 minute walk to the left coming out of the resort, there is an agency there where you can get the trips cheaper than at the resort: it really adds up, esp. when you buy for more than 1 person! you can bargain with them as well. you'll have a great time here. i wish i could go back! with my boyfriend this time though! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I have just returned from a fabulous week at the Allegro. The resort and grounds were beautiful and the sea was amazing. The entertainment team were all very friendly and made our stay even better. There's plenty of daytime activities for those that want them. However if you don't fancy tequila volleyball in the middle of the day then the relaxing pool is good for chilling out. The food was better and more varied in the buffet than I expected and the service was always excellent. We were however very unimpressed with the food and service in the Italian restaurant. The nightly shows were ok but there could have been a bit more variation and there's not a lot to do on site after that (although you can go to Fast Eddy's for a few). Playa Del Carmen is only a 5 minute taxi ride though and there's plenty of bars to chose from if you don't want to go to bed too early. The rooms were very basic but they were always clean and we loved coming back each day to see what animal had been created from the towels. The only downside was the hard bed and pillows and the noisy air conditioning. Overall this is a great resort. Don't let the negative reviews put you off. I've travelled extensively and this rates up there with my best vacations. I'm already planning my trip to return later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are beginning to show their age. Hotel staff were dressed very nicely and everyone was friendly and helpful. Restaurants were clean and food and drinks were endless. Grounds were beautiful and pools were crystal clear and clean. The bed was on a concrete base with a mattress which made it very hard and the pillows could have been used for weapons. The room was clean but smelled musty and a sewer leak near our air conditioner vented the odor right into our room. We were there on Memorial Day Weekend and the crowd was a little wild. I would not recommend this atmosphere for parents that want to spend time with small children.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Allegro!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Allergo Playacar this past Feb/March, 2005. We went with another couple & had a WONDERFUL time there!!! We all agreed we would go back in a heart beat! It was our first time to Mexico for all of us, therefore, we were AMAZED by the beautiful Mexico waters! Blue & Beautiful & unexplainable is all I can say. Pictures do not do it justice. The people were great & very friendly. We didn't have any problems to speak of, although, the only bad thing we can say, is agreeing with another review I read. & that is the beach. We were VERY disappointed about losing our beach! We at first figured, we never had seen it before, so it won't make much difference to us how it looks now? Until you see the pictures of how is "used" to be, then we were very disappointed! The beach was pretty much gone. Lots of sand bagging all week. It was hard to walk into the water on rough days, because you would fall on the sand bags that you couldn't see under the water. On the calmer days, it wasn't so bad. It still doesn't take the beauty of the gorgeous waters away, but it was a bit frustrating, when we didn't find out from our travel agent until two weeks before we left for our vacation. & yes, as I also read in another review, the stairways were under construction because of the water coming up so high, & we were priviledged enough to actually "witness" one of the palm trees literally fall into the water! We thought it was halarious at the time, but kinda sad really? We didn't blame the hotel staff for the beach though, they are not responsible for the weather, they can only do what they can & they still worked hard at making it a great place to be. Regardless of the lost beach, we had a wonderful, wonderful time & would go back again! (hoepfully with much more beach???) Oh, & our rooms? They were good. Not the Marriott, no...but we loved the thatched roof "Mexican" style look the resort had! The beds, yes, hard, but no bed is like your own bed! We had neighbors meet us there too & they loved it as much as we did & will definately go back! The beach was our only problem. Thank you Allegro for the wonderful memories! :)

Reviews.Title: “Abosutly Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They called this hotel a 4 Star, I don"t know who gave it that but they are wrongly mistaken. My husband booked this trip to the Allegro Playacar in the Mayan Rivieria for my birthday, (WHAT A GOOD GUY). To be totally disappointed. We were misled by the Signature Vacations book as it showed a lovely beach and the book said that it had all of these get things at the resort. That is called false advertisement. Needless to say we were voilently sick the whole trip and my husband got bleach poisoning from them not properly cleaning the glasses and utensils and we got back home to Canada we found out that my husband is allergic to bleach, so it hasn't been a good time at all. We had no Signature Rep as I think she is not a person. We could not find her at all. She didn't even know that we were even coming. There must be some miscommunication somewhere. One thing that I notice was that the guests seemed to be so miserable, that's got to tell you something. We met some people down there that they couldn't even drink their drinks or eat their food, so they went to Sam's Club and bought a cooler, their own beer and food as it was that terrible. Needless to say( it's short but if I if I kept going their wouldn't be room for any other complaints) I would not recommed this hotel as my husband and I travel alot and we've never had it this bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Allegero on 05/20/2005 and had a less than good experence. We had requested a second floor rom based on the other advise on Tripadvisor and was pleased with it until we found that the A/C could not keep up with the heat. It was so hot that we turned the A/C off and opened the windows We had three people come and try to fix it, and after two days they said that they would move us the next day. We prepared for the move and were ready when they said the room would be ready, only to find that we had to wait two more hours. After the move, I called the front desk and requested a remote control for the TV (we were both sick and it was raining), after three hours we were told that they would investagate. The second room was "worn", but was 30 feet from an area used to construct concrete forms, so there was hammering and sawing all day. The food was just ok (we did get sick) and the staff, except for the front desk, was great. Many people I spoke with were happy, but I suspose that it is the luck of the draw and God help if you loose, because the guest service personel will not.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visitied Allegro from April 26-May 6 for my honeymoon. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is average, rooms are nice, nothing special, food is good, but not great, entertainment was endless. The daytime entertainment included games, cooking lessons, aerobics classes, etc. There are sandbags on the beach; but there are sandbags on all of the beaches in that area due to the erosion. The staff is very friendly and polite. It you like to Scuba go to BARRAKUDA (right next store) and ask for Alberto. At first I was very nervous, but he was so patient with me. He taught my husband and I to dive; we ended up loving it and getting Advanced Open Water Certified. If you are at Allegro for more than a few days you will need to go into town to eat, there are lots of resturants in downtown PC; go down 5th street; prices & resturants get better with the higher block numbers. Overall, certainly would go back to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “The Beds Can Ruin the Trip”
Reviews.Author: BubbaKegMom
Reviews.Content: The Allegro was a very nice hotel. Our first all-inclusive which we would do again. The service was good, the food was also good, and though they need a few more bartenders the drinks were always flowing. Our biggest problem was the bed. If you like rock hard beds, and I am not joking when I say rock hard, then this is the place for you! If not, either bring an inflatable mattress which a couple we met did or look at another hotel. If you aren't drunk when you go to bed than you will not get a decent night's rest. Additionally, the Polynesian style rooms are neat but if you are on the top floor which is the nicest room to have, they can be very loud because of the thatch roofs. Also don't count on a pool or ocean view unless for some reason there are not too many timeshare people there. My two cents!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon at Allegro !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just visited the Allegro on 04/17/05- 04/24/05. We had a great time. I read the reviews before going and thought that I was doomed, just want to set the record straight. The resort is clean and beautiful. The food was excellent, we never went hungry and actually gained weight while we were there. Every night they changed the type of food, and I never had a problem finding bacon during breakfast. The staff is prompt, courteous, friendly and always have a smile. I recommend booking any tours with the kiosk in the lobby, we booked two day trips and everthing went great. The room was big enough for the two of us, plus 2 suitcases, and all our purchases from Playa del Carmen. We had plenty of room. Overall, I would like to say that we had a great honeymoon, the beach was nice, the pools great , the food plentiful, and really when you are on vacation what else could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Went with girlfriends and loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and two girlfriends went and felt very safe. The resort is beautiful and immaculately clean. Even though the beach is a bit washed out, there's still enough room to hang out there, they have several lounge chairs set up under palm trees. The staff was very friendly and professional. And the food was excellent. We were disappointed at first that we only would get two nights at the restaurants, but actually preferred the buffet afterwards. Always a lot of choice (fish, chicken and beef), lots of vegetable dishes and a few typical mexican dishes to choose from. The desserts were amazing. And, we'd read before we left that they don't give out straws...well, it's true. So if you're planning on drinking margaritas, bring straws. It was great having two pools to choose from, a relaxation pool and an activity pool. I participated in the aerobics and this kept me fit. To get chairs by the pool that have some shade, you have to get down there by 7. Just leave a towel on it and go back to bed! Playa del Carmen is a really pretty town with lots of good shopping. Only 10 dollar cab ride. And the boat ride to Cozumel is fun to do. But we weren't as impressed wth the sister resort as the one here in Playacar. (You can ask for a day pass to the sister resort in Cozumel.) There's also a fun mall that's walking distance from the hotel where the Internet and phone cards are cheaper. Overall, it was a really relaxing trip. We loved hanging out in the lounge area by the restaurant at night and met a lot of people that way.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back in a heartbear -a review for those with perspective”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from the Allegro Playacar. My husband and I have very little to say that is negative about this resort, save three concerns (and two of these aren't directly the fault of the resort itself). The staff: are wonderful. I do not agree with comments about the overuse of English. I came to Mexico with about three Spanish words to my name and they always seemed to prefer speaking in Spanish (which is why I was able to pick it up pretty quickly)-and they never minded me asking how to say something in Spanish either. I even partook in their Spanish classes---a great idea--Andreas was a very good instructor. The staff are ALWAYS friendly, even during the March Break madness (they certainly had heaps more patience than I did). My only regret is that I wished they'd have had the legal power to pen the always boorish and drunken highschoolers off in an area that would allow the adults to enjoy the verdant, beautifully manicured gardens and lawns in blissful peace. As an aside, why are irresponsible parents allowing their underage teenagers to go to resorts in Mexico in unsupervised groups and live in a stoned and drunken haze for one week? Shame on you. The food: is good. It's not authentic Mexican cuisine (which we had hoped for) but it has variety, and is suitable for anyone who thinks a special night out is a dinner at Boston Pizza. The Italian a la carte restaurant is wonderful (remember: you are in MEXICO not Little Italy or Italy for that matter). The Mexican rest. was ho-hum. The beach: yes, it has eroded. But there are places to hunker down in and all the resorts share the length of the beach. Overheard a conversation between an engineer and a French couple about plans to fill in the beach and expand it, possibly as early as in the next year. The housekeeping: excellent. Especially love the attention to little details such as the "origami towels" in the shape of a rabbit, mermaid or elephant etc. A nice, personal little touch. But then, this place is close-knit in feel and is all about the little touches. It is up to you to find these simple and sweet efforts that they make. They always endeavour to please and I only wish people appreciated the staff more, especially since they work very, very long hours and earn only $5-6.00 a DAY! The rooms: love the high, thatched ceilings, and hammock and it is always clean. They provide safe, bottled water each day as well. Security: excellent. Once at midnight, when we called to complain about the rowdy, obnoxious drunken and stoned, you guessed it, teenagers housed in our block, security was swift and immediate. Never had that arise again. Front desk: as mentioned in other reviews; the staff are dealing with chaos and ignorance on an hourly basis---they have the patience of saints and earn very little for it (I'd like to see a 40+ year old North American man or woman reduced to dealing with rude and pampered 16-18 year olds, who walk around with an heir of entitlement, with as much grace and aplomb as the staff did). A special mention: ALEJANDRO is exceptionally good. He made our car rental experience a positive one and expected no tip for any of the help he gave to me. He is que bien! Now for the three concerns: 1- The car rental company in the lobby- their prices varied from hour to hour, day to day. We wouldn't recommend using them at all. And the supposedly "safe" American car rental companies in town aren't any better either (Hertz, for example, deserves to be overlooked since one guy gave us the runaround after promising a car and making us kill time to wait for it, only to be unapologetically told later that they didn't have one after all). However, DO check out "Express" car rental. When my husband and I were in dire straits and couldn't seem to rent a car from anywhere in Playa Del Carmen, we happened upon "Express" car rental on the Xaman-Ha road near calle 2. Miguel was professional, very accommodating and had fantastic rates. We strongly recommend this small company (He even closed his shop temporarily to drive us back to the resort!) 2-The nightly entertainment: the Mexican food and entertainment night on Monday was fantastic, especially the regional dance performance from around Mexico. The other nights...not so much. 3- As mentioned earlier, and in no way the fault of the resort, the teenagers. My husband and I would DEFINITELY RETURN to the Allegro Playacar-but probably not during March Break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spring break (March 17 - 25) and were very happy with the Allegro. We went with a group of 20 which included 6 families with children from ages 15 on up. As you know, spring break in Cancun is the big thing for 18 and up kids. We wanted to be with our kids and be away from Cancun. The Allegro was perfect and being close to Playa Del Carmen worked out great. They could take a taxi into town for the evening and go to the popular spots if they wanted, but chose for the most part to just stay at the Allegro and go to the disco since it was all inclusive. They spent most of the day by the pool enjoying each others company and met lots of kids from other states as did the parents. However, there seemed to be alot of people from Minnesota at the Allegro. Rooms - The rooms were on the smaller side, but worked out just fine. Not alot of time was spent in the rooms. The hammock outside each room was great for naps. They were kept clean daily with fresh towels. The maids made cute decorations on the beds daily out of the towels. Grounds -The grounds were maintained daily. Beautiful gardens. Food - The food was good. You could always find something you liked. Lots of fresh fruit and salads. The egg omelets that are made to order were great for breakfast. The made to order pasta for dinner was also good. Sure, there was some weird stuff, but isn't there always when you go to diffferent countries. The snack bar by the pool was good at lunch time as was the pizza. The kids loved that they served pizza at night from 11:00 to 1:00 a.m. After a week, you do get tired of it to a certain extent, but we certainly did not go hungry. Beach - The poor beach. It would have been nice for the kids to have a beach to play volleyball or something on, but nothing you can do about it. There was quite a few hotels along there that have lost alot their beach due to the hurricane or whatever happened. We made the best of it! It did not ruin our vacation. Service - We never had any problems with anybody. The staff works extremely hard. Some of them I swear never go home. They are there in the early morning and still there late at night. Our room was close to the disco and the area they do the nightly show. The noice never bothered us. And believe me, with all the kids there on spring break at the disco until very late, it never kept us awake.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, NO problems”
Reviews.Author: Katzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allegro Playacar from March 11-18, 2005. We had a really relaxing as well as fun time and ate well, too! We booked our trip ONE week before we left. We were in our room probably 10 minutes after arriving at the resort! No problems there. The rooms: small but not TOO small. They are very quaint and felt like we were living in a tree house. I admit I was taken aback at first, but I grew to love our little home-away-from-home. There are shelves you can stack your clothes on next to the hangers, my husband just lived out of his suitcase but could have put stuff in the TV cabinet which was empty. The shower was NOT a problem -- we don't splash around so much while showering. Oh, and the water was always hot. The beds were fine -- I was shocked at first when I sat down on it, but never slept so well! The birds were heavenly in the morning! They're cooing, not squawking. A very relaxing way to wake up. It felt like we were in the middle of a jungle -- a banana tree right outside our room, iguanas, some pig/rodent creatures (there are signs out, I know, explaining what they are). One lone gecko ran up our wall---inside! That was cool. It's so relaxing to sit/hammock on your deck/patio. I think they're all shaded pretty well. The buffet is "fine" -- some things are tasty, some sort of strange. It's actually a fun experience. They had a great pasta chef a couple of times. We only had breakfast twice but that was very good. The Italian and Mexian are superb. Great service, and you also have waiters at the buffet getting you drinks. Very friendly. The Snack Bar was nice to have. I had chips, guacamole, cheese and salsa at least once per day -- it is to die for. My husband had hamburgers and hotdogs that were very good. The bar serves up any drinks -- they DO have top shelf liquors -- and any tropical drink you want. All water is filtered/bottled -- no worries. Anyway, make sure you try out some authentic Mexican food in town -- cheap and delicious. We ate away from there 3-4 times and it was all good. The beach: I will post a picture or two, but it's hard to tell since I took them from the pool deck. A lot of people used the beach. We got into the water and that was fun -- watch out for that surf. You can get boogie boards and those looked like a blast. The pool is RIGHT by the sea. You feel like it's ON the beach, so there's no reason to get all salty and sandy and be away from the food/drinks/fun that only the pool area has! You can take a break and walk down the beach, jump in the sea, but we really preferred being by the pool. Playa del Carmen is a 20 minute walk, 5 minute taxi ride. Take the taxi -- it's only 40 pesos. We went into town 6 times and it only cost us about $60, round trip. It's too hot to walk during the day and not recommended at night. Plus, you're walking around once you get there -- you don't want to be all worn out. There are so many shops and outdoor restaurants it's a lot of fun. There are live bands at night -- they were all good. We only caught parts of two shows at the hotel because we went into town almost every night. But those were very good and may get YOU involved whether you like it or not. Just remember no one knows you but the people you came with, and they'll get a kick out of whatever they make you do! It's fun. Complaint #1: Time share (vacation club) salespeople. The front people are very sweet and low pressure. Then they bring you to the heavy hitters and boy, can you feel cheap and stupid fast! I don't know why we did that. For free Cozumel ferry tickets? It would have been well worth our time and money to buy them and skip the sales pitch. We lost a precious two hours of our vacation time. Well, you never know, you MAY be interested in it. It's not a bad deal for the people that can use it. Complaint #2: Lounge chair saving. People are out saving their pool chairs at 6:00 a.m. (or earlier?) That wouldn't be SO bad if they actually used them. Some people next to us used their chairs for about 1/2 an hour all day, but saved them with their towels and belongings ALL DAY LONG. I don't know what could be done about that because they charge you for your towel if you lose it, so no one dares MOVE a towel that's been sitting there all day. All in all, the best features of the resort are the friendly staff -- hard working -- very long hours for those pool guys (players -- they are also entertaining at night) -- the beautiful, peaceful setting -- and the guacamole. It is really well worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “No Beach but Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravelRegina
Reviews.Content: We visited the Allegro March 3-11 and had our wedding there on March 7/05. We were a little nervous upon arrival as the reviews were somewhat questionable. We had a group of around 45, and everyone seemed to have a great time. The ages ranged from 6 mths old to 75. You need to go with an open mind and make the best of it....its your vacation have FUN. Food.....very good and wait staff was great...they loved to joke around with you and would do anything to make you happy. The buffet was a good variety, never got bored. Had the Italian a la carte for our wedding supper and it was superb. Mexican was also very good. Drinks.....plentiful. Though no straws. We had some ladies from Minnesota give us their stash when they left for home. BEWARE....found out late into our stay that the Chichen Itza s had no alcohol unless you asked for it Rooms.....we had ocean view. They were very small. Yes the beds are very hard though none of us seemed to have a problem sleeping in them. Your in Mexico....what are you doing inside your rooms???? Air conditioning didn't work upon arrival though was fixed within minutes when we advised them of the problem. Wedding.....was awesome. Was originally going to have it on the beach but that was out so we had it in the garden....was beautiful. Don't think they hold many weddings b/c our wedding planner didn't seem as helpful as she could have been....however we hired Claudia Rodriguez to do our photos.....she is absolutley amazing.....if anyone gets married in Mexico we highly recommend her. One of the nicest ladies I have met and does incredible work Staff......this was our favorite part. These people are working from early morning to late at night. They always have a smile on their face and want you to be entertained. No matter how many ignorant people they come across they are still willing to please you every waking moment you are there. Hats off to them. Our favorite part of our trip was talking with the staff and joining in their activities. Adan is the best. This is not a 5 star resort but if are going to have fun and catch some sun, its a great place to be.....45 sastisfied travellors can't be wrong. So those of you that have booked go and enjoy and don't sweat the small stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Made the best of it...”
Reviews.Author: chippewa7993
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Allegro Playacar. Stayed March 12 -17, 2005. We were made aware of the erosion problems after we had booked and paid for our room but decided to make the most of it and go. We traveled with two children (9 and 3) and they had a great time. Rooms: We had a first floor room, initially we wanted to upgrade to closer to the pool or ocean, but stayed in our room which turned out to be a good thing. We weren't bothered by late-night noise from the pool or the disco. Yes, the beds are incredibly hard, my hips were begging for my Serta. The kids slept soundly, as did my husband. There is Cartoon Network available in english or spanish which the kids enjoyed when they had to wait for Mom and Dad to get stuff together. Housekeeping did a great job for us and left extra bottles of water (3) everyday for us. All in all it was an accomodating room for sleeping in and showering. Food: There was kid friendly food available, pizza, hotdogs, hamburgers and fries. The breakfast buffet was fine, the children were happy and the egg lady was friendly. Lunch and Dinner Buffet were food, I cannot say that the food was exceptional, there was variety but in my opinion it was bland food. Buffet isn't my thing, but I didn't go hungry. I prefer european plan and taking the adventure and trying a new place nightly downtown, but with the kids in tow this year, there is no other way to go than all inclusive. Beer: The beer is Corona on tap. There are cans of Modelo available to some rooms.. not mine. The bar staff was very friendly and made all sorts of blended cocktails. Resort Grounds: It was beautiful. The groundskeepers should be commended, each day they rake up the fallen leaves and you have a garden to peruse at your leisure. Flowers in bloom, Iguana's, little lizards, it was fun to walk the grounds with the children to spot something new. Of course the lack of beach was a disappointment, but the kids wanted to be in the pool constantly. The surf was Awesome!! Abusive sure, dangerous too.. but warm water and exhaustive to play in. We thoroughly enjoyed the ocean anyway. Fun Club: The fun club is the resort staff provided to encourage you to participate in various activities, yoga, water aerobics, dance lessons, water volleyball, water polo, etc. They were around all day and constantly had upbeat attitudes and were friendly and engaging. The ladies of Kids Club ages 4-12 were very friendly and encouraging to the children, they had endless energy. Location: PDC is only a couple of miles away and without a beach your methods of getting there are walk, ride a bike (available through the resort) or take a cab. Cab was only 4$ usd each way. The one thing that I have to comment on. Although the staff is commendable in the multi lingual aspect, it lacks in encouraging you to use your spanish. Each year I hope to get better at my spanish, and it wasn't necessary, or encouraged to use spanish. I had hoped that my children would need to use it more, kind of an imersion, but they didn't need to and weren't encouraged at all?? All in all, we met some wonderful people while staying at the Allegro and will keep in touch with them, but it is doubtfull that we will ever stay at the Allegro again. PDC isn't for my kids, I didn't enjoy keeping the kids out of the shops. I will do all-inclusive again with the kids, perhaps in Cozumel hoping for fewer waves at the beach. But if I choose to go to PDC, I will find a hotel in town on a european plan for my hubby and I.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Fifiann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro in October 2004 on a half price Funjet all inclusive vacation. The Allegro is a good value 3 star resort on the edge of Playa Del Carmen. Please note that it is a three star. Many reviewers on this site have clearly gone there with 5 star expectations and so of course they were disappointed. The hotel is set in acres of beautifully maintained tropical gardens and the rooms are in small thatched buildings. The rooms are spacious enough and clean but no frills and the bathrooms are a little worn. They all enjoy large decks though with chairs and a hammock and it is a real pleasure to lie out surrounded by all the lush foliage. The beach is pretty but not amazing - if you walk further down the beach to the south it gets wider and less crowded. However, the pools are nice and the beach bar serves all the tropical drinks you could ever want. The buffet food is extensive and although not exactly gourmet, most people would be able to find something that appeals to them. Buffet food always gets boring after 3 days so I would recommend a meal out in Playa Del Carmen one night. The Italian restaurant at the hotel was hard to get a booking for and if you are only there for 3 or four nights it can be impossible. Our rep managed to wrangle one for us after we complained that the system was badly set up and penalised short stay visitors but unfortunately we were unable to use it in the end as we got back too late from a day trip. Personally, for just a few days, I enjoyed the snack food available from the beach bar. There are plenty of recreational activities available for free - hobie cat, kayacking etc and for a fee - scuba diving and parasailing and we had a lot of fun with these. I would recommend a day trip to Xcaret which offers lots of activities like floating down underwater rivers, swimming with dolphins and a fantastic butterfly enclosure. Try to go as a group in a taxi. The tour operator excursion was outrageously expensive. They add $30 a head onto the park admission fee to transport you there and it is literally 5 minutes drive away! I would not go to the Allegro for a honeymoon or to renew my wedding vows but it is an attractive, friendly and fun (but not too noisy) place for couples, singles and families alike who are looking for a good value short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned on March 14 after a week's stay...had a wonderful time... encountered no problems at all...food was delicious--quite a variety and choice of selections...rooms just great -- very clean. Except for the selling spiel for the Vacation Club (which we subjected ourselves to out of curiosity) this was a great vacation........visited Tulum on a trip arranged by the hotel and had a super trip there....can't say anything bad about the hotel...met some great people.....found the hotel manager very helpful when we had a problem with our Apple Representative (who never contacted us, never showed up, never helped us at all)....... Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Playacar from Feb. 17th - 25th and we had read a number of reviews regarding the beach and problems with the rooms. We went with 3 other couples and one of the reasons we went back to Playa Del Carmen was because of the water and the beaches. To see the majority of the beach gone, we were very sad but not surprised. Our main objective this vacation was to relax and really become beach bums and we pretty much accomplished that. 2 couples had second floor rooms and 2 couples had first floor rooms, the second floor rooms were very noisy with birds and critters and the first floor rooms were very musty and all rooms had hard beds. If you are a light sleeper do not get a second floor room. If you have a first floor room and keep the air conditioning off during the day and run it early evening you can get rid of most of the musty smell. Thought the food was pretty good at the main buffet, but limited choices at the snack bar by the pool. The chips/cheese/salsa was very good and had that every day and also the pizza was good - It was very nice to have pizza at night at 11:00 pm and to go down to the pool bar in the evening instead of just the disco. We ate at the Mexican and Italian restaurants, there was a small amount of food at the Mexican restaurant but we had a lot of fun with the waiters and the uno, dos, tres BAM! red tequila shots, we got a group picture with the somberos and our waiters and was very fun. We also went to the Italian restaurant, food was much better but took way too long - Almost 3 hours for dinner a little too long for our groups taste. We also suggest to get a day pass and go to the Allegro in Cozumel, the beach is beautiful and only costs $15 for a taxi when you get off the ferry, you can also go snorkeling right there at the resort and plenty of beach chairs, we took the 8:00 am ferry and that was plenty of time. Also walked down to the public beach called Mr. Sanchos which took about 20 min. from the resort and they have a bar, restaurant and shopping right there on the beach it was very nice. The day we were leaving there wasn't much left of the beach and they only had a limited amount of chairs, and overall the weather was great, we all came back with great tans, it was very relaxing and when your in Mexico with good friends how can you not have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star's a Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 8 day stay at the Grand Flamenco Xcaret but when we arrived with another couple we met on the plane - we were told that we did not have reservations there but that our reservations were for the Allegro Playacar. Nothing we did or said, including showing our Confirmation #'s helped. (We later found out that they had overbooked by 51 rooms). Their guests (with rooms) were offered 3 different options if they would give up their rooms, including free future stays, we were offered nothing. We even had to pay for the taxi to take us to the Allegro, while it was only $10 it is the principal of the thing that counts. When we arrived at the Allegro we were greeted by the front desk and our bags were immediately taken to our room. After first seeing the Grand Xcaret - what a disappointment!!! The staff at the Allegro was extremely nice and helpful but we had paid for a 5 star resort, not a 3 star. I would compare the Allegro to a Hotel 6, functional and adequate but definetly not what we paid for. The gounds are beautiful, beds are short and hard, we never had any problem with bugs but the rooms smelled musty and damp from the thatched roof. They look nice but my allergies absolutely did not like the smell. As far as the food goes, the buffet offered great variety but nothing was ever hot or even warm. We didn't go hungry but I want my hot food hot and my cold food cold. We were approached numerous times by the timeshare people until we gave in and listened to them. They really pressure you. Of course, they told us we wouldn't have had the problems we did if we were members. My feelings are that it shouldn't matter. If you paid for it, you should get what you paid for. We have e-mailed Occidental and am curious to see what they will do about this. The management staff at the Grand Xcaret was RUDE, especially their Manager, Raoul Martin. Even tho' he confirmed to our travel agent that he knew we had valid reservations, he told us we didn't and then ignored us, refusing to even acknowledge that we were there. Reading some of the reviews, I have the feeling that Occidental has a BIG problem with overbooking. In the good old USA, it is called FRAUD, but in Mexico they get by with it. If you are only looking for a neat, clean place to stay with no ammenities, then Allegro Playacar will be great. The beach is gone but that is no one's fault but mother nature. The only thing that Allegro has going for it is that it is only a short distance from Playa del Carmen. The Grand Xcaret is out in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Allegra the first week of Feb. Had heard about the beach and we were really nervous about what we were getting into. It was really wonderful. The grounds were so beautiful and extremely well groomed. I've never seem staff as polite and willing to help as they were. The bartenders by the buffet and Jorge in fast eddy's were great. The food was very good and lots of it. Drinks were plentiful and very good. The resort had no control over the beach and were trying so hard to correct it. We still had a wonderful time in the water, yes I'd have like a bigger beach to lay on but honestly it didn't result in any less fun. The rooms were ok with us, maybe not the fanciest but very clean, (no bugs) and no smells. Anyway how much time do you spend in a room when you have a wonderful resort and ocean just outside your door? The porch and Hammocks were fun! I think the people that complain are probably looking for 5 star resorts...then spend the money for one! Things got a little too quiet for us too early at night but where told by many that is the usual at all inclusive resorts. The 20min. walk into Playacar was very enjoyable and shopping there was a lot of fun. We'd go back to this resort in a minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please believe these reviews and do not waste your time there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are considering taking a trip to Cancun and staying at the Occidental Allegro Playacar, please reconsider and find a different resort. As mentioned in many of the reviews, there really is NO BEACH at this resort although they seem to be trying to fix it up. Being Canadians and not living near a beach, we travel south for that exact experience. Here's a brief summary of some of the things experienced at this resort....the rooms are quite a dissappointment since the beds are made of concrete with mattresses placed on top. If you like a hard bed, this might be acceptable for you. The walls, bathroom sinks and floors in the bathrooms are also made of concrete and then painted. The electricity went out twice in one week. The ceiling in the room was leaking until finally, a piece of dry-wall fell into the bathtub...luckily no one was in the shower at the time. The food in the buffet restaurants was somewhat edible, but not very good. The pool is usually cold until about 3:00pm when the sun finally starts to warm it up. These are only a few of the problems encountered at this resort, so please believe the reviews you read and take a look at the pics included.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise - no beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playcar from Feb. 17-Mar. 3/05. We enjoyed our vacation very much. When we arrived it was a great shock to see we had no beach - because the main reason we went to this area was because of the ocean and beach. We had no warning from Signature or our travel agent about this although I had read some reviews on the Trip Advisor. It was worse than we imagined. Also, trying to go swimming in the ocean was difficult because of the sandbags under the water. We did go in front of other resorts to enjoy the beach - but you have no drinks or chairs - so not really very nice. The positives first: The food at the buffet we found was excellent and lots of variety. We booked at the a la carte restaurants, Mexican and Italian once each, but found the food was better at the buffet. We also went into PDC twice and ate at local restaurants. The staff were excellent and very friendly. We tipped sometimes, but it didn't matter either way because we had good service. The grounds are beautiful and very neat and clean. Our room was adequate, but kept very clean by the staff. We were on the second floor under the palapa roof - I didn't really like that - but had no problems with musty smell or insects. Negatives were that the beds are very hard. We had a pad put on the bed but it didn't make much difference. We have stayed in many other resorts in Mexico but this bed was the hardest yet. There were not enough beach chairs - some people almost came to blows because of disputes over the chairs. Because of the lack of beach, space was very limited around the pool so that could have been part of the problem. We went over to the Allegro in Cozumel twice. It was wonderful and I recommend it. Despite costing us $50.00 cdn to go each trip it was worth it to enjoy the beach. I wonder if Signature would reimburse the cost? We loved the resort, but probably wouldn't go there again unless the beach comes back.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This trip was incredible. I had read some reviews before going and i was scared to go to this resort. But after reading some of the complaints and going there some people just can not be satisfied. The food was very good, it does get bland but you can stay at home and order in for every meal and it also gets bland. There was no beach but the pool activities were the best thanks to Adan, Esteban, and Andres. The staff will do anything for you. If you need a good drink just ask Manuel at the swim up bar to surprise you, as well as Jorge (Hor Hey) In Fast Eddies. The grounds are beautyful, the staff works so hard to keep everything in order. This was the best trip we had ever been on 2 weeks was not long enough. Don't worry about the bad reviews you read here because you will have the time of your life when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: PCfam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week (Feb. 20-27) at the Allegro and had a great time. We had a family group of 16 ranging in age from 2 to 65 and everyone had fun. The staff is wonderful, the grounds are beautiful and the rooms were clean and fine for our needs. The food and bars were great and my 2 year old is still asking when we can go to the Kid's Club-he had a great time there! The beach is definitely under seige but they are doing what they can to hang on to it. They had to remove 2 stairways while we were there and there are several palms trees that are going soon. But for our group the beach still worked out fine and you can take a short walk to other beaches. I did meet several senior citizens who were disappointed because it was hard for them to use the beach because of the restricted access and sandbags. If you have difficulty getting around and are looking to hang by the beach, you may want to look elsewhere until the beach is back.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and I met our friends down at the Allegro in Dec., they had already been there 1 week before us. this was when the beach started to wash away.We arrived on Dec. 31 and stayed for 2 weeks.
