It was the best 2 weeks ever. All of us had a blast, the staff was absolutely wonderful and we made many friends. Yes the beds were hard but we got use to them and slept like babies. Our rooms were clean and served the purpose.For the people complaining about no beach. Yes the beach was washing away and they were trying to save what they could but they weren't the only resort it was happening all along the beach,some places worse than others. At another 5 star resort they were gutting fish right in front of the resort, some people wouldn't like that either. It stunk! I was just happy to lay in the sun and have no worries,. that is what a holiday is for. Anyone who says that this resort was a poor one, all 18 of us have to disagree, we had from ages 9 to 76 and we all had a awesome time.The food,people and everything else was great. We would highly recommend the Allegro and we are going back.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Playacar a great resort”
Reviews.Author: littlesprite61
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Allegro Playacar. Were there from Feb 19-Feb 26. We had an awesome vacation and hope to go back soon. The staff and grounds at Allegro Playacar are top notch. The grounds are breathtaking. Every staff member we came into contact with from the Front Desk to the Towel Desk was wonderful. We would go back in a heartbeat. It is a great value. The beach-Yes it is pretty much gone. But since not the fault of the resort I will not blame them one bit. It is still beautiful and the beach will come back as nature has a way of putting things back to normal after storms. It actually got worse while we were there because a high tide came in with the full moon of Wednesday night. They lost their staircases going down to the beach and some palm trees. All of the staff, from housekeepers to bartenders worked all day Friday filling and hauling sandbags so that they wouldn't loose their sea wall. The security staff made sure all of the guests were kept safe. By morning more sand had come back and filled in around the bags so they were able to save the wall and the surf had calmed down a great deal. I saw all of the staff working so hard that day that I was moved by teamwork they all showed. Your experience is what you make of it and for us it was exceptional. We were a group of 3 couples traveling together from the Northern US.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: emmabelly
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at the Allegro and overall had a wonderful experience. I traveled with my mother and 4yr old daughter and we all had a great time! The only caveat to those booking their trips now... there is absolutely no beach left! We walked along the shore by the other hotels, and their beaches were great, so if beachfront is important to you, try the Gala, Iberostar or RIU. Other than the beach, the place was excellent! The rooms were small and yes, the beds were hard, but not unbearable. The grounds were beautiful, the food was great, the staff was very friendly, and there were tons of activities and entertainment for everyone. My daughter really enjoyed the kids club and my mom loved the shows at night. If you play tennis, they have a fabulous tennis coach (Isaac) on staff, and you can get free lessons every morning, or private lessons for only $25 (a steal!) Also, don't bother getting an "upgraded" room, it's the exact same room with a location closer to the beach (which also means closer to the noise), and an electronic room safe, that's all. We had one of these rooms and asked to be moved after the first night b/c the noise from the bar and restaurant were too much for my daughter to sleep at night. They were very accomodating and moved us the next day to a much more quiet room. If you're looking for peace and quiet, try the rooms in the 3200s or 3400s, if you want to be right next to the pool and bar, the 5200s are the best. The resort location was great, a short walk or $4 cab ride to town where you can shop or catch the ferry to Cozumel. You can get a day pass to the Allegro property there (which we did) and have full privelages there for the day. The resort there is almost identical, but they have a great beach and the water there is much calmer for those who want to swim in the ocean. As a resort, I'd highly recommend this property, as long as you don't mind the lack of beach. I'm definitely planning on returning to the area next year, but will probably try one of the other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Just back Allegro Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: sandgirl
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Allegro Playacar in Playa Del Carmen Feb 20th/05. Beach is mostly washed away, with lots of sand bags to keep a strip of 10 ft. available for some chairs. Ocean waves are quite high everyday , so the red flag is usually up. this however didn't stop us from swimming. Pools were cold , but this is nice because the weather was a perfect 85 to 90. Staff were extremely helpful and always smiling. Food was ok , but only one buffet restraunt available . Food there got pretty tiring. they also have a Italian and Mexican restraunt, but we only got one pass into each in our 2 week stay. Snack bar by pool was just ok hamburgers, hot dogs and such. Also pizzeria by pool. The grounds were beautiful with lots of flowers and well groomed. Lots of little animals like Tapiers , eguanas, camielions, lots of different birds. The birds do wake you up in the morning at first light, but to us this was very pleasant as we are early risers. Because of the beach you couldn't walk down to Playa Del Carmen to the ferrys or to shop. Taxi cabs are $4.00 us one way or $3.00 us if you flag one down on the street in front of the hotel. We think next year we will try for a Riu Hotel, because there is more variety and most people we met said they are the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the resort after spending a week, (Feb 13-Feb 20th) and we loved it. This was the first time myself and my friends were ever in Mexico and I have to say I was a little nervous about what to expect. I was very pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very quant, but I didn't go to Mexico to spend time in the room. The food buffet had a great variety. In fact at the buffet each night they changed the theme to mix it up a little. The location to Playa de Carmen was just right because we either walked or took a taxi, which was only $4.00 US. The grounds and gardens were emacualte. I have to be honest I was surprised at the beach, however I expected to see hurricane damage from all the storms. That is something that just happens. Further down on the beach it wasn't so bad. You can tell they were trying to save what they had left. Once you were in the water however, you really didn't care what the beach looked like. Water was beautiful! I found the staff and management to all be very helpful and VERY friendly to all. They all made eye contact and said hola everytime you passed them. We did have an issue with our air conditioner, however maintenance came within 15 minutes of the call and fixed it right away. The gentleman even came came back and checked on us the next day to make sure everything was working. We booked our vacation with Funjet and were very pleased with their overall service. We did not like our Funjet representative at the resort though. She lacked on her customer service skills and wasn't very clear about some of our day trips. HOWEVER everything worked out and we found if we asked any of the other representatives they were more than happy to help us out and answer our questions. I got my pictures back today and I wish I was back there again verse the snow I am looking at right now. This is a great place and we will be visiting there again! I would recommend this resort and we will be visiting it again!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Quaint and Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: LoriRayManitoba
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. The first night we were bumped to the Iberostar due to overbooking (seems to be an ongoing problem with the Allegro) but that was ok as it allowed us the opportunity to see what a 5 star was like. Once settled into the Allegro the second night, we were happy to see that there wasnt much difference. The Allegro was smaller...but more quaint. The rooms are small but very clean. We never had too much of a musty smell. (some people complain about the smallest details) The grounds are meticuloulsy kept. the food was wonderful and we never found the buffet repetitive. WE enjoyed the Mexican and Italian restaraunts and they now have a new "Grill" poolside (great ribs) The beach is almost non-existant but we knew that before we got there. They are doing there darndest to sandbag and save the trees and palapas. Once into the turquoise clear water you forget the beach has eroded. If you want to see a gorgeous. calm beach, take the local buses ($2.00) from PDC to Akumal. We snorkelled right off the beach and saw giant sea turtles. Our only complaints were the loud music at night from the Disco (til 1:00 am), and around the activity pool thru the day and the nightly entertainment was good...but loud also. and the beds are hard but they were at the 5 star too!!! Careful with the bikes, some of them aren't really road worthy. We had a great time during our 2 week vacation and would stay here again. The Playacar area is gorgeous and we felt safe all the time. Please email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Hot & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: gtogto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks & although we were looking for a beach holiday there wasn't one due to the huricanes,But that's not the hotel's fault. FOOD:- There was a lot of variety on the the buffet and enjoyed most nights,other than the mexican night, that was the only resturant open and coping with a full hotel got to be a pain and lenghty queues. The Italian was passable but we preffered the buffet. Poolside lunch was very good Pizza,Burgers,Fish,Nacho's etcccc. ROOMS:- Beds are very hard because the mattress is on a concrete base. Our room was very clean and well maintained No problems other than they were a bit on the small side (It helps to leave a tip each day we left a dollar). ENTERTAINMENT:- There is a show every evening but they start at 9pm which we found to be to late,because there is nothing to do after you have had tea.The guys round the activity pool were excellent and work hard to please.Say hello to Oscar,Esteban,Adan & Andreas they are a good laugh,but if you don't want the activity then there is a relaxing pool. Would we go there again No due to there being to many places in the world to visit but I would reccomend this hotel BUT ONLY FOR A WEEK because the routine is replicated every week.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing... Never Stay there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived for our honeymoon to the Allegro on January 30, 2005, we were shocked when we saw that the beach had been eroded away. This is not what it looked like in the brochures and the website. The water was right to the edge of the property and there were sand bags placed all over to slow down the erosion. Men worked everyday filling sand bags and placing them along the beach. Palm trees had fallen over and the beach was inaccessible. There was a sign posted apologizing for the loss of the beach due to seasonal changes. That was a little too late to tell us since we were already there. I didn't care about the pools I wanted a resort with a beautiful beach front, and that is what I was looking for when we were booking in December. The hotel management said that the beach had been gone for about 2-3 months and that the Tour companies were aware of this and that we should have been told. Well we were not told this by Signature Vacations or our travel agent at Sear Travel. Signature vacations must be getting compensated for this from the hotel but they are not passing on to their customers. I did not pay $ 4,200 to see a washed up beach. As well, we had asked for a suite closer to the beach or pool well we couldn't get further from both we were beside the disco. When we complained the hotel management said that thoughs suites near the beach and pool are for time share holders and vacation club guests. They said that there where only about 10 units left on the resort for the tour companies and they where at the back, and showed us on the map of the resort. When we arrived at the airport in Cancun we recieved a card from a Signature representative to meet in the lobby at the resort the next morning at 11:00, there we would meet Catherine and she would fill us in on all the amenities. We waited from 10:45 to 11:30 in the lobby and she never showed up. We got our information from the hotel management. We never did meet anyone from Signature vacations. The resort is listed as a 4 star, it is more like a 2. You never knew if you were going to have hot water, the rooms were musty smelling, and the beds were terrible. We were very mislead by the brochures and website on this property as shown by Signature vacations. We will never go back to this property and probably never book with Signature Vacations again. As customers we should be made aware of the conditions of the beach especially as it had already been gone for 2-3 months. I can go anywhere to sit beside a crowded pool for 7 days not quite the same affect as the beach has. Very poor way to spend a vacation and $ 4,000.00.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints-Awesome resort A++++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Allegro Jan 31st- Feb 5th and loved every minute. We were worried after reading all the bad reviews but went with a positive attitude. Here is our opinions... Yes, the beds are on the firm side but we were so tired it didn't matter. The rooms may be small and a little rustic but everything was extremely clean and functional. The food was good, large variety and always avaliable- plus I didn't have to cook it!! The entire staff, including the front desk, were some of the nicest people I've met. Our luggage was delayed and they were on top of it immediately. We did tip the maid, bartenders and waitress about $1 a day. Day and night entertainment was great- they keep you busy! The beach may be gone but we had a great time using the boogie boards and boats. Then we would return to our chairs by the pool to lay in the sun. By the way, you can still find chairs all day, you don't need to be up at 6am. We loved the Xel-Ha tour! If you do this, pick the all day package. We were there from 10am-5pm and still didn't do all we wanted. They have tubing, snorkeling, caves, cliff jumps and more. A short walk to Playa provided a day of shopping- just stay on 5th Avenue! We also parasailed in front of the resort- it was great! We would definately stay again. We did not expect the royal treatment and were just happy to be on vacation in such a beautiful, clean and friendly resort. Some people always complain and will find fault anywhere they go but we could find nothing wrong at Allegro except those people that did complain.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews, I was a bit hesistent when we arrived. The property and all the facilities were clean and well maintained. Yes the beds were hard and not much of a beach, but not the hotel's fault. We like a hard bed, so that was OK. We spent some time every day on the beach - although not very expansive (due to the loss of a good deal of beach due to the hurricane's in the late summer of 2004) and found a lounge each time. The ocean was crystal clear blue and a refreshing, with little undertow. How much beach does 1 or 2 people need??? All of the staff were friendly and very helpful, including the front desk, at no time did we fell any of the staff expected a tip for the outstanding service. We enjoyed the food at the buffet and both restaurants - but make your reservations as soon after check in as possible - they fill up quick. This was my second trip to Mexico and I enjoyed our stay at the Allegro much more than my prior trip. It was smaller, but I felt you got to know staff better, and had as much in activitites and amentities as the hotel we stayed at in downtown Cancun. The shows were Ok - if you saw one, you saw them all - lots of dancing, but at least it was something to do after dinner, in stead of going to town. Drinks were free flowing and they would make anything requested, on one particular night I was in the mode for a flavored martini and the bartendar made me one of the best melon martini's I ever had. One other suggestion - I would rent a car to get around the next time, taxi's and transfers from Cancun to Playa are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Tulum and then some”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico, and I have to say, I fell in love with this region. At first, all I could see were the poor conditions, despite the tourism, Playa Del Carmen is poor by Canadian standards. After a week, I saw a region rich with life and realized that the happiness the locals show is genuine. This, and the beaches, will bring me back every year. Now on to the resort itself. Luckily, I was a trip advisor reader, and was prepared for this resort. To confirm, beds are hard, bathrooms often smell of raw sewage, walls are made of paper. Birds are noisy, and something I haven't read yet, BATS are everywhere at night. Not a problem, just beware of falling guana. My friend has a stain that just won't come out.. Despite the bathroom smell, the rooms were very clean, sheets and towels fresh smelling. I brought a small mist air deoderizor, and we kept the garbage pail over the drain in the bathroom and the door shut. The beach, or what is left of it. Take the advertisment pictures and cut the beach in half. We didn't have a problem finding a chair on the beach, as long as we were up at 6:00am to put our towels down! By the way, leave only the towels. Some people mentioned their books being stolen, and I had a hat stolen. Otherwise, the ocean front is breathtaking. Other things to mention, do not be fooled by people in dress shirts with name tags who look like they are hotel guides. If they ask you to breakfast, or any meal, be wary. They are time share salespeople. Fine if you are interested in time shares, but a warning, a breakfast with one can take up your entire morning. I was with my friend, and we were not their target. Beware if you are a couple. I've seen many comments on the food. The buffet food does tire after a week. The desserts are all made of geletin, no pastry chefs here. The Italian restaurant was very good. I would suggest making your reservations early. We found that the 6:30pm reservations were the best. After that, they get behind, and some people were waiting up to two hours for their reservation. The staff is awesome. Regardless if you tip or not, it is just their nature. I did take more than $50 in ones, and glad of it. The hotel does not readily exchange large bills to small, and in town, they prefer to give you change in pesos. The nightly entertainment was top notch. Something for everyone. If you are interested in excursions, a small and affordable one is the "Marj and Glen" Tulum Experience. It will only cost you $4 for the bus out of Playa Del Carman and $4 for your entry into the ruins. It will however cost you $12 in bandaids if you do not wear socks with your shoes. Also included is the cardi workout through Playa Del Carmen backyards, a good way to work off that buffet! In summary, this hotel is not a 5-star. YOu will be disappointed if you are looking for high class and luxury. What you will get is a hotel that is unpretentious, a place without airs, with a group of people who will all complain about their rooms, while sitting in 86 degree weather, sipping beverages, with an ocean the colour of turquoise as their backdrop. My suggestion, stay out of the room as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “First trip in 3 years...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip in 3 years and the only thing that I can say is.....Occidental Allegro Playacar is not a 4 or 5 star hotel. The hotel claims that they spent close to 2million in renovation. I think they spent more money on their lobby then any other area. The front desk service was terrible extremely terrible, we were booked for a superior room with king size bed and a beach view. We got a room with two double beds and an awful location. They were willing to move us but not until someone checked out. Or toilette was always in need of a plunger as the service man carried around in this plastic bag. One night it took 4 calls in the matter of 6 hours for the front desk to send someone to unblock our toilette. Along with this our fourth day our room was not cleaned and it was already 4PM. The breakfast was a 4 star, lunch and supper I will give 2 stars. As for table service lets say that I will never go to this hotel even if it was offered for free.

Reviews.Title: “Some Beach Not Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Allegro with 4 other couples 1/18 to 1/25 and had a great time. First of all let me tell you there is no beach to speak of. Just enough room for a row of chairs. Did not see anyone use the beach the entire time we were there. There is plenty of room around the pool, But get there early to reserve a lounge chair. Service was excellent. A large variety of drinks to choose from. A little tipping goes along way. Food was okay but after a week it got a little boring which is to be expected. The rooms were small but nice. Beds were hard but you are so tired at the end of the day you could sleep any where. Maid service was excellent they left a little something on your bed, towels shaped as a swan, dog etc. nice little touch. Never had any problems with the front desk always very helpfull and friendly. If you can, get to know Estavon, he is one of the game coordinators. He is very personable, funny, and a real card. If you want to, which is what we did,is get a day pass from this resort and you can spend a day over at the other Allegro in Cozamel. This one has a beautiful beach. Again everyone is extremely friendly.Monday is Mexican night were they set the food out side and have entertainment while you eat. All in all it is a good resort but would not go back untill the beach is back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway Week! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our week last fall and then began to read all the reviews about this resort going downhill, losing its beach, marginal food, problems with the room, bugs, noise, etc. I want to write that my wife and I and another couple vacationed here last week (January 20 - January 27) to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversaries and we absolutely had a wonderful week. We're from Des Moines, Iowa and it was about 70 degrees warmer in Mexico. I'll try to address one issue at a time to put you at ease if you have planned a trip here or are about to. 1) Funjet .. We booked through a travel agent but it was a ..Funjet trip. Our airline filed bankruptcy and cancelled some flights including ours and Funjet had other options for us within 2 days. The flight times were even better for us. 2) Reception staff at the Allegro (front desk). We had no problems at all. There wasn't a line, we were checked in promptly, our bags were taken immediately to our rooms. I do need to point out that we vacationed from a Thursday to a Thursday. Perhaps there are problems on the weekends or at holiday times. 3) Overbooking ..while it may happen, it didn't to us. Again, maybe coming in on a Thursday helped us. 4) Small rooms ...We did not travel to Mexico for a large room. We went for vacation. The room was more than adequate in both size and features. Our room was somewhat near the pool and the beach and I feel that is probably preferable. You need to walk farther to the buffet, but you are close to the action. 5) Hard beds .. yes, they were harder than we were used to, but we had no problems getting to sleep and we did not request additional padding. We received our request of a King bed and it served a dual purpose as a place to spread out our stuff during the day depending on what we needed for the next activity. After a full day of activities, we had no trouble going to sleep. 6) The grounds... they are beautiful, well maintained, watered, and its paradise. 7) The food ...no problems. We had no difficulty in getting reservations to both the Mexican and the Italian restaurants. You must make your reservation at least a day ahead. Not a problem. Even though we had success, I could understand the possibility of scheduling problems, as there are a lot of guests and only so much seating in these restaurants. The menu was fine and the atmosphere was great. We were very satisfied with the buffet, but it was nice to break up the week with some sit down menu service and a more leisurely meal. The buffet food was varied and plentiful. Breakfast allows you to have a smoothie or an omelet made to your order. Lots of fruit, juices, cereals, cold meats, pancakes, etc. One surprise entree for breakfast that we came to enjoy was refried beans! If you get busy (or lazy) at the pool, there is food service near the pool so you don't even need to change out of your swimsuit. I recommend the hot dog and tuna pizza (seriously!) 8) Shopping ...you have 2 choices within walking distance. Plaza Playacar is a small shopping center that also doubles as a pick up spot for some tours in case they don't originate at the Allegro. It is a 5-minute walk at most. The other walking option is downtown Playa del Carmen. It's a strong 15-minute walk (or a $5 cab ride). While I suggest asking the cab fare before you get in, we were always quoted $5 and that's what it was. You will want to look for or get directions to 5th Avenue. We had to go twice as there was more shopping than we could accomplish in one afternoon. While the bars and restaurants were very enticing, we had our meals at the Allegro. Shopping tip: prices are negotiable even in many of the brick and mortar stores, especially the jewelry ones. I had the price of a pair of shot glasses go from $16 to $3 in one negotiating session. Do some comparison-shopping if you like to wheel and deal. 9) Noisy birds ... this may be a problem if you get a room upstairs. We were on level one and did not have a problem. Occasionally you could hear the birds and perhaps more often in the morning, but they never woke us up. 10) Bugs in the rooms ... yes, there were some small bugs crawling around. I expect that it's hard to avoid. They caused us no trouble and were not a bother. 11) Activities ... there were many activities to join in or watch or ignore. It's your vacation. The resort simply provides opportunities. There was a show every night and they were always entertaining. A bit too much dancing in the shows to suit my tastes, but they were excellent dancers. Some of the comedy bits and audience participation events were very funny and entertaining. 12) Fiesta night is Monday. Meal is served outdoors and there was a mariachi band. 13) Tours ... we actually booked our tours off site and were very satisfied. Tours can be booked on-site but you may wish to shop around a bit. Options include taking a "free tour" at Allegro or another resort (this is an attempt to sell a vacation club membership). We did so and did not buy but we did get free tours. There are also tour sales in town right on the street. Not really any need to pay a higher price for the same tour just because it is being sold at your resort. Note that if you buy elsewhere, you may get picked up at a site other than at the Allegro. If you do, be very sure you know where it is that you are being picked up..and do not rely on the reps on site (Allegro) if you purchased elsewhere. We were misled and almost missed a tour. 14) Cocktail service .. not only were the drinks tasty, they were made to order if possible. Some bars did not always have Kahlua, but the substitute was nearly as good. Also, while you could go up to the bar (walk up or swim up), there was often waiter service even while you were lounging in your chair. 15) The showers ... you have read about them in other reviews. Rather than being upset, we laughed about it. Other than not having a door, the shower was fine. It was large enough, the water was hot, towels were close, and it was always dry by the next morning. Complaints should only be if the room doesn't have a shower or it doesn't work. 16) The staff ... We did not have a single problem with any Allegro employee. They were always accommodating, helpful, and wearing a smile. 17) Tips are not necessary to get superb service. We tipped only for luggage handling and for our housekeeper..those towel designs left on the bed were very enjoyable. 18) The beach ... yes it washed away. Yes, it's not what it used to be. But, there is still some beach, still chairs on it, still beach activities, still beach swimming, kayaking, etc. Enjoy what you have. Don't despair over what couldn't have been prevented. I hope that you enjoy your trip as much as we did. If you have questions before you go, Email me at BERGIE77@aol.com and use "Allegro vacation" as your subject.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, beautiful gardens, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations the first week of Jan 2005 and we were not bumped. I would guess that may be a travel agency thing. The beds are very uncomfortable and short. The food was good and there was a great deal of items to choose from. There were activities going on all day at the pool however not many were focused on children. The relaxation pool was quieter. It was no fault of the resort obviously, but there was no beach left. The shopping area of Playa Del Carmen was a 3 minuted cab ride and a 15 minute walk through what appeared to be a safe area. There is also a shopping area directly across the street with souvenir stores. The rooms were very nice and clean. ALL of the staff were friendly and helpful. Also, a lot of the staff spoke multiple languages, primarily French, English, Spanish and some German. The drinks were made well and there was quite a bit of variety. Parasailing, jet skiing, snorkeling, boogie boarding, and wind surfing can be done right at the resort, however motorized water sports are an additional charge. Most of the guests appeared to be in their 40's. Overall, it was a great vacation with wonderful amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Completely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mom4marley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro from 01/05-01/13/05 after being bumped from the Wyndham Maya - which we had reservations for since 07/04! 1.) No one mentioned that there was NO beach left, but I should have checked Trip Advisor before going! We had one little, tiny spot on the "sand bar" and were asked to move because they needed to fill sand bags from our spot. What's a vacation on the Riveria Maya without a beach??? 2.) We found the front desk staff to be rude and unconcerned with our (daily) problems. We had requested a 2nd floor non-smoking room and they put us in a 1st floor smoking room directly across from the pool bar. When they FINALLY moved us, it was a 2nd floor room directly outside of the theatre where they did the nightly shows. We couldn't have slept if we wanted to. We asked to be moved to a different room when someone else checked out, but they never did. They said it was over-booked (we were not asking for an ADDITIONAL room, just to be moved when someone else left - let the next people have our room). 3.) Everything you read about the horrible beds being too hard is SO true! My husband slept in the hammock outside the room most nights. 4.) Our toilet kept over flowing and the sink and tub took hours to drain. Since there is no curtain or door on the shower that just drained onto the bathroom floor. It also took at least 30 minutes of continually running the water in the mornings before it even got luke warm. 5.) For an All-Inclusive place, if you don't tip the maid, you get little service. Also, do not trust that the maid will not touch your personal belongings. Lock up anything and everything of any value to you. I learned this lesson the hard way. 6.) The two "specialty" restaurants were the 2 worst meals we ate there. We had to make reservations for them and even then we had to wait for 45 minutes at the Italian place. 7.) On the good side - the service staff were some of the nicest people I've ever met. They bust their butts to please you - it's the managing staff that need improvement. The bartenders, wait staff, grounds staff, etc. deserve your tips. This was also one of the cleanest kept places I've ever seen. We will NEVER return to the Allegro Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “The beach is gone!”
Reviews.Author: QXflyer
Reviews.Content: Jan 15-22 2005 The beach is gone - completely eroded by last falls hurricanes. There is a strip near the hotel with a row of chairs, but surrounded by sandbags to stop further erosion. Almost impossible to walk on the beach unless one of your legs is two feet longer than the other. A real slope from the hotel to the water. Bring water shoes! One young woman cut her foot on something in the water the 1st day and ended up with 3 stitches and a wheelchair! Grounds beautiful, staff wonderful. Food and drinks plentiful, they have the same chicken/fish/pork type entrees every night at the buffet, but change the type of sauce everyday. The pools are not heated, so not many people used them as they were quite cold. The beds were fine, with a foamy thing under the sheets. Every room had small chairs and a table out on the deck and a hammock. 15 minute walk to Playa del Carmen. Hotel internet never worked, but dial up connections in Mexico have lots of problems. There are many internet cafes that charge a buck or two and are very helpful as the keyboards are totally different than ours. For example to get the @ symbol you need to enter ALT 64. Hard to compare resorts as the security escorts you out if you don't have one of their wrist bands on. No snooping around. Canun airport is a ZOO! Everyone wants to grab your bags and take you in their cab or bus - make sure you know what you are doing! They all sound like they are there to pick you up! There are no complaints about the Allegro whatsoever - your attitude gets you what you give!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booking this trip we found little from our age group here so here's a little something for the twenty-somethings (24+23 years old from NY - first time in mexico). We read the reviews and were skeptical after booking our trip but figured we would go to the Allegro with an open mind (1/9/05-1/16/05). Our first impressions were not good after seeing the front of several other resorts on the way. The Allegro has a smaller facade than other resorts, the beach had washed away, and yes, the beds are extremely hard. Despite this we went to sleep the first night excited for our first day. Among four star resorts the Allegro is five stars. The ages range, but if you're concerned about kids it was never an issue. You hardly notice the ones that are there, yet those that were seemed to have a great time. The advice to treat the staff as friends rather than servants couldn't be more correct. The few words of Spanish I spoke kept the staff smiling and they couldn't be happier to make you drinks all day long. Good advice is to bring $50US in singles for tipping. It's not mandatory or even expected half the time but a dollar here and there gets you a long way. The beds are hard - so what, you're only there for a few hours anyway, we slept just fine. There are no alarm clocks and language barrier becomes a problem sometimes for wake up calls, but the birds were pretty effective at letting us know it was time to wake up every day (we were on the 2nd floor). The shower is odd with this small piece of glass and no curtain but it didn't cause a mess and the water was plenty hot. The house keeper was outstanding (left towel sculptures every day with flowers on them). Overall, the grounds were very clean and well kept. The Fun Club was the best. Estevan and Andres kept us occupied all day in the pool with water polo, tequila volleyball, or whatever other crazy game they had planned. Definitely go to Cancun with Estevan if you're into that sort of thing - Coco Bongo is wild. What beach is left is beautiful and even though the forecast called for rain it was beautiful every single day (10 minutes of rain). On that note bring PLENTY of sun block. If you need to re-up in mexico, they charge $17US everywhere in mexico. We never heard from a single person about any timeshare or anything like that, so I don't know what people are talking about with pushy sales people. The people who do solicit you on the beach are parasail or jet-ski people but we even made friends with a few of them. Not interested? "No gracias." Is all you need. Take advantage of all there is to offer. The service and the food in the sit down restaurants were outstanding (and we're from NY - we hate everything). Also, we had no problem getting reservations and we didn't do it the first night. Just remember it's called a "reservation" - first come first serve. The buffets are exactly that - a buffet. The food is not gourmet, but they are making food for a large amount of people and attempting to keep things fresh for hours on end. We had no problem finding something to eat. On the beach I think we took part in every activity there was to offer both motorized and non-motorized. Their outdoor massage right by the beach is awesome. For expeditions the Tulum/Xel-ha tour is fantastic - they don't tell you how beautiful these places are. Playa Del Carmen is nice but you have to look around to find the really cool places. Playa is where the pushy people are. They will call you as you walk down the street and try to coax you into their store, but those people are just trying to make a living - it's a very friendly atmosphere. Try Deseo (trendy rooftop lounge type bar), The Blue Parrot (on the beach with swings for seats), and maybe the pub crawl (Carlos&Charlies, Senor Frogs, and some other place), and take a cab to Aleux - it's a restaurant in caves that's amazing. We had no problem with the water. We brushed our teeth with bottled water but other than that the glasses on your table at dinner are filled with bottled water and the ice is purified in the frozen drinks so drink away!! The key is that those who complain a lot never have fun anywhere they go. We didn't go out looking for this vacation to be Cancun-style-crazy, just a good time at the beach away from the snow. We had the time of our life and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We were bumped 'cause it was overbooked!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how a resort could be overbooked when reservations were made in November, but it was when we arrived on January 6. We were told that we were to stay at the Barcelo Maya resort about 20 minutes away. Needless to say that after getting up at 4 am to catch our flight and a 45 minute drive from Cancun, we weren't very happy. However, it turned out that we were upgraded to a 5-star resort and were thrilled with everything Barcelo offered, including a long wide beach with powder sand. My advice is to forget Occidental Allegro Playacar (which is tucked away with at least 10 other resorts and a housing development) and spend the extra money to stay at Barcelo and have a fabulous holiday.

Reviews.Title: “bumped from the allegro and was happy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: please note that we did not stay at the allegro playacar. we were a group of 13 friends that booked the allegro months ago. we knew the area, and that the beach was lovely. however, we found out at the cancun airport that we had been bumped to the barcelo maya in port adventuras. my husband was furious! the allegro had overbooked. when we arrived at the barcelo it was obvious that it was a beautiful 5 star resort.we were thrilled to have been upgraded to a superior hotel. anyway, we went to the allegro to check it out and see what we had missed. it appeared to be a nice resort, pretty gardens, nice pools... however, upon making our way down to the beach, IT WAS GONE! the lovely beach that we knew was not there! hurricane ivan had destroyed it last autumn. the "beach" was almost non existent, with room for maybe 1 row of lawn chairs! i cannot imagine it improving anytime soon. we were so happy that we were not staying at the the allegro, because our beach was so gorgeous. please be advised! i had to write to warn anyone who is planning a trip there to carefully reconsider your plans.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: anon37
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro Playacar the first week of January 2005. I have never been to Mexico or stayed in an AI, so although I rated this resort as "average", it is not intended as a comparison to any other resort. What I mean by average is that some parts were good, some could have been improved. 1. Grounds/staff. The grounds were clean and well kept. The pools are nice and big enough. We did not have any trouble finding a recliner in the morning, but I noticed that they did fill up in the early afternoon. The beach, for the most part, was gone (only a few feet wide at times). Our rep told us that Hurricane Ivan caused a lot of erosion, which exposed the rocks. As the rocks became exposed, the sea hit harder, which caused more erosion, and so on until there is very little beach. I don't know if this explanation is true or not, but the beach is gone. The staff, with the exception of the front desk, are friendly and will do their best to accomodate you. The front desk staff seem oblivious to you, and ignore you whenever possible. Stay away from the man who calls himself the concierge - he is a time share salesman. 2. Rooms. Small, but clean. The best comparison I can think of is a Motel 6 in the U.S. Adequate, but not luxurious. I did not go to Mexico to spend time in my room, however. The beds are hard, but no one in my group of 6 had trouble sleeping. Our A/C worked almost too well. 3. Food/drink. As others have said, breakfast is the best meal, but we always found something to eat, and no one in my group of 6 had any digestive problems. This is buffet-style food designed to feed the masses, not gourmet. Like going to a too-large wedding where quantity is more important than quality. If you want bacon, ask a waiter. Lunch at the pool was better (chicken wings, burgers, chicken, fish, salads, nachos) than lunch in the cafeteria. My wife said the fish at the pool snack bar was very good. The pizza bar had frozen pizza with some regular toppings and some very strange toppings (for instance, hot dog pieces). We ate dinner at the Mexican restaurant once, which was good. No trouble making reservations. We did not try the Italian restaurant. Drinks - we had no problems getting drinks and the bar staff will add more alcohol if you ask. The resort serves only two beers - Corona and a darker beer called Negro Modela. Both are draft. If you want non-draft beer, any of the little sundries stores on 5th Avenue in PDC sell Bud, Bud Lite, and/or Coors Light for $1.00 USD per can. 4. Entertainment. The activities pool seemed always busy, and everyone seemed to be having fun. The shows at night are not Broadway, but if you want Broadway, go to NYC. They consist mostly of dancing men, dancing women in thongs, and lip-syncing. 5. Surrounding area/activities. We went on the Koba/Pac Chen tour offered by Alltournatives. The tour company is good, and the tour is good. Doing group activities can be annoying, though, because you are always waiting for someone. Bring pesos and rent a bike at Koba. The main pyramid is about a 30 minute walk, which does not leave much time for exploring it or the other ruins unless you ride. PDC is about a mile away from the Allegro Playacar. This is an easy, safe walk past some ruins on the right where we saw a lot of iguanas, lemurs, and other creatures. There is a "mall" when you first get to town on the right with a bathroom on the second floor. To get to 5th avenue and the beach, make a right on one of the side streets in town and go one block.

Reviews.Title: “We had a memorable family holiday at the Allegro”
Reviews.Author: macloi
Reviews.Content: We had a memorable family holiday from Dec. 26 - Jan. 8. Seventeen in our family ages l0 to 82 and thirteen in our friends family ages l7 to 73. Eight of the kids were l7 to early 20's and they had an absolute blast as they were participants in most of the activities that were presented. The activities staff did a superb job at organizing the water polo, water games, volleyball etc. We had read so many poor reviews of the Allegro before we went but we wasnted to let other people know it was a perfect place for a family group. If you were there as a couple and wanted peace and quiet, it might not please you. We were in the 5600 building, had a bit of an ocean view and close to the pools etc. It was noisy in the daytime, but that was just fine as we weren't in the room anyway. The food was pretty good. There was a lot of choice at breakfast - we had every lunch down at the snack bar, but some went upstairs to have a more sedate lunch. They had great soups, hamburgers, pizza, salad bar and wonderful guacamole and nachos. They did have a different main meat or fish every night - pork roast, roast beef, or lamb. The vegetables were fine and always fruit, salads and the pasta section. We were there l3 nights and ate at the Mexican restaurant twice and the Italian once. The entertainment was fun - we were there every night and our kids or some of the grandkids were always participating so we enjoyed it. It was better than my expectations. The grandkids enjoyed the disco, but also went into Playa a few times. My husband had to see the doctor as his cold was so bad and the medication he put him on was the answer, so maybe we were just lucky. He seemed like a nice little man and has an office at the hotel. A holiday is what you bring to it and maybe we were fortunate that we had no negative happenings. By the way we were never approached by the timeshare people at the hotel. They were sitting there every day but never called us over or bothered us. The staff were very happy and pleasant and we had lots of fun with some of the wait staff. Can't comment on the front desk as we didn't have any problems to talk to them about. Of course, there are always picky little things you could mention, but we were there for a good time and had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Beth066
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Allegro Dec 26-31, 2004. Reading the previous comments I must admit, my expectations were lowered. Upon arriving we found that the hotel was overbooked by 90 (!) rooms. My parents and sister were moved to the hotel next door also owned by Occidental, Royal Hideaway for all 5 nights. While this was an "upgrade" for them, my husband and I were not allowed to visit, use facilities or dine at their location. We later found that the other overbookings arriving later in the day were being sent to hotels 15 KM away or back to Cancun or Cozumel. The hotel staff blamed the reservation agency in Spain and operators such at Funjet and Worry Free vacations for the overbookings. We booked through Funjet, who when confronted, blamed the hotel. - The hotel was nice with activities throughout the days like Spanish lessons, yoga, water games for teenagers and nightly shows (mostly geared toward families with preteen or teenage kids). The Italian and Mexican restaurants (reservations req'd) were difficult to book with available dining times at between 8:30 - 9:30 pm, were very tasty and worthwhile. The buffet was to be expected with same or similar food at every meal. - I must commend the wait staff, housekeeping and on-site Lomas Travel, who organized the excursions. They all did an excellent job! The front desk staff and guest services left much to be desired when it came to customer service. The hotel was still overbooked by 4 rooms when we checked out and we never did receive the hammock we daily requested for our balcony. - Despite the issues, we choose to have a good vacation. The area is beautiful, however, I would steer away from the Occidentals due to the issues above.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: nextime
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Allegro Dec 19-26/04. We also stayed at the Grand Palladium Kantennah Dec 26/04 - Jan2/05. Don't waste your money on the Allegro the Palladium is far more superior for almost the same price! Complaints: 1/ Thatched roof hotel units - The birds pecking on the roof got us up bright and early every morning. If you like rustic, this is it! Beds were also very hard, the rooms were too small to unpack your luggage. Water leaked from the shower as there were not shower doors. Overall - just plain bad! 2/ Front desk personal - not helpful, time share people pushy, maids were good only if you tipped them. 3/ Meals were ok, lots of food but not alot of variety. If you like seafood you won't find any here. Isn't it funny that shrimp and langostinos are so prevalent in the Gulf of Mexico, but you can't get them at your resort? We had to go into Playa Del Carmen to get some great seafood. 4/ Beach got washed away, every other hotel along the strip had a great beach except the Allegro 5/ 2 small pools, one for relaxing and one for fun. No waterslides for the kids! Also very very cold! You couldn't sit close to the pool as you would get wet from the Tequila Volleyball or Water Polo players as well as the aquasizers. Good Points: 1/ The Allegro Fun Staff that organized games etc around the pool were awesome, they had a variety of entertainment going all day and into the night. Estevan was great! 2/ The grounds were beautiful and the place was very clean 3/ The Italian Restaurant had the best food but you could only go once! 4/ Drinks were good 5/ Evening entertainment was ok but started at 9:30 almost too late. Overall kind of disappointing, our stay at the Palladium was far superior for about the same price. Would not go back to the Allegro. They need to see what the other hotels offer and step it up a notch! There are far too many great hotels in the Mayan Riviera to chose from. If in doubt stay at the Palladium you're guaranteed not to be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Quality Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Allegro Playacar over the Christmas week-end. We arrived on Dec. 23rd around 11:10 A.M. and we were told that check-in wasn't until 3:00 P.M. We had been up since 3:00 A.M. with nothing to eat during this time. The Buffet had closed, and the Snackbar didn't open until 12:00 noon. I have stayed at several other all-inclusive resorts, and they always had some sort of food service available. We asked if there was a room available for us to change clothes, and we were told to use the Restrooms in the Lobby if we wanted to. I found the Desk Staff to be very Rude from the first moment, and this never changed. When we finally got to our room, it took another thirty minutes for our luggage to be delivered. By the time we got to the Beach and Pool area it was almost 4:00P.M. The wait-staff I found to be very good. They didn't forget that the customer was paying their salary. The Buffet was not very good. Breakfast was the only good meal they served. The other meals left alot to be desired. On Christmas day I tried to obtain Ice in the Morning, I was told that I couldn't until 7:00A.M. I needed Ice because my Wife was running an extremely high Fever. I told the Front Desk about the problem, and I couldn't get any help. I summoned a Doctor, and after an Injection, my Wifes fever broke. Talking with another family, they told me that their Son had had the same problem two days earlier. The "highlited" activity on Christmas Day was a beer drinking contest at the Pool Area. Our problems were MINOR compared to others who arrived after us. It seems that the Resort had overbooked and many families with confirmed Reservations were sent elsewhere, or not given the accomidations they requested through their Travel Agent. The Funjet agent at the Resort was very helpful. He tried to help as best he could. Rating the Resort on the Grounds, At best three stars. Rating the Resort on Front Desk, a generous one star. I will definitely not be returning to this Resort, or any of their other properties. I did not get what I paid for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great weather”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the playacar. I will say that the grounds were nice, the beach was just fine! Don't expect help from the concierge, unless you want to be treated with rudeness. We were given a discount on an excursion if we listened to their vacation club. THE RUDEST PEOPLE I HAVE EVER MET! They were mean, insulting, and high pressure! Pay full price for your excusions and forget it the vacation club presentation! Food was average, front desk friendly. All inclusive to me means eat anywhere, at anytime. Here they tell you when and where! We had a second floor hut room. The smell was so horrible we could not sleep! The showers are open and the floors are constantly wet and musty! I would not go back to this one!

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Beach????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What happened to the Beach? We booked our honeymoon through Apple Vacations (another joke for a different time) for 12-27-2004 through 12-31-2004. When we arrived at Allegro, we tried to check in with the Reception Desk and were directed to Guest Relations. After a 10-15 minute wait, Peter informed us that the US offices of Occidental had overbooked the resort for Monday night and would like to transport us to a "5 star hotel just 15 minutes away", The Copacobana (which, btw, was awesome!). We half expected this since we had read reviews on this site Sunday before we left. This was really not a problem and it turned out that the Copacabana was so much better than Allegro that after we returned to Allegro, we wished we had insisted on staying at the Copa. We were whisked off in a van to be driven to the Copa which was NOT a 15 minute drive, more like 25-30 minute drive. Upon our arrival, we were checked quite quickly and given our room (it was not 3:00 check in time, so that was a nice surprise. We didn't have to sit around the resort until room was ready). We booked our tours/excursions with the Copa Tours rep and worked everything out so that we would be dropped off on Tuesday evening at the Allegro and picked up and dropped off Thursday at Allegro-no problems. HOWEVER-things did not turn out as such once we returned to Allegro on Tuesday night. After we checked in (we were supposed to have the "Honeymooner's package" which was fresh flowers in the room when checking in and breakfast in bed at some point of the stay) and went to our room, it was a little disappointing compared to the Copa and the Chameleon Marival (which I stayed at in March 2004). It was clean, but very small. It would have fit into either of the rooms at the other two resorts and the bathroom was small but adequate, I guess. After we got settled, we walked down to the beach-or what used to be the beach! The first thing we saw was yellow tape tied to various palm trees and sandbags piled up. The Beach was about 10-15 feet from the sea wall that separated the private property from the public beach. Well, that was OK since we really weren't going to be sitting out there that night trying to enjoy the sun. The next morning after breakfast, we strolled down to the "beach" area again, to check things out; see how crowded the area was and if there was chance we could sit in the sun...The beach had shrunk even more! And the "no reserving chairs" rule was blatently not enforced. People had personal belongings (towels, shoes, etc) on the chairs, but were obviously not sitting in them. They had saved them earlier-but whatever. So we went back to our room and returned later in the morning. At that time, there were workers from the hotel ( I guess) filling sandbags and stacking them around the few palm trees that were scattered around the 'beach front' as well as the little Tiki huts. We were asked to move to another part of the 'beach' because they needed that area of sand to fill the bags. They worked on sandbagging all day (they were still working later in the afternoon right before sunset). The following morning, I walked down to the 'beach' area again and the Tiki huts where my husband and I had been sitting the evening before, were laying in the ocean. Since very few of the miscellaneous workers spoke English, it was difficult to find out what happened. Another American tourist staying at the resort told me that someone told her that beach started washing away about a week or so before, and they had no idea why. In fact, when you looked up and down the coastline, all of the resorts were lacking a 'beach front'. What happened?? If you would like to see pictures, email me and I will send them to you. As for the buffet food-it was OK. Nothing to write home about-and that went for every meal; breakfast, lunch and dinner. We made reservations at the Italian restauraunt-if you like Chef Boyardee lasagna or ravioli, than you would LOVE their food. The ambiance was nice; it was nice to be waited on and very relaxing; and the service was good, but the food stunk. My husgand is still having some digestive problems, 2 days later. Overall, compared to the other two resorts I have stayed in, this was very disappointing. The only compensation for our inconveniences of being moved to the other resort was just that. They told us it was a 5 star resort, and we looked online when we got home to find it was only a 4 star (however, Allegro needs to take some lessons from the Copa as far as 4 star resorts are concerned). If you want to stay at an awesome resort-book here and have them send you elsewhere, since overbooking seems like a common practice. Insist on staying at the better resort and demand compensation such as a total refund,free tickets to whatever excursions or tours you would have paid for, etc (a tip from another visitor who got treated like royalty for complaining). Hindsight being 20/20, I wish we had insisted on staying at the Copa.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro hints”
Reviews.Author: packmule
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro over Christmas 2004. I'll keep this as concise as possible. 1) There are no ocean front rooms. Only Ocean front are reserved for Vacation Club. We reserved an Ocean Front, and did not receive. My husband even tried to bribe them, to no avail. Stay away from the Time Share people-they will approach you almost every time you pass to the restaurant. Ask for rooms close to the ocean, or pool-we were in the 4300 blocks--much better than the 1100s- which were by the stage, far from the pools, overlooking the bike racks and parking lot. 2) The food is fine. With regards to the 2 reservations only restaurants, The Italian and The Mexican, make your reservation within the first day of your arrival, or will risk not getting one. don't be late--or they'll cancel your reservation. Of the two, The Italian has better food, but the most horrid lighting--it's like, flourescent. The weird thing is, the lack of avail. on these two restuarants--and yet they were never full when we walked by. I think they are there for appearances, and the hotel is not really motivated to fill them, since they are more costly to man versus the buffet. The buffet is average. 3) The shows: Our kids loved them. Are they broadway? No, but-you're in Mexico, and for our 8, 7 and 18 month old, certainly captivating. Oh, and some of the shows are very entertaining for the men. The girls are pretty, and they qualify for thong use. and they do. 4) Kids Club: Miss janet is great. talk to her if you need a babysitter; she can help you out. The front desk is useless on this, even though they act like they can help you. Go to janet. The kiddie pool is at the Kids club. FYI, you don't really want a room over by the kids club, either. 5) Town: If you want to explore the town, here's what you do: Get up and take one of the bikes into Java Joes, off of Fifth and.. one block south of the street Mosquito Blue Hotel is on. Ronnie and Joel, great 'locals' from new Jersey, make great coffee, and know everything. Thru them we found the best restaurants, etc. Here's a few: Il Pomodoro-- an italian rest. several blocks north, by the Shangri La Caribe hotel--run by a guy from Naples. Very good. Ula Gula, on the corner of Java Joes street (sorry) and 5th. Glass House, part of Mosquito Blue. Hotel Deseo for the hip (which I pride myself on not being) for cocktails- the young crowd is very cool (I'm forty) and the bartenders are great. It's above the street, so away from the cacophony, and worth it. Oscar and Lalos- this is for a trip to Akumal. You will see a sign around mile marker 242, as you head south--it's like an official gov. sign. It's exp. but worth it. Plan on staying. Stores.. Not much, but the area by Mosquito blue has some of the better shops. The flea market area is at the very beginning, just outside the gates of the Playa compound. Last, if you have a need for the Dr. at Allegro, be careful! he overdosed our friends child with an Adult dose of a drug that was supposed to stop him from vomiting, so he could keep down an antibiotic. As the mum is playing cards with him, he freezes, and cannot even speak. she calls the Dr. to tell him what is happening, and he is curt with her, tells her he's done all that he can do, and hangs up on her. She and her husband rush him to the Play Del Carmen Hospital as her pediatrician informed her in advance should anything happen, not the Cancun hospital) in a cab, and save him further damage. If he would have been any smaller, his breathing could have shut down. If they didn't act as quickly as they did... I hope Playa comps their trip, and fires this Dr, which I hope she writes in her review, and gives the specifics. Would we stay there again? No, mainly because of the ocean view room, but otherwise, it was fine. I wouldn't necessarily take older kids (my niece who is 21 did not like it, as it was primarily for younger kids) I would return to Play, but I don't know where we would stay. My husband likes the El Presidente over in Cozumel, which has better food, better staff, not necessarily better grounds. If anyone knows of a better, and it can be more expensive, place in Play that has beach front rooms, let us know. for those of you without kids, the place next door, the Royal Hideway, has a bigger beach, complete with these big bed set ups that is very cool. I can't tell you if it has beach front rooms, as they would not even allow us to walk in and check it out. Oh, and renting a car in town is not really any cheaper than through the hotel. Adios.

Reviews.Title: “Was denied accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were treated as others have reported. On arrival on 23 December, we were denied accommodation and forced to stay at the Catalonia Riveria Maya, a cheaper hotel in Puerto Aventuras, far from Playa del Carmen. The agent at Allegro Playacar lied to us repeatedly about the circumstances and told us that the Catalonia was a superior accommodation just "15 minutes away". I suspect they pursue this kind of deceptive practice routinely. Stay away! Occidental Allegro is a faceless organization and totally non-responsive to Customers. I am pursuing redress from my travel agent and will post any results, but I am not hopeful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY VACATION!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Allegro Playacar (stayed 12/18/04 to 12/25/04). We have a six year old daughter and we exchanged our time-share week in Florida for this resort, so it's a little different because we didn't "pay" to stay here (except for the all-inclusive fee for meals/drinks). I was happier at this resort than at most hotels in the US we've paid $250-300/night for. Yes, there were some minor annoyances, but for every minor annoyance, there were ten great things to make up for it. Yes, the shower only having a 3ft. wide piece of glass on one side of the bath tub - the floor gets a little wet by the tub in the bathroom - but the maid changes out the bath mat every day - not enough to ruin my vacation. We were on the 2nd floor, near the beach and pools which was great. The birds did wake us up every morning around 6:30, which was an annoyance sometimes (the roofs are thatched and they sit on top of the roofs) but I looked at it as a natural alarm clock. No ants, and we had a fruit bowl in our room for a few days. Yes, the beds are hard (as they are in other resorts in Mexico), however we didn't feel the need to get a foam pad. If you need a really soft bed, this may bother you, but since we were exhausted from the day, any bed to lay down it was o.k. with us. We didn't sleep as soundly or comfortably as at home, but again, it didn't ruin our vacation. I've been more annoyed in an upscale hotel where people are yelling in the halls at 2am. There is a hammock and two chairs and table on every porch, which was really nice. My husband and daughter both loved relaxing in the hammock. The food was very good, and there was so much variety that you couldn't possibly try everything, as much as we wanted. For breakfast there was a smoothie station, an omelette/pancake station, and tables loaded with cereals, breads, fruit, meats, cheeses, sausage, and of course the more heartier, typical mexican fare such as pork, chicken and tortilla dishes. As we were always at the pool during lunchtime, we ate at the snack bar every day - it always had soups, meat dishes, all types of cold salads, fish, hamburgers/fries, guacamole, chips, etc, and of course the pizza. I loved the having the snack bar by the pool, because everyone just walked right over in the swimsuits. Dinner was always very good, and there were so many types of food to choose from, we never felt like we were sick of the food. There were beef/pork carvers every night, a pasta station, tostada or fajita stations and then tables and table of other items. Maybe the people who complain about the food don't try new things, are extremely picky and don't realize that different cultures have different ways of preparing and combining foods. Even if you don't want the chicken with mole sauce, there's always roast beef, broccoli, salad and pasta, etc. We travel to other states or countries to try new things - isn't that the point? The drinks were good, and had plenty of alcohol in them. If you ask for a rum and coke that's what you'll get - if you ask for a Bacardi and coke that's what you'll get. The staff at the entire resort was excellent!! We felt totally pampered. The maids were terrific! The wait staff was terrifice, as were the bartenders. Even by the pool someone would pick up your dirty dishes and ask if you needed anything else. We always saw smiles on their faces, and everyone was so fast and accommodating. The activities are FABULOUS! My husband used one of the free boogie boards, we saw the shows every night, the pool activities were a blast to watch even if you didn't participate. You can get pedicures, massages, etc. by the beach or in the spa - there is something for everyone. We did not use the Kids Club, because we wanted to enjoy the time with our daughter, but I would definitely feel comfortable leaving her there next time, after seeing how much the girls there were really good with the kids. You truly never need to leave the resort. There is a tiny shopping area about two blocks from the resort so you don't even need to go in to town if you don't want to. We didn't like the beach area much, as we found the beach in this entire area of resorts a little awkward to walk along and the kids can't really play there like they can on some other beaches because it's VERY narrow. Plus, there are lots of sand bags to keep sand from washing away right in front of the resort, so it can be a tripping hazard. It's also a pain as you walk to keep stepping over the ropes that separate the areas the wave runners, parasail boats, etc. come in. I love the beach if you're in the water or relaxing up on a chair, but not for walking on. Many people were complaining of stubbed toes or tripping on the rocks and sand bags. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL. You can play tennis, basketball, volleyball and even chess on a board with 3-ft tall chess pieces - it was a blast! We loved our vacation and we'd definitely go back to this resort again, and bring more family with us! There is just so much to do here, and so much fun to be had!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From Occidental Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing this notice to inform travellers that the Occidental Allegro Playacar overbooks their hotel. It happened to us this past year. We were then given a voucher for a free weeks stay but the chain is very sneaky, they said we could not use it for Christmas, New Years, Easter or "Blackout Times" Guess What, the blackout times are from Jan 1 to the end of May. I paid $3,000.00 for a vacation, got bumped to another hotel (we hated) and then are told, you can use a voucher for a vacation during "non-peak times" ie: summer early fall - in Canada but the rainy season in Mexico. PS: Don't try to speak with anyone in Customer Service with the Occidental Hotel and Resorts. I have been pushed from one person to the other. Looks like we will be going to Cuba for our trip in 2005. They lost a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware you may not stay there !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked the Allegro Playacar for our 31rst anniversary. Happily we arrived at 4PM in our rental car, breezed to the check in to be told, we must see another man at a desk across the room. We were greeted with, " Now everything will be okay", "but there is a small problem". We were totally taken back, but let him go on to tell us we must move to another facility down the road, The Riu, which is a 5 star and just sign these papers and go. No explanation as to why, just have to move to another place. Now don't get me wrong, the Riu was nice, but since I paid to stay at the Allegro and never saw a room or ate the food, I can't compare. What I did find was 12 more couples at the Riu that had the same experience. I am not one to complain, but after finding it had happened to 12 other couples, all Americans by the way. It got me to wondering what has really happened. My wife and I walked down to the Allegro and told the security guard that we had been moved and just wanted to see the facility. He had to ask three others but the escorted us around the exterior. In the course of the tour, I ask him about the occupancy and he told me they were full of european tourist !!!! Then I put 2 and 2 together and came up with 5. Upon our return, I sent an email to Occidental questioning why we were moved. Why if they had known they didn't contact us so we could make other arrangements. Six weeks later, still no response, I sent a second email this time to the Miami office. Within a day I received a response that they had forwarded my email to the property for response. Two weeks later, still nothing. Again , I contact Miami. They appologize and promise a quick response. Two days later I get an answer from the Manager that still did not give me a reason why we were moved and basicaly said "tough ****" , you signed a waiver when you went to the Riu and we don't care about you or any of our customers. So be warned, you may show up and find no rooms and worse, no choice where you end up. For Occidental to be one of the World's leading lodging groups, they sure suck when it comes to CUSTOMER SERVICE .

Reviews.Title: “very nice vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11/20-27/04. The resort was better than I was expecting based upon many of the reviews. Service excellent. Entertainment excellent. Food very good. Grounds were outstanding. Beach was typical for the cancun area-beautiful water but you can't snorkel on the spot. My wife and I went for my 50th birthday and did not take our kids. This is a family resort, but we still had a wonderful time. For people with young kids, I wonder how you could do better. The entertainment was outstanding-professional dancers and comics. ALso, the playacar area is very nice. this is where I will stay next time I go to Mexico- we've been to Cancun (x2) and to Cozumel. The only reason I did not give this an excellent rating is that the room was not a luxury room ala the Ritz Carlton, but then the price was far more reasonable. This resort was an excellent value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: NancyMIllnois
Reviews.Content: We visited the Allegro from Nov.27-Dec.4,2004.. It was amazing. The staff was wonderful and polite. This is no 6 star resort, but for the money, it was quite pleasant. Clean rooms, the grounds were beautiful. The ocean!! O MY! I would have been happy living on the beach. The only semi down side to the Allegro was there is one buffet and two resteraunts. The resturants you have to make reservations for but the buffett you can just walk in. The food was of good quality at all places. I guess that is the difference between a 6 star and a 4 star. For the first time though it was magnificent! We had reservations to the Club El Mandarin closer to Cancun and cancelled them becuase of reviews I read on this web site. The reviews said that there was a sewage smell and sure enough as we were driving by on the highway one day, there was a smell for about 3 miles. So if you make reservations near this resort Cancel them. The Occidental Royal Hideaway two places down fromthe Allegro had beds on the beach. It is a 6 star. We will stay there next time and pay the extra 500.00 $.. it's worth it if you can afford it. You may email me for any suggestions on what to do and what not to do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kids Club: Does NOT accept kids under 4 ... Despite what their website says, if your child is 2 or 3, a parent has to stay in the club with them. This was a major problem for us, as we booked this resort because they advertise taking 2+. They made an exception a few of the days and took my daughter for 3 hrs, from 2-5pm, but the sun goes down at 4 so it didn't really work well for us to have a vacation too. Plus there was only 1 very nice girl, Ceidy, running the club and we saw over 15 kids in there almost every day. That's a safety concern. There is no way you can watch this many kids in the pool, on the swingsets, watching TV, and playing Nintendo all at the same time. Also, even if your kids are old enough to come here, you have to pick them up in the middle of the day from 1-2 for the staff lunch break. The kids club facility is very nice, but they need more staff, 1 person can't handle it. Rooms: Small, and the bed is ROCK HARD. We go to Mexico 3 times per year and try new places each time. All beds are hard in Mexico, but these are HARDER. After 3 days we finally got a 1-inch pad that helped but not much. The showers do not have a door or curtain, they have a 2-ft glass shield by the shower head, but it doesnt stop the spray from making the whole bathroom floor wet. Also, we were in a top unit w/a thatched roof. Evidently there were birds nesting up there, we never saw the birds, but we found bird crap on our bed and clothes a few times. Ants: Yes there were alot of ants in the bedroom, all over. We had someone spray 3 times this week and they kept coming back. My husband and daughter were covered in bites, as well as many people we saw on the property. I personally have never had an ant problem in the other resorts of Playacar, and we've stayed at five. Food: This was the worst part. Everything is recycled into casseroles. You never knew what it was, almost every tray was goulash of some sort. We are not that picky, but this place had the worst and smallest selection of any all-inclusive we've stayed at. They have about 6 tables to lay out their food on, and one day 3 of the tables were all fruit. There just wasn't enough selection. My husband is basically a garbage disposal for food, being a weight-lifter, and he struggled to eat. My daughter ate spaghetti and pizza all week. And I was hungry most of the time. The chef is a very nice man and 2 days before we left my husband pulled him aside and asked if they have any shrimp, he cooked us a huge bowl which was nice, but I feel we shouldn't have to ask for the good food. We also noticed the next morning someone asked him for bacon and got it brought to the table. They don't have it out for everyone as part of the breakfast buffet. Basically, you have to ask for the things you are used to or you will be living off pasta, cactus, pizza, fruit, salad, and casserole all week. Gym: THERE IS NO GYM, at all! You have to go to downtown Playa and use the city gym. They will not let you go next door to their sister property and use the gym at Royal Hideaway. We snuck over anyway and used their nice gym. Beach and Pools: As always the beach is awesome in this part of Playa. And the 2 pools were large enough. The chairs on the beach need some replacements, the mesh is stretched so bad that you will be laying on the plastic support bars. If you are comparing this resort based on kids clubs in area, spend your money at the GALA. The only way we would ever stay here again is if we got a super rate, like less than $75 per night, because truly that is all it is worth. It's a budget property.

Reviews.Title: “My take on Allegro Occidental”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I visited Allegro Occidental from November 13 - November 27 and I have to tell you that our experience was outstanding. We girls vacation together every year but this was our first visit to Playa del Carmen. The service was excellent and we never had one bad experience the entire vacation. The rooms were comfortable, well maintained and our maid was wonderful. So, the beds are hard. If you are vacationing to sleep then you should stay at home! All beds in Mexico are hard! We especially loved the daily towel animals! The food was far better than we expected. The buffet was not boring or bland as some people have noted. The two other restaurants were especially nice. The pools were clean, well maintained and the entertainment staff were great. We went to Jamaica last year and the staff were juvenile and irritating. However, this staff was friendly, helpful and their daily fun was much more enjoyable. We loved the nightly shows, especially the Mayan show.
