The dancers were well trained and put 100% into their work. Now - if you are looking for fancy, then go somewhere else where you will spend twice the money. We girls would definitely return again and highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful on all counts!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Allegro Playacar, spending the week of Thanksgiving there, (Nov. 20-27). I am a freelance travel writer, so we travel a great deal, and the Playacar is a great deal if ever I saw one! After reading the reviews to select the hotel, I, as you will, saw mostly excellent ones, and some bad ones. I will try to be as helpful as possible and address most major issues. This was our 10th trip to the Cancun area, but the first to this resort. Since we rented a car prior to arrival, the shuttle picked us up at the airport, and within a few minutes, we were on our way. The Playacar is about 40 minutes south of the Cancun airport. When the speed limit sign indicates 110, just remember, is not miles per hour, it is kilometers per hour! (About 68 mph). We enjoyed the drive, seeing the growth that is extending south of Cancun along highway 307. The Allegro Playacar Resort is about a mile south of the city of Playa Del Carmen. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were welcomed by smiling employees everywhere we looked. We entered the beautiful marble lobby, were checked in rapidly by the very friendly staff, (never heard a rude remark, nor saw an unhelpful person the entire week, as other reviews have said), were given nice cold welcome drinks, and by that time, a bellboy had our bags and we were off to the room. The Playacar is one of the first resorts in this area, and for us, that was a major plus. This has given the resort time to develop spectacular landscaping. You walk winding paths, mostly shaded by beautiful trees, as you travel within the resort. The buildings are only 2-story, with 4 rooms on each floor, so you feel as though you have your own little cottage. Ours was downstairs with a patio, table, 2 chairs, and a large hammock that had my name on it! Knowing that many hotels in this part of the world have very firm beds, I asked for one of the foam pads. The maid made up the bed for us with it, and though still a little firm, we slept great. Other reviews said the A/C was not good, but we set ours only at medium, and it was so cool that we had the luxury of burrowing under the blankets-hence, sleeping was heaven! Bugs were mentioned in other reviews. In a week, I saw a total of 2 small flying ones...1 of which met his demise due to my swift hands! Never saw a single ant in the room, but neither did we leave food and drink around. There is space for both hanging your clothes and shelving, not huge, but more than ample. You are on vacation, not attending a seminar, lighten up! One thing I did not see on the other reviews, but our room had a hand-held shower massage. Needless to say, my wife was a happy camper. Food was very good and plentiful. The buffets had a good variety, and items were usually replaced with a new tray even before the older one was empty. On Thursday, (Thanksgiving), the hotel even had a "Thanksgiving Corner", with turkey, dressing, and mashed potatoes and gravy for the Americans. On the day of our arrival, we made reservations for both the Italian and the Mexican restaurants with no problem, and the hotel was full. There are various seatings, so I am not sure why some people said there was so much problem getting reservations. The food, atmosphere, and service at the air conditioned Italian restaurant were superb. The Mexican restaurant is more relaxed, but everything, music, food, service, was still great. Pools, beach, and bars were all wonderful. We got up, never had a problem getting a palapa, though you probably could not find one after 9-10. Drinks were good, strong as you want. I would agree with other reviews, be sure and bring an insulated mug. Your drinks will stay cold in the heat, and you don't have to get out of that comfortable chair as often. There is beach service, so you can stay all day if you wish and still have cold drinks. We have stayed at many resorts, and this is among the first with beach service. We came without children, so I have no personal experience with that area, but they had many activities for them, and the kids seemed to have a blast. Every night there are also shows for the whole family, and the ones we saw were good. They work hard on them, and you should see some while there. A couple of nights there were people there with their handicrafts. Great selection, with some very talented people! As you walk out the front of the resort, about a 5 minute walk to the left takes you to a small shopping mall. It may have some new stores now thanks to my wife. Maybe a mile to the right, is the town of Playa Del Carmen. Whether you walk, ride a bike, take a taxi, or have a car, make the trip. Walk the length of 5th avenue there, and some of the side streets and you may see a movie star, as we did! A sleepy little town that you will love if you look for the beauty of it. Life is too short to look for the negative in it. Would we return? In a second. The only bad thing, was leaving the wonderful, helpful staff, and their lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.....”
Reviews.Author: sksadams
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at The Allegro Playacar this was our 11th trip to Mexico and 5th to Playacar area. We have stayed at the following properties in Playacar: Riu Palace (2), The Gala, The Reef Club and now Allegro. So we have stayed at the nicest and also a few budgets and I am comparing this as a budget hotel and using The Reef Club as comparison however I do think the Allegro is one star highter than The Reef. The grounds are beautiful and well kept the lobby was typical the guy checking us in was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are what you would expect from a budget hotel very old Holiday Inn like but we thoroughly enjoyed the hammocks on the porch we thought this to be the best feature of the room. The beach heaven, pools beautiful and the swim up bar great with great friendly service ( for smokers this is a non smoking swim up bar). Food: breakfast typical, lunch the burgers were the best we have every had and dinner (big sigh) it was ok typical of a budget one beef selection, one fish selection and pasta so you were covered but picky eaters it would be a little difficult. This is where reservation restaurant's are important more later. Now here is my real gripe about the buffet I have never stayed anywhere in 11 trips that you had to wait in line for the buffet and they would keep you waiting with a room full of tables. I found this to be ridiculous and then you had to wait on somone to serve you drinks and you would be half way through your meal before you could even wave someone down. Part of this was due to being understaffed. Now having stayed at budget hotels we have always used the reservation restaurant for dinner because the food is usually better but getting reservations here was a nightmare when we checked in we went straight to guest services to make a reservation he said sorry come back when you have a room number and he would be back at 9:00 the next morning. So first thing we went to make reservations well guess what they were all booked up and he told me the Italian restaurant didn't allow kids so I firmly stated we wanted reservations and he magically found some in the Mexican restaurant (by the way there was a whole 20 pople in there that night) but the food was outstanding. So the next night we go check the buffett to see if we wanted to eat or not but it was so hot in there we couldn't stay I can't imagine what this would be like in August. As we were leaving I looked in the Italian restaurant and low and behold there is a room full o fkids I march right back down to Guest Service to speak with Peter again and he says no I told you kids were allowed from 6/6:30 well no he didn't and my friend who was with me said no you didn't and he just turned around and went back to looking at his computer never acknowledging us again!! So back to PDC for dinner which was very good and not expensive but just irritating that the hotel lied to us but I think they have a history with avoiding the truth. There are some great things about this hotel but the dinner is a real negative and other than the pool bar staff, The Mexican Restaurant and the lady who runs the kids club the staff is just not friendly. If I won a trip I would stay here again but if I am paying and looking for a budget trip I would go with The Reef Club where at least you can eat at the Reservation Restaurant every night. Also for the first time we had something stolen my daughters purse was taken from the room I went to guest services (Peter again and this before the Italaian Restaurant thing) and asked if a purse had been turned in (I didn't want to start out accusing someone of stealing) he said no and turned back to his computer and that was the end of the conversation. Luckly there wasn't anything of value in this purse but had it been mine (which is why I keep it locked up) I would have wanted him to be a little more conerned that there was a theif around!! We tipped everyone for good service and felt it was appreciated. I was disappointed because the grounds and pool are beautiful but I don't want to have to go in to town and eat every night!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: staceymck
Reviews.Content: Well I'm a bit late with my review- but I travel every year... and in March of 2002 I stayed at the Allegro Playacar... My fiance and I LOVED this resort... We have yet to TOP this one from being in Mexico twice, Dominican and Cuba. The pool, beach and grounds were beautiful and very inviting. The food was very good and the people were friendly. The rooms were very nice and well kept. My only issue was the entertainment staff was a little to "in your face"... if you were suntanning quietly they would still bug you to participate in the games. The resort also has a huge full basketball court- which for my fiance he was in heaven. The sports bar was really nice too- the bartender was a funny and very personable guy! The bar was a tad empty most of the nights however. Overall, this resort is beautiful and we were thankful that our original resort was over-booked and we were sent free of charge from the 'Village on the Green' to stay at the Allegro Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this resort 3 times already! We like very much that the rooms are in a bungalow style, rather than the standard (and kind of boring) hotel room with hallways style. They have fun things for the kids to do, and they also have fun things for the adults to do.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the Scoop!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie0428
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a vacation with another couple (I believe they already wrote a review) here from October 16-23rd. Let me preface this review with the fact that we have been to this area of Mexico many times. I have stayed at Iberostar Cozumel, Reef Club Cozumel, Barcelo Maya Beach, and Riu Cancun. I know what to expect in Mexico. The good points are: Drinks are good quality. Bar staff is always nice and willing to get you a drink. Food was pretty good everywhere in the resort. I will agree that sometimes it is bland and the selection is not always great, but the food tastes good and fresh. I have been to other resorts where everything has a funny taste, and this was not the case here. The italian restaurant was the best food I have ever had at an all-inclusive resort. The grounds were beautiful. All of the foliage was kept neatly trimmed and all of the plants were healthy. I was really amazed at how big some of the ficus trees were. The overall cleanliness of the place was great. The beach was clean and all of the chairs were lined up at the end of the day to prepare for the next day. The exteriors of the buildings were maintained well, all of the common areas were clean. The restaurants were clean. Even the little Pizza hut was immaculate. There were always people patrolling everywhere cleaning up used glasses, trash, etc. The only gripe I have about cleanliness was the lobby bathrooms were left neglected at times... The service everywhere was excellent. The housekeeping staff was great, the waiters attentive, and I already mentioned that the bar staff was awesome. With very few exceptions, the staff was great and always willing to please. The negatives: The beds are hard. Like I said before, I have stayed in Mexico several times, and the beds are always hard. But the beds here are harder! If you stay here, it might be a good idea to bring an inflatable mattress to stick under the sheets. The rooms are musty. Bring a plug in. I read to bring one on this site, but I forgot, and our room did stink a little. I think this is especially true in the upstairs units becuase they are thatched roofs and not airtight at all. There are ants in some of the rooms. I read about that, and I thought the people that had ants probably weren't taking care to rinse their glasses or were bringing food into the room. We took extra care and still had ants. I bought some spray in town, but then I had dead ants everywhere. Our friends were in two rooms and they didn't have ants in either. So I guess it is the luck of the draw on that. Staff is only following the rules, but the rules at this place stink! You cannot enter the sports bar until 6pm, even if to just turn on the TV. We were there during the playoffs, and they wouldn't let us go in until 6pm. You can't get the game anywhere else or we would have gladly gone there. I am personally not a sports fan, but many people are, and they should accomodate accordingly. Another gripe I have about the rules- we went to Cozumel for the day, and I wanted to view the Grand Cozumel by Occidental for the next time we go to Mexico. I talked to the manager and he told me to get a day pass to the Allegro Cozumel and that they would tell me how to tour the Grand. We got over there and they explained that the Grand was a category higher than the Allegro, so we were not allowed to even go over there. Never mind that we paid 150.00 more to stay at the Allegro playacar than the Grand Cozumel for the week. I just felt like they treated us like riff-raff, which is unacceptable. Based on this alone I am reluctant to ever stay at an Occidental resort again. OVERALL- We had a great time! Great fun with great friends! Even though I was unhappy with some stuff, I tried not to sweat it at the time. I just wanted to pass this along. The bottom line is that every place has its pros and cons. But if you make a choice, just go with it and have a great time. Afterall, you will be in Mexico!!!!! Sorry this was a little long!!!!! By the way, if you like the nightlife, go to the Blue Parrot!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time, not a great time.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to Playa del Carmen for our 10th anniversary from Oct. 23, 2004 until Oct. 30, 2004. The area has changed a lot in 10 years. It's much more touristy now, which is a shame, but it was inevitable. Allegro Playacar is a beautiful resort, and it seemed well maintained. The rooms were pretty nice, but they were a little small, as others have also mentioned. The staff was very nice, and they seem to try very hard to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The beach was great, but it seemed a little crowded at times. When we were there in 1994 we felt like we were the only ones on the beach. The food at Allegro was not that great. They offer a wide variety of choices, but it was rather bland. Breakfast seemed to be the best. We usually had lunch at the snack bar by the pool or outside the resort. The two “restaurants” they have (The Mexican, The Italian) were ok, but not great either. The Italian was the better of the two. The nightly entertainment was fair. Some nights were better than others. It’s mostly made up of different dance styles, which were pretty good. The entertainers work very hard. One night they had a Mr. Allegro contest, which was strictly audience participation with no other entertainers. It must have been there night off. Be prepared to take side trips when you get there. You can do things on your own, but it’s a bit easier and probably safer to book them. You can visit several different Mayan ruins, snorkel, scuba dive, horseback ride, dinner cruises, etc. They can cost anywhere from $45 per person up to $100 per person. Golf is quite expensive. I think it was $108 for 18 holes. The ferry over to Cozumel will cost you $16 to $18 roundtrip per person. Shopping can be an experience. The little shopping area near the Allegro is pretty expensive compared to downtown Playa del Carmen. The shopkeepers will drive you a little crazy after a while to get you in their stores, but they will bargain. Playa del Carmen is a bout a 25 minute walk from Allegro or a $5 cab ride. We will probably go back to the Riviera Maya, but we would probably try a different resort just to see something different. Having said that the Allegro is still probably one of the nicer resorts in the Playacar area. It’s worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Vintagewhine
Reviews.Content: It all started one day while I was looking at the Funjet and Apple web pages. I saw a price for the Occidental Allegro Playacar. Leaving from Cleveland in mid October for 7 days…. air, hotel, transfers and taxes included, totaled $650.00 pp. Who could turn that down? My husband could not get off work but didn’t object if I found a friend to go with me. Wasn’t too hard to do that! My friend Audrey agreed to accompany me and we were off! Spent the night of Oct. 22 in Cleveland Sheraton Airport and flew the Funjet charter Transmeridian Airlines on October 23rd at 9 a.m. Great flight! Landed in Cancun on time, unfortunately though, to a torrential downpour…I had never seen it rain in Cancun much less flood the streets! Cars were stalled outside of Playa del Carmen…it was a mess. Needless to say, we arrived at the Allegro under less than pleasant conditions. The week ahead would prove to be much more pleasant! I am definitely a 5 star “brat” having stayed at Iberostar Quetzal, IB* Paraiso (2 times), and the Bahia Principe Akumal. The only 4 star we have stayed at was the Riu Tequila. Trip reports were very mixed concerning the Allegro but we went with an open mind…after all, how bad can it be for less that $100.00 a day…can barely stay in a decent hotel room in the States for that amount much less air fare, food and drinks included. I did email a room request for 2nd floor and close to the beach as possible. Boy, were we ever Blessed….as far as I’m concerned, it was the best room in the resort (2715) ..other than the Villas that were part of the Vacation Club (time share~). Our patio was larger than most balconies…complete with table, chairs and hammock…and not to mention a gorgeous 5 star view of the ocean! The room is definitely on the small side…I would not recommend more than 2 to a room here. There is a coffee maker, ironing board/iron, and safe. There are only a few shelves for clothing. I mostly lived out of my suitcase which was fine for me. The beds are definitely hard and so are the pillows. However, after a full day of sun, sand and surf, I managed a good night’s sleep. The food was outstanding. We never had a bad meal. The selection is not as extensive as you get at the bigger resorts, but you never go hungry. Breakfast was just OK in my opinion…there was no bacon. However, we did find out later from the Chef that all you had to do is ask your waiter and it would be served to you. Lunch at the pool was wonderful. They have a great selection of pizza…pepperoni and green pepper, chicken, ham and pineapple, plain cheese….I’m sure there are more! You can order hamburgers, hot dogs and fries too. Lots of great salads…and the best cooked carrots I have ever tasted. I’m not a big veggie fan, but these carrots tasted like butter! They have great grilled fish, lots of chips, salsa and guacamole. They did not have ice cream, though, and I did miss that. The buffets in the evening were wonderful. Monday night is the Mexican theme night. They have tables set up outside the theatre area that are all decorated in the Mexican colors with banners and flags overhead. There are tables and tables of food….salads, grilled beef and pork, tacos, …so much food that night I can’t even remember. This was a wonderful evening…a great touch having it outdoors with a party atmosphere. The Mexican show was also going on at the same time which made the dinner even more special. Another evening, they had International night. The buffet area was set up very formal, with white slip covers over the chairs, white table cloths with black accents and white drapes over the ceiling. I felt underdressed wearing shorts that evening. They definitely try harder being rated a “4”! We had some wonderful roast pork, prime rib and chicken in the buffet for dinner. Plenty of potatoes, rice and vegetables were also served. We also ate at the 2 specialty restaurants there…the Mexican and Italian. Both were very good. Several nights during the week they do have vendors selling jewelry, etc. along the walkways. Also, there was someone painting ceramic tiles…had to buy one of these masterpieces for only $10.00. There are 2 pools…an activity pool and quiet pool. The activities going on were the same as at the 5 star resorts…volleyball, salsa dancing, aerobics, etc. Very upbeat activities team! They also had Spanish lessons and the Chef even had a cooking demonstration every day at 1:00. We both enjoyed the drinks offered, however, I am not a big drinker and probably am not a fair judge in this department. I had pina coladas and Corecaminos (tasted like a pina colada with some amaretto added…yummmm!) Audrey liked the Jamaican Surprise….don’t ask me…something with rum that she thought was good! In my research before I left, I read that they do not have straws at the pool/beach….I need them for my infamous Wal Mart mug! So, I brought along straws…helps to know that in advance! THE BEACH…well, it probably can be my most critical area in judging the resort. It is the smallest beach, I think, in Playacar. Very narrow and crowded. They sure could use more palapas for shade. The chaises are pretty close together. Since I am an early riser, I would go to the beach by 7 a.m and get our favorite spot…sort of move the chaises so that we could have a little more privacy. I can think of worse jobs than watching the sunrise on a lounge chair in the Caribbean every morning! They actually had beach service in the afternoons…a nice touch that I wasn’t expecting! And, of course, the usual non motorized water sports were included. THE GROUNDS… just lovely. They are constantly working hard keeping things weeded and watered. Beautiful plants and flowers are to be seen everywhere. The lobby is on the small side and certainly not as opulent as the larger resorts. There is a bar on the second floor of the lobby just outside the buffet. There is an internet room just outside the lobby…extremely hot in there with little ventilation. I usually like to email home once a day when I am on vacation….could not get myself to sit in there! I used the phone at the Playacar Plaza instead! To be fair, however, we did run into several folks who had problems with their air conditioning and lack of electricity in their rooms! I could not imagine staying in a room that you could not count on the electric working. They eventually got the problem fixed but it is a headache having to deal with it. The resort just finished undergoing a major renovation…too bad all these problems could not have been fixed. There were also people there pitching the time share but we just politely said “no”. I feel we received a tremendous value for our money. I would not hesitate to return to the Allegro if the price was right. The employees definitely work as hard here as all the 5 star resorts. They try their best to serve you and make your stay enjoyable. You will find negatives and positives everywhere you go. Best advice for anywhere you go: do your research and know what to expect!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my best friend and her husband stayed at the Allegro from Oct 16-20. We had a great time. The food was OK. I think our problem was we are picky eaters, and there wasn't much for us to eat. They did have a snack bar from 12-4 that served hamburgers w/ fries, hotdogs, etc. The tortilla chips were extemely hard. They have a pizza bar that is open at different times during the day. Some examples of the food they had at the buffet were green pepper soup, fried bananas, oysters in some kind of concoction. You could make a sandwich with pickle loaf, and they had refried beans at every meal. We were able to find some food to stay alive. The drinks were great. We never had a watered down drink, and if you wanted more alcohol then they would add it. The tea was horrible. We drank Pepsi and water the whole time. The staff is nice and eager to help you. We never ran into a time share person. When we were on the bus going to our resort from the airport the lady told us to beware of them. This obviously isn't just a problem at the Allegro. The beds were very hard, and the shower didn't have a curtain. It had a piece of glass covering the front part of the tub. The premises were very clean. They keep the beach clean also. Someone is always cleaning. The major problem we had was people going down really early and putting their towels on chairs under the huts and never coming to the beach until the afternoon, if even then. The hotel had plenty of chairs, but it was these people who were causing a problem. So, on the second and third day we moved their stuff. If we watched a chair that was vacant for 4-5 hours then they obviously weren't using it. When they came for their towel we would give it to them, but we weren't getting up. They found somewhere else to sit. They may have been pissed but tough. They should not do that out of respect for the other guests. Be prepared to see lots of boobs at the pools and on the beach. There is a disco club on the premises called Fast Eddies. They have pool tables, but there isn't a lot happening there. If you are wanting to party then Playa is not the place. It's really for people wanting to relax. We went into town 2 days. We ate at Senor Frogs. Don't waste your money. I have been in several of these, and this is the deadest place. We did eat at a Mexican place called Karen's. It was fabulous and reasonable. They cooked my husband's steak at our table. Overall, we had a relaxing and fun time. I would stay there again. The thing that you have to remember when you are there is that: it is not America and things are done differently. (food, etc.) You have to be willing to adjust to have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Occidental Allegro”
Reviews.Author: ArnoTA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Occidental Allegro from October 1 till October 9. I wonder if some people ever come out of their own country. We have been in S.E. Asia for many times but never had an Accomodation like this. The rooms where good, the garden magnificent and the beach and pools great. However I hear the cocktails where weak some Americans still managed to get drunk. The staff and service did everything to please you and entertainement was also wonderfull. So if you are looking for a relaxing and pleasant stay with lovely food don't hesitate to go there.

Reviews.Title: “3 Reasons NOT to go to Allegro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from the Allegro Playacar. We had a good time, but we will not return to this resort. The resort is beautiful: Good beach, good pools, good food, good drinks, & I liked the hammocks. However, we will spend a little extra cash & select a better resort for our next trip to Mexico. The following are the 3 reasons we will not return: #1 - High Pressure Time Share Sales (they called our room twice at 8am to tell us it's very important that we report to guest services) We're on vacation and do not want to be awoken by staff trying to sell timeshares. #2 - The EXTREMELY hard beds. Beds have no box spring, they're directly on a concrete slab. I'd recommend sleeping in a beach chair! #3 - Lack of pool side beach chairs. (maybe they're in the rooms?) You have to get up really early to claim a chair. Overall, it's an OK place. I guess you get what you pay for! It's one of the cheapest resorts in it's category!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from October 2, to October 9, 2004 and it wasn't long enough. The weather was warm 90-95 degrees everyday. It also rained twice a day for about 5 minutes, it is the rainy season. The resort was beautifully kept, the staff aimed to please. Food was plentiful, and to our liking. Yes, the drinks are mixed weak, but if you want them stronger, all you have to do is ask. We found the Aqua bar at the pool to be the best. The rooms are clean and on the small side, but we were only in our rooms to sleep. The staff puts on a beautiful show every night at 10:00, please make sure not to miss them. The show is totally different every night. We ate at both the Italian and Mexican restaurant, both were good. Although we liked the Italian restaurant best. The only downside we came across was the relaxation pool. According to the rules--No jumping or diving into the pool. But there were too many kids running, jumping, diving and screaming for this area to be referred to as a relaxation pool. Try the beach we found that much more peaceful. We would go again in a second, so don't let any of the negative reviews worry you. Some people just can't be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lynnelubec
Reviews.Content: WE 3 girlfriends had planned our vacation to the Punta Cana in June. We were so excited about going! We got to the airport and Hurricane Jean hit the Dominican and the flight was cancelled! so very last minute the Allegro rep switched us to the Allegro Playacar in Mexico. We were so lucky!! The place was beautiful. The staff there are so much fun!!! All 3 restaurants were very good. We liked the tropical drink menu at the pool bar too. Tequila volleyball was a blast. WE loved the members club where there was always chilled champagne! We were there for a week and only left once to buy souveniers in Playa Del Carmen. We will go back. Great place for woman to go and you feel very safe and pampered!!! Lynne, Lori and Lisa

Reviews.Title: “let me clear up a few things...”
Reviews.Author: Kenny&Diane
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews, good and bad and I have to say that all in all, we had a great time. It's Oct. 2 and I just got home. The place is beautiful and they keep it that way 24/7. Kudos to the desk clerk named Angel. He went out of his way to help us with a problem with the room. Yes, the're kinda on the small side, but with all of the activities you're not in there much except to shower and sleep. The girl who cleaned our room every day was excellent and very thorough. Her name was Margarita and she was a sweetie. If your looking for a 5 star resort where you have to dress up every time you eat, than don't come here. It's very relaxed and the food was pretty good. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Occidental Allegro Playacar the week of Sep 9-14, 2004, and here are some observations on this hotel. Arrival was uneventfully, and easy. The reception was cordial and prompt but including some threats of loosing the towel cards with a charge of 50.00 usd or the vault key of 100.00 usd. I guess they do that in order for you not to loose them. ( I guess a piece of plastic is worth 50.00 usd and key for a vault lock is worth 100.00 usd) The rooms where clean with normal amenities a TV with a few channels, a vault not very well anchor, and very unsafe shower with a half tub glass as curtain shower and a slippery tub with no safety handles. An A/C that barely works. One thing that is very well kept is the gardens; they are beautifully trim and well kept. The pools are nice and big, not very clean but nice. The Beach is nice and clean and the palapas and lounge chairs are nice. One thing that is vast is the food; there is plenty to choose from. Drinks. Well! They have a limited (2) kinds of bear and coke or diet coke forget it – it is Pepsi; so if you like Pepsi with rum this is your place, otherwise sorry! On the liquor, I reserve my comments, not the best quality or what you are accustomed at home. One major complain is the service. The guest service doesn’t exist on the beach or pool area and very limited on the general restaurants. The bars are very well attended but you must go to them to obtain anything. There is no waiters at the pool or beach areas, if you need something you must go to them. I guess I should say that the service is good providing you do their way no the customer way. Let me give a couple examples on this, I like to get up early in the mornings and walk on the beach take a few morning pictures and have a cup of coffee. It was obvious that several dozen folks have the same idea, but guess what - there is no coffee till 8 to 8:30 in the morning, get my point? Other example if you like to have coffee with breakfast in the main restaurant, if you are lucky a waiter that attends more than a dozen tables might bring it to you, otherwise you need to get up and serve your self, water juice, and coffee, so I guess if you are expecting a vacation where you pay for service this is not the place. So in summary I will rate this place a 3 star and not a 4 because of the very limited service. Some of the charges are like they feel they are 5 star, a 10 minute phone call to Cancun they charge 17.00 usd, and a national bottle of wine at 34.00 usd. And not to mention the constant hotel time-share selling. We where there at the time the hurricane Ivan was passing thru, lucky for us didn’t hit the Mexican Caribbean area, even though the hotel was preparing for the worst by picking everything up and locking everything and stores near where boarding the windows etc. the Hotel didn’t mention a word not even a posting message – nothing! We ask and the answer was “not to worry” gladly we where watching CNN and could see where the storm was heading, but there it is totally deplorable and it shows the lack of customer support the hotel has. They should immediately print a bulleting and place it on each room indicating the possible procedures in case of an emergency. The hotel it is run so cheaply, and for sure it is not a customer driven hotel. They should hire some one and do customer workshops, I guess if they care to compete. Should I go back again to this place – well the answer is NO. I have been in better facilities, next time I should take more serious other peoples comments.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: MarieSunnyvale
Reviews.Content: We will come back from 2 weeks at the Allegro hotel. It was wonderfull. Rooms are very clean, food is good and diversified, animations are funny and entertaining. People are very sympatic and friendly. I hope I could come there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: NrsJaneFzyWzy
Reviews.Content: 9/8/04-9/15/04. Have stayed in other all-inclusives in Mexico so we were not virgins to the way things should be handled. The grounds are beautiful & well kept. Very nice pools & excellent beach. The rooms, however, are a different story! There is barely enough room to fit 2 double beds. And when we asked for a bigger room, were told they were all the same size (a lie!) but we could have a rollaway brought in if we wanted! There wasn't even room to walk around once we got our luggage in! The buildings are concrete w/ palapa roofs. I read reveiws of the beds being hard but had no idea it is because they are on cement slabs!! I'm not kidding. A mattress on a cement slab! We asked for extra pads & got them but it didn't make much difference. Anyway, we wouldn't stay there again mainly because of the rooms. We were there during hurricane Ivan. Luckily didn't have any severe weather but couldn't get the staff to tell us anything but "It might rain a little, maybe!" This is while CNN is saying we're in a hurricane warning and the staff is boarding up windows!! Food is good. Restaurant staff excellent. Reception staff is rude. Bar staff good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Travelbarginseeker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Occidental Playacar from August 18th - 21st. I was a bit tentative before my arrival, but once I was there I knew everything would be just fine. It is like everyone says, the grounds are absolutely beautiful and indeed the workers are constantly cleaning. The rooms are small, but you manage to work around that. The Beach is fantastic and you never want to leave it. (That's how you work around the small room situation). One thing for you to know, many Europeans feel they need to go topless. Hey, whatever! My 12 year didn't seem to mind, I, however, found it a bit annonying. The food isn't bad at all. The buffet has a wide variety of different choices, so you can't go wrong. I found breakfast to be the best meal. Lunch was good by the pool side. You had your choice of burgers, pizza (which is great), hot dog, etc. The best meals were at the Mexican and Italian restaurants. We had no problem scheduling a time for either one. You can only go once to each, but they were worth it. Once you get situated, take a stroll to 5th Avenue it's very nice and great shopping. I took the ferry over to Cozumel one afternoon and it was great. One important thing, Playa Del Carmen is not a place to go if you want to party. At the resort, after the entertainment is over, it's over. They have a small club, which has two pool tables, a small dance floor and a great bar. It's fine, if you go with a group and just want to hang out for a bit, otherwise call it a night. I must say, it's a great place for family to have some R & R. Almost forgot, the birds can get a bit noisy, I noticed if you have a room towards the front of the resort it's much more noticeable. I had a room towards the back and I didn't have a problem. So, if your going to Occidental anytime soon, have a fabulous time and forget all those negative reviews. Go with an open mind and enjoy the hospitality of those wonderful people who serve you with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Allegro!!”
Reviews.Author: ellesmere
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two weeks at the Allegro and can honestly say that we had a wonderful time. I am still dreaming about the place and wish I could go straight back. My children, aged 12 and 14, thought it was the best holiday ever and I have to agree. Anyone in the UK who is going there please, please, please ignore the gripes you read in some of the reviews on this site - overall the Allegro is a fantastic place to stay. The hotel grounds are gorgeous, the beach and sea fantastic, staff amazingly friendly and helpful, weather brilliant.......I could go on and on!!! We booked in March and then began to worry having read some of the negative reviews on this site. Having been there, I now think that there is a real culture difference between Europeans and Americans. We didn't want everything to be a replica of hotels in Europe. We wanted to feel that we were in Mexico - why sit on a plane for 10 hours otherwise?! However listening to some Americans while we were there that seemed to be the problem for them - they wanted it to be just like home! Go with an open mind and you will have a wonderful time - this is a lovely hotel. Please email me if you want anymore information or tips.

Reviews.Title: “allegro playacar an excellent place to go”
Reviews.Author: davek1
Reviews.Content: We have now been to the allegro twice once in August this year and previously in July 2003. Please don't believe everything you read here about how bad the place is go and judge for yourself. Ok so the food is a bit repetative but it is well cooked and served with a smile. the drinks are not watered down and even if they were they are included in the price so get 2. The staff couldn't be friendlier or do more for you. There were 6 in our party with 2 children. the kids club is excellent with well trained and competent staff, who my daughter loved. The evening shows are both professional and entertaining. I agree there isn't a lot to do after about 11pm, but by then most ( especially those with kids) are tired and if you don't have kids then go to fast eddies bar which is open until 2am, or it's 40 pesos or $4 to go into town by taxi. I can only say that having been twice I would be happy to return a third time. Please please don't not go based on the reports here because I assure you apart from the 11 hour trip from the UK it is the most relaxing and good value holiday you will find anywhere. Another tip if you want to hire a car use the guy in the reception area. He is the cheapest around and the cars are well maintained and modern. If you, can, try a bit of spanish, you will find it works wonders. I have to say that I did find some of the Americans expected too much of the staff and that is perhaps what their opinions are based on here. However almost all the people I spoke to of all nationalities agreed that the place was excellent. If anyone wants any advice please feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Fun...but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort August 7 -14, 2004. Overall, my husband, 3 year old son and I had a great time. We went on vacation to relax and that we did. The location of the hotel is great...right on the beach. The beach is beautiful too! There are two pools, one for relaxing and one for fun and games. I can't complain about the facilities. What I can complain about are the rooms and the food. I was told there were three restaurants to choose from each day. Well, you can only eat at two of the restaurants ONE time! The main restaurant that you can eat from every day tends to get a little boring after a while. My main complaint are the rooms. They are small and the beds are AWFUL!!! I can't explain to you how awful they are. They are the hardest thing other than the floor I have ever slept on. The pillows are like sleeping on bags of concrete. This was the worst part of my trip. Also, the air conditioning started out great and slowly got warmer and warmer as the week went on. However, based on the price I paid for the trip, I would say the overall value was well worth it. We hardly spent any time in the room so I can get over that. The service is great and the pools and activities are abundant. If you have children, they will love it. This resort is very oriented towards children. My 3 year old son had a blast. If you are looking for a good deal and don't care about the rooms or the food...this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Allegro from 7/3-7/10/04. The weather was great, the ocean was warm and beautiful and the grounds were well taken care of. Other than that the place was not very nice. The food was the same old stuff every single day. After 7 days I never want to see another buffet again. The Italian restaurant was excellent, but you can only eat there one night. (Make your reservation as soon as you get there) We stayed at room #4301. It had a horrible mildew smell because there is not a shower curtain, which means the water is all over the floor. The beds were hard, but we asked for a pad at the front desk and it was much better. The drinks were lousy also. They watered down every drink and the beer was constantly warm. Never Again! Going on a cruise next time.

Reviews.Title: “i had a great time”
Reviews.Author: alevacanza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the last week of July 2004 and I loved it. The staff was extremely nice- very fun and entertaining. I actually really miss them. The shows at night are good; the dancers are really talented. After the shows there isn't really much to do, although some people are just tired and want to go to bed. Since I'm young I wanted more to do once the show ended. You can go in town (Playa del Carmen,) or to Cancun although the ride there in a taxi is about $40. I went to CoCoBongo , a club in Cancun one night. One of the entertainment guys planned the trip and some teens from the resort went. It was the best night I had. I recommend young people to go to the club trips they plan. We went snorkeling and it was so beautiful. It was a little scary at first that all these fish are swimming all around you in your face, but once you overcome that feeling you can really appreciate sea life. The one thing that could be better is the food- it wasn't great. But since I had such a good time I honestly didn't even care about the food. The Italian resaurant is excellent and the presentation of the food is so nice. We went to the Mexican restaurant and didnt like it, but that's just our personal taste. I can say that it seemed like a family place. It wasn't bustling with young people, but there was a fair share. I had a two-bedroom suite right in front of the pool and beach. It was the best room there and it was really beautiful. There was even a little bar by the dining/living room. And i love the hammocks on the balconies. They're great to relax and take a little nap with the beach breeze. I definetely want to go back sometime next year- I really can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Allegro from 6th to 20th July 2004 inclusive (my husband and myself - 3rd wedding anniversary) and this was our first all-inclusive holiday to Mexico. We have chosen this property as it was built within a Mayan style and wanted to get away from the normal 5 star bedroom properties. As our trip came nearer and have read all the negative reviews we were on the point of cancelling. But we were pleasantly surprised, the resort is immacculate, the staff are very friendly and running an extra mile for you, and the beach is great and very clean. The Italian Restaurant is excellent (you need to book as soon as possible) and the Mexican Restaurant is good as well. But please note that no shorts and flip-flops are allowed in the Italian Restaurant. The resort was full with families, friends or couples (noneymooners). We had no problems with the weather and it only rained once (heavy downpour for 1 hour). A very good tip as well for you. If you are deciding to go to Cozumel for a day you can use the Allegro over there as well on an all-inclusive basis but you need to get an authorization form from Peter prior to your departure. We stayed at the Allegro/Coumel for 2 hours but found it not that nice & staff were unfriendly. If you are checking-out by 12 noon and have a late flight you can ask for a hospitality room at reception and a time will be booked for you, You can use this room for 30 minutes where you can have a shower and make yourself ready for your long way home and still can make use of the all-inclusive until you depart which is great. The resort is about a 20 minute walk away from Playa del Carmen (you can cycle down there as wel) or in a taxi it is about 10 minutes and cost you 40 Pesos (or $4). As we checked in we stayed in a ground floor room which smellt a bit damp and complained straight away (checked-in about 2.30am in the morning due to flight delays) and were moved the next day to an upstairs room which was much better. The only disadvantage was that the air-conditioning was noisy. Just to warn you as well the birds are waking you up at around 4.30am but it didn't bother us. There is a good mix of nationalities, especially from the US and Canada,Mexico and Europeans. On your first days you might be harrassed on the beach to attend a 90 minute presentation or with cheap tickets to Chichen Itza (please beware it is about time-share). As well when you check into the Allegro you will receive a form saying that you have won a gift. Do not redeem it as it is about time-share. Only redeem it if you are interested in it. Therefore stay away from it. The locaton is great for all the excursions to Tulum, Xel-ha, Cancun, Xcaret, Cozumel, Chichen Itza. Otherwise we had a brilliant time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: peterinholland
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and and our first experience of an all-inclusive hotel. We loved the hotel and the location. The beach is clean and the water warm. The 2 pools were great & I could even do laps at some times during the day. The food was always forthcoming - plenty of it and always available. The guests are a good mixture - with most from the US & Europe - important to note for non-US visitors ! We really enjoyed the activities/entertainment - we took the Spanish lessons & Salsa classes by the pool during the day, shows during the evening. The rooms were great. Plenty of hot water in the shower and the ceiling fan and air-conditioning worked wonders. The only problem we encountered was finding the right person to turn on the lights for the tennis courts at night. A nice touch is the hospitality room. Check-out time was midday, but our flight wasn't until 7pm. We were still able to use all the facilities all afternoon and then shower in of the rooms designated as a hospitality room. You can reserve a room for half an hour to do so. Would strongly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Entire Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not believe any of the negative reviews you might read about the Allegro, Expedia, nor Best Day Tours. Some people are not happy regardless of where they are or what they are doing. Granted, we are not world travelers, but we have been to enough places to know the difference between good and bad. My husband and I just returned yesterday, July 17th, from our second honeymoon celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary. We could not have enjoyed our experience more. After booking our trip through Expedia in May, I contacted them by phone on two different ocassions in July before we left, and the agents were more than helpful. They contacted the Allegro to reserve specific rooms that I had read about through other reviews. We stayed in the best room in the entire resort--#5703. It is at the very end of the resort beachfront. It was private and a 20 foot walk to the beach. They also contacted Best Tours for us since we did not know how to find them once our flight landed in Cancun. The agent was able to provide pertinent information and we breezed through the airport to our awaiting bus. Look for blue pants and white shirts with blue and red stripes on the sleeves. Upon our departure from Cancun, a Best Day Tours agent escorted us to the correct airport desk for check-in and did not leave our side until she was sure that we were in the right place. My final call was about our short (30 minute) connection time in Houston before boarding our flight to Cancun. This agent contacted Continental Airlines for me and was able to assure us that if we took the shuttle, we would make the flight on time. Needless to say, we did. Once we arrived at the Allegro, we discovered that we were in paradise. The entire staff was friendly and very accommodating. We enjoyed the breakfast and dinner buffets. If you get tired of the food served on the buffet and are willing to wait in short, quick-moving lines, staff is available to make omelettes, pancakes, fruit smoothies, specialized pasta dishes, and specially offered entrees. When we were at the resort, we enjoyed our lunches poolside with a variety of choices from steak and fish to fajitas, hamburgers, and pizza. The Mexican and Italian Restaurants were very good--we made our reservations to each upon check-in. When you go to the Italian Restaurant, make sure that you are very hungry. They served us food and drinks for over two hours! We had reservations for the 9:00 dinner and were able to watch the nightly show (a Las Vegas Extravaganza) from our window seat. Other shows that we saw included a Mexican and Cirque de Soleil--type show. We were a short walk away from the poolside bar and found that an occasional dollar tip made for excellent service. It seemed that many people there chose not to tip at all. These are probably the people who write the negative reviews. I don't know of any other place where you can buy 2, 4, and sometimes even 6 drinks for a dollar. Remember to bring a large insulated mug. The bartender will gladly make your drink in it instead of the small, plastic glass provided by the hotel. We left the housekeeper a dollar each day and requested 4 bottles of water. The water awaited us along with her beautifully created towel sculptures and a perfectly cleaned room. We enjoyed a snorkeling trip through the resort to a beautiful reef . Bring a disposable underwater camera. We had not thought ahead of time about a tip to our tour guide until we saw a small box on the boat that said "Tips Appreciated". We were able to find him in the boutique once we returned to our room to get $3.00. We rented a car to drive to Tulum. It was a fascinating place with not only the phenomenal Mayan ruins but also shops and restaurants. I heard that the tour to Chichen Itza was wonderful, but we did not want to be stuck on a bus with a guide from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm. Make sure that, if you do rent a car, you know how to get back to the resort. We ended up driving through Playa del Carmen 3 times before we found our way "home." My husband was driving as crazily as the locals before we got back to the Allegro. Because we were there from July 12th to 17th, it was hot but beautiful and sunny. It rained briefly one afternoon and a couple of very early mornings--I mean 2:00 or 3:00 am. We're from Florida, so the weather was really no different from what we experience throughout the summer months. We took taxis to go into Playa del Carmen for shopping and to take the ferry to Cozumel. All you have to do is walk to the front of the lobby, and a taxi is waiting for you at the door. It was worth the $4.00 ride opposed to a sweltering 20 minute walk. The shopping was overwhelming on our first visit into Playa del Carmen. The store-keepers can be very pushy and aggressive. After pricing some items of interest and trying to deal with the bartering, we came home empty-handed the first night . After that, I decided the best approach was to enter only stores where they were not hawking their goods and demanding that you come into their shop to receive items "for almost free". Shopping got much easier after that, and I got wonderful deals on blankets, jewelry, leather, ceramics, and gifts. I shopped in Playa del Carmen, Tulum, and Cozumel and was able to purchase items for comparable prices in each of these places. A little research can go a long way. The rooms at the Allegro are adequate but not luxurious. Yes, the beds are hard, but we were so tired by the time we were ready to go to sleep each night that it didn't matter. As I said before, our experience in PlayaCar could not have been better. I highly recommend this resort for a fun, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “great resort for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: parrothead1691
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro late May, just before the Memorial holiday. We went with a LARGE group and this property was chosen based on price so as to be affordable for all. With that being said, and with this being my 8th trip to Mexico, I knew what to expect from a 4.5* hotel, and overall was not disappointed. This hotel appears to be somewhat older than others, but is well kept up. The grounds are lovely, the beach is beautiful. I would say the best part of staying at this resort is the staff. Of all the places I have stayed, the Allegro ranked right up there with friendliness of staff and excellent service. The first room we stayed in was fine. I know other reviews have said that they are too small and there is no storage space. The rooms are a little small, but quite adequate. There are no drawers but there are plenty of shelves in the bathroom. We are in a first floor room and I would probably recommend a second floor room as the ceiling is very high and it gives the appearance of the room seeming much larger. However, I have heard complaints from the 2nd floor residents that birds wake them up EARLY in the morning. Now, about the beds. The first room I was in the bed was quite firm but comfortable enough. I know from previous reviews that there are plenty of complaints about the beds. I thought these people were complainers until I switched rooms with someone and slept on a bed that was nothing like the first room and was extremely uncomfortable. Switching from room A to room B was like night and day. While the first room was fine, the second room had hard beds, broken AC, broken ceiling fan, ripped window screen, cracked bathroom mirror. I went to the front desk to at least have them fix the AC and fan, and to my surprise this was taken care of right away. As far as food goes, this was probably the biggest disappointment. I have stayed at many all-inclusives so I know what to expect as far as food goes, but the food here just wasn't all that great. My biggest complaint is the choices of eating places. Breakfast is fine, lunch is more limited but you can get your staples poolside like pizza, burgers and guacamole, but dinner is the worst. There are 3 restaurants but 2 of them are reservations only. The Mexican restaurant only has about 12 tables and the Italian is also small, so we had to eat at the buffet every night. Lots of non-descript items. The drinks were fine, bartenders friendly. The pool bar is fun during the day, but there is also a lovely bar over the lobby that shouldn't be missed. The beach is beautiful. They could use some more lounge chairs though, many of them are broken. The Allegro offers plenty of activities throughout the day with an energetic staff. Our group was kept busy and overall had a great time. My travel agent has always told me that a good rule of thumb for staying in Mexico is to stay at at least a 5* hotel (this is not the same as an American 5* hotel, I've read enough complaints about that!). The Allegro is great for the price, but if you can swing another couple hundred dollars, upgrade to a 5*. Feel free to e-mail with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Stop with the bad reviews...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a GREAT week at Allegro. Really have no complaints.....take ALOT of suntan lotion. You will not find a better place in Riviera Maya for the price. I read all of the bad reviews and wonder if all these people complain about their ice cream being cold also.....GREAT PLACE..GREAT STAFF...e-mail me if you need any info....

Reviews.Title: “Average trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was there for 7 days....On the first day, got a 1st floor room by the beach and pool. Switched to a 2nd floor room more into the resort because: a. We didn't feel like we had privacy, the curtains were opaque, and if you wanted the sunlight to shine in you would have to open up the curtains letting eveyone see inside. A mesh curtain would have been better. b. the music/dj by the pool was loud going on passed 9pm, and we wanted some peace/quiet. This is an all inclusive place. The buffet food was ok. Breakfast was good, lunch and dinner were bland. You really need to venture out to get good mexican food. However, the drinks were good. Captain Bob's was a great place for dinner, but pricey. If you go, try the coconut shrimp. You're going to have ants in the room, so don't bring any food/drinks back to the room. You may also have geckos, so don't be alarmed if you see one of those, as we did. I agree with other reviewers that the staff was very friendly and helpful. Although they did try to get us to go on a 60 to 90 minute "tour" of their resort for a free shirt, beach bag and towel. We didn't do the tour, because we were feeling pressured and didn't understand why they couldn't just have all the info in a book. I asked if they had such a book and they said no. I didn't go on vacation for a live infommercial. And plus, I don't need a t-shirt with their logo on it. All in all, a good experience, but next time would like to try the Riu palace next door.

Reviews.Title: “I really loved it there!”
Reviews.Author: Ready4Cabo
Reviews.Content: I have to say that overall this resort was beautiful, clean and pretty friendly. The waiters and staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We were put in a second floor room right near the beach. The couple that we were with wanted a second floor room as well and they were quick to switch the room for them to make them happy. A few days into the trip the air conditioner broke in their room and they moved them to a new room until it was fixed. Hey-it happens. The front desk staff went out of their way to help us out when we needed to get in touch with someone outside of the resort and were having trouble. My only problem was the fact that the restaurants, aside from the Italian one, are not air conditioned. It gets awfully hot and hard to eat when you are sweating! The food was good, not bland at all and the variety was good also. After reading reviews here I thought that I was going to a dirty, rude resort with smelly, small rooms. I was very excited to be placed in "paradise" for the week. The rooms are fine and the staff is constantly cleaning the grounds. I would happily go back to this resort again! Anyone who is not happy with this place is looking for a problem. THe price is right and the beach and location is amazing. I feel badly that this place gets such bad reviews.. it is definitely unwarrented.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Allegro for a week (June 21-28). At first I was a little worried about how it would be like after reading the reviews. The only complaint I had was that the beds were hard. Since we were always busy and out in the sun all day we'd get back to our room dead tired and didn't even notice how hard the bed was. The service was great! The shows were spectacular! If you get a chance definitely check out the Xcaret night show. That was an EXCELLENT show! If you visit Tulum make sure you put on some insect repellent. The tour leaves early so you get there before everyone else does and that's when the mosquitos come out for breakfast! It would have been nice to know that before we left the hotel. All in all we had a great time and would go back again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Good, Best Day Travels Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a pretty good week at the Allegro. Some of the other reviews are true in that the food is bland and the beds are hard but the pool and the beach is great and that is where we spent most of our time. We made 4 dives with Barakkuda which is connected to the hotel. They were great, especially Rodrigo, a little disorganized but it is Mexico after all. We had a second floor room that got very cold and the birds chirping in the morning was not a big deal at all. We met a lot of fun people and a great time at the swim up bar one afternoon! We stayed at the Gala last year and it is a little nicer, definitly better food but I think as a whole trip, because of the people we met and activities that we did, we had a much more fun time this trip. Best Day Travelers is a whole other experience. We got hooked up with them through Expedia. They were very unhelpful and downright rude. We had to wait at the airport in the hot sun for about 35 minutes until that had enough people for a full van. It was very inconvienent for us to catch the agent at the hotel to schedule our return trip to the airport. We asked the hotel staff to help us and they did but Best Day would not communicate with the hotel and would not help. We tried to call them ourselves and they wouldn't talk with us either. They were telling us that we had to go to the airport 6 hours before our flight left. When we finally caught up with our agent on the day of our departure, he made up some story of how we had to be there very early and was not freindly at all. I think we ended up leaving 4 hours prior to our flight. All in all, the trip was great but Best Day really put a damper on things the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: travelledbrummies
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews after I had booked this holiday and although they worried me I was prepared to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt as it is known that the Americans complain about nothng. How right they were to complain. The beds are on concrete bases, the rooms are very small and have an awful smell, the air conditioning is inadquate, the bath is a concrete box, the coffee maker is situated under a shelf that makes it impossible to fill unless you balance it in mid air and the cups are straigt from a transport cafe. Now the dining room. Not enough cutlery is laid and you are expected to use your only knife for each course, there seemed to be no organisation to how the buffet was laid out. The dining room staff were wonderful and worked hard and fast. After all, they can only work with tools they are given. There was an evening where the dinner was around the pool, but unless you had been around the pool that day you didn't know about it.It was nothing less than unorganised chaos. I doubt that much thought had gone into that night!!!!! The best meal of the holiday was in the Italian restaraunt. Superb! The entertainment ? The dancers were quite good but there was a trio (I think called chameleon) that does a turn and they seriously need some help, I would have prefered them to have the help out of there. DIABOLICAL would be the only word to use. As for the pool entertainment, well, what can I say?Nothing good about it. The beach. The sand was fine and white, the beach beds were in desperate need of renewing as most were broke, not nearly enough shade and as much as the English don't reserve beds on the beach, it was a case of "if you can't beat them, join them" We got fed up of having to listen to the OTT Amercans whether in the dining room, around the pool or on the beach.They like you to know they are there and you can't avoid hearing them. My advise would be- leave this hotel to the Americans, they are welcome to it and if you read this review after you have booked, pay the rate to change your hotel before you leave home because the holiday rep could do nothing for us when we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Had better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll just say if you don't know what your missing its ok... The staff was not helpful at all. Can't eat when you want, food was bland . I like when you can eat when you hungrey ,Could not take food to pool or carry out in morning if you like . Had a ok time! But i will say had a lot better service at another hotel in area two years ago... Would not go back !

Reviews.Title: “Will definetly return!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband took 6 days off to relax (w/o the kids). I was a little skeptical on the resort, due to some of the reviews I read, but I was very surprised. We had never stayed in an all inclusive resort. It was great! The only thing I didn't like was the time schedule for the buffet. One day we missed breakfast by 10 min. We were going to have to wait 2 hrs till they served lunch. The hotel staff were willing to go that extra mile w/a smile. We made friends w/alot of foreigners,in the pool & "Fast Eddies"(bar). The pool area has alot of things to do. They keep you busy. They also let you relax. The grounds were very well kept up & very clean. I really like the little figurines made out of towels, that the maids made up on the beds every night. Never had problems w/bugs. The rooms do smell a little musty, but after a day or 2 , you get used to it. Take a "plug in" freshner. Definetly try to make your reservations for the Italian restaurant as soon as you get there. The food was pretty good. I found that very little dishes were bland. The drinks were pretty good. Definetly make a trip to Isla de Mujeres & Xcaret (WOW). If you go to Xcaret, get there 1st thing in the morning the river & beach isn't crowded & you get better snorkeling. There is a great little restaurant we came across on Isla- "Mininos". If you take the ferry from Cancun, you go right after exiting the ferry landing. It's a family ownes restaurant where all the locals go. The guy has alot of lobster traps sitting just behind the shack, you can see them from the street. Order the mixed cocktel(shrimp,octopu & conch)-delish................. The fried whole fish was awsome, so was the lobster. Very moderately priced! The owners name is Sr. Gomez. if you want to eat region seafood, out under coconut trees, that's the place to go. On a scale of 1-5 I give our trip a 5. Will definetly be going back with the kids.*****Beware of timeshare reps by the baggage claim area. They sit under a sign that says tourist info /passenger info.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon, Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Allegro from June 6th-June 13th for our honeymoon. We absolutely loved the area, the shopping on 5th Avenue was a lot of fun and all of the people are friendly and helpful. Just like everyone else says, the beach is the best part of the resort, it is gorgeous! But it wasn't the only good thing at Allegro, in fact we were happy with everything. The food at the Buffet is very good, you just have to be selective. We found the Pasta Bar to be excellent because they make it just how you like it. Also, the chicken dishes at the buffet were always very good. The local Mexican dishes are very bland, nothing like the Mexican food we serve in the U.S. But everywhere we went we found the same thing, they don't tend to use a lot of spices. I read these reviews before I went and I was so nervous about getting reservations based on what I read, but we had no problem. The person at the Reservation Desk was very friendly and we got in both restaurants no problem. The Mexican Restaurant was so much fun! Miguel was our waiter and we had a great time! The Italian Restaurant had great food, and it was nice for a quiet evening. As far as the drinks at all the bars, we didn't think that they were weak, they were just right. Make sure to try all of the Mixed drinks they offer, they were very good and it's free! The staff is fantastic! Everyone is always smiling and they are very accomodating! Our room was cleaned everyday and the bed was hard but we slept great! The one problem that we had on our trip was it rained for the last 3 days non stop. We were unaware that rain was so common there in June. But this resort really didn't have any indoor activities for when it's raining, everywhere you went it was packed with people. We just ended up in our room most of the time, which actually flooded on the last night from all the rain! But as long as the weather is good, the resort is wonderful! The people who say otherwise wouldn't have been happy no matter where they went.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Rain !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and my first visit to Playa. We will definetely be back. The Hotel is a very quaint and extremely clean establishment. The grounds are kept immaculate and the service is very attentive. Beach is great and so are the pools, although it can be difficult to find a place to lay out by the pool that provides some shade, most of the "palapas" are taken in the morning and people have a tendancy to leave their towels on the chairs all day. The staff makes a great effort in trying to entertain you consistently. The food (buffet) is OK , not great not bad. The Mexican Restaurant was outstanding, it was by far the best "Chile Relleno" I have ever had. The weather was awful we had 2 days of Sun which were great and 3 consistent days of rain, rain and more rain. The shows were very entertaining and it looked like they had a great kids club. Lots of europeans, probably 80 % of the Hotel. The transportation that Expedia offers is totally unreliable , your better of taking your own cab there and back from the airport. They(BEST DAY TOURS) never picked me up to take me to the airport so I had to end up paying an extra 40 dollars, DO NOT USE BEST DAY TOURS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience outside Europe. From the moment we stepped on the place, we felt special. From the individual TVs on the plane, to the private transfer transport and the bell boys on arrival. We fell in love the the place as soon as we arrived and it looked just as good as it did in the photos (which is what attracted us there in the first place). Even my 10 year old very picky daughter couldn't find fault. We adored the thatched roof, the hammock on the balcony, and even feel in love with the local wildlife (what were those funny four-legged animals?!) We were pleasantly surprised by the quality and quantity of food and drinks available and were impressed by the Italian restaurant. Again, one satisfied 10 year old. The beach was idyllic and we had no problems with hustlers selling their wares. The staff couldn't do enough and we felt very well cared for. The evening shows were very entertaining. The only downside I can think of is that the entertainment staff clearly had their favourites and if you weren't "part of the gang", you could feel a bit left out. I have always said that I will never go back to the same place twice as there are so many other places in the world to go. But this just might have changed my mind...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but..................”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff and cleanliness was outstanding, as were beach and swimming pools. However, the food and the room left alot to be desired. The selection and presentation of food was very good, but was very bland in taste. The room was clean and well-kept. The bed was a matress on top of a cement slab that was not comfortable and the walls were so thin not only could you hear someone fart in the adjacent room you could smell it as well. Overall was a good time but not the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Allegro Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent the first week of May at the Allegro Playacar. The location was great - on a beautiful beach and close to Playa Del Carmen. The staff were very friendly and the food was adequate. The poolside buffet and pizzeria were great so you could spend your whole day on the beach. You can walk for an hour down the sandy beach as there are many resorts in the area. Some nearby resorts were nicer but The Allegro offered great value - the beach is the same and the food is probably comparable so unless you want to spend the day in you room the Allegro should be fine. The rooms were adequate. As far as the ants go just make sure you do not leave any open food or unrinsed glasses or plates in your room. We were on the top floor and the A/C worked fine - it was too cold most nights! The birds do start chirping early so you might want to bring earplugs if you plan on sleeping in (we were at the beach before 9am everyday). A good tip is to place a towel on a lounge chair under a palapya before breakfast so you can have some shade when you want it. If we wanted some sun for awhile we just took our towels to another lounger in the sun and left our other stuff under the palapya. There were time share people on the beach but after we said we were not interested on the first day he left us alone for the rest of the week. There is lots to do in the area if you want to. Another tip - bring an insulated cup so you can fill it up at the bar and it will stay cold for a good while. Also, leave a note on your bedside table asking for 2 or 3 bottles of water each day - it comes in handy for drinking, brushing teeth or rinsing cups etc. We left a tip each day and had great service. Overall, you can't go wrong in going to Playacar and the Allegro offers great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlm30
Reviews.Content: Overall, my boyfriend and I (we are both 24) had a great time in Playa del Carmen at the Allegro. Some words of advice that I would have liked to have known. First, do some research about the rooms. Some rooms are better than others (eg, we had a room 10 feet from the beach while other rooms were very far away). Our room number was 5704. It appears that the higher the room number, the closer you are to the beach. So any units with 57xx 56xx or 47xx are good. Also, we stayed in a 1st floor room and it was fine (ac worked). However, the rooms are small and there are no dressers to put your clothes (not a problem for my boyfriend, but a problem for me). Also, we did find some bugs, but they were just a few ants on the sink. Not a huge problem. The beds are hard-so ask for the pad that you can up on the mattress and then it wasn't too bad. Second, tip. I know it's included, but it really seemed like employees of the resort would go out of their way to help you without the tip. Once you tipped, they would be even more considerate. I brought about 25 singles with me. Get the singles before you go. THird, book your reservations to the restaurants the day you get there. They take the reservations very far in advance. Go to both--they were much much better than the buffet at night. As far as food, breakfast was pretty good. For lunch, I thought the poolside restaruant was much better than the buffet. Dinner at the buffet--ok, but kinda bland. Fourth, we rented a jeep for two days to travel to Tulum and Cel-Ha. Definitely the way to go. (Although the driving was quite scary!!) This way, you are on your own time. Both places were musts, but I heard that Coba was really neat, but physically enduring. We also went to Cozumel for the day to go snorkeling. I didn't think the snorkeling was all that good. (Other places in teh Caribbean, such as Caymans, Virgin Islands, Aruba, were much much better). But if you go, we went with a group from Scuba Libre (a dive center in Playa del Carmen) and they were very good. Also, at night, my boyfriend and I went to a bar called the Blue Parrot...go! It was great! Lastly, if you get a good deal to this resort, do it. But if you get a better or comparable deal to another hotel in Playacar (which is a neighborhood of resorts and private homes), go to that one instead. Being in Playacar was great and I wouldn't go to a hotel outside of it. You could walk around the neighborhood and walk (about 20 mins.) to playa del carmen. Have a great time!
