Reviews.Title: “Wanted just 1 more day”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Allegro Playacar with 2 other couples. We were all a little leary after reading some of the reviews, but found the hotel to be just fine. All time share situations were completely avoided, the beach was nice, location was perfect, and the staff was quite helpful. As to the previous comments...the beds were hard, but not a problem by the end of a full day. We slept great the 3 nights that we were there. The air conditioning worked better in the 1st floor rooms (ceilings were lower) than in the 2nd floor rooms with the high thatched roofs. We were on the 2nd floor and while our room wasn't "cold", we never had a problem sleeping with the ceiling fan on. Our friends that had the 1st floor room could get the room downright cold. I would give all of the food a "thumbs up" except for the Italian restaurant. It was a little bland, but we were in Mexico and not Italy. The Mexican restaurant was awesome and we didn't try the buffet at night. Snack station by the pool was good and the line at the bar moved rather quickly. All in all, we'd stay at the Allegro again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of time share”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If someone for the Occidental Allegro Playacar calls your room and tells you 'you have won a prize' but you need to attend a 60 minute breakfast meeting - DO NOT GO!!Our 60-minute breakfast turned into FOUR hours of harassment by seven different individuals all trying to sell us TIME SHARE!!! This was something that we were not interested in purchasing and we clearly made this known. Had I been interested, I would hope that they would assume I have the intelligence to contact someone. We were put in an uncomfortable situation as the staff continuously tried to manipulate (rather flimflamm) us into doing something that we were not interested in. Firstly, how many times do you have to tell someone you are not interested in order for them to understand without being rude. And secondly how can something get marked down from $40,000 to $29,000 to $6900. But it didn’t stop there. If we couldn’t do the $116 per month, how about 7 trips for $1999!! What an incredible offer my foot ... all they wanted was us to sign SOMETHING !!If approached by anyone ... tell them where to go!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to Playa del Carmen, the 1st time we've spent at Occidental Carribean, it was okay. We all like the Allegro much better. Like what everyone said, the beach was GREAT! The swimming pools was big enough and my 2 year old son had a great time at the kids club, which has a Micky Mouse shapped pool, toys, playground, TV and etc. All the staff we've met were very very nice and friendly. My travel agency contacted the manager 1 week prior to our arrival and had arranged 2 rooms right next to each other that's right next to the swim-up bar and only 30 second walk to the beach. They have plenty of food for everyone. Breakfast from 7am, lunch at 11am, snack at 3pm and dinner at 6pm, and of course, lots of drinks. The only thing is that the room has lots of sugar ants, don't leave unfinished drinks on the night stand, i'm sure you'll see sugar ants all over the next day. Eventhough we didn't spend much time in the room, mostly at the beach and pool, but only if they could make sure that the room is cleaner. Hey, nothing is perfect, besides, the price for the trip per person is very ideal. I would go there again for my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “allegro review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allegro May1-5, 2004. We met my husband's brother and his wife from Milwaukee at the resort. We had a great time. The beach is beautiful, and the pools areas are well kept up. There is always someone cleaning something. The grounds are beautiful. The buffet food is average, you can find something that you will like. The lunch by the pool has guac, salsa and chips, and it is excellent. We liked the Mexican and Italian restaurants, and we went into Playa one night and ate at Los Rancheros.. You must try it. The whole meal is a show and you look out at the ocean!! The hotel staff was curtious and went out of their way to please you. Our only complaints: 1. when my husband and his brother wanted to use one of the boats, they were told various things -- first to come back later, second they needed a credit card, and then third that they couldn't go out. 2. They need to come up with a better way to book your reservations for the Mexican and Italian restaurants, and a more friendly person than Peter.. All in all, it was a great vacation. We enjoyed ourselves, and would definitely return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Three Stars, Not Four”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ola! We stayed at the Allegro Playacar the last week of April 2004. The beaches, pools and landscaping were magnificent, and the weather was great. We met a wide variety of fellow guests from Canada, UK, Germany, France, and US. The hotel staff was generally excellent -- and most were tri-lingual! The mexican and italian restaurants were truly outstanding. Drinks at the pool were quite good. The buffet food was quite plentiful, but very bland. I like a firm mattress, so slept well on the "mattress with a foam cover on a concrete slab" beds. I would rate this hotel three stars, not a four star hotel. The travel agency tours (Chichen Itza and Xelha) were very good. The rumors we heard about this resort's plumbing problems proved true, but they were resolved promptly. A tip to future travelers -- make use of public restrooms as much as possible, even in the hotel complex. I wear contact lenses, so would have appreciated having a stopper for the sink to prevent dropping lenses down the drain. I think that Fast Eddie's disco (?) & bar should be renamed Not-So Fast Eddie's. The purpose of a DJ is to play music that the patrons want to hear and/or dance to, not to play the DJ's favorite music. The music was truly un-danceable, except for the few occasions where we made specific requests to the DJ (hidden in the back room -- for good reason); and then, he mixed the songs so short that you enjoyed about 8 bars of the songs you requested before he switched to something else un-danceable. Enough said! I'd stay there again for a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar 4/24 thru 4/29. I would rate Allegro a 3 star. Not 4 star. There were 6 women vacationing without husbands and kids and we had a wonderful time. The Allegro grounds are beautiful. Pools and Beach are the best. Manuel, you make the best drinks at the swim up bar. The activities offered met all expectations, GREAT! The staff were very polite and friendly. They especially liked our water guns and floats. We bribed a couple of staff with the water guns for some American Music. The Disco - Fast Eddies at the Allegro is lacking - BIG TIME. They play terrible music and no one wants to dance to that kind of music. Our beds were hard, but thanks to my reading the advisory before I left, I knew to ask for foam pads for our beds on our arrival. They put them on and all was well. The desk people did not want to help keep our group together when checking in, they just ignored our requests, but we did not let that get us down. The Funjet people were great. The food was average. Pizza was okay, if you ate only the cheese pizza. Thank goodness for cheeseburgers at lunch ! And real french fries! We had a great vacation. Of course I have the best friends in the world and we would have had fun no matter where we go. I love them all and hope they had as much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Allegro is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Mexico. We booked our reservation for the Allegro because it sounded like a nice place for a good price. The hammocks on the balcony is what initally attracted us. After booking the trip, I found this website with the reviews of the different hotels. After reading some of the reviews, I thought for sure I had made a huge mistake. I even tried to change to a different hotel, but everything was booked. So we went hoping for the best. The grounds of the Allegro are absolutely beautiful. We felt like we were in paradise. The food was average, not great but certainly not awful. The italian restaurant was outstanding and the mexican restaurant was very good. The drinks are a total farce. I think the liquor bottles are filled with water. We took the advice of other reviews about tipping so that the bartenders and waiters would take better care of you, it made absolutely no difference. Most of the help were extremely nice. The only bad part and the reason why we would not return to this particular resort, was the size of the rooms. There is no place to put your clothes! We lived out of our suitcases for the week. Also, there is a miniscule shower door which allows you to flood the bathroom floor whenever you take a shower. We did not see any bugs, did not hear our neighbors through the walls (it was very quiet), yes, the beds are hard but still very comfortable and did not have any problems booking dinner reservations. All in all we had a wonderful vacation. I would highly reccommend the Allegro if you don't care about the room. Everything else about it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Family Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sageranch
Reviews.Content: Family of four (4); two adults, 2 boys ages 9 & 12 stayed at The Allegro Playcar from 4/8 - 4/18/04 and had a WONDERFUL time! Read previous reviews re:hard beds, no reservations, ants. We experienced none of the above. My sons hated the kids club at previous resorts but they could not stay away from this one! Janis the kids club director is wonderful! The food is average; not top notch gourmet but delcious none the less. Caruso's Italian Rest, is excellent, very top of the line. Make reservations on the day of your arrival. Careful they will try and sell you timeshares and tell you that they're are a part of your "travel advisor". Negative side: rooms are small, but cozy; beds are a full size matress on top of a cement foundation. Not at all too hard to sleep on. Bathroom is small. Upside: Great pools, great beach! Activities team is wonderful! Staff very friendly/helpful. If you smile and ask nicely (try Spanish) then they will pretty much be at your beck and call!We luckily missed the partiers the week before. But beware, they do mix a strong drink! They definately do not measure the alchohol and are not at all tight with the hard stuff. We will definately return to this resort. Great location to downtown (15-20 min walk) 5 min., taxi ride ($4.00 us). Tulum is worth seeing and is approx. a 30 min drive. ALmost would recommend taking a taxi and avoiding the tour to Tulum & Xel-Ha as we left the hotel at 8:30, picked up one other hotel, had to go downtown to get the tickets, dropped off some passengers to Xel-Ha then we went to Tulum (arrived at 11:30) and then left at 1:30 and spent the rest of the day at Xel-Ha until 5:00. too rushed, not enough time at Xel-Ha which isnt a bad place but pretty much like Disneyland. Very crowded. Strongly recommend going on your own to both places. Tulum is wonderful though.Enjoy your Stay and don't let the negative, possibly pushy, expect more people advise you against going there. We were very concerned and did not experience anything previous reviews complained of.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about choices.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In summary, I think this is a great three-star resort. I just got back from the Allegro yesterday and was scared to death going in based upon the prior reviews. However, my husband and I had a lovely, relaxing week. The staff was WONDERFUL - very nice and eager to get to know you. I had a decent base in Spanish, and they loved to chat. The food was good - again, it's about the choices you make. The foods that were more native to the area (taquitos, beans, fish) were GREAT, and they had excellent salsas and sauces. I could have lived on the fruit alone. If you specifically ask for top shelf liquor, you'll get it. Just be clear about what you want (rum punch with the Bacardi Anjeo is wonderful). The beach is amazing and so relaxing - we spent all day there and would cool off in the pool. There were fun activities if you wanted to participate but we pretty much kept to ourselves and stayed in the peace and quiet. Our room was clean and a quick turn with the air conditioner cleaned out all musty smells. With the air on, we couildn't hear anything, but I actually liked the bird sounds, so I would leave it off to listen to the waves and birds. The only noisy thing was a group of midwesterners who were just having a great time on vacation. Who could argue with that? A few hints: 1. If you get outside by about 9 a.m., you can still get a palapa reserved on the beach, no problem. When we were there, there were chairs available all day. 2. Ask for top shelf and you'll get it - the coffee is great with a bit of Kalua in it. 3. Learn a bit of Spainish before you go - everyone appreciated our efforts. 4. If you go into Playa del Carmen, try the Casa del Agua on 5th Ave. and 2nd. Yummy (make a reservation to be out on the patio overlooking the ocean). 5. If you are expecting a message, warn the front desk. Two people left messages for us that were never relayed to us. VERY irritating. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average but decent enough”
Reviews.Author: HotHotel
Reviews.Content: I´m an ex-pat that lives in Mexico City and have visited many a Mexican beach resort. That being said I can tell you that travelling in Mexico DOES NOT require anyone to lower their standards if you pick the right hotel. The Allegro is fine but is not a 4 star hotel. Its a 3 star if you compare to the other resorts in PlayaCar development. However, if what you are looking for is a decent room, clean, with no luxury, average food and very nice service , and a fantastic beach, this is the place for you. I think that the hotel could improve the food a little bit, and also the staff working at the reception desk, but other than that, my daughter and I had a very decent and average stay. The rooms are quite small, and the bathroom and closet area are all one with a sink in between. This area really needs some sprucing up but it was always clean. There were ants in the room but I probably brought that on since I had sodas and chips in the room one night. The AC worked fine. The beds and the pillows were really hard for my taste, but the shower had lots of hot water etc. I really disliked the staff at the pool that practically bullied folks in participating in the poolside activities. Folks are there to relax and if they want to participate great---if not, leave them alone. I actually heard one staff member state that if the group that was participating in one activity did not return at 3pm, their open bar privileges would be revoked.......joking or not, that is not way to attract participation. The other staff were really nice though and there was constant cleaning and pruning. My opinion is that the Allegro should advertise as a three star and surprise folks when they receive more than leave people expecting 4 star and leaving them dissapointed and complaining. Its all about managing expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Its all in the expectations....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for the reviews here to temper my expectiaions for our first all-inclusive experience. If you've read all these reviews you know just what to expect. We were there 3/27 thru 4/4 and we found the resort to be a lot of fun, especially for those with children (we had 4 in our group). Supposed problems: 1) Beds-- Hard but all of us appreciated them in the end. Very restful and 'clean' feeling. 2) Birds--C'mon, you should pay extra for the birds! 3) Service-- Everyone worked as hard as they could and tried to keep you as happy as they could. Can't ask for more than that. 4) Room Size & storage-- Not good. Small and no room to unpack. Organize your suitcase to be your 'drawer'. 5) Room cleanliness-- Very clean. No odors for our 2 rooms. This service (as well as others) was improved with routine (yet small) tipping. 6) Food selection-- have to agree with the naysayers here but its hard to put a finger on why. The food was good enough and plentiful. Not all of it was great and it did get to be repetitious. Don't stay 2 weeks, I agree! Also, I would have loved to have some beers out of a bottle and some upgradeable liquor choices. That was really getting old at the end. 7) Unruly teens-- I've got to say we really enjoyed the younger crowd during our week, but it did look as if things were changing for the worse as we left. 8) Room noise-- We both had lower rooms (supposedly quieter) and heard nothing at all! We heard so little we really have to question the other reports, but if you have a problem with that sort of thing, stay on the 1st floor. We had no mechanical or technical difficulties whatsoever. What we did like: Pools, beach, seaweed-free waters, spectacular grounds, staff, service, atmosphere, pizza, location, kids activities, water sports, pool guys (but also the option for a 2nd, quieter pool), agoutis, plentiful beach and pool chairs, Playa Del Carmen itself, Playacar shopping plaza (within walking distance), etc, etc., etc. Would love to return to the area, but may not come back at the MOST expensive time of year and may upgrade to a higher ranked property based ONLY on food and beverage choices and quality. Otherwise this a comfortable, fun locale that if we do choose another property and get better food and drink but lose the attitude and atmosphere may regret the decision.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: anneanderson
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, this resort provided me the best vacation of my life! The staff was wonderful and would wait on you hand and foot, but you were also able to develop a friendly relationship with them also. The food was also excellent! There was a variety of foods so you wouldn't have a problem if you were a picky eater. And make sure you go to the Italian and Mexican restaurant, the food there is wonderful also. The shows were very entertaining, specially the Miss Allegro competition!The hotel rooms were very clean and nice, and if you needed and extra towel, people were there in a jiffy to bring it to you. Just don't run into the rooms expecting to plop on a soft bed like they do in the movies. In other words, the beds are hard, but not hard enough you can't sleep. If you also need to book any day trips, there are many peole who can help you book them at the hotel. If you also want to go to the little town of Playa del Carmen or shop at the Plaza it is just a short bike ride, walk, or taxi cab away. Hanging out by the pool and the beach was my favorite part! Many activities were provided so you were never bored. Some of the activities were swimming, water polo, beach volleyball, beach soccer, yoga, step aerobics, etc. And, there was unlimited drinks at the swim uo soda bar. This vacation was incredible and I would come here year after year!

Reviews.Title: “Whiners are snobs! Great place and people awesome!”
Reviews.Author: swimcoach1
Reviews.Content: I went there during spring break with my family and from reading most of the earlier reviews I expected a hell hole. Those people are snobs as the people there bent over backward to help and entertain the guests. The rooms were for the most part clean but a bit noisy up to 11-12 pm some nights but people are on vacation and do party! If we had a problem they were there within hours to remedy our report. The Kid's Place and the activities associated with it are the best. My grandson met many new friends there and the woman running it, Janet, has the patience of an angel. We loved the show put on every evening by the kids prior to the main attraction at the outdoor theatre. Well done and FUN! The pools are clean and the activities are superb. Go...expecting to have fun! Go looking for problems and they will find you. But these people will find problems no matter where they go. So enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: beckerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the allegro from April 3 - April 10 prior to that we spent a week at a real 5 star in Akumal. Although the Allegro is fine there were some huge differences. The people at first were not very friendly especially compared to Akumal. But we made out fine. The beds are hard but not as bad as people make them out to be. Our toilet backed up once and it took 3 calls and one trip to the lobby to get it fixed. We were there when the power went out and it wasn't the hotels fault, we asked for candles at the front desk and they were happy to oblige. As for the drunken teens, we were there although we didn't see the disgusting things that the other people did but having met one of the mothers at the lobby when they first arrived and her ranting about what a shabby place it was that they would charge $50 for a lost towel card and how better hotels would never do this, you can understand where the kids were coming from. ONe mother said to my husband "but they're only eighteen" and he said to her " I don't care how old they are". The food was not of great variety, especially having come from the 5 star, but it was ok. you would not want to spend 2 weeks here. The food and service was great in the Italian restaurant. The steak was superb. Had we known this, my son wanted steak so bad and we went to 5 Ave. and had a horrible steak, served raw, we would have booked the restaurant sooner. Book the restaurants as soon as you get there. The beach is beautiful. We only had one rough day and people were very cautious. The pool is right off the beach so it's no problem going into the pool and then back. The workers were very good and the grounds were very clean and well kept. Our room was on the upper floor and the air con worked great. We heard no noise from other suites in our building but we had no partiers either. They were working on the sidewalks outside our place but we never heard them. There were ants in the room but we had no other problems and no smell problems, so I'm sure it's a hit and miss with the rooms the way some people complain. The only thing I really see wrong is the two hotels we stayed at were of such different quality but they both charged the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a 7”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Allegro Playacar week of April 1-9, 2004. The resort is the mirror image of the property in Cozumel which I we stayed at 2 yrs ago. It is NOT a 4 star resort so don't expect the luxury you'd get at the Hideaway or Xcaret. The property consists of 8 unit, 2 story dwellings. I have stayed in both upstairs and downstairs units. The lower levels are a bit more claustrophobic but have better (i.e. working a/c). This time we got a top floor room which while it seemed larger due to the thatched high ceilings, was like sleeping in an oven at night. We had to sleep with the windows and curtains wide open which let in the ocean breezes. But generally not bad. The rooms were clean and I saw no bugs. Yes, the beds are hard - more like a futon then a mattress - but you are so dang tired at night from the beach, you barely notice. I suffer from insomnia while at home and I never woke up at night except for one instance having nothing to do with the accomodations (see below). The hotel has a small stretch of white sand beach and there were always plenty of beach chairs and shade from the palm trees and palapas. However since the beach is considered federal property there are no lifeguards and you swim at your own risk when the water is choppy. The upside is you can walk along the beach endlessly in both directions past the other resorts and homes. The beach was very clean. The color of the water is amazing but I could do without the incessant drone and exhaust smell of all the jet skis drivers who seemed intent and trying to kill each other. We witnessed one particularly nasty crash. At least the swimming area is roped off so you don't get run over by these crazies. There is plenty to do at Playacar (or not). The staff organized beach and pool games, excercise classes including intro yoga, land & water aerobics. They were constantly present from about 10am til 10pm but I often wished they would just shut up and turn off the music and leave us alone for a little bit. The nightly entertainment was generally ok, sometimes funny and would often include audience members. The food consists of one large dining hall buffet with lots of variety, and 2 smaller restaurants, one Mexican one Italian, which require reservations. The restaurants were excellent. In the afternoon they also have a small lunch buffet at the pool area and usually grill something, meat, fish, pork. We found all the waitstaff was very attentive and friendly. The grounds were kept immaculately clean, however there was some construction going on in several of the units so I can imagine it was noisy for those folks nearby if they wanted to sleep in. There was an occassional swapy smell but remember you are in the jungle. One night there was a power outage - the whole town blacked out but the hotel still had some areas with auxillary power. The upside was that it was a clear night and the stars were bright and the moon was full. The power remained off from about 7pm til about 1pm. It was clearly NOT a hotel problem but there were still the boorish louts who complained at the front desk as if there was something the hotel could do about it. This outage extended all the way up and down the coast. We made the most of it at the bar where Jorge the bartender lit candles and kept us all very happy. We rented a old VW bug from Alamo at the airport and would venture out a little bit everyday. We filled the tank up once and drove around for a whole week. We visited Tres Rios which while expensive was very interesting to float down the hidden rivers, spent a day at Akumal and Porto Morelos, snorkelled at some off the beaten path beaches. We spent a few nights in Playa, shopping on 5th Ave. Dinner at the Blue Lobster was exceptional. During past trips we visited XelHa, Tulum and Xcaret but steered clear of Cancun. The hotel has bikes which you can use to ride into town or a little plaza only 500 meters from the hotel. There are gift and jewelry shops, a drugstore and internet cafe. All very nice. The biggest problem with the resort has nothing to do with the resort itself but the loud, obnoxius people who made me totally ashamed to say I was from the USA. There was a large contingent of folks from GA, MI & MN and all the rest of us all wished they would have stayed home. There was a large group of teen boys and girls who spent their entire week binge-drinking, vomiting on the beach, fighting, breaking furniture and openly cursing. Since the drinking age is 18, I imagine this was for most of them, their first experience with alcohol. Especially obnoxious was the night when the parents of several "missing" teen girls went door to door at 4am, banging on doors, looking for their children, waking up all the residents. As a parent, I think if you are going to allow your child to binge drink all day (these kids were hammered by 12 noon) - don't come looking come looking for them at 4am! I saw numerous instances of these teens being very rude to the wait and barstaff and quite openly making fun of the delightful local workers. It made me cringe to see these Ugly Americans give the rest of us a bad name. My son and I have travelled all over Europe, US, Canada, Central America and the Caribbean and have never seen anything like this. It was a new low in boorish behavior. For you readers from other countries please believe we are not all like these jerks and I apologise for them. All in all - the resort is quite plesant but don't expect luxury. It had everything we needed and we did as little or as much as we wanted to do. We met some terrific people from all over and have some terrific memories.

Reviews.Title: “Never again in this lifetime...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Does the phrase " no rooms available because we are overbooked" sound familiar ??? It is unfortunately over used and I can say even abused at this hotel. I traveled to Mexico w/ a friend and we were told 3 hours after waiting in the lobby that the hotel had no room for us. Ny now, we had noticed this happening to everyone around us, including a honeymooning couple quite purturbed by the whole incident. We were then offered a stay at another hotel for a few days with the understanding that we would be moved back...We refused...We had spent 2 months doing research on this area and had picked this place to stay at. Eventually they offered us a room with only one bed, our reservations called for 2 !!! In desperation we took it with assurance that they would move us the very next day...not !!! We have complained to the hotel headquarters in Florida, to our travel agent, to our visa cards...to no avail!!! Please e-mail with suggestions and choose another hotel, Mexico has many...

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, yes...I know....when you travel to Mexico you need to lower your expectations. But when I'm paying a four-star price, I do expect four-star service. The rooms are small. The beds are rock-hard. The food is quite ordinary. And the drinks are bad. On the first night, our toliet backed-up and our room smelled like a sewer for the remainder of our stay. We found that the hotel has had so many complaints about the hardness of their beds that they've invested into 1" thick form pads that they will lay on the mattress if you request them...they do help. They have a shuffleboard court, but no equipment to play the game with. They have one basketball court and only one basketball that they check out to some but only one basketball which they'll check out to some luckly soul on a daily basis...everyone else is out of luck. No game room. Other than the pools and beach, the only other kid activity offered is outdoor chess. Food was plentiful. The same fare was served everyday with very little variation. Breakfast and lunch was OK. But dinner was consistently bad. Really bad. They have a very limited selection of alcohol...all of the lower shelf variety with no option for an upgrade. My gin was actually pored from plastic squeeze bottle...a sight I've never before witnessed. The bottom line. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and helpful. The beach is stunning. The pools and grounds are well maintained. But the property is completely over-rated and over-priced. I feel completely ripped-off.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us went to the Occidental and we all had a great time. The staff were helpful, friendly and very playful. I saw many tourists in various places (not only at the hotel) throwing fits and behaving quite boorishly. My belief is that one gets attitude when one shows attitude. I had many nice conversations with different staff members who went out of their way to make the stay more enjoyable. The beds are so very, very hard. Never saw bugs in the room and always had hot water. The grounds were lovely and clean. The food was great. I will go back to this hotel. We had a most fun and relaxing time. Saw other hotels that were much more elegant, but we were interested in a more casual fare and the Allegro was perfect for that. I even found the front desk a delight. I suspect that many of the booking troubles are not necessarily the hotels fault, but rather the various booking agencies as tourists from other resorts had the same problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, the beds are hard and yes the birds are loud, but afterall you are in the jungle of Mexico. The beach is among the best I have ever seen. The water was clear and warm. The food, while not great is very,very good. The grounds are extremely well kept. The rooms and public bathrooms are impeccably clean. The staff are very friendly and responsive to most requests. If you want to have a great time and you value outdoor activity, beach and pools over the room quality, this is a great resort. The rooms are fine, but not Ritz-Carleton quality. How much time do you plan on being in the room? If you really want a room with a great bed, TV and other amentities, then this is not the place for you. However, if you like to dive, snorkel and drink, this place is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading negative reports on the resort, I was very wary. But we were very pleasantly surprised. We found the rooms very clean and quiet, the staff were excellent. We had a couple of problems throughout the 2 weeks we were there, I rang reception, and within 10 minutes there was a member of staff at our door to sort it out, you can't get better service than that. The whole resort was very clean, the activities pool was very noisy from the loudspeakers, which then could be heard from the relaxation pool, so we used to go onto the beach, which was ideal. I have read some e-mails from people saying that you should tip every day to get good service, well I don't believe in that. I don't bribe people, if we get good service throughout the holiday, then we tip at the end. We were made to feel extremely welcome, and didn't feel that the staff were after tips. If you treat people with respect, then you get it back in return. I can recommend this hotel, it is extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: FrankNTulsa
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this resort and feel compelled to write a review. This is NOT a four star resort. At the most it rates a two. All I can say is that if you are seeking a first class resort go somewhere else. The rooms are small and very dated. The beds are very hard. There are no dressers, only shelves. There were ants in the bathroom. Many of the sidewalks were under construction. The food is very average. There is no wait service around the pool or the beach. Good luck using any of the watersports items. They are very limited. The only good aspect is the beach. The staff is pleasant. This place is in serious need of updating. Spend a few extra dollars, go somewhere else, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Please read before you go here!!”
Reviews.Author: delaney_10
Reviews.Content: We have to let you know that this was the worst vacation stay we have ever experienced. We had confirmation numbers upon our arrival, the Allegro did not have our reservations. We were informed that the Allegro was over booked. Please be advised we were not the only ones this happened to. This occurred every single night during our stay to others whether it was booked thru expedia or a travel agencies. They shipped others to different resorts, some were upgrades and some were not. During our stay, we had an entire shower head and adjusting height rail fall off the wall, hitting one of us on the head while using the shower. We had water running.....not dripping... out of light fixture in the ceiling while using a curling iron in the bathroom barefoot. The rooms stunk like sewer. They found methane gas coming from the floor drain in the bathroom. The problem was not fixed for 2 days after numerous complaints. The smell permeated our clothing, the bed sheets and blankets. We removed the bedding and asked for replacements. The housekeeping staff brought two twin size sheets for our king size bed. We called four times to get the right size sheets, and no one ever showed up with anything that night. We slept the night with no blankets or the proper size sheets. We understand things may go wrong but this got to the point of being ridiculous. We asked to speak to a manager. After waiting half an hour, the manager showed up at the front desk. We felt she, Carmen (the manager in charge), totally ignored us for the next 15 minutes. She was obviously not there to help us, we had enough, we walked out. As we were leaving, she turned around laughing and pointing at us. We found this to be totally unacceptable behavior. We have contacted Occidental Hotels asking them to compensate for our numerous inconveniences. We weren't looking for a gold carpet resort but we didn't expect to be ignored. Unfortunately, they did not find it necessary to reply to our request in any way. We can't understand how a 4 star resort would allow guests to be treated in this manner. We traveled often, stayed at many resorts, and never had such an unacceptable experience. Please understand we are not writing this e-mail to complain but to make others aware of what to expect when you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week at the Allegro Resort. It is not the fanciest place on the beach but it certainly met our expectations of a 4-star resort. We went to relax and lay on the beach and did just that. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and helpful. The food was excellent though we were a little tired of the buffet by the end of the week. The Italian restaurant "Caruso's" was fabulous. The evening "shows" were entertaining though a bit cheesy at times and were always over by 10:00 pm. There were enough poolside activites to participate in if you wanted to or you could go to the relaxation pool or to the beach if you preferred. Would we go back or recommend the Occidental Allegro Playacar to otheres? Sure, but only if you are looking for a low-key vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation and technically our honeymoon after 6 years of marriage. We were treated like royalty the entire time. We stayed at the Allegro Resort from Feb 26 - Mar 01 2004. No problems and all of the staff were friendly, fun, and professional. The beach was clean, with the exception of some cigarette butts from all of the Europeans. The food was good and the atmosphere was very relaxing. The only knock on this place has to be the rooms. They are VERY basic and the beds are literally concrete slabs with a mattress on top. You can also hear everything that is said or done in the room next to you. The cleaning staff stays right on top of things though so the room is never messy or dirty. We would definitely stay there again. The hotel is only a 2-minute taxi ride to 5th Avenue where the shopping is. The taxi ride is only $4 USD so it is worth it. The wait staff at the hotel is also right on top of things. The buffet is the normal place to eat and when you get up to get some more food, your previous plate is gone by the time you return and you are never without a beverage (alcoholic or otherwise). The water served in the resort is fine to drink. Do not drink the tap water in the rooms though. Even the staff tells you to stay away from it. You can brush your teeth and shower and such with no problems. Just don't drink it. In our opinion the stay was too short and we didn't want to leave. All-inclusive is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a 4 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got bumped to the Allegro for the 1st 2 nites after being informed that the Grand Xcaret had overbooked their hotel. This seems to be a common occurance with Occidental. We reluctantly accepted this as we had no other alternative. We were very disappointed with the Allegro. The room was small and dirty. The pool area was small. The food was average. The entertainment was less than professional. About the only thing this place had going for it was the beachfront. Too bad such a second rate resort has a first rate beach. If this is a 4 star resort, I would hate to see what a 2 or 3 star looks like. On the 3rd day we finally moved to the Grand Xcaret (the Resort we had booked) This place is a beautiful, well layed out resort. The Grand Xcaret deserves its 4+ star rating. Hint -- try to avoid Signature Tours, & Skyservice Airlines. You will be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunandfun420
Reviews.Content: I was very scared to go to this hotel after reading all the negative reviews. But I would go back to the Allegro again. I think that many of the people that have written negative reviews have not traveled extensively and expect a trip to Mexico to be just the same as traveling in the US. The room that we stayed in was on the upper level. The roof was thatched which is the standard in the counrty you are in. So you do hear the birds in the morning and occasionally your neighbors. The food was pretty standard fare. I really loved the nachos and the snack bar at the pool. Breakfast seemed to be the best meal of the day but all the meals had a wide variety of choices. I think the best thing that the Allegro has is location. The beach is beautiful. The water was warm and crystal clear and warm! The week that we were there the weather was overcast but we still had fun. We went horseback riding and snorkling and both trips were very nice. My personal favorite thing about Mexico was that the people were very helpful and friendly. Give the Allegro a chance by going to the resort with an open opinion and remember that you are not in Kansas anymore....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for :-}”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, Visited Allegro on Feb 8-11. Got there on 4th, but hotel was full, so we were transferred to Barcelo down south. Barcelo spoiled us, so when we got back, we felt miserable at first (more or less the same felt other people that were transferred like us). First of all, there are some not very nice people at front desk, but most are ok, including manager Alexandro - he is pretty reasonable. Carmen is good (i think she is a supervisor), Elske (from Holland) and some other girl - were good. Hotel is shabby and pretty old, rooms are smelly (ours smelled with chlorine like hell), occasional coacroches in bathroom and little something in wardrobe. We argued with Alexandro and they put us in "Coral suite" - it's like an apartment, so I can't really complain, but ordinary rooms are nothing to remember. But most of the trouble is food and drinks. Choice in buffet very limited (we adjusted to it after couple of days), but first impression after Barcelo was awful. Two a-la-carte restaurants - mexican and italian - we got trouble at both - one teenager was completely sick after mexican (diarrea, throwing up, etc), I thought I would be in diarrea crisis once I got to Coba pyramid next day, but I managed to go over it. Same thing after Italian. People at Italian restaurant are nice, but servants in buffet are very annoing - overly friendly. The difference with Barcelo is that you get young (sometimes very ) people there, here are all mid-30/40+ guys - think and you know the difference. They are lazier, more pushy. Their jokes are dumb. You may like it though. Beach is nice, it is the same beach you get all along Playa del Carmen. Drinks are pretty awful, they use some concentrated things. Pinocolada one day made me feel particularly bad - it was just coconut milk from concentrate with ice (i think something was missing - Barcelo pinocolada tasted somewhat richer). Watersports - you have to pay for lesson (again at Barcelo it is included). Equipment is not that great (especially windsurfing). At the same time, it is close to Playa (though you have to take taxi ($4) or walk ~20-30minutes). To get to highway to catch Collectivo you again have to walk ~20+minutes or pay $4 (it goes for all hotels in Playacar). At Barcelo, we just walk 3 minutes to highway. I mention Barcelo as it is not that much more, but at least it is cleaner, food is definitely much much better (no comparison whatsoever). So if it is your priority (you are not planning to go around a lot), consider Barcelo or something of its class. Allegro is at best 3 stars. Show is low-level, again i'm not sure what you are used to. At Barcelo there were good singers (not all of them), but it was higher class. Anyway it is not Broadway there.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro Playacar in the Mayan Riviera Jan 31 - Feb 7/04 and nothing but great things to say about it! The grounds are beautiful and we preferred the style of bungalows to hotel corridors. The staff are excellent and very hard-working, eager to please etc.. The activities staff in particular have great energy and the variety of things to do is impressive. The food was above-average... the buffet, both for breakfast and dinner (lunch by the pool) was great, good variance of meals. The a la carte restaurants were also very enjoyable.. the Mexican, outdoors by the pool and the Italian. Service, friendliness, facilities... All top notch. Sure, the rooms are a bit small, but how much time do you want to be in your room in the Mayan Riviera? The shows each night are really great too, the enthusiasm and talent, engaging the audience, very well done. Only small downside... the arrival was 2 hours late, and they had someone working the desk that was new, so it could've gone a bit better.. but even still, they had a decent number of people at once and did their best. All in all, highly recommend and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at Allegro! Dont read the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: caroleena
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Playa and it was FABULOUS! I can?t believe why anyone would complain while in paradise. We have been to Cancun 2x but after coming here I have no desire to visit Cancun again any time soon. For those of you who haven?t been there yet, Playacar is a gated community where all the All Inclusive resorts are located. There are also beautiful private homes, a nice golf course, Playacar Plaza outdoor open air shopping mall, and Xaman Ha Aviary (very neat 80 pesos) which is all in walking or biking distance. The green and lush tropical vegetation was so beautiful & a wonderful break from our cold gray Minnesota winter.The Allegro Resort was WONDERFUL. I had read some bad reviews & tried to take them with a grain of salt as I know some people are just negative in any situation. The set up of the buildings & rooms are perfect. There are 8 rooms in each building- 4 on top 4 on bottom. You have your own entrance with a patio or balcony with 2 chairs & table & a hammock to lounge. They are private also where you are not staring at your neighbor. We had requested ?primero piso privado? first floor private & got just that. I had read that the top floors were louder and if it rained would get wet, so we stuck with the first floor & that was fine. The day it did rain the Topaz buffet restaurant did leak & was a little slick. Everything is under a thatched roof which is neat. The rooms are functional like most Mexican hotels (unless you are at the Ritz I would guess), beds are hard but you get used to them. The plumbing in Mexico is different so that is why they have the trashcans by the toilet- don?t overload your toilet with paper. (You will also see signs in some restaurants that say this.) I am writing this because we didn?t know even after all the boards I have read. So it is mainly for the first timers FYI.Anyhow- the hotel atmosphere was so easy & comfortable to get around which was nice if you wanted to run back to your room from the beach or pool. It wasn?t a long hike at all. Again the lushness of the gardens with different palms & foliage was beautiful. This is one thing Cancun is lacking as it is more concrete and less vegetation. There are 2 pools, activity & relaxation pool. We stayed at the beach mainly but would just jump into the pool for a refreshing dip when it was really warm. The Caribbean is gorgeous! It is turquoise blue & awesome. It was calm one day but the rest there were lots of nice waves. We were out by 11am usually and had no problem getting a chair but if you want a palapa to sit under, go early.Next topic- FOOD. We ate like pigs- I probably gained 3 lbs! Diet starts tomorrow! Breakfast buffet was the best I think. Fresh fruits of all kinds, pan dulce ? croissants, breads, rolls, etc. Omelets station, smoothie station which I had everyday, bacon, sausage,etc. Good coffee & juices. Lunch we usually ate down by the pools in the snack bar. Also a smaller buffet but it is snacks & hamburgers/fries, misc items to choose but the best was the chips & guacamole. The guac was delicious. I am addicted to that- its all I ate for lunch everyday. Must be a woman thing because other ladies I talked to felt the same! The lunch & dinner buffets were good. Similar food with both- different meats, salads, & it was nice they had a pasta bar to create your own in case you didn?t see anything you liked. Very good vino tinto (red wine) & desserts. My hubby enjoyed the pizza place which was down by the pools also. This is open most of the day and until 1 in the morning if you are hungry. The pizza was quite tasty. So you never go hungry. The 2 speciality restaurants are El Troje- Mex & Caruso-Italian. You can only go to those 1x each per your stay. They are very small but delicious. The Mexican one they greet you at the door with a tequila shot & have certain items to choose from. It is a fun authentic night with mariachi band. We enjoyed it. The Caruso is more intimate & romantic. 4 course meal with items you choose.. Excellent appetizers with cheeses, great wine, & food. The Caruso is ?formal dinnerwear? but John just wore jean & a collar shirt so you don?t have to get all dolled up which we liked too. I wore black capri?s & a nice light sweater type tank. It was no big deal setting up these reservations. Just go to the lobby at 9am and have your days in mind that you want to go to each & then you pick a time. It was nice because at the bars they had a list of many different tropical drinks to try since you can never think of any on you own. I liked the Blue Lagoon & the Correscaminos. They have a drink of the day everyday. One day they had sangria which was so refreshing & another drink the ?coco loco? which was in a coconut & very island like & a fun photo op. The beer at the resort is Corona.You can do almost any type of water sport you want. The kayaks & boogie boards are free. But you can pay to parasail, jet ski, scuba, fish, catamaran sail, etc. Or you can just sit at the beach drinking a cerveza & enjoy the sun. There are some topless women but it is no big deal. Mostly Europeans. Most woman wear 2 piece suit regardless of body type. Nobody really cares. A variety of people visiting French, Italian, Canadians, Germans, American, Chileans. It was nice to see this as you realize what a big world we live in.The animation team is great. They are so energetic & fun. There is always some sort of game if you choose- volleyball, water polo, aerobics, etc. if you are into that. They have a night show at 930pm which is a different theme every night. They will have audience members participate & it is hilarious. Like Mr Allegro or a game show Women vs Men. Or they will have a dancing show.We ventured out and rented a car which was easy (its no big deal) and went down to Tulum which is a must see. There were a ton of people there probably from the cruise ship tours. But the view of the ocean there is gorgeous. It was worth it. Then we went to Oscar & Lalos for lunch where those Corona commercials were filmed. It is so tranquil & peaceful there & just beautiful calm blue water. Went into Playa Del Carmen a few times. You can walk if you like about 25 minutes or take a cab $4 to 5th Ave. 5th Ave is so neat esp at night . It is all open air restaurants, shops, bars, vendors, etc. It is just a wonderful atomoshere to be in. We had dinner one night at the Blue Lobster which was recommended by everyone we ask for the best seafood. It was! John had the lobster & I had shrimp & a bottle of wine. About 100 USD but who cares since we were on vacation & it was a nice evening. Then we checked out the Blue Parrot which is a typical tropical beach bar how you would envision. There are swings at the bar instead of stools & lots of fun. Dance floor on the beach and they play good music. We went to Senor Frogs one night. It is so Americanized but it is a nice bar restaurant that gets rowdy.Ok- this is long enough but here are just few helpful hints & FYI?s.There are lots of the time share sharks around. For those of you who haven?t been there, people will come up & be very friendly ask you about where are you from, etc. just say ?No gracias? & keep moving. We got this in Tulum, on 5th Ave, & a little in the resort but not as bad.Learn the Spanish basics- Hola, Como Estas, Bien, Adios, Por Favor, Gracias. And use it. Make an effort to speak the language. It is really appreciated & fun. Esp at the resort.Bring a small umbrella. It did rain 2 days most of the day & once we were walking & got totally drenched for a mile long. But it still felt nice & warm. Better than snow anyday!Use at least a 15 sunscreen even if you tan easily because the sun is very strong. You will get tan. We got nice tans and even used a 45 one day. (And normally I would never use that.)Get Laura?s (mapchick) maps. They were nice to read before leaving & have on our car rental day. We didn?t walk around town with them as they are big but familiarize yourself ahead of time- it felt like we knew the place before we even arrived.Things are slower here & way more laid back than USA so relax & enjoy. When at the Blue Lobster it was a long evening with the check taking a while to come, but this is how it is so you enjoy the ambiance. There is no rush. That is why you are on vacation.We would definitely go back to the Allegro again. We loved everything about it. Playa is so laid back & relaxing & just a wonderful vacation spot. We got on the plane from 85 degrees and came home to 2 degrees. BOOHOOHOO. Back to reality. Email me if you have any questions. Until next year? ADIOS????

Reviews.Title: “Greedy and Inconsiderate American Guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here, the value for money was incredible and we would not hesitate in returning or recommending to anyone.The only negative was the greedy and inconsiderate American guests who clearly had no idea how to conduct themselves. Shouting at each other at 2am and screeching at each other around the pool. But that was only 2 groups of people and maybe they had never been on holiday before so one can forgive them.The staff were great, the room clean and comfortable, the location great and the value for money cannot be disputed.

Reviews.Title: “They are all opinions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pretty skeptical after reading all the bad reviews. Of course, I was expecting the most horrible Mexico vacation yet. This was my husband and my fourth time. Our 1st at Moon Palace, 2nd Oasis Cancun, 3rd Sierra Cancun and 4th Allegro. People have rated the Sierra Cancun as 5 stars. My opinion is the Allegro was better. It's true you must book your specialty restaurant right away. They fill up fast. Tanya the customer service manager does all this on her own. People have complained about how rude she is. She deals with snobby demanding people day in and day out complaining they can't get what they want. It's not her fault. I found her to be rather pleasant. The main rule in Mexico is to treat them as you would like to be treated. They will do what you ask as long as you speak a tiny bit of their language, smile and treat them as humans not servants. Our maid was the best. We left her anywhere from .50 cents to a dollar a day. She made us little animals out of towels and left them on the bed for us. We were on the second floor and the noise wasn't what I expected. Only once during my stay did I hear our neighbor whistling in the shower but we both had our windows open. Yes, the rooms are small and needed a mini fridge. The mattress was placed on a slab of concrete. The harder the better for me. Bad neck and back. We never had any water problems like others have complained. We did see a gecko in our room one day but we scared him away before I could snap a picture. There were teeny tiny little ants by the coffee machine but that is because of the creamer and sugar they provide. What else can be expected? The hammock outside the room is cool. The air conditioners on the second floor are useless but we are here for the warmth and tropical breeze so it was windows open all the time. We thought the grounds were fantastic. The pool was good. The beach as good as it can get. The food was good. Plenty to always choose from. Even for the finicky. The smoothies in the morning was a nice touch. We had a wonderful time and thought the place was great. I was longing for a pina colada or banana daquiri but they don't seem to make them like I'm used to. It seems something was missing. They were to citrusy. Great bloody marys though. It comes down to the rooms being so-so and the rest of the resort an absolute 5 star. If you want the Ritz, go there. If you want Mexican flare stay here. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but don't expect amenties”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-night stay at the Allegro and thought I'd share my perceptions while they're still fresh. The reception staff was not very welcoming, but did handle the business of checking in. Later on however, when I was having difficulty with the tour company that was supposed to provide transpotation back to the airport, they were unsympathetic and unhelpful (charged me $1.00/min for a local call). The grounds are absolutely beautiful and very well maintained. It was wonderful to be surrounded by bouganvilla, oleander, and many other tropical varieties after leaving a cold climate. The rooms are small and very basic, but functional. We stayed on the lower level of one the "eightplexes", near one of the swimming pools. There was a slight damp odor in the room, but it wasn't intolerable. After all, this is the tropics! Once the air conditioner dried the air a little, the smell was barely noticeable. I had read about the "hard" beds resting on cement platforms, but I actually found them to be quite comfortable and slept well. The housekeeping staff was efficient and did not accept any tips left for them (I gave up after the second day). The main restaurant was average, the service fair, and it grew old pretty fast. However, Avenida 5 in Playa del Carmen is withing walking distance (or a $4 cab ride), so there are a number of alternatives to the buffet. I found that eating breakfast kept me full until dinner, so I didn't partake in the lunch buffet and can't comment. I did see a lot of nachos, burgers, and pizza though! The drinks from the bar (except the upstairs bar) were pretty weak. I'm not a big drinker, but do appreciate a little substance! The beach was just the right size with plenty of chairs. The best feature of this property by far! Finding shade will be difficult unless you stake out a palapa really early (same at the pool). I'm an early riser, and watched people begin staking out territory at around 0600 every day. The music at the activities pool and part of the beach is loud, but not horrible. On several occasions, the activities staff would blast American rap music liberally sprinkled with the "N" and "MF" words. Since the crowd is quite international, I'm not sure everyone really understood. I'm also not quite sure that the staff understood what they were playing and that it could potentially be offensive. The time share agents are very aggressive, so beware. Tell them you are leaving and they won't be so persistent. Yes, I would go back to this hotel, but not with the same expectations as this trip. It is extremely basic. If you're not going to venture beyond the walls of the resort, there aren't a lot of amenities worth touting.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we decided to stay at the allegro even after we read MANY reviews- many of them negative. however, our experience was nothing like the others. we arrived at the allegro shortly before 3pm and were immediately escorted to our room. no, it was not the hilton, but it suited us fine. there is a 'closet' to hang your clothes in and a safe for your valuables. the cabanas have thatched roofs, so yes, there were bugs, but that is to be expected. and the bugs were not overwhelming at all and in the 8 days we were there, i only saw 2. we didnt have problems at all with the front desk reps. they were very helpful! the only problem we had with the staff was that the customer service rep forgot to put in for our Honeymoon breakfast in bed, so they ended up bringing it the next morning. it was a small 'meal'- rolls, fruit and o.j.- we went to the breakfast buffet immediately after! the pool was wonderful. the beach is beautiful- not rocky at all! we loved Fast Eddie's, the resort bar. Jorge was a great bartender. we speak a small amount of spanish and the workers appreciated that. the food was average, but i never left hungry. there is a snack bar next to the pool and a pizzaria that is open for a late night snack. the landscape is amazing and there is always someone tending to it. we went there with realistic expectations. it is not a 5 star resort, but our experience was in no way negative! i hope others do not shy away from the allegro. we had a wonderful stay and would definately go again!

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for overdemanding snobs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Allegro: a very okay place to be, if you don't bother being surrounded bij eighthy percent (much) too fat, tattood/pierced holidaymakers! The gardens, beach, warmth, and friendly atmosphere make you realise how nice life can be, away from a cold and wet January. Read all the reviews we also were a bit sceptical. Returned just today we like to add our own comments. For us it is obvious that your own attitude will make your stay here a pleasant one or not. We never ever had any problem - during our two weeks stay - with the friendly staff, especially in the restaurant. They did their best, and ofcourse, they can't perform miracles (but then...can you?). It's all a matter of give and take. The food (both buffet and Mexican restaurant) was above what we expected from a mass restaurant and the choice was more than diverse. Only the Italian restaurant is average (pretends culinary more to be than it is with its oversized portions): the Italian food in the buffet restaurant is tastier, you should try the pasta's that are made right before your nose! Our room (we had a room downstairs without connecting door) was very silent. It's just a pity that sometimes drunkards (it's all free so some start to drink beers/cocktails from 9 am) want to share their loud daily adventures with the whole resort after midnight. But this says more about the 'classy' people than about the quality of the bugfree, and clean rooms. No problems with the beds at all...but hey...maybe the dutch are a bit Spartanic. There is entertainment day and night (if you want to be entertained), especially the dancegroups are good. For a safe, touristic holiday, this place is very okay. Playa del Carmen is of couse touristic and unfortunately has little to do with Mexico. You'll stumble over the tourists (and their often pathetic behaviour after some tequilla's) and dozens of the same shops with the same boring rubbish. If you're able to bargain, it's easy to get 40-50 percent off the prices (but then again...hey....we're Dutch). But, if you want to see something of the real Mexico, please look for a location more adventurous. If you want to make 'new friends' the all inclusive resorts certainly can be recommended. Most of the guests are dying to get in contact with you, either you like it or not. Keep some distance if you don't want to be matched. Life is what you make of it...so is your holiday. We certainly had a great time in the Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To clear the air...This is a 3 star hotel, the rooms aren't lavish(they are very clean....no bugs) and the buffets were below average, but, we really enjoyed ourselves. When you arrive book the Mexican and Italian restaurant as soon as you can. They're both much better than the buffet, the Mexican dinner was awesome, the Italian wasn't bad either. Make sure you have a dinner or two in Playa del Carmen, there are tons of great bars and restaurants there. We ate at "la Parilla" twice it was superb and very reasonable. The town really made our trip complete. To be able to walk there along the beach from the resort and sit at a seaside bar and eat seafood and drink coronas, well, you can't beat it. If the town wasn't near the resort we would not have enjoyed our trip as much as we did, as far as restaurants, bars and endless shopping you can't go wrong. You can literally walk for hours in the town and it sits right on a beautiful turquoise beach. Having been to several areas in Mexico, this is where it's at. The town is completely safe, we wandered the streets late into the night and didn't feel at all worried. At night go to the beach in town and you'll find several bars and clubs where you can bring your drinks right down to the ocean and relax under the stars. It's paradise. The hotel staff were the best I've seen and went out of the way to help you. The front desk is another story, if you don't speak directly to the manager your wasting your time. The others seem very challenged. In summary, if you don't let the hard beds and the usual buffet boredom get to you and instead enjoy the best beach in the area and the wonderful town nearby you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Andy and Paula in the mayan paradise”
Reviews.Author: MrsFoster
Reviews.Content: After leaving Canada in the cold blast of winter, my partner and I were looking forward to a relaxing week of sun,sand and surf.We had read up on everyone's experience at the Allegro before we left and were prepared for the "worst". We arrived in Cancun and found Sunwing very organized,thereby getting us straight to our resort. We did not get the king size bed that we had requested and our room was directly in front of the Kid's Club(room 5115). After leaving our 5 children back in Canada, I was not prepared to spend the week listening to the Kid's Club every morning......BUT, after spending the first morning sleeping in,we realized that no one used the Kid's club. We solved our bed problem by pushing the two beds together, to which the housekeeping staff pulled apart every day(got to be the joke of the day) The food was great,the beach and Caribbean Sea was lovely to swim in and the staff were friendly. We had no trouble getting reservations at the Italian and Mexican restaurants. We did make a point of reserving them as soon as we could. Recommendations: Go to Playa Del Carmen for great atmosphere and shopping. The people are very accomodating and willing to barter for everything. Had fun at Senor Frogs and Java Joe's. Go to Xel-ha for great snorkeling ...take your underwater camera and get the all inclusive day. Went to the Mayan ruins at Tulum.....Mac was our guide and he was great. We learned so much about the Mayan people....very interesting. All in all, Andy and I were looking to relax and unwind for seven days and we did just that at the Allegro. Great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Hell at Allegro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This "4 star" resort was total hell for our family and friend. For what we paid and the service we received, I will never stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone. In fact, I will openly campaign against going there. We booked a room through a travel agent for five nights. The first night we arrived and were told they did not have a room for us. Nothing. We would have to stay at the Gran Flamenco some 30 minutes away and come back the next day at 3 p.m. for our room! What a hassle. What poor, pathetic service and management. To top it off, we were offered nothing in the way of a reimbursement or way of making up for their mistake. Then we saw the same thing in the lobby day after day as we stayed there. This is a sham job with crap for help, management, and service. Don't go there and don't let your friends. You'll waste your money. What a con job this place is! I'm going so far as to deny the payment on my visa for the night we were inconvenienced.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro from 30-12-03 until 14-10-2004. and we loved it. Nice pool, lovely weather and a beautifull hotel-garden. Very clean. friendly people,everything oke.

Reviews.Title: “The bug room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made the horrible mistake of staying at this hotel. The room was absolutely disscusting !!!!!!! there is no dresser to hang your clothes and there are lots of bugs sharing the accomadations. I travel very often aand this is not a 4 star prpoperty. Playa del carmen is beautiful but I would definetly not stay at this hotel.It really put a damper on our trip!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: garyouel
Reviews.Content: On January 4th, my friend and I arrived at the Allegro playacar resort for a 7 night stay. When we arrived, the staff at the front desk said that all rooms were booked, even though we had reservations. We were informed that we could stay at the Carribbean Village. Through persitant calls by my travel consultant back home, the playacar resort finally gave us our rooms, 3 days later. No apologies, no nothing. This was the second year in a row that we experienced this same problem. It's a nice resort, too bad the staff at the front desk are so uncaring and unprofessional. I would caution other travellers going to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: DooDa Lee
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the resort, the resort is family orientented , food was great, the staff was very helpful, yes the beds are hard, but the best sleep I have had in years The hotel staff puts on a great entertainment show at night and was always helpful and friendly When I was visiting I observed some guests complaining about loud noise, (Bars, etc.) but remember its a 4 on the scale, if you want a five or more don't stay here. Some people you just cannot make happy I will would return to this paradise in a moment

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our 1-yr anniversary in Sept 2003. The resort landscaping, villa exterior, pool and beach area was attractive. However, the rooms had ants, the bed was hard, and the staff were skimpy with the towels. The food was not very good. The buffet restaurant had the same items over and over. And the restaurant reservationist could not be found to get a reservation for the 2 nicer restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned - It's FINE !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From Leon & Jaime Hi there. We were at the Allegro from January 01st - 09th. It is FINE !! We definitely didn't think that rooms are 4 star (maybe 3 star) but remember it is Mexico. That is what everyone seems to forget. Plus all Mexican beds ARE hard. ROOMS - All rooms are thatch-roof huts. They have four rooms on the second floor and four rooms on the bottom/main floor. We had a top floor, wore earplugs everynight, had windows opened and a/c on and had no noise problems. Top floor was GREAT. Bathroom/closet was a bit dismal, but how much are you there? FOOD - Buffet got a bit tiresome. You can only eat in the 2 other restaurants once each. We ended up going to the other resorts to visit/eat or go into Playa del Carmen. Town (Playa del Carmen) is only a $4 USD 5-minute cab ride. There are TONS and TONS of excellent restaurants there. Go down 5th Avenue and you will see it all. We had expected more seafood on the buffets. There really wasn't any. WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU - You can go and get a day pass to other Allegro Resorts and eat/drink there for the day and use all their facilities ! This is excellent for variety. We went into Cancun (cheap short bus ride from town - $3.60 USD) and saw Cancun and stayed at Caribbean Village for the day. Another day, caught the ferry to Cozumel. Rented brand-new scooters/mopeds for $20 and rode a great scenic 10 km drive to the Allegro Resort Cozumel. This resort has an amazing beach for snorkelling directly from the hotel. There are a few other resorts you can get day passes to. Just ask the Concierge the day before and she will give you a letter. Overall we thought it was great. It is definitely not for someone who is expecting 5-star luxury treatment. But for someone who wants good basic quality, you will be more than happy. Location is EXCELLENT. Viva Azteca resort is on one side and the Royal Hideaway is on the other side. Grounds, pools, beach, bars are all very nice. If you learn to speak a bit of Spanish, then you will find that the staff treat you really, really nice and will go above and beyond for you. We would definitely go back. Please feel free to e-mail us if you would like more information or some photos e-mailed. cosmobunny_69@hotmail.com Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “vacatining at Allegro-tips”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Allegro: Beach is beautiful, Buffets are scheduled well, accessible, and the food is very good. The folks at the resort are generally very friendly, fun, and courteous. 3 MAJOR issues to consider: 1) At the front desk, ONLY accept service from "Angel" - he was the only person who provided ANY assistance in a timely manner. ALL others, without exception, responded to every question/request with the answer "come back later". 2) The beds and pillows are ROCK HARD - this is NO EXAGERRATION! Do not plan on getting a comfortable nights' sleep unless you truly enjoy sleeping on concrete. (We'll bring an air mattress if we return.) 3) The Hotel and your Travel Agency will NOT coordinate your room availability with your arrival time. If you arrive before 3pm local time, your room will NOT be available - guaranteed. We waited, and witnessed everyone else arriving prior to this time waiting. Finally, be VERY SPECIFIC about EVERYTHING you may require when booking - NO accomodations will be made if it is not clearly stated on your itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and have never been treated so badly by staff at any hotel ever in my life. The first thing that got me upset was when we got out of our taxi and checked in. This took approx 35 mins and then we had to take our own bags down to our room. I don't usually mind this but my wife and I had got married the week before in New York and we had so much to carry it was un-trrue. The next thing that really upset us was the noise!!! The noise from the building next to us started at 07:45 and went on all day. I made a complaint to the receptionist on the first morning and they said that they were full and couldn't move us. I carried on complaining all week and finaly we were moved two days before leaving. On the second night we had a really great romantic dinner and we decided to go back to our room. My wife was really tired and decided to go to bed. I on the other hand decided to sit out on the terrace and listen to the sea and watch the stars. After sitting here for quite some time in such a fantastic setting I decided to see if I could get a drink and sit of a further 45mins or so. I take a walk to the bar which is about a 2 min walk from my hut, when I get there I find out that the bar is closed so walk back to my hut. When I turn around to walk back I see a man all dressed in white standing about 30-40 feet away from me, I wave and wonder on back top my hut where I sit down on the terrace. I'm sitting there just relaxing when I get approched by this man in the white and askes me questions about who I am and what i'm doing, well of course I told him the obvious as I think it's just the night sercurity guard, which really wasn't a problem. He then walks away and about 15mins later he returns with 3 other men(one of which was an extreamly big guy!) The big guy askes me all the questions again and then askes me to escourt him up to the reception. The questions this person was asking was, How long are you here for? What is the number of your hut? Whats you name? He even used his radio to check with someone at reception who was staying in my hut. Well he asked me to come upto reception which bearing in mind it was about 2am I said no and then he said if I didn't go up to reception with him he would call the police!!! So picture this, your on your honeymoon, relaxing one evening on the terrace of your beach side hut and then you get hasseled by 4 security men who threaten you with the police, what do you do??? Well I went up to reception and they confirmed who I was, what I was doing there and what my hut number was, this took all of an hour and a half!!! By the time I got into bed it nealy 4am. The next morning we were awoke by the banging from the construction site next door at 07:50 and that was it!!!! I went straight up to the reception and demanded to speak to the manager, this was an extreamly rude, unhelpfull and what I would say totally incompetant at her job. Well when we got home I put all this into a complaint to the resort and the group and guess what??? I'm still yet to here from them!! I visited the resort on 11th Nov 2003!! Loved Mexico but will never ever stay at that resort again! Totally ruiend our honeymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Allegro and then read all the reviews. It was fun to read them and then experience it ourselves. We are people who travel a lot but have only been to one other all inclusive. Sandals Resortin Negril is definitely a five star for couples only. This was more family oriented which worked for us as we had our 18 year old son along. We were at the Allegro from 12/27/03 to 1/03/04. Here's the real scoop as we saw it:1. Yes the beds are hard. We got over it. 2. Yes, the rooms are small but who cares when you have a beautiful beach, bar and pools to spend your days at. 3. Yes, the room smelled a bit musty in the humid climate but a candle helped. 4. We had no problem at all with thin walls. We were on the lower level of a two level unit (3201) away from the pool and it was quiet. We did have to keep the windows and curtains shut and air on at night for privacy since walkways were very close. 5.
