The Allegro staff was great everywhere we went except the restaurant reservation lady. My husband showed up and she became friendlier. But we were trying to book at the busiest time of the year. My advice is to book right away the next day after you arrive. Even still we could only book the Caruso at 9:30 p.m.! For some reason you have to wait until the next day. Try to book both restaurants. You'll love the change of pace from the buffet and the ambience. 6. The place is gorgeous and everything is well manicured. We loved the grounds. It was a lush evironment, especially when you are from Wisconsin! 7. Beach towel service was done via cards passed out to you on day one. Lose one and it will be $50. We wondered why they had this policy. People still freely left their towels to hold beach chair recliners. There was an in-room safe to store towel cards along with my wallet, passports and so on. 8. The beach was great. Lot's of people but never a problem getting a recliner or hut. You could walk all the way to town. The week we were there it was very windy(20-25 mph) and as a result some watersports were cancelled or hard to do. The trade off was that you could be cooled at the beach during the 85-90 degree daytime temps. Mexicans hassling you on the beach with wares were very minimal. 9. No bugs anywhere. 10. Nightly entertainment was OK. Lots of dancing acts. Fine if you like that kind of thing. Very enthusiastic hardworking entertainers though. New Year's Eve was absolutely incredible!!!!!!!!!! Mayan warriors, fire eaters in the bar, drummers and a spider man guy that did climbs and tricks on the bedsheet suspended from the thatched roof. Extra special buffet. The Mexicans seriously party at New Years and made it a fun, exciting evening. 11.Overall the food was fine with lots of variety. Afterall, it was a buffet. They have a guy making fresh smoothies, omelettes, and eggs depending on the day, and no matter the meal, you'll find something you like. Our son chose the pizza bar and fast food place by the pool quite often. Beware of the salsa. It's HOT, damn hot! They have 3: Greeen sauce, red sauce and the chopped up variety. The guaccamole is not hot, it's very good too. 12. Quite a variety of activities to choose from and the young staff there to liven things up were a lot of fun. Great for kids and adults. Overall we had a great time and would recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to worry where their next meal or glass of Corona is going to come from! We talked to people staying closer to town who said restaurants in Playa Del Carmen were few and expensive: $10, $10, and $15 to eat three meals a day.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT for kids! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I went during Christmas week. The rooms are a little small, and not elegant, but we didn't stay in the room enough for it to matter...only to sleep and shower! The activities near the pool and beach were a lot of fun....my daughter really enjoyed all the games they played...and I enjoyed taking pictures! We loved the nightly shows....9:30 every night. The dancers were great...and before the show each night a Kids Club staffer would get the kids up on stage to play do a little dancing around. The food was just fine with me. I have heard that the walls are paper thin...and you can hear your neighbors speaking very easily..but I must have had very quiet neighbors....didn't hear much. I suggest taking a white noise machine to use at night incase that could be a problem. Santa parachuted in on Christmas day.....that was great fun to watch. The water in the pool was too cold for me....but my daughter did manage to take a quick free scuba lesson. We are thinking about returning in July....as my daughter just loved it so much. It's just a quick taxi drive ($4) into Playa del Carmen...which we thoroughly enjoyed. I do believe that the front desk staff is mis-managed...as I saw quite a few problems with people not getting the room they wanted...as in...they were supposed to have 2 doubles...but ended up with king beds instead. I think if they could just have better management...that they could alleviate a lot of the problems they had at the front desk. When you walk out of the resort...and just down the street a bit....there is "Plaza Playacar"....which had some nice shops in it. I particularly enjoyed going to the Coffee Shop...which had internet access...which was very reasonable...$1.00 for 10 minutes. Great for families! And I am a single mother...and felt quite safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant - could improve a few things”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: We went during the Christmas holiday and we had an overall good time - A lot of that was due to the great weather and friendly hotel staff. The hotel is laid out very nicely. Individual buildings spread out amongst a garden area. Each building has 4 rooms down and 4 rooms up. If you are looking for a hotel with a 5 star rating, a fancy lobby and fine dining - this is not it. If you want a nice down home hotel with a great staff - this could be your place. ROOMS -------- The rooms are small but certainly more than adequate. If you get an upper level room, you can enjoy a 25 foot sloped ceiling. This makes the room seem much larger. The lower rooms would be a lot more cramped. TV's had 2-3 English channels including CNN, E!, and another channel. ROOM NOISE --------------- The rooms have a thatched roof. The roof does not go down and make a seal between the rooms. Hence, every noise made in one room is heard loud and clear in the next room. I mean every noise - so if you are going for an active romantic retreat - be aware of this. BEDS ------ The beds are HARD - HARD - HARD. They are made of concrete pedestals with a very hard mattress. We sleep on a "firm" mattress at home but were very uncomfortable on these platforms. Our backs are glad to be home. FOOD ------ Two nice restaurants - but - you can only make a reservation for each one ONCE. The buffet was adequate with good quality food, but I do not like to stand on line for each food course. Breakfast was good with fresh eggs, pancakes and French Toast. Always a person making fruit smoothies. The lunch by the pool was without variety. Cheeseburgers were "hard." Pizza bar was good. DRINKS --------- I saw them pour a lot of RUM, GIN and VODKA into the drinks, but after a couple, I was sure that those bottles contained some non-alcoholic alternative. However, the drinks tasted great and never a problem to get as much as you want. WATER -------- Don't drink the water from the faucet, but also, don't buy bottled water. Plenty of drinking water machines with filtered bottled water. Just bring a couple of insulated sport bottles and refill them every day. ENTERTAINMENT ------------------- Very pleasant nightly show. Each show is performed by the staff. Not a top-notch Vegas show, but very well done. The show is outdoors and we never had a problem getting a good seat. BEACH -------- Great - clean - if the hotel is crowded - reserve your beach chairs early (8:30) if you want shade. They say "no reserved chairs" but everyone does. LAST ------ The staff forgot our 6:30 a.m. wakeup call. Good thing we got up anyway. Very apologetic, but could have missed the airport shuttle

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place - Not the Hilton, but the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas 2003 at the Allegro in Playacar and had a great time. Before we left, I read some reviews and I was concerned. I can understand how some people might not find this resort all that they are looking for. If you are a couple looking for a super nice luxury hotel, go elsewhere. If you are a family looking for a nice place for your children to have fun, this is it. Yes, the rooms are small, and no it is not as luxurious as others, but you get a lot for your money. It was clean, the food was plentiful, and the service was wonderful. I cannot say the same for some of the tours my travel agent sent us to, but we always felt at home at the resort. There is a giant chess board that my kids (16 & 12 yrs.) went to everynight with kids from all over the world. They played beach volleyball, went kayaking, snorkled, and used a boogie board. All of which is included. There a bar and food by the pool and beach - hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza and mexican. No, this is not the Hilton! It is the Holiday Inn and it was great for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great family value!!!! Don't hesitate to book!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dh, the kids (5 and 7) and I went in early December 2003. We wanted a place to relax at, and to enjoy the water and sun together. This is not a fancy-schmancy resort, but it is VERY NICE. The beach was lovely. Mild waves to enjoy, and it didn't get too deep too fast. You can buy an inner tube in the gift shop and float on the waves. The pool, at 4.5 ft. was a little too deep for my youngest (and too cold for me), but she still had a great time using an inner tube or arm bands. One downside was that the kids playground was inside the Kids Club--which is essentially a drop-off free babysitting service. We had hoped that the playground was just part of grounds and available all the time. We all enjoyed the giant chess board; we played every evening. We are vegetarian, and had no problem finding good food choices. Naturally, it isn't gourmet food, but we were satisfied. The shows at night were quite enjoyable. The staff put a lot of heart into the shows, and laughs were guaranteed. Just before the evening show, they did a Kids Mini-Disco where they led the kids thru some songs and dance on stage, and played games (pinata, hot potato, musical chairs). My kids LOVED this, and are still talking about it. We went into town (Playa Del Carmen) to get the girls' hair braided. There is a nice playground in the town square. You can walk to town from the hotel, but it might be too far for wee ones. We enjoyed walking on the small Maya ruins along the way. Don't miss the Aviary! A 10 minute walk from the hotel, to the north. The kids were thrilled to be so close to the exotic tropical birds (we went twice!). Although the hotel has bikes, as expected there were no bikes for little ones, or bike trailers. Definately no helmets. ;) Bikes are supposed to be ridden on the street, not the sidewalk, so it was just as well b/c I think that would be nerve-wracking with kids. The grounds were very pretty and we enjoyed the set up of the low villas versus a glitzy tall tower type of a hotel. We found the staff to be friendly and courteous---I wish I could say the same of some of the guests! Smile! Say por favor and gracias! Yes, the rooms were small, but we really weren't hanging out in our room, y'know? Housekeeping seemed to forget we were a party of four, and sometimes only gave us 2 towels. We did have a couple mosquitoes in the room, which unfortunately, feasted on the kids at night. Tours-a-plenty were available, and easily accessible, but we declined and just chilled for the week. No one badgered us for tours, except on the streets of Playa del Carmen. My husband was slightly disappointed that more guys didn't want to play volleyball, water polo, or soccer. Some days the activity staff had trouble putting together a team, you just never knew if there were going to be sports or not. After reading some of the reviews on the Allegro, I was feeling buyer's remorse and a little nervous about our choice. No regrets! We had a great time, it was a very easy place to be in, to relax in, and it was an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to say that we've stayed many places in Mexico and the Carribbean and we've learned that we are happiest at a moderate resort at a great price. That is EXACTLY what we got at the OAP. Our check in went very smoothly and quickly. Rosa was very friendly and accomodating when we asked for a "quiet" room (we had 2215-away from the pool). The room was always very clean (we tipped a dollar a day) but it was a bit musty (I presume because of the thatched roof) and loud (we could hear our neighbors talking in regular voices clearly). BUT, we were prepared for that and brought along a white noise maker and ran that at night and slept great. We had a problem with our phone and talked with the front desk--within 20 minutes they had a different one installed. The employees were the friendliest we have ever encountered ANYWHERE! It was no problem getting a "double" if your drink was weak, The activity staff had boundless energy...going from aerobics to volleyball to beach contests to the nightly entertainment (which I thought was very good 5 out of 7 nights), then they would meet at the disco and dance with the guests and even take them out for a disco tour in Cancun some nights. The thumping "techno" music at the activities pool got to me some times, but by moving further down the beach or to the relaxation pool it would diminish to a "mild" noise and was bearable. There were little flys 2 out of 7 days. They didn't bite but were just annoying crawling on you. This corresponded with the calmer wind. When the wind picked up..they were gone. I noticed them at the pools and both ends of the beach, so I presume the OAP was not the only resort to have them. The food was good, they varried the buffet a little. It DID get a little old, but we've experienced that everywhere we've stayed that had buffet meals. The speciality restaurants were nice (especially the Italian). Make your reservations as soon as you can for the best choice of times. The rep was available for reservations from 9-11 am and 5-7 pm so it wasn't a problem getting them. We celebrated our ten year anniversary while there, so I talked with the captain of the Italian restaurant about playing a song off a CD I brought along. I gave a small "tip" and they played the song at the end of the meal when they brought us a small, lit anniversary cake. About the water...the water in the room is not purified, but we had a water bottle that we filled daily and used that to brush teeth, take pills, etc. The water at the bars & restaurants was purified and water dispensers were located at the pool bar and by the buffet restaurant so that you could re-fill your bottles. All things being the same we WOULD stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We saw numerous negative reivews, but didn't experience anything but friendly service, and a wonderful resort. Yes the beds were a little harder than we're used to , but we slept fine. We had to have some maintenance, and they responded quickly. This resort is the oldest in the immediate area, so some of the inside of the buildings are a little dated (older tv's and no optional movies), but the spaciousness of the units (only 4 unit buildings generally) and the lush vegetation make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible doesn't begin to describe it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had the misfortune of going to a resort in Mexico. It was called Occidental Allegro Playacar and it was sold as a great 4 star resort. The resort looked fabulous on the net, all the reviews, pictures, descriptions were Great! Once I got there, the resort left a lot to be desired. In fact, it was a complete DISASTER!!! The rooms were shabby motel rooms with very very thin walls. I could hear my next door neibhours too clearly for my liking.It was very dark and smelly in there as well. The resort itself was fairly dirty, and poorly designed. Walkways were dirty, service fromt he staff was non-existent. I didnt' even know if there were any Activity personel working at the hotel. The beach was nice, however instead of palm trees they had these thatched mushroom umbrellas. They're fine in general, however these ones were infected with GIant-sized fruit flies, or some such thing, and they were always landing on you, and biting you. Not a single peaceful moment. The resort had a problem with their drinks. Straws it seems are a rare commodity here. NO straws. Anywhere in the hotel. This hotel also doesn't skimp on the amount of ice (probably NOT purified) that they put into the drink, so the ONLY way anyone can drink, is if they use a fork to first toss all the ice out of the glass. Now, I say probably not purified, since we got sick. Not a pleasant experience. Thank god for Immodium. When we were complaining to our Sunquest Rep, a saleperson from the parent company of the hotel (Occidental) walked by, and hearing our complaints, wanted to listen in more in depth. When we told him that this was a very poor 4 star resort, he scoffed and stated that the company (Occidental) doesn't recognize it as anything higher than a 3 star! We then requested a switch over from our rep, as she offered it to us. She actually informed us, that we weren't the first to have thought the Allegro was bad enough to get a transfer out of. How ridiculous that it is still being sold as a 4 star. NEVER EVER travel to this or any other Occidental property!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy, No water, No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the third day, we asked for a transfer to another resort. It all started with no water in our room on two occasions, once each on the first two days of our stay. When we did have water, there wasnt any hot water, merely warm. The rooms are very noisy, offering virtually no privacy due to the extremely thin walls and Polynesian style thatched roofs. When you looked up at the ceiling at night, you could see light coming from the next room... thats how little insulation there was between them. We could hear the nightly disco music coming from the next complex loud and clear. The rooms also had a very musty smell to them. The food was average and by the third day, became repetitious. The beach was nice, but crowded. There are many resorts along this strip. I wouldnt recommend this place, it is definitely NOT a 4 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I went there for spring break 2003, we originally ended up at Club Banannas---Don't go there! We checked out before we checked in. There were not many properties to stay at without a reservation, but the Allegro was able to take us last minute. The front desk staff were more than helpful as we were trying to get our credit back from Club Banannas, they made the transition so easy. From my 32 year old prospective of this place I enjoyed the music, it made it fun the entertainment staff enhanced it. As for the time share people, they are around everywhere; get a backbone and say "NO THANK YOU" they seemed to get the message. I think if you are planning to go somewhere and don't want to have fun and listen to music while kicking back with a drink--- Don't go to Mexico! We had a blast, and we also were able to relax and came home rejuvenated.

Reviews.Title: “real good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the allegro from 4 untill 18 november and had a great time. The resort was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpfull. The beach was pardise and the resort was as lovely as well, the pool the tenniscourt and we liked the animation team they tried verry hard to give anyone a good time. The food was good also the mexican and the italian restaurant your not eating in the hilton!! The revieuws of some people they say the allegro is bad there spoiled. The allegro is a for an 4 stars resort very good, i told all my friend to go there, if they go to playa del carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For The Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allegro from November 16 - 21. We were a bit concerned due to all the poor reviews, but for the price, I'd go there again in a heartbeat. The only two bad points of the hotel were the front desk and the beds. The staff at the front desk was very rude and were unwilling to help with any questions or concerns. The rooms were average, yet very clean and the hammocks outside each room were wonderful. The beds, however were another story. It is simply a mattress as hard as a rock on a concrete slab that comes out from the wall. The grounds were amazing, and the beach was breathtaking. We were easily able to get reservations at both the Italian and Mexican restraunts and the service and food were absolutly spectacular. Most five star restraunts don't provide the level of service that the waitstaff in the Allegro do. The bartenders were also great and a small tip went very far with them, strong drinks, great service. My advice, tip. The onsite scuba diving provider was way overpriced and the divesites were not that great. If you dive, take a taxi to Playa Del Carmen, and go with Abyss Dive Center, they're awesome! All in all for the money, you can't beat the Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary if you're looking for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more along the lines of an aging Club Med than a 4-star resort. We stayed there for a few days after a week at the Occidental Grand Cozumel (which I HIGHLY recommend to divers and those seeking a romantic, relaxing getaway). We had a great time in Playacar, but only away from the hotel. I am not a spoiled American writing this, but in my opinion the staff was rude and unhelpful, wasting our time with a hard sell on a time share when we arrived. Our room was not ready on time (2 hour wait), nor did we receive the room we paid for. There were stagnant pools of water everywhere breeding mosquitos, and there was a nest of loud birds living INSIDE our thatched room. The buffet food was cold and sub par, and we were never able to book a reservation at a restaraunt. Lastly, there was loud music blaring at all hours at the pool, which kept us from sleeping both morning and night. So, if you're just looking for a roof over your heads, go for it. Otherwise, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing this to add weight to those who have submitted reviews in favour of this hotel.My wife and I honeymooned there from 14 October to 28 October so my tans still intact and my memory clear.We had an excellent time at the resort ansd was impressed by the way it was run and maintained. The room was small but once we unpacked it seemed cozy. It was clean and the air conditioning worked a treat. My wife and I are not the all inclusive types but found that we spent most of the time by the pool or getting involved with activities. Unlike our American cousins or Italian neighbours, we are not blessed in England with beach volleyball but I enjoyed getting involved.We enjoyed the food , particulary the Mexican night held outside in the first week.Top tip, the bar next to dining hall does lovely gin and tonics. They are more generous with the booze there than the one next to the pool. I suppose they dont want too may drunks by the pool.The beach was lovely and much better than Playa Carmen where initially we were going to stay.We found all the staff to be friendly and we met some nice people from all over the world. The most memorable person was an older German guy with a white thong who joined in all the activies.My only criticism is that the chess board was set up wrong. I tried putting the pieces in the correct place but to no awail. See if you can spot the problem when you get there. Theres a prize for the the first person to spot itTo sum up, we had a great time and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Allegro!”
Reviews.Author: StrayCat
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic resort for the price. The staff was wonderful, helpful in everyway, and did whatever it took to satisfy our every need. The grounds are lush, very beautiful -- the groundskeepers groomed them constantly. The front desk staff always greeted us with a smile, and were always polite. The food was better than we had expected, after reading all the negative reviews. The staff person who took reservations for the speciality restaurants was very punctual, the Mexican restaurant was superb, the best chicken mole I ever had. The room was more than adequate, loved the second floor under the thatch. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job of keeping things very clean, and their timing was superb, we never saw them. The animation staff were very entertaining both during the day, and the evening shows. Maybe not professional, but they had so much energy they made it fun. The beach, ahhhhhh!!! This alone made our vacation. Never had problems finding a chair, same with the pool area -- which was kept very clean. The waiters and bar staff were so friendly, they took the time to learn our names, and all had a great sense of humor. Compared to some of the larger resorts nearby, this one is smaller. It kept it more intimate, with the staff actually remembering who we were. The management is doing a great job, and we took the time to let the manager know. They probably hear from so many complainers, that I thought they should hear from folks who really appreciate their fine hotel. If you booked here, no worries, you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at the Allegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short stay at the Allegro in Playacar. (oct 23-26, 2003). I had read a number of mixed review and was a bit concerned. Well, to sum it up, I was very happy with my stay. I personally would rate this hotel a 4(on the mexican scale, not the american) The hotel is large and has lots of 2 story "8 plexs". The rooms are a bit small, but they were very clean and everything worked. One nice touch was the hammock just out side your door. I'd rate the room a 3, but then again, I didn't go to mexico to sit in a hotel room. The resteraunts: The buffet was acceptable, not great, but enough variety to keep me happy. The Italian resteraunt was good. The mexican resteraunt was execelent. (But you have to like interior mexican food. Don't expect tex-mex, or americanized food. Mexican food is all about the sauces). The Italian and Mexican resteraunts required reservations, but they were easy to make if you got there early. They also required formal dress, but any long pants worked i.e. jeans and tennis shoes. The drinks: Well, they only have one kind of beer and that got old after 2. The mixed drinks were tasty, but didn't seem to have to much alcohol in them. --Tipping can improve this situation. The staff: They seemed friendly and helpfull. The beach: The beach is fairly large and clean. You could always find a lounge chair. Finding one under shade was a bit tougher. You will also notice that alot of the visitors staying there are from europe. Some of the women don't wear tops. The pools: They have two large pools. They looked clean, but I didn't go in them. The water sports: They had some kayaks and a few sail boats. They also had boogie boards and snorkeling equipment. --Neither one of these was worth much, as the beach is some what protected by Cozumel and there is not much to see snorkeling. Atmosphere: I liked the atmosphere. It was laid back . Everything was generally availiable with out waiting in line (sailboat reservations and dinner reservations were required. --But easy to make.) There was music by the pool. Not to loud and a good mix of different songs. The entertainment in the evenings was fun, just don't expect profesionals. Also, depending on when you go, you may find alot of the other guests don't speak english. i.e. German, Italian, and French. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would be happy to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach”
Reviews.Author: Rickebob
Reviews.Content: As most people who read the negative reviews about this resort, we were also concerned that our vacation was not going to be what we expected. HOWEVER, this resort is pretty much what should be expected for the price. Yes, the rooms are average and the mattress is very hard (but I slept great). The room and grounds are very clean and well kept. The various amenities are in line with the resorts pricing. Let me say the beach is absolutely the best we have experienced in this area. We have stayed at Moon Palace, Aventura Palace in past years and these very expensive resorts have no beach to speak of. If your idea of a relaxing vacation is to lay in the sun on a glorious white beach, the Occidental Allegro Playacar is worth considering. The staff was very friendly (only one exception to this but everyone can have a bad day). Most of the waiters became "amigos" on the first day and were there to bring us drinks on the beach the rest of the week. As some other reviewers have noted, a few dollars in tips and a smile will get you as much or as little alcohol as you want, just ask! The various restuarants at the resort range from OK to very good. We enjoyed the Mexican theme restaurant two nights as we forgot to bring "formal" clothing that was required for the Italian theme restaurant. Other guests we met said the Italian restaurant was very good as well. The main restaurant was a normal buffet that most of the inclusive resorts offer. The food was good but not gourmet. We were able to find something tasty each time we went and I must admit the food here is equal or better than the other high-price resorts mentioned before. All in all, we were very happy with our weeks stay and we would probably go to this resort again. We like to visit different resorts whe we travel since we only take a vacation like this once every 18 months, so everyone please keep posting your reviews!

Reviews.Title: “most memorable vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladypatriotsfan2005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 4 teenage children...12,14,16,18....on a last splurge vacation before our oldest went off to college. We went into this vacation knowing that it was a budget minded vacation, and we knew we were not going to be getting the Ritz. However, we had a wonderful experience..our children met so many interesting people from many corners of the world..and each day was just a delightful social experience.....Your vacation is what you make it, and the Allegro seemed to move you through your day in a fun exchange of laughter and an enthusiasm for "being on vacation"....The activities staff were friendly, inviting, comforting, crazy, and very good at making you feel like you were among very welcome friends. The wait staff was just very warm, and friendly, and willing to accomodate...and we did not pass out many dollar bills.....we just smiled alot, "we" were very well mannered and thankful to their service. I have a feeling all of the staff can sense genuine people....people who are not there to be "served" but to enjoy a meal and good conversation. The pool was active, the beach beautiful, the non-motorized sports abundant and available, the motorized sports accomodating...my daughter took a windsurfing lesson..it was supposed to be for 1/2 hour, but, I think the instructor sensed her enthusiasm and he spent most of the morning with her...and always kept his eye on her to help her out for the next few times also...(no, not in that way....:-)) The shows at nite were entertaining in a simple sort of way, but, an all ages kind of way too! We were all so sad to leave, but, still bring up a little story almost every day, or a little memory creeps into our day of the fun we had at the Allegro even tho it was just about two months ago. We all want to go back and set up a coin jar for collecting our quarters as soon as we got home. If you enjoy a casual, relaxed and active at same time vacation, in a beautiful setting....(don't leave food around, you won't get ants....duh)....and are of the mind to make lemonade if you happen to get a lemon..(which we did not).....Allegro is a place to experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon..Wonderful resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the allegro, I was sure I had made a mistake in booking this resort. Well, turns out that this resort was wonderful. You whinners out there just don't know how to REALLY enjoy life or how to roll with the punches. I feel sorry for you and your attitudes. You must not be very happy people at heart. We had absolutely no problems whatsoever. What a beautiful tropical paradise. We got a room just a few yards from the ocean, king bed, no bugs, great air conditioning, good tv,nice and fresh. The food was very adequate, easy reservations at both resturaunts. a small tip even brought breakfast in bed one morning. Once the management found out it was our honeymoon, they even made us a small wedding cake. The pools were beautiful and even though I've traveled to many ocean resorts in several countries, this was the most beautiful beach I've ever relaxed on. I am absolutely astounded at the negativism I've read here. I had a great time!! Gained 5 lbs! My wife loved the allegro. What a nice getaway. Need a better or stronger drink? TIP!! I took $50.00 in one dollar bills and this paved the way to all the extras. I would stay there again without hesitation. To all the whiners who "just don't get it",, next time try a friendly smile or comment and 1 or 2 dollar tip. Thank goodness you don't live next to me. Thumbs up to the person who posted the review just before mine .He said it right ...The allegro resort gets an A from my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kelliebellie314
Reviews.Content: I read nearly every review before taking my trip and was very much on guard for the worst. We were ready to do battle with this sullen people if things weren't to our satisfaction. I've now come to the conclusion that there are people who see the world through either half full or half empty glasses. Then no one pays attention to the positive remarks. It's the bad that grab our attention. The front desk staff was consistently pleasant and helpful. It was comprised of young, bilingual men and women. We kept waiting for as much as a frown but never recieved one. We checked in without any hitch whatsover to our rooms (our party required three) early in the day, even before check in. We were never approached by any timeshare people. They had tables set up but if you didn't go up to check them out they didn't bother you. We knew who/where they were so we just smiled, said Hola, and went on our way. Our rooms were immaculate. We never tipped them as we were on the all inclusive plan, but one of our traveling companions did and every day they had special attention given to their room, such as towels folded into swans and such. The food was very satisfying and there was a good selection. We did have an incident with the dinner reservation system but I'm still inclined to say that we were prepared for the worst when we got there so we probably got more upset than the situation called for. It was a lack of communication more than anything else. The grounds were immaculate and charming. Every leaf that hit the concrete was expediently removed. There were impressive and entertaining shows in the evenings, lots of entertaining activities to participate in...Spanish lessons, cooking lessons, yoga, bingo, aerobics in the pool or ocean, cancun excursions etc. Your vacation is all lin your attitude. We found the staff delightful. Tonya was never at her desk to do the dinner reservations so you have to be prepared and make them some other way. There is always a restaurant open that you do not need reservations for so you always are certain of a hot, nutritious meal. The taxi ride into town is only 4 dollars each way or you can walk easily enough if you don't mind the exercise. The beach was prisitne and an absolute joy to swim in and walk on. They even had pizza available until 1 am down by the pool which came in really handy one night when I had the midnight munchies. One of our traveling companions took advantage of the expertise of the tennis pro and enjoyed that...we participated in the shows and immersed ourselves into the culture. I wish the drinks would have been better (stronger) and the colas tasted more American. I wish I would have brought a larger glass to keep with me from home as the ones you get are very small so you have to keep going back and back to the fountain machines to refil, especially when you use ice. There is plenty of filtered water and we didn't get sick at all. This isn't a four star resort, for sure, but it's very nice and charming. If you have a positive attitude generally in life then you will be quite satisfied here.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Review of the ARP...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With all these negative reviews and unfair observations, I thought it neccesary to write a fair and balanced review of this place so that you people traveling to this resort wouldn't be dismayed. First off, the rating says it all...this place is average, just average. Yes it is older than most resorts....yes they have rude people like MANY other resorts...yes they have average buffet food, but YOU paid an average PRICE for it!! You did not pay $1,100 p/p for a plush paradise LIKE NEXT DOOR...you paid maybe $600 p/p. What did you expect? You shopped around and found a bargain, then you recieved a bargain. I find old hotels in the USA and pay $60-70 night for...but I don't recieve all the food I can eat, nor all the DRINK you can drink...neither do they provide a show, nor are they located on the nicest blue ocean I've ever seen! But we don't complain. How cranky would you be if you worked 18 hr. days and dealt with drunk disrespectful snobs all day long for about 5 dollars a day? I could go on, but for now I will cease the preaching. Here we go, the workers work very hard to keep the place clean. The food is ok, but only because they cook what the owners provide. No different than eating in the average Denny's except its about half price. The beach is awesome, simple as that! If you want the best drinks you have ever had, tip the waitors 2 dollars and try smiling at them...they remember you; oh and don't forget, they have been there all day too. Treat the front desk the same way, and you will get a free upgrade...the rich snobby american act makes them people sick; remember, we spend more for an "average priced" vacation than they make all year..think about it...then we scream out demands expecting miracles. The average front desk clerk gets cussed out 5 times a day for something out of their control...how would you feel? "They lied to me"? Are you sure? Did you speak proper Spanish to them and ask them? How many languages do you speak? Maybe they didn't understand you. Maybe they were told to lie to you. Now for the Bugs...come on people, I can find them in every house in america!! Yes, all of them, even yours. Have you forgotten that you have just arrived in a third world country? Beds are hard? Ever stayed at a Days Inn? As for mee, I am getting ready to go back for my second visit to this resort, not because I have to, believe me...but because I want to. Why you may ask? Because I want an average stay in an awesome town. This way I can go three times this year, instead of once. I can stay at the Ibp, the Tucan and the Allegro. Royal Hideaway is where most of you need to stay...but be prepared to shuck out $2-3,000 for it for two people. I will stick to my $1,200 week long trip and put up with an average room..heck all you do is sleep in it anyway! Don't worry, I'll wave at you when I walk by with a fist full of money and a strong drink while we share the same beach; these resorts are side by side of each other...Go and stay here if you are looking to save money and stay at an AVERAGE place. If you need pampering, go somewhere else...hope this helps. Feel free to email me...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I was very concerned about my stay at the Allegro last may,but I enjoyed it so much that I have just returned again from my second trip in Sep 2003. The rooms both times were very clean(didnt see one insect in my room at all)and maid service very efficient.Air con also worked fine both times. Grounds looked fabulous and were excellently maintained.Both pools were spotlessly clean. Staff around the pool area and beach were very efficient at keeping the areas safe and clean and always nearby to take drink orders.There was never a queue to order drinks. Food overall was average with a fair selection.My favourite meal was breakfast,The Italian restaurant is also definatly worth a visit. The entertainment staff were great fun during the day,providing lots of poolside and beach activities.eg:volleyball,aerobics,and kayak races. Nightly shows in outdoor theatre were average but the hotel could do with a choice of other evening entertainment.However if you want more action visit the town only a five dollar taxi ride away.There will always be a taxi waiting outside the hotel reception. The best attraction of the hotel is the stunning,glorius,white sandy beach where sunbeds and umbrellas were always plentiful.Plus a good variety of watersports. Overall this hotel is an exellent choice for beachlovers and DO NOT be put off by some of the negative reviews as this hotel has just recently been renovated and my main priority being that the rooms were very clean. P.S (be sure to visit xcaret for a great day out)

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a 7 day stay at the hotel and have nothing but raves about the service, accomadations,and cleanliness. our room was steps from the pool and ocean, with great air conditioning, which i had read in other reviews was a problem. the staff, from checking in to the resturants or buffet's or maid service was excellent. we had a problem with the sink drain upon checking in and within minutes someone was there to fix the problem. I have never experienced a friendlier atmosphere in Mexico. Our favorite waiter, Juan, was a delight,as were the others. The only thing I would caution you about was the "Occidental Vacation Club" one hour presentation. If you are not prepared to sign up for a few years commitment...don't go. The area attracts alot of European travelers which we found to be delightful. We met people we hope to stay in contact with a lifetime. Don't hesitate to visit this lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews-problems exist!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Occidental Playacar the first week of August. While we personally only suffered without AC for one day, many others endured their entire trip without AC and many other inconveniences. The property is beautiful, the entertainment staff fun and the food is ok. Breakfast was our favorite meal and lunch by the pool was also wonderful. Very American, hamburgers, fries and killer avacado salad! Dinner depended on the day. It is almost impossible to eat at the Italian restaurant. Not sure why. Drinks were ok but with a tip now and then, they were great. OUr room was always clean but they are very small. A family of four would be cramped and there is very little space for clothes(no dresser) and no privacy for changing clothes, except in the lavatory. For two people it was ok. I personally would not stay there again. There are two many other nice places. Be cautious and don't expect much help from the lobby staff. They seem overwhelmed and put out by your requests for help. IF you are just going for the pool, ocean and little else, you will be fine. THe kids program was slow to start and there seemed to be favorites among the staff. Needless to say, my son was happier with me at the pool. THe nightly entertainment was fun. THey really try to put on a good show and they are different every night.

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 11 am - which was fine, except the hotel's check-in was not until 3:00. So, we changed into our bathing suits (in the lobby restroom) and made our way to the beach. We were able to keep our luggage locked up at the front desk, so we felt safe leaving it there. The first thing I noticed about this hotel is that the people at the front desk are not friendly at all, and are not that eager to help. But we got over it very quickly after we got to the bar and had a drink. The pool bar was always busy, and always had very good service. The only thing that bothered me was the overwhelming amount of bees that swarmed everywhere around the drink dispensers. Once we were able to check in (at 3:30) we went to our room - small, but clean and cozy - and enjoyed the air conditioning for awhile. The rest of our trip was lovely. The only complaints I have are about the unfriendly front desk staff and the restaurant booking process. We were only in Playa for 3 days, and were not able to eat at both of the hotel's restaurants. The Italian restaurant was available on the last night we were there and was amazingly good-awesome food and service. But we weren't able to get a reservation in the Mexican restaurant at all, and it upset us, because every time we walked by it, it was not full at all. But the buffets were good enough. The beach for this hotel is probably one of the best parts of the entire beach. It was clear, free of seaweed, and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ugh. What an awful experience. We booked and paid for reservations at the Allegro Playacar back in April. It was my husband and I and 3 other couples celebrating one couple's anniversary. My husband and I arrived 2 days earlier than the other 3. When we got to the property, we walked into a lobby full of grumpy looking people - and with good reason. Every single person there - at least 20 - were being "moved" due to the fact that they were way overbooked and the few rooms they did have had poor air conditioning. I have worked as a travel agent for 7 years - and I understand the concept of overbooking and "walking" guests - but I have NEVER seen it abused to that extent. It's not like the construction just popped up the day before - why book the rooms if you know they are limited? After much grief with an insincere desk staff - I spoke to Eduardo. I explained that we were expecting 3 other couples - and would need them moved to they same property we were being moved to. He assured me this would not be a problem, and gave me money for the taxi transfer. The day that the other couples were to arrive - I walked back to the Allegro - to speak with the desk staff, reassure that the others would be moving to our property, and try to streamline their transfer process. I was told that there was no problem - everything was set. While waiting - I encountered 2 people who were unfortunate enough to have gotten rooms at the Allegro. They were at the front desk - demanding to be moved because the food was terrible and the rooms were disgusting. When the rest of my party arrived - the desk staff seemed very confused as to what they were talking about. Even the people I had spoken to an hour before were acting like they had no idea of what was arranged. Suddenly, Eduardo appeared - I thanked him for arranging the transfer of the others to our property. His response? "Um - well - we can't move them there. They have no room. " It appeared that in an hour - the other resort had completely booked up. To avoid any more time taken out of my vacation - I told him that he needed to move all 4 couples to the same resort - which - after much grief, finally happened. We were all transfered to the RIU Playacar - which we THOROUGHLY enjoyed. I will NEVER book an Occidental property again - and plan to advise all people I come in contact with to do the same. Save yourself the time and hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid to go to this resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at this resort! We stayed from August 3-10th, 2003. Before I go into my discussion on the resort facilities, I will admit that we did have a few set-backs our first day. I traveled with a group, and between the 7 of us, we needed 4 rooms. 2 rooms were had easy enough. However, some of us had problems. Check in time is 3 pm, but we had to wait for a room till 5 pm. When we did get the room, we went to it, opened the door, and here was a whole family's belongings! We went back and explained to them that someone was in "our" room. They told us to wait, the people must need to check out yet. So we waited a few more hours, went back, and still the stuff was in "our" room. I was irritated, but I'd bet that the people who were in that room would be even more irritated to know that we were able to get into their room, with all their belongings! Now, thank goodness for them, we are honest, midwesterners who would never dream of stealing - but this whole scenario could have been very bad for that poor family if circumstances were a bit different! Finally, I did have to go get my Apple Vacation rep. and have her straighten this all out. Based on what I saw, I would not take your chances and book on-line through expedia.com or hotels.com. We saw several couples who were out of luck because they made their reservations on-line and showed up only to find out they did NOT have a reservation! Go through a travel company like Apple, Funjet, or TransGlobal - someone who has a representative on-site at the resort to help you should anything go wrong. The other couple in our party got a room with no air conditioning and had to suffer a night without it. The next day they got the Apple rep and were given a new room. Now, as for the resort, it is wonderful! VERY clean, good food, great drinks, BEAUTIFUL facilities, breathtaking beach . . . . but what made it even better were the people. The people who work here are phenomenal and always willing to help you with a smile on their face. The waitstaff is marvelous. Definitely eat at the Italian restaurant - the food is excellent and the people who work there were great. The buffet is good, but again, the waitstaff is friendly, efficient, and courteous. They love to joke about bringing you a tequila. . . . You say you want water, they say "ah, yes, more tequila". We had a great time. The shows at night are a lot of fun, and they always end with a catchy tune - the Allegro song. It is really a cute, and addictive, little song. Enjoy the beach and the pool! And go to town. It is a really cute little town with lots to offer. A few other quick words of advice: 1. Bring some junk food in your carryon luggage. We craved Doritos and Chips Ahoy cookies after about 5 nights of eating food we weren't used to. We took the bikes to a grocery store and bought some, but Mexican Doritos DO NOT taste like ours (spicier and a different cheese), and they don't have chewy Chips Ahoy cookies! 2. Bring lots of small bills. In town, all your change is in pesos. Very few vendors will give you change in US dollars. So unless you plan to spend a lot of $, or want a lot of pesos as souvineers, bring lots of $1, $5 and $10 bills. But I guess my biggest word of advice is have a travel rep available for you in the resort - they get your problems worked out in a snap if you have any (many people I talked to had no problems). And be prepared to have a great time. It is an excellent place to vacation. I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our honeymoon at the Occidental Allegro Playacar in July 2003. All I can say is that I wish we'd had more money in the wedding budget to afford a better hotel than this one. You definately get what you pay for, if not less, than what you pay for. After reading the reviews, I had my fingers crossed that people were exaggerating, unfortunatlely that was not the case. This entire hotel screamed dirty. Its old and it shows. Not filthy, just not as clean as you'd expect. Our room was tiny, the mattress was like a solid rock and the boxspring was replaced with a cement slab. We had a constant trail of ants running through our room to the adjoinging room next door and getting into all our stuff, huge palmetto bugs running up and down the walls, and geckos hanging out on our ceiling. I managed to take a family of ants home in my purse, thanks to a box of cough drops I forgot about. The food was uneventful and repetitive, and the restaurants you make reservations for were great on service, horrible on taste. The only way to get a reservation was to be up at the crack of dawn, which as you can imagine, is impossible for a honeymooning couple. We got there in time once and once only! Those same ants from our room were everywhere and anywhere food was around, so there were ants on our tables, near/on the buffet, etc. It was nauseating. Let's just say I lost weight on this trip, not the usual for an all-inclusive. I was also highly disappointed at the number of topless women at the hotel pool. I specifically called the hotel before booking to ask if that was allowed and was told absolutley not at the pool, only the beach. But without fail, day after day, I was forced to view other women's breasts. Disgusting. I felt bad for any parent who had children there as I'm sure they had some explaining to do. I know European's are used to this, but I am not, nor will I ever be. The activities staff were a bore as well. Not once did we ever feel compelled to join in. We tried watching several of the "free" evening shows and they were boring at best. If you buy any of the tours, I suggest skipping the "All Inclusive" day trip deals they sell. We lost money on that. They claim that food and activities are included, but you barely had time for food or activities, so we didn't get our money's worth by any means. We would've been better paying a la carte. Also, we were told this was a day's worth of all inclusive benefits, but found out later that only our first stop of the day, Xel-Ha, was included, not the second stop, Tulum, so we ended up spending more money. The only real plus is that most of the staff were extremely nice and attentive, which was great. I would never return to this hotel and recommend you gather up a little more money and upgrade to a better hotel. All of the other hotels on this strip looked more impressive, at least from from the lobby, than this one. We looked like we got dropped off at a Super 8 vs. a Holiday Inn or better.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allegro last year and the year before. Mainly because we found great special rates for the months we were going. Last year we decided to bring our 5-year old son. We had a ball!!!!! The resort is VERY beautiful and a great beach. The run of the house room is ok, but the beds are VERY hard. Carusos is very nice with great service, and the buffet is different every day with a good selection of fruits, a omlet and pancake station. My husband loves pizza, and was in heaven with the unlimited pizza bar near the pool. The mexican restaurant was a lot of fun, and is outside by the pool all lit up for dinner. There are 2 pools, one for activities with a swim up bar, and a quiet pool on the other side. I recommend a room a far away from the activity pool a possible. Our room was just out side that pool, and there was constantly loud booming music playing. It started early in the morning and went to late afternoon. There were a lot of children there, and the resort if very child friendly. My son met and hung out with some lovely children, and he spent all day on the beach. Overall both times were wonderful and I would highly recommend it to anyone with a family. We are going back this year in December, but this time we are trying a different resort. If you have any questions, you may e-mail me anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in May had an absolutely fantasic time. This is my 2nd trip to the Mayan Riviera and I can honestly say that this hotel exceeded my expectations. Unlike a certain traveller from Richmond USA, we didn't feel the need to use intimidating behaviour or threats of violence when speaking to reception, finding he staff and management all too happy to help. Perhaps Alejandro just didn't want people like this in the hotel - understandable! Beach is absolutely stunning and the separate pools are great for those who want to join in the activities or just relax and have a swim. No need to 'reserve' a sunlounger, there's plenty to go 'round - why emerge bleary eyed at 6:30am and then re-appear hours later to reclaim your spot?!! The lunch buffet is good, lots of variety - although the sight of a man in speedos bending over the salad bar was a little offputting (guys, please cover up a bit before feeding time!) Italian & Mexican restaurants were fantastic and easy to reserve. Food in all restaurants was good, although in the hot weather, not really a priority. Our room was scrupulously clean, with modern, Italian style bathrooom, efficient aircon, balcony and hammock to relax on. We were directly opposite reception, with the stage to the left. The evening shows are very professional and well choreographed - and will be getting much better as I know the guys have a lot of new ideas up their sleeves. The walk into town takes about 20 minutes, but a taxi only costs a couple of quid and it is well worth going out a few times. We went to Blue Parrot, Mambo Cafe, Tutix and a couple of other lovely low-key non touristy places (which shall remain nameless.) The nightlife is there if you want it, with the hotel sports bar more of a meeting point before heading off. I would certainly reccommend this hotel and area to anyone. Quiet, but with plenty to do and the town within easy reach. Be polite to the staff and attempt to speak a bit of Spanish - the majority are very friendly and approachable! Above all, don't moan and whinge. You're lucky. You can afford a holiday - to a different country with a different culture and a different way of life. Relax and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The last review pretty much said everything I was planning on saying. We lucked out and didn't have any trouble getting a room though. Our room was about as close as you can get to the construction and we never had any problems with it, so I don't think that is anything to worry about (I know some of the negative reviews worried me). The construction actually worked out quite well for us. I believe that all the rooms available now are renovated, so there is no concern of getting one of the run-down rooms described in other reviews. Because of the construction, more than half the rooms are closed. This means very few crowds for a while. We never had to wait in lines for drinks or food. We never had to fight for a perfect spot on the beach. We loved it. We thought the room was very nicely decorated and VERY clean and comfortable. We even got birds made with our towels on a few days. It was a bit smaller than the average room, but we didn't really need much space. The AC worked great! I actually had to turn it down a few times. The food was okay. It's nice to have so many choices. I was disappointed that there were no vegetarian choices at the Mexican restaurant. This was never a problem at the regular buffet though. Bring shoes other than flip-flops if you want to try the Italian restaurant. I brought all kinds of dresses with me, but nothing but sandals to wear with them and the dress code outside the restaurant says no flip-flops. We enjoyed that the lunch buffet was moved from the main building to near the pools and beach. The whole place is beautiful! Even the parts under construction are very nicely covered by simple white walls so they blend in quite well. We had a wonderful experience at the Allegro. We had a peaceful, relaxing, VERY enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Demand your room, then relax and have a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Occidental Allegro 6/16-6/20/2003. These reviews were very helpful for us. As soon as we got there, the manager informed us he didn't have ANY rooms available, and he was moving us next door. Expecting this to happen from reading these reviews, we raised a BIG fuss and refused to leave, so he took us into his office. We spent the entire first hour of our vacation arguing with this fellow, Alejandro, who refused to even let us see his resort until we looked next door first. Finally, after I told him if he didn't have a room he better pay for our plane tickets back to the USA, and after I mentioned that if I were really mad I would throw a chair through his glass door, he admitted there was a room "near the construction," but he said there would be loud noises and we would be uncomfortable. We told him we'd take it, but if we absolutely hated it we would be back demanding a better room. Wouldn't you know, it was nowhere near the construction! He lied to us! All of the units near the ocean are under renovation, but we near the hospitality center and lobby - far, far away from construction. Our Amex representative told us we did the right thing to argue with the manager, b/c people who are "soft" will get sent to other resorts, and they could be much lower quality, or only have 1 night available. All of this initial trouble was WELL WORTH IT. I must warn you that we were there for the beach, not for the food or the entertainment. The beach is 500% better than the beach at Cancun. No seaweed, no smell, no rocks or shells, and plenty of lounge chairs available in the pure white sand. The water was three beautiful different shades of blue! Wear lots of sunscreen, even if you normally don't burn, and reapply it after you go in the water. Many people got burnt the first day and we never saw them again on the beach! The Allegro is a very clean resort, and the staff (aside from the front desk) is delighted to serve you. A little tip goes a long way, too! There were guests there from Mexico, USA, France, UK, Germany, Italy, and who knows where else? The Mexican restaurant is currently being renovated, so they moved it to the buffet area. No big deal. The construction, even if you do get a room near it, is only during the day from like 9 to 5 or so. Most people are not in their rooms anyway during these hours. Besides, the music at the activity pool and the crashing of the gulf waves drown out the noise. The gardens are well-maintained, and the tropical sounding birds are a delight to hear when you wake up. The food is decent, definitely good enough for a meat and potatoes kind of person, but DON'T EXPECT GOURMET FOOD! The rooms are clean, the A/C is good and cold, the bed is nice and firm, and the TV works, but don't expect much. It is a perfect, quaint little place to crash at night. There is even a hammock to take a nap on outside your room. DO NOT EXPECT a huge, luxurious room! If you want the RITZ, go somewhere else and expect to pay for it! This resort is a quieter resort, mostly for families and more settled couples. This is where you go to relax, not to party. This is NOT the MTV Spring Break type of resort. There is nightly entertainment by the staff, but the resort is pretty darn quiet after the nightly show is over at 10:30. There is a night club, but it is SMALL and it didn't seem like very many guests were using it during the weekdays. The highlight of our stay was the Captain Hook Lobster Cruise in Cancun. It was a little pricey, but well worth it. You can book this with a representative at the Hospitality Center. All of the drinks are included, so get your money's worth! The lobster was delicous. The pirates can really throw a party! My advice, if you are looking at this resort, is to pay for the cheapest run-of-the-house room they have, expect everything to be "just par," be really tough and persistent when they try to send you somewhere else, and once you are done at the front desk, get ready for a great time! You will be pleasantly surprised when you actually get to your little room and relax after a long travel. Proceed to the Aqua Bar near the beach and have a few Coronas (on tap) or Margaritas to calm your nerves after dealing with the front desk! Book your Captain Hook Lobster Cruise at the Hospitality Center the first morning you are there, I guarantee you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Not Crowded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Returned from Cancun last week. Had a wonderful time. The allegro was a very nice hotel, the atmosphere of bungalows and tiki huts was very welcoming instead of mass hotel rooms. The food was good overall, reservations were needed in two of the three restaurants and that process needs work. The staff was very friendly and seemed to bend over backwards to please us. There was construction going on for half the property which had a good and bad point. the good was that the place was not packed and there were no crowds on the beach/pool or waits for food and drinks. The bad was the noise of hammers and such (although it was minimal and only during the week). They are modernizing all the units with central air and redesign. The beach was UNBELIEVABLE. We walked the beach line and by far our section of the beach and ocean was the best. Other resorts had more beach front, but it was full of chairs and people. The ocean was pristine, NO seaweed, great sand bars and warm, oh so warm. A reminder that the beach is topless-allowed, so there is alot of women walking around in bottoms only. Not exactly a good thing for young boys (or old married ones that could easily be distracted). We went snorkling in Cozumel for the day using a Aquaworld package and had a great time. They offer snorkeling at the hotel too, but I heard the reefs in Cozumel were superior. Anyway they feed us, transported us and entertained us, it was a fun full day out. Recommend either snorkeling or scuba while you are there to truly appreciate God's creations in the ocean. The shops were nice too, a little pushy on 5th avenue, but that is to be expected. Make sure that you have transportation arranged from the airport ahead of time, the airport exit is a zoo. It is a little intimidating and scary to let you know. All in all it was a very relaxing experience and we would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny relaxing week on the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent my April school vacation at this resort. Overall, I had an enjoyable time. I've been to several other all-inclusive resorts and this one had good/bad features compared to the others. The weather was great and the beach was spacious, with clear blue water. The buffets for lunch and dinner had a variety every day. There are two basic pools, and they were busy with kids during the day. There are plenty of chairs by the beach, yet it is difficult to reserve the chairs under the shaded cabanas. Two positive features that make this resort stand out from other all-inclusives: drinks served to you on the beach and morning breakfast room service (fill out form at dinner for what you'd like and it's delivered at the time you request). Two drawbacks to this resort are: no bottled water, only a couple water coolers (you have to fill your own glass or use your own bottle that you bring) and reserving chairs on the beach in the shade is a nightmare. We woke up at 7am to reserve 2 chairs at the beach or pool and most mornings all of the covered chairs were already reserved with towels. By late afternoon, some chairs became available. Overall, it was a relaxing, sunny vacation in at clean, friendly resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the allegro!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 9 day holidays at the allegro playacar resort. Overall I had a fab holiday. The hotel was fantastic, the grounds are beautiful and really well maintained, we were really lucky to have a room with sea view, and a hammock in the balcony of the room, air conditioning wasn't working brilliant but we only went to the room in the evening so who cares!!. The food was nicely prepared and opposite to some of the the comments in this web page, we never had problems to book a room in the "A la carte restaurants", the weather was amazing every day blue sky and the sun was shining, NEVER had to get up early to put towels on the sun loungers, THERE WERE PLENTY AVAILABLE. The entretaining staff were fantastic, I was really impressed by their dancing performance in the evening, we really had a laugh with them, we went out with them a couple of nights (guided by Tony, the king of the night life!!) it was good to see some of the local bars rather than the tourist bars.!! You may think that some of them have been on the stage for too long but we love them despite this!!Overall, I would say that if you are looking for a fun holiday with a bit of Mexican ambience this is the place to go. If you are looking for a luxury resort/business style go to somewhere like the Royal hideway resort.We love this resort and hope to come back soon!!
